TEXT.English: Afonso I, also known as Afonso Henriques, was the first king of Portugal (113985), who conquered Santarm and Lisbon from the Muslims (1147) and secured Portuguese independence from Leon (1139). By victory in the Battle of Ourique (1139) he was able to impose tribute on his Muslim neighbours; and in 1147 he further captured Santarm and, availing himself of the services of passing crusaders, successfully laid siege to Lisbon. He carried his frontiers beyond the Tagus River, annexing Beja in 1162 and vora in 1165; in attacking Badajoz, he was taken prisoner but then released. He married Mafalda of Savoy and associated his son, Sancho I, with his power. By the time of his death he had created a stable and independent monarchy.
TEXT.Polish: Alfons I, znany bardziej jako Afonso Henriques, nazywany Zdobywc¹ (ur. 25 lipca 1109, zm. 6 grudnia 1185)? pierwszy król Portugalii, od 26 lipca 1139. Syn Henryka Burgundzkiego, hrabiego Portugalii i Teresy de Leon. Pocz¹tkowo w³adzê w imieniu ma³oletniego hrabiego sprawowa³a jego matka, jednak Alfons, pomimo m³odego wieku, posiada³ odmienne pogl¹dy polityczne, maj¹c zaledwie dwanaœcie lat stan¹³ po stronie politycznego przeciwnika swojej matki, arcybiskupa Bragi, za co oboje zostali wygnani z kraju. Powróci³ do hrabstwa po skoñczeniu 14 roku ¿ycia (w œredniowieczu oznacza³o to wkroczenie w wiek mêski), gdzie stan¹³ na czele rebelii przeciwko swojej matce. Po pokonaniu wojsk kochanka swojej matki, Fernando Peresa de Trava w bitwie pod Sao Mamede, wygna³ z kraju dotychczasow¹ regentkê. Prowadzi³ walki przeciwko Maurom. W czasie tych walk, po bitwie pod Ourique w 1139 koronowa³ siê na króla. Jednak Stolica Apostolska uzna³a jego tytu³ dopiero po 40 latach starañ, w 1179. Przez ten czas król budowa³ nowe klasztory, sprowadzi³ do Portugalii cystersów. Dla celów rekonkwisty stworzy³ rycerski zakon Avis, którego pierwszym mistrzem by³ jego naturalny syn Piotr Alfons. W 1147 odbi³ z r¹k Arabów Lizbonê, a podczas wojny w latach 1158-1166 prowincjê Alentejo. W 1184 odda³ realn¹ w³adzê swojemu synowi Sancho.

TEXT.English: The African grey parrot, grey parrot or Congo African grey parrot (Psittacus erithacus) is an Old World parrot in the family Psittacidae.[PARAGRAPH:2]The African grey parrot is a medium-sized, predominantly grey, black-billed parrot which weighs 400 g, with a length of 33 cm and an average wingspan of 46 - 52 cm. The tail and undertail coverts are red, in comparison to the maroon of the smaller Timneh Parrot. Both sexes appear similar.[PARAGRAPH:2]The colouration of juveniles similar to that of adults, however the eye is typically dark grey to black, in comparison to the greyish eyes of the adult birds. The undertail coverts are also tinged with grey.
TEXT.Polish: ¯ako, papuga popielata, papuga szara (Psittacus erithacus) - gatunek œredniego ptaka z rodziny papugowatych (Psittacidae). Jest jedynym przedstawicielem monotypowego rodzaju Psittacus.

TEXT.English: African Penguins are about 68 cm in length, and weigh between 2.1 and 3.7 kg. Spheniscus is a diminutive of the Greek word spen, meaning a wedge, which refers to their streamlined swimming shape, while demersus is a Latin word meaning plunging.[PARAGRAPH:2]African Penguins are black above and white below, with a black chin and face patch separated from the crown by a broad white band. They have a narrow black band across the chest and down the flanks towards its legs. Some birds show a double bar on the throat and chest, which is a diagnostic feature of Magellanic Penguins. Males tend to be larger with heavier bills, but these differences usually can only be seen when a pair is seen together. Juveniles differ from adults by being entirely blue-grey above, and lacking the white face markings and black breast band of the adults.[PARAGRAPH:2]The African Penguin is the only penguin species that breeds in Africa, and it is found nowhere else. Its distribution coincides roughly with the cold, nutrient rich, Benguela Current. The distribution of African Penguins is further determined by the availability of offshore islands as breeding sites.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brillenpinguin[COLOR_REVERT] (Spheniscus demersus) ist die einzige Pinguinart, die heute noch in Afrikas freier Wildbahn lebt. Dazu gehören die Westküste und zahlreiche Inseln von Angola bis zur südafrikanischen Ostküste und nach Mosambik.[NEWLINE]Brillenpinguine werden maximal 70 cm groß und 3 kg schwer. Sie sind auffällig schwarz-weiß gefärbt. Die Hinterseite, das Kinn und die Wangen sind schwarz, der Bauch ist weiß mit einem schmalen, schwarzen Band über der Brust und den Körperseiten. Vom Schnabel aus und um die Augen geht ein rosa Fleck, welcher ihnen den deutschen Namen verschaffte. Brillenpinguine leben in Kolonien. Die Eiablage erfolgt in Küstennähe, wobei sie teilweise Höhlen nutzen, die sie mit Holzstücken und Federn auspolstern. Auch selbst ausgescharrte, flache Vertiefungen dienen als Brutplatz. Ein Weibchen legt zwei Eier. Jungtiere besitzen zunächst ein Daunenkleid, bevor sie nach drei Monaten ihr Alterskleid bekommen. Die Nahrung der Brillenpinguine besteht zum größten Teil aus Schwarmfischen, teilweise jagen sie auch Krebse und andere Krustentiere.[NEWLINE]Pinguineier galten in den 1950er und 1960er Jahren als Delikatesse, besonders in der französichen Küche. Das führte zum dramatischen Rückgang der Population. Dazu kam die Nutzung des Guanos als Dünger, der jedoch als Nistmaterial gebraucht wird. Schiffsunglücke, Ölkatastrophen usw. verschmutzen den Lebensraum der Tiere, was häufig tödlich endet. Die Fischerei entzieht den Pinguinen die Nahrungsgrundlage, weshalb sie ihre Jagdreviere weiter ausdehnen und auch mit weniger nahrhafter Beute vorliebnehmen müssen. Die Organisation SANCCOB betreibt in Südafrika eine Auffangstation für Seevögel, die durch Ölkrisen zu Schaden gekommen sind. Dadurch sind die Pinguinbestände wieder um 19 % gewachsen. Des Weiteren werden Brillenpinguine weltweit in Zoos gehalten, da sie nicht zwingend niedrige Temperaturen benötigen.
TEXT.Polish: Pingwin przyl¹dkowy, pingwin toniec (Spheniscus demersus) - gatunek ptaka z rodziny pingwinów (Spheniscidae), o czarnym wierzchu cia³a i masce, z wyraŸn¹ bia³¹ brwi¹. Skóra wokó³ oczu i nad nimi ró¿owa, dziób czarny z jasn¹ przepask¹ przy koñcu. Spód cia³a bia³y, z czarnym pasem na piersi. ¯yje samotnie lub w stadkach, ¿eruje na morzu.

TEXT.English: Caral was inhabited between roughly 2600 BCE and 2000 BCE, enclosing an area of more than 60 hectares. Caral was described by its excavators as the oldest urban center in the Americas, a claim that was later challenged as other ancient sites were found nearby. Accommodating more than 3,000 inhabitants, it is the best studied and one of the largest Norte Chico sites known.
TEXT.French: Caral fut habitée entre environ 2600 av. J.-C. et 2000 av. J.-C., sur une superficie de plus de 60 hectares. Les archéologues ont décrit Caral comme étant le plus ancien centre urbain des Amériques, une affirmation contestée par la découverte d'autres sites anciens à proximité. Accueillant plus de 3 000 habitants, c'est l'un des sites de Norte Chico les mieux étudiés et parmi les plus grands.

TEXT.English: The Agrianes were a Thracian tribe. They flourished between the late 6th and mid-2nd century BC. They were loyal allies to many larger neighbours in their time, including Epirus. They formed an elite axe unit in support of their allies, and were specialists in the difficult barren/rocky terrain of what is today northern Greece.
TEXT.French: Les Agrianes étaient une tribu thrace. Elles ont prospéré entre la fin du 6ème siècle av. J.-C. et le milieu du 2ème siècle av. J.-C. Elles étaient des alliés fidèles de nombreux voisins plus grands, notamment l'Épire. Elles formaient une unité d'élite armée de haches, soutenant leurs alliés, et étaient spécialistes du terrain difficile, désertique et rocheux, de ce qui est aujourd'hui le Nord de la Grèce.
TEXT.Italian: Gli Agriani erano una tribù della Tracia; fiorirono tra la fine del VI secolo e la metà del II secolo a.C.; erano alleati fidati di molte tribù più importanti del loro tempo, incluso l'Epiro. Formavano un'unità di guerrieri con ascia d'élite che supportava i loro alleati ed era specializzata nei combattimenti sui terreni aspri e rocciosi della Grecia settentrionale.

TEXT.English: Agueybana II (c. 1470 - 1511), born Gueybana, was one of the two principal and most powerful caciques of the Taíno people in "Boriken" when the Spaniards first arrived on the island on November 19, 1493. Agueybana II led the Tainos of Puerto Rico in the Battle of Yaguecas, also known as the "Taino rebellion of 1511" against Juan Ponce de Leon and the Spanish Conquistadors.
TEXT.French: 1493. Agueybana II led the Tainos of Puerto Rico in the Battle of Yaguecas
TEXT.Polish: Agueybana II to przywódca idnian Taino z Puerto Rico. Rz¹dzi³ na prze³omie XV i XVI wieku.

TEXT.English: Agueybana is the name of two of the principal and most powerful caciques (chiefs) of the Taino people in "Boriken" (Puerto Rico) in the late 1400s and early 1500s. The second Agueybana, or Agueybana II, was the nephew of the first Agueybana, or Agueybana I. They led their people to fight against the invading Spanish, and though they both eventually died in the end, their legacy lives on in Puerto Rico.
TEXT.French: Agueybana est le nom de deux des principaux et plus puissants caciques (chefs) du peuple Taïno à "Boriken" (Porto Rico) à la fin des années 1400 et au début des années 1500. Le second Agueybana, ou Agueybana II, était le neveu du premier Agueybana, ou Agueybana I. Ils ont mené leur peuple à combattre contre les Espagnols envahisseurs, et bien qu'ils soient tous deux finalement morts, leur héritage perdure à Porto Rico.
TEXT.Polish: Agueybana II to przywódca idnian Taino z Puerto Rico. Rz¹dzi³ na prze³omie XV i XVI wieku.

TEXT.English: Ahmad Shah Durrani was the founder of the Durrani Empire and is regarded as the founder of the modern state of Afghanistan. He began his career by enlisting as a young soldier in the military of the Afsharid kingdom and quickly rose to become a commander of the Abdali Regiment, a cavalry of four thousand Abdali Pashtun soldiers. After the death of Nader Shah Afshar in 1747, Ahmad Shah Durrani was chosen as King of Afghanistan. Rallying his Afghan tribes and allies, he pushed east towards the Mughal and the Maratha empires of India, west towards the disintegrating Afsharid Empire of Persia, and north toward the Khanate of Bukhara. Within a few years, he extended his control from Khorasan in the west to Kashmir and North India in the east, and from the Amu Darya in the north to the Arabian Sea in the south.

Aili Keskitalo (born 29 October 1968) is a Norwegian Sami politician representing Norwegian Sami Association (NSR), and sami the fifth and current president of the Sami Parliament of Norway, incumbent since 16 October 2013. Prior to her current presidency, she served as president of the Sami Parliament of Norway in 2005, the third in its history and the first female President of any Sami Parliament. She stepped down in September 2007. The collapse of her coalition made way for the first ever non-NSR presidency, led by Egil Olli from the Norwegian Labour Party.

TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]L'unità fornisce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]+4 di popolazione[COLOR_REVERT] quando fonda una città

TEXT.English: A large balloon of lighter-than-air gas, usually hydrogen, held within a rigid frame, the Airship became the first controllable method of manned flight. Seeing the military applications of the Airship's long flight distance and impressive speeds (the finest Airships could sustain 40mph), Germany, France and the United States each adopted the flying machines into regular use from the turn of the century until the 1930s. During World War I, the first Airship bombing runs struck London. But a number of high profile catastrophes, such as the crash of the US Navy's Macon or Germany's Hindenburg, along with the development of aircraft, returned the Airship to the hangar for good.
TEXT.French: Grand ballon rempli d'un gaz plus léger que l'air, généralement de l'hydrogène, soutenu par un cadre rigide, le dirigeable constitue la première méthode de vol contrôlable opérée par un équipage. L'Allemagne, la France et les Etats-Unis, voyant des applications militaires aux longues distances parcourues par le dirigeable et à son impressionnante vitesse (le plus rapide pouvait atteindre 65 km/heure), adoptent ces machines volantes et les utilisent du début du siècle jusqu'aux années 1930. Pendant la Seconde Guerre mondiale, le premier bombardement effectué par un dirigeable frappe Londres. Mais plusieurs catastrophes, comme le crash du Macon de la marine américaine ou celui de l'Hindenburg allemand, ainsi que le développement de l'aviation, remisent pour de bon le dirigeable au hangar.
TEXT.German: Ein Luftschiff ist ein großer Ballon gefüllt mit einem Gas, das leichter ist als Luft (üblicherweise Wasserstoff), in einer starren Einfassung. Damit war es zum ersten Mal möglich, kontrollierte, bemannte Flüge durchzuführen. In Anbetracht der militärischen Vorteile der langen Flugstrecke und eindrucksvollen Geschwindigkeiten des Luftschiffs (die besten Luftschiffe erreichten 65 km/h) setzten Deutschland, Frankreich und die USA die Fluggeräte von der Jahrhundertwende an bis in die 30er Jahre häufig ein. Während des Ersten Weltkriegs wurde London vom ersten Luftschiff-Bombenangriff getroffen. Aber aufgrund der zahlreichen Katastrophen, wie etwa der Absturz der Macon der US Navy oder der Hindenburg der Deutschen, sowie der Entwicklung des Flugzeugs wurde das Luftschiff für immer in den Hangar verbannt.
TEXT.Italian: Il Dirigibile è un grosso pallone di gas più leggero dell'aria, di solito idrogeno, contenuto in un telaio rigido e divenne il primo metodo controllabile di volo con equipaggio umano. Intuendo le applicazioni militari del Dirigibile per il suo grande raggio d'azione e l'impressionante velocità (i migliori Dirigibili potevano mantenere velocità di circa 65 chilometri all'ora), Germania, Francia e Stati Uniti adottarono le macchine volanti dall'inizio del secolo fino al 1930 circa. Ma un numero di importanti catastrofi, come lo schianto del Macon della US Navy o del tedesco Hindenburg, assieme allo sviluppo dell'aereo, fecero rientrare i Dirigibili negli hangar una volta per tutte.
TEXT.Spanish: El dirigible, un gran globo de gas volátil rodeador por una estructura rígida, se convirtió en el primer vehículo volador cuyo movimiento se podía controlar. Conscientes de las potenciales aplicaciones bélicas que ofrecían los dirigibles por su autonomía y velocidad (los modelos más avanzados podían superar los 60 km/h), Alemania, Francia y los Estados Unidos hicieron uso regularmente de estas máquinas voladoras desde comienzos del siglo XX hasta la década de los 30. Durante la I Guerra Mundial, se produjeron los primeros bombardeos desde dirigible sobre la ciudad de Londres. Pero una serie de accidentes catastróficos, como los del dirigible de la marina norteamericana Macon o el del alemán Hindenburg, junto con la invención de los aviones, devolvieron a los dirigibles a los hangares para siempre.

TEXT.English: The Wayana (alternate names: Ajana, Uaiana, Alucuyana, Guaque, Ojana, Orcocoyana, Pirixi, Urukuena, Waiano etc.) are a Carib-speaking people located in the south-eastern part of the Guiana highlands, a region divided between Brazil, Surinam, and French Guiana. In 1980, when the last census took place, the Wayana numbered some 1,500 individuals, of which 150 in Brazil, among the Apalai, 400 in Surinam, and 1,000 in French Guiana, along the Maroni River. About half of them still speak their original language.

The Pima are a group of Indigenous Americans living in an area consisting of what is now central and southern Arizona. Currently, the majority population of the surviving two bands of the Akimel O'odham are based in two reservations: the Keli Akimel O'otham on the Gila River Indian Community (GRIC) and the On'k Akimel O'odham on the Salt River Pima-Maricopa Indian Community (SRPMIC). They are also closely related to other river people, the Ak-Chin O'odham, now forming the Ak-Chin Indian Community, and the Sobaipuri, whose descendants still reside on the San Xavier Indian Reservation or Wa:k (together with the Tohono O'odham) and in the Salt River Indian Community. Together with the kindred Tohono O'odham ("Desert People", formerly known as Papagos) of Eastern Papagueria and the Hia C-ed O'odham ("Sand Dune People", formerly known as Sand Papagos) of the Western Papagueria they form the Upper O'otham or Upper Pima (also known as Pima Alto).

The Kingdom of Aksum or Axum, also known as the Aksumite Empire, was a trading nation in the area of Eritrea and Northern Ethiopia. It existed from approximately 100-940 AD. It grew from the proto-Aksumite Iron Age period c. 4th century BC to achieve prominence by the 1st century AD, and was a major player in the commercial route between the Roman Empire and Ancient India. The Aksumite rulers facilitated trade by minting their own Aksumite currency, the state established its hegemony over the declining Kingdom of Kush and regularly entered the politics of the kingdoms on the Arabian Peninsula, eventually extending its rule over the region with the conquest of the Himyarite Kingdom.

Ala al-Din Husayn was king of the Ghurid dynasty from 1149 to 1161. He was one of the greatest Ghurid kings, and it was during his reign that the Ghurid dynasty rose to prominence. n order to avenge the death of his brothers, Ala al-Din, launched a campaign against Bahram in 1150. The Ghaznavid and Ghurid armies met at Tiginabad and through the heroic efforts of Kharmil Sam-i Husain and Kharmil Sam-i Banji the Ghaznavid army was routed. Bahram rallied elements of his army at the hot springs, Jush-i Ab-i Garm, but was again routed and fled back to Ghazna. Bahram again rallied the remaining elements of his army with the addition of the city's garrison, but again his army was routed and the city was burned by the Ghurids. Following this defeat, Bahram fled to the Ghaznavid territories in India. Ghazna was then subjected to seven days of pillage and rapine, in which 60,000 of the city were killed. All the tombs of the Ghaznavid rulers, with the exception of Mahmud, Mas'ud and Ibrahim, were broken open and the remains burned. He also destroyed the city of Bust. From these events, Ala ad-Din Husayn gained the nickname, Jahansuz (meaning the World Burner).

The first Janissary units were formed from prisoners of war and slaves, probably as a result of the sultan taking his traditional one-fifth share of his army's plunder in kind rather than cash; however the continuing enslaving of dhimmi constituted a continuing abuse of a subject population. Initially the recruiters favoured Greeks and Albanians. As borders of the Ottoman Empire expanded, the devsirme was extended to include Bulgarians, Croats, Serbs, Armenians and later, in rare instances, Romanians, Georgians, Ukrainians and southern Russians. The Janissaries first began enrolling outside the devsirme (known as blood tax) system during the reign of Sultan Murad III (1574-1595).

Alfred Athiel Thorne (August 14, 1871-April 23, 1956) was a statesman, educator, advocate and key contributor to the history of human rights in the Americas. He became famous for championing human rights during the late nineteenth century, establishing the first free secondary school for poor children in British Guiana in 1894, serving as Mayor of British Guiana's capital city Georgetown, and authoring editorial columns for two of the British colony's influential newspapers, "Echo" and "Outlook" between 1891 and 1925. A. A. Thorne was born in Barbados, and became the first person of African descent from any British colony to earn both a bachelor's degree and master's degree from any British University in England (graduating with honors from University of Durham, England in 1898). He served as an educator, writer and elected official in British Guiana for many decades, creating a positive impact for generations by advocating for the principles of freedom, democracy and self-determination.

Alfred (born 849 - died 899) was the King of Wessex (871 - 899) in southwestern England. He joined his brother Ethelred I in confronting a Danish army in Mercia (868). Succeeding his brother as king, Alfred fought the Danes in Wessex in 871 and again in 878, when he was the only West Saxon leader to refuse to submit to their authority and was driven from the kingdom to the island of Athelney. He defeated the Danes at the Battle of Edington (878) and saved Kent from another Danish invasion in 885. The next year he took the offensive and captured London, a success that brought all the English not under Danish rule to accept him as king. The conquest of the Danelaw by his successors was enabled by his strategy, which included the construction of forts and a naval fleet and the reformation of the army. Alfred drew up an important code of laws (see Anglo-Saxon law) and promoted literacy and learning, personally translating Latin works by Boethius, Pope Gregory I, and St. Augustine of Hippo into Anglo-Saxon. The compilation of the Anglo-Saxon Chronicle was begun under his reign.
TEXT.Polish: Alfred Wielki (848 lub 849-899), najm³odszy syn Ethelwulfa, król Wessexu od 871. W m³odoœci przebywa³ kilkakrotnie w Rzymie, gdzie 853 papie¿ Leon IV mianowa³ go konsulem rzymskim. W 868 poœlubi³, w ramach obronnego porozumienia miêdzy Mercj¹ a Wessexem, krewn¹ króla Mercji. Tron obj¹³ po œmierci swego brata, Ethelreda. Zwyciêstwo Alfreda w bitwie pod Edington 878 powstrzyma³o postêpuj¹cy podbój Anglii przez Duñczyków, a wyparcie ich z Wessexu i Mercji umo¿liwi³o mu utworzenie w po³udniowo-zachodniej czêœci wyspy zjednoczonego pañstwa anglosaskiego (jego zwierzchnictwo uznali równie¿ ksi¹¿êta po³udniowej Walii). Œwietny organizator i wódz, wzmocni³ w³adzê królewsk¹, zreformowa³ armiê (zreorganizowa³ pospolite ruszenie), stworzy³ flotê, ufortyfikowa³ szereg miast (m.in. Londyn), wprowadzi³ administracyjny podzia³ kraju, opublikowa³ zbiór praw. Za panowania Alfreda rozkwit prze¿ywa³a równie¿ kultura anglosaska. Na wzór karoliñski Alfred otacza³ siê wybitnymi uczonymi, pochodz¹cymi z Anglii, Irlandii oraz z kontynentu (m.in. jego przysz³y biograf, walijski zakonnik Asser, czy Irlandczyk Jan Szkot Eriugena), fundowa³ opactwa oraz szko³y dla kleru, inicjowa³, a nawet osobiœcie uczestniczy³ w przek³adzie z ³aciny na jêzyki staroangielski takich dzie³ jak: Ksiêga regu³y pasterskiej papie¿a Grzegorza I Wielkiego, Historia przeciw poganom Paw³a Orozjusza, O pocieszeniu, jakie daje filozofia Boecjusza, Historia Koœcio³a angielskiego Bedy Czcigodnego, Solilokwia œw. Augustyna. Planowa³ rozszerzenie znajomoœci pisania i czytania w jêzyku narodowym na szersze krêgi arystokracji anglosaskiej.

TEXT.English: The Ancestral Puebloans were an ancient Native American culture that spanned the present-day Four Corners region of the United States, comprising southeastern Utah, northeastern Arizona, northwestern New Mexico, and southwestern Colorado. It is believed that the Ancestral Puebloans developed, at least in part, from the Oshara Tradition, who developed from the Picosa culture. They lived in a range of structures that included small family pit houses, larger clan type structures, grand pueblos, and cliff sited dwellings. The Ancestral Puebloans possessed a complex network that stretched across the Colorado Plateau linking hundreds of communities and population centers. They held a distinct knowledge of celestial sciences that found form in their architecture. The Kiva, a congregational space that was used for ceremonial purposes chiefly, were an integral part of this ancient peoples community structure.

Alp Arslan was the second Sultan of the Seljuk Empire and great-grandson of Seljuk, the eponymous founder of the dynasty. As Sultan, Alp Arslan greatly expanded Seljuk territory and consolidated power, defeating rivals to his south and northwest. His victory over the Byzantines at Manzikert ushered in the Turkish settlement of Anatolia. For his military prowess, personal valour, and fighting skills he obtained the name Alp Arslan, which means "Heroic Lion" in Turkish.
TEXT.French: Alp Arslan fut le deuxième sultan de l'Empire seldjoukide et arrière-petit-fils de Seljuk, le fondateur éponyme de la dynastie. En tant que Sultan, Alp Arslan a considérablement étendu le territoire seldjoukid et consolidé son pouvoir, battant ses rivaux au sud et au nord-ouest. Sa victoire sur les Byzantins à Manzikert a lancé la colonisation turque de l'Anatolie. Pour ses prouesses militaires, son courage personnel et ses compétences de combattant, il a reçu le nom d'Alp Arslan, ce qui signifie "Lion Héroïque" en turc.

TEXT.English: A number of indigenous men had made a place for themselves in post-independence Mexico, the most prominent being Benito Juarez. But an important nineteenth-century figure of Nahua was Ignacio Manuel Altamirano (1834-93), born in Tixtla, Guerrero who became a well respected liberal intellectual, man of letters, politician, and diplomat. Altamirano was a fierce anticlerical politician, and was known for a period as "the Marat of the Radicals" and an admirer of the French Revolution. Altamirano, along with other liberals, saw universal primary public education as a key way to change Mexico, promoting for upward mobility. Altamirano's chief disciple in this view was Justo Sierra.

The Kogi base their lifestyles on their belief in "Aluna" or "The Great Mother," their creator figure, whom they believe is the force behind nature. The Kogi understand the Earth to be a living being, and see humanity as its "children." They say that our actions of exploitation, devastation, and plundering for resources is weakening "The Great Mother" and leading to our destruction.
TEXT.French: Les Kogi fondent leur mode de vie sur leur croyance en "Aluna" ou "La Grande Mère", leur figure créatrice, qu'ils considèrent comme la force derrière la nature. Les Kogi comprennent que la Terre est un être vivant et voient l'humanité comme ses "enfants". Ils disent que nos actions d'exploitation, de dévastation et de pillage des ressources affaiblissent "La Grande Mère" et nous mènent à notre destruction.

TEXT.English: Pedro de Alvarado and his army advanced along the Pacific coast unopposed until they reached the Samala River in western Guatemala. This region formed a part of the K'iche' kingdom, and a K'iche' army tried unsuccessfully to prevent the Spanish from crossing the river. Once across, the conquistadors ransacked nearby settlements in an effort to terrorise the K'iche'. On 8 February 1524 Alvarado's army fought a battle at Xetulul, called Zapotitlan by his Mexican allies (modern San Francisco Zapotitlan). Although suffering many injuries inflicted by defending K'iche' archers, the Spanish and their allies stormed the town and set up camp in the marketplace.

Ibrahim I ibn al-Aghlab was the first Emir of the Aghlabids in Ifriqiya (800-812) He was the son of al-Aghlab, who successfully quelled the revolt of the Khawarij in Ifriqiya at the end of the 8th century. In 800 Ibrahim became Emir of Ifriqiya and founded the Aghlabid dynasty, and was recognised as the hereditary ruler by Caliph Harun al-Rashid. After the pacification of the country he established a residence at al-Abbasiyya to keep his distance from the restless Maliki jurists of Kairouan, who were always ready to incite the people into revolt. A guard of 5000 Zanji slaves was set up to avoid total dependence on Arab troops, the necessity of which measure was proven by the revolts of Arab soldiers in 802, 805 and 810. Ibrahim built up a strong administrative framework for the state which lay the foundations for the prosperity of Ifriqiya in the following century.

Hamad bin Isa bin Salman Al Khalifa is the 1st King of Bahrain (since 14 February 2002), having previously been its 2nd Emir (from March 6, 1999). He is the son of Isa bin Salman Al Khalifa, the previous and 1st Emir. The country has been ruled by the Al Khalifa dynasty since 1783.
TEXT.French: Hamad bin Isa bin Salman Al Khalifa est le 1er roi de Bahreïn depuis le 14 février 2002, auparavant il était le 2e émir (depuis le 6 mars 1999). Il est le fils d'Isa bin Salman Al Khalifa, qui a été l'émir précédent et premier. La dynastie Al Khalifa règne sur le pays depuis 1783.

TEXT.English: Abu Muhammad Abdallah al-Mahdi Billah (873 - 4 March 934) was the founder of the Ismaili Fatimid Caliphate, the only major Shi'a caliphate in Islam, and established Fatimid rule throughout much of North Africa, Hejaz, Palestine and the Levant. At the beginning of the Abbasid realm in Baghdad, the Alids faced severe persecution by the ruling party as they were a direct threat to the Abbasid Caliphate. Owing to the political complexities, the forefathers of Imam Abdullah opted to conceal themselves which helped them maintain the Dawa's existence. As a result, these Imams travelled towards the Iranian Plateau to distance themselves from the epicentre of their political difficulties. Al Mahdi's father, Imam al Husain al Mastoor returned in secrecy to Syria and began to control the Dawa's affairs from there in complete concealment. He sent two Da'is of great calibre, Abul Qasim and Abu 'Abdullah Al-Husayn Al-Shi'i to Yemen and North Africa, respectively, to build the foundation for what was to later be the Fatimid Caliphate.

Al-Mansur or Abu Ja'far Abdallah ibn Muhammad al-Mansur was the second Abbasid Caliph reigning from 136 AH to 158 AH (754 AD - 775 AD) and succeeding his brother Abu al-'Abbas al-Saffah. Al-Mansur is generally regarded as the real founder of the Abbasid Caliphate, one of the largest polities in world history, for his role in stabilizing and institutionalizing the dynasty. He is also known for founding the 'round city' of Madinat al-Salam which was to become the core of imperial Baghdad.
TEXT.French: Al-Mansur, ou Abu Ja'far Abdallah ibn Muhammad al-Mansur, a été le deuxième calife abbasside, en fonction de 136 AH à 158 AH (754 à 775 ap. J.-C.), succédant à son frère Abu al-'Abbas al-Saffah. Al-Mansur est généralement considéré comme le véritable fondateur du califat abbasside, l'une des plus grandes puissances de l'histoire mondiale, notamment pour avoir stabilisé et institutionnalisé la dynastie. Il est aussi connu pour avoir fondé la 'ville ronde' de Madinat al-Salam, qui est devenu le coeur de l'empire de Bagdad.

TEXT.English: Ya'qub ibn al-Layth al-Saffar a Persian coppersmith, was the founder of the Saffarid dynasty of Sistan, with its capital at Zaranj (a city now in south-western Afghanistan). He ruled territories that are now in Iran and Afghanistan, as well as portions of western Pakistan and a small part of Iraq. He was succeeded by his brother, Amr ibn al-Layth.
TEXT.French: Ya'qub ibn al-Layth al-Saffar, or orfilianteur persan, était le fondateur de la dynastie Saffaride de Sistan, avec sa capitale à Zaranj (une ville aujourd'hui dans le sud-ouest de l'Afghanistan). Il a gouverné des territoires qui sont maintenant en Iran et en Afghanistan, ainsi que des parties de l'ouest du Pakistan et une petite partie de l'Irak. Son frère, Amr ibn al-Layth, lui succéda.

TEXT.English: Speculation that the idea of Amazons contains a core of reality is based on archaeological findings from burials, pointing to the possibility that some Sarmatian women may have participated in battle. These findings have led scholars to suggest that the Amazonian legend in Greek mythology may have been "inspired by real warrior women". Evidence of high-ranking warrior women comes from kurgans in southern Ukraine and Russia. David Anthony notes, "About 20% of Scythian-Sarmatian 'warrior graves' on the lower Don and lower Volga contained women dressed for battle similar to how men dress, a phenomenon that probably inspired the Greek tales about the Amazons."
The act of lying in wait to attack by surprise. A sudden attack made from a concealed position.
TEXT.French: L'acte d'attendre caché pour lancer une attaque surprise. Une attaque soudaine menée depuis une position cachée.
TEXT.Polish: Napastnik ukrywa siê by dokonaæ nag³ego ataku z zaskoczenia.

German.Text: Navy SEAL:Navy SEALs:Navy SEAL:Navy SEAL:Navy SEALs:Navy SEALs:Navy SEALs:Navy SEALs

Spanish.Text: SEAL de la Marina:SEAL de la Marina

TEXT.English: Navy SEALs are elite counter-terrorism and covert operations forces trained to operate in small groups deep behind enemy lines. Their missions include reconnaissance, counter-terrorism and unconventional and counter-guerilla warfare. The SEALs are deployed by sea, air and land; hence their title. SEALs are trained to reach their destination by parachutes and paragliders, by marching through miles of difficult terrain, or by small boat or scuba gear. [PARAGRAPH:1]SEALs are equipped with the most sophisticated combat gear in the world, including night goggles, global positioning systems, satellite radios, laser sights, plastic explosives, and so on. Further, SEALs are trained in many forms of hand-to-hand combat, and an unarmed SEAL may be more dangerous than a handful of regular soldiers armed with assault rifles.
TEXT.French: Les Navy SEALs forment une troupe d'élite spécialisée dans l'antiterrorisme et les opérations clandestines, entraînée pour opérer en petites unités loin derrière les lignes ennemies. Leurs missions incluent la reconnaissance, l'antiterrorisme, ainsi que les guerres non-conventionnelles et antiguérillas. Les SEALs interviennent par air, mer ou terre. Ils sont entraînés au saut en parachute, aux longues marches en terrain difficile et à la plongée sous-marine. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les SEALs disposent de l'équipement de combat le plus sophistiqué au monde : lunettes de vision nocturne, systèmes GPS, radios satellite, visée laser... Les SEALs sont, de plus, entraînés au combat au corps à corps et, même désarmés, sont extrêmement dangereux.
TEXT.German: Navy SEALs sind auf Geheimoperationen im feindlichen Hinterland spezialisierte Antiterror-Einheiten. Sie werden als Aufklärungseinheiten, für Antiterroreinsätze und als Guerillakämpfer zu Wasser, in der Luft oder an Land eingesetzt (daher die Bezeichnung (SEa, Air, Land)). SEALS springen mit Fallschirmen über dem Zielgebiet ab und sind in der Lage, sich auch in schwierigstem Gelände zurechtzufinden. Darüber hinaus gehören Boote und Tauchgeräte zu ihrer Standardausrüstung.[PARAGRAPH:1]SEALs verfügen über eine perfekte Ausrüstung (Nachtsichtgeräte, GPS, Satellitentelefone, Laserzielerfassung, Plastiksprengstoff usw.) und beherrschen verschiedene Nahkampftechniken. Nicht zuletzt deshalb kann ein unbewaffneter SEAL mehrere, mit Sturmgewehren bewaffnete, Soldaten problemlos ausschalten.
TEXT.Italian: I Navy SEAL sono delle squadre operative speciali antiterrorismo, specializzate nell'operare in mezzo alle linee nemiche. I loro compiti comprendono ricognizioni, operazioni antiterrorismo e di guerriglia. I SEAL vengono schierati via mare, terra e cielo: vengono addestrati per raggiungere la loro destinazione tramite paracadute, parapendio o camminando per chilometri su terreni accidentati e pericolosi. [PARAGRAPH:1]I SEAL sono equipaggiati con le tecnologie di combattimento più avanzate del mondo, come visori notturni, GPS, radio satellitari, mirini laser, esplosivi al plastico e via dicendo. Inoltre, i SEAL sono addestrati nel combattimento corpo a corpo: un solo SEAL disarmato può essere più pericoloso di una manciata di soldati regolari armati con fucili d'assalto.
TEXT.Spanish: Los SEAL de la Marina son fuerzas especializadas en lucha anti-terrorista y operaciones especiales, entrenadas para operar en grupos reducidos tras las líneas enemigas. Realizan misiones de reconocimiento, anti-terrorismo, guerra no-convencional y contrainsurgencia. Los SEAL se despliegan por tierra, mar y aire; de ahí su denominación ("sea, air and land" en inglés). Están entrenados para llegar a su destino en paracaídas o planeadores, atravesando territorio agreste, en lancha o utilizando equipos de buceo. [PARAGRAPH:1]Los SEAL cuentan con el equipamiento de combate más sofisticado del mundo, que incluye gafas de visión nocturna, sistemas de posicionamiento global, radios por satélite, miras láser, explosivos plásticos y cosas por el estilo. Además, reciben entrenamiento en numerosas formas de lucha cuerpo a cuerpo, y uno de ellos desarmado puede ser más letal que un puñado de soldados regulares con rifles de asalto.

TEXT.English: Amina Sukhera (also called Aminatu) was a Muslim princess of the royal family of Zazzau (now Zaria), in what is now northeast Nigeria. She was born c. 1533 and is estimated to have died around 1610. Amina was a preeminent gimbiya (princess) but various theories exist as to the time of her reign or if she ever was a queen. One explanation states that she reigned from approximately 1536 to 1573, while another posits that she became queen after her brother Karama's death, in 1576. Yet another claims that although she was a leading princess, she was never a queen. When Amina was seven years old her mother, Bakwa Turunku, became queen. During this point in her life, she became involved in the Zazzau military, earning much admiration for her bravery. Her military achievements brought her great wealth and power. She is credited as the architect of the earthen walls around the city of Zaria, for which the providence is named. These walls are often referred to as Ganuwar Amina. It is a subject of debate as to whether or not Amina was actually queen, but she was responsible for conquering many of the cities in the area surrounding Zazzau. According to those who believe that she did ascend to the throne, in her thirty-four year reign she expanded the domain of Zazzau to its largest size. Some sources state that her main focus was not on the annexation of neighboring lands, but on forcing local rulers to accept vassal status and permit Hausa traders safe passage.
TEXT.Polish: Amina Sukhera (zwana równie¿ Aminatu) by³a muzu³mañsk¹ ksiê¿niczk¹ z królewskiej rodziny z Zazzau (dzis. Zaria), w pó³nocno-wsch. Nigerii. Urodzi³a siê ok. 1533 i szacuje siê, ¿e umar³a ok. 1610. Amina by³a znakomit¹ gimbiya (ksiê¿niczk¹) ale istnieje wiele teorii mówi¹cych o latach w których panowa³a, a nawet o fakcie czy w ogóle panowa³a. Wed³ug jednych teorii panowa³a w latach 1536 - 1573, wed³ug innych dosz³a do w³adzy dopiero po œmierci swego brata Karamy w 1576. Jeszcze inne mówi¹ o tym, ¿e by³a czo³ow¹ ksi¹¿niczk¹, ale nigdy nie zosta³a królow¹.

TEXT.English: Amon Bazira (1944-1993) was a Pan-Africanist leader and organiser who created an extensive intelligence network that was a clandestine component of the struggle to end the regime of Ugandan military dictator and president, Idi Amin. After helping to remove Idi Amin, Bazira served as Deputy Director of intelligence, and then as Director of Intelligence in Uganda in 1979. He produced a government report predicting that there would be a massive genocide in Rwanda that would lead to the collapse of order in Central and Eastern Africa, and proposed granting citizenship to Rwandan refugees and other displaced Africans in Uganda, as a means of preventing genocidal warfare. In August 1993, Amon Bazira was assassinated in Kenya at Nakuru, allegedly with the complicity of Tiny Rowland, Yoweri Museveni and Daniel arap Moi. Bazira's Pan African ideas and efforts helped in the creation of the African Unification Front, which has advanced the cause of Pan Africanism.
The Ancient Flamethrower throws burning pitch or tar onto his enemies, killing them painfully.
TEXT.French: Le Flambeur Antique jette de la braise ou du goudron enflammés sur ses ennemis, les tuant de façon douloureuse.
TEXT.Italian: Il lanciafiamme antico lancia pece e catrame incendiati contro i nemici, uccidendoli dolorosamente.
TEXT.Polish: Ogieñ grecki - ³atwopalna mieszanina, uwa¿ana za pierwowzór napalmu. Ogieñ grecki zwany jest te¿ ogniem bizantyjskim (sami Bizantyñczycy zwali go rzymskim lub morskim, nazwa grecki jest póŸniejsza). Zapewne znany by³ w staro¿ytnoœci, a udoskonalony w Bizancjum.
TEXT.Russian: Äðåâíèé îãíåìåòàòåëü áðîñàåò ãîðÿùóþ ñìîëó èëè äåãîòü â ñâîèõ âðàãîâ, ïðè÷èíÿÿ èì ìó÷èòåëüíóþ ñìåðòü.
TEXT.Spanish: El Guerrero con lanzallamas lanza brea o alquitrán sobre sus enemigos, llevándolos a una muerte dolorosa.

TEXT.English: Prior to the invention of the cannon, projectile weapons existed using compressed air and steam. The invention of the cannon, driven by gunpowder, was first developed in China. Like firearms, cannon are a descendant of the fire-lance, a gunpowder-filled tube used as a flamethrower. Shrapnel was sometimes placed in the barrel, so that it would fly out along with the flames. Eventually, the paper and bamboo of which fire lance barrels were originally constructed came to be replaced by metal. The earliest known depiction of a firearm is a sculpture from a cave in Sichuan, dating to the 12th century, that portrays a figure carrying a vase-shaped bombard, firing flames and a cannonball. The oldest surviving gun, dated to 1288, has a muzzle bore diameter of 2.5 cm (1 in); the second oldest, dated to 1332, has a muzzle bore diameter of 10.5 cm (4 in).
TEXT.Polish: Staro¿ytne Dzia³o Rêczne - ulepszona wersja Staro¿ytnej Rakietnicy.

TEXT.English: The availability of black powder (gunpowder) to propel projectiles was a precursor to experiments as weapons such as bombs, cannon, incendiary fire arrows and rocket-propelled fire arrows.[nb 1][nb 2] The discovery of gunpowder was probably the product of centuries of alchemical experimentation in which Taoist alchemists were trying to create an elixir of immortality that would allow the person ingesting it to become physically immortal. However, anyone with a wood fire might have observed the acceleration of combustion that accidentally-chosen saltpetre-containing rocks would have produced. Exactly when the first flights of rockets occurred is contested. Merely lighting a centimeter-sized solid lump of gunpowder on one side can cause it to move via reaction (even without a nozzle for efficiency), so confinement in a tube and other design refinements may easily have followed for the experimentally-minded with ready access to saltpetre.
TEXT.Polish: Staro¿ytna Rakietnica pierwsza broñ wykorzystuj¹ca siarkê do miotania pocisków.

TEXT.English: The Andamanese resemble other Negrito groups in Southeast Asia. They are pygmies, and are the only modern people outside of certain parts of Sub-Saharan Africa with steatopygia. They lead a hunter-gatherer lifestyle, and appear to have lived in substantial isolation for thousands of years. The Andamanese are believed to be descended from the migrations which, about 70,000 years ago, brought the first modern humans out of Africa to the Andaman Islands.
TEXT.French: Les Andamanais ressemblent à d'autres groupes négritos d'Asie du Sud-Est. Ce sont des pygmées, et ils sont la seule population moderne hors de certaines régions de l'Afrique subsaharienne à présenter une steatopygie. Ils mènent un mode de vie de chasseurs-cueilleurs, et il semble qu'ils aient vécu dans une grande isolation pendant des milliers d'années. On pense que les Andamanais descendent des migrations qui, il y a environ 70 000 ans, ont fait sortir les premiers Homo sapiens d'Afrique vers les îles Andaman.

TEXT.English: The Next Generation of cybernetic footsoldiers. Upgraded with all the latest tech for hurting people and blowing stuff up! Morale and insubordination issues are a thing of the past! No mission is too big - or too suicidal - now that the Androids are here!
TEXT.French: La nouvelle génération de fantassins cybernétiques. Améliorés avec toute la technologie moderne pour faire du mal et faire sauter des choses ! La morale et l'insubordination appartiennent au passé ! Aucune mission n'est trop grande - ni trop risquée - maintenant que les Androids sont là !
TEXT.Polish: Android - robot humanoid, czyli mechaniczne urz¹dzenie wykonuj¹ce automatycznie pewne zadania, którego kszta³t przypomina ludzkie cia³o. Androidy s¹ postaciami wystêpuj¹cymi w literaturze i filmie science-fiction. Android posiadaj¹cy cechy kobiece nazywany jest fembotem.
TEXT.Russian: Ñëåäóþùåå ïîêîëåíèå êèáåð-ïåõîòèíöåâ. Îíè ìîäåðíèçèðîâàíû ñ ó÷åòîì âñåõ ïîñëåäíèõ òåõíîëîãèé, êîòîðûå îñòàâëÿþò îáû÷íóþ ïåõîòó äàëåêî ïîçàäè! Ïðîáëåìû áîåâîãî äóõà è íåïîä÷èíåíèå ïðèêàçàì îñòàëèñü â ïðîøëîì! Íè îäíà ìèññèÿ íå ÿâëÿåòñÿ ñëèøêîì òðóäíîé èëè ñëèøêîì ñàìîóáèéñòâåííîé - ñ òåõ ïîð êàê àíäðîèäû çäåñü!

TEXT.English: The time has finally arrived where the formless begins to trump form. Where the meek shall inherit the Earth. The miniature minds of many add into a massive mind of one. This particular Anima Cloud is tasked to find and repair all manner of biological and technological systems, repairing flesh and silicon at mind-numbing speeds by recombinating at the sub-molecular level. The cloud simply extends to coat the injured and 'flesh' out whatever happens to be missing or dysfunctional. Humans live in terror of that which they have created has now created. But at least this particular swarm is entirely benevolent. Not all such submolecular forces will prove to be so kind.
TEXT.Polish: W teorii s¹ to mechanizmy bardzo ma³e (kilka nanometrów) s³u¿¹ce do celów medycznych, tudzie¿ bojowych. Mog¹ dzia³aæ jak Chmura Naprawcza (reperowaæ struktury budynków i pojazdów). Specjaliœci od Nanotechnologii czêsto krytykuj¹ pomys³y pisarzy gatunków Cyberpunk czy Wojennej Fantastyki ¿e Nanoboty ( popularna nazwa Nanomaszyn) mog¹ byæ u¿ywane do celów przestêpczych lub wojny, choæ inni specjaliœci twierdz¹ ¿e: "Armia i Ulica znajd¹ zastosowanie do wszystkiego". Obecnie najbardziej prawdopodobne jest zastosowanie In¿ynierów z ksi¹¿ek naukowych Dexlera. s¹ to Nanomaszyny stworzone z Bia³ek, min kultur E-coli.
TEXT.Russian: Наконец пришло время, когда бесформенное начинает диктовать условия форме, где малые наследуют Землю, а меньшие умы многих превосходят один сверхразум. Именно этому Облаку Анима поручено находить и восстанавливать всевозможные биологические и технологические системы, восстанавливая плоть и кремний с невероятной скоростью путем рекомбинации на субмолекулярном уровне. Облако просто простирается, чтобы покрыть раненых и «размять» то, что, как оказалось, отсутствует или недееспособно. Люди живут в ужасе от того, что они создали. Но, по крайней мере, этот особый рой совершенно доброжелателен. Не все такие субмолекулярные силы окажутся такими благими.

TEXT.English: The Giant Anteater, Myrmecophaga tridactyla, is the largest species of anteater. It is the only species in the genus Myrmecophaga. It is found in Central and South America from Honduras to northern Argentina. Its fossil remains have been found as far north as northwestern Sonora, Mexico.[PARAGRAPH:2]It is a solitary animal, found in many habitats, including grasslands, deciduous forests and rainforests. It feeds mainly on ants and termites, sometimes up to 30,000 insects in a single day.[PARAGRAPH:2]The genus name Myrmecophaga is from Greek murmekos, ant, and phagein, to eat.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Große Ameisenbär[COLOR_REVERT] (Myrmecophaga tridactyla) ist ein Säugetier der Gattung Zahnarme und ein naher Verwandter der Faultiere. Er ist wie alle Ameisenbären in Mittel- und Südamerika verbreitet. Wie der Name schon sagt, handelt es sich um den größten Vertreter der Ameisenbären. Er misst maximal 140 cm, der Schwanz ist weitere 50-70 cm lang. Typisch für Ameisenbären ist die lange, röhrenförmige Schnauze, die hervorragend für das Aufspüren ihrer Lieblingsspeise geeignet ist. Ebenfalls charakteristisch sind der lange Schwanz und die scharfen Krallen an den Vorderzehen.[NEWLINE]Der Große Ameisenbär ist ein Bodenbewohner. Er lebt in Wäldern oder offenen Savannen. Weibchen bringen in der Regel ein einzelnes Junges zur Welt, das in den ersten Monaten häufig auf dem Rücken der Mutter liegt. Durch die Fellzeichnung verschmilzt es fast mit der Mutter und ist somit für Feinde unsichtbar. Die natürlichen Fressfeinde sind Puma und Jaguar.[NEWLINE]Der Große Ameisenbär ist die einzige der zehn Ameisenbärarten, die als gefährdet eingestuft wird. Hauptgründe sind die Bejagung und die Zerstörung des Lebensraums.
TEXT.Polish: Mrówkojad wielki (Myrmecophaga tridactyla)? gatunek ssaka z rodziny mrówkojadów. Zwierzêta tego gatunku wystêpuj¹ w Ameryce Œrodkowej i Po³udniowej. Œredniej wielkoœci ssak o szarobrunatnym ubarwieniu z czarn¹ szerok¹ prêg¹ biegn¹c¹ po bokach i przez pierœ. Charakterystyczny, bardzo d³ugi pysk zakoñczony jest ma³ym otworem gêbowym; brak zêbów, d³ugi (do 60 cm) i lepki jêzyk umo¿liwia wyci¹ganie mrówek i termitów z ich gniazd. Koñczyny przednie przystosowane do grzebania, zaopatrzone w 4 pazury, z których 3 s¹ bardzo du¿e i silne.[PARAGRAPH:2]Zamieszkuje d¿ungle deszczowe, lasy mieszane, trawiaste równiny i stepy. ¯yj¹ samotnie, ³¹cz¹ siê w pary tylko w okresie godów. Jeden osobnik, zale¿nie od iloœci dostêpnego po¿ywienia zajmuje obszar od 1 km2 - 2,5 km2. Od¿ywia siê g³ównie ¿yj¹cymi w ziemi gatunkami mrówek. Termity lub mrówki wêdrowne zjada bardzo rzadko. Wyszukuje mrowiska korzystaj¹c ze znakomitego wêchu, nastêpnie rozgrzebuje czêœæ mrowiska i za pomoc¹ d³ugiego, lepkiego jêzyka wyci¹ga mrówki z wnêtrza mrowiska. Nigdy nie niszczy ca³ego mrowiska. Ponadto zjada równie¿ larwy owadów, owoce oraz ptasie jaja.

TEXT.English: Anthroids are so intelligent, they claim to be as good or better than biological people in every way. If them taking the battlefield means that I don't have to, they can't be that smart, but then who am I to argue?
TEXT.French: Les anthroids sont si intelligents qu'ils affirment être aussi bons, voire meilleurs, que des êtres humains biologiques à tous points de vue. S'ils prennent le champ de bataille à ma place, ils ne peuvent pas être si intelligents, mais alors, qui suis-je pour argumenter ?
TEXT.Polish: Antroidy s¹ tak doskona³ym tworem, ¿e uwa¿aj¹ siê za lepszych od istot ludzkich.
TEXT.Russian: Ñ÷èòàåòñÿ, ÷òî Àíòðîèäû íàñòîëüêî óìíû, ÷òî ïðåâîñõîäÿò îáû÷íîãî ÷åëîâåêà âî âñåõ îòíîøåíèÿõ. Ðàíåíîå ×ÑÂ, êîíå÷íî, ïîäíèìåò ïðè ýòîì áóíò, íî âðÿä ëè ýòî áóäåò àðãóìåíòîì, åñëè Àíòðîèäû çàÿâÿòñÿ íà ïîëå áèòâû.

TEXT.English: Light 'Mechs are those that weigh between 20 and 35 tons. They often serve as Scout 'Mechs or Striker Roles. They are light, therefore generally fast why they tend to mount light weapon payloads or electronics and ECM equipment. Despite their small size they can be quite formidable having a small profile and being fast.
TEXT.French: Les mechs légers pèsent entre 20 et 35 tonnes. Ils servent souvent comme mechs éclaireurs ou en rôle de frappe rapide. Ils sont légers, donc généralement rapides, et équipés de charges légères ou de composants électroniques et ECM. Malgré leur petite taille, ils peuvent être très redoutables, avec un profil réduit et une grande vitesse.
TEXT.Russian: Легкие роботы - это те, которые весят от 20 до 35 тонн. Они часто служат в качестве роботов-разведчиков или нападающих. Они легкие, поэтому обычно быстрые, поэтому на них обычно устанавливают полезную нагрузку в лице легкого вооружения или электроники, ЭМИ-оборудования. Несмотря на свой небольшой размер, они могут быть довольно грозными, имея небольшой профиль и мобильными.

TEXT.English: The Akimel O'otham lived along the Gila River, Salt River, Yaqui River, and Sonora River in ranchería-style villages. The villages were set up as a loose group of houses with familial groups sharing a central ramada and kitchen area with brush olaski's (round houses) surrounding. The O'otham are matrilocal, and familial groups tended to consist of extended families. The Akimel O'otham also lived in temporary field houses seasonally, to tend their crops.
TEXT.French: Les Akimel O'otham vivaient le long du fleuve Gila, du Salt River, du Yaqui, et du Sonora, dans des villages de style ranchería. Ces villages étaient construits en groupes de maisons avec des familles partageant une ramada centrale et une zone de cuisine, entourés de huttes rondes en branchages (olaskis). Les O'otham sont matrilocaux, et leurs groupes familiaux comprenaient généralement des familles étendues. Ils vivaient aussi dans des maisons de campagne temporaires en saison, pour prendre soin de leurs cultures.

TEXT.English: Antonio Ruiz de Montoya, born in Lima, Peru on 13 June 1585 and died there on 11 April 1652, was a Jesuit priest and missionary in the Paraguay Reductions. Montoya entered the Society of Jesus on 1 November 1606. In the same year, he accompanied Father Diego Torres, the first provincial of Paraguay, to this mission. In co-operation with Fathers Cataldino and Mazeta, he founded the Reductions of Guayra. He also brought a number of tribal groups into the Catholic Church, and is said to have personally baptized 100,000 Indians. As head of the missions he had charge from 1620 of the "Reductions" on the upper and middle course of the Parana River, on the Uruguay River, and the Tape River, and added thirteen further "reductions" to the twenty six already existing.

[H1]Cochise[\H1][BOLD] Chief of the Chiricahua Apache Lived:[\BOLD] 1805 - 1874[BOLD] [PARAGRAPH:2]Background:[\BOLD] Adatlichi, better known as 'Cochise' (meaning 'hardwood') was a chief of the Chokonen band of the Chiricahua Apache and the leader of an uprising that began in 1861. Cochise was described as a large man (for the time), with a muscular frame, classical Roman features, and long black hair which he wore in traditional Apache style. [PARAGRAPH:1]Cochise and the Chokonen-Chiricahua lived in the area that is now the northern Mexican region of Sonora, and New Mexico and Arizona, which were traditional Apache territories until the coming of the Europeans. Due to encroachment by Spain and later Mexico, the Chokonen and Nednhi-Chiricahua became increasingly dependent upon food rations issued by the Mexican government to placate them. When this practice was abruptly ended in 1831, the various Chiricahua bands resumed raids to acquire food. Mexican troops were largely unsuccessful in their attempts to address this and were often fought to a standstill by the Apache. As part of their attempts at controlling the Chiricahua, Mexican forces, often with the help of American and Native American mercenaries, began to kill Apache civilians, including Cochise's father. Mexican forces were finally able to capture Cochise in 1848 during an Apache raid on Fronteras, Sonora, but they exchanged him for nearly a dozen Mexican hostages. [PARAGRAPH:1]At Apache Pass in 1862, Cochise and his father-in-law, Mangas Coloradas, with 500 fighters, held their ground against a force of 3,000 California volunteers under Carleton until howitzer artillery fire was brought to bear on their position. The impasse continued until both parties agreed to parley. During what was to be a peaceful parley session, the Americans took the unsuspecting Mangas Coloradas prisoner and then later executed him. This continued a series of incidents that fanned the flames of enmity between the encroaching Americans and the Apache. For Cochise, the Americans held nothing sacred and had violated the rules of war by capturing Mangas Coloradas during a parley session. Cochise and the Apache continued their raids against American and Mexican settlements and military positions throughout the 1860s. [PARAGRAPH:1]Following various skirmishes, Cochise and his men were gradually driven into the Dragoon Mountains but were nevertheless able to use the mountains as cover and as a base from which to continue significant skirmishes against white settlements. This was the situation until 1871 when General George Crook assumed command and used other Apaches as scouts and informants and was thereby able to force Cochise's men to surrender. Cochise was taken into custody in September of that year. The next year, the Chiricahua were ordered to Tularosa Reservation in New Mexico but refused to leave their ancestral lands in Arizona, which were guaranteed to them under treaty. Cochise managed to escape again and renewed raids and skirmishes against settlements through most of 1872. A new treaty was later negotiated by General Oliver O. Howard as the Americans relented to some of the Apaches' terms. Cochise quietly retired to an Arizona reservation, where he died of natural causes.

The Apollonian Guard is a Trojan unique unit, an alternative to the Spearman. Because it is a palace guard type of unit, it comes with the promotions Policing I and City Garrison I. Thus it is the ideal unit for defending cities against mounted units, and better than the Town Watchmen at keeping Crime in check.
TEXT.French: La Garde Apollonienne est une unité unique troyenne, alternative au fantassin de pique. En tant qu'unité de garde du palais, elle dispose des promotions Policing I et City Garrison I. Elle est donc idéale pour défendre les villes contre les unités montées, et meilleure que les Veilleurs de la ville pour maintenir le crime sous contrôle.
TEXT.Italian: La guardia Apolloniana è l'unità unica troiana, sostituta del lanciere. Dato che era assegnata alla difesa di un palazzo, inizia con le promozioni Polizia I e Guarnigione I. Per questo motivo è l'unità ideale per difendere le città dalle unità montate, oltre ad essere meglio delle sentinelle cittadine a tenere sotto controllo il crimine.
TEXT.Russian: Гвардия Аполона - это уникальный троянский отряд, альтернатива Копьеносцу. Поскольку это отряд дворцовой стражи, он стартует с квалификациями Оперативник I и Гарнизон I. Таким образом, это идеальный отряд для защиты городов от конных отрядов, и он лучше справляется в сдерживании преступности, чем любые Городские стражи.

TEXT.English: The Apothecary provides his patients with medicinal herbs, which were very effective in healing the allergies, and raising and renewing the body vitality.
TEXT.French: L'Apothicaire fournit à ses patients des plantes médicinales, très efficaces pour la guérison des allergies, et permettant d'am renouveler la vitalité du corps.

TEXT.English: The Killke culture occupied the South American region around Cusco, Peru from 900 to 1200 AD, prior to the arrival of the Incas in the 13th century. Killke culture flourished in highland Peru in the Late Intermediate Period around what is now Cusco. They built the massive fortress, Saksaywaman, during the 12th century. Later, the fortress was used by the Inca, following their occupation of the region.
TEXT.French: La culture Killke occupa la région sud-américaine autour de Cusco, au Pérou, de 900 à 1200 après J.-C., avant l'arrivée des Incas au XIIIe siècle. La culture Killke prospère dans la haute région du Pérou à la période intermédiaire tardive, autour de ce qui est aujourd'hui Cusco. Ils ont construit la masseive forteresse de Saksaywaman au XIIe siècle. Par la suite, les Incas ont utilisé cette forteresse après avoir occupé la région.

TEXT.English: Historically, a galiot was a type of ship with oars, also known as a half-galley, then, from the 17th century forward, a ship with sails and oars. As used by the Barbary pirates against the Republic of Venice, a galiot had two masts and about 16 pairs of oars. Warships of the type typically carried between two and ten cannons of small caliber, and between 50 and 150 men. According to Philip Carse's The Age of Piracy (Hale, 1959), it was a Barbary galiot, captained by Barbarossa I, that captured two Papal vessels in 1504.

In the Arabian Peninsula, cavalrymen ride on either horse or camel. While horses are somewhat easier to train than camels, camels are the obvious choice for forces operating in the deep desert. Arab tribesmen such as the Bedouin have always been fearsome warriors, and their prowess with bow and arrow (and later, rifle) from atop a mount has become the stuff of legend.
TEXT.French: Dans la péninsule arabique, les cavaliers montaient soit des chevaux soit des chameaux. Bien que les chevaux soient plus faciles à dresser, les chameaux sont, par nature, beaucoup mieux adaptés au désert. Les membres des tribus arabes, comme les bédouins, ont toujours été de redoutables combattants, et leur adresse à l'arc (et plus tard au fusil) depuis le dos d'une monture est légendaire.
TEXT.German: Auf der Arabischen Halbinsel reiten Kavalleristen auf Pferden oder Kamelen. Pferde sind zwar leichter auszubilden als Kamele, eignen sich aber nur bedingt für den Einsatz in der Wüste. Beduinen und andere arabische Stämme gelten traditionell als Furcht erregende Krieger, die vortrefflich mit Pfeil und Bogen (bzw. Gewehren) umzugehen wissen.
TEXT.Italian: Nella penisola Araba, i soldati montavano cammelli o cavalli. Sebbene i cavalli siano più addomesticabili dei cammelli, questi ultimi erano la scelta obbligata per affrontare le regioni desertiche. I Beduini delle tribù arabe sono sempre stati temibili guerrieri e la loro abilità con l'arco (e successivamente con i fucili) montando in sella, li rese leggendari.
TEXT.Spanish: En la península arábiga, la caballería empleaba caballos o camellos. Aunque los caballos son un poco más fáciles de entrenar que los camellos, éstos son idóneos para las operaciones militares en el desierto. Las tribus árabes, como por ejemplo los beduinos, han sido siempre luchadores temibles, y su destreza con el arco (y, más adelante, el fusil) a lomos de una caballo ha llegado a ser legendaria.

TEXT.English: The Chaco region in the north of Argentina and part of Paraguay was formerly covered with forests. The Toba were originally nomadic hunter-gatherers who, upon the arrival of the Spanish, adopted the horse and resisted colonial encroachment and the establishment of missions for several centuries. In the 1880s the Argentine government began a campaign to occupy new territories, defeating the last organized attempts by the Toba to defend their lands. The Argentine Chaco was divided up in large portions and exploited, especially for the valuable quebracho tree, used for its tannin and its extremely durable timber. This devastated the ecosystem in a relatively short time. The private owners of the Chaco then turned to cotton production, employing the Toba as a cheap seasonal workforce; the conditions did not change substantially for decades

The bow and arrow, invented in prehistoric times, greatly improved the hunting skills of early man, allowing him to kill his targets from a distance. The bow was eventually adapted for use in battle, and was first used by Egyptian, Persian, and Assyrian armies as early as 5000 BC. The range provided by the bow allowed small forces of archers to rout armies of superior number armed only with hand-to-hand weapons. Archers were often used to soften enemy resistance prior to sending in mounted and skirmishing forces. Refinements in design and construction allowed the bow to remain an effective weapon until firearms finally replaced it in the 1500s.
TEXT.French: L'arc et la flèche, inventés à l'époque préhistorique, ont considérablement facilité la pratique de la chasse, en permettant à nos ancêtres de tuer leurs cibles à distance. L'arc a ensuite été adapté pour la guerre, d'abord par les Egyptiens, les Assyriens et les Perses, et ce dès 5 000 ans av. J.-C. Le tir à distance permettait à de petites troupes de mettre en déroute des armées entières équipées seulement d'armes de combat rapproché. Les archers étaient également souvent utilisés pour affaiblir l'ennemi avant l'attaque. Les améliorations successives ont permis à l'arc de rester une arme efficace jusqu'à son remplacement par les armes à feu, au XVIe siècle.
TEXT.German: Bereits in prähistorischen Zeiten verbesserten Pfeil und Bogen das Jagdgeschick des Frühzeitmenschen, der so seine Beute aus der Entfernung erlegen konnte. Später wurde der Bogen auch zu Kampfzwecken eingesetzt und schon um 5000 vor Christus von den ägyptischen, persischen und assyrischen Streitkräften benutzt. Dank der Reichweite des Pfeils war selbst eine kleine Truppe von Bogenschützen in der Lage, auch größere, mit Nahkampfwaffen ausgerüstete Heerscharen vernichtend zu schlagen. Bogenschützen dienten häufig als Vorhut, um den feindlichen Widerstand bis zum Eintreffen der nachrückenden berittenen und sonstigen Nahkampfeinheiten zu schwächen. Da Form und Herstellungsverfahren von Pfeil und Bogen kontinuierlich verbessert wurden, zählten sie bis zum Aufkommen der Schusswaffen im 16. Jahrhundert zu den effizientesten Kampfwerkzeugen überhaupt.
TEXT.Italian: L'arco e la freccia, inventati in periodo preistorico, migliorarono notevolmente le capacità di caccia dei primi uomini, consentendo loro di colpire il bersaglio da lontano. L'arco fu successivamente modificato per essere utilizzato in battaglia e impiegato dagli eserciti Egizi, Persiani e Assiri fin dal 5000 a. C. L'efficacia dell'arco consentiva a piccole unità di mettere in rotta eserciti di dimensioni maggiori, i cui soldati usavano armi da combattimento ravvicinato. Gli arcieri venivano spesso impiegati per fiaccare la resistenza del nemico, prima di far intervenire le truppe a cavallo e la fanteria. Gli interventi sulla forma e sulla struttura dell'arco permisero a quest'arma di rimanere efficace fino al 1500, quando fu sostituito dalle armi da fuoco.
TEXT.Spanish: El arco y la flecha, inventados en la Prehistoria, supusieron una notable mejora para los cazadores primitivos, permitiéndoles abatir presas situadas a gran distancia. El arco no tardó en convertirse en un arma de guerra, y fue empleado por primera vez por los ejércitos egipcios, persas y asirios allá por el año 5000 a. C. El gran alcance del arco permitía que pequeños contingentes de arqueros derrotaran ejércitos más numerosos que fueran equipados solo con armas blancas. A menudo se usaba a los arqueros para socavar la resistencia enemiga antes de enviar a la caballería y los hostigadores. Los avances en el diseño y la construcción permitieron que el arco siguiera siendo un arma eficaz hasta la consolidación definitiva de las armas de fuego en el siglo XV.

TEXT.English: Archimedes of Syracuse was an Ancient Greek mathematician, physicist, engineer, inventor, and astronomer. Although few details of his life are known, he is regarded as one of the leading scientists in classical antiquity. Generally considered the greatest mathematician of antiquity and one of the greatest of all time, Archimedes anticipated modern calculus and analysis by applying concepts of infinitesimals and the method of exhaustion to derive and rigorously prove a range of geometrical theorems, including the area of a circle, the surface area and volume of a sphere, and the area under a parabola.

Aretas III was king of the Nabataean kingdom from 87 to 62 BCE. Aretas ascended to the throne upon the death of his brother, Obodas I, in 87 BCE. During his reign, he extended his kingdom to cover what now forms the northern area of Jordan, the south of Syria, and part of Saudi Arabia. Probably the greatest of Aretas' conquests was that of Damascus, which secured his country's place as a serious political power of its time. Nabataea reached its greatest territorial extent under Aretas' leadership.

The Arverni ("Superior Ones", home to the famous Vercingetorix) are a large powerful tribe who have become extremely wealthy through trade with the Mediterranean and 'exploitation' of the trade routes North. As such, the Arverni have a large body of Nobles afforded the time and wealth to prepare for battle. The Arjos ("Nobles") sport the finest equipment available and train daily in its use. Due to their wealth and status they tend not to be as concerned with feats of valor, but instead exhibit greater tenacity in battle.

At the beginning of the twentieth century a number of military armored vehicles were manufactured by adding armor and weapons to existing vehicles. Most of the early designs were a large car chassis to which a body made of steel plates had been added such as the Rolls-Royce Armoured Car.[PARAGRAPH:1]A military armored car is a type of armoured fighting vehicle having wheels (from four to ten large off-road wheels) instead of tracks, and usually light armor. Armored cars are typically less expensive and have superior speed and range compared to tracked military vehicles. Most are not intended for heavy fighting; their normal use is for reconnaissance, command, control, and communications, or for use against lightly armed insurgents or rioters. Only some are intended to enter close combat, often accompanying convoys to protect soft-skinned vehicles. They usually mount a machine gun, autocannon, or small tank gun. Other uses include as a way to move (or tow) various long-range rocket, missile, or mortar batteries through dangerous areas while giving some protection to the crew.
TEXT.Italian: Unità da combattimento su ruote con blindatura pesante.
TEXT.Polish: Samochód pancerny to opancerzony pojazd ko³owy, zwykle uzbrojony w armatê lub karabiny maszynowe, zazwyczaj umieszczone w wie¿y obrotowej. Podstawowym przeznaczeniem wiêkszoœci samochodów pancernych by³o rozpoznanie, rzadziej ich podstawowym przeznaczeniem by³a walka. Zazwyczaj pancerz samochodów pancernych chroni³ tylko przed pociskami karabinowymi i od³amkami. W zale¿noœci od masy i uzbrojenia czasami wyró¿nia siê lekkie, œrednie i ciê¿kie samochody pancerne. Samochodów pancernych nie nale¿y myliæ z ko³owymi transporterami opancerzonymi, których zadaniem jest przewo¿enie ¿o³nierzy. Pierwsze samochody pancerne skonstruowano w pierwszej dekadzie XX wieku, apogeum ich rozwoju nast¹pi³o przed i w okresie II wojny œwiatowej. Stopniowo powstaj¹ce konstrukcje charakteryzowa³y siê lepszymi w³asnoœciami w terenie i uzbrojeniem. Zamiast samochodów dwuosiowych z napêdem na tyln¹ oœ, budowanych na podwoziach samochodów cywilnych, zaczê³y powstawaæ konstrukcje z napêdem na wszystkie ko³a, a liczba osi wzros³a w niektórych konstrukcjach do czterech.

TEXT.English: Ken Arok or Ken Angrok, (d. around 1227) was the founder and first ruler of the Singhasari Kingdom, an ancient Hindu-Budhist kingdom in the East Java area of Indonesia. He came from humble origins but subsequently rose to be the most powerful ruler in Java. His life was coloured with adventures, treacheries, and tragedies. Today, the story of Ken Arok is very popular as a legend in Central and East Java. He is the subject of several books, movies, and traditional Javanese theater (Ketoprak). He is remembered both as a cunning and treacherous man but also as a man with a strong will to pursue his dream. It is believed that all the kings and queens who ruled on Java Island (Ancient Mataram, Majapahit and Islamic Mataram) are the descendants of Ken Arok.
TEXT.Polish: Ken Arok lub Ken Angrok, (zm. oko³o 1227) by³ za³ozycielem i pierwszym w³adc¹ królestwa Singasari na wschodniej czêœci wyspy Jawa. W dzisiejszych czasach, legendy o nim s¹ bardzo popularne na centralnej i wschodniej Jawie.

TEXT.English: Arpad (c. 845 - c. 907) was the second Grand Prince of the Magyars (Hungarians) (c. 895 - c. 907). Under his rule the Magyar people settled in the Carpathian basin. The dynasty descending from him ruled the Magyar tribes and later the Kingdom of Hungary until 1301. Although the founder of the Kingdom of Hungary was not Arpad (as he lived a century earlier) - but his descendant Saint Stephen I, he is generally thought of as the forefather of Hungarians and is often affectionately mentioned as "our father Arpad".
TEXT.Polish: Arpad (miêdzy 845 a 855-907), wg tradycji w³adca Madziarów, protoplasta rodu Arpadów. 893 odziedziczy³ w³adzê wojskow¹ po swym ojcu, Almosie. 904 po œmierci, sprawuj¹cego zwierzchnoœæ religijn¹, Kursz¹na przej¹³ tak¿e jego uprawnienia. 896 kierowani przez Arpada Madziarowie zasiedlili kotlinê karpack¹, przyczyniaj¹c siê nastêpnie do upadku pañstwa wielkomorawskiego. Pokonanie Bawarów w bitwie pod Bratys³aw¹ (907) umocni³o pozycjê Madziarów nad œrodkowym Dunajem.

TEXT.English: The arquebus is an early muzzle-loaded firearm used in the 15th to 17th centuries. In distinction to its predecessor, the hand cannon, it has a matchlock. As low-velocity firearms, they were used against enemies that were often partially or fully protected by steel-plate armour. Plate armour was standard in European combat from about 1400 until the middle of the 17th century. This was essentially the era of the arquebus. Good suits of plate would usually stop an arquebus ball at long range. It was a common practice to "proof" (test) armour by firing a pistol or arquebus at a new breastplate. The small dent would be circled by engraving, to call attention to it. However, at close range, it was possible to pierce even the armor of knights and other heavy cavalry. This led to changes in plate design like three-quarter plate and finally the retirement of plate armor altogether.
TEXT.Polish: Arkebuz (spotykano równie¿ nazwy: arkabuz, harkabuz, harkebuz) dawna broñ strzelecka u¿ywana od trzeciego dziesiêciolecia XV do pocz¹tku XVII wieku. By³a to d³uga rêczna broñ palna g³adkolufowa kalibru oko³o 10-20 mm, pierwotnie zaopatrzona w zamek lontowy (arkebuzów z takimi zamkami u¿ywali konkwistadorzy hiszpañscy na pocz¹tku XVI wieku). Od I po³owy XVI wieku stosowano tak¿e zamek ko³owy.

TEXT.English: Arson is the crime of intentionally or maliciously setting fire to structures or wildland areas. It may be distinguished from other causes such as spontaneous combustion and natural wildfires. An [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Arsonist[COLOR_REVERT] is one who commits arson.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Le Guerrier pyromane[COLOR_REVERT] est le criminel mettant le feu intentionnellement à des structures ou des zones de végétation.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pirómano[COLOR_REVERT] es el criminal que incendia de forma premeditada o maliciosa estructuras o áreas forestales. Este tipo de incendios se distinguen de otros causados por combustión espontánea u otras causas naturales.
TEXT.Polish: Podpalacz podk³ada ogieñ pod cudz¹ w³asnoœæ.

TEXT.English: Sir Arthur William Currie was the first Canadian commander, from 1917, of Canada's overseas forces in World War I. Currie taught school before going into business in Victoria, B.C. He enlisted in the militia and rose from the ranks to become lieutenant colonel of artillery. In spite of this minimum of professional training, he was given command of a battalion in the first Canadian contingent sent to assist Britain in 1914. He advanced steadily, winning distinction at the battles of Ypres and Saint-Julien in Belgium and at the battle of Vimy Ridge in France. Within three years he became lieutenant general and commander of the four divisions of the Canadian Corps, succeeding the British general Sir Julian Byng. He was one of the most successful and effective corps commanders in any army during the war's final months. Currie was knighted in 1918. After the war Currie served as inspector general of the Canadian militia and became the first general in the Canadian Army. In 1920, he accepted the position of principal and vice-chancellor of McGill University, Montreal, and retained this post until his death. Canadian historians, including Pierre Berton and J.L. Granatstein, have described Currie as Canada's greatest military commander. Although physically a large man, standing over six feet tall, Currie did not cut a heroic military figure. Nor was he a charismatic speaker. Described as aloof by his troops, who called him "Guts and Gaiters," he nevertheless inspired them. He was a brilliant tactician who used his skills to reduce casualties and is credited with accelerating the end of the war. "His slogan was pay the price of victory in shells - not lives," according to historian Jack Hyatt. "And if he did anything heroic it was that."
TEXT.Polish: Sir Arthur William Currie (5.12.1875 - 30.11.1933) by³ pierwszym kanadyjskim dowódc¹, od 1917 r., Kanadyjskich Si³ Zbrojnych podczas I Wojny Œwiatowej. Po wojnie Currie s³u¿y³ jako generalny inspektor w kanadyjskiej milicji i zosta³ pierwszym genera³em w Armii Kanadyjskiej. w 1920 przyj¹³ stanowisko dyrektora i vice-kanclerza Uniwersytetu McGill w Montreal, które piastowal a¿ do swej œmierci.

TEXT.English: King Arthur was a legendary British king who appears in a cycle of medieval romances (known as the matter of Britain) as the sovereign of a knightly fellowship of the Round Table. It is not certain how or where (in Wales or in those parts of northern Britain inhabited by Brythonic-speaking Celts) these legends originated or whether the figure Arthur was based on a historical person. Assumptions that a historical Arthur led Welsh resistance to the West Saxon advance from the middle Thames are based on a conflation of two early writers, the religious polemicist Gildas and the historian Nennius, and on the Annales Cambriae of the late 10th century. The 9th-century Historia Brittonum, traditionally attributed to Nennius, records 12 battles fought by Arthur against the Saxons, culminating in a victory at Mons Badonicus. The Arthurian section of this work, however, is from an undetermined source, possibly a poetic text. The Annales Cambriae also mention Arthur's victory at Mons Badonicus (516) and record the Battle of Camlann (537), in which Arthur and Medraut fell. Gildas' De excidio et conquestu Britanniae (mid-6th century) implies that Mons Badonicus was fought in about 500 but does not connect it with Arthur. Early Welsh literature quickly made Arthur into a king of wonders and marvels. The 12th-century prose romance Kulhwch and Olwen associated him with other heroes, this conception of a heroic band, with Arthur at its head, doubtless leading to the idea of Arthur's court. Regardless, if a real King Arthur did exist, then most likely he and his knights were not the warriors in plated armour and large stone castles that most would imagine; more than not, he was probably a Romano-Celtic warlord in rusty chainmail who lived before or during the Anglo-Saxon invasion.
