TEXT.English: Artillery is a general term covering several varieties of large-caliber weapons including mortars and field guns. Mortars fire an explosive projectile in a high arc, and are particularly effective against small, concealed targets. Field guns, long-range weapons that fire their projectiles in a flat arc, are used primarily for their ability to penetrate hard targets. Powerful enough to batter opposing forces even behind the strongest fortifications, artillery is also able to move quickly from one firing position to another. This is an important capability when fighting a moving battle or when avoiding enemy fire.
TEXT.French: "Artillerie" est un terme générique qui recouvre différents types d'armes de gros calibre, dont les mortiers ou les canons de campagne. Les mortiers envoient des projectiles explosifs par un tir courbe et sont particulièrement efficaces contre de petites cibles dissimulées. Les canons de campagne sont des armes à longue portée qui tirent à plat et sont particulièrement efficaces contre les cibles solides. Suffisamment puissante pour réduire des troupes ennemies, même protégées par des fortifications, l'artillerie est aussi capable de se déplacer rapidement d'une position à une autre. Cette caractéristique est particulièrement importante dans les batailles de mouvement, ou pour éviter les tirs ennemis.
TEXT.German: Der Begriff Artillerie umschreibt verschiedene Waffen großen Kalibers, einschließlich Mörsern und Feldgeschützen. Mörser feuern explosive Geschosse in hohem Bogen ab und eignen sich besonders für Angriffe auf kleine, verdeckte Ziele. Feldgeschütze sind Fernbereichswaffen, die ihre Geschosse in flachem Bogen abschießen und hauptsächlich eingesetzt werden, um solide, befestigte Ziele zu durchdringen. Die Artillerie ist nicht nur effizient genug, um selbst massiv befestigte feindliche Truppen zu beschießen, sondern kann sich darüber hinaus auch schnell von einer Abschussposition zur nächsten fortbewegen. Dies ist insbesondere dann von Vorteil, wenn es gilt, feindlichem Beschuss auszuweichen oder sich bei einer Schlacht zu bewegen.
TEXT.Italian: Artiglieria è un termine generico che comprende diverse categorie di armi di grosso calibro, tra cui mortai e cannoni da campo. I mortai sparano un proiettile esplosivo con traiettoria ad arco e sono particolarmente efficaci contro obiettivi piccoli e nascosti. I cannoni da campo, armi a lunga gittata che sparano proiettili ad arco piatto, vengono invece impiegati principalmente per la loro capacità di penetrare obiettivi resistenti. Abbastanza potente da colpire il nemico dietro le fortificazioni più efficaci, l'artiglieria è anche in grado di spostarsi rapidamente da una postazione di tiro a un'altra. Ciò è indispensabile per combattere una battaglia in movimento o evitare il fuoco nemico.
TEXT.Spanish: Artillería es un término genérico que engloba varios tipos de armas de gran calibre, entre las que se incluyen los morteros y los cañones de campaña. Los morteros disparan un proyectil explosivo con una trayectoria curva muy pronunciada y son especialmente efectivos contra objetivos pequeños y camuflados. Los cañones de campaña, armas de largo alcance que disparan sus proyectiles en línea recta, se utilizan principalmente por su capacidad de penetración contra objetivos de gran dureza. Capaz de desencadenar duros ataques contra enemigos refugiados en las fortificaciones más poderosas, la artillería cuenta con la ventaja adicional de poder trasladarse con rapidez. Ésta es una característica importante cuando se trata de una batalla de movimiento o de esquivar el fuego enemigo.

German.Text: Großer Künstler:Großen Künstlers:Großen Künstler:Großen Künstler:Große Künstler:Großen Künstler:Großen Künstlern:Großen Künstler

TEXT.English: Arwa al-Sulayhi was the long-reigning ruler of Yemen, firstly through her first two husbands and then as sole ruler, from 1067 until her death in 1138. She was the greatest of the rulers of the Sulayhid Dynasty and was also the first woman to be accorded the prestigious title of hujja in the Isma'ili branch of Shia Islam, signifying her as the closest living image of God's will in her lifetime. She is popularly referred to as "as-Sayyidah al-urrah" ("the Noble Lady") and "al-Malika al-Hurra" ("the Noble Queen").

Ashina was a tribe and the ruling dynasty of the ancient Turks who rose to prominence in the mid-6th century when their leader, Bumin Khan, revolted against the Rouran. The two main branches of the family, one descended from Bumin and the other from his brother Istemi, ruled over the eastern and western parts of the Göktürk empire, respectively.
TEXT.French: Ashina était une tribu et la dynastie régnante des anciens Turcs qui gagnèrent en importance au milieu du VIe siècle, lorsque leur chef, Bumin Khan, se révolta contre les Rourans. Les deux branches principales de la famille, l'une issue de Bumin et l'autre de son frère Istemi, régnaient sur les parties orientale et occidentale de l'Empire Göktürk, respectivement.

TEXT.English: Ashina Jieshe'er was a member of the Turkic noble family Ashina clan of Eastern Turkic khaganate and general (Zhonglangjang) of the Tang Dynasty. By summer 639, as Ashina Jiesheshuai had not been favored by the Tang Dynasty's Emperor Taizong (because he had falsely accused his brother Ashina Shibobi of treason, which Emperor Taizong found despicable), he formed a conspiracy with Ashina Shibobi's son Ashina Hexiangu to assassinate Emperor Taizong at his summer palace, Jiucheng Palace. They had planned to wait for Li Zhi the Prince of Jin to depart from the palace in the morning and use that opportunity to attack the palace. On the day they planned, May 19, however, Li Zhi did not leave the palace due to a storm and immediately afterwards heavy rainfall. Ashina Jiesheshuai attacked the palace anyway, engaging the palace guards, but the guards was supported by troops who came outside. Ashina Jiesheshuai and his comrades stole some 20 horses from the stable. They fled to the north, but were caught by pursuers near the Wei River and killed. Ashina Hexiangu was exiled to Lingbiao.

Ashurbanipal was the last great Assyrian king (r. 668 - 627 BC). He was appointed crown prince of Assyria in 672 BC; his half-brother was appointed crown prince of Babylonia. On his father's death, Ashurbanipal assumed full power without incident. He quelled a rebellion in Egypt and successfully besieged Tyre. His half brother, who served him in Babylonia peacefully for 16 years, joined a coalition of peoples from outlying areas of the Assyrian empire and plotted rebellion, but Ashurbanipal discovered the plots and, after a three-year siege, took Babylon. By 639 BC he had the whole known world under his control. A person of religious zeal, he rebuilt or adorned most of the major shrines of Assyria and Babylonia. His principal intellectual accomplishment was the creation in Nineveh of the first systematically organized library in the Middle East; the clay tablets collected there preserved omen texts, Mesopotamian epics, prayers and incantations, scientific texts, lexicographical texts, and folktales.
TEXT.Polish: Aszurbanipal (VII w. p.n.e.), król Asyrii 669-626 p.n.e., syn Asarhaddona. Utrzyma³ pañstwo w granicach od Morza Œródziemnego na zachodzie do Zatoki Perskiej na wschodzie i od gór Armenii (Urartu) na pó³nocy do Egiptu na po³udniu. 667 p.n.e. zdoby³ Egipt, w którym panowa³ do 655 p.n.e. 652-648 p.n.e. st³umi³ bunt brata Szamaszumukina, wielkorz¹dcy Babilonii. 646-645 p.n.e. walczy³ zwyciêsko z Elamem (zburzy³ Suzê). TEXT.English: The Asian black bear (Ursus thibetanus), also known as the moon bear or white-chested bear is a medium-sized species of bear, largely adapted for arboreal life, seen across much of the Himalayas and the northern parts of the Indian Subcontinent, Korea, northeastern China, the Russian far east and Honshu and Shikoku islands of Japan. It is classed by the IUCN as a vulnerable species, mostly due to deforestation and active hunting for its body parts. The species is morphologically very similar to some prehistoric bears, and is thought by some scientists to be the ancestor of other extant bear species. Though largely herbivorous, Asian black bears can be very aggressive toward humans, and have frequently attacked people without provocation. The species was described by Rudyard Kipling as "the most bizarre of the ursine species."

Askia Muhammad I was an emperor, military commander, and political reformer of the Songhai Empire in the late 15th century, the successor of Sunni Ali Ber. Askia Muhammad strengthened his country and made it the largest country in West Africa's history. At its peak under his reign, the Songhai Empire encompassed the Hausa states as far as Kano (in present-day Nigeria) and much of the territory that had belonged to the Songhai empire in the west. His policies resulted in a rapid expansion of trade with Europe and Asia, the creation of many schools, and the establishment of Islam as an integral part of the empire.
Although weak at attacking and defending cities, an Assassin's ability to attack the weakest unit in a stack makes it perfect for picking off units.
TEXT.French: Bien qu'étant faible pour attaquer ou défendre des villes, la capacité d'un Assassin à attaquer l'unité la plus faible dans une pile en fait un excellent choix pour éliminer des unités.

Êàê ìîæíî äîâåðÿòü ÷åëîâåêó, êîòîðîìó ïðîùå óñêîëüçíóòü èç îñàæäåííîãî ãîðîäà, ÷åì âñòàòü íà åãî çàùèòó?[PARAGRAPH:1]Íåìíîãèå çíàþò, ÷òî àññàñèíû äàþò îáåò âåðíîñòè ñâîåìó ïîâåëèòåëþ. Ìíîãèå èç íèõ óáèâàþò çà ñâîþ æèçíü íå ìåíüøå âðàãîâ, ÷åì ãåðîè-âîèíû íà ïîëå áîÿ.

TEXT.English: Assault Droid (also referred to as war droid, combat droid, or killer droid) was any droid designed for combat. There were numerous types of Assault Droids. One thing all combat droids had in common was that they had limited intelligence. They were programmed to follow orders, and not much else, though they did have personalities.
TEXT.French: Le Droid d'Assaut (souvent appelé also droid de guerre, droid de combat, ou droid tueur) désignait tout robot conçu pour le combat. Il existait de nombreux types de droids d'assaut. Ce que tous ces droids avaient en commun, c'était leur intelligence limitée. Ils étaient programmés pour suivre des ordres, et pas grand-chose d'autre, même s'ils avaient une certaine personnalité.
TEXT.Russian: Штурмовой дроид (также называемый военным дроидом, боевым дроидом или дроидом-убийцей) был любым дроидом, предназначенным для боя. Было множество типов штурмовых дроидов. Все боевые дроиды были объединены тем, что у них был ограниченный интеллект. Они были запрограммированы на выполнение узко очерченных приказов и не более того, хотя у них были личности.

TEXT.English: Originally created to exert control over rebellious citizens of conquered cities, the earliest mechanized assault units were designed as much to be terrifying as they were to be militarily potent. Just park one of these monsters in the center of a city - the theory went - where it would literally tower over everything else within sight, and even the staunchest citizens would rapidly lose all interest in armed rebellion. Not surprisingly, the Assault Mechs proved quite effective at this task, and it was determined to try the units in field combat.[PARAGRAPH:1]Military traditionalists have repeatedly pointed out that the Assault Mechs are very poorly designed weapons - farcically bad, some have even said. They're extremely tall and are almost impossible to camouflage, making them easy targets. Their two-legged gait is more complicated, more expensive, more vulnerable and less efficient than are treaded wheels. And if one of the blasted things fall over, it can't get up again without the assistance of massive cranes or helicopters. Yank off the legs and mount the chassis on treads, the experts say, and you'll get a better weapon at lower cost.[PARAGRAPH:1]All this is true. However, the units have one thing going for them that more than compensates for all of their weaknesses: they're massively, enormously cool. Military planners have long noted that national governments often confuse coolness with effectiveness and are willing to pay a lot more for flashy armaments than they are for effective but dull systems. In other words, a military with Mech Assault units has an easier time getting its bloated budget approved than does one without them. As long as this continues, the Mech's future is assured.
TEXT.French: Crées dans le but de contrôler les populations hostiles des villes conquises en territoire ennemi, les unités de combat robotisées sont aussi terrifiantes qu'efficaces. Placer l'un de ces monstres au milieu d'une ville, en surplomb des gratte-ciel, suffit généralement à dissuader les dissidents les plus téméraires. Les robots de combat se révélèrent si efficaces dans leur rôle de sentinelle, qu'ils furent rapidement envoyés sur les champs de bataille.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les militaires les plus conservateurs n'ont cessé de pointer du doigt les insuffisances des robots de combat, qu'ils qualifient de gros gadgets ridicules. Ces robots sont extrêmement grands et absolument impossibles à camoufler, ce qui en fait des cibles faciles. Leur mode de déplacement sur deux jambes est assez complexe, coûteux à produire et les rend à la fois plus vulnérables et moins efficaces que des chenilles. Une fois à terre, le robot de combat ne peut pas se relever sans l'aide d'une grue ou d'hélicoptères. Tous les experts vous le diront: arrachez-lui les jambes et montez-le sur chenilles et vous obtiendrez une arme bien plus efficace pour bien moins cher.[PARAGRAPH:1]Malgré tous ces défauts, ces robots présentent un avantage qui compense toutes leurs lacunes: ils ont une allure incroyable. Les experts militaires ont bien compris que les gouvernements confondaient souvent allure et efficacité. Ils sont ainsi souvent disposés à payer plus cher un armement moins performant, mais qui leur en met plein la vue. Autrement dit, il est plus facile de faire voter un budget militaire colossal à partir du moment où la dotation comprend des Robots de combat. Et tant qu'il en sera ainsi, leur avenir sera assuré.
TEXT.German: Die ersten Angriffsroboter waren ursprünglich erschaffen worden, um die rebellische Bevölkerung eroberter Städte unter Kontrolle zu bringen. Dementsprechend sollten sie nicht nur Angst und Schrecken verbreiten können, sondern auch für militärische Zwecke einsetzbar sein. Ist auch nur eins dieser Monster im Zentrum einer Stadt stationiert - so die Theorie -, überragt es praktisch alles andere in Sichtweite, so dass selbst die hartgesottensten Revoluzzer sehr schnell ihren bewaffneten Widerstand aufgeben werden. Nachdem sich die Angriffsroboter bei der Ausführung dieser Aufgabe als ziemlich effizient erwiesen hatten, beschloss man schließlich, sie auch als Kampfeinheiten auf dem Schlachtfeld auszuprobieren.[PARAGRAPH:1]Traditionelle Militärs wiesen wiederholt darauf hin, dass die Angriffsroboter lediglich sehr schlecht konzipierte Waffen seien - manche vertraten sogar die Meinung, sie seien aus militärischer Sicht ein schlechter Witz. Wegen ihrer extremen Größe ist eine wirkungsvolle Tarnung fast unmöglich, so dass sie leicht als Ziel zu erfassen sind. Außerdem bewegen sich auf zwei Beinen fort, sind teurer, verwundbarer und weniger effizient als mit Profilreifen ausgestattete Einheiten. Und wenn eins der verdammten Dinger umfällt, kann es sich ohne Zuhilfenahme großer Kräne oder Hubschrauber nicht allein wieder aufrichten. Experten vertreten daher die Auffassung, man könne sie zu besseren und preiswerteren Waffen umrüsten, indem man die Beine abmontiert und das Chassis auf Profilreifen setzt.[PARAGRAPH:1]Das alles ist nicht von der Hand zu weisen, dennoch spricht eine Sache mehr für diese Einheit, als all ihre Schwächen gegen sie sprechen: Sie ist extrem cool. Und die Militärstrategen sind sich schon lange darüber im Klaren, dass Regierungen oftmals Coolness mit Effizienz verwechseln und daher auch bereit sind, weitaus höhere finanzielle Mittel für schrille Panzerungen zur Verfügung zu stellen als für effiziente, aber weniger eindrucksvolle Systeme. Mit anderen Worten: Sofern es über Angriffsroboter verfügt, hat es das Militär deutlich leichter, seine übersteigerten Budgetforderungen durchzusetzen, als ohne sie - und solange das so bleibt, ist die Zukunft der Roboter gesichert.
TEXT.Italian: Inizialmente create per esercitare il controllo sui cittadini ribelli delle città conquistate, le prime unità meccanizzate d'assalto erano progettate per essere tanto terrificanti quanto potenti da un punto di vista militare. Bastava parcheggiare uno di questi mostri al centro di una città, diceva la teoria, dove avrebbe sovrastato tutto ciò che lo circondava, e anche i più fedeli cittadini avrebbero rapidamente perso qualsiasi interesse nella ribellione armata. I Mech d'assalto si rivelarono davvero efficaci, in questo, e venne deciso di testarli in combattimento.[PARAGRAPH:1]I tradizionalisti militari hanno sottolineato più volte come il Mech d'assalto sia un'arma progettata male, "da farsa" hanno detto alcuni. Sono estremamente alti e quasi impossibili da mimetizzare, il che li rende facili bersagli. Il loro movimento a due gambe è più complicato, costoso, vulnerabile e meno efficiente di quello su cingoli. E se uno dei dannati affari cade, non può rialzarsi senza l'aiuto di enormi gru o elicotteri. Secondo gli esperti basterebbe levare le gambe e metterci dei cingoli per avere un'arma migliore a un costo inferiore.[PARAGRAPH:1]Tutto ciò è vero. Queste unità hanno però una caratteristica che basta e avanza a compensare tutte le loro altre debolezze: sono enormemente, incredibilmente affascinanti. I progettisti militari hanno notato da molto tempo che i governi tendono a confondere il fascino con l'efficacia e sono disposti a pagare molto di più per armi appariscenti di quanto non facciano per sistemi efficaci ma noiosi. In altre parole, un esercito con un Mech d'assalto fa meno fatica a farsi approvare un budget enorme di quanta ne farebbe senza. Fino a quando ciò continuerà, esisteranno i Mech.
TEXT.Spanish: Creados originalmente para someter a los habitantes rebeldes de las ciudades conquistadas, las primeras unidades de asalto mecanizado ("mechs") fueron diseñadas tanto para aterrorizar como para ser potentes militarmente. La teoría decía que, con solo aparcar a uno de esos monstruos en el centro de una ciudad, donde literalmente dominaría la vista de cualquier sitio, hasta los ciudadanos más intrépidos perderían todo interés por levantarse en armas. No es de sorprender que los mechs de asalto resultasen bastante eficaces en este cometido. Así que se ha decidido probarlos en el campo de batalla.[PARAGRAPH:1]Los militares tradicionalistas han señalado repetidamente que los mechs de asalto son armas muy mal diseñadas, y alguno incluso se han atrevido a clasificarlas de absurdas. Son extremadamente altas y casi imposibles de camuflar, lo que les convierte en objetivos fáciles. Su modo de desplazamiento, bípedo, es más caro y vulnerable y menos eficaz que las orugas. Y, si uno de esos malditos cacharros se cayese, no podría levantarse sin ayuda de grúas o helicópteros enormes. Arráncale las patas y monta el chasis sobre unas orugas y tendrás un arma mejor y a un coste inferior, a decir de los expertos.[PARAGRAPH:1]Todo eso es verdad. No obstante, estas unidades tienen algo que compensa con creces todos sus puntos débiles: molan una barbaridad. Los planificadores militares hace mucho que se han dado cuenta de que los gobiernos nacionales suelen confundir la "molonería" con la eficacia y desean pagar mucho más por un armamento llamativo que por equipos más sobrios pero eficaces. En otras palabras, un ejército con mechs de asalto tiene más fácil que le aprueben un presupuesto inflado que uno que no los tenga. Mientras esto siga así, el futuro del mech está asegurad.
TEXT.Polish: Pocz¹tkowo stworzone do kontrolowania buntowniczych mieszkañców w podbitych miastach, najwczeœniejsze zmechanizowane jednostki szturmowe zosta³y zaprojektowane zarówno do budzenia strachu, jak i w celu zwalczania wrogów. Zaparkuj takie monstrum w centrum miasta, a wszyscy mieszkañcy od razu strac¹ chêæ do organizowania rebelii.[PARAGRAPH:1]Wojskowi tradycjonaliœci wiele razy powtarzali, ¿e Mechy Szturmowe s¹ bardzo s³abo zaprojektowanymi jednostkami. S¹ ekstremalnie wysokie i niemo¿liwe do zakamuflowania, czyni¹c je ³atwymi celami. Jednak jednostki te maj¹ jedn¹ rzecz, która rekompensuje wszystkie wady - s¹ po prostu czadowe.

TEXT.English: The Assault Ship is the quickest and most powerful pirate ship in the game. These ships are small, fast, agile and offensive warships, which can reach speeds of 25-50 knots. The fast attack boats were used in almost all theaters of war, the Baltic Seas, the Mediterranean or the Black Sea, but their main operational area was the British Channel where they attacked coastal shipping, especially during the night. Their operational record was quite successful, the german S-boats sunk over 40 warships (including 12 destroyers) and far over 100 merchants, while damaging 14 other warships (including 2 cruisers) and 15 merchants. It's high speed capability makes the Assault Ship the choice unit to conduct maritime raids against merchant ships.
TEXT.French: Le Navire d'Assaut est le bateau pirate le plus rapide et le plus puissant du jeu. Ces navires sont de petits navires de guerre rapides, agiles et offensifs, qui peuvent atteindre des vitesses de 25 à 50 noeuds. Les bateaux d'attaque rapide ont été utilisés sur presque tous les théâtres de guerre, la mer Baltique, la Méditerranée ou la mer Noire, mais leur principale zone opérationnelle était la Manche britannique où ils ont attaqué la navigation côtière, surtout pendant la nuit. Leur record opérationnel a été assez réussi, les S-boats allemands ont coulé plus de 40 navires de guerre (dont 12 destroyers) et bien plus de 100 marchands, tout en endommageant 14 autres navires de guerre (dont 2 croiseurs) et 15 marchands. Sa capacité à grande vitesse fait du navire d'assaut l'unité de choix pour mener des raids maritimes contre les navires marchands.
TEXT.Polish: Piractwo istnia³o od pocz¹tków komunikacji morskiej. W staro¿ytnoœci z piractwem walczyli m.in. tacy wodzowie jak Pompejusz, Juliusz Cezar i Oktawian August. Obecnie za najbardziej niebezpieczne rejony pod wzglêdem zagro¿enia piractwem uchodz¹: Karaiby, Zatoka Adeñska, Cieœnina Malakka. Piraci rekrutuj¹ siê g³ównie z by³ych rybaków. W sk³ad ich grupy wchodzi najczêœciej "statek-matka" (udaj¹cy statek rybacki), który s³u¿y do uzupe³niania paliwa.

TEXT.English: The Assyrian military contained cavalry, chariots, and infantry. The Assyrian army consisted of both foreigners, and natives. Within the infantry, there were archers, spearmen, slingers, and shield barers. The infantry were the cheapest and most numerous. The Assyrian infantry was effectively used in siege warfare, for which the Assyrians are famous.
TEXT.French: La cavalerie, les chars, et l'infanterie contenus militaires assyriens. Chez l'infanterie, il y avait des archers, des hommes armés d'une lance, des baques d'étanchéité, et des barers de bouclier. L'infanterie étaient la meilleur marché et la plus nombreuse. L'infanterie assyrienne a été efficacement employée dans la guerre de siège, pour laquelle les Assyriens sont célèbres.
TEXT.German: Die Assyrian militärische enthaltene Kavallerie, die chariots und die Infanterie. Innerhalb der Infanterie gab es Bogenschützen, Spearmen, Slingers und Schild barers. Die Infanterie waren das preiswerteste und das am zahlreichsten. Die Assyrian Infanterie wurde effektiv in der Belagerungkriegsführung verwendet, für die die Assyrians berühmt sind.
TEXT.Italian: Il cavalry, i chariots e la fanteria contenuti militari Assyrian. Presso la fanteria, ci erano archers, spearmen, dispositivi lubricanti e barers dello schermo. La fanteria era il più poco costoso e più numeroso. La fanteria Assyrian è stata usata efficacemente nella guerra di siege, per cui i Assyrians sono famosi.
TEXT.Spanish: La caballería, los chariots, y la infantería contenidos militares asirios. Dentro de la infantería, había archers, spearmen, honderos, y barers del protector. La infantería era el la más barata y más numerosa. Utilizaron a la infantería asiria con eficacia en la guerra del sitio, por la cual los asirios son famosos.
TEXT.Polish: Mieszkañcy Asyrii, le¿¹cej na pó³noc od oœrodków wczeœniejszych cywilizacji, Sumeru i Akadu, byli przez setki lat kulturowo zacofani w stosunku do swoich s¹siadów z po³udnia. W czasach Sargona Wielkiego i Ur-Nammu tylko chwilowo ziemie asyryjskie zosta³y zjednoczone z doln¹ Mezopotami¹. Spowodowa³o to póŸniejsze wytworzenie siê pañstwowoœci. Jak informuj¹ zapiski asyryjskie (Asyryjska lista królów), pierwsi królowie tego ubogiego kraju byli nomadami i mieszkali w namiotach. Trudne warunki egzystencji wymusi³y poniek¹d stworzenie pañstwa o charakterze wojskowym. Dziêki po³o¿eniu na pó³nocy Mezopotamii rozwój Asyrii opiera³ siê na handlu, gdy¿ przez miasta asyryjskie przebiega³y g³ówne szlaki handlowe ³¹cz¹ce Zatokê Persk¹ z Morzem Œródziemnym.

TEXT.English: As early spacecraft and aircraft share similar design factors, Astronautic Technicians emerge. Of course, the technology for any manner of spacecraft is still new so their abilities to repair these things are not all that wonderful yet. But their abilities to heal aircraft have expanded, and they've begun to pick up some spacecraft healing skills at least. As usual, however, they're still found to be unnecessary to heavily arm with distracting weaponry, keeping them mostly focused on the job at hand, and equally unnecessary to equip with dedicated vehicles as they can always be flown out to the repair site.
TEXT.Polish: Astronautyka - zespó³ dziedzin nauk œcis³ych, technicznych, biologiczno-medycznych oraz humanistycznych, które zajmuj¹ siê lotami (gr. nautike - ¿egluga) poza atmosferê Ziemi oraz poznawaniem przestrzeni kosmicznej jak równie¿ znajduj¹cych siê w niej obiektów.

TEXT.English: The Asvaran were Persian military units and were a division of cavalry during the time of the Sassanid Persian dynasty; they ranged from light cavalry such as horse archers to heavy cavalry such as cataphracts. Each Asvaran unit would have had its own Drafsh (banner). Membership in such units and other important posts was generally reserved for individuals of noble Asavaran ancestry. The Asvaran were led by Asvaran Sardar.
TEXT.French: Les Asvaran étaient des unités militaires perses, une division de cavalerie à l'époque de la dynastie sassanide ; elles variaient de la cavalerie légère comme les archers à cheval, à la cavalerie lourde comme les cataphracts. Chaque unité d'Asvaran aurait eu son propre Drafsh (bannière). L'appartenance à ces unités et à d'autres postes importants était généralement réservée à des individus de noble ascendance Asavaran. Les Asvaran étaient dirigés par l'Asvaran Sardar.

TEXT.English: Mustafa Kemal Atatürk was a Turkish army officer, revolutionary, and the first President of Turkey. He is credited with being the founder of the Republic of Turkey. His surname, Atatürk (meaning "Father of the Turks"), was granted to him in 1934 and forbidden to any other person by the Turkish parliament. Atatürk was a military officer during World War I. Following the defeat of the Ottoman Empire in World War I, he led the Turkish National Movement in the Turkish War of Independence. Having established a provisional government in Ankara, he defeated the forces sent by the Allies, eventually leading to victory in the Turkish War of Independence. Atatürk then embarked upon a program of political, economic, and cultural reforms, seeking to transform the former Ottoman Empire into a modern and secular nation-state. Under his leadership, thousands of new schools were built, primary education was made free and compulsory, and women were given equal civil and political rights, while the burden of taxation on peasants was reduced. His government also carried out an extensive policy of Turkification. The principles of Atatürk's reforms, upon which modern Turkey was established, are referred to as Kemalism.

[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Atlatl[COLOR_REVERT] refers to a person who uses an Atlatl weapon. [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]An atlatl or spear-thrower is a tool that uses leverage to achieve greater velocity in spear-throwing, and includes a bearing surface which allows the user to temporarily store energy during the throw. It consists of a shaft with a cup, in which the butt of the spear rests. It is held near the end farthest from the cup, and the spear is thrown by the action of the upper arm and wrist. A well-made atlatl can readily achieve ranges of greater than 100 meters. Atlatl designs may include improvements such as thong loops to fit the fingers, the use of flexible shafts, stone balance weights and thinner, highly flexible darts for added power and range. Darts resemble large arrows or thin spears and are typically from 1.2 to 2.7 meters (4 to 9 feet) in length and 9 to 16 millimetre (3/8 to 5/8) in diameter.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Miotacz Oszczepów[COLOR_REVERT] to wojownik uzbrojony w atlatl.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Atlatl to broñ w postaci wydr¹¿onego kawa³ka drewna z zag³êbieniem na jednym z koñców, stosowana na ca³ym œwiecie od czasów górnego paleolitu. Najstarsze odnalezione atlatle maj¹ ok. 20 tys. lat. Broñ ta nigdy nie by³a specjalnie rozpowszechniona, gdy¿ ustêpowa³a pod wieloma wzglêdami praktyczniejszemu ³ukowi, który stopniowo wypiera³ miotacz oszczepów. Najwiêcej znalezionych atlatli ma ok. 12-10 tys. lat. Ostatecznie atlatl na niemal ca³ym œwiecie ust¹pi³ ³ukowi ok. 8-6 tys. lat temu. Najd³u¿ej, bo do XVI w. miotacz oszczepów by³ w u¿yciu w Ameryce Œrodkowej, m.in. stosowa³y go wojska Azteków przeciwko hiszpañskim konkwistadorom pod wodz¹ Hern¹na CortŸsa. Atlatl ma postaæ niezbyt d³ugiego (ok. 40 - 60 cm) kawa³ka wydr¹¿onego drewna, na koñcu którego znajduje siê hakowate zag³êbienie, bêd¹ce miejscem na umieszczenie koñcówki drzewca oszczepu. Zastosowanie miotacza oszczepów znacznie zwiêksza zasiêg rzutu - rekord œwiata w rzucie oszczepem z u¿yciem atlatla wynosi 258 m, podczas gdy rekord w klasycznym rzucie oszczepem (mê¿czyzn) to niespe³na 98,5 m.

TEXT.English: An Attack Submarine is any submersible with the capacity to destroy enemy ships. In the past, nearly all subs would have been considered Attack Submarines, but with advances in technology, many shed their torpedoes for the capability to carry ballistic missiles. While able to attack land targets, such submarines are particularly vulnerable to attacks from their torpedo-armed cousins.
TEXT.French: Le terme "sous-marin d'attaque" s'applique à tout submersible ayant la capacité de détruire les navires ennemis. Dans le passé, presque tous les sous-marins auraient été considérés comme des sous-marins d'attaque mais au fur et à mesure des avancées technologiques, nombre d'entre eux troquent leurs torpilles contre des missiles balistiques. Capables de s'attaquer à des cibles terrestres, ces sous-marins sont néanmoins particulièrement vulnérables aux attaques de leurs cousins armés de torpilles.
TEXT.German: Jedes Tauchboot mit der Fähigkeit, feindliche Schiffe zu zerstören, ist ein Angriffs-U-Boot. In der Vergangenheit galten fast alle U-Boote als Angriffs-U-Boote, aber mit der fortschreitenden Technologie verzichteten immer mehr auf ihre Torpedos zugunsten von Raketen. Sie besitzen zwar die Fähigkeit, Ziele an Land anzugreifen, sind jedoch ein leichtes Ziel für ihre mit Torpedos ausgerüsteten Gegenstücke.
TEXT.Italian: Un Sottomarino d'attacco è un qualsiasi sommergibile con la capacità di distruggere navi nemiche. In passato quasi tutti i sottomarini sarebbero stati considerati d'attacco ma, con i progressi tecnologici, molti hanno abbandonato i siluri per trasportare missili balistici. Pur essendo in grado di attaccare obiettivi terrestri, questi sottomarini sono particolarmente vulnerabili agli attacchi dei loro cugini armati di siluri.
TEXT.Spanish: Un cazasubmarinos es cualquier sumergible capaz de destruir barcos enemigos. En el pasado, casi todos los submarinos se habrían incluido en esta categoría, pero, con los avances tecnológicos, muchos de ellos renunciaron a los torpedos para poder llevar misiles balísticos. Estos submarinos, aunque capaces de atacar objetivos terrestres, son especialmente vulnerables a los submarinos armados con torpedos.

TEXT.English: Since its introduction at the tail-end of WWI, the tank has completely recast the modern battlefield. Being heavily armored, tanks are almost invulnerable to the small arms carried by standard infantry. To combat this new force, Anti-Tank Infantry units were developed by world militaries. These units employed high-velocity cannons capable of penetrating a tank's thick armor, turning once unstoppable war machines into oversized, mobile targets.
TEXT.French: Depuis son apparition à la fin de la Première Guerre mondiale, le char a totalement remodelé le champ de bataille moderne. Lourdement blindés, les chars sont presque invulnérables aux petites armes transportées par l'infanterie standard. Pour combattre cette nouvelle force, des unités d'infanterie anti-chars seront développées par toutes les armées du monde. Ces unités emploient des canons ultrarapides, capables de pénétrer l'épais blindage d'un char, transformant ainsi des machines de guerre jadis impossibles à arrêter en gigantesques cibles mobiles.
TEXT.German: Seit seiner Einführung am Ende des Ersten Weltkriegs hat der Panzer das moderne Schlachtfeld vollkommen neu gestaltet. Mit seiner schweren Panzerung ist der Panzer gegenüber den kleinen Waffen der gewöhnlichen Infanterie fast unverwundbar. Um diese neue Streitkraft zu bekämpfen, entwickelten die Weltmächte Panzerabwehrinfanterie-Einheiten. Diese Einheiten setzten Hochgeschwindigkeitskanonen ein, die die dicke Panzerung durchschlagen konnten und die die nicht aufzuhaltenden Kriegsmaschinen in übergroße mobile Ziele verwandelten.
TEXT.Italian: Dai tempi della sua introduzione, verso la fine della Prima Guerra Mondiale, il carro armato ha completamente rivoluzionato il moderno campo di battaglia. Essendo pesantemente corazzati, i carri armati sono quasi invulnerabili alle armi in dotazione alla normale fanteria. Per contrastare questa nuova forza furono sviluppate unità di Fanteria anticarro dagli eserciti di tutto il mondo. Queste unità impiegano cannoni ad alta velocità in grado di penetrare la spessa corazza di un carro, trasformando quelli che una volta erano inarrestabili macchine da guerra in grossi bersagli mobili.
TEXT.Spanish: Desde su aparición en los tramos finales de la I Guerra Mundial, el tanque ha cambiado por completo el campo de batalla moderno. Gracias a su grueso blindaje, son casi invulnerables a las armas de infantería. Para hacerles frente, los diferentes ejércitos tuvieron que desarrollar unidades de infantería antitanque. Estas tropas emplean proyectiles de alta velocidad, capaces de perforar el grueso blindaje de los tanques, lo que convierte a estas máquinas de guerra, antaño imparables, en simples objetivos móviles.

TEXT.English: [H1]Agustin Cosme Damian de Iturbide y Aramburu[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]President of the Mexico[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 27 September 1783 - 19 July 1824[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]After the liberation of Mexico was secured, he was proclaimed President of the Regency in 1821. A year later, he was announced as the Constitutional Emperor of the new nation, reigning as Emperor briefly from 19 May 1822 to 19 March 1823. He is credited as the original designer of the first Mexican flag.[PARAGRAPH:1]Although Iturbide's reign was short, it defined the political struggles before and after independence. The two ends of Mexico's political spectrum: liberals who favored populist representative government and conservatives who favored a more authoritarian regime, would each gain the upper hand at various times in the decades after Iturbide's abdication.[PARAGRAPH:1]The new emperor had congress decree the crown to be hereditary with the title of "Prince of the Union". As emperor, Iturbide had sovereignty over lands bordered by Panama in the south and the Oregon Country in the north, including the current countries of Central America and the U.S. states of California, Texas, Arizona, Utah, Nevada, Colorado, and New Mexico.
TEXT.Polish: Meksykañski wojskowy, dyktator, polityk. Po wygranej wojnie z Hiszpani¹ w 1822 og³osi³ siê cesarzem. W 1822 og³osi³ siê cesarzem Agustinem I. Jego panowanie by³o okresem despotyzmu i nieporadnych rz¹dów. 10 miesiêcy póŸniej zosta³ zmuszony do abdykacji przez Antonio López de Santa Anna. Iturbide uda³ siê na wygnanie do W³och. Powróci³ do Meksyku w 1824. Zosta³ wtedy aresztowany, uznany za zdrajcê i skazany przez kongres meksykañski na karê œmierci. Wyrok zosta³ wykonany przez rozstrzelanie.

TEXT.English: Augusto Bernardino Leguia y Salcedo was a Peruvian politician who twice served as President of Peru, from 1908 to 1912 and from 1919 to 1930. Augusto B. Leguia is depicted as a tyrant in the 1937 novel Pity the Tyrant by American novelist Hans Otto Storm. American travel writer Richard Halliburton met Leguia during his Latin American travels chronicled in New World to Conquer. He describes Leguia as a charming and self-effacing "man of the people" who gives a humorous account of the 1908 coup attempt.

In the 200-year history of India's Mughal Empire, which was founded in 1530, Aurangzeb was the last great ruler. A warrior-statesman, he was also a zealous follower of the religion of Islam. His fanatic intolerance of other religions gave rise to tensions that eventually led to the dissolution of the empire after his death. Born on Nov. 3, 1618, Aurangzeb was the son of the emperor Shah Jahan. His given name was Muhi-ud-Din Muhammad. Early in life he showed military and administrative abilities and was given a number of troop commands by his father. When Shah Jahan became ill in 1657, Aurangzeb defeated his brothers in the war of succession that followed. His father, meanwhile, was confined to the palace from 1658 until his death in 1666. Aurangzeb crowned himself emperor in 1658, with the title Alamgir (world holder). His reign fell into two parts. Until 1680 he consolidated his power in northern India by war and shrewd politics. He patterned himself after his great-grandfather, Akbar, by reconciling his enemies and placing them in his service. Much of the second half of his reign was spent trying to subdue rebellions in the south of India. His wars exhausted the imperial treasury, and he began to lose control of northern India. The most unfortunate aspect of his reign was his severe persecution of the majority Hindu population. His attempt to force Islam on the people weakened his whole kingdom. Aurangzeb died on March 3, 1707. The failure of his successors to cope with the problems he had created led to the downfall of the Mughal Empire.
TEXT.Polish: Aurangzeb (jêz. perskim: Ozdobiony koron¹) (ur. 3 listopada 1618, zm. 3 marca 1707) - szósty w³adca Imperium Mogo³ów w Indiach od 1658 do 1707. Te dzia³ania oraz rygorystyczne pobieranie "podatku od niewiernych" (d¿izja) spowodowa³y wybuch wielu buntów przeciwko niemu (m.in. rebelii w Marwarze i Mewarze). Aurangzeb nakaza³ torturowanie i zabicie Dziewi¹tego Guru Sikhów- Teg Bahadura za odmowê przyjêcia islamu. Ta zbrodnia spowodowa³a wybuch walk z Sikhami. Z drugiej strony Aurangzeb rozpocz¹³ intensywn¹ i kosztown¹ militaryzacjê pañstwa, aby rozszerzyæ w³adzê islamu na ca³y Pó³wysep Indyjski. Jednak jego fanatyzm powodowa³ zaciek³y opór ze strony hinduistycznych w³adców i chocia¿ wielokrotnie zwyciê¿a³ (zdoby³ BidŸapur i Golkondê), to ogromnym kosztem. Nierozstrzygniête walki trwa³y ponad 20 lat, wyczerpuj¹c skarb pañstwa. Zyska³ kontrowersyjn¹ s³awê niszczyciela tysiêcy œwi¹tyñ (w tym wielkiej œwi¹tyni Narodzenia Kryszny w Mathurze oraz wszystkich œwi¹tyñ w Varanasi); czêsto wznosi³ meczety na ich ruinach. TEXT.English: Austin Wonaeamirri is a professional Australian rules football player of indigenous (Tiwi) origin. He previously played for the Melbourne Football Club in the Australian Football League (AFL). Wonaeamirri was born and grew up on the Tiwi Islands in the remote community of Snake Bay and Milikapiti, on Melville Island. He began playing football at the age of six and as a junior, he played in the Tiwi Islands Football League. He lost his mother at the age of 12 and was brought up by his father, Matthew.
The Autogyro is an early attempt at building an air unit with vertical flight capabilities.
TEXT.French: L'autogyre est une première tentative de construction d'un engin volant avec des capacités de vol verticales.
TEXT.Italian: L'autogiro è uno dei primi prototipi di elicottero, con capacità di volo verticale.
TEXT.Polish: Wiatrakowiec to statek powietrzny ciê¿szy od powietrza (aerodyna), z rodziny wirop³atów, wyposa¿ony w wirnik noœny i œmig³o typu pchaj¹cego b¹dŸ ci¹gn¹cego. Wirnik nie jest napêdzany silnikiem. Obraca siê dziêki wykorzystaniu zjawiska autorotacji, powstaj¹cego dziêki ruchowi postêpowemu wirop³ata wzglêdem powietrza, uzyskanego dziêki sile napêdowej œmig³a. Wiatrakowce posiadaj¹ cechy krótkiego startu i l¹dowania (STOL).

TEXT.English: Developed in the mid-twenty-first century, the so-called "automatons" are soldiers, of a sort. In fact, these creatures are human clones controlled by sophisticated computers. Without the aid of controlling computers, human clones are barely sentient and totally incapable of reasoned action; clones equipped with computers are able to perform fairly effectively on the battlefield. While they are not as skilled as fully-human soldiers, automatons are also not subject to fear, and they always attempt to carry out orders, no matter how suicidal. They are also much cheaper to train and equip than their human counterparts, a factor which has become of increasing importance as wars have become more and more expensive.
TEXT.French: Développés au milieu du vingt-et-unième siècle, les automates sont des soldats un peu particuliers. Il s'agit en fait de clones d'humains contrôlés par des programmes informatiques complexes. Sans l'aide de ces programmes, ces clones sont totalement incapables d'avoir un comportement rationnel. Les clones équipés de ces programmes sont en outre très efficaces au combat parce qu'ils ne sont pas aussi intelligents que des humains, mais ils ignorent la peur et obéissent aveuglément aux ordres, même les plus suicidaires. Enfin, le coût de formation d'un clone est absolument dérisoire, un facteur de plus en plus important dans le cadre de guerres de plus en plus onéreuses.
TEXT.German: Mitte des 21. Jahrhunderts wurden die so genannten "Robotersoldaten" als eine Art neue militärische Einheitengattung entwickelt. Tatsächlich handelt es sich bei diesen Kreaturen um menschliche Klone, die von hoch entwickelten Computern gesteuert werden. Ohne den Einsatz der Kontrollcomputer sind die Klone vollkommen empfindungsunfähig und außerstande, logische Handlungen nachzuvollziehen. Mit diesen Computern ausgestattete Robotersoldaten lassen sich allerdings relativ wirkungsvoll auf dem Schlachtfeld einsetzen: Sie sind zwar nicht so qualifiziert wie menschliche Soldaten, kennen jedoch keinerlei Angst und führen ihre Befehle nach Möglichkeit immer bis zum Ende aus - unabhängig davon, wie selbstzerstörerisch sie auch sein mögen. Außerdem ist die Ausbildung und Ausrüstung der Roboter im Vergleich zu ihren menschlichen Kameraden deutlich preiswerter und dieser Faktor hat in der Vergangenheit stetig an Bedeutung gewonnen, da die Kriegsführung allgemein immer teurer geworden ist.
TEXT.Italian: Sviluppati a metà del ventunesimo secolo, i cosiddetti "automi" sono una specie di soldati. Infatti, queste creature sono cloni umani controllati da sofisticati computer. Senza l'aiuto dei computer i cloni umani sono a malapena senzienti e totalmente incapaci di azioni ragionate, mentre i cloni equipaggiati con i computer sono in grado di operare in maniera abbastanza efficiente sul campo di battaglia. Non sono abili come i soldati umani, ma non sono soggetti alla paura e cercano sempre di eseguire gli ordini, a prescindere da quanto siano suicidi. Sono anche molto meno costosi da addestrare ed equipaggiare delle controparti umane, un fattore che ha assunto un'importanza sempre crescente, visto che le guerre si sono fatte sempre più costose.
TEXT.Spanish: Desarrollados a mediados del s. XXI, los llamados "autómatas" son soldados, por así decirlo. De hecho, dichas criaturas son clones humanos controlados por sofisticados ordenadores. Sin la ayuda de los ordenadores de control, apenas son conscientes o capaces de cualquier acción razonada. Los clones equipados con ordenadores son perfectamente capaces de actuar con mucha eficacia en el campo de batalla. Pese a que no son tan hábiles como los soldados completamente humanos, los autómatas no conocen el miedo y siempre están dispuestos a desempeñar cualquier orden, por suicida que sea. También son mucho más baratos de entrenar y equipar que sus equivalentes humanos, factor que ha ido adquiriendo mayor importancia a medida que las guerras se han encarecido cada vez má

TEXT.English: Automated Infantry are the second 'generation' of autonomous military (after the Walker Robot). They are armed with coilguns.
TEXT.French: L'Infanterie Automatisée est la seconde 'génération' de militaires autonomes (après le robot marcheur). Ils sont armés de coilguns.
TEXT.Polish: Automatyczna Piechota to druga generacja autonomicznej piechoty. Wyposa¿ona jest w broñ Gaussa.
TEXT.Russian: Автопехота - это второе «поколение» автономных вооруженных сил (после робота-разведчика). Они вооружены гаусс-пушками.

TEXT.English: As computerized fuel injection systems become common, the knowledge base and electronic systems needed for mechanical maintenance expands dramatically. This has the side effect of enabling these mechanics to also adopt some ability to repair technological systems despite having a primary capacity for mechanical repair.
TEXT.French: Avec la généralisation des systèmes d'injection de carburant informatisés, la base de connaissances et les systèmes électroniques nécessaires à la maintenance mécanique s'étendent considérablement. Cela permet aussi à ces mécaniciens d'acquérir une certaine capacité à réparer des systèmes technologiques, malgré leur spécialisation initiale en maintenance mécanique.
TEXT.Polish: Elektryk - zawód zwi¹zany z monta¿em i napraw¹ instalacji elektrycznych oraz konserwacyjno-naprawczych instalacji zalicznikowych.

TEXT.English: Although it may seem that standard mechanics could easily adapt to handle the needs of aircraft repair, in reality, there are many specialized elements here. Yes, mechanic type units CAN help with aircraft recovery but there's significant enough differences in knowledge base that its very similar to the difference between people and animal healers. Governments rapidly implemented impressive parts tracking procedures that standard mechanics would be unaware of and there are unique concerns to the design of aircraft hulls and engines that other vehicles do not have to maintain. Additionally, many military aircraft technicians are classically trained so specifically for the repair of the aircraft that the skills are only loosely transferable to other vehicles.
TEXT.Polish: Lotnictwo - ogó³ zagadnieñ zwi¹zanych z wszelkiego rodzaju statkami powietrznymi (samolotów, œmig³owców, szybowców, balonów i in.). Lotnictwo dzieli siê na cywilne (transportowe, sportowe, gospodarczo-us³ugowe) i wojskowe.

TEXT.English: The original axes were constructed of stone many thousands of years ago. They were hand-held tools and lacked a handle, which began appearing some time around 6000 BC. The original use of the axe was to chop wood, but axe-wielders no doubt quickly realized its potential as a weapon. [PARAGRAPH:1]An axe is a device that concentrates energy at the edge of a sharp blade, which can then chop into a tree - or skull. The axe is an edged weapon and is most effective when the user swings it in a wide arc, preferably with both hands. [PARAGRAPH:1]The first bronze axes begin to appear around 3000 BC. Most early cultures used some form of this fearsome weapon, which is far superior to clubs and other primitive melee weapons.
TEXT.French: Les premières haches, fabriquées il y a plusieurs milliers d'années, étaient en pierre. Elles n'avaient pas de poignée et se tenaient directement dans la main. La poignée n'apparut qu'en 6 000 av. J.-C. environ. D'abord utilisée pour couper du bois, la hache devint rapidement une arme redoutable. [PARAGRAPH:1]La hache est un outil qui concentre l'énergie sur le tranchant d'une lame, laquelle peut alors efficacement fendre du bois... ou des crânes ! C'est une arme tranchante, particulièrement efficace quand son porteur frappe avec élan, de préférence des deux mains. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les premières haches en bronze apparaissent vers 3 000 av. J.-C. La plupart des civilisations anciennes ont utilisé une arme de ce genre, bien supérieure à la massue ou aux autres armes primitives de combat rapproché.
TEXT.German: Die ersten Äxte wurden als grifflose Werkzeuge vor mehreren tausend Jahren aus Stein geschaffen. Erste Handgriffe entstanden erst um 6000 vor Christus. Äxte wurden zunächst ausschließlich als Werkzeuge, später aber vermehrt als Waffen eingesetzt. [PARAGRAPH:1]Ein mit einer Axt bewaffneter Mann ist in der Lage, ohne allzu großen Kraftaufwand Holz (oder Schädel) zu spalten. Wie alle Klingenwaffen ist die Axt besonders effektiv, wenn sie von ihrem Träger (im Idealfall mit beiden Händen) in großem Bogen geschwungen wird. [PARAGRAPH:1]Die ersten Bronzeäxte entstanden um 3000 vor Christus und traten damit an die Stelle einfacher Keulen und anderer primitiver Nahkampfwaffen.
TEXT.Italian: Le prime asce erano fatte di pietra e risalgono a qualche migliaio di anni fa. Si trattava di oggetti da tenere in mano, ma ancora privi di manico, il quale apparve per la prima volta intorno al 6000 a. C. Inizialmente, le asce servivano per tagliare la legna, ma ci volle poco per capire che sarebbe potuta essere usata anche come arma. [PARAGRAPH:1]La lama affilata di un'ascia può facilmente tagliare della legna o fracassare crani; è un'arma molto efficace se viene roteata e impugnata con due mani. [PARAGRAPH:1]Le prime asce di bronzo apparvero intorno al 3000 a. C. e divennero l'arma prediletta di molte civiltà, che la sostituirono alle prime clave e ad altri strumenti rudimentali per il combattimento corpo a corpo.
TEXT.Spanish: Hace miles de años, las hachas originales se hacían de piedra. Eran herramientas que se cogían con la mano y carecían de mango, que empezó a aparecer alrededor del año 6000 a. C. Su cometido original era el corte de madera, pero no cabe duda de que sus usuarios pronto vieron su potencial como arma. [PARAGRAPH:1]El hacha es un objeto que concentra la energía en el borde de una hoja afilada, que después puede cortar un árbol... o un cráneo. Es un arma de filo, y resulta más eficaz cuando quien la maneja la hace oscilar en un arco amplio, preferiblemente con ambas manos. [PARAGRAPH:1]Las primeras hachas de bronce empezaron a aparecer alrededor del año 3000 a. C. La mayoría de las culturas primitivas emplearon alguna variedad de esta temible arma, que es muy superior a los garrotes y a otras armas contundentes primitivas.

TEXT.English: The Roxolani were a people of the Wallachian plain, near the mouth of the Danube on the Black Sea (modern-day Romania/Moldova). They were enemies of the Romans from around 100 BC until being conquered by the Huns in the 4th century. The Romans found their axemen to be especially potent adversaries, especially the Legio XXI Rapax, which was destroyed by a combined force of Roxolani and Dacians in 92 AD.
TEXT.French: Les Roxolani étaient un peuple de la plaine de Wallachie, près de l'embouchure du Danube dans la mer Noire (actuelle Roumanie/Moldavie). Ils furent ennemis des Romains à partir de 100 av. J.-C. jusqu'à leur conquête par les Huns au IVe siècle. Les Romains considéraient que leurs hommes à la hache étaient des adversaires particulièrement redoutables, notamment la Legio XXI Rapax, qui fut détruite par une force combinée de Roxolani et de Daces en 92 apr. J.-C.
TEXT.Italian: I Rossolani erano un popolo delle pianure della Valacchia, vicino alla foce del Danubio nel Mar Nero (attuali Romania e Moldavia). Furono nemici dei Romani dal 100 a.C. fino a quando furono conquistati dagli Unni nel IV secolo. I Romani scoprirono che i loro guerrieri con ascia erano avversari estremamente pericolosi, in particolare quando la Legio XXI Rapax venne annientata da una forza congiunta di Rossolani e Daci nel 92 d.C.

TEXT.English: The Songhai had been the dominant force in Western Africa for more than a century, controlling the Western Sudan from the headwaters of the Senegal River to what is now Niger; however, a rivalry for succession after the 1583 death of Askia Daoud left the Empire in a weakened state.
TEXT.French: Les Songhaï avaient été la force dominante en Afrique de l'Ouest pendant plus d'un siècle, contrôlant le Soudan occidental depuis les sources du fleuve Sénégal jusqu'à ce qui est aujourd'hui le Niger ; cependant, une rivalité pour la succession après la mort d'Askia Daoud en 1583 a affaibli l'Empire.

TEXT.English: The most feared predator of their Mexican empire, the Aztecs embraced the wild jaguar as a totem for their warrior elite. These soldiers were ferocious fighters, often emerging victorious even when badly outnumbered. The Jaguar Warriors carried obsidian swords and wooden shields for weaponry, and wore jaguar skins with their faces peering out of the animal's head to frighten their opponents. Only the greatest of Aztec warriors were granted the honor of becoming Jaguar Warriors, which usually required the capture of four or five enemies in battle. These savage fighters were universally feared throughout Mesoamerica but proved to be no match for the superior technology of the Spanish Conquistadors.
TEXT.French: Les Aztèques ont adopté le plus redoutable prédateur du Mexique pour représenter leurs guerriers d'élite. Ces derniers étaient des combattants farouches qui parvenaient bien souvent à triompher de leurs adversaires même lorsque ceux-ci les dépassaient largement en nombre. Armés d'épées d'obsidienne et de boucliers en bois, les Jaguars portaient des peaux de jaguar dont la tête recouvrait la leur et ne laissait voir que leur visage afin d'effrayer les ennemis. Seuls les guerriers hors pair avaient l'honneur de devenir des Jaguars. Afin de prouver leur valeur, les aspirants devaient généralement parvenir à capturer quatre ou cinq ennemis lors d'un combat. Ces impitoyables combattants, qui étaient craints dans toute la Mésoamérique, ne parvinrent pourtant pas à résister aux technologies avancées des Conquistadors espagnols.
TEXT.German: Der Jaguar, das gefürchtetste Raubtier des mexikanischen Reiches, war das Totem der aztekischen Elitekrieger. Diese wilden und grausamen Kämpfer konnten sich oftmals sogar gegen zahlenmäßig deutlich überlegene Gegner behaupten. Die mit Obsidianschwertern und Holzschilden bewaffneten Jaguarkrieger trugen Jaguarfelle, um ihre Gegner einzuschüchtern. Lediglich die mutigsten Krieger der Azteken wurden in den Stand des Jaguarkriegers erhoben. Voraussetzung für diese Ehre war die Gefangennahme von vier oder fünf Gegnern. Obwohl diese Krieger in ganz Mittelamerika gefürchtet waren, hatten sie der überlegenden Technik der spanischen Invasoren nichts entgegenzusetzen.
TEXT.Italian: Gli Aztechi usavano il più temuto predatore del loro impero messicano, il selvaggio giaguaro, come simbolo per i loro migliori guerrieri. Questi soldati erano feroci lottatori e spesso uscivano vittoriosi in condizioni di netta inferiorità numerica. I guerrieri giaguaro erano armati di spade d'ossidiana e scudi di legno; inoltre, indossavano delle pelli di giaguaro che rendevano visibile solo la faccia, in modo da spaventare i rivali. Solo ai più grandi guerrieri Aztechi era garantito l'onore di diventare un guerriero giaguaro: in genere bastava catturare quattro o cinque nemici durante una battaglia. Questi selvaggi guerrieri erano temuti in tutta l'America Centrale, ma si riveleranno inefficaci contro la tecnologia dei Conquistadores Spagnoli.
TEXT.Spanish: Los aztecas nombraron tótem de sus soldados de elite al jaguar salvaje, el más temido depredador del imperio mexicano. Estos soldados eran fieros luchadores que solían salir victoriosos aun cuando estaban en inferioridad numérica. Los guerreros jaguar iban pertrechados con espadas de obsidiana y escudos de madera, llevaban pieles de jaguar y se cubrían la parte superior del rostro con la cabeza de estos animales para asustar a sus enemigos. Solo a los mejores guerreros aztecas se les concedía el honor de convertirse en guerreros jaguares, lo que solía requerir la captura de cuatro o cinco enemigos en combate. En toda Centroamérica se temía a estos salvajes luchadores, pero no fueron rival para la tecnología superior de los conquistadores españoles.

TEXT.English: The Rockwell B-1 Lancer is a four-engine, variable-sweep wing strategic bomber used by the United States Air Force. First envisioned in the 1960s as a supersonic bomber with sufficient range and payload to replace the Boeing B-52 Stratofortress, it developed primarily into a low-level penetrator with long range and supersonic speed capability.
TEXT.French: Le Rockwell B-1 Lancer est un bombardier stratégique à ailes variables et quatre moteurs, utilisé par l'US Air Force. Conçu dans les années 1960 comme un bombardier supersonique avec une portée et une charge utile suffisantes pour remplacer le Boeing B-52 Stratofortress, il s'est principalement transformé en un pénétrateur à faibles altitudes avec une grande portée et une capacité de vitesse supersonique.
TEXT.Polish: Bombowiec strategiczny dalekiego zasiêgu o zmiennej geometrii skrzyde³, zbudowany przez wytwórniê Rockwell International (obecnie Boeing BDS). Wraz z samolotami B-52 Stratofortress i B-2 Spirit stanowi trzon strategicznego lotnictwa bombowego Stanów Zjednoczonych.

TEXT.English: The Boeing B-52 Stratofortress is a long-range, subsonic, jet-powered strategic bomber. The aircraft first flew on 15 April 1952 and was Built to carry nuclear weapons for Cold War-era deterrence missions. Although a veteran of a number of wars, the Stratofortress has dropped only conventional munitions in combat. The B-52 carries up to 70,000 pounds (32,000 kg) of weapons. On 16 February 1991, a flight of B-52Gs flew from Barksdale AFB, Louisiana, refueled in the air en route, struck targets in Iraq, and returned home. The journey took 35 hours and 14,000 miles (22,530.82 km) round trip. It set a record for longest-distance combat mission.
TEXT.Polish: Samolot bombowy (bombowiec) - rodzaj samolotu wojskowego, którego podstawowym przeznaczeniem jest niszczenie obiektów naziemnych lub jednostek p³ywaj¹cych nieprzyjaciela za pomoc¹ bomb, ewentualnie pocisków rakietowych.

TEXT.English: Baal-Eser II (also known as Balbazer II and Bal-mazzer I) (846 - 841 BC) was a king of Tyre, the son of Ithobaal I. Baal-Eser reigned at the height of Tyrian influence in the affairs of the Levant. During his reign, his sister was queen of Israel and his niece (or sister-in-law) reigned as queen for a period in Judah, creating a zone of Tyrian influence unrivalled at any period in its history.
TEXT.French: Baal-Éser II (également connu sous les noms de Balbazer II et Bal-mazzer I) (846 - 841 av. J.-C.) était un roi de Tyr, fils d'Ithobaal I. Baal-Éser régna à l'apogée de l'influence tyrienne dans les affaires du Levant. Pendant son règne, sa soeur fut reine d'Israël et sa nièce (ou belle-soeur) régna comme reine pendant une période en Juda, créant une zone d'influence tyrienne sans égal à aucune autre époque de son histoire.
TEXT.Polish: Baal-Eser II (846 - 841 BC) by³ królem Tyru, synem Ethbaala I. Za jego czasów wp³ywy Tyru rozpoœciera³y siê na wiêksz¹ czêœæ Lewantu. Oprócz tego jego siostra Jezebel by³a królow¹ Izraela powiêkszaj¹c i tak ju¿ wielkie wp³ywy fenickie.

TEXT.English: The Bowman was a cornerstone of the Babylonian military. The Babylonians, similar to their Sumerian predecessors, fielded highly trained and well-equipped bowmen. These archers were instrumental in siege warfare; they cleared enemy walls of troops, and sowed terror into the populace by launching volleys of fire arrows into the cities. Once a city had been captured, these bowmen became the key to defending their newly acquired prize.
TEXT.French: L'archer est la pierre angulaire de l'armée babylonienne. Comme leurs prédécesseurs sumériens, les babyloniens se servent d'archers très entraînés et bien équipés. Ces archers sont surtout utilisés pendant les sièges ils tuent les soldats installés sur les murailles ennemies et sèment la terreur dans la population en lançant des volées de flèches enflammées dans les villes. Une fois la ville capturée, ces archers deviennent indispensables à la défense de leur nouvelle prise.
TEXT.German: Der Kampfbogenschütze bildete das Fundament des babylonischen Militärs. Die Babylonier, ähnlich wie ihre Vorgänger, die Sumerer, schickten gut ausgebildete und bestens ausgerüstete Kampfbogenschützen ins Feld. Diese Bogenschützen waren wesentlich bei Belagerungen. Sie erledigten die feindlichen Truppen auf den Mauern und säten Furcht unter der Bevölkerung, indem sie Feuerpfeile in Salven in die Städte feuerten. Sobald eine Stadt eingenommen worden war, wurden die Kampfbogenschützen der Schlüssel zur Verteidigung des neuen Besitzes.
TEXT.Italian: L'Arciere era la pietra angolare dell'esercito babilonese. I Babilonesi, in maniera simile ai Sumeri che li avevano preceduti, mettevano in campo arcieri ben addestrati ed equipaggiati. Gli arcieri erano utili durante gli assedi: ripulivano le mura nemiche dai difensori e diffondevano il panico nella popolazione tirando scariche di frecce infuocate nelle città. Una volta che la città era stata catturata, gli arcieri diventavano fondamentali per la difesa della stessa.
TEXT.Spanish: Los saeteros eran la piedra angular del sistema militar babilonio. Los babilonios, al igual que sus antecesores sumerios, reclutaban fuerzas de saeteros muy bien entrenados y equipados. Estos arqueros eran esenciales en los asedios. Limpiaban las fortificaciones enemigas de tropas y sembraban el terror en las ciudades lanzando proyectiles incendiarios más allá de las murallas. Además, una vez capturadas las ciudades, los saeteros eran claves en su defensa.

TEXT.English: Nations in the East occasionally fielded cataphracts mounted on camels rather than on horses (the Romans also adopted this practice, calling camel mounted riders dromedarii), with obvious benefits for use in arid regions, as well as the fact that the stench of the camels, if upwind, was a guaranteed way of panicking enemy cavalry units that they came into contact with. Also, camels have greater weight-bearing capability compared to horses enabling heavier armament and armour compared to horse cavalry. The camel's greater height also gives obvious physical and psychological advantages when confronting enemy horsemen. Balanced against this, however, is the relatively greater vulnerability of camel-mounted units to caltrops, due to their softly padded soles on their feet, unlike the hardened hooves of horses. This also meant that camels cannot use horseshoes either. Camels also have much reduced speed and agility compared to horses.

Al-Muizz ascended the throne as a minor following the death of his father Badis ibn Mansur, with his aunt acting as regent. In 1016 there was a bloody revolt in Ifriqiya in which the Fatimid residence Al-Mansuriya was completely destroyed and 20,000 Shiites were massacred. The unrest forced a ceasefire in the conflict with the Hammadids of Algeria, and their independence was finally recognized in 1018. Al-Muizz took over the government in 1022 following the overthrow of his aunt. The relationship with the Fatimids was strained, when in 1027 they supported a revolt of the Zanatas in Tripolitania which resulted in permanent loss of control of the region. His son Abdallah shortly ruled Sicily in 1038-1040, after intervening with a Zirid army in the civil war that broke out in the island.

Badi VII (reigned 1805-1821) was the last ruler of the Kingdom of Sennar. Badi offered no resistance to Ismail Pasha, who had led the khedive army of his father up the Nile to his capital at Sennar. Alan Moorhead repeats Frédéric Cailliaud's impression of Badi, that the king was an extremely limited little man who was stunned by the loss of his kingdom, taking particular note that Badi "was intrigued by Cailliaud's gift of a box of matches." According to Moorhead, even had the king wanted to resist, he had few resources to do so. There was no sign of the famous cavalry of Black Horses which had impressed James Bruce forty years before, and his armament consisted of four rusty cannons which were "flung into the Blue Nile to appease the Turks." Of the town itself, the palace and mosque the only two buildings of any consequence in Sennar, were tumbling down, and the inhabitants no more steadfast; Cailliaud singled out the women of the town, "who were much given to smoking and beer-drinking."

Baibars was an important Mamluk Sultan of Egypt and Syria. He was one of the commanders of the forces which inflicted a devastating defeat on the Seventh Crusade of King Louis IX of France, and he led the vanguard of the Egyptian army at the pivotal Battle of Ain Jalut in 1260, which marked the first substantial defeat of the Mongol army. His reign marked the start of an age of Mamluk dominance in the Eastern Mediterranean and solidified the durability of their military system. He managed to pave the way for the end of the Crusader presence in Syria and to unite Egypt and Syria into one powerful state that was able to fend off threats from both Crusaders and Mongols. As Sultan, Baibars also engaged in a skillful combination of diplomacy and military action which allowed the Mamluks to greatly expand their empire. Baibars was a popular ruler in the Muslim World who had defeated the crusaders in three campaigns, and the Mongols in the Battle of Ain Jalut which many scholars deem of great macro-historical importance. In order to support his military campaigns, Baibars commissioned arsenals, warships and cargo vessels. His military campaign also extended into Libya and Nubia. He was also an efficient administrator who took interest in building various infrastructure projects, such as a mounted message relay system capable of delivery from Cairo to Damascus in four days. He also built bridges, irrigation and shipping canals, improved the harbours, and built mosques. His memoirs were recorded in Sirat al-Zahir Baibars ("Life of al-Zahir Baibars"), a popular Arabic romance recording his battles and achievements. He has a heroic status in both Egypt and Syria.
TEXT.Polish: Bajbars urodzi³ siê wœród Kipczaków koczuj¹cych na nadczarnomorskich stepach i w roku 1241 dosta³ siê do niewoli kiedy jego plemiê uciekaj¹c przed Mongo³ami zosta³o zaatakowane przez anatolijskich Turkmenów. Kupi³ go niejaki Ajdid¿in al-Bundukdar, mameluk su³tana z dynastii Ajjubidów As-Saliha Ajjuba (1240 - 1249), który wkrótce popad³ w nie³askê, tak ¿e Bajbars trafi³ bezpoœrednio na dwór su³tana, gdzie zacz¹³ robiæ szybk¹ karierê. W roku 1250 Bajbars wzi¹³ udzia³ w spisku mameluków, który obali³ ostatniego su³tana z dynastii Ajjubidów, Turan Szaha (1249 - 1250), i wyniós³ do w³adzy Ajbaka (1250 - 1257). W roku 1254 w zwi¹zku z wewnêtrznymi walkami poœród mameluków musia³ uciekaæ do Syrii, gdzie szybko sta³ siê przywódc¹ wygnañców przeciwnych Ajbakowi. Jednak ich dwukrotne próby podboju Egiptu w latach 1257 i 1258 zakoñczy³y siê klêsk¹. W zwi¹zku z najazdem mongolskim na Syriê Bajbars w roku 1260 porozumia³ siê z nastêpc¹ Ajbaka, Kutuzem (1259 - 1260), i 3 wrzeœnia 1260 roku pokonali oni armiê mongolsk¹ w bitwie pod Ajn D¿alut. Kiedy jednak Kutuz nie odda³ Bajbarsowi wczeœniej obiecanego Aleppo ten zawi¹za³ spisek i 24 paŸdziernika 1260 roku zamordowa³ go, a nastêpnie obj¹³ su³tanat. Wykorzystuj¹c obalenie kalifatu Abbasydów przez Mongo³ów Bajbars w roku 1261 ustanowi³ marionetkowego kalifa w Kairze w osobie niejakiego Al-Mustansira, podobno wywodz¹cego siê od Abbasydów. Kalifat ten mia³ trwaæ przez ca³y okres panowania Mameluków, którzy czerpali polityczne korzyœci z bycia protektorami nominalnej g³owy islamu, chocia¿ nie uznawa³a go wiêkszoœæ pañstw muzu³mañskich. Dla zabezpieczenia siê przed mongolskimi Ilchanidami Bajbars w roku 1263 zawar³ sojusz z nawróconym na islam chanem Z³otej Ordy Berke (1257 - 1267). W latach 1263 - 1271 podj¹³ on szereg wypraw na pañstwa krzy¿owców - w roku 1263 zdoby³ Nazaret, w roku 1266 twierdzê templariuszy Safed, w roku 1268 Antiochiê, co zakoñczy³o historiê ksiêstwa Antiochii, a w roku 1271 najpotê¿niejszy z zamków krzy¿owców, nale¿¹cy do joannitów Krak des Chevaliers. W roku 1272 Bajbars zawar³ jednak rozejm z Boemundem VI, co by³o spowodowane przybyciem do Ziemi Œwiêtej wojsk angielskiego ksiêcia Edwarda I, który z trudem unikn¹³ œmierci na skutek zamachu prawdopodobnie inspirowanego przez Bajbarsa. Armia Edwarda by³a jednak zbyt ma³a ¿eby zmieniæ ogólny stosunek si³ i ostatecznie powróci³ on do Anglii. W roku 1277 Bajbars wyprawi³ siê do Anatolii, chc¹c wywo³aæ tam powstanie przeciwko Ilchanidom, jednak miejscowi Seld¿ucy z Su³tanatu Rum nie poparli go. Zmar³ po powrocie z Anatolii w Damaszku, 30 czerwca 1277 roku. Oprócz dzia³añ na polu wojny i dyplomacji Bajbars dba³ tak¿e bardzo o gospodarkê swojego pañstwa, odbudowuj¹c i buduj¹c nowe drogi i budynki u¿ytecznoœci publicznej w spustoszonym wojnami kraju. Jego zwyciêstwa nad Mongo³ami i Krzy¿owcami oraz sprawne rz¹dy przynios³y mu wielk¹ popularnoœæ. Bajbars jest bohaterem romansu rycerskiego Sirat Malik az-Zahir (¯ywot Malika az-Zahira), bardzo popularnego w œwiecie arabskim.

TEXT.English: Warriors at the front lines of the army would carry the ahtlatl and about three to five tlacochtli, and would launch them after the waves of arrows and sling projectiles as they advanced into battle before engaging into melee combat. The ahtlatl could also throw spears as its name implies "spear thrower".
TEXT.French: Les guerriers en première ligne de l'armée portaient l'ahtlatl et environ trois à cinq tlacochtli, qu'ils lançaient après les vagues de flèches et de projectiles de fronde en avançant au combat avant de s'engager au corps à corps. L'ahtlatl pouvait également lancer des javelots, comme le suggère son nom « lance-javelot ».

TEXT.English: Various ancient peoples enjoyed a reputation for skill with the sling. Thucydides mentions the Acarnanians and Livy refers to the inhabitants of three Greek cities on the northern coast of the Peloponnesus as expert slingers. Livy also mentions the most famous of ancient skillful slingers: the people of the Balearic Islands. Of these people Strabo writes: And their training in the use of slings used to be such, from childhood up, that they would not so much as give bread to their children unless they first hit it with the sling.

The arbalest (also arblast) was a late variation of the crossbow coming into use in Europe during the 12th century. A large weapon, the arbalest had a steel prod ("bow"). Since an arbalest was much larger than earlier crossbows, and because of the greater tensile strength of steel, it had a greater force. The strongest windlass-pulled arbalests could have up to 22 kN (5000 lbf) of force and be accurate up to 100 m. A skilled arbalestier (arbalester) could loose two bolts per minute.
TEXT.French: and because of the greater tensile strength of steel

TEXT.English: Used as weapons of war from Rome to China, nowhere did the War Elephant become a more essential part of battle than in Southeast Asia. The animals' massive size allowed them to trample infantry and their unsettling smell caused horses to panic and flee, giving the beast a stunning tactical advantage in the field. But it was the sheer strength of the War Elephant that proved to be its greatest asset.[PARAGRAPH:1]While towers and howdahs were an essential part of a War Elephant's accoutrement across the world, it was the Khmer that perfected the deployment of the great siege crossbow, the ballista, deployed on the back of a mountainous pachyderm. This made both elephant and ballista more deadly than ever: the panic-inducing character of the elephant granted the ballista protection from flanking cavalry, while the elephant suddenly became a fearsome ranged implement of destruction.
TEXT.French: Utilisé comme arme de guerre de Rome à la Chine, l'éléphant de guerre n'a jamais joué un rôle aussi essentiel qu'en Asie du sud. La taille massive de ces animaux leur permet d'écraser les unités d'infanterie et leur odeur fait paniquer les chevaux, ce qui confère à l'éléphant un énorme avantage tactique sur le champ de bataille. Mais c'est la force de l'éléphant de guerre qui s'avère son meilleur atout.[PARAGRAPH:1]Alors que les tours et les howdahs forment une part essentielle de l'accoutrement des éléphants à travers le monde, ce sont les Khmers qui perfectionnent le déploiement de la grande arbalète de siège, la baliste, déployée sur le dos de l'animal. Ce dispositif rend à la fois l'éléphant et la baliste plus redoutables que jamais: la panique qu'inspire le pachyderme protège la baliste des attaques de flanc lancées par la cavalerie, tandis que l'éléphant devient soudain un redoutable outil de destruction à distance.
TEXT.German: Kriegselefanten wurden von Rom bis China als Waffen eingesetzt, doch nirgends waren sie für das Schlachtgeschehen wichtiger als in Südostasien. Dank ihrer gewaltigen Größe konnten die Tiere Infanterie zertrampeln, und ihr Geruch ließ Pferde in Panik fliehen, was ihnen einen überwältigenden taktischen Vorteil im Feld einbrachte. Doch die schiere Stärke des Kriegselefanten erwies sich als dessen größter Vorteil.[PARAGRAPH:1]Türme und Howdahs gehörten zwar überall auf der Welt zur wesentlichen Ausrüstung eines Kriegselefanten, doch es waren die Khmer, die den Einsatz der großen Belagerungsarmbrust, der Balliste, vom Rücken eines gewaltigen Dickhäuters perfektionierten. Auf diese Weise wurden der Elefant und auch die Balliste tödlicher denn je: Der panikeinflößende Charakter des Elefanten schützte die Balliste vor flankierender Kavallerie, und der Elefant wurde plötzlich zur gefürchteten zerstörerischen Fernwaffe.
TEXT.Italian: Usato come arma da Roma alla Cina, in nessun altro posto l'elefante da guerra fu parte tanto essenziale di una battaglia come nel sudest asiatico. Le gigantesche dimensioni dell'animale gli permettevano di schiacciare la fanteria e il suo strano odore faceva cadere nel panico e fuggire i cavalli, dandogli un enorme vantaggio tattico sul campo. Tuttavia la più grande risorsa dell'elefante da guerra si rivelò infine l'enorme forza.[PARAGRAPH:1]Mentre torri e palanchini erano parte essenziale dell'equipaggiamento di un elefante da guerra in tutto il mondo, furono i Khmer a perfezionare l'uso della balestra da assedio, la balista, sul dorso di un gigantesco pachiderma. Ciò rese sia la balista sia l'elefante più letali che mai: la capacità di seminare il panico dell'elefante proteggeva la balista dalla cavalleria, in grado di fiancheggiarla, mentre il pachiderma divenne un temibile strumento di distruzione.
TEXT.Spanish: Utilizado como arma de guerra desde Roma hasta China, en ningún sitio se generalizó tanto el empleo del elefante en la guerra como en el sudeste asiático. El inmenso tamaño del animal le permitía pisotear a la infantería y su olor asustaba a los caballos, lo que proporcionaba a estas bestias una inmensa ventaja táctica en el campo de batalla. Pero su principal ventaja era la fuerza bruta.[PARAGRAPH:1]Aunque las torres y los howdahs eran parte esencial de la impedimenta de los Elefantes de guerra de todo el mundo, fueron los jémeres los que perfeccionaron el despliegue de la gran ballesta de asedio (o balista), en la espalda de los inmensos paquidermos. Esto dotaba al elefante y a la balista de un peligro superior: la imponente presencia del animal proporcionaba a la balista protección frente a la caballería, mientras que el elefante, así equipado, se convertía en un arma de destrucción realmente aterradora.

TEXT.English: Is a powerful weapon resembling a giant crossbow, to eject heavy darts singly or in groups. It is also sometimes referred to as a bolt thrower. The first ballistae were deployed in Ancient Greece, and were mainly large crossbows fastened on a mount. The first known appearance was in Syracuse, in Sicily, around 400 BC.
TEXT.French: C'est une arme puissante ressemblant à une arbalète géante, utilisée pour lancer des flèches lourdes individuellement ou en groupe. On l'appelle aussi parfois lance-carreaux. Les premières balistes furent déployées dans la Grèce antique et étaient principalement de grandes arbalètes fixées sur un socle. Leur première apparition connue remonte à Syracuse, en Sicile, vers 400 av. J.-C.
