TEXT.English: The hot air balloon is the oldest successful human-carrying flight technology. It is in a class of aircraft known as balloon aircraft. On Nov 21, 1783, in Paris, France, the first untethered manned flight was made by Jean-François Pilâtre de Rozier and François Laurent d'Arlandes in a hot air balloon created on Dec 14, 1782 by the Montgolfier brothers. Hot air balloons that can be propelled through the air rather than just being pushed along by the wind are known as airships or, more specifically, thermal airships.[PARAGRAPH:2]A hot air balloon consists of a bag called the envelope that is capable of containing heated air. Suspended beneath is a gondola or wicker basket (in some long-distance or high-altitude balloons, a capsule), which carries passengers and (usually) a source of heat, in most cases an open flame. The heated air inside the envelope makes it buoyant since it has a lower density than the relatively cold air outside the envelope. As with all aircraft, hot air balloons cannot fly beyond the atmosphere. Unlike gas balloons, the envelope does not have to be sealed at the bottom since the air near the bottom of the envelope is at the same pressure as the surrounding air. In today's sport balloons the envelope is generally made from nylon fabric and the mouth of the balloon (closest to the burner flame) is made from fire resistant material such as Nomex. Beginning in the mid-1970s, balloon envelopes have been made in all kinds of shapes, such as hot dogs, rocket ships, and the shapes of commercial products, though the traditional shape remains popular for most non-commercial, and many commercial, applications.[PARAGRAPH:2]The term hot air balloon is occasionally used inaccurately to denote any balloon large enough to carry people, including gas balloons.

Python regius is a nonvenomous python species found in Africa. This is the smallest of the African pythons and is popular in the pet trade. No subspecies are currently recognized. They are also known as royal pythons or ball pythons. The name ball python refers to the animal's tendency to curl into a ball when stressed or frightened. The name royal python (from the Latin "regius") is based in part on the story that Cleopatra supposedly wore the snake around her wrist.[PARAGRAPH:2]Adults generally do not grow to more than 90 - 120 cm (3.0 - 3.9 ft) in length, although some specimens have reached 152 cm and even 182 cm (5 - 6 feet), but this is very rare. Females tend to be slightly bigger than males maturing at an average of 4-4.5 feet. Males usually average around 3-3.5 feet. The build is stocky while the head is relatively small. The scales are smooth and both sexes have anal spurs on either side of the vent. Although males tend to have larger spurs, this is not definitive, and sex is best determined via manual eversion of the male hemipenes or inserting a probe into the cloaca to find the inverted hemipenes (if male). When probing to determine sex, males typically measure eight to ten subcaudal scales, and females typically measure two to four subcaudal scales.[PARAGRAPH:2]The color pattern is typically black or dark brown with light brown or gold sides and dorsal blotches. The belly is a white or cream that may include scattered black markings. However, those in the pet industries have, through selective breeding, developed many morphs (genetic mutations) with altered colors and patterns.
TEXT.German: Der Königspython (Python regius) ist eine ungiftige Riesenschlange, die in den tropischen Gebieten West- und Zentralafrikas heimisch ist. Erwachsene Exemplare können maximal eine Gesamtlänge von 2 m erreichen, damit sind sie die kleinsten Vertreter der Gattung Python. Durch ihre hell- bis dunkelbraune Färbung mit der markanten Fleckenstruktur passen sich Königspythons perfekt ihrer Umgebung an.[NEWLINE]Königspythons sind, was ihren Lebensraum betrifft, sehr anpassungsfähig. Man findet sie in tropischem Regenwald genauso wie in Savannen und sogar in den Randbereichen von menschlichen Siedlungen. Sie sind dämmerungs- und nachtaktiv und verstecken sich tagsüber, meist in Termitenhügeln oder Nagerbauten. Königspythons ernähren sich ausschließlich von kleinen Säugetieren und Vögeln.[NEWLINE]Der Königspython ist wegen seiner geringen Größe, der Schönheit seiner Hautzeichnung und des niedrigen Preises ein beliebtes Haustier. Deshalb wird er in großen Mengen für die Terrarienhaltung gefangen. Da sie in landwirtschaftlich genutzten Gebieten die Anzahl an Vorrats- und Ernteschädlingen – Mäuse zählen zu ihrer bevorzugten Beute – dezimieren, gelten sie in einigen Gebieten Ghanas und Benins als heilig und dürfen nicht getötet werden.

TEXT.English: The Bandeirantes, "those who are of the banner") were 17th century Portuguese settlers in Brazil, fortune hunters and adventurers from the São Paulo region, the Captaincy of São Vicente (later called the Captaincy of São Paulo). They were the leaders of expeditions called bandeiras (Portuguese, "flags") that penetrated the interior of Brazil far south and west of the Tordesillas Line of 1494 that divided the Spanish (west) domain from the Portuguese (east) domain in South America.
TEXT.French: Les Bandeirantes (littéralement « ceux qui sont de la bannière ») étaient des colons portugais du XVIIe siècle au Brésil, des chasseurs de fortune et des aventuriers originaires de la région de São Paulo, dans la capitainerie de São Vicente (plus tard appelée capitainerie de São Paulo). Ils dirigeaient des expéditions appelées bandeiras (en portugais, « bannières ») qui pénétraient l'intérieur du Brésil, bien au sud et à l'ouest de la ligne de Tordesillas de 1494, laquelle divisait l'Amérique du Sud entre les domaines espagnol (à l'ouest) et portugais (à l'est).
TEXT.Polish: Bandeirantes cz³onkowie wypraw w g³¹b interioru w okresie portugalskiego podboju Brazylii. Pocz¹wszy od XVI wieku powstawa³y oddzia³y awanturników ruszaj¹cych w g³¹b kontynentu. Trudnili siê handlem indiañskimi niewolnikami, byli tak¿e poszukiwaczami z³ó¿ mineralnych (z³oto, diamenty). Oddzia³y mog³y liczyæ po kilkuset ludzi, ich g³ówn¹ baz¹ wypadow¹ by³o powsta³e w roku 1554 Sao Paulo, dlatego te¿ zwano ich czasami paulistami. Dziœ w wielu miastach Brazylii znajduj¹ siê ich pomniki.

TEXT.English: As long as there have been footpaths, there have been bandits. Banditry is common in rural, rugged areas of countries with weak militaries, since such nations do not have the means to defend their borders and control the hinterland. Bandits prefer wooded, hilly areas, since such environments provide many hiding places. It should be noted that there are social bandits, different from the run-of-the-mill cut-throats who prey on undefended travellers. Social bandits prey on the wealthy and soldiers of the country they have issue with as a means of protest; such acts are similar in nature to the peasant revolt.
TEXT.Polish: Od kiedy istnia³y drogi, istnieli równie¿ bandyci. Bandyci preferowali zadrzewione górskie tereny, jako, ¿e zapewnia³y im one sporo potencjalnych kryjowek.

TEXT.English: As long as there have been footpaths, there have been bandits. Banditry is common in rural, rugged areas of countries with weak militaries, since such nations do not have the means to defend their borders and control the hinterland. Bandits prefer wooded, hilly areas, since such environments provide many hiding places. It should be noted that there are social bandits, different from the run-of-the-mill cut-throats who prey on undefended travellers. Social bandits prey on the wealthy and soldiers of the country they have issue with as a means of protest; such acts are similar in nature to the peasant revolt.

TEXT.English: A band society is the simplest form of human society. A band generally consists of a small kin group, no larger than an extended family or clan; it has been defined as consisting of no more than 30 to 50 individuals.
TEXT.French: Une société en bande est la forme la plus simple de la société humaine. Une bande se compose généralement d'un petit groupe de parents, pas plus grand qu'une famille élargie ou un clan ; elle a été définie comme ne comprenant pas plus de 30 à 50 individus.
TEXT.German: Heutzutage gehen Archäologen davon aus, dass die Menschen der Altsteinzeit sich bereits in halbsesshaften, mobilen Horden von Jägern und Sammlern organisierten. Diese Horden waren sich selbst versorgende Gemeinschaften, die meist aus mehreren Großfamilien bestanden. Es handelte sich bei der Hordengesellschaft durchaus schon um eine Anfangsstufe der soziokulturellen Entwicklung, denn das Zusammenleben zeichnete sich dadurch aus, dass sich alle Individuen gemeinsam und gleichgestellt um Arbeit, Sicherheit, religiöse Rituale und die Betreuung von Kindern und Alten kümmerten. Diese Gesellschaftsform findet sich heute noch bei den Buschleuten im südlichen Afrika.
TEXT.Polish: Grupa spo³eczna to najprostsza forma ludzkiego spo³eczeñstwa. Grupa sk³ada siê z regu³y z kilkunastu do kilkudziesiêciu spokrewnionych ze sob¹ osób, nie wykraczaj¹c poza rozszerzon¹ rodzinê czy klan.

TEXT.English: Xebecs were similar to galleys used by Algerian corsairs and Barbary pirates having both lateen sails and oars for propulsion. Early xebecs had two masts; later ones three. Xebecs featured a distinctive hull with pronounced overhanging bow and stern, and rarely displaced more than 200 tons, making them slightly smaller and with slightly fewer guns than frigates of the period.
TEXT.French: Les xebecs étaient similaires aux galères utilisées par les corsaires algériens et les pirates barbaresques, possédant à la fois des voiles latines et des rames pour la propulsion. Les premiers xebecs avaient deux mâts ; les plus tardifs en avaient trois. Les xebecs se caractérisaient par une coque distinctive avec un avant et un arrière surplombants prononcés, et déplaçaient rarement plus de 200 tonnes, les rendant légèrement plus petits et avec un peu moins de canons que les frégates de l'époque.

TEXT.English: Barbarossa, originally named Khidr, was a Barbary pirate and later admiral of the Ottoman fleet, by whose initiative Algeria and Tunisia became part of the Ottoman Empire. For three centuries after his death, Mediterranean coastal towns and villages were ravaged by his pirate successors. Khidr was one of four sons of a Turk from the island of Lesbos. Hatred of the Spanish and Portuguese who attacked North Africa between 1505 and 1511 encouraged Khidr and his brother 'Aruj to intensify their piracy. They hoped, with the aid of Turks and Muslim emigrants from Spain, to wrest an African domain for themselves and had begun to succeed in this design when 'Aruj was killed by the Spanish in 1518. Khidr, who had been his brother's lieutenant, then assumed the title Khayr ad-Din. Fearing he would lose his possessions to the Spanish, he offered homage to the Ottoman sultan and in return was granted the title beylerbey and sent military reinforcements (1518). With this aid Khayr ad-Din was able to capture Algiers in 1529 and make it the great stronghold of Mediterranean piracy. In 1533, he was appointed admiral in chief of the Ottoman Empire, and the next year he conquered the whole of Tunisia for the Turks, Tunis itself becoming the base of piracy against the Italian coast. The Holy Roman emperor Charles V led a crusade that captured Tunis and Goletta in 1535, but Barbarossa defeated Charles V's fleet at the Battle of Preveza (1538), thereby securing the eastern Mediterranean for the Turks (until their defeat at the Battle of Lepanto in 1571). Barbarossa remained one of the great figures of the court at Constantinople until his death.

TEXT.English: The Barbary macaque, or common macaque, is a macaque with no tail. Found in the Atlas Mountains of Algeria and Morocco with a small population, of unknown origin, in Gibraltar, the Barbary macaque is one of the best-known Old World monkey species. Besides humans, they are the only primates living freely in Europe. Although the species is commonly referred to as the "Barbary ape", the Barbary macaque is a true monkey, not an ape.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]Appearance[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]The monkey is yellowish-brown to grey with lighter undersides, growing to a maximum size of 75 cm (30 in) and 16 kg (35 lb). Its face is a dark pink and its tail is vestigial. The front limbs of this monkey are longer than its hind limbs. Females are somewhat smaller than males.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]Ecology[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Dwelling in forests of cedar, pine and oak, the Barbary macaque may frequent elevations of 2,100 m (6,900 ft) above sea level or more. It is a diurnal animal, dividing its time more or less equally between arboreal and terrestrial territory. Mostly herbivorous, this monkey feeds on leaves, roots, and fruit, but will also eat insects. By day, the Barbary macaque patrols a territory which may span several square kilometres; it peacefully coexists with other primate species, sharing watering holes without incident. The Barbary macaque moves about energetically on all fours, occasionally rising erect on its hind limbs to survey for threats.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Barbary macaque is gregarious, forming mixed groups of several females and males; the troop of 10 to 100 individuals is matriarchal, with its hierarchy determined by lineage to the lead female. Unlike other macaques, the males participate in rearing the young; much time is spent playing and grooming with them. In this way, a strong social bond is formed between a male and his offspring, both the male's own and those of others in the troop. This may be a result of selectiveness on the part of the females, which seem to prefer highly parental males.[PARAGRAPH:2]The mating season runs from November through March. After a gestation period of 147 to 192 days, typically one offspring per female is born; twins are rare. The monkeys reach maturity at three to four years of age, and may live for 20 years or more.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Berberaffe[COLOR_REVERT] (Macaca sylvanus) gehört zu den Makaken und ist neben dem Menschen die einzige freilebende Primatenart Europas. Das Fell der schwanzlosen Berberaffen ist gelblich-braun bis graubraun, das Gesicht dunkelrosa. Sie haben wie alle Makaken Backentaschen, um Nahrung zu verstauen.[NEWLINE]Ihre Heimat sind vor allem die Gebirge Marokkos, sowie Teile Algeriens. Durch den Menschen sind Berberaffen außerdem nach Gibraltar gekommen. Die Tiere können sehr gut klettern, halten sich aber meist am Boden auf. Sie leben in unterschiedlich großen Gruppen, die von einem dominanten Männchen geleitet werden. Berberaffen sind Allesfresser, verzehren jedoch hauptsächlich Früchte, Blätter, Wurzeln usw., im Winter oft Rinde und Baumnadeln. Das Paarungsverhalten ist promiskutiv, also mit wechselnden Partnern. Weibchen bringen meist ein einzelnes Jungtier zur Welt, um das sich die Männchen ebenfalls kümmern (auch ohne zu wissen, ob sie der Vater sind).[NEWLINE]Durch die Zerstörung des Lebensraumes sind die Berberaffen stark gefährdet. In Europa gibt es mehrere Freigehege mit bis zu 250 Tieren.

TEXT.English: The Barbary Corsairs, sometimes called Barbary Pirates, were Muslim pirates and privateers who operated from North Africa, based primarily in the ports of Tunis, Tripoli and Algiers. This area was known in Europe as the Barbary Coast. Their predation extended throughout the Mediterranean, south along West Africa's Atlantic seaboard and even South America, and into the North Atlantic as far north as Iceland, but they primarily operated in the western Mediterranean. In addition to seizing ships, they engaged in raids in many coastal towns in all the aforementioned areas. The main purpose of their attacks was to capture Christian slaves for the Islamic market in North Africa and the Middle East. More than 20,000 captives were said to be imprisoned in Algiers alone. While such raids had occurred since soon after the Muslim conquest of the region, the terms Barbary Pirates and Barbary Corsairs are normally applied to the raiders active from the 16th century onward, when the frequency and range of the slavers' attacks increased. Pirates captured thousands of ships and from the 16th to 19th century, pirates captured an estimated 800,000 to 1.25 million people as slaves. The most famous corsairs were the brothers Hayreddin Barbarossa and Oruç Reis, both nicknamed "Redbeard", who took control of Algiers on behalf of the Ottomans in the early 16th century. The adoption of European sailing and shipbuilding techniques around 1600 enabled the corsairs to extend their activities into the Atlantic Ocean, and the impact of Barbary raids peaked in the early to mid-17th century.
TEXT.Polish: Piraci berberyjscy byli muzu³mañskimi rabusiami morskimi, którzy dzia³ali na akwenach Morza Œródziemnego i Atlantyku w oparciu o porty Afryki Pó³nocnej od koñca XI do pocz¹tków XIX wieku. Wyruszaj¹c z pó³nocnoafrykañskich portów jak Tunis, Trypolis, Algier, Sala, czy te¿ innych od Maroka po Cyrenajkê, ¿eglowali g³ównie wzd³u¿ pasa l¹du zwanego Berberi¹ (jest to dawna nazwa Maghrebu, wywodz¹ca siê od zamieszkuj¹cych te ziemie Berberów). Napadali na statki i osady nadbrze¿ne zarówno na Morzu Œródziemnym, jak i na Atlantyku wzd³u¿ zachodnich wybrze¿y Afryki, a nawet daleko na pó³nocy, docieraj¹c a¿ do Islandii. G³ównym celem tych rejz by³o chwytanie chrzeœcijan obojga p³ci, celem sprzedania ich na targach niewolników w Algierii i Maroku.

TEXT.English: The barn owl (Tyto alba) is the most widely distributed species of owl, and one of the most widespread of all birds. It is also referred to as the common barn owl, to distinguish it from other species in its family, Tytonidae, which forms one of the two main lineages of living owls, the other being the typical owls (Strigidae). The barn owl is found almost everywhere in the world except polar and desert regions, Asia north of the Himalayas, most of Indonesia and some Pacific islands.[PARAGRAPH:2]Phylogenetic evidence shows that there are at least three major lineages of barn owl, one in Eurasia and Africa, one in Australasia and one in the New World, and some highly divergent taxa on islands. Some authorities further split the group, recognising up to five species, and further research needs to be done to clarify the position. There is considerable variation between the sizes and colouring of the approximately 28 subspecies but most are between 33 and 39 cm (13 and 15 in) in length with wingspans ranging from 80 to 95 cm (31 to 37 in). The plumage on head and back is a mottled shade of grey or brown, the underparts vary from white to brown and are sometimes speckled with dark markings. The face is characteristically heart-shaped and is white in most species. This owl does not hoot, but utters an eerie, drawn-out shriek.[PARAGRAPH:2]The barn owl is nocturnal over most of its range but in Britain and some Pacific islands, it also hunts by day. Barn owls specialise in hunting animals on the ground and nearly all of their food consists of small mammals which they locate by sound, their hearing being very acute. They mate for life unless one of the pair gets killed, when a new pair bond may be formed. Breeding takes place at varying times of year according to locality, with a clutch, averaging about four eggs, being laid in a nest in a hollow tree, old building or fissure in a cliff. The female does all the incubation, and she and the young chicks are reliant on the male for food. When large numbers of small prey are readily available, barn owl populations can expand rapidly, and globally the bird is considered to be of least conservation concern. Some subspecies with restricted ranges are more threatened.
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Schleiereule[COLOR_REVERT] (Tyto alba) gehört zu den am weitesten verbreiteten Vogelarten. Außer in der Tundra, in tropischen Regenwäldern, Wüsten und großen Teilen Asiens ist sie überall anzutreffen. Es gibt über 30 verschiedene Unterarten. Die vergleichsweise hell gefärbten Schleiereulen werden 33 bis 35 Zentimenter lang, wobei die Weibchen etwas größer und dunkler sind als die Männchen. Ihren Namen verdanken sie dem herzförmigen Gesichtsschleier, der je nach Unterart weiß, grau oder leicht rostrot ist. Die dunkelbraunen bis schwarzen Augen sind recht klein. Das Gefieder ist auf der Oberseite meist goldbraun, die Bauchseite variiert je nach Unterart. Schleiereulen besitzen keine Federohren und haben recht lange Beine mit fast unbefiederten Zehen. Ihr Gehör ist ausgesprochen gut. Nestlinge wechseln zweimal ihr Federkleid (Dunenkleid) und öffnen am achten Tag nach der Geburt ihre Augen, deren Iris anfangs blau ist. Auch Schnabel und Zehen besitzen kurz nach der Geburt eine hellere Farbe.[NEWLINE]Der Lebensraum der Schleiereule sind halboffene Landschaften, in Mitteleuropa sind sie als Kulturfolger jedoch nur in offenen Agrarlandschaften mit dörflichen Siedlungen anzutreffen. Mit ihren langen Flügeln gleiten sie bei der Jagd fast geräuschlos über offenes Gelände, um kleine Säugetiere (meist Mäuse) zu erbeuten. Dabei haben sie vermutlich feste Flugrouten, die oft an Zäunen, Hecken und Gräben entlang führen. Tagsüber verstecken sich die nachtaktiven Tiere z.B. in Scheunen, Baumhöhlen oder Felsspalten, wo sie Schutz vor Witterung und hellem Tageslicht finden. In der Abenddämmerung strecken und schütteln sie sich und putzen ausgiebig ihr Gefieder. In der Balzzeit putzt sich das Paar gegenseitig. Männchen paaren sich oft mit mehrern Weibchen, umgekehrt ist es eher selten. Schleiereulen sind ortstreu und überdauern auch strenge und schneereiche Winter in ihren Revieren. Dies und die recht schlechte Nahrungsverwertung führen in Mitteleuropa in strengen Wintern oft zu Bestandseinbrüchen oder gar zur Auslöschung regionaler Vorkommen. Fressfeinde hat die Schleiereule kaum, da sie Konflikte meidet und sich bei Gefahr versteckt. Bei einer Konfrontation nimmt sie eine Drohhaltung ein, schreit und wehrt sich mit ihren Krallen. Liegt sie auf dem Rücken, verfällt sie oft in eine Schreckstarre.[NEWLINE]Die Schleiereule ist als Mäusejäger besonders bei den Landwirten geschätzt. In der Vergangenheit baute man deshalb in Scheunen und Ställe oft "Uhlenlöcher", die als Brutplätze dienten. Die intensive Landnutzung u.a. durch Siedlungsbau und Stadtsanierung sowie die moderne Ackerbewirtschaftung mit der Einschränkung der Lebensräume für Feld- und Wühlmäuse sorgten dafür, dass die Bestände der Schleiereule in den letzten Jahrzehnten deutlich zurückgingen. Da Feldmäuse fast nur noch entlang von Straßen vorkommen, werden Schleiereulen auf der Jagd auch vermehrt Verkehrsopfer. Durch das Anbringen von Nistkästen und die Wiederherstellung von Uhlenlöchern haben sich die Bestände recht gut erholt. Teilweise werden gezüchtete Schleiereulen gezielt ausgewildert. Im Zuge des Klimawandels wird sich der Lebensraum in Europa bis zum Ende des 21. Jahrhunderts in den kühleren Nordosten verschieben. Ein Aberglaube besagt, dass eine an die Scheunentür genagelte Eule den Hof vor Blitzeinschlag und Feuer bewahren soll. In einigen Regionen kündigt der Eulenruf den Tod an, in anderen Gegenden eine Geburt. In Afrika und Indien wird die Schleiereule in der weißen und schwarzen Magie benutzt. Ihr ausgezeichnetes akustisches Ortungssystem dient in der Forschung als Modellsystem für das Richtungshören.
TEXT.Polish: P³omykówka zwyczajna, p³omykówka (Tyto alba) - gatunek œredniej wielkoœci ptaka z rodziny p³omykówkowatych (Tytonidae). Spoœród wszystkich sów najbardziej rozpowszechniony na œwiecie gatunek. Zamieszkuje wszystkie kontynenty oprócz Antarktyki. TEXT.English: Al-Malik Az-Zahir Sayf ad-Din Barquq was the first Sultan of the Mamluk Burji dynasty. The name Barquq means "apricot" in Arabic (the English word was derived from the Arabic), and was taken by Barquq on his arrival in Egypt. Barquq placed many of his own family in positions of power to the detriment of fellow Mamluks, attempting to solidify his position. He sponsored the construction of the Madrasa-Khanqa of Sultan Barquq in the center of Cairo. Completed in 1386, it was a pious foundation designed to serve as both a khanqah and a madrasa. It is one of the three dominant Islamic monuments clustered on the street Bayn al-Qasrayn in Fatimid Cairo. Although often called the Mausoleum of Barquq, only his daughter is buried there.

The Barred Owl's hooting call, "Who cooks for you? Who cooks for you-all?" is a classic sound of old forests and treed swamps. But this attractive owl, with soulful brown eyes and brown-and-white-striped plumage, can also pass completely unnoticed as it flies noiselessly through the dense canopy or snoozes on a tree limb. Originally a bird of the east (USA), during the twentieth century it spread through the Pacific Northwest and southward into California.[PARAGRAPH:2]Barred Owls are large, stocky owls with rounded heads, no ear tufts, and medium length, rounded tails.
TEXT.Polish: P³omykówka zwyczajna, p³omykówka (Tyto alba) - gatunek œredniej wielkoœci ptaka z rodziny p³omykówkowatych (Tytonidae). Spoœród wszystkich sów najbardziej rozpowszechniony na œwiecie gatunek. Zamieszkuje wszystkie kontynenty oprócz Antarktyki. TEXT.English: The Muslims acquired knowledge of gunpowder some time between 1240 and 1280, by which time the Syrian Hasan al-Rammah had written, in Arabic, recipes for gunpowder, instructions for the purification of saltpeter, and descriptions of gunpowder incendiaries. Gunpowder arrived in the Middle East, possibly through India, from China. This is implied by al-Rammah's usage of "terms that suggested he derived his knowledge from Chinese sources" and his references to saltpeter as "Chinese snow", fireworks as "Chinese flowers" and rockets as "Chinese arrows". However, because al-Rammah attributes his material to "his father and forefathers", al-Hassan argues that gunpowder became prevalent in Syria and Egypt by "the end of the twelfth century or the beginning of the thirteenth". Persians called saltpeter "Chinese salt" or "salt from Chinese salt marshes" (Persian namak shura chini).

In the pre-Islamic period the Bashkirs were followers of Tengrianism. Bashkirs began to convert to Islam from in the 9th century. Arab traveler Ibn Fadlan in 921 met some of the Bashkirs, who were Muslims. The final assertion of Islam among the Bashkirs occurred in the 1320s and 1330s (Golden Horde times). On the territory of Bashkortostan preserved the burial place of the first Imam of Historical Bashkortostan - The mausoleum of Hussein-Bek (ru), 14th-century building. In 1788 Catherine the Great established the "Orenburg Mohammedan Spiritual Assembly (ru)" in Ufa, which was the first Muslim administrative center in Russia.

Basil II, later surnamed the Bulgar-slayer (Basileios II Boulgaroktonos, 958 December 15, 1025), known in his time as Basil the Porphyrogenitus and Basil the Young to distinguish him from his ancestor Basil I the Macedonian, was a Byzantine emperor from the Macedonian dynasty who reigned from 10 January 976 to 15 December 1025. The first part of his long reign was dominated by civil war against powerful generals from the Anatolian aristocracy. Following their submission, Basil oversaw the stabilization and expansion of the Byzantine Empire's eastern frontier, and above all, the final and complete subjugation of Bulgaria, the Empire's foremost European foe, after a prolonged struggle. At his death, the Empire stretched from Southern Italy to the Caucasus and from the Danube to the borders of Palestine, its greatest territorial extent since the Muslim conquests, four centuries earlier. Despite near-constant warfare, Basil also showed himself a capable administrator, reducing the power of the great land-owning families who dominated the Empire's administration and military, and filling the Empire's treasury. Of far-reaching importance was Basil's decision to offer the hand of his sister Anna to Vladimir I of Kiev in exchange for military support, which led to the Christianization of the Kievan Rus', and the incorporation of Russia within the Byzantine cultural sphere. Both in near-contemporary history and in manuscript illustrations, Basil II is pictured as a short, well-proportioned figure, with brilliant light-blue eyes, a round face, and full, bushy whiskers, which he would twirl in his fingers when angry or while giving an audience. He dressed plainly and even when wearing the purple chose only a dark hue. An abrupt speaker, he scorned rhetoric yet was capable of wit. He has been described as mean, austere, and irascible, spending most of his time as though he were a soldier on guard. He knew only too well the danger of any relaxation. He showed no obvious interest in learning, but he did apparently commission works of religious art, and he had churches and monasteries rebuilt or completed in Boeotia and in Athens, though this may be accounted for by conventional piety. He seems never to have married or had children, though he was reputedly a womanizer in his youth. On his death there was no able military aristocrat or other leader to take the situation in hand, and thus Basil II's work was rapidly undone.

TEXT.English: Scholars C. Scott Littleton and Ann C. Thomas posited that the legends of King Arthur and The Holy Grail derive from Sarmatian legends. The authors find parallels between the Sarmatian legend of Batradz, a Sarmatian king commanding his companions to throw his magical sword into a lake and Arthur's instructions to Sir Bedivere to throw his magical sword Excalibur into a lake. The authors also use historical records to demonstrate the presence of a 2nd-century AD colony of Sarmatian veterans at Bremetennacum, in modern Lancashire, as a historical source for the legends entering Britain. A more extensive study of the Alano-Sarmatian impact on the Roman Empire and the Arthurian tradition is presented by C. Scott Littleton and Linda A. Malcor in From Scythia to Camelot.

A battering ram is a siege engine originating in ancient times to break open fortification walls or doors. In its simplest form, a battering ram is just a large, heavy log carried by several people and propelled with force against an obstacle; the ram would be sufficient to damage the target if the log were massive enough and/or it were moved quickly enough, and if it had enough momentum. In a more sophisticated design, a battering ram was slung from a wheeled support frame by ropes or chains so that it could be much more massive and also more easily swung against its target. Sometimes the ram's attacking point would be reinforced with a metal head and vulnerable parts of the ram might be bound with metal bands. Many battering rams had protective roofs and side-screens covered in materials, usually fresh wet hides, presumably from the animals eaten by the besiegers, to prevent the ram being set on fire, as well as to protect the operators of the ram from enemies firing arrows down on them by allowing them to seek shelter within the battering ram structure. The image of the Assyrian battering ram shows how sophisticated attacks and defences had become by the 9th century BC. The defenders are trying to set the ram alight with torches and have also put a chain under the ram. The attackers are trying to pull on the chain to free the ram, while the aforementioned wet hides would protect against the fire. The first confirmed use in the Occident was when the Spartans attacked Platea. The first use in the Mediterranean Sea with siege towers was in the 409 BC with the Selinus siege.

TEXT.English: Battlecruisers were large warships of the first half of the 20th century. First introduced by the British Royal Navy. The battlecruiser was developed as the successor to the armoured cruisers, but their evolution was more closely linked to that of the dreadnought battleships. The first such ship, the Invincible, was originally designated a "dreadnought cruiser".[PARAGRAPH:1]Battlecruisers shared the very large main armament of battleships, and were generally as large and costly as battleships of the same generation. They traded off armour or firepower for higher speed, which was made possible by their powerful engines and slender hulls. The earliest battlecruisers carried significantly less armour than the equivalent battleship, meaning they were not intended to stand up against the guns they themselves carried.

Kr¹¿owniki liniowe zaliczane by³y obok pancerników do okrêtów liniowych. W dawnym polskim piœmiennictwie nazywano je te¿ "kr¹¿ownikami bojowymi". Mia³ przy tym byæ jednostk¹ bardziej uniwersaln¹ od pancernika, mog¹c¹ prowadziæ dzia³ania rajderskie na liniach komunikacyjnych przeciwnika oraz dzia³ania rozpoznawcze na rzecz floty liniowej. German.Text: Modernes Schlachtschiff:Modernen Schlachtschiffes:Modernen Schlachtschiff:Moderne Schlachtschiff:Moderne Schlachtschiffe:Modernen Schlachtschiffe:Modernen Schlachtschiffen:Modernen Schlachtschiffe

TEXT.English: The battleship was once the most powerful vessel on the seas. Heavily armored and difficult to destroy, its massive guns could accurately fire heavy projectiles at targets miles away. The battleship had two primary functions: clearing the seas of enemy ships and bombarding enemy coastal targets, usually in preparation for an invasion. The battleship's importance began to decline in World War II when the increasing use of fighters and bombers launched from aircraft carriers greatly extended the range of naval conflicts. Ship-to-ship combat became less frequent than long-range air attacks against enemy battle groups. The last of the U.S. Navy's battleships was decommissioned shortly after the Vietnam War, but the four battleships of the Iowa class were remodeled and re-commissioned in the 1980s.
TEXT.French: Le cuirassé moderne était en son temps le plus puissant des navires de guerre. Il était lourdement armé et difficile à détruire, et ses énormes canons pouvaient tirer avec précision des projectiles de très gros calibre sur des cibles situées à des kilomètres. Le cuirassé moderne avait deux fonctions principales : détruire les navires ennemis et bombarder les positions côtières, généralement pour préparer les opérations de débarquement. L'importance des cuirassés modernes a commencé à décliner au cours de la Deuxième Guerre mondiale, alors que l'utilisation croissante de chasseurs et de bombardiers embarqués sur des porte-avions a augmenté considérablement la portée des conflits maritimes. Les combats entre bateaux de guerre sont devenus plus rares que les attaques aériennes contre des flottes ennemies. Le dernier cuirassé moderne américain a été déclassé peu de temps après la guerre du Viêt-nam, mais les quatre cuirassés de la classe Iowa ont été modernisés et remis en service dans les années 1980.
TEXT.German: Das Kriegsschiff galt früher als das mächtigste Seefahrzeug der Marineschifffahrt: Dank seiner starken Panzerung war es nur sehr schwer zu zerstören, und seine massiven Geschütze konnten ihre schwere Munition mit hoher Genauigkeit auf meilenweit entfernte Zielobjekte feuern. Seine beiden Hauptaufgaben bestanden in der Vertreibung feindlicher Schiffe aus den eigenen Gewässern und in der Bombardierung feindlicher Küstengebiete, üblicherweise in Vorbereitung einer Invasion. Die Bedeutung des Kriegsschiffes ließ bereits im 2. Weltkrieg nach, als mehr und mehr Kampfflugzeuge und Bomber von Flugzeugträgern aus gestartet wurden und den Radius der maritimen Kriegsführung immens erweiterten. Reine Seegefechte, an denen ausschließlich Schiffe beteiligt waren, wurden seltener, während die Zahl der weit reichenden Luftangriffe auf feindliche Truppen immer weiter anstieg. Das letzte Kriegsschiff der U.S. Marine wurde kurz nach Ende des Vietnamkriegs außer Dienst gestellt, allerdings wurden vier Kriegsschiffe der Iowa-Klasse später renoviert und in den 80er Jahren wieder in Betrieb genommen.
TEXT.Italian: La nave da guerra era, un tempo, l'unità navale più potente dei mari. Dotata di armamenti pesanti e difficile da distruggere, poteva sparare proiettili di grosso calibro a lunghe distanze, grazie ai suoi enormi cannoni. Le navi da guerra avevano due funzioni primarie: ripulire i mari dalle navi avversarie e bombardare obiettivi nemici sulla costa, di solito in previsione di un'invasione. L'importanza della nave da guerra cominciò a calare durante la Seconda Guerra Mondiale, quando l'impiego crescente di aerei da caccia e di bombardieri lanciati dalle portaerei allargò notevolmente il raggio d'azione degli scontri navali. I combattimenti tra navi divennero così meno frequenti degli attacchi aerei contro le forze nemiche. L'ultima nave da guerra americana fu smantellata poco dopo la Guerra del Vietnam, ma nel 1980 le quattro unità della classe Iowa furono riadattate e riequipaggiate.
TEXT.Spanish: El acorazado era en su momento el barco más poderoso de los mares. Dotado de un grueso blindaje y difícil de destruir, sus enormes cañones podían disparar con precisión proyectiles de gran calibre contra objetivos situados a varios kilómetros de distancia. El acorazado cumplía dos funciones principales: limpiar los mares de barcos enemigos y cañonear objetivos costeros, normalmente como paso previo a una invasión. La importancia de los acorazados empezó a declinar en la Segunda Guerra Mundial, cuando la generalización de los cazas y bombarderos lanzados desde portaviones aumentó considerablemente el alcance de las operaciones navales. Los combates de superficie se volvieron más raros que los ataques aéreos lanzados a distancia contra las agrupaciones enemigas. El último acorazado de la armada estadounidense abandonó el servicio activo poco después de la Guerra de Vietnam, pero los cuatro de la clase Iowa fueron remodelados y volvieron al servicio en la década de los 80.

TEXT.English: Batu Khan was a Mongol ruler and founder of the Golden Horde, division of the Mongol Empire. Batu was a son of Jochi and grandson of Genghis Khan. His ulus was the chief state of the Golden Horde, which ruled Rus', Volga Bulgaria, Cumania, and the Caucasus for around 250 years, after also destroying the armies of Poland and Hungary. "Batu" or "Bat" literally means "firm" in the Mongolian language. After the deaths of Genghis Khan's sons, he became the most respected prince called agha (elder brother) in the Mongol Empire.

The concept of the Baghatur has its roots in Turco-Mongolian folklore. Like the Bogatyrs of Russian myth, Baghaturs were heroes of extraordinary courage, fearlessness, and decisiveness, often portrayed as being descended from heaven and capable of performing extraordinary deeds. Baghatur was the heroic ideal Turco-Mongolian warriors strove to live up to, hence its use as a military honorific of glory.
TEXT.French: Le concept du Baghatur trouve ses racines dans le folklore turco-mongol. Comme les Bogatyrs du mythe russe, les Baghatures étaient des héros d'un courage extraordinaire, intrépides et décisifs, souvent représentés comme descendants du ciel et capables d'accomplir des exploits extraordinaires. Le Baghatur était l'idéal héroïque auquel les guerriers turco-mongols aspiraient, d'où son utilisation comme titre militaire honorifique de gloire.

TEXT.English: Bayajidda is a character from the mythology of the Hausa people of northern Nigeria and the central figure of the Bayajidda Legend. The various versions of the legend differ on minor points, but generally agree that he originated in Baghdad, traveled across the Sahara, and arrived in the Kanem-Bornu Empire, where he married a local princess. Tensions with her father, the king, forced him to flee; leaving his wife in Hadejia, he made his way to Gaya, where he had the local blacksmiths forge him a knife. With this knife, Bayajidda proceeded to the final point on his journey, the city of Daura, where he slew a serpent that had been terrorizing the townspeople. In gratitude for this deed Magajiya Daurama, the local queen, married him. He had one child, Bawo, with Daurama, and Bawo's own children are said to have gone on to found the seven Hausa states. While some Hausa maintain that Bayajidda was real, others hold the view that he did not actually exist, but is instead a personification of a group of people from West African history.
TEXT.Polish: Bayajidda to mityczna postaæ z legend ludu Hausa. Istnieje wiele wersji tej legendy, które ró¿ni¹ siê miêdzy sob¹ w drobnych szczegó³ach, ale wszystkie zgadzaj¹ siê, ¿e Bayajidda pochodzi³ z Bagdadu, podró¿owa³ przez Saharê i dotar³ do Królestwa Kanem-Bornu, gdzie poœlubi³ lokaln¹ ksiê¿niczkê. Nieporozumienia z Królem, jej ojcem, doprowadzi³y do jego ucieczki; zostawiaj¹c ¿onê w Hadejia, wyruszy³ do Gaya, gdzie miejscowy kowal wyku³ dla niego nó¿. Z tym no¿em, Bayajidda wyruszy³ do ostatecznego celu swojej podró¿y, do miasta Daura, gdzie pokona³ i zabi³ ogromnego wê¿a terroryzuj¹cego mieszkañców. Z wdziêcznoœci za jego uczynek, miejscowa Królowa Magajiya Daurama poœlubi³a go. Mieli jedno dziecko imieniem Bawo i jego potomstwo uwa¿a siê za za³o¿ycieli siedmiu pañstwa ludu Hausa.

TEXT.English: The bazooka is a man-portable anti-armor rocket launcher, made famous during World War II, where it was one of the primary infantry anti-tank weapons used by the United States Armed Forces. It was one of the first weapons based on the High explosive anti-tank (HEAT) shell to enter service. It was nicknamed "bazooka" from a vague resemblance to the musical instrument of the same name invented and used by Bob Burns. It saw widespread use throughout WWII.
TEXT.French: Le bazooka est un lance-roquettes anti-blindage portable, rendu célèbre pendant la Seconde Guerre mondiale, où il fut l'une des principales armes antichars d'infanterie utilisées par les forces armées américaines. C'était l'une des premières armes basées sur le projectile antichar à haute explosion (HEAT) à entrer en service. Il a été surnommé « bazooka » en raison d'une vague ressemblance avec l'instrument de musique du même nom, inventé et utilisé par Bob Burns. Il a été largement utilisé tout au long de la Seconde Guerre mondiale.
TEXT.Polish: Bazooka - amerykañska rêczna wyrzutnia niekierowanych przeciwpancernych pocisków rakietowych z g³owic¹ kumulacyjn¹, granatnik przeciwpancerny stosowany przez wojska alianckie w czasie II wojny œwiatowej i pozostaj¹cy na uzbrojeniu armii amerykañskiej do lat szeœædziesi¹tych XX wieku.

TEXT.English: A bead is a small, decorative object that is formed in a variety of shapes and sizes of a material such as stone, bone, shell, glass, plastic, wood or pearl and that a small hole is drilled for threading or stringing. Beads range in size from under 1 millimetre (0.039 in) to over 1 centimetre (0.39 in) in diameter. A pair of beads made from Nassarius sea snail shells, approximately 100,000 years old, are thought to be the earliest known examples of jewellery/jewelry. Beadwork is the art or craft of making things with beads. Beads can be woven together with specialized thread, strung onto thread or soft, flexible wire, or adhered to a surface (e.g. fabric, clay).

The Mississippi stage is usually divided into three or more chronological periods. Each period is an arbitrary historical distinction varying regionally. At a particular site, each period may be considered to begin earlier or later, depending on the speed of adoption or development of given Mississippian traits. The "Mississippi period" should not be confused with the "Mississippian culture". The Mississippi period is the chronological stage, while Mississippian culture refers to the cultural similarities that characterize this society.

Romani social behavior is strictly regulated by Hindu purity laws ("marime" or "marhime"), still respected by most Roma (and by most older generations of Sinti). This regulation affects many aspects of life, and is applied to actions, people and things: parts of the human body are considered impure: the genital organs (because they produce emissions), as well as the rest of the lower body. Clothes for the lower body, as well as the clothes of menstruating women, are washed separately. Items used for eating are also washed in a different place. Childbirth is considered impure, and must occur outside the dwelling place. The mother is considered impure for forty days after giving birth.

Benazir Bhutto was the 11th Prime Minister of Pakistan, serving two non-consecutive terms in 1988-90 and then 1993-96. A scion of the politically powerful Bhutto family, she was the eldest daughter of Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, a former prime minister himself who founded the centre-left Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP). She was the first woman to become head of government of any Muslim nation. In 1982, three years after her father's execution, 29-year-old Benazir Bhutto became the chairperson of the PPP-a political party, making her the first woman in Pakistan to head a major political party. In 1988, she became the first woman to be elected as the head of an Islamic state's government; she also remains Pakistan's only female prime minister. Noted for her charismatic authority and political astuteness, Bhutto drove initiatives for Pakistan's economy and national security, and she implemented capitalist policies for industrial development and growth. In addition, her political philosophy and economic policies emphasised deregulation (particularly of the financial sector), flexible labour markets, the denationalisation of state-owned corporations, and the withdrawal of subsidies to others. Bhutto's popularity waned amid recession, corruption, and high unemployment which later led to the dismissal of her government by conservative President Ghulam Ishaq Khan.

Bencomo, sometimes called Benchomo (c. 1438-November 1494), was the penultimate mencey or king of Taoro, a Guanche menceyato on the island of Tenerife. He fought in the First Battle of Acentejo, a victory for the Guanches against the invading Castilians, after having refused the terms of Alonso Fernandez de Lugo. He may have perished on the heights of San Roque during the Battle of Aguere alongside his brother Tinguaro. He had several (grand)children, including Adjona, Dacil, Bentor, Ruiman, Rosalva, Chachinama, and Tinate. Bentor succeeded him as mencey until his suicide in February of 1495.

German.Text: Bengalischer Tiger:Bengalischen Tigers:Bengalischen Tiger:Bengalischen Tiger:Bengalische Tiger:Bengalischen Tiger:Bengalischen Tigern:Bengalischen Tiger

TEXT.English: Benjamin William Mkapa was the third President of Tanzania, in office from 1995 to 2005. He was also Chairman of the Revolutionary State Party (Chama Cha Mapinduzi, CCM). Mkapa's second five-year term of office as President ended in December 2005. During this term in office, Mkapa privatized state-owned corporations and instituted free market policies. His supporters argued that attracting foreign investment would promote economic growth. His policies won the support of the World Bank and International Monetary Fund and resulted in the cancellation of some of Tanzania's foreign debts. He has been criticized for some ineffectiveness of his anti-corruption efforts as well as for his lavish spending. He spent?5 million on a private presidential jet, as well as almost?0 million on military aviation equipment which experts deemed beyond the limited needs of the country's armed forces. It was over the latter purchase that British International Development Secretary Clare Short expressed public outrage, resulting in her becoming known as 'Mama Radar' in the Tanzanian press.

Beowulf is a legendary Geatish hero in the epic poem named after him, one of the oldest surviving pieces of literature in the English language. Beowulf ruled the Geats for 50 years, until his realm was terrorized by a dragon after a thief stole a golden cup from its hoard of treasure. After unsuccessfully attacking the dragon with his thegns, Beowulf decided to pursue the monster into its lair at Earnanæs, but only his young Swedish relative Wiglaf dared join him. Beowulf finally slew the dragon by cutting it in half with a seax, but was mortally wounded by being stabbed with the dragon's poisonous horn. Dying, he was carried out by Wiglaf and with his last breaths named Wiglaf his rightful heir. He was buried in a barrow by the sea.

Numerous police and international intelligence agencies classify the Hells Angels as one of the "big four" motorcycle gangs, along with the Pagans, Outlaws, and Bandidos, and contend that members carry out widespread violent crimes, including drug dealing, trafficking in stolen goods, and extortion, and are involved in prostitution. Members of the organization have continuously asserted that they are only a group of motorcycle enthusiasts who have joined to ride motorcycles together, to organize social events such as group road trips, fundraisers, parties, and motorcycle rallies, and that any crimes are the responsibility of the individuals who carried them out and not the club as a whole. Members of the club have been accused of crimes and/or convicted in many host nations.

Bilge Khan was one of the most powerful emperors of the Göktürk Empire, a powerful nomadic confederation that included various nomadic peoples such as the Uighurs. His name literally means "wise chieftain". In 716, he assumed the leadership together with his brother Kul Tigin after a coup against the previous ruler, his cousin Inal Khan who was a weak leader. Bilge Khan and Kul Tigin took their place in history as the wisest and most heroic figures among Göktürk statesmen. They asserted that the state could not be ruled only by fighting and bravery and the Khanate should also require wisdom. Bilge's empire spanned vast steppes from the Caspian Sea to Manchuria; he also invaded the western sections of the Chinese territories. After his death from poisoning, several stelae were erected in the capital area by the Orkhon River. These Orkhon inscriptions are the first known texts in the Old Turkic language.
TEXT.Polish: Kagan Bilge by³ jednym z najpotê¿niejszych w³adców Imperium Turkutów, potê¿nej konfederacji plemion nomadów. Jego imiê znaczy dos³ownie "m¹dry wódz". W 716, po œmierci Kagana Kapagana obj¹³ przywództwo razem ze swym m³odszym bratem Kul-Tegin dokonuj¹c przewrotu przeciwko aktualnemu w³adcy Inalowi, który by³ s³abym i pozbawionym zdolnoœci liderem. Bilge w roku 721/722 zawar³ pokój z Chinami i odt¹d jego relacje z cesarzem Xuanzongiem (712 - 756) sta³y siê serdeczne. Wielkim ciosem dla Bilge by³a œmieræ jego brata na wiosnê 731 roku. Bilge zgin¹³ otruty 25 listopada 734 roku.

TEXT.English: The Austronesian ancestors of the present-day Iloanos came to the Philippines through bilogs, or outrigger boats during the Iron Age.
TEXT.French: Les ancêtres austronésiens des Iloanos actuels sont venus aux Philippines à bord de bilogs, ou pirogues à balancier, durant l'âge du fer.

TEXT.English: While medium and long-range missiles have been in use since the mid-twentieth century, they were never able to effectively carry biological warheads - the biological agent tended to be destroyed or too dispersed to be effective when the weapon was detonated. With the recent development of a sturdier virus (by a shadowy consortium located somewhere in the Pacific rim), biological missile weapons are now practical.[PARAGRAPH:1]Bio-missiles are banned by treaty across the planet. However, it is rumored that a number of empires are in fact stockpiling them, ready to be deployed if necessary.[PARAGRAPH:1]Though capable of being used against armies in the field, these weapons are most effective against targets in cities, where they damage the military assets and harm the civilian population as well. This has beneficial secondary effects as well - fleeing citizens might very well spread the disease to other enemy cities.[PARAGRAPH:1]The diseases are designed to be short-lived, lessening the risk of them spreading to friendly cities. However, there is always the possibility that once deployed the virus might mutate, becoming a menace to all of humanity. Thus, leaders (sane ones, anyway) see these missiles as weapons of last resort.
TEXT.French: Les missiles à moyenne ou à longue portée sont utilisés depuis la moitié du vingtième siècle, mais ils n'avaient encore jamais permis l'utilisation d'ogives biologiques, puisque l'agent biologique était généralement détruit au moment de l'impact ou que sa dispersion était trop importante pour être efficace. Avec le développement d'un virus plus résistant (suite aux travaux d'un mystérieux consortium situé quelque part sur la ceinture pacifique), les missiles à ogive biologique sont aujourd'hui opérationnels.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les missiles biologiques sont interdits sur toute la surface de la planète. Toutefois, des rumeurs affirment que certains empires ont tout un arsenal prêt à être déployé en cas de besoin.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ces missiles sont bien sûr susceptibles d'être utilisés contre une armée sur le champ de bataille, mais ils sont avant tout efficaces contre les villes, où ils touchent tout autant les infrastructures militaires que les populations civiles. L'un des effets secondaires "bénéfiques" de cette méthode est la fuite des populations touchées vers d'autres villes ennemies, permettant la propagation du virus.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les maladies ainsi transmises sont conçues pour durer le moins longtemps possible, de manière à limiter les risques de propagation aux villes alliées. Toutefois, rien ne permet de prévoir les éventuelles mutations du virus, qui deviendrait alors une menace pour l'humanité tout entière. C'est pourquoi les nations considèrent ces missiles comme leur dernier recours.
TEXT.German: Mittel- und Langstreckenraketen werden zwar bereits seit Mitte des 20. Jahrhunderts eingesetzt, dennoch waren sie nie wirklich geeignet, um biologische Sprengköpfe zu transportieren - weil sich der Wirkstoff entweder verflüchtigte oder zu weit verstreut wurde, um bei der Zündung der Waffe seine volle Wirkung entfalten zu können. Durch die jüngste Entwicklung eines widerstandsfähigeren Virus (initiiert von einem undurchsichtigen Konsortium, das sich irgendwo in den pazifischen Randgebieten versteckt hält) sind biologische Sprengköpfe jetzt jedoch auch in der Praxis einsetzbar.[PARAGRAPH:1]Obwohl biologische Sprengköpfe im Rahmen eines weltweiten Abkommens geächtet wurden, halten sich Gerüchte, dass eine Reihe von Nationen sie dennoch herstellen, lagern und, wenn nötig, auch sofort einsetzen können.[PARAGRAPH:1]Derartige Waffen können zwar auch gegen Truppen auf offenem Gelände eingesetzt werden, am besten sind sie allerdings für Angriffe auf Städte geeignet, um militärische Einrichtungen zu beschädigen und die Zivilbevölkerung zu dezimieren. Dies hat darüber hinaus noch weitere Nebeneffekte, die im Sinne des Angreifers liegen könnten - denn es ist durchaus wahrscheinlich, dass fliehende Bürger den biologischen Kampfstoff auch in andere Städte tragen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die freigesetzten Krankheitserreger sind relativ kurzlebig, wodurch die Gefahr der Ausbreitung in befreundeten Städten begrenzt ist, dennoch bleibt stets ein Restrisiko, dass das Virus nach seiner Freisetzung mutiert und am Ende die gesamte Menschheit gefährdet. Aus diesem Grund betrachten die Staatoberhäupter der Reiche (jedenfalls die mit gesundem Menschenverstand) biologische Sprengköpfe ausschließlich als allerletzten Ausweg.
TEXT.Italian: Mentre è dalla metà del ventesimo secolo che vengono usati missili a medio e lungo raggio, non sono mai stati in grado di trasportare efficacemente testate biologiche: al momento dell'esplosione l'agente biologico solitamente o veniva distrutto o si disperdeva troppo per risultare efficace. Con il recente sviluppo di un tipo più resistente di virus (a opera di una misteriosa associazione con base da qualche parte nel Pacifico), è ora possibile realizzare missili con testate biologiche.[PARAGRAPH:1]I Missili biologici sono banditi da un trattato a livello mondiale. Pare però che alcuni imperi ne stiano producendo, pronti a usarli in caso di necessità.[PARAGRAPH:1]Anche se possono essere utilizzate sul campo, contro gli eserciti, queste armi sono più efficaci contro bersagli cittadini, dove danneggiano sia le risorse militari che la popolazione civile. Ci sono anche degli effetti secondari, visto che i cittadini in fuga possono anche diffondere la malattia in altre città nemiche.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le malattie sono progettate per avere breve durata, diminuendo così il rischio che si diffondano in città amiche. C'è sempre però la possibilità che, una volta utilizzato, il virus muti diventando una minaccia per tutta l'umanità. Per questo i leader (quelli sani di mente, quantomeno) vedono questi missili come l'ultima risorsa.
TEXT.Spanish: Pese a que los misiles de largo alcance se venían usando desde mediados del s. XX, nunca fueron capaces de cargar ojivas biológicas: al detonar el arma, los agentes biológicos solían destruirse o dispersarse demasiado como para ser efectivos. Gracias al reciente desarrollo de virus más sólidos (a manos de un misterioso consorcio ubicado en alguna costa del Pacífico), los misiles biológicos ya son factibles.[PARAGRAPH:1]Los biomisiles están prohibidos en todo el planeta por un tratado internacional. Sin embargo, se rumorea que algunos imperios están haciendo acopio de ellos, listos para ser lanzados en caso de necesidad.[PARAGRAPH:1]Aunque puedan usarse contra ejércitos en el campo de batalla, dichas armas son más efectivas contra objetivos en las ciudades, donde pueden destruir tanto recursos militares como población civil. Esto también tiene efectos secundarios, ya que los ciudadanos que huyan propagarán la enfermedad a otras ciudades enemigas.[PARAGRAPH:1]Las enfermedades están diseñadas para durar poco, de modo que se reduce el peligro de propagación a ciudades amigas. Sin embargo, siempre queda la posibilidad de que, una vez utilizado, el virus pueda mutar y convertirse en una amenaza para toda la humanidad. Por ello los líderes (los cuerdos, al menos) contemplan dichos misiles como armas de último recurs
