TEXT.English: Bison hunting (hunting of the American bison, also commonly known as the American buffalo) was an activity fundamental to the economy and society of the Plains Indians peoples who inhabited the vast grasslands on the Interior Plains of North America, prior to the animal's near-extinction in the late nineteenth century. The species' dramatic decline was the result of habitat loss due to the expansion of ranching and farming in western North America, industrial-scale hunting practised by non-indigenous hunters, increased indigenous hunting pressure due to non-indigenous demand for bison hides and meat, and even cases of deliberate policy by settler governments to destroy the food source of the native Indian peoples during times of conflict.

Cannibalism was part of their ritual after a war. The warriors captured from other Tupi tribes were eaten as they believed they were absorbing their strength. The practice of cannibalism among the Tupi was known in Europe by Hans Staden, a German soldier and mariner who was captured by the Tupi. They carried him to their village where he claimed he was to be devoured at the next festivity. He allegedly won the friendship of a powerful chief, whom he cured of a disease, and his life was spared. Back in Europe, Staden published a book about his experience among the Brazilian Indians, which was published in 1557.

The Black Guard, were the corps of West African and Black Moroccan soldiers assembled by the Alaouite sultan of Morocco, Moulay Ismail (reigned 1672-1727). The Black Guard descended from black tribes of the south brought to Morocco from sub-Saharan Africa, who were settled with their families in a special colony, at Mechra er-Remel, to have children and to work as indentured servants. At age 10, they were trained in certain skills; the girls in domestic life or entertainments, and the boys in masonry, archery, horsemanship, and musketry. At age 15 those that were chosen entered the army. They would marry and have children and continue the cycle. Considered more loyal than Arab or Berber warriors because of their lack of tribal affiliation, Ismail's black soldiers formed the bulk of his standing army and numbered 150,000 at their peak.

The Genetic Soldiers were organized to cope with terrorist incidents specifically involving weapons of mass destruction typified in nuclear, biological and chemical warfare. Its members were strengthened through gene therapy, having either been injected with the "soldier genes", or otherwise having their nucleotide alignment rearranged to resemble Perfect DNA. Many also underwent VR training, guided by the Force XXI concept, but had little or no actual field experience.
TEXT.French: or otherwise having their nucleotide alignment rearranged to resemble Perfect DNA. Many also underwent VR training
TEXT.Russian: Генно-модифицированные солдаты предназначены для борьбы с местным и международным терроризмом, в частности с применением оружия массового уничтожения, типичного для ядерной, биологической и химической войны. Его члены были усилены с помощью генной терапии, либо им были введены «гены солдата», либо их нуклеотидное выравнивание изменилось иным образом, чтобы оно стало напоминанием совершенной ДНК. Многие также прошли обучение виртуальной реальности, руководствуясь концепцией Force XXI, но практически не имели практического опыта.

TEXT.English: A blimp, or non-rigid airship, is an airship (dirigible) without an internal structural framework or a keel. Unlike semi-rigid and rigid airships (e.g. Zeppelins), blimps rely on the pressure of the lifting gas (usually helium, rather than hydrogen) inside the envelope and the strength of the envelope itself to maintain their shape.
TEXT.French: Un dirigeable non rigide, ou blimp, est un dirigeable dépourvu de charpente interne ou de quille. Contrairement aux dirigeables semi-rigides et rigides (comme les Zeppelins), les blimps comptent sur la pression du gaz porteur (généralement de l'hélium, plutôt que de l'hydrogène) à l'intérieur de l'enveloppe et sur la résistance de l'enveloppe elle-même pour conserver leur forme.

TEXT.English: The Kainai Blackfoot were seen as particularly bloodthirsty by their neighbours the Plains Cree, who called them 'Miko-Ew', literally, 'stained with blood'. Thus the Blood Warrior, this elite unit of their braves, is attributed with almost supernatural abilities in the minds of their enemies - the ability to appear as if from nowhere and fight like possessed...
TEXT.French: Les Kainai des Pieds-Noirs étaient considérés comme particulièrement sanguinaires par leurs voisins Cris des Plaines, qui les appelaient 'Miko-Ew', littéralement « tachés de sang ». Ainsi, le Guerrier de Sang, cette unité d'élite de leurs braves, est doté aux yeux de leurs ennemis d'aptitudes presque surnaturelles – la capacité d'apparaître comme sortie de nulle part et de combattre comme possédé...
TEXT.Italian: I Kainai dei Blackfoot erano ritenuti particolarmente assetati di sangue da parte dei loro vicini Cree, che li chiamavano 'Miko-Ew', ovvero 'pieni di sangue'. Perciò i guerrieri sanguinari, unità di élite di questa tribù, erano ritenuti avere abilità quasi soprannaturali nelle menti dei loro nemici: la capacità di apparire dal nulla e di combattere come posseduti...

TEXT.English: Bolas (from Spanish bola, "ball", also known as boleadoras) is a type of throwing weapon made of weights on the ends of interconnected cords, designed to capture animals by entangling their legs. They were most famously used by the gauchos (Argentinian cowboys), but have been found in excavations of Pre-Columbian settlements, especially in Patagonia, where indigenous peoples (particularly the Tehuelche) used them to catch 200-pound guanaco (llama-like mammals) and ñand?(birds). They were also used in battle by the Mapuche and Inca army. They have also been found as a modern-day tool in North America at the Calico Early Man Site.
The Bombard Elephant is an elephant which has a primitive cannon on it's back. It is doubly terrifying to its enemies because of it's size and cannons.
TEXT.French: L'éléphant bombardier est un éléphant portant un canon primitif sur son dos. Il est doublement terrifiant pour ses ennemis en raison de sa taille et de ses canons.
TEXT.Polish: S³oñ Oblê¿niczy to poprostu wielkie dzia³o zamocowane do grzbiecie s³onia.

TEXT.English: A [BOLD]Bombard[\BOLD] is a type of medieval cannon or mortar, used chiefly in sieges for throwing heavy stone balls. The modern term bombardment derives from this. [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Bombards were usually used during sieges to hurl various forms of missile into enemy fortifications. Projectiles such as stone or metal balls, burning materials and weighted cloth soaked in quicklime or Greek fire are documented.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Eventually bombards were superseded by weapons using smaller calibre iron projectiles with more powerful gunpowder. A bulba is a common type of bombard.
TEXT.Polish: A [BOLD]Bombard[\BOLD] is a type of medieval cannon or mortar, used chiefly in sieges for throwing heavy stone balls. The modern term bombardment derives from this.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Bombards were usually used during sieges to hurl various forms of missile into enemy fortifications. Projectiles such as stone or metal balls, burning materials and weighted cloth soaked in quicklime or Greek fire are documented.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Eventually bombards were superseded by weapons using smaller calibre iron projectiles with more powerful gunpowder. A bulba is a common type of bombard.

TEXT.English: The bombing of strategic targets from the air dates back to the beginning of World War I, when the Germans used zeppelins to bomb Paris and London. Because zeppelins proved to be extremely vulnerable, they were withdrawn from war in favor of airplanes. By the end of World War I planes were being designed specifically as bombers.[PARAGRAPH:2]The bomber's job is to carry bombs into enemy territory, normally beyond the range of artillery, and destroy targets of military and economic value. Bombers were often designed for specific missions, such as attacking ships, bombing vehicles and railroads, daylight precision bombing, and carpet-bombing.
TEXT.French: Le bombardement de cibles stratégiques depuis le ciel remonte au début de la Première Guerre mondiale. Les Allemands utilisaient alors déjà des zeppelins pour bombarder Paris et Londres. Mais ceux-ci étaient extrêmement vulnérables et furent rapidement remplacés par des avions. A la fin de la Première Guerre mondiale, des avions étaient spécialement conçus pour le bombardement.[PARAGRAPH:2]Le rôle du bombardier est de transporter des bombes au-dessus du territoire ennemi, dans des zones hors de portée des tirs d'artillerie, et de détruire des cibles stratégiques militaires ou économiques. Les bombardiers étaient souvent conçus pour des missions spécifiques, comme l'attaque de bateaux, la destruction de véhicules ou de voies de chemin de fer, le bombardement de précision, ou le bombardement intensif.
TEXT.German: Erste Bombardierungsangriffe auf strategische Ziele wurden bereits zu Beginn des 1. Weltkrieges durchgeführt, als die Deutschen Zeppeline einsetzten, um Paris und London unter Beschuss zu nehmen. Da die Zeppeline selbst jedoch sehr verwundbar waren, wurden sie aus dem Kampfgeschehen genommen und von Flugzeugen abgelöst. Gegen Ende des 1. Weltkrieges wurden dann Flugzeuge als spezielle Bomber entworfen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Bomber sollen in den feindlichen Luftraum außerhalb der Reichweite der Artillerie vordringen und dort militärisch und wirtschaftlich relevante Ziele zerstören. Häufig richtete sich die Bauweise des Bombers nach dem geplanten Einsatzzweck, wie z.B. dem Angriff auf Schiffe, dem Abwurf von Bomben auf Landfahrzeuge oder Eisenbahnen, gezielten Bombenangriffen bei Tageslicht oder auch dem Auslegen eines so genannten Bombenteppichs.
TEXT.Italian: Il bombardamento aereo degli obiettivi strategici risale all'inizio della Prima Guerra Mondiale, quando i Tedeschi utilizzarono gli zeppelin per bombardare Parigi e Londra. Essendo molto vulnerabili, gli zeppelin furono ritirati dal conflitto in favore degli aeroplani. Alla fine della guerra, vennero progettati degli aerei con la funzione specifica di bombardieri.[PARAGRAPH:2]Il compito di un bombardiere è quello di sganciare bombe in territorio nemico, normalmente oltre il raggio d'azione dell'artiglieria, e di distruggere obiettivi militarmente ed economicamente rilevanti. I bombardieri venivano spesso progettati per missioni specifiche, come attaccare navi, distruggere veicoli e tratte ferroviarie, effettuare bombardamenti diurni di precisione e a tappeto.
TEXT.Spanish: El bombardeo de objetivos estratégicos desde el aire data del comienzo de la Primera Guerra Mundial, cuando los alemanes emplearon zepelines para bombardear París y Londres. Debido a su extremada vulnerabilidad, los zepelines fueron descartados y reemplazados por aviones. Hacia el final de la Primera Guerra Mundial empezaban a diseñarse aviones concebidos específicamente como bombarderos.[PARAGRAPH:2]La misión de este aparato es llevar bombas hasta territorio enemigo, normalmente más allá del radio de acción de la artillería, para destruir objetivos militares y económicos. Los bombarderos solían ser diseñados para un fin específico, como por ejemplo atacar barcos, bombardear vehículos y ferrocarriles, realizar ataques de precisión diurnos o bombardeos estratégicos.

TEXT.English: The Blue Footed Booby, is named, quite appropriately, for his huge blue feet. The males take great pride in them, and during the mating rituals, will show off their feet by doing a strut that is high stepping and designed to show the blue feet to the prospective mate. The more blue their feet are, the more the females are attracted to the male of the species.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Its Nature
TEXT.French: Le Fou à pieds bleus doit son nom, à juste titre, à ses énormes pattes bleues. Les mâles en sont très fiers, et lors des rituels d'accouplement, ils exhibent leurs pattes en faisant une démarche haute enjambe, destinée à montrer leurs pieds bleus à la partenaire potentielle. Plus les pattes sont bleues, plus les femelles sont attirées par le mâle de l'espèce.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source : Its Nature
TEXT.Polish: G³uptak niebieskonogi, gap niebieskonogi (Sula nebouxii) - gatunek du¿ego ptaka morskiego z rodziny g³uptaków (Sulidae), zamieszkuj¹cy zachodnie wybrze¿e Ameryki Œrodkowej i Po³udniowej oraz wyspy Galapagos.

TEXT.English: A Borobudur ship is the 8th-century wooden double outrigger, sailed vessel of Maritime Southeast Asia depicted in some bas reliefs of the Borobudur Buddhist monument in Central Java, Indonesia. This has been designated as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. The ships depicted on Borobudur were most likely the type of vessels used for inter-insular trades and naval campaigns by the Sailendran and Srivijayan thalassocracy empire that ruled the region around the 7th to the 13th century. The function of the outrigger was to stabilize the ship; a single or double outrigger canoe is the typical feature of the seafaring Austronesians vessels. It is considered by scholars to have been the most likely type of vessel used for their voyages and exploration across Southeast Asia, Oceania, and the Indian Ocean.
Bosneger (literally: "bushnegro") was originally a neutral anthropological term for Maroons from the Surinam hinterland; today it is considered rather derogatory.
TEXT.French: Bosneger (littéralement : « nègre de brousse ») était à l'origine un terme anthropologique neutre désignant les Marrons de l'arrière-pays du Suriname ; aujourd'hui, ce terme est considéré comme plutôt péjoratif.

TEXT.English: Boudica was a queen of the British Celtic Iceni tribe who led an uprising against the occupying forces of the Roman Empire. Boudica's husband Prasutagus ruled as a nominally independent ally of Rome and left his kingdom jointly to his daughters and the Roman emperor in his will. However, when he died his will was ignored, and the kingdom was annexed. Boudica was flogged, her daughters raped, and Roman financiers called in their loans.
TEXT.French: Boudica était une reine de la tribu celtique britannique des Icéniens qui mena une révolte contre les forces d'occupation de l'Empire romain. Le mari de Boudica, Prasutagus, régna en tant qu'allié nominalement indépendant de Rome et laissa son royaume conjointement à ses filles et à l'empereur romain dans son testament. Cependant, à sa mort, son testament fut ignoré et le royaume annexé. Boudica fut fouettée, ses filles violées, et les financiers romains réclamèrent leurs prêts.

TEXT.English: A boyar was a member of the highest rank of the feudal Bulgarian, Moscovian, Kievan Rus'ian, Wallachian, and Moldavian aristocracies, second only to the ruling princes (in Bulgaria, tsars), from the 10th century to the 17th century. The rank has lived on as a surname in Russia, Ukraine and Romania, and also in Finland, where it is spelled Pajari.
TEXT.French: Un boyard était un membre du plus haut rang des aristocraties féodales bulgare, moscovite, de la Rus' de Kiev, valaque et moldave, juste après les princes régnants (en Bulgarie, les tsars), du Xe au XVIIe siècle. Ce titre est devenu un nom de famille en Russie, en Ukraine et en Roumanie, ainsi qu'en Finlande, où il s'écrit Pajari.

TEXT.English: The Duchy of Brabant was a State of the Holy Roman Empire established in 1183. It developed from the Landgraviate of Brabant and formed the heart of the historic Low Countries, part of the Burgundian Netherlands from 1430 and of the Habsburg Netherlands from 1482, until it was partitioned after the Dutch revolt.
TEXT.French: Le duché de Brabant était un État du Saint-Empire romain établi en 1183. Il s'est développé à partir de la Landgraviate de Brabant et formait le coeur des Pays-Bas historiques, faisant partie des Pays-Bas bourguignons à partir de 1430 et des Pays-Bas habsbourgeois à partir de 1482, jusqu'à ce qu'il soit partitionné après la révolte néerlandaise.

TEXT.English: The recurrence of the name Brennus makes it possible that it was a title rather than a proper name. Some 19th-century scholars connected the name with the modern Welsh word for "king", brenin, though Brennus and brenin have since been proven to be unrelated (brenin - earlier breenhin - being derived from the Celtic *brigantinos, meaning "(someone) pre-eminent, outstanding"). As early as the 12th century AD, authors such as Geoffrey of Monmouth (in his Historia Regum Britanniae were connecting the name Brennus with the Welsh personal name Bran meaning "Crow", though the similarity of the names is superficial and they are not likely to share a common linguistic origin.

The Brigade Piron is a Belgian unique unit, an alternative to Trench Infantry. Its starting promotions are Trench I (giving a reduction in collateral damage) and City Raider I and II. Thus it is an ideal unit for storming cities in the early Modern era.
TEXT.French: La Brigade Piron est une unité unique belge, alternative à l'infanterie de tranchée. Ses promotions de départ sont Tranchée I (réduction des dégâts collatéraux) et Pillard de ville I et II. C'est donc une unité idéale pour la prise d'assaut des villes à l'époque moderne.
TEXT.Italian: La Brigata Piron è l'unità unica belga, sostituzione della fanteria da trincea. Le sue promozioni iniziali forniscono una riduzione dei danni collaterali e un bonus all'attacco contro le città, perciò è un'unità ideale per guidare una forza d'assalto contro le città all'inizio dell'era moderna.

TEXT.English: The Hopewell inherited from their Adena forebears an incipient social stratification. This increased social stability and reinforced sedentism, social stratification, specialized use of resources, and, probably, population growth. Hopewell societies cremated most of their deceased and reserved burial for only the most important people. In some sites, it appears that hunters received a higher status in the community because their graves were more elaborate and contained more status goods.
TEXT.French: Les Hopewell ont hérité de leurs ancêtres Adena une stratification sociale naissante. Cela a accru la stabilité sociale et renforcé la sédentarité, la stratification sociale, l'utilisation spécialisée des ressources et, probablement, la croissance démographique. Les sociétés Hopewell incinéraient la plupart de leurs défunts et réservaient l'inhumation aux personnes les plus importantes. Sur certains sites, il semble que les chasseurs aient reçu un statut plus élevé dans la communauté car leurs tombes étaient plus élaborées et contenaient davantage d'objets témoignant du statut.

TEXT.English: The Brute is the first warrior you get, an unarmed man that clobbers his enemies to death.
TEXT.French: Le Brut est le premier guerrier que vous obtenez, un homme non armé qui assomme ses ennemis à mort.
TEXT.German: Die waffenlose Schlägerei ist die simpelste Form des Nahkampfes. Ein Schläger weiß seine Fäuste gezielt einzusetzen und kann seinen Gegner damit schwer verletzen oder sogar zu Tode bringen. Heutzutage stehen brutale Haudraufs eher am Rand der Gesellschaft, während sie für die frühen Sippen überlebenswichtig waren.
TEXT.Italian: Il Bruto è il primo guerriero disponibile, un uomo disarmato in grado di picchiare i nemici.
TEXT.Polish: Osi³ek to pierwsza jednostka w grze. Prymitywna, s³aba i pozbawiona wszelkiego wyposa¿enia.
TEXT.Russian: Ãðîìèëà - ýòî ïåðâûé âîèí ïîëó÷åííûé âàìè, áåçîðóæíûé ÷åëîâåê, êîòîðûé îäîëåâàåò ñâîèõ âðàãîâ äî ñìåðòè.
TEXT.Spanish: El Bruto es el primer guerrero que manejarás, un hombre desarmado que aporrea a sus enemigos hasta la muerte.

TEXT.English: The rise in the use of semi-automatic and automatic firearms in the late 19th and early 20th century led to the demise of horse-mounted cavalry. As a result, attackers lost a significant advantage in both scouting and deployment. It was only with the development of tanks, armored mobile attack vehicles equipped with high caliber-guns, that a weapon was found which could once more punch a hole through enemy field forces. First appearing in World War I, armored attack vehicles move quickly and strike with power, while still possessing an effective defensive strength. Tanks are powerful weapon against any ground unit.
TEXT.French: L'utilisation croissante des armes automatiques et semi-automatiques à la fin du XIXe et au début du XXe siècle, sonna le glas de la cavalerie à cheval. De ce fait, les troupes offensives perdirent un atout important, que ce soit pour la reconnaissance ou pour l'attaque. Ce n'est qu'avec l'apparition des chars d'assaut, lors de la Première Guerre mondiale, que les armées disposèrent à nouveau d'une arme capable de percer en force les lignes ennemies. Les chars d'assaut sont des véhicules d'attaque blindés équipés de canons à gros calibre. Ils sont capables de se déplacer rapidement, disposent d'une puissance de feu importante et sont efficacement protégés par leur blindage. Les chars d'assaut sont particulièrement redoutables contre les troupes d'infanterie.
TEXT.German: Der im späten 19. und frühen 20. Jahrhundert weltweit vermehrte Einsatz halbautomatischer und automatischer Waffen besiegelte das Ende der Kavallerie und Angreifer verloren dadurch ihre bisherigen Vorzüge bei Erkundungs- und Angriffsfeldzügen. Erst mit der Entwicklung von Panzern bzw. gepanzerten mobilen Angriffsfahrzeugen, die mit hochkalibrigen Geschützen ausgestattet waren, war es wieder möglich geworden, durch die feindlichen Bodentruppen vorzustoßen. Erstmalig traten gepanzerte Angriffsfahrzeuge im 1. Weltkrieg in Aktion. Während sie sich schnell fortbewegen und mit verheerender Schlagkraft angreifen konnten, wiesen sie gleichzeitig eine wirksame Defensivstärke auf. Panzer sind eine mächtige Waffe gegen jede feindliche Bodeneinheit.
TEXT.Italian: Il maggiore uso delle armi da fuoco automatiche e semiautomatiche nel tardo XIX secolo e all'inizio del XX secolo portò alla fine della cavalleria. Di conseguenza, gli attaccanti persero un vantaggio significativo sia dal punto di vista dell'esplorazione che nello spiegamento. Fu solo con lo sviluppo dei carri armati, veicoli d'attacco corazzati dotati di cannoni di grosso calibro, che venne trovata un'arma che potesse nuovamente aprire una breccia nelle truppe nemiche. Apparsi per la prima volta nella Prima Guerra Mondiale, i veicoli d'attacco corazzato si muovevano rapidamente e attaccavano con efficacia, riuscendo nel contempo a difendersi validamente. I carri armati sono potenti armi contro qualsiasi tipo di unità di terra.
TEXT.Spanish: El triunfo de las armas de fuego automáticas y semiautomáticas, a finales del XIX y principios del XX, provocó el declive de la caballería. Como consecuencia, los atacantes perdieron una ventaja significativa en la exploración y el despliegue de tropas. Hasta la aparición de los tanques, vehículos blindados de ataque equipados con cañones de gran calibre, no volvió a verse un arma capaz de abrir una brecha en las líneas enemigas. Los vehículos ofensivos blindados, dotados de gran movilidad sin menoscabo de su capacidad defensiva, aparecieron por primera vez en la Primera Guerra Mundial. Los tanques son armas poderosas contra cualquier unidad de tierra.
TEXT.Polish: BTR-80 to wspó³czesny rosyjski transporter opancerzony. W 1976 roku rozpoczêto produkcjê transportera opancerzonego BTR-70. W nastêpnych latach sta³ siê on podstawowym pojazdem jednostek piechoty zmechanizowanej operuj¹cych w Afganistanie. BTR-70 by³ wozem lepszym ni¿ BTR-60 którego zast¹pi³, ale okaza³o siê ¿e nadal posiada pewne wady. Pojazd posiada³ skomplikowany system napêdowy sk³adaj¹cy siê z dwóch silników co zwiêksza³o prawdopodobieñstwo awarii. Krytycznie oceniano rozmieszczenie w³azów do przedzia³u desantowego i ich niewielkie rozmiary. Dodatkowo okaza³o siê ¿e maksymalny k¹t podniesienia uzbrojenia jest zbyt niski i niemo¿liwe jest zwalczanie celów po³o¿onych na stokach gór, czy dachach budynków. Nap³ywaj¹ce z Afganistanu meldunki spowodowa³y opracowanie zmodernizowanej wie¿y dla BTR-70 w której maksymalny k¹t podniesienia karabinów maszynowych zwiêkszono do 60o, oraz rozpoczêcie prac nad jego g³êboko zmodernizowana wersj¹ pozbawion¹ pozosta³ych wad. Pierwsze prototypy nowego wozu powsta³y na prze³omie lat 70. i 80. XX wieku. W nastêpnych latach trwa³o udoskonalanie pojazdu i w 1984 roku rozpoczêto produkcjê nowego transportera który otrzyma³ wojskowe oznaczenie BTR-80. BTR-80 jest napêdzany pojedynczym silnikiem wysokoprê¿nym. Uzbrojenie jest umieszczone wie¿y identycznej z zastosowan¹ w póŸnych BTR-70. BTR-80 jest pierwszym radzieckim oœmioko³owym transporterem opancerzonym który otrzyma³ du¿e boczne drzwi przedzia³u desantowego. Obecnie BTR-80 jest u¿ywany w pañstwach powsta³ych po rozpadzie ZSRR.
TEXT.Russian: Рост использования полуавтоматического и автоматического огнестрельного оружия в конце 19-го и начале 20-го века привел к упадку кавалерии. В результате атакующая сторона потеряла на тот момент значительное преимущество как в разведке, так и в развертывании. Лишь с развитием танков и бронетранспортеров, оснащенных крупнокалиберными орудиями, было найдено оружие, которое могло снова пробить брешь в полевых силах противника. Впервые появившись в Первой мировой войне, броневики движутся быстро и наносят мощный удар, сохраняя при этом эффективную защиту. Танки - наиболее эффективное оружие против любого наземного отряда.

TEXT.English: A bhikkhu is an ordained Buddhist monk. A female monastic (a nun) is called a bhikkhuni. The lives of bhikkhus and bhikkhunis are governed by a set of rules called the pratimoka or patimokkha. Their lifestyle is shaped to support their spiritual practice: to live a simple and meditative life and attain nirvana. A person under the age of 20 cannot be ordained as a bhikkhu or bhikkhuni but can be ordained as a sramanera or sramane
TEXT.French: Un bhikkhu est un moine bouddhiste ordonné. Une moniale (une nonne) est appelée bhikkhuni. La vie des bhikkhus et bhikkhunis est régie par un ensemble de règles appelées pratimoka ou patimokkha. Leur mode de vie est conçu pour soutenir leur pratique spirituelle : vivre une vie simple et méditative et atteindre le nirvana. Une personne de moins de 20 ans ne peut pas être ordonnée en tant que bhikkhu ou bhikkhuni mais peut être ordonnée en tant que sramanera ou sramane.

TEXT.English: [H1]Po-cha-na-quar-hip[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Buffalo Hump[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] ca. late 1790s to early 19th century-1870[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]which meant "erection that won't go down".[PARAGRAPH:1]He came to prominence after the Council House Fight when he led the Comanches on the Great Raid of 1840. Little is known of Buffalo Hump's early life. He became a historically important figure when, angered by the Council House fight of 1840, he led a group of Comanches, mostly his own band plus allies from various other Comanche bands, in the Great Raid of 1840. Their goal was to get revenge on the Texans who had killed thirty members of a delegation of Comanche Chiefs when these had been under a flag of truce for negotiations.
TEXT.Polish: Wojenny Wódz Komanczów z po³owy XIX w.

TEXT.English: Bulan was a Khazar king who led the conversion of the Khazars to Judaism. His name means "elk"(Moose) in Old Turkic. In modern Turkish, it means The one who finds (Bul + an). The date of his reign is unknown, as the date of the conversion is hotly disputed, though it is certain that Bulan reigned some time between the mid-8th and the mid-9th centuries. Nor is it settled whether Bulan was the Bek or the Khagan of the Khazars. D. M. Dunlop was certain that Bulan was a Khagan; however, more recent works, such as The Jews of Khazaria by Kevin Brook, assume that he was the Bek due to references to him leading military campaigns. Khazar tradition held that before his own conversion, Bulan was religiously unaffiliated. In his quest to discover which of the three Abrahamic religions would shape his own religious beliefs, he invited representatives from each to explain their fundamental tenets. In the end, he chose Judaism.

Burhanuddin Rabbani was President of the Islamic State of Afghanistan from 1992 to 1996. After the Taliban government was toppled during Operation Enduring Freedom, Rabbani returned to Kabul and served as a temporary President from November to December 20, 2001, when Hamid Karzai was chosen at the Bonn International Conference on Afghanistan. Rabbani was also the leader of Jamiat-e Islami Afghanistan (Islamic Society of Afghanistan), which has close ties to Pakistan's Jamaat-e-Islami.
TEXT.French: Burhanuddin Rabbani fut président de l'État islamique d'Afghanistan de 1992 à 1996. Après la chute du gouvernement taliban lors de l'opération Liberté durable, Rabbani retourna à Kaboul et servit comme président par intérim de novembre à décembre 2001, date à laquelle Hamid Karzai fut choisi lors de la conférence internationale de Bonn sur l'Afghanistan. Rabbani était également le chef de Jamiat-e Islami Afghanistan (Société islamique d'Afghanistan), qui entretient des liens étroits avec la Jamaat-e-Islami du Pakistan.

TEXT.English: Prior to the arrival of Europeans, the Noongar population has been variously estimated at between 6,000 and some tens of thousands. Colonisation by the British resulted in both violence and new diseases, taking a heavy toll on the population. The 2001 census figures showed that 21,000 people identified themselves as indigenous in the south-west of Western Australia. In 2004, the community claimed to number over 28,000 people. Today, most of the Noongar live in the Perth Metropolitan Region. By 2016, the Swan Valley Noongar Community estimated the number of Noongars to be 46,000.

While not a Byzantine invention, heavy cavalry reached a new level of perfection under Byzantine command. Until the sixth century AD, Byzantium had relied on Teutonic and Hunnish mercenary cavalry, but under Emperor Nicephorus II - known as "The Pale Death" - native heavy cavalry, the Cataphracts, became the cornerstone of Byzantine warfare. The heaviest cavalry of its age, the Cataphract shielded both rider and mount with thick protective armor, making them a terror on the battlefield. The effectiveness of the Byzantine heavy cavalry made the Cataphracts one of the key models for later European knights.
TEXT.French: Même si elle n'est pas originaire de Byzance, la cavalerie lourde atteint la quasi-perfection sous le commandement byzantin. Jusqu'au sixième siècle ap. J.C., Byzance s'est appuyée sur la cavalerie teutonne et hunnique, mais la cavalerie lourde de l'empereur Nicéphore II (les cataphractaires) devient la pierre angulaire de l'armée byzantine. Cavalerie la plus lourde de cette période, les cataphractaires blindent leurs cavaliers et leur monture d'une épaisse armure, ce qui en fait de redoutables ennemis sur le champ de bataille. L'efficacité de la cavalerie lourde byzantine a fait des cataphractaires un modèle à suivre pour les futurs chevaliers européens.
TEXT.German: Die schwere Kavallerie ist zwar keine byzantinische Erfindung, erreichte unter byzantinischer Führung jedoch eine neue Stufe der Vervollkommnung. Bis zum 6. Jahrhundert n. Chr. hatte sich Byzanz auf teutonische und hunnische Söldner als Kavallerie verlassen, doch unter Kaiser Nikephoros II. - bekannt als "Der Bleiche Tod" - wurde schwere Kavallerie, die Kataphraktoi, zum Grundstein der byzantinischen Heerführung. Beim Kataphrakt, der schwersten Kavallerie dieser Epoche, waren Reiter und Pferd durch einen dicken Panzer geschützt, der sie zu einem Schrecken auf dem Schlachtfeld machte. Die Effektivität der byzantinischen schweren Kavallerie machte die Kataphraktoi zu einem Schlüsselmodell für die späteren europäischen Ritter.
TEXT.Italian: Pur non essendo un'invenzione bizantina, la cavalleria pesante raggiunse un nuovo livello di perfezione sotto il comando di Bisanzio. Fino al sesto secolo dopo Cristo, Bisanzio aveva fatto affidamento su mercenari teutonici e unni a cavallo, ma sotto l'imperatore Niceforo II, conosciuto come "Pallida morte", la cavalleria pesante nazionale, la Catafratta, divenne la pietra angolare delle operazioni militari bizantine. La Catafratta fu la cavalleria più pesante della propria era, e proteggeva cavaliere e cavalcatura con una stessa armatura, rendendoli il terrore del campo di battaglia. L'efficacia della cavalleria pesante bizantina rese la Catafratta uno dei modelli chiave per i cavalieri europei.
TEXT.Spanish: A pesar de que no era una invención bizantina, la caballería pesada alcanzó un nuevo nivel de perfección en el Imperio Romano de Oriente. Hasta el siglo VI d. C., Bizancio había empleado caballería mercenaria teutónica y huna, pero, durante el reinado del emperador Nicéforo II, conocido como "La muerte pálida", la caballería pesada nativa, los catafractos, se convirtió en la piedra angular de la maquinaria militar bizantina. Los catafractos, la caballería más pesada de su época, empleaban una gruesa armadura que cubría tanto al jinete como a la montura, lo que los convertía en el terror del campo de batalla. La eficacia de la caballería pesada bizantina convirtió a los catafractos en uno de los modelos fundamentales para los caballeros europeos de épocas posteriores.

TEXT.English: The Cabanagem was a social revolt that occurred in the then-state of Grão-Para, Empire of Brazil. Among the causes for this revolt were the extreme poverty of the Paraense people and the political irrelevance to which the province was relegated after the independence of Brazil.
TEXT.French: La Cabanagem fut une révolte sociale qui eut lieu dans l'État alors appelé Grão-Pará, Empire du Brésil. Parmi les causes de cette révolte figuraient la pauvreté extrême du peuple paraense et l'irrélevance politique à laquelle la province fut reléguée après l'indépendance du Brésil.

TEXT.English: Lule appears to be distantly related to the still-spoken Vilela language, together forming a small Lule-Vilela family. Kaufman (1990) finds this relationship likely and with general agreement among the major classifiers of South American languages. Viegas Barros published additional evidence 1996-2006. Zamponi (2008) and other authors consider Lule and Vilela two linguistic isolates.
TEXT.French: Le lule semble être faiblement lié à la langue vilela encore parlée, formant ensemble une petite famille lule-vilela. Kaufman (1990) considère cette relation probable, en accord général avec les principaux spécialistes des langues sud-américaines. Viegas Barros a publié des preuves supplémentaires entre 1996 et 2006. Zamponi (2008) et d'autres auteurs considèrent Lule et Vilela comme deux isolats linguistiques.

TEXT.English: Even in the age of the rifle, desert civilizations, especially those of the Sahara, found that the camel's endurance - and its sand-adapted hooves - gave it a slight edge over the horse as a mount for desert campaigns. Of course it has its disadvantages, but if camels are all that is readily available to you, you find them a very competitive substitute.
TEXT.French: Même à l'âge du fusil, les civilisations du désert, en particulier celles du Sahara, ont constaté que l'endurance du chameau - et ses sabots adaptés au sable - lui donnait un léger avantage sur le cheval comme monture pour les campagnes dans le désert. Bien sûr, il a ses inconvénients, mais si les chameaux sont tout ce qui est à votre disposition, vous les trouvez comme un substitut très compétitif.
TEXT.Russian: Даже в эпоху винтовок цивилизации пустынь, особенно в Сахаре, обнаружили, что выносливость верблюда и его адаптированные к песку копыта давали ему небольшое преимущество над лошадью в качестве ездового животного для походов в пустыне. Конечно, у него есть и свои недостатки, но если верблюды - это все, что вам легко доступно, вы найдете их очень конкурентоспособной заменой.

TEXT.English: Even in the age of gunpowder, desert civilizations, especially those of the Sahara, found that the camel's endurance - and its sand-adapted hooves - gave it a slight edge over the horse as a mount for desert campaigns.
TEXT.French: Even in the age of gunpowder, desert civilizations, especially those du Sahara, found that the camel's endurance - and its sand-adapted hooves - gave it a slight edge over the horse as a mount for desert campaigns.
TEXT.Russian: Даже в эпоху пороха пустынные цивилизации, особенно в Сахаре, обнаружили, что выносливость верблюда и его адаптированные к песку копыта давали ему небольшое преимущество над лошадью в качестве ездового животного для походов в пустыне.

TEXT.English: Camels are even-toed ungulates within the genus Camelus. The dromedary, one-humped or Arabian camel has a single hump, and the Bactrian camel has two humps. They are native to the dry and desert areas of western Asia and East Africa, and central and east Asia, respectively.
TEXT.French: Les chameaux sont des ongulés de type Camélidés. Le dromadaire, une bosse ou le chameau arabe à une bosse simple, et le chameau de Bactriane à deux bosses. Elles sont indigènes des régions sèches et du désert de l'Asie et de l'Afrique de l'Est occidentales, et centrale et en Asie de l'Est, respectivement.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kamele[COLOR_REVERT] sind Paarhufer und unterscheiden sich in die Altweltkamele (mit einem oder zwei Höckern) und die höckerlosen Neuweltkamele. Es gibt auch mehrere Hybridformen.[NEWLINE]Alle Kamele besitzen lange Beine und einen langen Hals sowie einen kleinen Kopf. Die Neuweltkamele sind jedoch deutlich kleiner und leichter als ihre höckerigen Verwandten. Kamele sind Schwielensohler, sie bilden keine Hufschalen, sondern die breite Sohlenfläche besteht aus einem elastischen Bindegewebspolster. Im Gegensatz zu anderen Paarhufern bewegen sie sich im Passgang fort. Reiter kommen daher ins Schaukeln, was den Tieren den Beinamen "Wüstenschiff" gibt. Altweltkamele kommen ursprünglich vermutlich aus Asien, Neuweltkamele sind vor allem in den Bergregionen Südamerikas zu Hause. Kamele sind gut an extreme Lebensbedingungen angepasst und können u.a. durch die besondere Form ihrer Nieren lange ohne Wasser überleben. Altweltkamele speichern zusätzlich Fett in ihren Höckern. Die Ernährung besteht vorwiegend aus Gräsern. Kamelmännchen bilden Harems mit mehreren Weibchen und dem Nachwuchs, heranwachsende Männchen leben in Junggesellengruppen.[NEWLINE]Kamele wurden bereits im letzten Jahrtausend v.Chr. domestiziert. An ihrer Nutzung als Last- und Zugtiere sowie Woll-, Milch- und Fleischlieferanten hat sich seit damals nichts geändert. Lamas und Alpakas sind Zuchtformen aus Guanakos und möglicherweise Vikunjas. Von den Altweltkamelen gibt es nur noch wenige Trampeltiere in freier Wildbahn.
TEXT.Italian: I cammelli sono ungulati uniforme-piantati all'interno del genere Camelus. Il dromedary, one-humped o il cammello arabo ha un singolo hump ed il cammello di Bactrian ha due humps. Sono natali regioni del deserto ed asciutte dell'Asia e dell'Africa orientale occidentali ed in Asia centrale ed orientale, rispettivamente.
TEXT.Spanish: Los camellos son ungulates uniforme-tocados con la punta del pie dentro del género Camelus. El dromedario, one-humped o el camello árabe tiene una sola chepa, y el camello de Bactrian tiene dos chepas. Son nativas las áreas secas y del desierto de Asia occidental y de África del este, y central y del este a la Asia, respectivamente.

Fizjologicznie przystosowane do ¿ycia w warunkach suchego i gor¹cego klimatu, s¹ w wielu krajach wykorzystywane jako zwierzêta u¿ytkowe. TEXT.English: Sometimes warriors or soldiers of this type also fought from camel-back with spears, bows or rifles. Camels were a common element in desert warfare throughout history due in part due to the animal's high level of adaptability. They provided a mobile element better suited to work and survive in an arid and waterless environment than the horses of conventional cavalry. The smell of the camel according to folklore alarms and disorients horses, making camels an effective anti-cavalry weapon.
TEXT.French: Parfois, des guerriers ou soldats de ce type combattaient aussi à dos de chameau avec des lances, des arcs ou des fusils. Les chameaux étaient un élément courant dans la guerre désertique à travers l'histoire en raison notamment de leur grande capacité d'adaptation. Ils offraient un élément mobile mieux adapté pour travailler et survivre dans un environnement aride et sans eau que les chevaux de la cavalerie classique. Selon le folklore, l'odeur du chameau alarme et désoriente les chevaux, rendant les chameaux une arme anti-cavalerie efficace.
TEXT.Polish: Wielb³¹d (Camelus) - rodzaj du¿ych ssaków z rodziny wielb³¹dowatych. Fizjologicznie przystosowane do ¿ycia w warunkach suchego i gor¹cego klimatu, s¹ w wielu krajach wykorzystywane jako zwierzêta u¿ytkowe. Od pozosta³ych przedstawicieli rodziny ró¿ni je obecnoœæ charakterystycznego garbu lub garbów na grzbiecie, bêd¹cych miejscem odk³adania zapasów t³uszczu. Wielb³¹d potrafi w nim zgromadziæ nawet do 45 kg t³uszczu, co ma zwi¹zek z drug¹ charakterystyczn¹ cech¹ wielb³¹dów - ich odpornoœci¹ na d³ugotrwa³y brak wody.

TEXT.English: Even in the late Industrial era, to the extent that mounted warfare was persisted with, it was believed that the camel's endurance - and its sand-adapted hooves - gave it a slight edge over the horse as a mount for desert campaigns.
TEXT.French: Même à la fin de l'ère industrielle, dans la mesure où la guerre à cheval persistait, on a gardé l'idée que l'endurance du chameau - et ses sabots adaptés au sable - lui donnait un léger avantage sur le cheval comme monture pour les campagnes dans le désert.
TEXT.Russian: Даже в позднюю промышленную эпоху, когда была еще в деле конница, считалось, что выносливость верблюда и его адаптированные к пескам копыта давали ему небольшое преимущество над лошадью в качестве ездового животного для походов в пустыне.

TEXT.English: The Tairona people formed one of the two principal linguistic groups of the Chibcha family, the other being the Muisca. Genetic and archaeological evidence shows a relatively dense occupation of the region by at least 200 BCE. Pollen data compiled by Luisa Fernanda Herrera in the 1980 shows considerable deforestation and the use of cultigens such as yuca and maiz since possibly 1200 BCE. However, occupation of the Colombian Caribbean coast by sedentary or semi-sedentary populations have been documented to have occurred by c. 4000 BCE. Ethnohistorical data shows that initial contact with the Spanish was tolerated by the Tairona but by the 1600 CE confrontations built and a small part of the Tairona population moved to the higher stretches of the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta. This movement allowed them to evade the worst of the Spanish colonial system during the 17th and 18th centuries. The indigenous Kogui, Wiwa, Arhuacos (Ijka, Ifca) and Cancuamo people who live in the area today are believed to be direct descendants of the Tairona.

The bow and arrow appears around the transition from the Upper Paleolithic to the Mesolithic. At the site of Nataruk in Turkana, Kenya, obsidian bladelets found embedded in a skull and within the thoracic cavity of another skeleton, suggest the use of stone-tipped arrows as weapons. After the end of the last glacial period, use of the bow seems to have spread to every inhabited continent, including the New World, except for Australia.
TEXT.French: L'arc et la flèche apparaissent autour de la transition du Paléolithique supérieur au Mésolithique. Sur le site de Nataruk à Turkana, au Kenya, de petites lames d'obsidienne trouvées fichées dans un crâne et dans la cavité thoracique d'un autre squelette suggèrent l'utilisation de flèches à pointe de pierre comme armes. Après la fin de la dernière période glaciaire, l'utilisation de l'arc semble s'être répandue sur tous les continents habités, y compris le Nouveau Monde, à l'exception de l'Australie.

TEXT.English: Canis Superior, commonly referred to as a "K-9 dog" (which is a homophone of canine), is a dog that is trained specifically to assist police and other law-enforcement personnel in their work.
TEXT.French: is a dog that is trained specifically to assist police and other law-enforcement personnel in their work.
TEXT.Polish: Pies Tropi¹cy jest specjalnie tresowany towarzyszenia policjantom w pracy.
TEXT.Russian: Canis Superior, которую обычно называют «собакой К-9» (которая является гомофоном собаки), является специально обученным псом для оказания помощи полиции и другим сотрудникам правоохранительных органов в их работе.

TEXT.English: Closely following the invention of gunpowder, the development of the cannon caused a revolution in siege warfare. Invented by a German monk in the 14th century, early cannons used gunpowder charges to fire rocks or metal balls. The cannon forced a redesign of most fortifications because the straight, high walls surrounding most cities could be easily destroyed by direct fire. This was the fate of the walls of Constantinople, which had held against countless sieges for over a thousand years. The cannon quickly assumed an important role on the battlefield.
TEXT.French: L'invention du canon, peu après celle de la poudre, fut une véritable révolution dans la guerre de siège. Inventés au XIVe siècle par un moine allemand, les premiers canons utilisaient des charges de poudre pour propulser des rochers ou des boules de métal. L'apparition des canons entraîna une modification de la conception des fortifications. En effet, les traditionnels murs droits qui entouraient la plupart des villes pouvaient être facilement détruits par des tirs directs. Ce fut le cas des murs de Constantinople, qui avaient pourtant résisté à de nombreux sièges au cours des siècles. Le canon prit rapidement une place importante dans la pratique de la guerre.
TEXT.German: Kurz nach der Erfindung des Schießpulvers revolutionierte die Entwicklung der Kanone den Belagerungskrieg: Die im 14. Jahrhundert von einem deutschen Mönch entwickelte Kanone wurde mit Schießpulver gezündet und feuerte Steine oder Metallkugeln ab. Diese neue Art der Kriegsführung machte die Umgestaltung der meisten städtischen Festungsanlagen erforderlich, deren bis dahin geraden hohen Mauern durch den direkten Beschuss leicht zerstört werden konnten. Ein Paradebeispiel dafür sind die Stadtmauern von Konstantinopel, die mehr als tausend Jahre lang zahllosen Belagerungsangriffen standhielten. Die Kanone übernahm auf dem Schlachtfeld schnell eine wichtige Rolle.
TEXT.Italian: La progettazione del cannone, che seguì all'invenzione della polvere da sparo, provocò una rivoluzione nelle tattiche d'assedio. Inventati da un monaco tedesco del XIV secolo, i primi cannoni usavano cariche di polvere da sparo per scagliare pietre o palle di metallo. I cannoni obbligarono a riprogettare molte fortificazioni, perché la maggior parte delle cinte murarie che circondavano le città potevano venire facilmente distrutte dai colpi diretti. Questo capitò alle mura di Costantinopoli, che per un migliaio di anni avevano resistito a infiniti assedi. Il cannone assunse presto un ruolo dominante sui campi di battaglia.
TEXT.Spanish: La invención de los cañones, poco después de la de la pólvora, supuso una revolución en el arte del asedio. Los cañones primitivos, inventados por un monje alemán en el siglo XIV, utilizaban pólvora para lanzar piedras o bolas de metal. El cañón obligó a rediseñar la mayoría de las fortificaciones, ya que las murallas rectas y de gran altura que protegían la mayoría de las ciudades podían destruirse fácilmente con fuego directo. Ésta fue la suerte sufrida por las murallas de Constantinopla, que durante casi mil años habían rechazado incontables asedios. El cañón no tardó en asumir un papel destacado en el campo de batalla.

TEXT.English: Early canoes were wooden,often simply hollowed-out tree trunks. Early canoes have always incorporated the natural materials available to the local people.
TEXT.French: Les premières pirogues étaient en bois, souvent de simples troncs d'arbre évidés. Les premières pirogues ont toujours incorporé les matériaux naturels disponibles pour les populations locales.
TEXT.Italian: Le prime canoe erano in legno, spesso semplici tronchi scavati. Le prime canoe hanno sempre utilizzato i materiali naturali disponibili alle persone locali.
