TEXT.English: In Christian churches, a Priest is someone who is authorized by a church or religious organization to perform functions such as teaching of beliefs; leading services such as weddings, baptisms or funerals; or otherwise providing spiritual guidance to the community.
TEXT.French: Dans les églises chrétiennes, un prêtre est quelqu'un qui est autorisé par une église ou une organisation religieuse à exercer des fonctions telles que l'enseignement des croyances ; la direction de services tels que les mariages, les baptêmes ou les funérailles ; ou autrement fournir une guidance spirituelle à la communauté.

TEXT.English: Chrocus or Crocus (fl. 260-306 AD) was a leader of the Alamanni in the late 3rd to early 4th centuries. In 260, he led an uprising of the Alamanni against the Roman Empire, traversing the Upper Germanic Limes and advancing as far as Clermont-Ferrand, and possibly as far as Ravenna, and he was possibly present at the Alamannic conquest of the Frankish town of Mende. According to Gregory of Tours' History of the Franks, Chrocus was a famous king of his time and was responsible for a great deal of destruction throughout Gaul, most notably of all ancient temples located in Gaul, though this may have been exaggerated. One of the temples he allegedly tore down was called the Vasso Galat? a marvelous structure that once stood in Clermont.

Years of secret experimentation with "discarded" IVF foetuses has led us to this. We can now reliably enhance the genetic makeup of a pre-born human... so as to better suit our purposes. Forget cloning (because we can't do that yet...) - we will enhance each human killing machine individually for you.
TEXT.French: Des années d'expérimentation secrète avec des foetus FIV "jetés" nous ont menés à ceci. Nous pouvons maintenant améliorer de façon fiable le patrimoine génétique d'un humain avant sa naissance... afin de mieux répondre à nos besoins. Oubliez le clonage (parce que nous ne pouvons pas encore le faire...) - nous améliorerons chaque machine à tuer humaine individuellement pour vous.
TEXT.Russian: К этому нас привели годы тайных экспериментов с «выброшенными» плодами ЭКО. Теперь мы можем надежно улучшить генетический состав еще не рожденного человека... дабы тот лучше соответствовал нашим целям. Забудьте о клонировании (потому что мы пока не можем этого сделать...) - мы улучшим каждую машину для убийства людей индивидуально для вас.

TEXT.English: Chulalongkorn, posthumously known as Rama V, was the king of Siam who avoided colonial domination and embarked upon far-reaching reforms. Chulalongkorn was the ninth son of King Mongkut, but since he was the first to be born to a royal queen, he was recognized as heir to the throne. He was only 15 years old when his father died in October 1868, and he succeeded to the throne under the regency of Somdet Chao Phraya Si Suriyawong (q.v.). Over the next five years he was prepared to assume his duties by observing court business and by travels to British Malaya and the Dutch East Indies in 1871 and to Malaya, Burma (Myanmar), and India in 187172. Following his coronation in November 1873, the young king enacted a series of ambitious reforms, beginning with the abolition of slavery, the improvement of judicial and financial institutions, and the institution of appointed legislative councils. His commitment to reforms patterned on Western models, which he considered vital to Siam's survival, antagonized conservative factions at court and precipitated a political crisis early in 1875. Rebuffed by the older generation, the king instituted no further reforms for the next decade, but he slowly built up a corps of able, trusted administrators with whom he began from the mid-1880s to overhaul Siam's antiquated administration. These steps culminated in 1892 with the creation of 12 ministries functionally organized on Western lines, responsible for such functions as provincial administration, defense, foreign affairs, justice, education, and public works. He thereby drastically curbed arbitrary administration, ended the autonomy of outlying provinces, instituted the rule of impersonal law, and laid the foundations of modern Thai citizenship through compulsory primary education and universal military conscription. Internal reforms were undertaken both because the liberal king believed them to be right and because he recognized that he had to show the colonial powers that Siam was civilized in order to avoid the fate of neighbouring countries that fell under colonial rule. Even so, old Siam did not survive intact. The French provoked war with Siam in 1892, and by treaties with France up to 1907 Siam had to give up its rights in Laos and western Cambodia. In 1909 Siam ceded to Great Britain the four Malay states of Kelantan, Trengganu, Kedah, and Perlis, and this brought some moderation of the system of extraterritorialitywhich ended only two decades later. In relations with the West, Chulalongkorn even-handedly balanced the colonial powers against one another and consistently sought to have Siam treated as an equal among nations. During tours of Europe in 1897 and 1907, he was received as an equal by Western monarchs. When Chulalongkorn died in 1910, following the longest reign in Thai history, he bequeathed to his son Vajiravudh a modern, independent kingdom.
TEXT.Polish: Chulalongkorn (Rama V), o imieniu królewskim Phra Chula Chomklao Chaoyuhua (ur. 20 wrzeœnia 1853, zm. 23 paŸdziernika 1910) - król Tajlandii z dynastii Chakri panuj¹cy w latach 1868 - 1910. Król Chulalongkorn jest uwa¿any za jednego z najwiêkszych królów Tajlandii. Wprowadzi³ on wiele reform maj¹cych na celu unowoczeœnienie kraju. Zniós³ poddañstwo ch³opów oraz zast¹pi³ prace przymusowe na rzecz pañstwa opodatkowaniem. Dziêki wprowadzanym zmianom pañstwo cieszy³o siê rozkwitem gospodarczym. W uznaniu dla jego zas³ug, po œmierci zaczêto go nazywaæ Ukochanym Wielkim Królem (Somdej Phra Piyamaharaj).

TEXT.English: The Qulla have lived in their region for centuries, before the arrival of the Inca Empire in the 15th century. Sillustani is a prehistoric Qulla cemetery in Peru, with elaborate stone chullpas. Several groups made up the Qulla people, including the Zenta, and Gispira. The Qulla came into contact with Spaniards in 1540. They resisted Spanish invasion for 110 years but ultimately lost the Santiago Estate to the Spanish. One particularly famous rebel leader was Ñusta Willaq, a female warrior who fought the Spanish in 1780. With Argentinian independence in 1810, the situation of the Qulla people did not improve and they worked for minimal wages.

During the Han dynasty, a group of nomads to the southwest of Dunhuang were known as the Chuo Qiang. They were described in the Book of Han as a people who moved with their livestock in search of water and pasture, made military weapons themselves using iron from the mountains, and possessed bows, lances, short knives, swords and armour. In the Weilüe, other Qiang tribes named were the "Brown Onion", "White Horse", and "Yellow Ox" Qiang. The various tribes of the Qiangs formed a confederation against the Han but were defeated.

According to oral tradition in the area of the Great Lakes of Africa, the Empire of Kitara (also known as Bachwezi, Bacwezi, or Chwezi empire) was ruled into the 16th century by a dynasty known as the Bachwezi (or Chwezi), successors of the Batembuzi Dynasty. The sphere of influence of this empire would have included what corresponds to modern Uganda, northern Tanzania, eastern Congo (DRC), Rwanda and Burundi. There is no evidence of the historicity of such an empire, and scholarly opinion is sceptical, but the tradition has been important in the political history of the East African Community, especially in the Buganda kingdom of the 19th century, whose kings sought legitimacy by declaring themselves the heirs of the Kitara empire.

The name Cibola first entered recorded history in 1539, when Spaniards in southern New Spain (present day Mexico and Central America) heard rumors that there was a province by this name with "Seven Cities of Gold", located across the desert hundreds of leagues to the north. These rumors were largely caused by reports given by the four shipwrecked survivors of the failed Narvaez expedition, including alvar Núñez Cabeza de Vaca and an African slave named Esteban Dorantes, or Estevanico. Upon finally returning to New Spain, the adventurers said they had heard stories from Natives about cities with great and limitless riches.

The Marshal, city guard, city watch, town guard or town watch was a law enforcement formation found in some countries and historical periods, usually subordinate to the local municipal government. Historically many cities had their own guard formations, which doubled as police and military force in times of need.
TEXT.French: La garde de la ville, la surveillance de la ville, la garde de la ville ou la surveillance de la ville était une formation policière trouvée dans certains pays et périodes historiques, généralement subordonnée au gouvernement municipal local. Historiquement, de nombreuses villes avaient leurs propres formations de garde, qui faisaient également office de police et de force militaire en cas de besoin.
TEXT.Italian: Le guardie erano formazioni di rinforzo alla legge in alcuni paesi e periodi storici, solitamente subordinate al governo municipale locale. Storicamente molte città avevano le loro guardie, che avevano funzioni sia di polizia sia di esercito.

TEXT.English: Beginning in the late 1840s American shipbuilders started to build a new kind of merchant vessel - the Clipper ship. Several qualities set the clipper ship apart from others sailing ships. A clipper was technically a sailing ship with three masts on which sat a large expanse of square sails. It was designed to carry a small, highly profitable cargo over long distances at high speeds. The clipper's masts, which could reach as high as a twenty-story building, carried more sails and more kinds of sails than any other ship that had been built by that time. This cloud of sails controlled by a complicated web of rigging rose above a sharp bow and a sleek narrow hull. The long lines of the ship combined with the enormous driving power of the sails allowed the ships to "clip" along at speeds that earlier generations of sailors never dreamed of, and later generations never matched. Sailing 150 miles (ca. 241 km) a day was considered a good day's run only a few years earlier, clippers traveled approximately 250 miles (ca. 402 km) a day. The best of the clippers could cover more than 400 miles (ca. 644 km) a day. Speed was important to clipper captains because speed meant a big profits for the owners and captains. The clipper Merchant Ship is the fastest sailing ship in the game.
TEXT.Polish: Kliper Handlowy to statek handlowy epoki przed przemys³owej, który mo¿e przeprowadzaæ morskie misje handlowe.

Kliper - smuk³y, bardzo szybki ¿aglowiec z o¿aglowaniem typu fregata, nosz¹cy na ka¿dym z trzech lub czterech wysokich masztów nawet do siedmiu ¿agli rejowych oraz dodatkowe ¿agle boczne, tzw. lizele, rozpinane na przed³u¿aj¹cych reje wytykach, nie licz¹c sztaksli przednich i miêdzymasztowych. TEXT.English: While animal cloning has been around for decades, for many years all attempts to clone humans were unsuccessful. Technological advances eventually allowed scientists to "grow" human clones; however, while physically identical to "natural" humans, these unfortunate creatures seem incapable of developing any higher mental functions. The clones' organs and limbs could be harvested for replacement parts, but the clones themselves were totally useless. Until recently, that is.[PARAGRAPH:1]Recent advancements in medicine and bioengineering have allowed clones to be "jacked" into fairly sophisticated computer networks able to direct them to perform simple tasks. Clone laborers are now deployed worldwide, building roads, digging trenches, plowing fields, and so forth. While the initial outlay for the zombie-like workers is high, it's not actually much higher than the cost of feeding, clothing and educating a human worker for some eighteen years before you can put him to work. And when a clone worker wears out, you don't have to provide for its retirement: instead you can sell the creature to an organ bank for "decommissioning."
TEXT.French: Après la mise au point du clonage d'animaux, il y a des dizaines d'années, toutes les tentatives de clonage humain se sont soldées par des échecs. Il aura fallu attendre une véritable révolution technologique pour voir des scientifiques parvenir à "faire pousser" des clones humains en laboratoires. Mais si ce clone humain était physiquement identique à son modèle, il était en revanche dépourvu de toute faculté mentale. Le clonage fut donc utilisé exclusivement dans le but de fournir des organes de substitution à la médecine. Mais là encore, les choses ont changé.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les récents progrès de la médecine et de la bio-ingénierie ont abouti à la création de systèmes très complexes permettant de programmer les clones pour des tâches rudimentaires. Ces nouveaux ouvriers sont depuis utilisés pour construire des routes, creuser des tranchées, labourer des champs, etc. L'investissement de départ est élevé mais le coût d'un clone est vite amorti, compte tenu des frais de nourriture, d'habillement et de formation d'un ouvrier humain pendant les dix-huit ans qui précèdent sa "mise en service". En outre, lorsqu'un clone ouvrier ne peut plus travailler, il ne nécessite pas de prise en charge: il suffit de le revendre à une banque d'organes pour officialiser son déclassement.
TEXT.German: Während Tiere schon seit Jahrzehnten geklont werden, schlugen sämtliche Versuche, Menschen zu klonen, jahrelang fehl. Dank technologischer Fortschritte war die Wissenschaft schließlich aber doch noch in der Lage, menschliche Klone zu "züchten". Diese bedauernswerten Kreaturen sind zwar physisch mit "natürlichen" Menschen identisch, schienen aber keine höheren geistigen Fähigkeiten entwickeln zu können. Dementsprechend konnte man die Organe und Gliedmaßen der Klone sozusagen als "Ersatzteile" verwenden, ansonsten waren sie allerdings völlig nutzlos - bis vor kurzem.[PARAGRAPH:1]Jüngste Fortschritte auf den Gebieten der Medizin und der Biotechnologie ermöglichen heute das "Einklinken" von Klonen in ein relativ ausgefeiltes Computernetzwerk, wodurch sie einfache Aufgaben ausführen können. Mittlerweile werden solche Klonarbeiter weltweit für den Straßenbau, das Ausheben von Schützengräben, die Feldarbeit etc. eingesetzt. Die Anschaffungskosten für diese Golem-artigen Arbeiter mögen zunächst recht hoch erscheinen, andererseits übersteigen sie aber kaum die Kosten für die Verpflegung, Kleidung und Ausbildung eines Menschen bis zum 18. Lebensjahr, wenn er mit der Arbeit beginnt. Und wenn ein Klonarbeiter verschlissen ist, braucht man sich außerdem auch nicht um seinen Ruhestand zu sorgen - sondern verkauft ihn einfach zwecks "Stilllegung" an eine Organbank.
TEXT.Italian: Anche se la clonazione animale esiste da decenni, per molti anni è fallito ogni tentativo di clonare gli esseri umani. I progressi tecnologici hanno infine permesso agli scienziati di "crescere" cloni umani. Pur essendo fisicamente identici agli umani "naturali", però, queste sfortunate creature sembravano incapaci di sviluppare funzioni cerebrali superiori. Era possibile raccoglierne organi e parti per i trapianti, ma i cloni in sé rimanevano completamente inutili. Fino a poco fa, comunque.[PARAGRAPH:1]I recenti progressi nella medicina e nella bioingegneria hanno fatto in modo che i cloni potessero essere "collegati" a reti di computer abbastanza sofisticati da poterli controllare nell'esecuzione di semplici compiti. I lavoratori cloni ora sono utilizzati in tutto il mondo nella costruzione di strade, nello scavo di fossati, nel lavoro dei campi e così via. Anche se il costo iniziale di un lavoratore zombi è alto, non lo è molto di più di quello complessivo per cibare, vestire ed educare un umano per diciotto anni prima di metterlo al lavoro. E quando un clone si logora non c'è bisogno di preoccuparsi della sua pensione: lo si vende a una banca di organi.
TEXT.Spanish: Aunque se habían clonado animales durante décadas, todos los intentos de clonar humanos fracasaron durante muchos años. Los avances tecnológicos permitieron finalmente a los científicos "criar" clones humanos. Sin embargo, aunque eran físicamente idénticos a los humanos "naturales", estas desafortunadas criaturas parecían incapaces de desarrollar cualquier función mental. Se podían "recolectar" sus órganos y miembros para transplantes, pero los clones por sí mismos eran completamente inútiles. Es decir, hasta hace poco.[PARAGRAPH:1]Los últimos avances en medicina y bioingeniería han permitido que los clones se "enchufen" a redes de ordenadores bastante sofisticadas, capaces de ordenarles la realización de tareas simples. Los obreros clonados se han desplegado por todo el mundo, construyendo carreteras, cavando zanjas, arando campos, etcétera. Aunque el desembolso inicial para los obreros cuasi zombis es alto, de hecho no representa mucho más que el coste de alimentar, vestir y educar a un obrero humano durante unos dieciocho años antes de poder ponerlo a trabajar. Y cuando un obrero clonado se agota, uno no debe preocuparse por su jubilación: en lugar de ello, puede vender a la criatura a un banco de órganos para que lo "desguace"
TEXT.Polish: Piechota Klonów to podstawowa piechota ery masowego klonowania.

TEXT.English: Now that cloning is a mainstream technology, it was only a matter of time before the mad scientists of the 'defence' sector got their hands on it. At first activists were up in arms about people bred in labs purely as killing machines. However, the clones themselves pointed out that they are not automatons, even going so far as to claim that the military was their chosen profession. Of course, not everyone was convinced, but - what can you do?
TEXT.French: Maintenant que le clonage est une technologie courante, ce n'était qu'une question de temps avant que les scientifiques fous du secteur de la 'défense' ne mettent la main dessus. Au début, les activistes étaient indignés par les personnes élevées en laboratoire uniquement comme machines à tuer. Cependant, les clones eux-mêmes ont souligné qu'ils ne sont pas des automates, allant même jusqu'à affirmer que l'armée était leur profession choisie. Bien sûr, tout le monde n'était pas convaincu, mais - que pouvez-vous faire ?
TEXT.Russian: Теперь, когда клонирование стало основной технологией, это было лишь вопросом времени, когда сумасшедшие ученые из «оборонного» сектора овладели ею. Поначалу активисты негодовали по поводу людей, выращенных в лабораториях в качестве машин для убийства. Однако сами клоны указали, что они не автоматы, даже заявив, что они выбрали профессию военного. Конечно, не всех убедили, но - что поделаешь?

TEXT.English: A cog is a type of ship that first appeared in the 10th century, and was widely used from around the 12th century on. Cogs were generally built of oak, which was an abundant timber in the Baltic region of Prussia. This vessel was fitted with a single mast and a square-rigged single sail. Even though this type of rigging prohibited sailing into the wind, it could be handled by a smaller crew, which reduced operational costs. These vessels were mostly associated with seagoing trade in medieval Europe, particularly in the Baltic Sea region.

TEXT.English: Cogs are ships that first appeared in the 10th century, and were widely used from around the 12th century on. Cogs were generally built of oak, which was an abundant Baltic timber. This vessel was fitted with a single mast and a square-rigged single sail. Even though this type of rigging prohibited sailing into the wind, it could be handled by a smaller crew, which reduced operational costs. These vessels were mostly associated with seagoing trade in medieval Europe, particularly in the Baltic Sea region.

TEXT.English: The Far East held similar ideas to the West of what a gentleman is, which are based on Confucian principles. The term Junzi is a term crucial to classical Confucianism. Literally meaning "son of a ruler", "prince" or "noble", the ideal of a "gentleman", "proper man", "exemplary person", or "perfect man" is that for which Confucianism exhorts all people to strive. In modern times, the masculine bias in Confucianism may have weakened, but the same term is still used; the masculine translation in English is also traditional and still frequently used. A hereditary elitism was bound up with the concept, and gentlemen were expected to act as moral guides to the rest of society.

Constantine XI (1405-1453) was the last Byzantine emperor. A gallant prince, he completed the conquest of the Peloponnesus from the Latins and heroically commanded the futile defense of Constantinople against the Turks. The fourth son of Emperor Manuel II Palaeologus (reigned 1391-1425), Constantine was born on Feb. 8, 1405. Following the Palaeologan custom of apportioning territorial responsibilities to each member of the reigning family, as a young man Constantine was assigned authority in the Black Sea coastal towns. His eldest brother, who had always favored him, became Emperor John VIII in 1425. In 1427 Manuel's second son, Despot Theodore II of the Morea, announced his decision to resign his power in this important Peloponnesian territory. The Emperor designated Constantine to take Theodore's place. When Constantine arrived, however, Theodore had changed his mind. It was then agreed that Constantine should renew Byzantine efforts to conquer the areas of the Peloponnesus still in Latin hands, thus making an enclave for himself. He attacked Glarentza and finally won the city in 1428 by marrying the ruler's niece. By 1430 Constantine had conquered Patras and thus controlled the northern Peloponnesus. Two years later his younger brother Thomas annexed the last segments of Achaea, thereby placing all the Peloponnesus in Byzantine hands for the first time since the Fourth Crusade (1204). While John VIII attended the Council of Ferrara-Florence from 1437 to 1440, Constantine served as regent in Constantinople. During the following years he presided over what was to be the final flowering of Byzantine unity and prosperity in the Peloponnesus. At John VIII's death at the end of 1448, Constantine succeeded to the imperial throne. He proceeded cautiously regarding the hated agreements for Church union with the Latins, which John had accepted at Florence in hopes of winning Latin aid but which he had never implemented. Finally, under pressure from Rome, Constantine allowed the union to be proclaimed in Hagia Sophia on Dec. 12, 1452. This act greatly antagonized the bulk of his subjects, while it actually won him little effective help from the Latin West. With only token help from outside, Constantine had to face the empire's last agony, as the Turkish sultan Mohammed II launched his great siege against Constantinople in early April 1453. Before the beginning of the siege, Mehmed II made an offer to Constantine XI. In exchange for the surrender of Constantinople, the emperor's life would be spared, and he would continue to rule in Mistra. Constantine refused this offer. Instead, he led the defence of the city and took an active part in the fighting along the land walls. At the same time, he used his diplomatic skills to maintain the necessary unity between the Genovese, Venetian, and Greek troops. As the city fell on May 29, 1453, Constantine is said to have remarked: "The city is fallen but I am alive". Realising that the end had come, he reportedly discarded his purple cloak and led his remaining soldiers into a last charge where he was killed. It is claimed by some that his corpse was identified after the battle by his purple boots, while others claim that the Turks were never able to identify his body, and that the last Roman Emperor was very likely buried in a mass grave alongside his soldiers. A legend tells that when the Ottomans entered the city, an angel rescued the emperor, turned him into marble and placed him in a cave under the earth near the Golden Gate, where he waits to be brought to life again. Today the Emperor is considered a national hero in Greece. Some Eastern Orthodox and Greek-Catholics consider Constantine XI a saint, though he was never officially made so, for fear that it would cause Ottoman leaders to feel hostile towards the Greeks.
TEXT.Polish: Konstantyn XI Dragazes (ur. 8 lutego 1404, zm. 29 maja 1453) - cesarz bizantyjski z dynastii Paleologów, ostatni w³adca Bizancjum, panuj¹cy od 1449 roku a¿ do œmierci. Cesarz w 1452 roku podpisa³ akt o zjednoczeniu obu Koœcio³ów, jednak unia zosta³a powszechnie odrzucona zarówno przez prawos³awne duchowieñstwo, jak i przez lud. Przed rozpoczêciem ostatecznego szturmu na Konstantynopol su³tan Mehmed II zaproponowa³ Konstantynowi, by ten podda³ mu stolicê i osiad³ w Mistrze jako despotes Morei, gdzie móg³by panowaæ, jednak on odrzuci³ tê propozycjê. Zdecydowa³ siê na walkê w obronie cesarstwa. Konstantynopol zosta³ zdobyty 29 maja 1453 roku, a Konstantyn zgin¹³ w boju.

TEXT.English: The Copena culture was a Hopewellian culture in northern Alabama, Mississippi and Tennessee as well as in other sections of the surrounding region including Kentucky. The Copena name is derived from the first three letter of copper and the last three letters of the mineral galena. Copper and galena artifacts are often associated with Copena burials.
TEXT.French: La culture Copena était une culture hopewellienne dans le nord de l'Alabama, du Mississippi et du Tennessee ainsi que dans d'autres sections de la région environnante, y compris le Kentucky. Le nom Copena est dérivé des trois premières lettres de cuivre (copper) et des trois dernières lettres du minéral galène. Les artefacts en cuivre et en galène sont souvent associés aux sépultures Copena.

TEXT.English: According to some scholars, they are depicted on the Arch of Constantine, as the soldiers who are shown wearing horned helmets. On the relief representing the Battle of Verona (312) they are in the first lines, and they are depicted fighting with the bowmen in the relief of the Battle of the Milvian Bridge.
TEXT.French: Selon certains chercheurs, ils sont représentés sur l'Arc de Constantin, comme les soldats qui sont montrés portant des casques à cornes. Sur le relief représentant la bataille de Vérone (312), ils sont en première ligne, et ils sont représentés combattant avec les archers dans le relief de la bataille du pont Milvius.

TEXT.English: Jäger is a German military term adopted in 1631 by the landgrave of Hesse when he first formed an elite infantry unit out of his professional hunters (Jäger) and rangers (Forstleute) in the Hessian Army. During the Age of Enlightenment in German-speaking states (and others influenced by them) Jäger was used to describe elite light infantry, especially skirmishers, scouts, sharpshooters and couriers. Jäger, which means "hunter" or "huntsman" in German, came by extension to denote light infantrymen whose forester background made them suitable for skirmishing as individuals rather than as a drilled and regimented body of soldiers. Often they came from families with a tradition of service to one feudal lord. Initially Jägers made use of their own precision-made rifles: a more accurate weapon with a longer range than the muskets used by line troops.

The Toltecs sacked and burned everything and everyone.[PARAGRAPH:1]This cult and others, as well as the Toltec military orders of the [BOLD]Coyote[\BOLD], the Jaguar, and the Eagle, were introduced into important Mayan cities to the south in Yucatán, such as Chichén Itzá and Mayapán, indicating the broad influence of the Toltecs.
TEXT.French: Les Toltèques ont pillé et brûlé tout et tout le monde.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ce culte et d'autres, ainsi que les ordres militaires toltèques du [BOLD]Coyote[\BOLD], du Jaguar et de l'Aigle, ont été introduits dans d'importantes villes mayas au sud du Yucatán, comme Chichén Itzá et Mayapán, indiquant la large influence des Toltèques.
TEXT.Polish: Toltekowie - nazwa nadawana przez naukowców ma³o znanej prekolumbijskiej kulturze ze œrodkowego Meksyku, wi¹zanej zwykle z miastem Tula z X w., albo - zw³aszcza w ostatnich dekadach - mitycznym po czêœci przodkom Azteków i Majów z ca³ego szeregu rozwiniêtych cywilizacyjnie spo³ecznoœci ich poprzedników. Niezale¿nie od powy¿szych teorii, pod koniec XX w. niektóre œrodowiska z krêgów New Age, za przyk³adem pisarza Carlosa Castanedy, Toltekami zaczê³y te¿ nazywaæ osoby, które osi¹gnê³y "wysoki poziom œwiadomoœci".

TEXT.English: The Cree were hunters, trappers, and nomads who traveled throughout the northern parts of North America. Plains Cree traveled south to follow the buffalo herds of the Great Plains. Forest Cree stayed in their lands hunting caribou, elk, and deer. They adopted horses, though not to the extent that the Comanche did, and used canoes, snowshoes, and dogs to travel the sometimes harsh environment of their homelands. The Cree were formed into loose warrior societies, much less formal than many other native groups. When the Cree fought, they used bows, clubs, axes, and rifles.
TEXT.Spanish: El Rastreador cree.

TEXT.English: Cristina Calderón is the last living full-blooded Yaghan person. By 2004, Calderón (often referred to as simply Abuela, spanish for Grandmother) and her sister-in-law Emelinda Acuña were the only two remaining native speakers of the Yaghan language. After Acuña died at 84 years of age (October 12, 2005), Calderón became the last living full-blooded Yaghan person. With her granddaughter Cristina Zarraga and her sister Ursula Calderon she published a book of Yaghan stories called Hai Kur Mamashu Shis [I Want to Tell You a Story] in 2005.

A crocodile is any species belonging to the family Crocodylidae (sometimes classified instead as the subfamily Crocodylinae). The term can also be used more loosely to include all extant members of the order Crocodilia: i.e. the true crocodiles, the alligators and caimans (family Alligatoridae) and the gharials (family Gavialidae), as well as the Crocodylomorpha which includes prehistoric crocodile relatives and ancestors.[PARAGRAPH:2]Member species of the family Crocodylidae are large aquatic reptiles that live throughout the tropics in Africa, Asia, the Americas and Australia. Crocodiles tend to congregate in freshwater habitats like rivers, lakes, wetlands and sometimes in brackish water. They feed mostly on vertebrates like fish, reptiles, and mammals, sometimes on invertebrates like molluscs and crustaceans, depending on species. They first appeared during the Eocene epoch, about 55 million years ago.
TEXT.German: Krokodile sind Panzerechsen, die zu den Reptilien (Kriechtieren) zählen, obwohl sie auch nahe mit den Vögeln verwandt sind. Dies zeigt sich an einer ganzen Reihe von Gemeinsamkeiten, die wohl darauf beruhen, dass sowohl Krokodile als auch Vögel die letzten noch existierenden Nachfahren der Archosaurier sind.[PARAGRAPH:2]Krokodile leben bis auf wenige Ausnahmen (Salzwasserkrokodil) in Flüssen und Seen in der tropischen und subtropischen Klimazone. Sie können dementsprechend sehr gut schwimmen. Außerdem sind sie durch ihren Körperbau in der Lage, sich gut im Wasser zu tarnen, indem sie soweit untertauchen, dass nur noch Augen und Nasenlöcher aus dem Wasser schauen. Krokodile nähern sich geräuschlos dem Ufer und überraschen ihre Beute, indem sie unvermittelt aus dem Wasser schnellen, wobei sie ihren Schwanz zum Vortrieb nutzen. Sie graben ihre Zähne in das Opfer und halten es mit den gewaltigen Kiefern schraubstockartig fest, so dass es kaum eine Chance zum Entkommen hat. Die Beute wird dann ins Wasser gezogen und ertränkt.[PARAGRAPH:2]Krokodile faszinierten die frühen Menschen schon beim ersten Kontakt durch ihre Kraft und ihre Gefährlichkeit. Sie betrachteten die Tiere mit einer Mischung aus Angst, Ehrfurcht und Bewunderung, was man an den vielen Mythen und Legenden erkennt, in die sie Einzug gehalten haben. In manchen Kulturen ging der Verehrung sogar soweit, dass sie als heilige Tiere betrachtet und Götter nach ihnen gestaltet wurden (Beispiele: Sobek im Alten Ägypten, Chinesische Drachen).
TEXT.Polish: Krokodyle (Crocodilia) rz¹d gadów, jedynych oprócz ptaków wspó³czesnych przedstawicieli archozaurów (Archosauria) oraz jedynych ¿yj¹cych przedstawicieli kladu Crurotarsi. Obecnie reprezentowany jest przez trzy rodziny: krokodylowatych, aligatorowatych oraz gawiali. Poszczególne rodziny ró¿ni¹ siê miêdzy sob¹ kszta³tem pyska oraz liczb¹ i uk³adem zêbów. ¯yj¹ w strefie tropikalnej, subtropikalnej i umiarkowanej na wszystkich kontynentach oprócz Europy i Antarktydy.[PARAGRAPH:2]S¹ zwierzêtami o jaszczurowatym kszta³cie cia³a, pokryte kostnymi tarczami, ze szczêkami opatrzonymi zêbami osadzonymi w zêbodo³ach. Cia³o zakoñczone silnie rozwiniêtym i umiêœnionym ogonem. Dwie pary krótkich, silnych odnó¿y, z których przednie maj¹ palce wolne, tylne spiête s¹ w ca³oœci lub czêœciowo b³on¹ p³awn¹. Prowadz¹ pó³wodny tryb ¿ycia. Potrafi¹, w przeciwieñstwie do innych gadów, wydawaæ g³oœne dŸwiêki. S¹ jajorodne, jaja sk³adaj¹ na l¹dzie.

TEXT.English: Croesus was the king of Lydia who, according to Herodotus, reigned for fourteen years: from 560 BC until his defeat by the Persian king Cyrus the Great in 546 BC (sometimes given as 547 BC). Croesus was renowned for his wealth-Herodotus and Pausanias noted his gifts were preserved at Delphi. The fall of Croesus made a profound impact on the Greeks, providing a fixed point in their calendar. "By the fifth century at least," J.A.S. Evans has remarked, "Croesus had become a figure of myth, who stood outside the conventional restraints of chronology."

Crossbows were actively being used in European warfare from 800 to 1500 A.D. They supplanted bows in many European armies for a number of reasons. While an expertly handled longbow had greater range, better accuracy, and a much faster rate of fire than an average crossbow, the value of the crossbow came in its simplicity: a crossbow could be used effectively after a week of training, while a comparable single-shot skill with a longbow could take years. The use of winches allowed soldiers to use and fire weapons with a draw weight far in excess of what they could have handled with a bow. In the later years of its use, the crossbow had enough power to penetrate the armor of a knight with ease. Moreover, crossbows could be kept cocked and ready to shoot for some time with little effort, allowing crossbowmen to aim better and to "cover" a target area, while archers could not keep their powerful bows pulled for long periods of time.
TEXT.French: L'arbalète fut largement utilisée en Europe entre 800 et 1500 ap. J.-C. De nombreuses armées la préféraient à l'arc pour différentes raisons. Même si, dans les mains d'un tireur expérimenté, l'arc permettait de tirer plus loin, avec plus de précision et une cadence de tir supérieure, l'arbalète avait l'avantage de la simplicité : une semaine d'entraînement suffisait pour apprendre à tirer correctement, alors qu'il fallait aux archers des années de pratique pour maîtriser parfaitement leur arme. La présence d'un treuil sur l'arbalète permettait aux soldats de tirer des projectiles beaucoup plus lourds que les flèches traditionnelles. Les derniers modèles d'arbalètes étaient suffisamment puissants pour percer facilement l'armure d'un chevalier. De plus, il était possible de garder sans effort et relativement longtemps une arbalète chargée et prête à tirer, ce qui permettait aux arbalétriers de prendre leur temps pour chercher leurs cibles et viser, alors que les archers devaient rapidement tirer une fois la flèche engagée.
TEXT.German: Armbrüste wurden in Europa zwischen 800 und 1500 nach Christus eingesetzt und traten damit an die Stelle der traditionellen Langbögen. Diese hatten zwar eine größere Reichweite und eine höhere Schussfrequenz, waren aber deutlich schwieriger zu handhaben. Während die Ausbildung eines Armbrustschützen etwa eine Woche dauerte, nahm die Ausbildung eines guten Bogenschützen nicht selten mehrere Jahre in Anspruch. Der Einsatz von Winden erhöhte darüber hinaus die Durchschlagskraft der Armbrust. Selbst die Rüstungen der Ritter hatten den Bolzen der Armbrustschützen nichts entgegenzusetzen. Überdies konnten Armbrüste gespannt und bereit gehalten werden, während Bogenschützen ihre Bögen nur für kurze Zeit gespannt halten konnten.
TEXT.Italian: Le balestre vennero usate con grande profitto nei conflitti Europei dall'800 al 1500 d. C., sostituendo gli archi nella maggior parte degli eserciti per la semplicità d'uso: se scoccare una freccia con un arco lungo poteva richiedere mesi di addestramento, una balestra consentiva di sparare proiettili in poco meno di una settimana di pratica, senza però riuscire a equiparare la potenza e la precisione degli archi lunghi. L'impiego di un verricello consentiva ai soldati di poter "caricare" maggiormente un colpo di balestra rispetto a quello di un arco. Successivamente, la balestra divenne abbastanza potente da penetrare con facilità l'armatura di un cavaliere. Inoltre, le balestre permettevano una rapidità di utilizzo decisamente superiore a quella degli archi lunghi.
TEXT.Spanish: Las ballestas se emplearon activamente en los campos de batalla europeos entre el año 800 y el 1500 d. C. Reemplazaron a los arcos en muchos ejércitos por varias razones. Aunque un arco largo, en manos de un experto, poseía mayor alcance, precisión y cadencia de fuego que una ballesta normal, la ventaja de la ballesta radiaba en su sencillez. Podía utilizarse de forma eficaz con solo una semana de entrenamiento, mientras que una habilidad comparable con un arco podía requerir años. El uso de las manivelas permitía que los soldados utilizasen y disparasen armas con una potencia muy superior a la que habría sido posible con un arco. Poco antes de su desaparición, la ballesta tenía la potencia suficiente para atravesar con facilidad la armadura de un caballero. Además, podían mantenerse preparadas para disparar durante algún tiempo, lo que permitía que el soldado apuntara mejor y "cubriera" una zona, mientras que los arqueros no podían mantener tensa su arma mucho tiempo.

TEXT.English: Crowfoot was a chief of the Siksika First Nation. His parents were Kainai. His brother Iron Shield became Chief Bull.
TEXT.French: Pied-de-Corbeau était un chef de la Première Nation Siksika. Ses parents étaient Kainai. Son frère Bouclier de Fer est devenu Chef Taureau.

TEXT.English: Crows form the genus Corvus in the family Corvidae. Ranging in size from the relatively small pigeon-size jackdaws (Eurasian and Daurian) to the Common Raven of the Holarctic region and Thick-billed Raven of the highlands of Ethiopia, the 40 or so members of this genus occur on all temperate continents (except South America) and several offshore and oceanic islands (except for a few, which included Hawaii, which had the Hawaiian crow that went extinct in the wild in 2002). In the United States and Canada, the word "crow" is used to refer to the American Crow, Corvus brachyrhynchos.[PARAGRAPH:2]The crow genus makes up a third of the species in the Corvidae family. Other corvids include rooks and jays. Crows appear to have evolved in Asia from the corvid stock, which had evolved in Australia. A group of crows is called a flock or a murder, because the group will sometimes kill a dying crow.[PARAGRAPH:2]Recent research has found some crow species capable not only of tool use but of tool construction as well. Crows are now considered to be among the world's most intelligent animals. The Jackdaw and (along with its fellow corvid, the European Magpie) has been found to have a neostriatum approximately the same relative size as is found in chimpanzees and humans, and significantly larger than is found in the gibbon.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Krähen[COLOR_REVERT] bilden zusammen mit den Raben die Gattung Corvus und gehören zu den Rabenvögeln. Dabei sind die Krähen die kleineren der 42 Arten.[NEWLINE]In Europa sind Saat- und Aaskrähen heimisch, wobei besonders die Nebelkrähe mit ihrem grauen Gefieder auffällt. Sie verpaart sich oft mit der schwarzen Rabenkrähe, wodurch unterschiedliche Zeichnungen des Gefieders entstehen. Auch an ihren typischen Rufen ("krah") sind Krähen leicht zu erkennen. Sie ernähren sich vorzugsweise von Getreidesamen, aber auch Vogeleier und Aas stehen auf dem Speiseplan. Im Winter fressen sie vorzugsweise menschliche Abfälle. In der Vergangenheit richteten vor allem Saatkrähen großen landwirtschaftlichen Schaden an, der aber mittlerweile durch verschiedene Methoden wie die Behandlung des Saatguts mit unangenehm schmeckenden Stoffen verringert wird.[NEWLINE]Krähen sind ebenso wie Raben sehr intelligent. So können sie Anzahlen bis zu 30 unterscheiden sowie Menschen- und Krähengesichter erkennen.
TEXT.Polish: Wrona, wrona siwa (Corvus cornix) - gatunek œredniego ptaka z rodziny krukowatych, zasadniczo wêdrowny, choæ du¿a czêœæ osobników jest ju¿ osiad³a (zw³aszcza populacje miejskie). Wystêpuje w pó³nocnej i wschodniej Europie od Pó³wyspu Apeniñskiego i £aby po Ural. Pierwotnie specjacja nastêpowa³a w po³udniowo-wschodniej Europie i w cieplejszych strefach Azji. TEXT.English: A cruiser is a large type of warship, which had its prime period from the late 19th century to the end of the Cold War. The first cruisers were intended for individual raiding and protection missions on the seas. Over the years, the nature and role of the cruiser has changed considerably, and today the cruiser has largely been replaced by destroyers in its roles.
TEXT.French: Un croiseur est un grand type de navire de guerre, qui a connu sa période de gloire de la fin du 19e siècle à la fin de la Guerre froide. Les premiers croiseurs étaient destinés à des missions individuelles de raid et de protection sur les mers. Au fil des ans, la nature et le rôle du croiseur ont considérablement changé, et aujourd'hui le croiseur a été largement remplacé par des destroyers dans ses rôles.
TEXT.Polish: Kr¹¿ownik klasa du¿ych, silnie uzbrojonych okrêtów nawodnych, wyró¿niana od II po³owy XIX wieku do chwili obecnej. W miarê rozwoju techniki klasa kr¹¿owników ewoluowa³a i dzieli³a siê na liczne podklasy, ró¿ni¹ce siê od siebie charakterystykami, w tym wielkoœci¹. Najbardziej ogólnym podzia³em, wi¹¿¹cym siê ze zmian¹ rodzaju uzbrojenia i zadañ kr¹¿owników, jest podzia³ na kr¹¿owniki klasyczne (artyleryjskie), dziœ ju¿ nie wystêpuj¹ce i wspó³czesne kr¹¿owniki rakietowe.
TEXT.Russian: Крейсер - это большой тип боевого корабля, расцвет которого пришелся на конец XIX века до конца холодной войны. Первые крейсера предназначались для индивидуальных рейдов и защиты на море. С годами характер и роль крейсера значительно изменились, и сегодня крейсер в значительной степени заменен на эсминцы.[PARAGRAPH:1]Крейсеры долго выполняли роль эскорта и защитных судов, прикрывая авианосцы и амфибии от вражеских кораблей и самолетов. Во время Второй мировой войны они делились на легкие (класс "CL") и тяжелые (класс "CA")крейсеры. Легкие крейсеры оснащались орудиями диаметром не более 6 дюймов, а на тяжелых находились орудия 6-8 дюймов в диаметре. В отличие от большинства крейсеров Союзников, японские корабли также оснащались запасами торпед "Длинное копье", топливом для которых служил кислород. Кроме того, эти смертоносные торпеды можно было перезаряжать(у других флотов не было торпед такого типа).

TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Généré par la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT][LINK=BUILDING_KINGS_CRUSADE]Croisade du Roi[\LINK][COLOR_REVERT] tous les quelques tours
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]L'unità è [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]prodotta[COLOR_REVERT] dall'edificio [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT][LINK=BUILDING_KINGS_CRUSADE]Crociata del re[\LINK][COLOR_REVERT] a intervalli regolari

TEXT.English: The original crusaders were known by various terms, including fideles Sancti Petri (the faithful of Saint Peter) or milites Christi (knights of Christ). They saw themselves as undertaking a journey, or a pilgrimage, though pilgrims were usually forbidden from carrying arms. Like pilgrims, each crusader swore a vow, to be fulfilled on successfully reaching Jerusalem, and they were granted a cloth cross (crux) to be sewn into their clothes. This "taking of the cross", the crux, eventually became associated with the entire journey; the word "crusade" (coming into English from the French croisade, the Italian crociata, the Portuguese cruzada, or the German Kreuzzug) developed from this.
TEXT.Polish: Krucjaty (³ac. crux, krzy¿) okreœlenie religijnie sankcjonowanych wypraw zbrojnych w œredniowieczu, podejmowanych przez pañstwa i rycerstwo g³ównie katolickiej Europy. Wojny te by³y prowadzone przede wszystkim przeciw muzu³manom, ale tak¿e przeciw poganom, chrzeœcijañskim heretykom, a czasami nawet przeciw samym katolikom. Choæ powody tych wojen by³y w du¿ym stopniu religijne, to miesza³y siê one równie¿ z czynnikami politycznymi i ekonomicznymi. Krucjaty og³aszane by³y g³ównie przez papie¿y, jednak czasami równie¿ przez innych w³adców, wspieranych przez papiestwo.

TEXT.English: The Cuachic is a Mixtec warrior wielding a wooden club lined with Stone or Obsidian blades on either side. It is a Mixtec unique unit, and starts with Shock I and Mobility, in addition to the standard swordsman's city attack bonus.
TEXT.French: Le Cuachic est un guerrier mixtèque maniant une massue en bois bordée de lames de pierre ou d'obsidienne de chaque côté. C'est une unité unique mixtèque, et commence avec Choc I et Mobilité, en plus du bonus d'attaque de ville standard du spadassin.
TEXT.Italian: Il Cuachic è un guerriero Mixteco che utilizza un'asta di legno con lame di pietra o ossidiana. Si tratta dell'unità unica Mixteca ed ottiene bonus contro le unità da combattimento ravvicinato e attaccando le città, oltre a muoversi più velocemente sul terreno.

TEXT.English: The Cuirassier was the last step in the evolution of European armored cavalry. Drawing their name from their heavy, metal breastplates - or "cuirasses" - the Cuirassiers were the heaviest of the heavy cavalry.[PARAGRAPH:1]The earliest Cuirassiers, born in the 15th century, were armored head-to-toe and armed with heavy saber and pistols. As European warfare began to rely more on firearms, much of this heavy armor was shed to increase mobility, eventually adapting into what is now recognized as the standard Cuirassier uniform - a breastplate and helm. Fielded almost exclusively in the battles of continental Europe, the Cuirassier saw its most widespread use under the command of Napoleon, who was fielding 14 regiments of the cavalrymen by 1812.
TEXT.French: Le cuirassier constitue l'évolution ultime de la cavalerie blindée européenne. Tirant leur nom de leurs imposants plastrons métalliques (ou cuirasses), les cuirassiers forment la plus puissante unité de la cavalerie lourde.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les premiers cuirassiers, nés au 15ème siècle, sont blindés de pied en cap et armés de sabres et de pistolets. Alors que les conflits européens emploient de plus en plus les armes à feu, une grosse partie de cette lourde armure est abandonnée au profit de la mobilité, pour finalement devenir ce qui est maintenant considéré comme l'uniforme classique des cuirassiers : un plastron et un casque. Employé presque uniquement lors des batailles sur le continent européen, le cuirassier est surtout utilisé sous le commandement de Napoléon, qui dispose de 14 régiments de cavaliers en 1812.
TEXT.German: Die Kürassiere waren die letzte Entwicklungsstufe der gepanzerten europäischen Kavallerie. Ihr Name leitet sich von ihren schweren, metallischen Brustharnischen - oder "Kürassen" - ab. Sie waren die schwerste Einheit der schweren Kavallerie.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die frühesten Kürassiere, geboren im 15. Jahrhundert, steckten von Kopf bis Fuß in ihrer Rüstung und waren mit schweren Säbeln und Pistolen bewaffnet. Als sich die europäische Kriegsführung mehr auf Feuerwaffen konzentrierte, wurden viele Teile der schweren Rüstung abgelegt, um die Mobilität zu erhöhen. Daraus entstand schließlich die später übliche Kürassier-Uniform - ein Brustharnisch und ein Helm. Der Kürassier kam fast ausschließlich in den Schlachten des kontinentalen Europas zum Einsatz, und dort am stärksten unter dem Befehl Napoleons, der im Jahre 1812 14 Regimenter dieser Kavalleriesoldaten in den Kampf schickte.
TEXT.Italian: Il Corazziere fu l'ultimo passo dell'evoluzione della cavalleria corazzata europea. Il loro nome deriva dalle pesanti armature, corazze appunto, ed erano la più pesante tra le cavallerie pesanti.[PARAGRAPH:1]I primi Corazzieri, nati nel quindicesimo secolo, erano corazzati da testa a piedi e armati con pesanti sciabole e pistole. Successivamente le operazioni militari europee fecero sempre più affidamento sulle armi da fuoco, quindi gran parte della pesante corazza fu eliminata per aumentare la mobilità, arrivando infine a quella che oggi è riconosciuta come l'uniforme standard del Corazziere: pettorale ed elmo. Utilizzati quasi esclusivamente nelle battaglie dell'Europa continentale, i Corazzieri furono usati più di tutti sotto il comando di Napoleone, che nel 1812 ne schierava 14 reggimenti.
TEXT.Spanish: El coracero fue el último peldaño de la evolución de la caballería pesada europea. Su nombre deriva de la pesada armadura de metal que llevaban sobre el pecho, la coraza, y que lo convertía en el más pesado de la caballería pesada.[PARAGRAPH:1]Los primeros coraceros, aparecidos en el siglo XV, utilizaban una armadura que los cubría de la cabeza a los pies y estaban armados con sable y pistolas. A medida que se incrementaba la importancia de las armas de fuego en los campos de batalla europeos, gran parte de esta armadura fue descartándose en beneficio de la movilidad, hasta quedar reducida a lo que en la actualidad se reconoce como el uniforme estándar del coracero: una coraza y un yelmo. Empleados casi exclusivamente en los campos de batalla de Europa, los coraceros vivieron su momento de gloria durante el reinado de Napoleón, quien llegó a tener 14 regimientos en 1812.

TEXT.English: A culverin was a relatively simple ancestor of the musket, and later a medieval cannon, adapted for use by the French in the 15th century, and later adapted for naval use by the English in the late 16th century. The culverin was used to bombard targets from a distance. The weapon had a relatively long barrel and a light construction. The culverin fired solid round shot projectiles with a high muzzle velocity, producing a relatively long range and flat trajectory. Round shot refers to the classic solid spherical cannonball.
TEXT.Polish: Kolubryna - ogólna nazwa odprzodkowych dzia³ artyleryjskich u¿ywanych w XVI i XVII wieku. Nazwa kolubryna pochodzi od ³aciñskiego s³owa colubra ¿mija, wê¿yca; we Francji, gdzie przede wszystkim by³y u¿ywane, nazywane by³y coulevrine. Tego typu dzia³a nazywano tak¿e koluwryny, wê¿ownice, serpentyny lub szlangi. Dzia³a tego typu charakteryzowa³y siê gruboœcienn¹ luf¹ o d³ugoœci 27 - 40 kalibrów, wykonan¹ ze spi¿u lub ¿eliwa. Wagomiar kolubryn waha³ siê do 1 do 40 funtów, co odpowiada³o kalibrom 55 - 210 mm. Kolubryny o d³u¿szych lufach nazywano pospolitymi lub esktraordynalnymi, o krótszych bastardami lub bêkarkami. Ciê¿ar lufy kolubryny wynosi³ od 750 kg (oktawa kolubryna) do 6000 kg (kolubryna podwójna). Ze wzglêdu na du¿¹ donoœnoœæ i skutecznoœæ pocisku, kolubryny o wiêkszym wagomiarze stosowano do niszczenia fortyfikacji, o mniejszym do ra¿enia si³y ¿ywej przeciwnika na du¿ych odleg³oœciach.

TEXT.English: Cyaxares the son of King Phraortes, and according to Herodotus was the third and most capable king of Media. According to Herodotus, Cyaxares, grandson of Deioces, had a far greater military reputation than his father or grandfather. He was the first to divide his troops into separate sections of spearmen, archers, and horsemen.
TEXT.French: Cyaxare, fils du roi Phraorte, et selon Hérodote, était le troisième et le plus capable roi de Médie. Selon Hérodote, Cyaxare, petit-fils de Déjocès, avait une réputation militaire bien plus grande que son père ou son grand-père. Il fut le premier à diviser ses troupes en sections distinctes de lanciers, d'archers et de cavaliers.

TEXT.English: Cyborgs are improved "automatons," clone soldiers controlled by bio-mechanical computers. Cyborgs are smarter and tougher than their primitive cousins, and while still not as intelligent or effective as "normal" human soldiers, they come pretty close. While further advancement in intelligence is theoretically possible, many political leaders are reluctant to allow the scientists to try to increase the cyborgs' mental capacity any farther, fearing that smarter organisms may decide to rebel against their creators, wreaking a terrible revenge on those who have enslaved them. Exasperated generals believe that this so-called "Battlestar Galactica" syndrome (named after an American television program from the beginning of the twenty-first century) is patent nonsense, but, as yet, have been able to prevail.
TEXT.French: Les cyborgs sont des automates améliorés, des clones soldats contrôlés par des programmes biomécaniques. Plus intelligents que leurs cousins primitifs, les cyborgs n'atteignent pas encore tout à fait les niveaux de raisonnement des soldats humains. Si une avancée dans ce domaine est encore théoriquement possible, de nombreux dirigeants refusent de laisser les scientifiques créer des cyborgs trop évolués mentalement, de peur qu'ils n'utilisent leurs capacités pour se rebeller contre leurs créateurs et qu'ils se vengent. Cette frilosité agace les généraux au plus haut point ; ils voient dans ce syndrome "Battlestar Galactica" (du nom d'une série télévisée américaine du début du vingt-et-unième siècle) un sérieux coup de frein à l'amélioration des techniques militaires.
TEXT.German: Cyborgs sind verbesserte "Robotersoldaten", also Klonsoldaten, die von biomechanischen Computern gesteuert werden. Sie sind cleverer und widerstandsfähiger als ihre primitiven Artgenossen und kommen den "normalen" Soldaten, trotz ihrer geringeren Intelligenz und Leistungsfähigkeit, doch recht nahe. Theoretisch wäre es zwar möglich, sie mit einer verbesserten Intelligenz auszustatten, dennoch zögern viele politische Führer, ihren Wissenschaftlern die Genehmigung zu erteilen, die mentalen Kapazitäten der Cyborgs zu steigern, weil sie fürchten, dass sich die dann klügeren Organismen gegen ihre Schöpfer wenden und fürchterliche Rache an all jenen üben könnten, die sie unterjocht haben. Genervte Generäle halten dieses so genannte "Kampfstern Galactica"-Syndrom (benannt nach einer amerikanischen Fernsehserie des 21. Jahrhunderts) für reinen Unsinn, konnten sich aber bislang nicht dagegen durchsetzen.
TEXT.Italian: I cyborg sono "automi" migliorati, cloni soldato controllati da computer biomeccanici. Sono più furbi e resistenti dei loro cugini primitivi e, anche se non sono intelligenti o efficaci come i "normali" soldati umani, ci vanno molto vicino. Pur essendo in teoria possibile un ulteriore sviluppo intellettuale, i leader politici sono riluttanti a permettere agli scienziati di tentare di aumentare ulteriormente la capacità mentale dei cyborg. Temono, infatti, che degli organismi più intelligenti possano decidere di ribellarsi ai propri creatori, vendicandosi in maniera terribile su coloro che li hanno resi schiavi. I generali, esasperati, credono che questa sindrome da "Battlestar Galactica" (che prende il nome da una serie televisiva americana dell'inizio del ventunesimo secolo) sia una stupidaggine, ma non sono ancora riusciti ad averla vinta.
TEXT.Spanish: Los ciborgs son "autómatas" mejorados, soldados clonados que están controlados por ordenadores biomecánicos. Son más listos y duros que sus primitivos primos y, aunque no sean tan eficaces ni inteligentes como los soldados humanos "normales", se les parecen bastante. Aunque avanzar más en inteligencia sea posible en teoría, muchos líderes políticos son reticentes a permitirles a los científicos que aumenten más las capacidades mentales de los ciborgs, pues temen que unos organismos más listos decidan rebelarse contra sus creadores y vengarse de quienes les han esclavizado. Algunos generales, exasperados, creen que este llamado síndrome "Battlestar Galactica" (en honor a la serie de televisión estadounidense de principios del s. XXI) no son más que paparruchas, pero hasta el momento no han conseguido imponer su punto de vist
TEXT.Polish: Cyborgi s¹ ulepszonymi "automatami", wojownikami-klonami kontrolowanymi przez biomechaniczne komputery. S¹ m¹drzejsze i twardsze ni¿ ich prymitywni kuzyni, i chocia¿ nie tak inteligentne jak ludzie, nie pozostaj¹ jednak daleko w tyle. Chocia¿ dalszy postêp w sztucznej insteligencji jest teoretycznie mo¿liwy, wielu przywódców wojskowych jest niechêtnych do pozwolenia naukowcom na podniesienie mentalnych umiejêtnoœci boj¹c siê, ¿e im m¹drzejsze roboty tym wiêksze prawdopodobieñstwo, ¿e zbuntuj¹ siê przeciwko swoim twórcom.
