TEXT.English: The Muiscan people were organized in a confederation that was a loose union of states that each retained sovereignty. The Confederation was not a kingdom, as there was no absolute monarch, nor was it an empire, because it did not dominate other ethnic groups or peoples. The Muiscan Confederation cannot be compared with other American civilizations such as the Aztec or the Inca empires. The Muiscan Confederation was one of the biggest and best-organized confederations of tribes on the South American continent. Every tribe within the confederation was ruled by a chief or cacique. Most of the tribes were part of the Muisca ethnic group, sharing the same language and culture, and relating through trade. They united in the face of a common enemy. The army was the responsibility of the Zipa or Zaque. The army was made up of the güeches, the traditional ancient warriors of the Muisca.

Daedalus was a mythical Greek architect and sculptor, who was said to have built, among other things, the paradigmatic Labyrinth for King Minos of Crete. Daedalus fell out of favour with Minos and was imprisoned; he fashioned wings of wax and feathers for himself and for his son Icarus and escaped to Sicily. Icarus, however, flew too near the Sun, and his wings melted; he fell into the sea and drowned. The island on which his body was washed ashore was later named Icaria. Minos pursued Daedalus to Sicily and was killed by the daughters of Cocalus. The Greeks of the historic age attributed to Daedalus buildings and statues the origins of which were lost in the past. Later critics ascribed to him such innovations as representing humans in statues with their feet apart and their eyes open. A phase of early Greek art, Daedalic sculpture, is named for him.
TEXT.Polish: Dedal - w mitologii greckiej architekt i wynalazca, syn Ateny. Ojciec Ikara. M¹¿ Naukrate. Dedal pochodzi³ z Aten, jednak uciek³ z nich po zabiciu swojego siostrzeñca Talosa, któremu zazdroœci³ wynalezienia pi³y (za co ukara³a go Atena)(pi³a Talosa). Schroni³ siê na Krecie, gdzie pracowa³ jako wynalazca na dworze Minosa. Zbudowa³ wtedy labirynt Minotaura. Gdy król zabroni³ mu powrotu do ojczyzny i zamkn¹³ w wie¿y, Dedal wraz z synem uciek³ z niej na skrzyd³ach zrobionych w³asnorêcznie z piór i wosku. W trakcie ucieczki Ikar zgin¹³, gdy podlecia³ za blisko s³oñca, pomimo ¿e ojciec ostrzeg³ go wczeœniej s³owami: "Pamiêtaj, synu, ¿ebyœ zawsze lata³ œrodkiem, miêdzy morzem a niebem. Nie wolno ci zbyt wysoko szybowaæ, gdy¿ gor¹co promieni s³onecznych roztopi wosk, który spaja skrzyd³a; ani nie zlatuj zbyt nisko, aby wilgoci¹ wody nie nasi¹k³y pióra." Ikar nie pos³ucha³ jednak ojca i rozgrzane przez s³oñce skrzyd³a rozpuœci³y siê. Dedal dotar³ do Sycylii, gdzie zbudowa³ œwi¹tyniê Apolla, w której umieœci³ swoje skrzyd³a, jako ofiarê dla tego boga.

TEXT.English: The Dahomey Amazons or Mino were a Fon all-female military regiment of the Kingdom of Dahomey (now Benin) which lasted until the end of the 19th century. They were so named by Western observers and historians due to their similarity to the semi-mythical Amazons of ancient Anatolia and the Black Sea. For many years, the Black Sea was called the Amazon.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Origins of the Dahomey Amazons were from a group of elephant hunters organized by king Houegbadja. They were soon professionaly trained and some even ended up as his bodyguards. During the rule of Houegbadja's son, Agadja, the bodyguard were further developed into a milita and used when deafeating the neighbouring Savi. For the next hundred years, they got a reputation as fearless warriors.[PARAGRAPH:1]The group of female warriors was referred to as Mino, meaning "Our Mothers" in the Fon language by the male army of Dahomey. From the time of King Ghezo (ruling from 1818 to 1858), Dahomey became increasingly militaristic. Ghezo placed great importance on the army and increased its budget and formalized its structures. The Mino were rigorously trained, given uniforms, and equipped with Danish guns (obtained via the slave trade). By this time the Mino consisted of between 4000 and 6000 women, about a third of the entire Dahomey army.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Mino were recruited from among the ahosi ("king's wives") of which there were often hundreds. Some women in Fon society became ahosi voluntarily, while others were involuntarily enrolled if their husbands or fathers complained to the King about their behaviour. Membership among the Mino was supposed to hone any aggressive character traits for the purpose of war. During their membership they were not allowed to have children or be part of married life. Many of them were virgins. The regiment had a semi-sacred status, which was intertwined with the Fon belief in Vodun.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Mino trained with intense physical exercise. Discipline was emphasised. In the latter period, they were armed with Winchester rifles, clubs and knives. Units were under female command. Captives who fell into the hands of the Amazons were often decapitated.[PARAGRAPH:1]During the Franco-Dahomey Wars in the late 19th Century, the French, who tried to invade the country, suffered heavy casulties and lost several battles to the amazons, described as "the equal of every contemporary body of male elite soldiers from among the colonial powers". Ultimately, bolstered by the Foreign Legion, and armed with superior weaponry, including machine guns, as well as cavalry and Marine infantry, the French inflicted casualties that were ten times worse on the Dahomey side. After several battles, the French prevailed. The Legionnaires later wrote about the "incredible courage and audacity" of the Amazons. The last surviving Amazon of Dahomey died in 1979.
TEXT.Italian: Le Amazzoni del Dahomey, note anche come Mino, erano un reggimento militare di sole donne del Regno del Dahomey (oggi Benin), che durò fino alla fine del XIX secolo. Vennero chiamate così dagli osservatori e storici occidentali per la loro somiglianza con le semi-mitiche Amazzoni dell'antica Anatolia e del Mar Nero; per molti anni infatti il Mar Nero venne chiamato Amazzonia.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le origini delle Amazzoni del Dahomey erano da un gruppo di cacciatrici di elefanti organizzato dal re Houégbadja. Erano professionalmente addestrate fin da giovani, e alcune diventavano addirittura sue guardie del corpo. Durante il regno del figlio di Houégbadja, Agadja, le guardie del corpo vennero trasformate in una milizia che venne utilizzata nella guerra contro i Savi. Nei seguenti cento anni ottennero la fama di guerrieri impavidi.[PARAGRAPH:1]Il gruppo di donne guerriere veniva indicato come Mino, che significa "Le nostri Madri" nella lingua Fon da parte dell'esercito maschile del Dahomey. Dal tempo del re Ghezo (che regnò nel periodo 1818-1858), il Dahomey divenne sempre più militarista. Ghezo pose grande importanza nell'esercito, aumentando il suo budget e formalizzando le sue strutture. Le Mino erano rigorosamente addestrate, dotate di uniformi e equipaggiate con armi danesi (ottenute tramite il commercio degli schiavi). A questo punto le Mino erano tra 4000 e 6000 donne, circa un terzo di tutto l'esercito Dahomey.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le Mino venivano reclutate tra le ahosi ("mogli del re") che erano spesso centinaia. Alcune donne nella società Fon divennero ahosi volontariamente, mentre altre venivano involontariamente arruolate se i loro mariti o padri si lamentavano con il Re per il loro comportamento. Per essere una Mino era necessario un carattere aggressivo per andare in guerra. Durante la loro adesione non erano autorizzate ad avere figli o avere una vita coniugale. Molte di loro erano vergini. Il reggimento aveva uno status semi-sacro, intrecciato con la credenza Fon nel Vodun.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le Mino si allenavano con un intenso esercizio fisico. La disciplina veniva enfatizzata. Negli ultimi periodi, erano armati di fucili Winchester, bastoni e coltelli. Le unità erano sotto il comando di sesso femminile. I Prigionieri caduti nelle mani delle Amazzoni venivano spesso decapitati.[PARAGRAPH:1]Durante le guerre tra Francia e Dahomey nel tardo XIX secolo i francesi, che tentarono di invadere il paese, subirono pesanti perdite e persero diverse battaglie contro le amazzoni, descritte come "alla pari di ogni corpo contemporaneo di soldati d'élite di sesso maschile tra le potenze coloniali". Alla fine, sostenuta dalla Legione Straniera e armata con armi superiori, tra cui mitragliatrici, cavalleria e fanteria marina, i francesi inflissero perdite che erano dieci volte peggiori sul lato Dahomey. Dopo varie battaglie vinsero i francesi. I Legionari in seguito scrisse di un "incredibile coraggio e audacia" da parte delle Amazzoni. L'ultima Amazzone del Dahomey superstite morì nel 1979.

TEXT.English: Damballa or Damballah or Danbala is one of the most important of all the loa. Damballa is the Sky Father and the primordial creator of all life. He rules the mind, intellect, and cosmic equilibrium. Damballa, as the serpent spirit and "The Great Master", created the cosmos by using his 7,000 coils to form the stars and the planets in the heavens and to shape the hills and valleys on earth. By shedding the serpent skin, Damballa created all the waters on the earth. Damballa is syncretized with either Saint Patrick, Christ the Redeemer, Our Lady of Mercy, or Moses.
Dardo Rocha (September 1, 1838 - September 6, 1921) was an Argentine naval officer, lawyer and politician best known as the founder of the city of La Plata and of the University of La Plata.
TEXT.French: Dardo Rocha (1er septembre 1838 - 6 septembre 1921) était un officier de marine, avocat et homme politique argentin surtout connu comme le fondateur de la ville de La Plata et de l'Université de La Plata.

TEXT.English: Tanshihuai of the Xianbei divided his territory into three sections: the eastern, the middle and the western. From the You Beiping to the Liao River, connecting the Fuyu and Mo to the east, it was the eastern section. There were more than twenty counties. The darens (chiefs) (of this section) were called Mijia, Queji, Suli and Huaitou. From the You Beiping to Shanggu to the west, it was the middle section. There were more than ten counties. The darens of this section were called Kezui, Queju, Murong, et al. From Shanggu to Dunhuang, connecting the Wusun to the west, it was the western section. There were more than twenty counties. The darens (of this section) were called Zhijian Luoluo, Ril Tuiyan, Yanliyou, et al. These chiefs were all subordinate to Tanshihuai.

The War in Darfur is a major armed conflict in the Darfur region of Sudan, that began in February 2003 when the Sudan Liberation Movement (SLM) and Justice and Equality Movement (JEM) rebel groups began fighting the government of Sudan, which they accused of oppressing Darfur's non-Arab population. The government responded to attacks by carrying out a campaign of ethnic cleansing against Darfur's non-Arabs. This resulted in the deaths of hundreds of thousands of civilians and the indictment of Sudan's president Omar al-Bashir for genocide and crimes against humanity by the International Criminal Court.

Poison dart frog (also dart-poison frog, poison frog or formerly poison arrow frog) is the common name of a group of frogs in the family Dendrobatidae which are native to Central and South America. These species are diurnal and often have brightly-colored bodies. Although all wild dendrobatids are at least somewhat toxic, levels of toxicity vary considerably from one species to the next and from one population to another. Many species are critically endangered. These amphibians are often called "dart frogs" due to the Amerindians' indigenous use of their toxic secretions to poison the tips of blowdarts. However, of over 175 species, only three have been documented as being used for this purpose (curare plants are more commonly used), and none come from the Dendrobates genus, which is characterized by the brilliant color and complex patterns of its members.
TEXT.German: Als [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Baumsteigerfrosch[COLOR_REVERT] (auch Pfeilgiftfrosch oder Farbfrosch) bezeichnet man eine Familie der Froschlurche. Es existieren ca. 170 Arten.[NEWLINE]Baumsteigerfrösche leben fast ausschließilich im mittel- und südamerikanischen Regenwald, die meisten von ihnen sind mit 12 bis 50 Millimetern sehr klein und farbenfroh. Weitere Merkmale sind das Fehlen der Gaumenbeine (Gesichtsschädelknochen) und der Schwimmhäute zwischen der ersten und zweiten bzw. der zweiten und dritten Zehe. Zur Fortpflanzung laichen die kleineren Arten auf Blättern, die größeren in Höhlen. Sie verzehren giftige Beutetiere wie Milben, Ameisen und Käfer, um ihren Giftvorrat, der über 200 Alkaloide umfasst, aufrecht zu erhalten. Nachzuchten in Gefangenschaft haben aufgrund des abweichenden Nahrungsangebots oft kein Hautgift mehr. Einige Arten sind von Natur aus ungiftig und tragen ihre auffälige Signalfarbe nur, um Fressfeinde zu täuschen (Mimikry).[NEWLINE]Indigene Völker benutzen das Gift bei der Jagd mit dem Blasrohr, indem sie es auf die Pfeile auftragen (daher die Bezeichnung Pfeilgiftfrosch). Jedoch bilden nur wenige Arten ein für den Menschen tödliches Gift aus. Einige Gattungen der Baumsteigerfrösche stehen unter Artenschutz, ihre Bestände sind durch illegalen Handel und die Abholzung des Regenwaldes stark gefährdet. In kühleren Regionen der Anden droht zudem ein Pilzbefall, der tödlich verlaufen kann.
TEXT.Russian: Древолазы - распространенное название семейства Dendrobatidae - лягушек, обитающих в Центральной и Южной Америке. Эти виды ведут дневной образ жизни и часто имеют ярко окрашенное тело. Хотя все дикие древолазы, по крайней мере, в некоторой степени токсичны, уровни токсичности значительно варьируются от одного вида к другому и от одной популяции к другой. Многие виды находятся под угрозой исчезновения. В англоязычной среде этих земноводных часто называют "dart frog" (дротиковыми лягушками) из-за того, что индейцы использовали их ядовитые выделения для отравления наконечников дротиков. Однако из более чем 175 видов только три были документально подтверждены как используемые для этой цели (чаще используются растения кураре), и ни один из них не относится к роду Dendrobates, который отличается яркой окраской и сложными узорами своих представителей.

TEXT.English: Most of the warships of the era were distinguished by their names, which were compounds of a number and a suffix. Thus, the English term quinquereme derives from Latin quinque-rmis and has the Greek equivalent -. Both are compounds featuring a prefix meaning "five": Latin quinque, ancient Greek. The Roman suffix is from rmus, "oar": "five-oar". As the vessel cannot have had only five oars, the word must be a figure of speech meaning something else. There are a number of possibilities. The - occurs only in suffix form, deriving from "to row". As "rower" is erets and "oar" is eretmon, -rs does not mean either of those but, being based on the verb, must mean "rowing". This meaning is no clearer than the Latin. Whatever the "five-oar" or the "five-row" originally meant was lost with knowledge of the construction, and is, from the 5th century on, a hotly debated issue. For the history of the interpretation efforts and current scholarly consensus, see below.[PARAGRAPH:2]Like the septireme, the deceres (Greek: dekrs) is attributed by Pliny to Alexander the Great, and they are present alongside "nines" in the fleet of Antigonus Monophthalmus in 315 BC. Indeed, it is most likely that the "ten" was derived from adding another oarsman to the "nine". A "ten" is mentioned as Philip V's flagship at Chios in 201 BC, and their last appearance was at Actium, where they constituted Antony's heaviest ships.

Decebalus (ruled 87-106) was the last king of Dacia. He is famous for fighting three wars, with varying success, against the Roman Empire under two emperors. After raiding across the Danube, he defeated a Roman invasion in the reign of Domitian, securing a period of independence during which Decebalus consolidated his rule.
TEXT.French: Décébale (règne 87-106) était le dernier roi de Dacie. Il est célèbre pour avoir mené trois guerres, avec un succès variable, contre l'Empire romain sous deux empereurs. Après avoir fait des raids au-delà du Danube, il a vaincu une invasion romaine sous le règne de Domitien, s'assurant une période d'indépendance pendant laquelle Décébale a consolidé son règne.

TEXT.English: Dedan Kimathi Waciuri (31 October 1920 - 18 February 1957) born Kimathi wa Waciuri, was a leader of the Mau Mau which led an armed military struggle known as the Mau Mau uprising against the British colonial government in Kenya in the 1950s.
TEXT.French: Dedan Kimathi Waciuri (31 octobre 1920 - 18 février 1957), né Kimathi wa Waciuri, était un leader des Mau Mau qui a mené une lutte militaire armée connue sous le nom de soulèvement Mau Mau contre le gouvernement colonial britannique au Kenya dans les années 1950.

TEXT.English: Demetrius I was a Greek king (reigned c. 200-180 BC) of Gandhara. He was the son of Euthydemus and succeeded him around 200 BC, after which he conquered extensive areas in what now is now Afghanistan and Pakistan. thus creating an Indo-Greek Kingdom far from Hellenistic Greece. He was never defeated in battle and was posthumously qualified as the Invincible (Aniketos) on the pedigree coins of his successor Agathocles.
TEXT.French: Démétrios Ier était un roi grec (règne c. 200-180 av. J.-C.) de Gandhara. Il était le fils d'Euthydème et lui succéda vers 200 av. J.-C., après quoi il conquit de vastes territoires dans ce qui est maintenant l'Afghanistan et le Pakistan, créant ainsi un royaume indo-grec loin de la Grèce hellénistique. Il ne fut jamais vaincu au combat et fut qualifié à titre posthume d'Invincible (Aniketos) sur les monnaies généalogiques de son successeur Agathocle.

TEXT.English: The Dene are expert at breeding dogs for their bitterly cold environment.
TEXT.French: Les Dénés sont experts dans l'élevage de chiens pour leur environnement extrêmement froid.

TEXT.English: The desert tortoise (Gopherus agassizii) is a species of tortoise native to the Mojave desert and Sonoran desert of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. They can be located in western Arizona, southeastern California, southern Nevada, and southwestern Utah. The species name agassizii is in honor of Swiss-American zoologist Jean Louis Rodolphe Agassiz. Recently, on the basis of DNA, geographic, and behavioral differences between desert tortoises in the Sonoran and Mojave desert, it was decided that the species should be split into two separate species: the Mojave Desert Tortoise (Gopherus agassizii) and Sonoran Desert Tortoise (Gopherus morafkai).[PARAGRAPH:2]This tortoise may attain a length of 10 to 14 inches (25 to 36 cm), with males being slightly larger than females. Male tortoises have a longer gular horn than females, their plastron (lower shell) is concave compared to female tortoises. Males have larger tails than females do. Their shells are high-domed, and greenish-tan to dark brown in color. Desert tortoises can grow from 4 - 6'(10 - 15 cm) in height and weigh 8 - 15 lb (4 - 7 kg) when fully grown. The front limbs have sharp, claw-like scales and are flattened for digging. Back legs are skinnier and very long.
TEXT.German: Gopherschildkröten (Gopherus) sind eine Tiergattung aus der Familie der Landschildkröten. Ausgewachsen sind sie etwa 40 cm lang und bis zu 4 kg schwer. Auffallend sind ihre abgeflachten, stark beschuppten Vorderbeine, die sie u.a. zum Graben ihrer Baue benutzen.[NEWLINE]Gopherschildkröten gibt es nur im Süden Nordamerikas und im Norden Mexikos. Sie leben in den Trockengebieten und am Rande von Wüsten. Tagsüber flüchten sie vor den hohen Temperaturen in ihre unterirdischen Baue, die bis zu 12 m lang und 3 m tief werden können. In der Dämmerung hingegen werden sie aktiv und gehen auf Nahrungssuche. Gopherschildkröten fressen überwiegend pflanzliche Nahrung, aber auch Aas und die Exkremente von Säugetieren. Trinken müssen sie nur sehr selten, da sie das meiste Wasser bereits über die Nahrung aufnehmen.[NEWLINE]Gopherschildkröten zählen zu den bedrohten Tierarten, da ihr Lebensraum immer mehr verloren geht. In einigen Gebieten ist ihr Bestand seit den 80er Jahren um mehr als 90% zurückgegangen. Deshalb ist mittlerweile vielerorts nicht nur der Fang, sondern schon die Berührung wildlebender Schildkröten gesetzlich verboten.
TEXT.Polish: ¯ó³w pustynny (Geochelone sulcata) - jest jednym z bardziej interesuj¹cych gatunków ¿ó³wi l¹dowych, który ¿yje w Afryce. Osi¹ga do 0,5 m d³ugoœci oraz oko³o 50 kg wagi. Jego pancerz grzbietowy, o ochronnej szarobe¿owej barwie i o wyraŸnym rysunku, jest silnie wysklepiony. Koñczyny pokryte s¹ d³ugimi i stosunkowo ostrymi wyrostkami rogowymi. Zaniepokojony, b³yskawicznie chowa g³owê do skorupy, ca³kowicie zas³aniaj¹c otwór przednimi koñczynami.[PARAGRAPH:2]W ogrodach zoologicznych spotykany jest rzadko. W Polsce znajduje siê ca³a hodowla we Wroc³awskim ZOO.

German.Text: Moderner Zerstörer:Modernen Zerstörers:Modernen Zerstörer:Modernen Zerstörer:Moderne Zerstörer:Modernen Zerstörer:Modernen Zerstörern:Modernen Zerstörer

TEXT.English: Destroyers are small escort ships that serve a variety of useful functions. These light, fast vessels were used extensively in World War II to provide air and sea cover for carrier groups. One of the primary functions of the destroyer is to locate and destroy enemy submarines. Using their sonar equipment to locate the subs, and their batteries of depth charges and torpedoes to destroy them, the destroyer forces of World War II were the key to the success of many crucial naval operations. Modern destroyers are still used in much the same role, as escorts for larger vessels and as submarine hunters. In addition to five-inch guns, the arsenal of today's destroyer includes anti-submarine helicopters, anti-ship cruise missiles, and the Phalanx system for defense against anti-ship missiles.
TEXT.French: Les destroyers sont de petits bateaux d'escorte aux fonctions multiples. Ces navires, légers et rapides, furent largement utilisés au cours de la Deuxième Guerre mondiale pour assurer aux porte-avions une couverture contre les menaces aériennes et navales. Une de leurs fonctions principales est de localiser et détruire les sous-marins ennemis. Grâce à leur équipement sonar, leurs batteries de grenades sous-marines et leurs torpilles, les destroyers de la Deuxième Guerre mondiale ont joué un rôle prépondérant dans la plupart des grandes opérations navales. Les destroyers modernes ont conservé leurs rôles de navires d'escortes et de chasseurs de sous-marins. En plus des canons de cinq pouces, l'arsenal des destroyers modernes comprend des hélicoptères de lutte anti sous-marine, des missiles de surface et le système Phalanx de défense antimissile.
TEXT.German: Zerstörer sind kleine Geleitschutzschiffe, die eine Reihe nützlicher Funktionen erfüllen. Während des 2. Weltkrieges wurden diese schnellen und wendigen Seefahrzeuge sehr häufig zur Überwachung und Sicherung des Luft- und Seeraums der begleiteten Flugzeugträger eingesetzt und waren in vielen bedeutenden Gefechten der Schlüssel zum Erfolg. Zu den wichtigsten Aufgaben der Zerstörer gehören auch heute noch die sonargestützte Ortung und die anschließende Zerstörung feindlicher U-Boote mittels der an Bord bereitstehenden Wasserbomben und Torpedos. Das vormals nur aus 5-Zoll-Geschützen bestehende Waffenarsenal wurde beim modernen Zerstörer mittlerweile um Anti-U-Boot-Hubschrauber, Anti-Schiff-Marschflugkörper und ein Phalanxsystem zur Verteidigung gegen Anti-Schiff-Marschflugkörper erweitert.
TEXT.Italian: I cacciatorpedinieri sono piccole navi da scorta che vengono utilizzate in molte occasioni. Queste navi leggere e veloci furono impiegate diffusamente nel corso della Seconda Guerra Mondiale per proteggere le flotte di portaerei da attacchi navali e aerei. Uno dei compiti principali del cacciatorpediniere è individuare e distruggere i sottomarini nemici. Utilizzando la strumentazione sonar per individuare i sottomarini e cariche di profondità e torpedini per distruggerli, i cacciatorpedinieri della Seconda Guerra Mondiale furono la carta vincente per molte importanti operazioni navali. I cacciatorpedinieri moderni vengono ancora impiegati con la stessa funzione di scorta per le navi più grandi e di caccia ai sottomarini. Oltre al cannone da cinque pollici, l'arsenale dei cacciatorpedinieri odierni comprende elicotteri antisommergibili e missili antinave, oltre al sistema Phalanx, per difendersi dai missili antinave avversari.
TEXT.Spanish: Los destructores son pequeños barcos de escolta que llevan a cabo diferentes tareas de gran utilidad. En la Segunda Guerra Mundial, estos ligeros y rápidos buques se usaron a menudo para proporcionar cobertura a las agrupaciones de portaviones. Una de las funciones principales de los destructores es localizar y destruir los submarinos enemigos. Haciendo uso de sus equipos de sonar para localizarlos, y de sus cargas de profundidad y sus torpedos para destruirlos, los destructores de la Segunda Guerra Mundial fueron la clave del éxito de muchas operaciones navales cruciales. Los destructores modernos siguen usándose prácticamente del mismo modo, como escoltas para naves más grandes y cazadores de submarinos. Además de los cañones de cinco pulgadas, el arsenal de los destructores modernos cuenta con helicópteros antisubmarinos, misiles de crucero antinavales y un sistema defensivo antimisiles llamado Falange.

TEXT.English: Dewi Sartika (4 December 1884 - 11 September 1947) was the leading figure and pioneer for the education for women inIndonesia. She founded the first school for women in Dutch East Indies. She was formally acknowledged as a National Hero by the Indonesian government in 1966.
TEXT.French: Dewi Sartika (4 décembre 1884 - 11 septembre 1947) était la figure de proue et pionnière de l'éducation des femmes en Indonésie. Elle a fondé la première école pour femmes dans les Indes orientales néerlandaises. Elle a été officiellement reconnue comme Héroïne Nationale par le gouvernement indonésien en 1966.

TEXT.English: However, in Cochabamba the First Battalion of the Infantry Regiment "Ferdinand VII", led by colonel Jos Martínez, rebelled and side with the independence movement, only to be followed later by the Second Battalion, "Ferdinand VII" Infantry Regiment in Vallegrande, resulting in the forced resignation of Brigadier Francisco Aguilera on February 12. Royalist colonel Jos Manuel Mercado occupied Santa Cruz de la Sierra on February 14, as Chayanta stayed in the hands of lieutenant colonel Pedro Arraya, with the cavalry squadrons "Santa Victoria" (Holy Victory) and "Dragones Americanos" (American Dragoons), and in Chuquisaca the cavalry squadron "Dragones de la Frontera"(Frontier Dragoons) under colonel Francisco López claimed victory for the independence forces on February 22. At this point, the majority of royalist troops of Upper Peru refused to continue fighting against the powerful army of Sucre and switched allegiances. Colonel Medinacelli with 300 soldiers also revolted against Olañeta, and on April 2 of 1825 they faced each other in the Battle of Tumusla, which ended with the death of Olañeta. A few days later, on April 7, general Jos María Valdez surrendered in Chequelte to general Urdininea, putting an end to the war in Upper Peru and signalling victory to the local independence movement which had been active since 1811.

Dharama Pala was the second ruler of the Pala Empire of Bengal region in the Indian Subcontinent. He was the son and successor of Gopala (rule: 750-770 CE), the founder of the Pala Dynasty. He greatly expanded the boundaries of the Pala Empire founded by his father and made the Palas the most dominant power in the northern and eastern Indian subcontinent. He was succeeded by his son Devapala who further expanded the empire.
TEXT.French: Dharma Pala était le deuxième souverain de l'Empire Pala de la région du Bengale dans le sous-continent indien. Il était le fils et successeur de Gopala (règne : 750-770 EC), le fondateur de la dynastie Pala. Il a considérablement étendu les frontières de l'Empire Pala fondé par son père et a fait des Palas la puissance la plus dominante dans le nord et l'est du sous-continent indien. Il a été succédé par son fils Devapala qui a encore étendu l'empire.
TEXT.Polish: Dharmapala by³ drugim w³adc¹ Imperium Pala w Bengalu.

TEXT.English: Dido was a princess of Tyre who founded Carthage. At its peak, her metropolis came to be called the "shining city," ruling 300 other cities around the western Mediterranean and leading the Phoenician (or Punic) world. Dido's brother, King Pygmalion of Tyre, had murdered her husband, the high priest. Dido escaped the tyranny of her own country and founded the "new city" of Carthage and subsequently its later dominions. Details of her life are sketchy and confusing, but the following can be deduced from various sources. Princess Dido was the daughter of King Matten of Tyre (also known as Muttoial or Belus II). When he died, the throne was jointly bequeathed to her and her brother, Pygmalion. She married her uncle Acherbas (also known as Sychaeus) the High Priest of Melqart, a man with both authority and wealth comparable to the king. This furthered rivalry between religion and the monarchy. Pygmalion was a tyrant, lover of both gold and intrigue, who desired the authority and fortune enjoyed by Acherbas. Pygmalion assassinated Acherbas in the temple and kept the misdeed concealed from his sister for a long time, deceiving her with lies about her husband's death. At the same time, the people of Tyre called for a single sovereign, causing dissent within the royal family. In the Roman epic of Virgil, the Aeneid, Queen Dido is first introduced as an extremely respected character in his legend. In just seven years, since their exodus from Tyre, the Carthaginians have rebuilt a successful kingdom under her rule. Her subjects adore her and present her with a festival of praise. Her character is perceived by Virgil as even more noble when she offers asylum to Aeneas and his men, who have recently escaped from Troy. A spirit in the form of the messenger god, Mercury, sent by Jupiter, reminds Aeneas that his mission is not to stay in Carthage with his new-found love, Dido, but to sail to Italy to found Rome. Virgil ends his legend of Dido with the story that, when Aeneas tells Dido, her heart broken, she orders a pyre to be built where she falls upon Aeneas' sword. As she lay dying, she predicted eternal strife between Aeneas' people and her own: "rise up from my bones, avenging spirit" she says, an obvious invocation of Hannibal.
TEXT.Polish: Dydona wed³ug Eneidy Wergiliusza legendarna za³o¿ycielka Kartaginy i jej pierwsza królowa. Wed³ug innej legendy spisanej przez historyka sycylijskiego, Greka Timajosa, w IX w. p.n.e. oraz rzymskiego autora Pompejusza Trogusa, z dalekiego Tyru zbieg³a garstka jego mieszkañców na pó³nocne wybrze¿a Afryki, niedaleko fenickiej kolonii, Utyki. Przywódczyni¹ kolonistów by³a Dydona (zwana te¿ Elisz¹, Eliss¹), która uciek³a, poniewa¿ brat Pigmalion zabi³ jej mê¿a Acharbasa. Gdy wysiedli na l¹d, otoczyli ich Numidyjczycy (autochtoni) i zaczê³y siê pertraktacje. Ostatecznie Dydonie u¿yczono takiego skrawka ziemi na wybrze¿u, jaki obejmie skóra wo³u. Gdy za³o¿one przez ni¹ miasto rozkwit³o, chciwy jej bogactw Jarbas (Iarbas, Hiarbas) poprosi³ o jej rêkê, gro¿¹c w razie odmowy wojn¹. Aby unikn¹æ ma³¿eñstwa z barbarzyñskim królem i pozostaæ wiern¹ zamordowanemu mê¿owi, Dydona wst¹pi³a na zapalony stos i przebi³a siê sztyletem.

TEXT.English: The Second Australian Imperial Force (2nd AIF) was the name given to the volunteer personnel of the Australian Army in World War II. Under the Defence Act (1903), neither the part-time Militia nor full-time the Permanent Military Force (PMF) could serve outside Australia or its territories unless they volunteered to do so. The Second AIF fought against Nazi Germany, Fascist Italy, Vichy France and the Japanese Empire.
TEXT.French: Le Second Australian Imperial Force (2nd AIF) était le nom donné au personnel volontaire de l'armée australienne pendant la Seconde Guerre mondiale. En vertu de la Loi sur la défense (1903), ni la Milice à temps partiel ni la Force militaire permanente (PMF) à plein temps ne pouvaient servir en dehors de l'Australie ou de ses territoires à moins qu'elles ne se portent volontaires pour le faire. Le Second AIF s'est battu contre l'Allemagne nazie, l'Italie fasciste, la France de Vichy et l'Empire japonais.
TEXT.Italian: Seconda forza imperiale australiana (The Second Australian Imperial Force, 2nd AIF) era il nome dato ai volontari dell'esercito australiano nella II guerra mondiale. Secondo il Defence Act (1903), né la milizia ausiliaria né l'esercito permanente (PMF) potevano combattere al di fuori dell'Australia e dei suoi territori, a meno che non fossero volontari. La seconda AIF combatté contro la Germania nazista, l'Italia fascista, la Francia di Vichy e l'impero giapponese.

TEXT.English: Diponegoro also known as Dipanegara, was a Javanese prince who opposed the Dutch colonial rule. He played an important role in the Java War (1825-1830). In 1830, the Dutch exiled him to Makassar.
TEXT.French: Diponegoro, également connu sous le nom de Dipanegara, était un prince javanais qui s'opposait à la domination coloniale néerlandaise. Il a joué un rôle important dans la guerre de Java (1825-1830). En 1830, les Néerlandais l'ont exilé à Makassar.

TEXT.English: Divico was a Gallic king and the leader of the Helvetiian tribe of theTigurini. During the Cimbrian War, in which the Cimbri and Teutonsinvaded the Roman Republic, he led the Tigurini across the Rhine to invade Gaul in 109 BC towards the Roman region of Province. He defeated a Roman army and killed its leaders Lucius Cassius Longinus (consul 107 BC) and Lucius Calpurnius Piso Caesoninus during theBattle of Burdigala in 107 BC. He may also have been the leader of theHelvetiii against Julius Caesar at the Battle of Bibracte in 58 BC.

The dob dobs (referred to as both "warrior monks" and "police monks") were primarily tasked with maintaining law and order in the various monasteries that dotted the country. Dob dobs were more often than not, men from the north and north-eastern region of Tibet (Kham). The men of Kham had distinct physical characteristics - essentially, tall and sturdy well-built men. Mostly on account of their diet owing to the geography of the area they came from. They were also noted for their ferocity. Tibet was full of monasteries - the larger ones often housed thousands of monks. The Sera monastery was famous for its fighting monks.
TEXT.Polish: Mnisi Dob Dob (zwani czasami "mnichami wojownikami" albo "mnichami policjantami") pocz¹tkowo pe³nili obowi¹zki pilnowania przestrzagania ³adu i porz¹dku w licznych klasztorach rozsianych po ca³ym kraju. Najczêœciej pochodzili z pó³nocnych, lub pó³nocno-wschodnich regionów Tybetu.

TEXT.English: Jos Eduardo dos Santos (born 28 August 1942) is an Angolan politician who has been President of Angola since 1979. As President, Jos Eduardo dos Santos is also the commander in chief of the Angolan Armed Forces (FAA) and president of the People's Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA), the party that has ruled Angola since it gained independence in 1975.
TEXT.French: Jos Eduardo dos Santos (né le 28 août 1942) est un homme politique angolais qui est Président de l'Angola depuis 1979. En tant que Président, Jos Eduardo dos Santos est également le commandant en chef des forces armées angolaises (FAA) et président du Mouvement populaire de libération de l'Angola (MPLA), le parti qui gouverne l'Angola depuis son indépendance en 1975.

TEXT.English: Cao Cao had chained his ships from stem to stern, possibly aiming to reduce seasickness in his navy, which comprised mostly northerners who were not used to living on ships. Observing this, divisional commander Huang Gai sent Cao Cao a letter feigning surrender and prepared a squadron of capital ships described as mengchong doujian. The ships had been converted into fire ships by filling them with bundles of kindling, dry reeds, and fatty oil. As Huang Gai's "defecting" squadron approached the midpoint of the river, the sailors applied fire to the ships before taking to small boats. The unmanned fire ships, carried by the southeastern wind, sped towards Cao Cao's fleet and set it ablaze. A large number of men and horses either burned to death or drowned (Chen c. 280:54.1262-63).

Pirates have wreaked havoc in waters worldwide since people began sailing the seas. Not long after ancient peoples took to the sea, such as the Phoenicians and Greeks in the Mediterranean, piracy soon followed. In fact, Homer's Iliad and Odyssey, which were written before 700 B.C., provide early examples of coastal raiding and looting by sea-voyaging bandits. The Dragon Ship Pirate is the first pirate ship available in the game.
TEXT.French: Les pirates ont semé le chaos dans les eaux du monde entier depuis que les hommes ont commencé à naviguer sur les mers. Peu de temps après que les peuples antiques, tels que les Phéniciens et les Grecs en Méditerranée, se soient lancés en mer, la piraterie a rapidement suivi. En fait, l'Iliade et l'Odyssée d'Homère, écrites avant 700 av. J.-C., fournissent des exemples précoces de raids côtiers et de pillages par des bandits naviguant en mer. Le Dragon Ship Pirate est le premier navire pirate disponible dans le jeu.
TEXT.Polish: Piractwo rozwija³o siê tak¿e na Dalekim Wschodzie, gdzie parali siê nim g³ównie Chiñczycy. W Chinach, si³¹ napêdow¹ rozwoju piractwa, by³y wewnêtrzne i zewnêtrzne konflikty pañstwowe oraz podobnie jak w Europie handel, gdy¿ statki kupieckie by³y cennym ³upem dla ka¿dego pirata. Pocz¹wszy od VIII w. rozboje rzeczny i morski zwi¹zane by³y z transportem wodnym, który by³ w Chinach podstawowym œrodkiem przemieszczania siê na odleg³e dystanse. Tamtejsi piraci posiadali ogromne flotylle, licz¹ce do kilkuset statków. Metody jakie stosowali, by³y szczególnie potêpiane przez europejskich w³adców. By³y to przede wszystkim ró¿nego rodzaju fortele polegaj¹ce na przyk³ad na tym, ¿e piraci przebierali siê za pasa¿erów okrêtów, które wyp³ywa³y z portów, po czym znajduj¹c siê na pe³nym morzu, wyci¹gali broñ i terroryzowali za³ogê. Innym rodzajem zasadzki by³o zaimprowizowanie katastrofy morskiej. Gdy ratownicy podp³ywali do rabusiów, aby udzieliæ im pomocy, wówczas ci atakowali ich brutalnie.

TEXT.English: Dragoons were an evolution of using horses as transport for infantry. Dragoons were troops mounted on horses, but did not generally ride them into combat; the troops would dismount before battle, enabling them to take advantage of defensive terrain and fortifications. During the 17th and 18th centuries, many European armies used these units as part of their armies. The name "dragoon" is derived from "dragon", either from using dragon's heads as decorations on early firearms or from a galloping horseman with a burning match resembling a dragon. Dragoon units later evolved into general cavalry units before advances in firearms technology made horse cavalry obsolete. Some units today bear the name "dragoon" in honor of the dragoon units they are descended from.
TEXT.Italian: I dragoni erano l'evoluzione dei cavalli da trasporto per la fanteria. I dragoni erano truppe a cavallo che non combattevano a cavallo; i soldati infatti scendevano da cavallo prima di combattere, permettendo loro di fortificarsi, Durante il 17° e il 18° secolo molti eserciti europei utilizzavano questo tipo di truppe. Il nome "Dragoni" deriva dalle decorazioni presenti sulle armi da fuoco e sui cavalli. I dragoni divennero poi normali forze di cavalleria, e scomparvero con il declino di quest'ultima. Attualmente, molte unità portano il nome di dragoni, dato che discendono da queste antiche unità.
TEXT.Polish: Dragoni - ¿o³nierze formacji wojskowej zwanej dragoni¹, "wynalezionej" przez Henryka IV, króla Francji w koñcu XVI wieku. Walczyli pieszo (rodzaj piechoty), a poruszali siê wierzchem (konno). U¿ywali zarówno broni palnej, jak i bia³ej. Od XVIII w. regimenty dragonii coraz czêœciej walczy³y równie¿ konno. W Rzeczypospolitej Obojga Narodów byli ¿o³nierzami autoramentu cudzoziemskiego. Nazwa prawdopodobnie wziê³a siê od du¿ego nasycenia broni¹ paln¹, st¹d porównanie do smoka (draco - niektóre Ÿród³a podaj¹, ¿e pierwotnie by³a to nazwa krótszego muszkietu, na którym widnia³ stylizowany smok, co nastêpnie przeniesiono na samych ¿o³nierzy).

TEXT.English: The development of lightweight and efficient cold fusion generators has allowed the creation of ever-larger and more deadly land-based vehicles. The so-called "dreadnoughts" are the largest land vehicles ever built, towering over ordinary tanks like a skyscraper over a humble peasant cottage.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dreadnoughts are huge, powerful vehicles, typically equipped with one or more massive main guns and a number of smaller weapons to deal with any close-in opponents. They are heavily-armored, carrying anti-air weapons and the latest in physical and electromagnetic shielding capable of defending against the deadliest attack. It is theorized that a dreadnought could withstand a nuclear explosion, though this has not yet been put to the test.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the field dreadnoughts are usually deployed to attack enemy cities, especially well-defended arcologies cities equipped with electromagnetic shielding. These behemoths are virtually unstoppable, unless the enemy has its own dreadnoughts or is willing to sacrifice huge numbers of lesser troops in suicidal wave assaults.
TEXT.French: Le développement de générateurs de fusion froïde plus légers et plus efficaces permit la création de nouveaux véhicules de combat, plus grands et plus puissants. Ces "dreadnoughts" sont les plus grands véhicules jamais construits. A côté d'eux, les tanks ordinaires semblent minuscules.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les dreadnoughts sont des véhicules gigantesques et ultra puissants, généralement dotés d'un ou plusieurs canons principaux et de tourelles dédiées au combat rapproché. Lourdement blindés, ils sont montés de canons anti-aériens et équipés des tout derniers boucliers électromagnétiques, ce qui leur permet de résister aux attaques les plus destructrices. En théorie, un dreadnought ne peut pas survivre à une explosion nucléaire, mais aucun test n'a encore confirmé cette hypothèse.[PARAGRAPH:1]Au combat, les dreadnoughts sont généralement déployés pour attaquer les villes ennemies et tout particulièrement les arcologies dotées de boucliers électromagnétiques. Ces géants sont virtuellement impossibles à arrêter, à moins que l'ennemi ne dispose d'autres dreadnoughts ou soit prêt à envoyer de nombreuses unités au suicide.
TEXT.German: Die Entwicklung kompakter, leistungsfähiger Kaltfusionsgeneratoren ermöglichte unter anderem auch die Herstellung noch stärkerer und vernichtenderer Landfahrzeuge. Der so genannte "Dreadnought" ist das größte Landfahrzeug, das je gebaut wurde: Er überragt einen herkömmlichen Panzer wie ein Wolkenkratzer eine bescheidene Bauernhütte.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dreadnoughts sind riesige, äußerst effiziente Fahrzeuge, die normalerweise mit einer oder mehreren gewaltigen Primärwaffen und einer Batterie von kleineren Nahkampfwaffen ausgerüstet sind. Sie sind massiv gepanzert, haben Luftabwehrwaffen an Bord und verfügen über modernste physische und elektromagnetische Schildtechnologie, die selbst tödlichste Attacken abwehren kann. Theoretisch könnte ein Dreadnought sogar einer atomaren Explosion standhalten, dies wurde jedoch bislang in der Praxis noch nicht erwiesen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Auf dem Schlachtfeld werden die Dreadnoughts normalerweise für Angriffe auf feindliche Städte eingesetzt, insbesondere gegen gut befestigte Arkologien, die sich mit elektromagnetischen Schilden schützen. Diese Giganten sind praktisch nicht aufzuhalten, es sei denn, der Feind verfügt über eigene Dreadnoughts oder ist bereit, in selbstzerstörerischen Angriffswellen eine enorme Anzahl unterlegener Truppen zu opfern.
TEXT.Italian: Lo sviluppo di generatori per la fusione a freddo leggeri ed efficienti ha portato alla creazione di veicoli terresti ancora più grandi e letali. I cosiddetti "Dreadnought" sono i più grandi veicoli terrestri mai costruiti e torreggiano sui normali carri armati come grattacieli su villette di campagna.[PARAGRAPH:1]I Dreadnought sono veicoli enormi e potenti, solitamente equipaggiati con uno o più enormi cannoni e un numero di armi più piccole per eliminare gli avversari a corto raggio. Sono pesantemente corazzati, hanno armi antiaeree e i più recenti scudi in campo fisico ed elettromagnetico, in grado di difenderli dagli attacchi più letali. Si dice che in teoria un Dreadnought potrebbe resistere a un'esplosione nucleare, anche se tale teoria non è ancora stata messa alla prova.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sul campo i Dreadnought vengono solitamente utilizzati per attaccare le città nemiche, specialmente le arcologie ben difese e dotate di scudi elettromagnetici. Questi giganti sono virtualmente inarrestabili, a meno che il nemico non ne abbia a sua volta uno o sia disposto a sacrificare in attacchi suicidi un enorme numero di truppe meno potenti.
TEXT.Spanish: El desarrollo de generadores de fusión fría ligeros y eficaces ha llevado a la creación de vehículos terrestres cada vez más grandes y mortales. Los llamados "dreadnoughts" son los mayores vehículos jamás construidos, pues se alzan sobre los tanques normales como un rascacielos sobre la choza de un campesino.[PARAGRAPH:1]Los dreadnoughts son vehículos enormes y potentes que suelen ir equipados con uno o más cañones principales enormes y cierto número de armas menores para hacer frente a cualquier enemigo que se acerque. Cuentan con blindaje pesado, llevan armas antiaéreas y el último grito en escudo electromagnéticos, capaces de protegerlos de los ataques más mortíferos. En teoría, un dreadnought podría resistir una explosión atómica, aunque este extremo no ha llegado a probarse.[PARAGRAPH:1]En el campo de batalla, los dreadnoughts se suelen desplegar para atacar ciudades enemigas, especialmente las arcologías, que están muy bien defendidas con escudos electromagnéticos. Estos titanes son prácticamente imparables, a menos que el enemigo cuente con sus propios dreadnoughts o esté dispuesto a sacrificar cantidades ingentes de tropas menores en sucesivas oleadas de ataques suicida

TEXT.English: The dreadnought was the predominant type of 20th-century battleship. The first of the kind, the Royal Navy's Dreadnought had such an impact when launched in 1906 that battleships built after her were referred to as 'dreadnoughts', and earlier battleships became known as pre-dreadnoughts. Her design had two revolutionary features; an 'all-big-gun' armament scheme and steam turbine propulsion. The arrival of the dreadnoughts renewed the naval arms race, principally between Britain and Germany but reflected worldwide, as the new class of warships became a crucial symbol of national power.[PARAGRAPH:2]The concept of an all-big-gun ship had been in development for several years before Dreadnought's construction. The Imperial Japanese Navy had begun work on an all-big-gun battleship in 1904, but finished the ship as a pre-dreadnought; the United States Navy was also building all-big-gun battleships. Technical development continued rapidly through the dreadnought era. Successive designs increased rapidly in size and made use of improvements in armament, armor, and propulsion. Within ten years, new battleships outclassed Dreadnought herself. These more powerful vessels were known as 'super-dreadnoughts'. Most of the dreadnoughts were scrapped after the end of World War I under the terms of the Washington Naval Treaty, but many of the newer super-dreadnoughts continued serving through World War II.[PARAGRAPH:2]While dreadnought building consumed vast resources in the early 20th century, there was only one pitched battle between dreadnought fleets. At the Battle of Jutland, the British and German navies clashed with no decisive result. The term 'dreadnought' gradually dropped from use after World War I, as all battleships shared dreadnought characteristics; it can also be used to describe battlecruisers, the other type of ship resulting from the dreadnought revolution.

TEXT.Russian: Дредноут был преобладающим типом линкоров 20 века. Первый в своем роде дредноут Королевского флота оказал такое влияние, когда был спущен на воду в 1906 году, что построенные после него линкоры стали называть «дредноутами», а более ранние линкоры стали известны как дредноуты. Ее дизайн имел две революционные особенности; схема вооружения «все-большая пушка» и паровая турбина. Прибытие дредноутов возобновило гонку военно-морских вооружений, в основном между Великобританией и Германией, но отразившуюся во всем мире, поскольку новый класс военных кораблей стал решающим символом национальной мощи.[PARAGRAPH:2]Концепция корабля с мощными орудиями большого калибра на борту разрабатывалась за несколько лет до постройки Дредноута. Императорский флот Японии начал работы над линкором с большой артиллерией в 1904 году, но закончил его как дредноут; ВМС Соединенных Штатов также строили крупнокалиберные линкоры. Техническое развитие быстро продолжалось в эпоху дредноутов. Последовательные конструкции быстро увеличивались в размерах и включали улучшения в вооружении, броне и силовой установке. В течение десяти лет новые линкоры превзошли саму Дредноут. Эти более мощные суда были известны как «супер-дредноуты». Большинство дредноутов было списано после окончания Первой мировой войны в соответствии с положениями Вашингтонского военно-морского договора, но многие из более новых супердредноутов продолжали служить во время Второй мировой войны.[PARAGRAPH:2]В то время как в начале 20 века строительство дредноутов потребляло огромные ресурсы, между флотами дредноутов было только одно крупное сражение. В Ютландской битве британские и немецкие флоты столкнулись без решающего результата. Термин «дредноут» постепенно исчез из употребления после Первой мировой войны, поскольку все линкоры имели общие характеристики дредноутов; его также можно использовать для описания линейных крейсеров, другого типа кораблей, возникшего в результате революции дредноутов.

TEXT.English: Those jaded Drone Copters are really showing their age. Well never mind, because here's a smarter, fully robotic helicopter to replace them with.
TEXT.French: Ces drones hélicoptères fatigués montrent vraiment leur âge. Peu importe, voici un hélicoptère entièrement robotisé, plus intelligent, pour les remplacer.
TEXT.Russian: Эти потрепанные в боях дронокоптеры действительно явили свой возраст. Что ж, теперь это неважно, потому что здесь есть более умный, полностью роботизированный вертолет, который придет им на замену.

TEXT.English: Finally, we can put boots on the ground without needing to stuff them with soldiers. No more body bags means never having to say you're sorry for starting a war! As their menacing appearance suggests, they have the firepower to do the job - and they're never afraid to use it...
TEXT.French: Enfin, nous pouvons déployer des forces au sol sans avoir besoin d'y mettre des soldats. Plus de sacs mortuaires signifie ne plus jamais avoir à s'excuser d'avoir déclenché une guerre ! Leur apparence menaçante suggère qu'ils ont la puissance de feu nécessaire pour faire le travail – et ils n'ont jamais peur de l'utiliser...
TEXT.Polish: Droid to okreœlenie wiêkszoœci bardziej skomplikowanych robotów, w tym androidów - zazwyczaj wyposa¿onych w pewien poziom sztucznej inteligencji.

TEXT.English: The need to accommodate humans inside has held the tank back for too long! The dream of the "autonomous land vehicle" is finally here... with a vengeance! Advances in AI mean the Droid Tank is more than a mere intimidatory presence. It has the firepower - and the smarts - to kick serious butt.
TEXT.French: Le besoin d'accueillir des humains à l'intérieur a freiné le développement du char trop longtemps ! Le rêve du « véhicule terrestre autonome » est enfin là... avec force ! Les progrès de l'IA signifient que le Droid Tank est plus qu'une simple présence intimidante. Il a la puissance de feu – et l'intelligence – pour botter sérieusement des culs.
TEXT.Polish: Droid to okreœlenie wiêkszoœci bardziej skomplikowanych robotów, w tym androidów - zazwyczaj wyposa¿onych w pewien poziom sztucznej inteligencji.

TEXT.French: Navire antique utilisant le Feu Gréco-Romain
TEXT.Italian: Antica nave in grado di utilizzare il fuoco greco
TEXT.Spanish: Un navío antiguo que utiliza el fuego griego.

TEXT.English: Due to the low cost of miniature UAVs, this technology brings aerial reconnaissance into the hands of soldiers on the ground. The soldier on the ground can both control the UAV and see its output, yielding great benefit over a disconnected approach. With small systems being man packable, operators are now able to deploy air assets quickly and directly. The low cost and ease of operation of these miniature UAVs has enabled forces such as the Libyan Rebels to use miniature UAVs.
TEXT.French: En raison du faible coût des mini-UAV, cette technologie met la reconnaissance aérienne entre les mains des soldats au sol. Le soldat au sol peut à la fois contrôler l'UAV et visualiser ses données, ce qui offre un avantage considérable par rapport à une approche déconnectée. Avec des systèmes compacts transportables par l'homme, les opérateurs peuvent désormais déployer rapidement et directement des ressources aériennes. Le faible coût et la facilité d'utilisation de ces mini-UAV ont permis à des forces telles que les rebelles libyens d'en faire usage.
TEXT.Russian: Благодаря невысокой стоимости миниатюрных БПЛА эта технология дает возможность воздушной разведки солдатам на земле. Наземный оператор может одновременно управлять БЛА и видеть его выход, что дает большие преимущества по сравнению с автономным подходом. Благодаря тому, что небольшие системы могут быть собраны человеком, операторы теперь могут быстро и напрямую развертывать авиационные средства. Низкая стоимость и простота эксплуатации этих миниатюрных БЛА позволили таким силам, как ливийские повстанцы, использовать подобные миниатюрные БЛА.

TEXT.English: A shuttlecraft, also known as a shuttle spacecraft, shuttle ship, drop shuttle, drop spacecraft, or dropship, is a type of spacecraft described in theory and science fiction. Serving the same purpose as a ship's tender, it is a smaller vessel that is launched from a mother ship, and has the ability to transport people or cargo between ships, or to and from a planet's surface without being damaged or destroyed. It has a secondary purpose as an evacuation ship if the mother ship is destroyed. While the Space Shuttle was envisioned to make this type of craft a reality and reduce the cost of going into space, it ultimately failed in its goal and expendable launch systems remained a more cost-effective option.

At the point that Medical Care begins to become a scrutinized research practice and science, the Doctor was the practicing physician relied upon to deliver assistance where needed. Often Doctors would work house calls and go to the patient if at all possible. Interestingly, often Doctors were also the Barbers of the town.
TEXT.French: Au moment où les soins médicaux commencent à devenir une pratique et une science de recherche scrutée, le médecin était le praticien de confiance pour fournir une assistance là où c'était nécessaire. Souvent, les médecins faisaient des visites à domicile et allaient voir le patient si possible. Fait intéressant, les médecins étaient souvent aussi les barbiers du village.
TEXT.Russian: В те времена, когда целительство становится тщательно изученной исследовательской практикой и наукой, доктора были практикующими врачами, на которых полагались, чтобы получить в случае необходимости медицинскую помощь. Часто врачи совершали вызовы на дом и обращались к пациенту, если это было возможно. Интересно, что доктора также бывали одновременно и городскими цирюльниками.

TEXT.English: The Jugunthiz ("Youth") is a unit of lightly armed skirmisher troops who break up and harass enemy formations before the main battle lines meet, and act as a screen for heavy troops, taking losses in order to increase the odds of survival of more valuable "proven" warriors (Dugunthiz) who stand just behind. They must first prove themselves in battle in order to earn experience and status and fight beside their betters. Their skills also make them useful in springing tactical ambushes. Each warrior is armed with a bundle of throwing spears, a slightly longer spear for melee and a stout ovular shield, but they do not wear armor, being poor and of low status, but also choosing speed over protection.
The Early Chariot is the first attempt at militarizing horses, by shackling two horses to a cart. This unit can overrun melee units with ease.
TEXT.French: Le char primitif est la première tentative de militariser les chevaux, en attachant deux chevaux à un chariot. Cette unité peut aisément submerger les unités de mêlée.
TEXT.Italian: Il carro primitivo è il primo tentativo di usare i cavalli in battagli, attaccando un carro a due cavalli; quest'unità può facilmente sconfiggere i nemici appiedati.
TEXT.Spanish: El Carro antiguo es el primer intento de uso de los caballos en el ámbito militar, encadenando a dos de ellos a un carruaje. Esta unidad abalanzarse sobre unidades a pie con facilidad.

TEXT.English: The word "fighter" was first used to describe a two seater aircraft, with sufficient lift to carry a machine gun and its operator as well as the pilot. The first such "fighters" belonged to the "gunbus" series of experimental gun carriers of the British Vickers company which culminated in the Vickers F.B.5 Gunbus of 1914. The main drawback of this type of aircraft was its lack of speed. It was quickly realised that an aircraft intended to destroy its kind in the air needed at least to be fast enough to catch its quarry.[PARAGRAPH:1]Fortunately another type of military aircraft already existed, which was to form the basis for an effective "fighter" in the modern sense of the word. It was based on the small fast aircraft developed before the war for such air races as the Gordon Bennett and Schneider trophies. The military scout aeroplane was not initially expected to be able to carry serious armament, but to rely on its speed to be able to reach the location it was required to "scout" or reconnoitre and return quickly to report all the time making a difficult target for AA artillery or enemy gun-carrying aircraft. British "scout" aircraft in this sense included the Sopwith Tabloid and Bristol Scout French equivalents included the light, fast Morane-Saulnier N.[PARAGRAPH:1]Hanz Schneider had patented a device before the war to interrupt the machine gun's stream of bullets (by preventing it from firing when the propeller's blade was in the way) before the war and Anthony Fokker developed this into the Interrupter gear that would make the Fokker Eindecker such a feared name over the Western Front despite it being an adaptation of an obsolete pre-war French Morane-Saulnier racing monoplane. Simultaneously, Roland Garros (the first French 'Flying ace') was also working on a Interrupter gear, which attempted to time the firing of the individual rounds similarly when the propellor wasn't in the way. Unfortunately his choice of machine gun was poor - the gas operated Hotchkiss wasn't predictable enough to be able to time the firing and as a desperation measure he fitted metal wedges to protect the propeller's blades. At the same time the RNAS was taping up the blades on its scouts so that any rounds that damaged the prop wouldn't cause it to fail before the aircraft could be landed, with the fabric from the tape hopefully holding the blade together.
TEXT.Polish: Samolot myœliwski, myœliwiec samolot bojowy przeznaczony przede wszystkim do zwalczania innych statków powietrznych i uzyskania przewagi powietrznej, jak i obrony w³asnych samolotów o innym przeznaczeniu, czym ró¿ni siê od bombowców, s³u¿¹cych do atakowania celów naziemnych, g³ównie przy u¿yciu bomb. Myœliwce z za³o¿enia s¹ wzglêdnie ma³e, przewa¿nie jednomiejscowe, a przy tym silnie uzbrojone, szybkie i bardzo zwrotne.

TEXT.English: An imperial guard or palace guard is a special group of troops (or a member thereof) of an empire, typically closely associated directly with the Emperor or Empress. Usually these troops embody a more elite status than other imperial forces, including the regular armed forces, and maintain special rights, privileges and traditions. Because the head of state often wishes to be protected by the best soldiers available, their numbers and organisation may be expanded to carry out additional tasks. In the post-colonial period, the term has been used colloquially and derisively to describe the staff of a person, usually a politician or corporate executive officer, that acts to prevent direct communication with the person.
TEXT.Italian: Unità per la difesa della capitale. Solo una è permessa per ogni civiltà.
TEXT.Spanish: Unidad defensora de la capital. Solo se permite una por civilización.
TEXT.Polish: Gwardia (w³. guardia - stra¿) - pocz¹tkowo stra¿ przyboczna monarchy lub wodza, póŸniej doborowe oddzia³y liniowe. Stacjonowa³y g³ównie w stolicy pañstwa.
TEXT.Russian: Имперская гвардия или дворцовая гвардия - это особая группа войск, обычно тесно связанная с Императором или Императрицей. Обычно эти войска обладают более элитарным статусом, чем прочие имперские силы, включая регулярные вооруженные формирования, и поддерживают особые права, привилегии и традиции. Поскольку глава государства часто желает быть защищенным лучшими солдатами, их численность и организация могут быть расширены для выполнения дополнительных задач. В постколониальный период данное определение использовалось в разговорной и насмешливой форме для обозначения охраны должностных лиц, чаще всего политических деятелей или выборных госслужащих, которые отгораживаются телохранителями от общества.

TEXT.English: The first aircraft to incorporate the principles of the jet engine was the Coanda-1910. Its engine, unlike modern jet engines, used a piston engine rather than a turbine to drive its compressor. The aircraft crashed during its first and only demonstration but remained intact. The first true turbine-equipped jetplane was the Heinkel He 178 (Germany), piloted by Erich Warsitz on August 27, 1939. The first operational jet fighter was the Messerschmitt Me 262, piloted by Fritz Wendel. It was the fastest conventional aircraft of World War II - only the rocket-powered Messerschmitt Me 163 Komet was faster. Mass production started in 1944, too late for a decisive impact on the outcome of the war. About the same time, the United Kingdom's Gloster Meteor made up the first operational jet fighter squadron in 1944. It was used to defend the UK against the V1 flying bomb and in ground-attack operations over Europe towards the end of the war. The Imperial Japanese Navy also developed jet aircraft in 1945, including the Nakajima J9Y Kikka, partially inspired by German designs.
TEXT.Polish: Coanda 1910 (znany tak¿e jako Coanda 1)? pierwszy na œwiecie samolot z silnikiem odrzutowym (powszechnie uwa¿any za pierwszy samolot odrzutowy Heinkel He 178 by³ pierwszym samolotem ze wspó³czeœnie u¿ywanym silnikiem turboodrzutowym) zbudowany przez rumuñskiego konstruktora Henriego Coandê w 1910. Samolot ten u¿ywa³ opracowany przez Coandê prymitywny silnik odrzutowy.

TEXT.English: The Maceman is a warrior wielding a stick topped with a spiked metal ball.
TEXT.French: Le massier est un guerrier maniant un bâton terminé par une boule métallique hérissée de pointes.
TEXT.Italian: Il guerriero con mazza utilizza come arma un'asta con in cima una palla in metallo.
TEXT.Spanish: El Soldado con maza es un luchador que lleva un palo con una bola de metal con clavos en su parte superior.
TEXT.Polish: Maczuga - jedna z najstarszych broni obuchowych; znana by³a od paleolitu, rozpowszechniona na wszystkich kontynentach zamieszkiwanych przez cz³owieka. Jej póŸniejsze odmiany, takie jak ber³o, bu³awa czy buzdygan, bywa³y czêsto oznak¹ w³adzy.
