TEXT.English: Tanks were first manufactured during World War I in an effort to break the deadlock of trench warfare. The British Army realized that they required a vehicle that had the mobility to reach the enemy trenches over barbed wire and rough terrain, the armour to withstand small arms fire and shrapnel from artillery and the weaponry to suppress or destroy enemy infantry, machine gun nests and pillboxes.
TEXT.French: Les chars furent fabriqués pour la première fois pendant la Première Guerre mondiale afin de briser l'impasse de la guerre des tranchées. L'armée britannique réalisa qu'elle avait besoin d'un véhicule suffisamment mobile pour atteindre les tranchées ennemies par-dessus les fils barbelés et les terrains accidentés, d'un blindage pour résister aux tirs d'armes légères et aux éclats d'artillerie, et d'une armement pour supprimer ou détruire l'infanterie ennemie, les nids de mitrailleuses et les blockhaus.
TEXT.Polish: Pierwsze czo³gi, oznaczone Mark I wesz³y do akcji w bitwy pod Somm¹, czo³gi by³y u¿yte w roli wsparcia piechoty. Pierwsze zmasowane natarcie czo³gów mia³o miejsce w czasie bitwy pod Cambrai. Jedyn¹ niemieck¹ konstrukcj¹ z okresu I wojny œwiatowej by³ nieudany czo³g A7V. Za najbardziej udany czo³g I wojny œwiatowej uwa¿ana jest francuska konstrukcja FT-17. Okres miêdzywojenny to czas prób i udoskonalania istniej¹cych pomys³ów. W wiêkszoœci krajów powsta³y konstrukcje czo³gów "szybkich" i "piechoty" - przeznaczonych albo do niszczenia czo³gów nieprzyjaciela i szybkich ataków na ty³y wroga (czo³g poœcigowy) albo do wsparcia piechoty (czo³g piechoty). W III Rzeszy oprócz czo³gów lekkich (PzKpfw I, PzKpfw II) zaprojektowano dwa czo³gi œrednie - PzKpfw III (pocz¹tkowo z armat¹ 37 mm, w póŸniejszym czasie z armatami wiêkszego kalibru) przeznaczony do zwalczania pojazdów nieprzyjaciela i PzKpfw IV (pocz¹tkowo z krótkolufow¹ armat¹ 75 mm) przeznaczonym do wspomagania piechoty. Pierwszymi czo³gami uzbrojonymi w armaty "uniwersalne" (d³ugolufowe armaty kalibru ponad 50 mm pozwalaj¹ce na u¿ywanie skutecznej amunicji przeciwpancernej jak i od³amkowej i krusz¹cej) by³y radzieckie konstrukcje KW-1 i T-34.

TEXT.English: The Ecologist is a person who studies the ecology of an area and tries to preserve it.
TEXT.French: L'écologiste est une personne qui étudie l'écologie d'une zone et tente de la préserver.
TEXT.Italian: L'ecologista è una persona che studia l'ecologia di un'area, cercando di preservarla.
TEXT.Polish: Ekologia (gr. oikos + -logia = dom (stosunki ¿yciowe) + nauka) - nauka o strukturze i funkcjonowaniu przyrody, zajmuj¹ca siê badaniem oddzia³ywañ pomiêdzy organizmami a ich œrodowiskiem oraz wzajemnie miêdzy tymi organizmami (struktur¹ ekosystemów).

TEXT.English: In July 1831 - a few months after the abdication of Emperor Pedro I of Brazil at Rio de Janeiro - a rebellion in the military garrison of Belém do Para broke out, and Batista Campos was imprisoned as one of the implicated leaders. The indignation of the poor grew, and in 1833 already there was talk of converting Brazil into a federation. The provincial president, Bernardo Lobo de Souza, unleashed a repressive political wave, in an attempt to contain the separatists. The climax was reached in 1834, when Batista Campos published a letter from the Bishop of Para, Romualdo de Sousa Coelho, criticizing various politicians from the province. For not having permission from the provincial government, Campos was persecuted, and sought refuge on the fazenda of his friend Clemente Malcher. Meeting the Vinagre brothers (Manuel Vinagre, Francisco Pedro Vinagre, and Antônio Vinagre) and the India-rubber collector and journalist Eduardo Angelim they joined a contingent of rebels on Malcher's plantation. Before being attacked by government forces, they abandoned the plantation. Nevertheless, on November 3, troops managed to kill Manuel Vinagre and hold Malcher and other rebels. Batista Campos died on the last day of the year, apparently because of an infection caused by a cut he suffered while shaving.

Egushawa (c.1726 - March 1796), also spelled Egouch-e-ouay, Agushaway, Agashawa, Negushwa, and many other variants, was a war chief and principal political chief of the Ottawa tribe of North American Indians. His name is loosely translated as "The Gatherer" or "Brings Together" (c.f. Ojibwe agwazhe'waa, "to quilt something(s); to blanket someone(s)"). He was a prominent leader among the Detroit Ottawa, a prominent group in southeast Michigan and northwest Ohio. Egushawa is considered a successor to Chief Pontiac. As a leader in two wars against the United States, Egushawa was one of the most influential Native Americans of the Great Lakes region in the late eighteenth century.

The chariot was the earliest means of transportation in combat other than man's own powers of locomotion. The earliest known chariots, shown in Sumerian depictions from about 2500 BC, were not true chariots but four-wheeled carts with solid wooden wheels, heavy and cumbersome and lacking a pivoting front axle. The Hyksos apparently introduced the Assyrian chariot into Egypt shortly thereafter, where it was perfected for transportation and warfare. Within 500 years, Egyptian, Hittite and Palestinian chariots were extraordinarily light and maneuverable vehicles, the wheels and tires in particular exhibiting great sophistication in design and fabrication. Egyptian war chariots were drawn by either two or three horses, which were harnessed by means of chest girths secured by a pole and a yoke.[PARAGRAPH:2]The decline of the war chariot by the end of the 2nd millennium BC was probably related to the spread of iron weaponry, but it was surely related also to the breeding of horses with sufficient strength and stamina to carry an armed man into battle. Armed horsemen replaced the chariot in most Mediterranean civilizations. The use of chariots in war lingered in areas of slower technological advance, but in classical Egypt they were retained mainly for ceremonial functions.
TEXT.French: Le char de guerre fut le premier moyen de locomotion autre que la marche à pied utilisé pour la guerre. Les plus anciens chars connus, qui apparaissent sur des représentations sumériennes datant d'environ 2 500 av. J.-C., n'étaient pas de véritables chars, mais plutôt des charrettes à quatre roues en bois, lourdes, encombrantes et dépourvues d'essieu à l'avant. Un peu plus tard, les Hyksôs introduisirent le char assyrien en Egypte, où il fut amélioré pour le transport et la guerre. Moins de 500 ans après, les Egyptiens, les Hittites et les Palestiniens possédaient des chars incroyablement légers et manoeuvrables, munis de roues extrêmement sophistiquées. Les chars de guerre égyptiens étaient tirés par deux ou trois chevaux, attelés par des sangles fixées à un joug.[PARAGRAPH:2]Le déclin du char, vers la fin du deuxième millénaire av. J.-C., est probablement lié à l'apparition massive des armes en fer, mais aussi très certainement à l'apparition de races de chevaux suffisamment forts et endurants pour transporter un homme à la bataille. Le char fut ainsi remplacé dans la plupart des civilisations méditerranéennes par des cavaliers armés. L'utilisation des chars pour la guerre a perduré dans des régions moins avancées techniquement, mais dans l'Egypte antique, son emploi était limité à des fonctions de cérémonie.
TEXT.German: Der Streitwagen war mit Ausnahme der eigenen Fortbewegungsfäigkeit des Menschen das früeste Transportmittel im Kampf. Die früesten Streitwägen, bekannt aus sumerischen Darstellungen von ca. 2500 vor Christus, waren keine echte Streitwägen, sondern schwere, schlecht zu manövrierende vierrädrige Karren mit soliden Holzrädern, die noch keine lenkbare Vorderachse besaßen. Vermutlich waren es die Hyksos, die kurz darauf den assyrischen Streitwagen nach Ägypten brachten, wo er für Transport- und Kampfzwecke optimiert wurde. Innerhalb von 500 Jahren wurden die von Ägyptern, Hethitern und Palästinensern verwendeten Streitwagen außerordentlich leicht manövrierfähig, wobei vor allem die Räder und Reifen besonders durchdacht gestaltet und verarbeitet waren. Die ägyptischen Kriegsstreitwagen wurden von entweder zwei oder drei Pferden gezogen, die mit Hilfe eines Brustgeschirrs angespannt waren, das durch ein Gestänge und einen Bügel gesichert war.[PARAGRAPH:2]Der Niedergang des Kriegsstreitwagens gegen Ende des 2. Jahrtausends vor Christus stand allem Anschein nach im Zusammenhang mit dem vermehrten Einsatz von Eisenwaffen - fest steht allerdings auch, dass die Verdrängung dieser Gefährte aus dem Militärwesen etwas mit der Aufzucht von Pferderassen zu tun hatte, die über ausreichend Kraft und Kondition verfügten, um einen bewaffneten Soldaten in die Schlacht tragen zu können. In den meisten Zivilisationen des Mittelmeerraums wurde der Streitwagen durch bewaffnete Reiter ersetzt. In Regionen, in denen der technologische Fortschritt nur langsam Einzug hielt, wurden Streitwagen auch weiterhin im Gefecht eingesetzt, im klassischen Ägypten dienten sie hingegen in erster Linie nur noch für zeremoniellen Zwecken.
TEXT.Italian: La biga fu il primo mezzo di trasporto in combattimento al di là del potere locomotorio umano. I primi esemplari conosciuti, rappresentati in dipinti sumeri intorno al 2500 a. C., non erano vere bighe, ma carri con quattro ruote di legno, pesanti e ingombranti, senza un asse sterzante anteriore. Pare che siano stati gli Hyksos a introdurre il carro assiro in Egitto poco tempo dopo, un mezzo perfetto per il trasporto e per la guerra. Per 500 anni, i carri egizi, ittiti e palestinesi furono veicoli straordinariamente leggeri e manovrabili; in particolare, le ruote e i loro rivestimenti mostravano una notevole cura nel progetto e nella fabbricazione. I carri da guerra egizi erano trainati da due o tre cavalli, i quali erano bardati al petto e fissati al carro con un paletto e un giogo.[PARAGRAPH:2]Il declino del carro da guerra, alla fine del secondo millennio a. C., fu dovuto probabilmente alla diffusione delle armi in ferro, ma sicuramente anche alle nuove razze di cavalli, dotate di forza e resistenza sufficienti a trasportare un uomo armato in battaglia. I cavalieri armati sostituirono il carro nella maggior parte delle civiltà mediterranee. L'uso dei carri in guerra continuò nelle aree tecnologicamente meno progredite, ma nell'Egitto classico furono conservati solamente per funzioni cerimoniali.
TEXT.Spanish: El carro es el más antiguo medio de transporte militar, aparte de los medios de locomoción naturales del hombre. Los primeros carros de los que se tiene noticia, representados en imágenes sumerias datadas alrededor del 2500 a.C., no eran carros en el sentido estricto de la palabra, sino más bien carromatos con cuatro sólidas ruedas de madera, pesados y torpes, desprovistos de eje central pivotante. Según parece, los hicsos introdujeron poco después el carro asirio en Egipto, donde fue perfeccionado como medio de transporte y artefacto bélico. Antes de que transcurrieran quinientos años, los egipcios, hititas y palestinos habían desarrollado carros extraordinariamente livianos y maniobrables. En especial, las ruedas y llantas exhibían enorme sofisticación en su diseño y fabricación. Los carros de guerra de los egipcios eran tirados por dos o tres caballos, cuyos arreos consistían en cinchas pectorales fijadas por una barra y un yugo.[PARAGRAPH:2]Posiblemente, el declive del carro de guerra a finales del II milenio a. C. estuviera relacionado con la generalización del armamento de hierro y, con toda seguridad, con la aparición de razas de caballos con la fuerza y resistencia necesarias para transportar un hombre armado. Los jinetes armados reemplazaron al carro en la mayoría de las civilizaciones mediterráneas. Los carros de guerra siguieron utilizándose en áreas atrasadas desde el punto de vista tecnológico, pero en el Egipto clásico se conservaron principalmente por razones ceremoniales.

TEXT.English: The Elephant Gunner is an elephant with a primitive artillery piece on its back. The artillery, combined with the elephants size, make it doubly terrifying to its enemies.
TEXT.French: Le tireur d'éléphant est un éléphant équipé d'une pièce d'artillerie primitive sur son dos. L'artillerie, combinée à la taille de l'éléphant, le rend doublement terrifiant pour ses ennemis.
TEXT.Italian: L'artiglieria su elefante consiste in un pezzo di artiglieria montato su un elefante; è terrificante sia per la sua dimensione, sia per la sua potenza.
TEXT.Polish: S³oñ bojowy - s³oñ wykorzystywany w dzia³aniach wojennych, przede wszystkim w staro¿ytnoœci. G³ównym przeznaczeniem s³oni bojowych by³y szar¿e, maj¹ce na celu wzniecenie paniki w szeregach wroga lub przerwanie jego szyków. Diadochowie u¿ywali tych zwierz¹t tak¿e do ochrony w³asnych wojsk przed atakami jazdy nieprzyjaciela. Oddzia³y s³oni uczestniczy³y miêdzy innymi w bitwach nad rzek¹ Hydaspes (326 p.n.e.), Herakle¹ (280 p.n.e.), Zam¹ (202 p.n.e.) i Tapsus (46 p.n.e.).

TEXT.English: The war elephant was first used in India and was known to the Persians by the 4th Century BC. Using war elephants, Candra Gupta defeated Alexander's successor Seleucus and established the Mauryan Empire. Though Carthage's African war elephants accomplished little subsequently, their presence in Hannibal's army during his transit of the Alps into the heart of Rome in 218 BC established their reputation as a fearsome weapon. The elephant's tactical importance apparently stemmed in large part from its willingness to charge both foot soldiers and cavalry and from the panic that it inspired. Although used in Indian military forces until the 20th Century, as with so many traditional weapons, the utility of elephants in war ended with the widespread use of gunpowder.
TEXT.French: L'utilisation des éléphants pour la guerre a commencé en Inde et était connue des Perses au IVe siècle av. J.-C. C'est grâce à ses éléphants de guerre que Chandragupta parvint à vaincre Seleucos, le successeur d'Alexandre le Grand, et à fonder l'Empire maurya. Même si les éléphants africains de Carthage ont peu d'exploits à leur actif, leur présence dans l'armée d'Hannibal lors de la traversée des Alpes en 218 av. J.-C. leur a valu une réputation d'arme redoutable. L'importance tactique des éléphants repose beaucoup sur leur capacité à attaquer l'infanterie comme la cavalerie, et à inspirer la terreur. Bien que les armées indiennes aient utilisé l'éléphant jusqu'au XXe siècle, son utilité dans la pratique de la guerre a pris fin avec l'invention de la poudre à canon.
TEXT.German: Der Kriegselefant wurde zuerst in Indien eingesetzt und war den Persern im 4. Jahrhundert vor Christus schon geläufig. Mit Hilfe von Kriegselefanten gelang es dem indischen König Chandragupta, die Truppen von Seleukos, dem Nachfolger Alexanders des Großen, zu besiegen und das Maurya-Reich zu begründen. Auch wenn die afrikanischen Kriegselefanten der Karthager nur wenig ausrichten konnten, so machten sie ihrem Ruf als gefürchtetes Kriegsgerät alle Ehre, als Hannibal seine Truppen mitsamt den Dickhäutern über die Alpen führte, um im Jahre 218 vor Christus in Rom einzufallen. Die taktische Bedeutung der Kriegselefanten resultiert zum großen Teil aus ihrer Eigenschaft, sowohl Fußsoldaten als auch die Kavallerie anzugreifen und in Panik zu versetzen. Das indische Militär setzte sie zwar noch bis zum 20. Jahrhundert aktiv ein, letztlich erging es ihnen am Ende aber wie vielen anderen traditionellen "Waffen": Ihr militärischer Nutzen endete mit dem verbreiteten Einsatz von Schießpulver.
TEXT.Italian: L'elefante da guerra fu usato per la prima volta in India e fu conosciuto dai Persiani intorno al quarto secolo a. C. Grazie a queste unità, Candra Gupta sconfisse il successore di Alessandro, Seleuco, e fondò l'Impero Maurya. Anche se gli elefanti da guerra africani di Cartagine non furono determinanti, la loro presenza nell'esercito di Annibale durante la sua traversata delle Alpi verso il cuore di Roma, nel 218 a. C., affermò la loro reputazione di arma temibile. Apparentemente, l'importanza tattica dell'elefante si basa in gran parte sulla sua predisposizione a caricare sia i fanti che la cavalleria, nonché sul panico che è in grado di suscitare. Malgrado sia stato usato nelle truppe indiane fino al XX secolo, alla pari di molte armi tradizionali, la sua utilità in guerra è cessata con la diffusione della polvere da sparo.
TEXT.Spanish: Los elefantes de guerra fueron utilizados por primera vez en la India, y los persas ya lo conocían hacia el siglo IV a. C. Utilizando elefantes de guerra, Chandragupta derrotó a Seleuco, sucesor de Alejandro, y fundó el imperio mauryan. Aunque estos animales no sirvieron de mucho a Cartago, su presencia en el ejército de Aníbal durante el cruce de los Alpes y la invasión de Roma en el año 218 a. C. bastó para cimentar su reputación como armas terribles. La importancia táctica de los elefantes derivaba aparentemente de su disposición a cargar tanto contra la infantería como contra la caballería, y del pánico que esto inspiraba. Aunque sirvieron en el ejército indio hasta el siglo XX, su utilidad real, al igual que ocurrió con muchas otras armas tradicionales, terminó con la difusión generalizada de la pólvora.
TEXT.Polish: S³oñ bojowy s³oñ wykorzystywany w dzia³aniach wojennych, przede wszystkim w staro¿ytnoœci. G³ównym przeznaczeniem s³oni bojowych by³y szar¿e, maj¹ce na celu wzniecenie paniki w szeregach wroga lub przerwanie jego szyków. Diadochowie u¿ywali tych zwierz¹t tak¿e do ochrony w³asnych wojsk przed atakami jazdy nieprzyjaciela. Oddzia³y s³oni uczestniczy³y miêdzy innymi w bitwach nad rzek¹ Hydaspes (326 p.n.e.), Herakle¹ (280 p.n.e.) i Tapsus (46 p.n.e.).

TEXT.English: The Elmeti were non-noble knights of Italy. Their name is derived from the Italian term for helmet, referring to the headgear they wore along with the finely crafted plate armor. The Elmeti fought in a series of skirmishes between Italy and other European states during the latter half of the fifteenth century. One key battle occurred in 1487 at Ponte di Crevola, where the Milanese army, led by Trivulzio, defeated Swiss forces in a battle that foreshadowed nearly half a century of further European encroaches into Italy - a period now known as the Italian Wars.

Elpidio Rivera Quirino (born Elpidio Quirino y Rivera; November 16, 1890 - February 29, 1956) was a Filipino-Chinese politician who served as the sixth President of the Philippines from 1948 to 1953. A lawyer by profession, Quirino entered politics when he became a representative of Ilocos Sur from 1919 to 1925. He was then elected as senator from 1925-1931. In 1934, he became a member of the Philippine independence commission that was sent to Washington, D.C., which secured the passage of Tydings-McDuffie Act to American Congress. In 1935, he was also elected to the convention that drafted the 1935 constitution for the newly established Commonwealth. In the new government, he served as secretary of the interior and finance under President Manuel Quezon's cabinet.

El Cid was also known as Rodrigo Daz de Vivar, Ruy Daz de Vivar (also spelled Bivar), and El Campeador ("the Champion"). His title of "the Cid" comes from a Spanish dialect of Arabic, sidi, meaning "sir" or "lord," and was a title he acquired during his lifetime. Being the national hero of Spain. El Cid displayed remarkable military ability in his conquest of Valencia, and after his death he became the subject of many legends, stories, and poems, including the 12th-century epic El cantar de mo Cid ("The Song of the Cid"). Born into minor nobility, Rodrigo Daz de Vivar was raised in a royal household and was appointed the standard-bearer and commander of troops by Sancho II. Fighting for Sancho against Sancho's brother, Alfonso, would prove awkward to Daz when Sancho died childless and Alfonso became king. Though he lost some prestige, he married Alfonso's niece, Jimena; and, despite his presence serving as a magnet for Alfonso's opponents, Daz served loyally for several years. Then, after leading an unauthorized raid into Toledo, Daz was exiled. Diaz then fought for the Muslim rulers of Saragossa for almost 10 years, scoring significant victories against Christian troops. When Alfonso was defeated by the Almoravids in 1086, he recalled Diaz from exile, though the Cid did not stay in the kingdom for long. He embarked on a long campaign to take over Valencia, which he successfully captured in 1094 and ruled in Alfonso's name until he died. After his death, literature and poetry lionizing the Cid would obscure the facts of Daz's life. A popular legend, possible true, states that El Cid won a victory after death, when his soldiers put his dead body on his horse, and his enemies, believing him to be alive, fled the battlefield.
TEXT.Polish: Rodrigo Diaz de Vivar (ur. ok. 1043 w Vivar del Cid w prowincji Burgos, zm. 10 lipca 1099 w Walencji), zwany Cydem Walecznym (hiszp. TEXT.English: Endubis (c. 270-c. 300) was a King of the Kingdom of Aksum. He was among the earliest rulers in the Horn region to mint coins. This Aksumite currency was issued in gold and silver denominations.
TEXT.French: Endubis (vers 270-vers 300) fut un roi du royaume d'Aksoum. Il fut parmi les premiers souverains de la région de la Corne à frapper des monnaies. Cette monnaie aksoumite était émise en or et en argent.

TEXT.English: As society complexifies and leadership emerges, those who serve the will of the leaders begin to exert their strength over the people to enforce that will. Usually in primitive societies the will of the leader would serve the best intentions for the people, even if the people didn't always agree.
TEXT.French: À mesure que la société se complexifie et que le leadership émerge, ceux qui servent la volonté des dirigeants commencent à exercer leur force sur le peuple pour faire appliquer cette volonté. Généralement, dans les sociétés primitives, la volonté du chef servait les meilleures intentions pour le peuple, même si celui-ci n'était pas toujours d'accord.

TEXT.English: A soldier of the British Army. The usual uniform of British soldiers during the 18th and 19th centuries (prior to the introduction of khaki) was a red (or scarlet) coat and white breeches. The epithet "Redcoats" was used throughout the world, but is particularly associated with the American colonists. The term is still used in Ireland to refer to the British Army, and sometimes to all British people.
TEXT.French: Soldat de l'armée britannique. L'uniforme traditionnel des troupes britanniques, au cours des XVIIIe et XIXe siècles (avant l'introduction du kaki), se composait d'un manteau rouge (ou écarlate) et de culottes blanches. L'expression "Tuniques Rouges" était utilisée dans le monde entier, notamment par les colons américains. Les Irlandais désignent encore ainsi les soldats britanniques, et parfois même le peuple britannique dans son ensemble.
TEXT.German: Ein Soldat der britischen Armee. Die Uniform britischer Soldaten bestand im 18. und 19. Jahrhundert aus einem roten (bzw. scharlachroten) Rock und weißen Hosen. Später traten khakifarbene Uniformen an die Stelle der traditionellen britischen Uniform. Die "Rotröcke" kamen in aller Welt, vor allem aber bei der Kolonialisierung des amerikanischen Kontinents, zum Einsatz. In Irland wird die Bezeichnung bis heute für die englische Armee bzw. Engländer im Allgemeinen verwendet.
TEXT.Italian: Un soldato dell'esercito Britannico: durante il XVIII e XIX secolo, la classica divisa dei soldati Britannici (prima dell'introduzione del cachi) era una giubba rossa (o scarlatta) con pantaloni bianchi. Il termine "giubbe rosse" è stato utilizzato in tutto il mondo, ma è particolarmente associato ai coloni Americani. Questo termine viene ancora utilizzato in Irlanda per riferirsi all'esercito Britannico e più in generale all'intera popolazione Inglese.
TEXT.Spanish: Un soldado del ejército británico. Los colores usuales de los soldados británicos durante los siglos XVIII y XIX (antes de la introducción del caqui) eran el rojo (o escarlata) para las casacas y el blanco para los pantalones. El epíteto "casacas rojas" se usó en todo el mundo en general pero solía asociarse a los colonizadores americanos en particular. El término aún se utiliza en Irlanda para referirse al ejército británico y, en algunos casos, a todos los británicos.

TEXT.English: Enkidu is a central figure in the Ancient Mesopotamian Epic of Gilgamesh. In the story he is a wild-man raised by animals and ignorant of human society until he is bedded by the Shamhat. Thereafter, a series of interactions with humans and human ways bring him closer to civilization, culminating in a wrestling match with Gilgamesh, king of Uruk. Enkidu then becomes the king's constant companion, accompanying him on adventures until he is stricken ill. The loss of Enkidu inspires Gilgamesh's quest to escape death in the remainder of the narrative.
TEXT.Polish: Enkidu - myœliwy i wojownik, towarzysz Gilgamesza. Wed³ug eposu o Gilgameszu lud Uruk b³aga³ bogów, aby zes³ali kogoœ, kto pomóg³ by powœci¹gn¹æ surow¹ rêkê ich w³adcy, Gilgamesza. Bogini Aruru stworzy³a wiêc Enkidu, kud³atego barbarzyñcê o nadludzkiej sile, mieszkaj¹cego na pustyni, razem ze zwierzêtami poœród których siê wychowa³. Gilgamesz postanowi³ pojmaæ Enkidu, pos³a³ wiêc prostytutkê, aby go uwiod³a. Enkidu odby³ z ni¹ stosunek, w wyniku czego odkry³ w sobie cz³owieczeñstwo a zwierzêta zaczê³y uciekaæ od niego. Wówczas pozwoli³ siê zaprowadziæ do cywilizacji. Kiedy przywiod³a Enkidu przed oblicze Gilgamesza, ci natychmiast starli siê w zapasach. Po walce stali siê przyjació³mi i razem wyprawili siê, aby zabiæ potwora Humbabê. Kiedy obaj powrócili zwyciêsko bogini Isztar usi³owa³a uwieœæ Gilgamesza, ale ten ni¹ wzgardzi³. Rozgniewana zes³a³a Byka Niebiañskiego, aby zabi³ Gilgamesza, jednak Enkidu przyby³ mu z pomoc¹ i razem go zar¿nêli. Lud Uruk uradowa³ siê, ale bóstwa postanowi³y, ¿e Enkidu musi umrzeæ ze wzglêdu na rolê, jak¹ odegra³ w zabiciu Humbaby i Byka. Zmar³ w ramionach Gilgamesza.

TEXT.English: Enrico Dandolo (1107 - 21 June 1205) anglicised as Henry Dandolo and latinized as Henricus Dandulus was the thirty-ninth Doge of Venice from 1195 until his death. Remembered for his blindness, piety, longevity, and shrewdness, he is infamous for his role in the Fourth Crusade which he, at age ninety, directed against the Byzantine Empire, sacking Constantinople. Born in Venice, he was the son of the powerful jurist and member of the ducal court, Vitale Dandolo. Dandolo had served the Serenissima Republic in diplomatic (as ambassador to Ferrara and bailus in Constantinople) and perhaps military roles for many years. Dandolo was from a socially and politically prominent Venetian family. His father Vitale was a close advisor of Doge Vitale II Michiel, while an uncle, also named Enrico Dandolo, was patriarch of Grado, the highest-ranking churchman in Venice. Both these men lived to be quite old, and the younger Enrico was overshadowed until he was in his sixties. Although Enrico Dandolo held a number of public offices throughout his life, it was not until he became doge in 1192 at the age of 85 that his career acquired historical importance. In his first years as doge he defeated an armada from Pisa. He subsequently sent a powerful squadron to the canal of Otranto to break a blockade which the Pisans, aided by the king of Sicily, had set up to injure Venetian commerce. Dandolo's most significant political achievement was his contriving to have Venetian ships hired for the Fourth Crusade (1202). Venice's direct participation with a powerful fleet was contingent upon its receiving half of the spoils of victory. But since the doge had not received full payment in advance for transporting the French cavalry, he refused to put them aboard, and the crusade did not take place. Instead, Dandolo induced the forces to attack the city of Zara, then in rebellion against Venice. And for thus turning Christian against Christian, he and all Venetians were excommunicated by the Pope. After the bloody defeat of Zara the French crusaders wintered there, thus providing Dandolo with a ready body of men. These he employed in alliance with Alexis Angelus, son of Isaac II, the emperor of Constantinople, against Isaac's brother Alexis III, who had deposed and blinded the Emperor. In return, Alexis Angelus promised both the assistance of Byzantine forces in the crusade and the unification of the Greek and Latin churches. Dandolo moved with the crusaders against Constantinople. The siege of the city provoked an internal revolution which ousted Alexis III and effected the return of the Emperor and his son Alexis Angelus. But when the crusaders sought the union of the Greek and Latin churches, a second revolution took place which led to the imprisonment of the aged emperor and the death of his son. In the face of this impasse Dandolo encouraged the crusaders to reconquer the city for themselves; and in April 1204 Constantinople fell to the Latins, who established a Latin empire on the ruins of the Greek one. Although Dandolo, who had personally directed all operations, was offered the crown of the new empire, he resolutely declined it, contenting himself with the enormous advantages which the conquest had brought to his city. From April 1204 until his death little is recorded of Dandolo's activities. He died on June 14, 1205.

Wykorzystuj¹c osobê bizantyjskiego ksiêcia Aleksego, któremu wyprawa mia³a przywróciæ tron zagarniêty przez jego stryja Aleksego III, oraz potencjaln¹ uniê Koœcio³ów greckiego i zachodniego (a raczej podporz¹dkowanie tego pierwszego Zachodowi) krucjata ruszy³a na Konstantynopol, zamiast na muzu³manów. Taki cel wyprawy spowodowa³, ¿e papie¿ nie móg³ siê jej sprzeciwiæ, gdy¿ (przynajmniej teoretycznie) mog³a przynieœæ jednoœæ Koœcio³a. TEXT.English: The Erna long-range reconnaissance group (Estonian: Erna luuregrupp) was a Finnish Army formation, of Estonian volunteers, that fulfilled reconnaissance duties in Estonia behind the Red Army lines during World War II. The unit was formed by Finnish military intelligence with the assistance of German military intelligence for reconnaissance operations.
TEXT.French: Le groupe de reconnaissance longue portée Erna (estonien : Erna luuregrupp) était une formation de l'armée finlandaise composée de volontaires estoniens, qui assurait des missions de reconnaissance derrière les lignes de l'Armée rouge en Estonie pendant la Seconde Guerre mondiale. L'unité fut formée par le renseignement militaire finlandais avec l'aide du renseignement militaire allemand pour des opérations de reconnaissance.

TEXT.English: Erwin Rommel, nicknamed the "Desert Fox", was perhaps the most famous German Field Marshal of World War II. He was a highly decorated officer in World War I, awarded the Pour le Mrite for his exploits on the Italian front. In World War II he further distinguished himself as the commander of the "Ghost Division" during the 1940 invasion of France. However, it was his masterful leadership of German and Italian forces in the North African campaign that established the legend of the Desert Fox.[PARAGRAPH:2]He is generally considered to have been the most skilled commander of desert warfare in the war. He later commanded the German forces opposing the Allied cross-channel invasion in Normandy. Rommel is considered to have been a chivalrous and humane military officer, in contrast with many other figures of Nazi Germany. His famous Afrikakorps was not accused of any war crimes. Indeed, soldiers captured during his Africa campaign were reported to have been largely treated humanely. Furthermore, orders to kill captured Jewish soldiers and civilians out of hand in all theatres of his command were defiantly ignored. He was suspected of involvement in the failed July 20 Plot of 1944 to kill Adolf Hitler. Because of his great prestige, he was allowed to commit suicide.
TEXT.Polish: Erwin Johannes Eugen Rommel (ur. 15 listopada 1891 w Heidenheim an der Brenz, zm. 14 paŸdziernika 1944 w Herrlingen) niemiecki feldmarsza³ek. Erwin Rommel by³ najm³odszym niemieckim feldmarsza³kiem (Generalfeldmarschall) podczas II wojny œwiatowej. Dowodzi³ Afrika Korps niemieckim korpusem ekspedycyjnym w Afryce. Dziêki swoim znakomitym posuniêciom i taktyce szybkiego przemieszczania wojsk sta³ siê ¿yw¹ legend¹ wœród ¿o³nierzy niemieckich, ale przede wszystkim wœród aliantów. Ze wzglêdu na przebieg³oœæ nazwany Lisem Pustyni (niem. Wustenfuchs). Pod koniec wojny (1944) zosta³ skierowany do Francji jako dowódca Grupy Armii B, z zadaniem poprawienia umocnieñ w Normandii, w obliczu spodziewanej alianckiej inwazji.

TEXT.English: The Oromo are a cultural group that has lived for centuries in the area today known as Ethiopia. Historically defined by their unique democratic caste system, each age group within the Oromo was assigned to a specific position within society. As an Oromo citizen aged, they progressed through these age groupings to assume different positions within the Oromo hierarchy. Young men between the ages of sixteen and thirty-two were traditionally assigned to the warrior caste. Young Oromo men were not fully considered men until they had killed a man or, in times of peace, a fierce animal.[PARAGRAPH:1]Bravery in combat was paramount among Oromo culture, and many of their customs required retelling the histories of great warriors. These storytelling traditions reinforced the warlike attitude prevalent throughout Oromo society. In addition to this focus on military achievement, the Oromo also heavily stressed the importance of harmony and peace amongst their people. This unifying ideal ensured that if any outside military force attacked an Oromo tribe, they could expect a united Oromo counterattack.
TEXT.French: Les Oromo sont un groupe culturel qui vit pendant des siècles dans la région de l'Ethiopie contemporaine. Dotés d'un système de caste démocratique unique en son genre, chaque groupe d'âge est assigné à un poste spécifique au sein de la société. Au fil des ans, les citoyens Oromo progressent à travers ces groupes pour assumer différentes positions au sein de la hiérarchie Oromo. Les hommes âgés de seize à trente-deux ans sont traditionnellement associés à la caste des guerriers. Les jeunes Oromo ne sont pas considérés adultes avant d'avoir tué un homme ou, en temps de paix, un animal sauvage.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le courage au combat est extrêmement important dans la culture Oromo, et leurs rituels accordent une place majeure aux légendes des grands guerriers. Ces histoires renforcent le caractère belliqueux de la société Oromo. En plus de cet intérêt pour les exploits militaires, les Oromo insistent également sur l'importance de l'harmonie et de la paix parmi leur peuple. En cas d'attaque étrangère, cette notion d'unité garantit que les Oromo peuvent se rassembler pour affronter l'ennemi.
TEXT.German: Die Oromo bilden eine kulturelle Gruppe, die seit Jahrhunderten in dem heute als Äthiopien bekannten Gebiet lebt. Sie definieren sich historisch durch ihr einzigartiges demokratisches Kastensystem, das jeder Altersgruppe innerhalb der Oromo eine bestimmte gesellschaftliche Position zuweist. Mit zunehmendem Alter durchlief jeder Oromo-Bürger diese Altersgruppen und hatte innerhalb der Oromo-Hierarchie verschiedene Positionen inne. Junge Männer zwischen sechzehn und zweiunddreißig Jahren wurden traditionell der Kriegerkaste zugeteilt. Junge Oromo galten erst als Mann, wenn sie einen anderen Mann oder in Friedenszeiten ein gefährliches Tier getötet hatten.[PARAGRAPH:1]Mut im Kampf war in der Oromo-Kultur das höchste Gut, und viele ihrer Bräuche verlangten, dass die Geschichten großer Krieger wieder und wieder erzählt wurden. Diese Erzähltradition verstärkte noch die kriegerischen Sitten, die kennzeichnend für die Gesellschaft der Oromo waren. Außer kriegerischen Leistungen betonten die Oromo ebenfalls sehr stark die Bedeutung von Harmonie und Frieden unter den eigenen Leuten. Dieses Ideal der Einheit sorgte dafür, dass jede auswärtige Militärmacht, die einen Stamm der Oromo angriff, mit einem Gegenangriff aller Oromo rechnen musste.
TEXT.Italian: Gli Oromo sono un gruppo culturale che ha vissuto per secoli nella zona conosciuta oggi come Etiopia. Storicamente definiti dal loro singolare sistema democratico a caste, a ogni gruppo d'età all'interno degli Oromo era assegnata una specifica posizione all'interno della società. Con l'avanzare dell'età una persona progrediva attraverso le diverse posizioni nella gerarchia degli Oromo. I giovani uomini con un'età compresa fra i 16 e i 32 anni erano tradizionalmente assegnati alla casta dei guerrieri. I giovani non venivano considerati veramente uomini fino a quando non avevano ucciso un altro uomo o, in tempi di pace, un animale feroce.[PARAGRAPH:1]Il coraggio in combattimento è fondamentale nella cultura degli Oromo, e molte delle loro tradizioni prevedono il racconto della storia di grandi guerrieri. Tali tradizioni rinforzarono l'atteggiamento bellicoso prevalente nella società degli Oromo. Oltre all'attenzione ai risultati militari, gli Oromo davano anche molta importanza all'armonia e alla pace all'interno del loro popolo. Questo ideale di unificazione fece in modo che, se una forza militare esterna avesse attaccato una tribù Oromo, avrebbe subito un contrattacco da parte di tutti.
TEXT.Spanish: Los oromo son un grupo cultural que ha vivido siglos en la zona conocida actualmente como Etiopía. Caracterizados históricamente por un sistema democrático de castas, cada grupo de edad tenía un papel específico asignado en el seno de la sociedad. A medida que los oromo envejecían, iban progresando por las diferentes categorías sociales hasta asumir posiciones en el seno de la jerarquía. Tradicionalmente, los jóvenes de dieciséis a treinta y dos años se englobaban en la casta de los guerreros. A los jóvenes oromo no se les consideraba hombres hasta que habían matado un hombre o, en tiempos de paz, una fiera salvaje.[PARAGRAPH:1]En su cultura, la bravura en combate tenía una importancia capital, y la recreación oral de las hazañas de grandes guerreros desempeñaba un gran papel en sus tradiciones. Estas tradiciones narrativas reforzaban la actitud belicosa que transpiraba su sociedad. Además de la importancia de lo militar, los oromo también concedían enorme importancia a la armonía y la paz social. Este ideal unificador garantizaba que, si una fuerza externa atacaba a los oromo, se encontrase con un contraataque coordinado.

TEXT.English: Prince Eugene of Savoy was one of the most prominent and successful military commanders in European history. Born in Paris to aristocratic Savoyard parents, Eugene grew up around the French court of King Louis XIV. He was initially prepared for a career in the church, but by the age of 19 he had determined on a military career. Rejected by Louis XIV for service in the French army, Eugene moved to Austria, and transferred his loyalty to the Habsburg Monarchy. Spanning six decades, Eugene served three Habsburg emperors Leopold I, Joseph I, and Charles VI. Eugene first saw action against the Ottoman Turks at the Siege of Vienna in 1683 and the subsequent War of the Holy League, before serving in the Nine Years' War alongside his cousin, the Duke of Savoy. However, the Prince's fame was secured with his crushing victory against the Ottomans at the Battle of Zenta in 1697. Eugene enhanced his standing during the War of the Spanish Succession where his partnership with the Duke of Marlborough secured victories against the French on the fields of Blenheim, Oudenarde and Malplaquet; he gained further success as Imperial commander in northern Italy, most notably at Turin in 1706. Renewed hostilities against the Ottomans in the Austro-Turkish War of (171618) consolidated his reputation with victories at the battles of Petrovaradin, and Belgrade. Throughout the late 1720s Eugene's influence and skilful diplomacy managed to secure the Emperor powerful allies in his dynastic struggles with the Bourbon powers; but physically and mentally fragile in his later years, Eugene enjoyed less success as commander-in-chief of the army during his final conflict, the War of the Polish Succession. Nevertheless, in Austria, Eugene's reputation remains unrivalled. Although opinions differ as to his character, there is no dispute over his great achievements: Eugene helped to save the Habsburg Empire from French conquest; he broke the westward thrust of the Ottomans, liberating central Europe after a century and a half of Turkish occupation; and he was one of the greatest patrons of the arts, whose building legacy can still be seen in Vienna today. Eugene died in his sleep at his home on 21 April 1736 aged 72. Napoleon Bonaparte considered Eugene one of the seven greatest commanders of history. Although later military critics have disagreed with that assessment, Eugene was undoubtedly the greatest Austrian general. He was no military innovator, but he had the ability to make an inadequate system work. He was equally adept as organizer, strategist and tactician, believing in the primacy of battle and his ability to seize the opportune moment to launch a successful attack. To his responsibilities Eugene attached his own personal values physical courage, loyalty to his sovereign, honesty, self-control in all things, and he expected these qualities from his commanders. Eugene's approach was dictatorial, but he was willing to co-operate with someone he regarded as his equal, such as Baden or Marlborough. The result was an austere figure, inspiring respect and admiration rather than affection.
TEXT.Polish: Eugeniusz Sabaudzki (1663-1736), syn Eugeniusza Maurycego, ksiêcia de Savoie-Carignan, hrabiego Soissons i Olimpii Mancini, dyplomata i genera³ w s³u¿bie austriackiej. Znakomity wódz w zwyciêskich wojnach Austrii z Turcj¹ i Francj¹, odniós³ wielkie zwyciêstwo w bitwie z armi¹ tureck¹ pod Zent¹ (1697). Do jego najwiêkszych sukcesów militarnych zalicza siê zwyciêsko zakoñczone oblê¿enie twierdzy w Lille. W 1707 otrzyma³ od cara Rosji, Piotra I propozycjê objêcia tronu polskiego, z której nie skorzysta³. W latach 1714-1724 austriacki namiestnik Niderlandów. Znany opiekun nauki i sztuki.

TEXT.English: Juan Evo Morales Ayma is a Bolivian politician and cocalero activist who has served as President of Bolivia since 2006. Widely regarded as the country's first president to come from the indigenous population, his administration has focused on the implementation of leftist policies, poverty reduction, and combating the influence of the United States and multinational corporations in Bolivia. A democratic socialist, he is the head of the Movement for Socialism (MAS) party.
TEXT.French: Juan Evo Morales Ayma est un homme politique bolivien et activiste cocalero qui est président de la Bolivie depuis 2006. Considéré comme le premier président du pays issu de la population indigène, son administration s'est concentrée sur la mise en oeuvre de politiques de gauche, la réduction de la pauvreté et la lutte contre l'influence des États-Unis et des multinationales en Bolivie. Socialiste démocratique, il est à la tête du parti Mouvement vers le Socialisme (MAS).

TEXT.English: Oba Ewuare (Ewuare the Great) was the greatest warrior legend and the most outstanding king in the history of the Benin Empire. The title Ewuare (Oworuare), meaning it is cool or the trouble has ceased and as a result the war is over. The title symbolizes an epoch of reconciliation, reconstruction and the return of peace among the warring factions in Benin between 1435-1440 AD. Oba Ewuare ruled the Benin kingdom between 1440-1473 AD. His rule is also cited as extending to 1480. His reign marked the beginning of recovery and reform which opened up the pathway to the power and advancement of the Benin Kingdom and the emergence of the Benin Empire as one of the leading states in West Africa in the fifteenth and sixteenth centuries. Ewuare's political intelligence, is credited with transforming the character of the state along its quest for imperial expansion. Ewuare is also responsible for territorial expansion of Benin, with assertions that he marched against and subdued 201 villages in southern Nigeria. Coastal trade with the Portuguese, who came into contact with Ewuare toward the end of his reign, provided increased wealth for Ewuare and resulted in the introduction of new weaponry, such as the crossbow.
TEXT.Polish: Ewuare Wielki by³ królem Beninu ok. 1440-1473. Za jego panowania przeprowadzono wiele reform maj¹cych na celu wzmocnienie w³adzy centralnej. Do rady koronnej do³¹czono najstarszego syna wladcy z tytu³em edaiken. Utworzono radê pañstwow¹ (eghaevbo nore). Oko³o 1470 r. zmieniono nazwê pañstwa na Edo. Pod koniec jego panowania dosz³o do pierwszych kontaktów z Portugalczykami.

TEXT.English: The Lord said, "What have you done? Listen! Your brother's blood cries out to me from the ground. Now you are under a curse and driven from the ground, which opened its mouth to receive your brother's blood from your hand. When you work the ground, it will no longer yield its crops for you. You will be a restless wanderer on the Earth."
TEXT.French: which opened its mouth to receive your brother's blood from your hand. When you work the ground
TEXT.German: Und der Herr sprach: "Was hast du getan! Horch! Das Blut deines Bruders schreit zu mir vom Erdboden her. Und nun, verflucht seiest du von dem Erdboden hinweg, der seinen Mund aufgetan hat, das Blut deines Bruders von deiner Hand zu empfangen! Wenn du den Erdboden bebaust, soll er dir hinfort seine Kraft nicht geben; unstet und flüchtig sollst du sein auf der Erde."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]mehr zur Verbannung: siehe [LINK=BUILDING_EXILE_PRACTICES]Verbannungsstätte[\LINK]

TEXT.English: The Powered Exoskeleton Infantry is an infantry unit. It uses Powered Exoskeleton technology to carry more armor and equipment than a normal infantryman.
TEXT.French: L'infanterie à exosquelette motorisé est une unité d'infanterie. Elle utilise la technologie des exosquelettes motorisés pour porter plus d'armure et d'équipement qu'un fantassin normal.
TEXT.Italian: La fanteria con esoscheletro è un'unità di fanteria che utilizza un esoscheletro per trasportare più equipaggiamento e corazze di una normale unità di fanteria.

TEXT.English: Instructions: 1. Select the hemisphere you want to get rid of. 2. Declare war on everyone on that hemisphere. 3. Target at the Equator in selected hemisphere and watch as you turn whole continents to nuclear waste land. Caution: Use in extreme emergency only. Don't use on smaller planets.

Visez l'Équateur dans l'hémisphère sélectionné et regardez toute la région se transformer en décharge nucléaire. Attention : à n'utiliser qu'en cas d'extrême urgence. Ne pas utiliser sur des planètes plus petites.
TEXT.German: Anleitung: 1. Hemisphäre aussuchen, die ausgelöscht werden soll. 2. Allen Bewohnern dieser Hemisphäre Krieg erklären. 3. Mitte der Hemisphäre anvisieren und dabei zusehen, wie ganze Kontinente nuklear verseucht werden. ACHTUNG: Nur in extremen Notfällen und niemals auf kleineren Planeten anwenden!
TEXT.Italian: Istruzioni: 1. Seleziona l'emisfero di cui ti vuoi liberare. 2. Dichiara guerra a chiunque su quell'emisfero. 3. Mira all'equatore e guarda mentre trasformi interi continenti in terra nuclearmente contaminata. Attenzione: Usare solo in estrema emergenza. Non usare su piccoli pianeti.

TEXT.English: Throughout history there are those whose thirst for adventure led them from the safe confines of civilized lands. These explorers, frequently funded by government stipends, would then journey into the unknown, charting their progress all the way. These expeditions, and the maps they helped create, became blueprints for the conquest and domestication of the once uncharted regions of the world.
TEXT.French: De tout temps, des hommes assoiffés d'aventure ont quitté l'abri des terres civilisées pour se lancer à l'assaut de l'inconnu. Ces explorateurs, souvent financés par les gouvernements, parcouraient des territoires encore vierges et en établissaient des cartes. Ces expéditions, et les cartes ainsi réalisées, étaient les premiers pas vers la conquête et la colonisation des régions inexplorées du monde.
TEXT.German: Im Lauf der Geschichte gab es immer wieder Menschen, deren Abenteuerlust sie über die Grenzen der zivilisierten Länder hinaus in die weite Welt führte. Diese Entdecker und Kundschafter, deren Exkursionen häufig von Regierungsseite finanziert wurden, brachen in unbekannte Gefilde auf und kartografierten unterwegs ihre Reise. Ihre Erkundungsstreifzüge und Landkarten machten die Eroberung und "Domestizierung" ehemals unerforschter Regionen der Erde überhaupt erst möglich.
TEXT.Italian: Nel corso della storia, gli esploratori si sono spinti ai limiti dei confini civilizzati per saziare la loro fame di avventura. Spesso sovvenzionati da fondi governativi, gli esploratori hanno viaggiato ai limiti del mondo conosciuto, tenendo traccia dei propri spostamenti. Queste spedizioni e le mappe che contribuirono a creare, servirono a realizzare i piani di conquista di alcune regioni del mondo semi sconosciute.
TEXT.Spanish: A lo largo de la historia ha habido gentes a las que su ansia de aventura ha llevado a abandonar los seguros confines de las tierras civilizadas. Estos exploradores, financiados frecuentemente por los gobiernos, se dirigirían hacia lo desconocido, trazando mapas durante todo su periplo. Estas expediciones y los mapas que ayudaron a crear se convirtieron en los planos de diseño de la conquista y sumisión de las regiones antaño desconocidas del mundo.

TEXT.English: Extraction Facility is more advanced offshore platform designed for mining mineral and methane gas deposits from deep ocean floor.
TEXT.French: Une installation d'extraction est une plateforme offshore plus avancée conçue pour exploiter les gisements de minéraux et de méthane des fonds marins profonds.

TEXT.English: Ezana of Axum was a ruler of the Axumite Kingdom (c.330 c.356). Tradition states that Ezana succeeded his father Ella Amida (Ousanas) while still a child and his mother, Sofya served as regent. He was the first monarch of Axum to embrace Christianity, and the first after Zoskales to be mentioned by contemporary historians, a situation that led S. C. Munro-Hay to comment that he was "the most famous of the Aksumite kings before Kaleb." He appointed his childhood tutor, the Syrian Christian Frumentius, head of the Ethiopian Church. A surviving letter from the Arian Roman Emperor Constantius II is addressed to Ezana and his brother Saizanas, and requests that Frumentius be sent to Alexandria to be examined for doctrinal errors; Munro-Hay assumes that Ezana either refused or ignored this request. Ezana also launched several military campaigns, which he recorded in his inscriptions. A pair of inscriptions in Ge'ez have been found at Meroe, which is understood as evidence of a campaign in the fourth century, either during Ezana's reign, or by a predecessor like Ousanas. While some authorities interpret these inscriptions as proof that the Axumites destroyed the Kingdom of Kush, others note that archeological evidence points to an economic and political decline in Meroe around 300. He is, with his brother, Sazana, regarded as a saint by the Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church.
TEXT.Polish: Ezana, ok. 325 - ok. 375, król pañstwa Aksum (wg tradycji 339 - 351). W czasie jego panowania Aksum przyjê³o chrzeœcijañstwo (333 r.), religiê przyniesion¹ przez kupców bizantyjskich czêsto odwiedzaj¹cych królestwo aksumskie. Kraj uleg³ hellenizacji. Chrzeœcijañstwo izolowa³o Etiopiê zarówno od ludów islamu, jak i od tych, które wyznawa³y religie animistyczne.

TEXT.English: The Lockheed F-104 Starfighter is an American single-engined, high-performance, supersonic interceptor aircraft that served with the United States Air Force (USAF) from 1958 until 1969. The F104's thrust-to-drag ratio was excellent, allowing a maximum speed well in excess of Mach 2. The top speed of the Starfighter was limited more by the aluminum airframe structure and the temperature limits of the engine compressor than by thrust or drag, which gives an aerodynamic maximum speed of Mach 2.2. Later models used upgraded J79 engines, which improved both thrust and fuel consumption significantly.
TEXT.Polish: Myœliwiec przechwytuj¹cy - rodzaj samolotu myœliwskiego przystosowany przede wszystkim do przechwytywania i zwalczania innych samolotów, g³ównie bombowców, nad w³asnym terytorium lub przed jego osi¹gniêciem. Klasa ta podlega³a zasadniczym zmianom w toku swojego rozwoju, lecz zazwyczaj ró¿ni³a siê od innych myœliwców bogatszym wyposa¿eniem do wykrywania celów powietrznych i s³abym przystosowaniem do zwalczania celów naziemnych lub jego brakiem. Obecnie klasa myœliwców przechwytuj¹cych w du¿ym stopniu zanik³a, wraz z rozwojem wielozadaniowych samolotów myœliwskich i zmniejszeniem siê roli bombowców.

TEXT.English: The General Dynamics F-111 Aardvark is a medium-range interdictor and tactical strike aircraft that also fills the roles of strategic bomber, reconnaissance, and electronic warfare in its various versions. The F-111 pioneered several technologies for production military aircraft including variable-sweep wings, afterburning turbofan engines, and automated terrain following radar for low-level, high-speed flight. Developed in the 1960s and first entering service in 1967, the United States Air Force (USAF) variants were officially retired by 1998.
TEXT.Polish: Samolot myœliwski, myœliwiec - samolot bojowy przeznaczony przede wszystkim do zwalczania innych statków powietrznych i uzyskania przewagi powietrznej, jak i obrony w³asnych samolotów o innym przeznaczeniu, czym ró¿ni siê od bombowców, s³u¿¹cych do atakowania celów naziemnych, g³ównie przy u¿yciu bomb. Myœliwce z za³o¿enia s¹ wzglêdnie ma³e, przewa¿nie jednomiejscowe, a przy tym silnie uzbrojone, szybkie i bardzo zwrotne.

TEXT.English: The Grumman F-14 Tomcat is a supersonic, twin-engine, two-seat, variable-sweep wing fighter aircraft. The Tomcat was developed for United States Navy's Naval Fighter Experimental (VFX) program following the collapse of the F-111B project. The F-14 was the first of the American teen-series fighters which were designed incorporating the experience of air combat against MiGs during the Vietnam War. The F-14 first flew in December 1970. It first deployed in 1974 with the U.S. Navy aboard USS Enterprise (CVN-65), replacing the F-4 Phantom II. The F-14 served as the U.S. Navy's primary maritime air superiority fighter, fleet defense interceptor and tactical reconnaissance platform. In the 1990s it added the Low Altitude Navigation and Targeting Infrared for Night (LANTIRN) pod system and began performing precision strike missions. The F-14 was retired from the active U.S. Navy fleet on 22 September 2006, having been replaced by the F18 Super Hornet.
TEXT.Polish: Grumman F-14 Tomcat (ang. F-14 Tomcat by³ samolotem obrony floty, przewagi powietrznej i rozpoznania taktycznego, póŸniej poprzez dodanie mo¿liwoœci przenoszenia bomb przystosowany do zadañ bliskiego wsparcia. TEXT.English: The F18 Hornet is a twin-engine, all-weather tactical fighter designed to gain and maintain air superiority in aerial combat.
TEXT.French: Le Chasseur moderne Naval est un chasseur tactique bimoteur conçu pour gagner et maintenir la supériorité aérienne en combat aérien.

TEXT.English: The F22 Raptor is a twin-engine, all-weather tactical fighter that uses stealth technology and was designed to gain and maintain air superiority in aerial combat. Additional capabilities include ground attack, electronic warfare, and signals intelligence roles.
TEXT.French: Le F22 Raptor est un chasseur tactique bimoteur toutes conditions météorologiques qui utilise la technologie furtive et a été conçu pour obtenir et maintenir la supériorité aérienne en combat aérien. Ses capacités supplémentaires incluent l'attaque au sol, la guerre électronique et le renseignement sur les signaux.

G³ównym wytwórc¹ jest koncern Lockheed Martin, odpowiedzialny za konstrukcjê p³atowca, uzbrojenie oraz koñcowy monta¿ samolotu. Firma Boeing Integrated Defense Systems dostarcza natomiast skrzyd³a, tyln¹ czêœæ kad³uba oraz awionikê.
TEXT.Russian: F-22 Раптор - это двухмоторный всепогодный тактический истребитель, использующий технологию малозаметности и разработанный для достижения и поддержания превосходства в воздухе в воздушном бою. Дополнительные возможности включают в себя функции наземной атаки, радиоэлектронной борьбы и разведки сигналов.

TEXT.Spanish: F4 Phantom

TEXT.English: The McDonnell Douglas F-4 Phantom II is a tandem two-seat, twin-engined, all-weather, long-range supersonic jet interceptor fighter bomber originally developed for the United States Navy in 1960. Proving highly adaptable, it was adopted by the U.S. Marine Corps, and U.S. Air Force by the mid-1960s and became a major part of their air wings. The F4 Phantom is a large fighter with a top speed of over Mach 2. It can carry over 18,000 pounds (8,400 kg) of weapons on nine external hardpoints, including air-to-air and air-to-ground missiles, and various bombs. Beginning in 1959, it set 15 world records, including an absolute speed record, and an absolute altitude record.
TEXT.Polish: NaddŸwiêkowy samolot myœliwsko-bombowy dalekiego zasiêgu zdolny do dzia³ania w ka¿dych warunkach pogodowych. Zosta³ opracowany na zamówienie Marynarki Wojennej Stanów Zjednoczonych przez wytwórniê McDonnell Aircraft Corporation. Phantomy by³y wykorzystywane przez amerykañskie si³y zbrojne od 1960 do 1996 roku s³u¿¹c jako podstawowy myœliwiec przewagi powietrznej i g³ówny samolot myœliwsko-bombowy dla USAF, US Navy i korpusu Marines podczas wojny wietnamskiej. W 2001 roku nadal pozostawa³o w s³u¿bie 11 pañstw ponad 1000 maszyn tego typu, w 2012 roku oko³o 462 sztuki w barwach siedmiu pañstw.

TEXT.English: Fady, in Malagasy culture, refers to a wide range of cultural prohibitions or taboos. People, places, actions or object may be the subject of fady, which vary by region within Madagascar. The taboos are believed to be enforced by supernatural powers, and are particularly connected with Malagasy ancestor worship. Although some are held nationwide, others may be particular to regions, villages or even individual families. Fady are an integral part of Malagasy identity and play an important part in community and identity formation.

Emir Fakhr-al-Din ibn Maan was a Druze Ma'ani prince and an early leader of the Emirate of Chouf, a self-governed area under the Ottoman Empire between the 17th and 19th centuries. Son of Prince Qorqmaz ibn Maan and Sit Nasab of the Tanukhi family, he was given the title "Emir" or Prince in Arabic because the Maan family was pre-eminent in the Shouf and, periodically, a larger area. He is often referred to as "Fakhr ad-Din II" because of his grandfather Fakhr ad-Din I. He and members of his family were from time to time appointed Sanjakbeyi or governor/tax-farmer of districts (Sanjaks) like Sidon or Beirut. His period was characterized by economic and cultural prosperity, and he had fought other Lebanese families to unite the people of Lebanon and seek independence from the Ottoman Empire. He is therefore considered by some to be the first "Man of Lebanon" to seek the sovereignty of modern-day Lebanon. Others consider this to be anachronistic as his aims were more dynastic than national. However, the Ottomans eventually tired of this troublesome vassal. Sultan Murad IV had him executed with one or two of his sons on April 13, 1635.

The falconet or falcon was a light cannon developed in the late 15th century. During the Middle Ages guns were decorated with engravings of reptiles, birds or beasts depending on their size. For example, a culverin would often feature snakes, as the handles on the early cannons were often decorated to resemble serpents. The falconet fired small yet lethal shot of similar weight and size to a bird of prey, and so was decorated with a falcon. Similarly, the musket was associated with the sparrowhawk.
TEXT.Spanish: Falconete
TEXT.Polish: Falkonet ma³e dzia³ko, rodzaj broni odprzodowej z XVI i XVII wieku, umieszczane na burcie okrêtu b¹dŸ na kasztelu (zazwyczaj na ruchomej, widlastej podstawie); stosowane g³ównie w czasie aborda¿u. Na l¹dzie jako dzia³ko polowe piechoty lub w ma³ych zameczkach. By³ to rodzaj kolubryny (tzw. oktawa kolubryna), strzelaj¹cej kulami o wagomiarze 1-3 funtów (kaliber 55 - 70 mm). TEXT.English: Falx is a Latin word originally meaning sickle but was later used to mean any of a number of tools that had a curved blade that was sharp on the inside edge such as a scythe. Falx was also used to mean a weapon - particularly that of the Thracians and Dacians - and, later, a siege hook used by the Romans themselves.
TEXT.French: Falx est un mot latin signifiant à l'origine faucille mais utilisé plus tard pour désigner divers outils à lame courbe tranchante sur le bord intérieur, comme la faux. Falx désignait également une arme – particulièrement celle des Thraces et Daces – et, plus tard, un crochet de siège utilisé par les Romains eux-mêmes.
