TEXT.English: Religious fanatics are people which are filled with anger and hate against other religions. They get their motivation through the presence of hated religions, and they will do everything to get rid of them.[PARAGRAPH:2]Concept WarriorsOfGod by The_J, Fanatic graphics is the WarriorMonk by AlazkanAssassin. Made into a module for RoM by Dancing Hoskuld.
TEXT.French: Les fanatiques religieux sont des personnes remplies de colère et de haine envers d'autres religions. Ils tirent leur motivation de la présence des religions détestées, et ils feront tout pour s'en débarrasser.[PARAGRAPH:2]Concept WarriorsOfGod par The_J, les graphismes des fanatiques sont le WarriorMonk par AlazkanAssassin. Adapté en module pour RoM par Dancing Hoskuld.
TEXT.German: Religiöse Fanatiker sind Menschen, die vom Hass auf andere Religionen erfüllt sind. Sie ziehen ihre Motivation aus der Anwesenheit der anderen Religionen, und werden alles tun, um sie loszuwerden.[PARAGRAPH:2]Concept WarriorsOfGod by The_J, Fanatic graphics is the WarriorMonk by AlazkanAssassin. Made into a module for RoM by Dancing Hoskuld.
TEXT.Polish: Fanatyzm (³ac. fanaticus - zagorza³y, szalony) - postawa oraz zjawisko spo³eczne polegaj¹ce na œlepej i bezkrytycznej wierze w s³usznoœæ jakichœ pogl¹dów politycznych, religijnych lub spo³ecznych. Przejawem fanatyzmu jest skrajna nietolerancja wobec przedstawicieli odmiennych pogl¹dów. Po raz pierwszy okreœlenia fanatici u¿yto wobec kap³anów bogini Bellony w Rzymie.
TEXT.Russian: Религиозные фанатики - это люди, преисполненные ненависти и нетерпимости к другим религиям. Они получают свою мотивацию благодаря присутствию ненавидимых религий, и они сделают все, чтобы избавиться от них.[PARAGRAPH:2]Концепт отряда: WarriorsOfGod от The_J, Fanatic graphics, а также WarriorMonk от AlazkanAssassin. Сделано в в рамках сабмода для RoM от Dancing Hoskuld.

TEXT.English: Faruk Imam Muhammad (born on 15 July 1942 Bida, Nigeria) was a judge at the Kogi State Judiciary from January 1990 to 2007. Prior to this appointment, he was a lecturer at Ahmadu Bello University Zaria, from January 1975 to September 1988. He also worked with the Kwara State Judiciary, from June 1989 to January 1990.
TEXT.French: Faruk Imam Muhammad (né le 15 juillet 1942 à Bida, Nigeria) a été juge au pouvoir judiciaire de l'État de Kogi de janvier 1990 à 2007. Avant cette nomination, il était chargé de cours à l'Université Ahmadu Bello de Zaria, de janvier 1975 à septembre 1988. Il a également travaillé au pouvoir judiciaire de l'État de Kwara, de juin 1989 à janvier 1990.

TEXT.English: Super soldiers are foremost amongst the defenders of their nation, the greatest warriors known in human history. They are barely human at all, but superhuman; having been made superior in all respects to a normal man by a harsh regime of genetic modification, psycho-conditioning, and rigorous training. Super soldiers are immune to any natural disease, and can suffer wounds that would kill a lesser being several times over and live to fight again. Clad in power armour and wielding the most potent weapons, the super soldiers are terrifying foes.
TEXT.Russian: Суперсолдаты - главные защитники человечества, величайшие из известных воинов в истории человечества. Хоть они и являются предтавителями человеческой расы, но в то же время обладают сверхчеловеческими возможностями; превосходя во всех отношениях обычных людей благодаря жесткому геномному редактированию, психоконтролю и строгой выучке. Суперсолдаты не подвержены чуме или каким-либо природным заболеваниям и могут переносить ранения, при которых не способны выжить обычные Homo Sapiens, тогда как суперсолдаты восстанавливаются до следующего боя. Суперсолдаты, экипированные древней Силовой броней и самым мощным оружием, известным человеку, являются ужасающими противниками.

TEXT.English: Ferdinand II (10 March 1452 - 23 January 1516), called the Catholic, was King of Sicily from 1468 and King of Aragon from 1479 until his death. As a consequence of his marriage to Isabella I, he was King of Castile jure uxoris as Ferdinand V from 1474 until her death in 1504. He was recognised as regent of Castile for his daughter and heir, Joanna, from 1508 until his own death. In 1504, after a war with France, he became King of Naples as Ferdinand III, reuniting Naples with Sicily permanently and for the first time since 1458. In 1512, he became King of Navarre by conquest.

TEXT.Polish: Niszczyciel Fuzyjny jest niewykrywalnym okrêtem wojennym. Mo¿e zadawaæ dodatkowe obra¿enia oraz bombardowaæ miasta, a tak¿e przydatny jest do przechwycania wrogich samolotów.

TEXT.English: Fusion engines are the powerhouse of late game vehicles. Engines provide the power necessary to move a vehicle and fire its weapons. Unlike internal combustion engines, fusion engines generate power by fusing hydrogen isotopes, much like the center of a sun. Despite conventional expectations, these engines are not potential nuclear explosions. When damaged to a significant degree they will automatically shut down all fusion reactions and power down.
TEXT.French: Les moteurs à fusion sont la source d'énergie des véhicules de fin de partie. Les moteurs fournissent la puissance nécessaire pour déplacer un véhicule et tirer ses armes. Contrairement aux moteurs à combustion interne, les moteurs à fusion génèrent de l'énergie en fusionnant des isotopes d'hydrogène, un peu comme le centre du soleil. Contrairement aux attentes conventionnelles, ces moteurs ne sont pas des explosions nucléaires potentielles. Lorsqu'ils sont endommagés de manière significative, ils arrêtent automatiquement toutes les réactions de fusion et se mettent hors tension.
TEXT.Russian: Термоядерные реакторы являются двигателями поздней игры. Они обеспечивают мощность, необходимую для передвижения транспортного средства и ведения огня его орудиями. В отличие от двигателей внутреннего сгорания, термоядерные реакторы вырабатывают энергию путем слияния изотопов водорода (1H) так же, как в центре Солнца. Несмотря на традиционную мысль, эти реакторы не являются потенциальными источниками радиационной опасности. При значительном повреждении они автоматически блокируют все реакции синтеза и отключают питание.

TEXT.English: As military forces came to rely more and more upon mounted warfare, not only were there major medical improvements in the field of veterinary medicine, but it became necessary to mount the healers as well so that nation's mounted armies could retain their high mobility without losing access to specialized healing care to support them.
TEXT.French: À mesure que les forces militaires comptaient de plus en plus sur la guerre montée, non seulement il y eut de grandes améliorations médicales dans le domaine de la médecine vétérinaire, mais il devint également nécessaire de monter les soigneurs afin que les armées montées d'une nation puissent conserver leur grande mobilité sans perdre l'accès à des soins spécialisés pour les soutenir.
TEXT.Polish: Masztalerz - osoba zajmuj¹ca siê koñmi w stadninach; starszy stajenny. Do jego obowi¹zków nale¿y: podje¿d¿anie i zaje¿d¿anie m³odych koni, sprawdzanie stanu ich zdrowia oraz ogólna opieka nad wszystkimi koñmi w stadzie. Masztalerza nie nale¿y myliæ ze stajennym, którego obowi¹zki sprowadzaj¹ siê do karmienia i pojenia koni oraz czyszczenia boksów (pomieszczenia dla koni) i innych prostych prac gospodarczych na terenie stajni. Zawód masztalerza obecnie zanika. Starej daty masztalerze s¹ po¿¹danymi luzakami, a nawet zawodnikami jeŸdziectwa, ze wzglêdu na swoje doœwiadczenie. Patronem masztalerzy i stajennych jest œw. Marceli.

Spanish.Text: Caza naval a hélice:Cazas navales a hélice

TEXT.English: The Ilyushin Il-2 Shturmovik was a ground attack aircraft in the Second World War, produced by the Soviet Union in huge numbers. In combination with its successor, the Ilyushin Il-10, a total of 36,163 were built, making it the single most produced military aircraft design in all of aviation history as well as the third most produced aircraft in history behind the Cessna 172 and the Polikarpov Po-2. It was the leading aircraft for tank kills with its accuracy in diving bombing.
TEXT.French: L'Ilyushin Il-2 Shturmovik était un avion d'attaque au sol pendant la Seconde Guerre mondiale, produit en très grand nombre par l'Union soviétique. En combinaison avec son successeur, l'Ilyushin Il-10, un total de 36 163 exemplaires furent construits, ce qui en fait le design d'avion militaire le plus produit de toute l'histoire de l'aviation ainsi que le troisième avion le plus produit en histoire, derrière le Cessna 172 et le Polikarpov Po-2. Il était l'avion leader pour les destructions de chars grâce à sa précision lors du bombardement en piqué.
TEXT.Polish: I³-2 to dwumiejscowy samolot szturmowy produkcji ZSRR z czasów II wojny œwiatowej. Zbudowany w wiêkszych iloœciach (36 150 egzemplarzy) i w krótszym okresie ni¿ jakikolwiek inny samolot bojowy w historii, I³-2 walnie przyczyni³ siê do radzieckiego zwyciêstwa nad Niemcami w roku 1945.Istnieje teoria, jakoby maszyna zosta³a zaprojektowana jako dwumiejscowa (pilot i strzelec os³aniaj¹cy tyln¹ pó³sferê), jednak w wyniku dzia³añ politycznych (g³. Ludowego Komisarza Obrony ZSRR Klimenta Woroszy³owa) zosta³ przerobiony na maszynê jednomiejscow¹ - czemu mia³ przeciwstawiaæ siê Siergiej Iljuszyn. W rzeczywistoœci chocia¿ faktycznie pierwszy projekt pod oznaczeniem BSz-2 przewidywa³ dwuosobow¹ za³ogê, jego osi¹gi nie spe³nia³y wymagañ si³ powietrznych i to sam Iliuszyn zrezygnowa³ z tylnego strzelca. Skrócenie pancernej czêœci kad³uba i dodatkowy zbiornik paliwa na tyle poprawi³y osi¹gi, ¿e jednomiejscowa wersja wygra³a rywalizacjê z projektem Suchoja Su-6 i wesz³a do s³u¿by na trzy miesi¹ce przed niemieckim atakiem w czerwcu 1941 roku. Pocz¹tkowo samolot by³ wyposa¿ony w silnik AM-38 o zbyt niskiej mocy 1660 KM, uzbrojon¹ w dwa dzia³ka SzWAK kalibru 20 mm i dwa karabiny maszynowe SzKAS kalibru 7,62 mm oraz bomby i rakiety kalibru 82 mm. Pierwotna wersja by³a niezbyt udan¹ konstrukcj¹, charakteryzuj¹c¹ siê ma³¹ statecznoœci¹, a brak os³ony tylnej pó³sfery powodowa³ bardzo du¿e straty. Po zastosowaniu innego p³ata ze skosem (dla poprawienia statecznoœci) i mocniejszego silnika, oraz powrocie do za³ogi 2 osobowej (strzelec ochraniaj¹cy tyln¹ pó³sferê) samolot dojrza³ jako niezwykle groŸna maszyna szturmowa, budz¹ca postrach wœród niemieckich si³ l¹dowych. Po Ile-2 wyprodukowano I³a-2M z silnikiem AM-38F i dzia³kiem WJa-23 kal. 23 mm, I³a-2M3, dwumiejscow¹ wersjê I³a-2M ze stanowiskiem tylnego strzelca oraz I³a-2M z dzia³kiem NS-37 kal. 37 mm w miejsce dzia³ka 23 mm w celu zwiêkszenia skutecznoœci zwalczania czo³gów. Jednak mimo mocniejszych silników nie powrócono do pierwotnego projektu opancerzenia i znajduj¹cy siê poza pancern¹ czêœci¹ kad³uba tylny strzelec wci¹¿ mia³ o wiele s³absz¹ os³onê (na jednego straconego pilota przypada³o kilku strzelców). Obaj cz³onkowie za³ogi uzyskali pe³n¹ ochronê dopiero w nastêpuj¹cym po Ile-2 samolocie I³-10. Samolot ten nie atakowa³ celów z lotu nurkowego (nie by³ bombowcem nurkuj¹cym z uwagi na brak hamulców aerodynamicznych i niezbyt du¿¹ odpornoœæ na przeci¹¿enia). Atak odbywa³ siê z p³ytkiego nurkowania po prostej, czêsto w formacji kilku maszyn jako atak po krêgu, dziêki czemu nieprzyjaciel by³ pod nieustannym ostrza³em
TEXT.Russian: Штурмовик Ил-2 КБ Ильюшина был одним из самых массовых боевых самолетов в годы Второй мировой войны, выпускаемым Советским Союзом в огромных количествах. В сочетании с его преемником, Ил-10, было построено 36163 самолета, что делает его единственным наиболее выпускаемым военным самолетом за всю историю авиации, а также третьим наиболее выпускаемым самолетом в истории после Cessna 172 и Поликарпова, По-2. Это был лучший штурмовик в качестве истребителя танков и наиболее точный тактический бомбардировщик в свое время.

TEXT.English: The earliest military aircraft were used primarily in a reconnaissance role. In 1915, during World War I, aircraft designer Anthony Fokker developed a gear system that allowed a plane-mounted machine gun to fire through the propeller, giving birth to the first fighter aircraft. The fighter's mission was to shoot down enemy reconnaissance and fighter planes. Later, as the use of bombers became more widespread, fighters were called upon to act as interceptors against enemy bombing runs and escorts for friendly bombers. The best way to ensure the safe passage of friendly bombers to their selected targets is the destruction of enemy fighters.
TEXT.French: Les premiers avions militaires étaient utilisés pour l'observation. En 1915, pendant la Première Guerre mondiale, le concepteur d'avion Anthony Fokker inventa un mécanisme permettant à une mitrailleuse montée sur un avion de tirer sans toucher l'hélice. Le premier chasseur était né. Son rôle était de détruire les avions de reconnaissance et les chasseurs ennemis. Plus tard, avec la généralisation de l'utilisation des bombardiers, le chasseur servait d'intercepteur contre les raids ennemis et d'escorte pour les bombardiers alliés. Le meilleur moyen d'assurer la protection de ces bombardiers est de détruire les chasseurs ennemis.
TEXT.German: Die ersten militärischen Flugzeuge wurden vorwiegend zu Aufklärungs- und Erkundungszwecken eingesetzt. Im Jahre 1915, während des 1. Weltkrieges, entwickelte der Flugzeugkonstrukteur Anthony Fokker ein System, das die Montage eines Maschinengewehrs in einem Flugzeug ermöglichte, mit dem durch den Propeller hindurchgeschossen werden konnte - das Jagdflugzeug war erfunden. Seine Hauptaufgabe war die Zerstörung feindlicher Aufklärungsflugzeuge und Jäger. Später, als zunehmend auch Bomber den Luftraum bevölkerten, dienten die Jagdflugzeuge außerdem zum Abfangen feindlicher sowie als Begleitschutz für eigene und alliierte Bomber, denn das Abschießen feindlicher Jäger stellte nach wie vor die beste Methode dar, um einen sicheren Flug bis zum Zielort zu gewährleisten.
TEXT.Italian: I primi apparecchi militari furono utilizzati esclusivamente per missioni di ricognizione. Nel 1915, durante la Prima Guerra Mondiale, l'ingegnere aereo Antony Fokker ideò un sistema di sincronizzazione che permetteva alla mitragliatrice di bordo di sparare attraverso l'elica, dando luogo al primo aereo da caccia, il cui compito era di abbattere i ricognitori e gli aerei nemici. Più tardi, quando l'impiego dei bombardieri si fece più diffuso, i caccia vennero adoperati per ostacolare le azioni dei bombardieri nemici e per scortare quelli alleati. La distruzione di tutti i caccia nemici è il modo migliore per garantire il successo di un'azione di bombardamento.
TEXT.Spanish: Los primeros aviones militares se utilizaban principalmente en misiones de reconocimiento. En 1915, durante la Primera Guerra Mundial, el ingeniero aeronáutico Anthony Fokker desarrolló un mecanismo que permitía disparar una ametralladora instalada en un avión sin dañar la hélice, lo que significó la creación del primer caza. La misión de los cazas era derribar los aviones de reconocimiento enemigos y sus cazas. Más tarde, a medida que se iba generalizando el empleo de los bombarderos, los cazas empezaron a actuar como interceptores frente a los bombarderos enemigos y como escoltas para los suyos. El mejor modo de garantizar que los bombarderos amigos llegarán a su destino previsto es destruir los cazas enemigos.

TEXT.English: Valdivian pottery initially was rough and practical, but it became splendid, delicate and large over time. They generally used red and gray colors; and the polished dark red pottery is characteristic of the Valdivia period. In their ceramics and stone works, the Valdivia culture shows a progression from the most simple to much more complicated works.
TEXT.French: La poterie valdivienne était initialement rugueuse et pratique, mais elle est devenue splendide, délicate et de grande taille avec le temps. Ils utilisaient généralement des couleurs rouges et grises ; et la poterie rouge foncé polie est caractéristique de la période Valdivia. Dans leurs céramiques et travaux en pierre, la culture Valdivia montre une progression des oeuvres les plus simples à des oeuvres beaucoup plus complexes.

TEXT.English: Modern flamethrowers were first used during the trench warfare conditions of World War I; their use greatly increased in World War II. They can be vehicle mounted, as on a tank, or hand-carried by infantry.[PARAGRAPH:2]The flamethrower consists of two elements: backpack and gun. The backpack element usually consists of two or three cylinders. One cylinder holds compressed, inert propellant gas (usually nitrogen), and the other two hold inflammable liquid - typically petrol with some form of fuel thickener added to it. A three-cylinder system often has two outer cylinders of inflammable liquid and a central cylinder of propellant gas to improve the balance of the soldier who carried it. The gas propels the fuel liquid out of the cylinder through a flexible pipe and then into the gun element of the flamethrower system. The gun consists of a small reservoir, a spring-loaded valve, and an ignition system; depressing a trigger opens the valve, allowing pressurized inflammable liquid to flow and pass over the igniter and out the gun nozzle. The igniter can be one of several ignition systems: A simple type is an electrically-heated wire coil; another used a small pilot flame, fueled with pressurized gas from the system.[PARAGRAPH:2]The flamethrower is a potent weapon with great psychological impact upon unprepared soldiers, inflicting a particularly horrific death i.e. being burnt alive. This has led to some calls for the weapon to be banned. It is primarily used against battlefield fortifications, bunkers, and other protected emplacements. A flamethrower projects a stream of flammable liquid, rather than flame, which allows bouncing the stream off walls and ceilings to project the fire into blind and unseen spaces, such as inside bunkers or pillboxes. Typically, popular visual media depict the flamethrower as short-ranged, of a few effective meters (due to the common use of propane gas as the fuel in flamethrowers in movies, for the safety of the actors), but contemporary flamethrowers can incinerate targets at 50 - 80 meters (165 - 270 feet) distance from the gunner; moreover, an unignited stream of flammable liquid can be fired and afterwards ignited, possibly by a lamp or other flame inside the bunker.[PARAGRAPH:2]Flamethrowers pose many risks to the operator. The first disadvantage is the weapon's weight, which impairs the soldier's mobility. Flamethrowers are very visible in the battlefield, and so operators become prominent targets for snipers. Historically, flamethrower operators were rarely taken prisoner, especially when their targets survived attack by the weapon; in reprisal, captured flamethrower users often were summarily executed. Finally, the flamethrower's effective range is short in comparison with that of other battlefield weapons of similar size. To be effective, flamethrower soldiers must approach their targets closely, risking exposing themselves to close enemy fire. Vehicular flamethrowers also have this problem; they may have considerably greater range than a man-portable flamethrower, but their range is still short compared with that of even infantry firearms.

TEXT.English: Flamingos are a type of wading bird in the genus Phoenicopterus (from Greek meaning "purple wing"), the only genus in the family Phoenicopteridae. There are four flamingo species in the Americas and two species in the Old World.
TEXT.French: the only genus in the family Phoenicopteridae. There are four flamingo species in the Americas and two species in the Old World.

TEXT.English: Fire arrows are an early form of gunpowder solid fuel rocket which were attached to a shaft of the arrow to provide a propulsive force. The Chinese are credited with both the invention of the fire arrow and also the first use of fire arrows in a military warfare. The Chinese developed fire arrows from their previous invention of fireworks and gunpowder.
TEXT.French: Les flèches enflammées sont une forme primitive de fusée à propergol solide à poudre noire, attachées à la hampe de la flèche pour fournir une force propulsive. Les Chinois sont crédités à la fois de l'invention de la flèche enflammée et de leur première utilisation en guerre militaire. Les Chinois ont développé les flèches enflammées à partir de leur invention antérieure des feux d'artifice et de la poudre à canon.

TEXT.English: Aircraft continued to develop into far more intricate forms throughout the world wars. Although they were still propeller based craft, their hull and aerodynamic designs were far superior to those models that came before them. And the technical knowhow to repair them became more and more specialized. Flight Technicians are fully qualified to repair these craft.
TEXT.French: Les avions ont continué à évoluer vers des formes beaucoup plus complexes durant les guerres mondiales. Bien qu'ils restaient basés sur des hélices, leurs coques et leurs designs aérodynamiques étaient bien supérieurs à ceux des modèles précédents. Et le savoir-faire technique pour les réparer est devenu de plus en plus spécialisé. Les techniciens de vol sont entièrement qualifiés pour réparer ces appareils.
TEXT.Polish: Prowadzi naprawy g³ówne (remonty i naprawy specjalne) oraz modyfikacje statków powietrznych albo ich zespo³ów i wyposa¿enia lotniczego; zapewnia wykonywanie tych napraw zgodnie z obowi¹zuj¹c¹ dokumentacj¹ techniczn¹ i przy u¿yciu w³aœciwych czêœci i materia³ów; utrzymuje w technicznej zdatnoœci do lotu statki powietrzne, ich zespo³y lub ich wyposa¿enie lotnicze.

TEXT.English: A combat medic is a trained soldier who is responsible for providing first aid and frontline trauma care on the battlefield. Combat medics are officially known by a variety of names. In the United States Army, medics have often been called 68Ws since December of 2005. In the United States Navy, they are known as Corpsmen and fill the combat medic role of the United States Marine Corps, which does not have its own medical personnel. Combat Medical Technicians (CMTs) in the British Army are members of the Royal Army Medical Corps. The general NATO description is Combat Lifesaver (CLS). In most armies, medics wear specific insignia, with a prominent Red Cross on a white background. Islamic countries use a red crescent instead while Israeli medics wear the Magen David Adom (a red star of David on a white background). These symbols signify to enemy soldiers that the medic is a noncombatant, providing medical care. For many years, most medics have carried at least a side arm (and now, frequently a rifle, carbine or submachine gun), to be used as a defensive weapon. Medical personnel may be armed, but may only use their weapons to protect themselves or the wounded and sick in their care. If they use their arms offensively (i.e. attacking or assaulting), or carry arms that qualify as offensive (such as a sniper rifle, machine gun or grenade launcher), they then sacrifice their protection under the Geneva Conventions. Generally, a medic holding his/her weapon is considered to be an armed, military threat. According to the Geneva Convention, knowingly firing at a medic wearing clear insignia is a war crime. During World War II (and before the implementation of the 1949 revision to the Geneva Convention made it illegal), there was an unwritten law of ethics between Allied and German forces whereby soldiers would not knowingly fire at a medic treating a wounded comrade. This was in stark contrast to the policy of the Japanese forces, who regarded medics as primary targets, resulting in Allied medics removing or covering their insignia.
TEXT.Polish: Angielska pielêgniarka, statystyk, dzia³aczka spo³eczna i publicystka. By³a zwana "Dam¹ z lamp¹" (ang. The Lady with the Lamp). Jest uwa¿ana za twórczyniê nowoczesnego pielêgniarstwa.

TEXT.English: A Fluyt is a type of sailing vessel originally designed as a dedicated cargo vessel. Originating from the Netherlands in the 16th Century, the vessel was designed to facilitate transoceanic delivery with the maximum of space and crew efficiency. It usually carried 12 to 15 cannons, but was still an easy target for pirates. To the end, the standard design minimized or completely eliminated its armaments to maximize available cargo space, and used block and tackle extensively to facilitate ship operations. This ship class was credited in enhancing Dutch competitiveness in international trade, and was widely employed by the Dutch East India Company in the 17th and 18th centuries. However it gained such popularity beyond its native waters that it was soon in use by other sea faring nations.

TEXT.English: Batek are a peaceful society. If a member of the group has a conflict with another member of the group they will discuss the matter privately. If that does not end the disagreement, each will publicly share their side of the argument in an attempt to have other members of the camp suggest a resolution. Since each adult member of the camp is equal, there is no internal leader or adjudication system so one or both of the aggrieved parties will leave the camp until cooler heads prevail.
TEXT.French: Les Batek sont une société pacifique. Si un membre du groupe entre en conflit avec un autre, ils discuteront de la question en privé. Si cela ne met pas fin au désaccord, chacun partagera publiquement son point de vue dans une tentative d'amener les autres membres du camp à proposer une résolution. Comme chaque membre adulte du camp est égal, il n'y a pas de leader interne ni de système d'arbitrage, donc une ou les deux parties lésées quitteront le camp jusqu'à ce que les esprits s'apaisent.

TEXT.English: Sweyn I Forkbeard was king of Denmark and England, as well as parts of Norway. His name appears as Swegen in the Anglo-Saxon Chronicle. He was the son of King Harald Bluetooth of Denmark. He was the father of Cnut the Great.
TEXT.French: Sweyn Ier Forkbeard fut roi du Danemark et d'Angleterre, ainsi que de parties de la Norvège. Son nom apparaît sous la forme Swegen dans la Chronique anglo-saxonne. Il était le fils du roi Harald Bluetooth du Danemark. Il était le père de Knut le Grand.
TEXT.Polish: Swen Wid³obrody - król duñski (ok. 987-1014) i norweski (987-994), w³adca Anglii (1013-1014). Swen wyprawia³ siê na Angliê ju¿ w latach 90. X wieku, ale by³y to tylko wyprawy ³upie¿cze. Do zorganizowanego podboju przyst¹pi³ w 1002. 13 listopada tego¿ roku, w dzieñ œw. Brycjusza, na rozkaz angielskiego króla Ethelreda II wymordowano kilka setek duñskich osadników. TEXT.English: The hardy fortune-seeking miners of the California goldrush became known as Forty-Niners.
TEXT.French: Les mineurs robustes et chercheurs de fortune de la ruée vers l'or en Californie sont devenus connus sous le nom de Quarante-neufers.
TEXT.Italian: I cercatori d'oro della corsa all'oro in California divennero noti come Forty-Niners.

TEXT.English: Sebastin Francisco de Miranda y Rodrguez (Caracas, March 28, 1750 in prison, El Arsenal de la Carraca, Cadiz, July 14, 1816), commonly known as Francisco de Miranda, was a Venezuelan revolutionary. Although his own plans for the independence of the Spanish American colonies failed, he is regarded as a forerunner of Simn Bolvar, who during the Hispanic American wars of independence successfully liberated a vast portion of South America. Miranda led a romantic and adventurous life. An idealist, he developed a visionary plan to liberate and unify all of Spanish America but his own military initiatives on behalf of an independent Spanish America failed in 1812. He was handed over to his enemies and four years later, in 1816, died in a Spanish prison. Within fourteen years of his death, however, most of Spanish America was independent.
TEXT.Polish: Francisco de Miranda, w³aœc. Sebasti¹n Francisco de Miranda y Rodriguez (ur. 28 marca 1750 w Caracas, zm. 14 lipca 1816 w Kadyksie) wenezuelski rewolucjonista, którego plan wyzwolenia kolonii hiszpañskich w Ameryce siê nie powiód³, lecz uwa¿a siê go za poprzednika Simóna Bolivara i innych, bardziej skutecznych po³udniowoamerykañskich bojowników o niepodleg³oœæ (Libertadores). Miranda jest nazywany Prekursorem Niepodleg³oœci Ameryki £aciñskiej (El Precursor).

TEXT.English: For his efforts to unify the German states and for his opposition to the Roman popes, the Holy Roman Emperor Frederick I became a legendary German hero and a symbol of national unity. Duke of Swabia from 1147, Frederick succeeded his uncle as Holy Roman Emperor in 1152. Nicknamed Barbarossa from his red beard, Frederick was perhaps the dominant figure of his age. He was a bold and skilful general, an accomplished speaker, good administrator, and natural leader, although his driving ambition sometimes manifested itself in cruelty. He spent most of his reign in conflict with refractory vassals in Germany, the rebellious cities of Lombardy, and the papacy. He could not consolidate initial success in Lombardy, although he sacked Milan in 1162 and went on to take Rome. In 1176 the cities of the Lombard League, aided by Venice and the pope, defeated him at Legnano, in an unusual victory of civic infantry over feudal cavalry. Thereafter he proved conciliatory to Lombards and pope alike, converting the former into loyal subjects and in 1177 acknowledging the latter, thus paving the way for a final agreement in 1183. He bought off his strongest vassals by conferring greater titles on them, and asserted his feudal rights over states like Poland and Burgundy. Frederick had served with his uncle Conrad in the Second Crusade, and in 1188, though in his 70th year, he took the Cross again, and set out for Outremer in 1189 with the largest single force ever to go on a crusade. After a difficult journey across Byzantine territory he reached Turkey, only to be drowned crossing the Calycadnus river in June 1190. Saladin, who had feared him, regarded his death as a miracle. The emperor's body, imperfectly preserved, accompanied his army, but both disintegrated. Most of Frederick was interred in Antioch, while his army, reduced by sickness and desertion, went on to join other crusading contingents in the siege of Acre. The towering achievements of his lifetime and the strange circumstances of his death and burial helped make him the German King Arthur, the once and future king, still sleeping beneath the hills awaiting the call to arms.
TEXT.Polish: Fryderyk I Barbarossa (Rudobrody) (ur. ok. 1125, zm. 10 czerwca 1190) z dynastii Hohenstaufów, syn ksiêcia Szwabii - Fryderyka II i ksiê¿niczki Judyty, córki ksiêcia Bawarii Henryka IX Czarnego (zm. 1126) z rodu Welfów, konkurencyjnego w tamtym okresie wobec Hohenstaufów. Po œmierci ojca (1147) przyj¹³ tytu³ ksiêcia Szwabii (jako Fryderyk III), 4 marca 1152 zosta³ wybrany na króla niemieckiego, a 18 czerwca 1155 zosta³ koronowany cesarzem Œwiêtego Cesarstwa Rzymskiego. W latach 1154 - 1186 by³ równie¿ królem W³och. W swych rz¹dach wzorowa³ siê na najwa¿niejszych cesarzach, miêdzy innymi Justynianie I Wielkim i Karolu Wielkim.

TEXT.English: Frederick II (26 December 1194 - 13 December 1250), was one of the most powerful Holy Roman Emperors of the Middle Ages and head of the House of Hohenstaufen. His political and cultural ambitions, based in Sicily and stretching through Italy to Germany, and even to Jerusalem, were enormous; however, his enemies, especially the popes, prevailed, and his dynasty collapsed soon after his death.
TEXT.French: Frédéric II (26 décembre 1194 - 13 décembre 1250), fut l'un des empereurs du Saint-Empire romain germanique les plus puissants du Moyen Âge et chef de la maison de Hohenstaufen. Ses ambitions politiques et culturelles, basées en Sicile et s'étendant à travers l'Italie jusqu'en Allemagne, voire à Jérusalem, étaient énormes ; cependant, ses ennemis, en particulier les papes, ont prévalu, et sa dynastie s'est effondrée peu après sa mort.
TEXT.Polish: Fryderyk II (niem. Friedrich II., ur. 26 grudnia 1194, zm. 13 grudnia 1250) - król Sycylii od 1198 (jako Fryderyk I), król Rzymian (Niemiec) od 1212, ksi¹¿ê Szwabii od 1212 do 1216 (jako Fryderyk VII), Œwiêty Cesarz Rzymski od 1220 i król Jerozolimy od 1225-1228 (jako Fryderyk I), z dynastii Hohenstaufów.

TEXT.English: Although often used to designate the flintlock-armed formations of a number of European countries, the term "Musketeer" generally refers to the King's Guard under Louis XIII and Louis XIV of France, immortalized in Dumas' famous novel. As such, the Musketeers served as a training ground for the young nobility, intended to be the elite of the army. Training not only included mastery of all weapons, from epee to musket, but instruction in social skills and military etiquette as well. In peacetime, the Musketeers served as the King's personal escort.[PARAGRAPH:2]Monsieur Treville, one of the Louis XIII's advisors and ardent sponsor of the Musketeers, and Cardinal Richelieu, who maintained his own company of guards, were political adversaries until the banishment of Treville following a 1642 plot to assassinate the Cardinal. Following that, the prestige of the Musketeers declined. In the military reforms that followed the death of Louis XIV, the Musketeers were disbanded and absorbed into the ranks of the French army.
TEXT.French: Bien que le terme "mousquetaire" soit souvent utilisé pour désigner les formations armées de fusils à silex de nombreux pays européens, il fait référence à la Garde Royale des rois de France Louis XIII et Louis XIV, immortalisée par Alexandre Dumas. Le corps des mousquetaires servait alors à former la jeune noblesse, destinée à devenir l'élite de l'armée. La formation militaire comprenait non seulement l'apprentissage des armes, de l'épée et du mousquet, mais aussi des règles de savoir-vivre et de l'étiquette militaire. En temps de paix, les mousquetaires formaient la garde personnelle du roi.[PARAGRAPH:2]Monsieur de Tréville, conseiller de Louis XIII et ardent défenseur des mousquetaires, et le Cardinal de Richelieu, qui possédait sa propre compagnie de gardes, se sont opposés politiquement jusqu'à ce que de Tréville soit banni, suite au complot de 1642 visant à assassiner le Cardinal. Ces événements ont précipité le déclin du prestige des mousquetaires. Le corps des mousquetaires fut supprimé lors des réformes militaires qui suivirent la mort de Louis XVI.
TEXT.German: Zwar wird der Begriff "Musketier" häufig zur Beschreibung der mit Steinschlosspistolen bewaffneten Truppenformationen verschiedener europäischer Länder benutzt, allgemein ist damit allerdings die königliche Leibgarde unter Ludwig XIII. und Ludwig XIV. von Frankreich gemeint, die in dem berühmten Roman von Alexandre Dumas verewigt wurde. Als solche dienten die Musketiere als Ausbilder für junge Adlige, die den späteren Elitetruppen der Armee angehören sollten. Sie unterwiesen ihre Schützlinge dabei nicht nur im Umgang mit den verschiedenartigsten Waffen, vom Degen bis hin zur Muskete, sondern brachten ihnen auch soziale Umgangsformen und Militäretikette bei. In Friedenszeiten dienten die Musketiere als persönliche Eskorte des Königs.[PARAGRAPH:2]Monsieur Treville, einer der Berater König Ludwig des XIII., seines Zeichens ein leidenschaftlicher Fürsprecher der Musketiere, und Kardinal Richelieu, der seine eigene Garde unterhielt, waren politische Gegner. Nachdem Treville wegen eines geplanten Attentats gegen den Kardinal im Jahre 1642 in die Verbannung geschickt worden war, verloren die Musketiere zusehends an Ansehen und Bedeutung. Schließlich wurden sie im Rahmen der Militärreformen, die nach dem Tode Ludwigs XIV. in Kraft traten, aufgelöst und in die Reihen der französischen Armee eingegliedert.
TEXT.Italian: Malgrado sia usato spesso per designare le formazioni con armi dotate di otturatore a selce appartenenti a diversi paesi europei, il termine "moschettiere", immortalato nel famoso romanzo di Dumas, si riferisce generalmente alla Guardia del Re sotto Luigi XIII e Luigi XIV di Francia. L'addestramento dei moschettieri non consisteva solamente nella padronanza di tutte le armi, dal moschetto alla spada, ma comprendeva anche il senso civico e la disciplina militare. In tempo di pace, i moschettieri erano la scorta personale del re.[PARAGRAPH:2]Monsieur Treville, uno dei consiglieri di Luigi XIII, nonché fervente sostenitore dei moschettieri, e il Cardinale Richelieu, che mantenne la sua compagnia di guardie, furono avversari politici fino a quando Treville non venne messo al bando, in seguito al complotto del 1642 per assassinare il Cardinale. Dopo questo evento, il prestigio dei moschettieri diminuì e, con le riforme militari che seguirono alla morte di Luigi XIV, queste unità furono congedate e integrate nei ranghi dell'esercito francese.
TEXT.Spanish: Aunque a menudo se usa para designar a los contingentes armados con mosquetes de varios estados europeos, el término "mosquetero" se suele referir a la guardia real de los reyes Luis XIII y Luis XIV de Francia, inmortalizada en la famosa novela de Dumas. Como tales, los mosqueteros sirvieron como base de entrenamiento para los jóvenes nobles, destinados a formar la elite del ejército. La instrucción no incluía solo el dominio de todas las armas, desde el florete al mosquete, sino también la educación social y la etiqueta militar. En tiempos de paz, componían la guardia real del monarca.[PARAGRAPH:2]Monsieur de Treville, consejero de Luis XIII y ardiente defensor de los mosqueteros, y el cardenal Richelieu, quien contaba con su propia guardia, fueron adversarios políticos hasta el exilio de Treville en 1642, como consecuencia de un complot para asesinar al cardenal. A partir de entonces, el prestigio de los mosqueteros entró en declive. Durante las reformas que siguieron a la muerte de Luis XIV, los mosqueteros fueron disueltos e integrados en las filas del ejército francés.

TEXT.English: The frigate was a fast and powerful warship that evolved to fill several important roles, but one of its primary roles was to raid enemy shipping. These three masted ships were lighter and faster than the European great ship or man-of-war, and usually carried 36 or fewer guns. The frigate was powerful enough to overcome most of its prospective opponents and fast enough to escape those it could not outgun. Because of their speed and strength, frigates were often employed as escorts for merchant vessels during times of war. The frigate remained the most useful and dominant naval vessel until the development of the ironclad.
TEXT.French: La frégate était un navire de guerre rapide et puissant dont l'évolution lui permit de remplir différents rôles. L'un des principaux était l'attaque des bateaux ennemis. Ces trois-mâts, plus légers et plus rapides que les grands vaisseaux de guerre européens, contenaient au maximum 36 pièces d'artillerie. La frégate était assez puissante pour triompher de la plupart de ses opposants et suffisamment rapide pour échapper à ceux qu'elle ne pouvait vaincre. Du fait de sa puissance de feu et de sa rapidité, la frégate fut souvent utilisée pour escorter des navires marchands en temps de guerre. La frégate fut le navire le plus puissant et le plus utile en activité jusqu'à l'arrivée des cuirassés.
TEXT.German: Die Fregatte war ein wendiges und leistungsfähiges Kriegsschiff, zu dessen Hauptaufgabe Überfälle auf feindliche Schiffe gehörten. Dieser Dreimaster war leichter und schneller als die europäischen Kriegs- und Schlachtschiffe und gewöhnlich mit bis zu 36 Geschützen ausgestattet. In der Regel war die Fregatte damit überlegen genug, um die meisten ihrer Gegner besiegen zu können - und wenn ihre Feuerkraft doch einmal nicht ausreichte, konnte sie schnell genug entkommen. Nicht zuletzt wegen dieser Qualitäten wurde die Fregatte häufig als Eskorte zum Schutz von Handelsschiffen eingesetzt. Erst die Entwicklung der Panzerschiffe beendete die Vorherrschaft dieses vielseitig nutzbaren Schiffstyps.
TEXT.Italian: La fregata era un vascello da guerra veloce e potente, che andò evolvendosi fino a svolgere funzioni specifiche nella marina, prima tra tutte l'attacco alle imbarcazioni nemiche. Queste trialberi, che spesso arrivavano a portare fino a 36 cannoni, erano più leggere e veloci delle pesanti navi europee. La fregata era abbastanza potente da sconfiggere i suoi eventuali oppositori e veloce a sufficienza da poter sfuggire a quelli che non poteva sopraffare. Grazie alla loro velocità e alla loro forza, le fregate venivano spesso impiegate in tempo di guerra come scorta ai mercantili e rimasero il tipo di vascello più importante fino alla creazione della corazzata.
TEXT.Spanish: La fragata era una nave de guerra poderosa y veloz, que evolucionó para adoptar diferentes funciones de importancia, aunque uno de sus cometidos principales fue siempre el acoso a los barcos enemigos. Estas naves, con sus tres mástiles, eran más rápidas y ligeras que los grandes barcos de guerra europeos, y normalmente no montaban más de treinta y seis cañones. Era lo bastante poderosa como para superar a la mayoría de sus contrincantes potenciales y lo suficientemente rápida como para escapar de los que la superaban en armamento. Debido a su rapidez y potencia, en tiempos de guerra solían emplearse como escoltas para los mercantes. La fragata siguió siendo el buque más útil y generalizado hasta la aparición del buque blindado.

TEXT.English: The armies of Sennar relied most on heavy cavalry: horsemen drawn from the nobility, armed with long broadswords as the toe stirrups they used did not permit the use of lances. These riders were armoured with chain mail while the horses were covered in thick quilts and copper headgear. A greater mass of troops were infantry carrying swords and who were also armoured. This permanent standing army, the largest in East Africa until the 1810s, was garrisoned in castles and forts throughout the sultanate. Reliance on a standing army meant that the professional armies fielded by Sennar were usually smaller, but highly effective against their less organized rivals.

A technical is a type of improvised fighting vehicle, typically a civilian or military non-combat vehicle, modified to provide an offensive capability similar to a military gun truck. It is usually an open-backed civilian pickup truck or four-wheel drive vehicle mounting a machine gun, light anti-aircraft gun, anti-tank weapon, or other support weapon.
TEXT.French: Un technical est un type de véhicule de combat improvisé, généralement un véhicule civil ou militaire non combattant, modifié pour offrir une capacité offensive similaire à celle d'un camion-pickup militaire armé. C'est habituellement un pick-up civil à plateau ouvert ou un véhicule tout-terrain équipé d'une mitrailleuse, d'un canon antiaérien léger, d'une arme antichar ou d'une autre arme de soutien.

TEXT.English: Fusion Battleships are battleships with a fusion powersource, making them optimal for long-range journeys, and excellent for rapid fire railguns and taking fire with their fusion shields.
TEXT.French: Les cuirassés à fusion sont des cuirassés dotés d'une source d'énergie par fusion, les rendant optimaux pour les voyages longue distance, excellents pour le tir rapide de canons électromagnétiques et capables d'encaisser les tirs grâce à leurs boucliers à fusion.
TEXT.Polish: Pancernik Fuzyjny jest jedna z mocniejszych i zarazem silniejszych okrêtów wojennych. Mo¿e bez problemu zatapiaæ wiêkszoœæ innych
TEXT.Russian: Эти линейные корабли с термоядерными двигателями являются оптимальными для дальних походов, и отлично подходят для скорострельных артиллерийских и ракетных дуэлей. В качестве средства защиты эти корабли оснащены щитами из композитных и огнеупорных материалов, а также средствами экранирования.

TEXT.English: Fusion engines are the powerhouse of late game vehicles. Engines provide the power necessary to move a vehicle and fire its weapons. Unlike internal combustion engines, fusion engines generate power by fusing hydrogen isotopes, much like the center of a sun. Despite conventional expectations, these engines are not potential nuclear explosions. When damaged to a significant degree they will automatically shut down all fusion reactions and power down.
TEXT.French: Les moteurs à fusion sont la source d'énergie des véhicules de fin de partie. Les moteurs fournissent la puissance nécessaire pour déplacer un véhicule et tirer ses armes. Contrairement aux moteurs à combustion interne, les moteurs à fusion génèrent de l'énergie en fusionnant des isotopes d'hydrogène, un peu comme le centre du soleil. Contrairement aux attentes conventionnelles, ces moteurs ne sont pas des explosions nucléaires potentielles. Lorsqu'ils sont endommagés de manière significative, ils arrêtent automatiquement toutes les réactions de fusion et se mettent hors tension.
TEXT.Polish: Lotniskowiec Fuzyjny jest bardzo silna niewykrywalna jednostka ale glównie sluzy do transportowania 10 mysliwców.
TEXT.Russian: Термоядерные реакторы являются двигателями поздней игры. Они обеспечивают мощность, необходимую для передвижения транспортного средства и ведения огня его орудиями. В отличие от двигателей внутреннего сгорания, термоядерные реакторы вырабатывают энергию путем слияния изотопов водорода (1H) так же, как в центре Солнца. Несмотря на традиционную мысль, эти реакторы не являются потенциальными источниками радиационной опасности. При значительном повреждении они автоматически блокируют все реакции синтеза и отключают питание.

TEXT.Polish: Kr¹¿ownik Fuzyjny mo¿e transportowaæ 6 bomb, a tak¿e zatapiaæ wrogie statki wojenne. Dodatkowo bez problemu wykrywa statki podwodne oraz mo¿e broniæ bombardowanego miasta.
TEXT.Russian: Термоядерные реакторы являются двигателями поздней игры. Они обеспечивают мощность, необходимую для передвижения транспортного средства и ведения огня его орудиями. В отличие от двигателей внутреннего сгорания, термоядерные реакторы вырабатывают энергию путем слияния изотопов водорода (1H) так же, как в центре Солнца. Несмотря на традиционную мысль, эти реакторы не являются потенциальными источниками радиационной опасности. При значительном повреждении они автоматически блокируют все реакции синтеза и отключают питание.

TEXT.English: Directly related to it's cousin the Tactical Fusi, the Fusion Nova (a.k.a. The Island Sinker) uses fusion implosions to destroy areas of target rich environments. Unlike the Tactical Fusi, this weapon has a larger implosion radius, sinking any city and its improvements or surrounding guardian units. Due to the intensity of this weapon, the number able to be made is much smaller than that of the Tactical Fusi.
TEXT.French: Directement lié à son cousin le Tactical Fusi, le Fusion Nova (également appelé The Island Sinker) utilise des implosions par fusion pour détruire des zones riches en cibles. Contrairement au Tactical Fusi, cette arme a un rayon d'implosion plus grand, coulant toute ville avec ses améliorations ou les unités gardiennes environnantes. En raison de l'intensité de cette arme, le nombre pouvant être fabriqué est bien moindre que celui du Tactical Fusi.
TEXT.German: Genau wie die taktische Fusionsbombe nutzt die Nova-Fusionsbombe (auch Inselversenker genannt) Fusionsimplosionen, um Bereiche voller potenzieller Ziele zu vernichten. Als Weiterentwicklung der taktischen Fusionsbombe hat sie allerdings einen größeren Implosionsradius, der es ihr ermöglicht, eine Stadt samt all ihrer Geländemodernisierungen und aller Einheiten im Umfeld komplett im Meer zu versenken. Da diese Waffe so unglaublich verheerend ist, können nur sehr wenige Nova-Fusionsbomben zur gleichen Zeit unterhalten werden.
TEXT.Italian: Direttamente imparentata con la bomba a fusione tattica, la bomba a fusione Nova (a.k.a. Affondatrice di isole) usa le implosioni a fusione per distruggere aree con ricchi miglioramenti. A differenza della bomba a fusione tattica, quest'arma ha un raggio di implosione più ampio, affondano in acqua ogni città, relativi miglioramenti e le unità difensive. A causa della potenza di quest'arma, ne possono essere costruite un numero minore rispetto alla bomba a fusione tattica.
TEXT.Russian: Непосредственно связанный со своим близким родичем - ОТР «Нова» (или «Island Sinker») использует реакцию ядерного синтеза для опустошения участков областей со множеством целей. В отличие от оперативно тактической ракеты «Фьюжн», это оружие имеет больший радиус поражения, накрывая взрывной волной любой город и его окрестности вместе с его гарнизоном. Из-за дороговизны технологии изготовления этого оружия, его доступное количество намного меньше, чем у «Фьюжн».

German.Text: Taktische Fusionsbombe:Taktischer Fusionsbombe:Taktischer Fusionsbombe:Taktische Fusionsbombe:Taktische Fusionsbomben:Taktischen Fusionsbomben:Taktischen Fusionsbomben:Taktischen Fusionsbomben

TEXT.English: The Tactical Fusi (short for Fusion) is the first in the latest and greatest way to give that special civilization a good surprise. This new type of bomb obsoletes the need for messy explosions including the all-elusive radiation fallout from nuclear bombs. Instead, this bomb expands upon the power of implosions, forcing everything within its radius into a ball of mush the size of a baseball. Due to the pure intensity of this weapon, only so many may be made to try and keep the pothole count down. This is also a great weapon to make a canal or give that useless, landlocked city some water access. WARNING: try to keep as many civs allied at a time so your country won't end up as a big lake.
TEXT.German: Die taktische Fusionsbombe ist ein Implosivkörper, der seine Energie nicht aus Kernspaltung, sondern aus Kernfusion bezieht. Es handelt sich um eine Weiterentwicklung der herkömmlichen Kernwaffen, die ohne die lästigen Nebenprodukte wie die atomare Verseuchung und den radioaktiven Fallout auskommt. Die Bombe implodiert, anstatt zu explodieren, und zerstört dabei alles in ihrem Wirkungsbereich. Jegliche Art von Materie, seien es Häuser, Einheiten, Menschen, Tiere, Pflanzen, ja selbst der Erdboden, wird auf die Größe eines Tennisballs komprimiert, sodass nach einem Einschlag nichts als das reine Grundwasser zurückbleibt. Die taktische Fusionsbombe ist deshalb nicht nur zur Kriegsführung geeignet, sie kann auch genutzt werden, um neue Wasserwege zu erschaffen und ansonsten unnützes Land zu entfernen.
TEXT.Italian: La bomba a fusione tattica è la prima delle più moderne e grandi risorse con cui dare una bella sorpresa a quella speciale civiltà. Questo nuovo tipo di bomba rende obsoleta la necessità di grandi esplosioni, includendo le radiazioni del fallout delle comuni bombe atomiche. Al contrario, la bomba usa il potere dell'implosione, forzando tutto ciò che è all'interno del suo raggio esplosivo in un grumo delle dimensioni di una palla da baseball. A causa della grande intensità di quest'arma, solo poche sono state costruite. Questa è una grande arma anche per costruire un canale e dare accesso all'acqua a quell'inutile città di terra. ATTENZIONE: cerca di mantenere molti alleati, se non vuoi che il tuo impero diventi un grande lago!.
TEXT.Polish: The Tactical Fusi (short for Fusion) is the first in the latest and greatest way to give that special civilization a good surprise. This new type of bomb obsoletes the need for messy explosions including the all-elusive radiation fallout from nuclear bombs. Instead, this bomb expands upon the power of implosions, forcing everything within it's radius into a ball of mush the size of a baseball. Due to the pure intensity of this weapon, only so many may be made to try and keep the pothole count down. This is also a great weapon to make a canal or give that useless, landlocked city some water access. WARNING: try to keep as many civs allied at a time so your country won't end up as a big lake.
TEXT.Russian: Оперативно-тактическая термоядерная ракета (сокращенно «Фьюжн») - это первый и наилучший способ преподнести хороший сюрприз зазнавшемуся конкуренту. Этот новый тип бомб устраняет необходимость в грязных взрывах, включая всеохватывающие радиационные выбросы от ядерных бомб. Вместо этого эта ракета порождает чистую взрывную волну необычайной мощности, обращая все в пределах своего радиуса действия в шарики размером с бейсбольный мяч. Из-за чистой силы этого оружия, только очень немногие могут попытаться уменьшить количество ударных кратеров. Также это отличное оружие для сооружения рукотворных проливов, дав шанс захудалому, не имеющему выхода к морю городу доступ к воде. [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]ВНИМАНИЕ:[COLOR_REVERT] старайтесь поддерживать отношения с как можно большим числом союзных цивилизаций, чтобы ваша страна однажды не превратилась в большое озеро.

TEXT.English: The Hi-Tech APC, also known as the H-APC, is an Future Armoured Personnel Carrier (APC) that is widely used throughout the world by many different factions. Hi-tech APC is a mainstay vehicle of the transhuman army. It has provided safe transportation of Super Soldiers swiftly and safely to the forefront of battle. Robust and versatile, and able to resist the most hostile of environments, the H-APC has become the basic troop transport for transhuman infantry squads. It has also been used by many other trusted branches of the future armed forces, including the Special Infantry, Genetic Soldiers, Anddroids and the cybernetic forces.
TEXT.Polish: Opancerzony wóz bojowy s³u¿¹cy do transportu piechoty i sprzêtu na polu walki, a w ograniczonym zakresie do jej wsparcia ogniowego. Jest s³abiej uzbrojony i opancerzony od bojowego wozu piechoty, o podobnym przeznaczeniu, lecz s³u¿¹cego ponadto do wsparcia ogniowego piechoty w walce. Transportery opancerzone budowane s¹ zarówno jako terenowe pojazdy ko³owe oraz jako g¹sienicowe; w okresie II wojny œwiatowej budowano transportery pó³g¹sienicowe. Liczne konstrukcje tego typu s¹ pojazdami amfibijnymi, mog¹cymi p³ywaæ w wodzie. Wczesne transportery opancerzone by³y czêsto odkryte od góry, od lat 60. budowane s¹ jedynie konstrukcje zakryte, z regu³y wyposa¿one tak¿e w systemy ochrony wnêtrza przed broni¹ masowego ra¿enia (urz¹dzenie filtrowentylacyjne). TEXT.Russian: Высокотехнологический бронетранспортер, также известный как Хай-тек БМП, является бронетранспортером будущего (БМП), который широко используется во всем мире многими различными фракциями. Высокотехнологичный БТР является опорным средством трансчеловеческой армии. Это обеспечило быструю и безопасную транспортировку суперсолдат на передовую. Надежный и универсальный, способный противостоять самым враждебным условиям, этот БМП стал основным транспортом войск для отрядов сверхчеловеческой пехоты. Он также использовался многими другими заслуживающими доверия подразделениями будущих вооруженных сил, включая спецназ, генно-модифицированных солдат, андроидов и киборгов.

TEXT.English: A fyrd was a type of early Anglo-Saxon army that was mobilized from freemen to defend their shire, or from selected representatives to join a royal expedition. Service in the fyrd was usually of short duration and participants were expected to provide their own arms and provisions. The composition of the fyrd evolved over the years, particularly as a reaction to raids and invasions by the Vikings. The system of defence and conscription was reorganised during the reign of Alfred the Great, who set up 33 fortified towns (or burhs) in his kingdom of Wessex. The amount of taxation required to maintain each town was laid down in a document known as the Burghal Hidage. Each lord had his individual holding of land assessed in hides. Based on his land holding, he had to contribute men and arms to maintain and defend the burhs. Non-compliance with this requirement could lead to severe penalties.

Gaeroas (Guy-rows; "Spear Soldiers") are the file warriors of the tribes of Gaul and Britain. The Gaeroas all utilize well-made long spears, and a few decent javelins, making them both fair melee warriors and impromptu skirmishers. Their versatility, and low relative expense, mean they are a fine warrior band for enterprising warlords looking to expand their lands. They have some experience with combat, but are not yet hardened to battle. However, they are trained well enough to march in a good formation, something actually lost on greater warriors for the Britons. Their longspears may seem a bit unwieldy, but this is likely to help them in combating cavalry and chariot horses as a unit. While unarmored, they have large oval shields, which provides them a good amount of protection. They are fairly well trained with these shields, and they provide a fair amount of protection from ranged attacks, but the lack of armor makes them quite vulnerable to flanking

Galapagos Penguins have the smallest breeding range and population size of any penguin, with less than a thousand breeding pairs. They only occur in the Galapagos Islands, with 90% of the population being restricted to the western islands of Fernandina and Isabela.[PARAGRAPH:2]Galapagos Penguins are the smallest of the South American penguins, with an average length of less than 50cm, and an average weight of less than 2.5kg. They have a black head and upperparts, with a thin white line running from the throat, up around the head to meet the corner of the eye. The underparts are white, but are bordered by a black line which extends down to the blackish legs. The upper bill and tip of the lower bill are black, with the remainder of the lower bill and surrounding skin around to the eye being pinkish yellow. The females are smaller than the males, but have similar plumage.[PARAGRAPH:2]Unlike most other penguins, Galapagos Penguins have no particular breeding season, and may have as many as three clutches in a single year. This is an adaptation that allows them to take advantage of periods of high food abundance, and to cope with a very variable and unreliable food resource.>
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Galápagos-Pinguin[COLOR_REVERT] (Spheniscus mendiculus) gehört zu den Brillenpinguinen und kommt ausschließlich auf den Galápagos-Inseln vor. Es ist die seltenste Pinguinart überhaupt.[NEWLINE]Galápagos-Pinguine werden 48 bis 53 Zentimeter groß. Ihr Rückengefieder ist dunkel, das Bauchgefieder weiß und manchmal mit dunklen Flecken versehen. Wie alle Brillenpinguine haben sie ein weißes Band, das um die Augen bis zum Schnabel verläuft. Der ebenfalls weiße Streifen um den Bauch herum ist weniger stark ausgeprägt als bei anderen Brillenpinguinen. Jungtiere sind zunächst grau und erhalten nach der ersten Mauser ihr Erwachsenengefieder. Die meisten Brutpaare leben auf der Hauptinsel Isabela und der ihr vorgelagerten Insel Fernandina. Obwohl sie keine guten Taucher sind, wagen sich die Tiere bei der Jagd in Tiefen von drei Metern, maximal können sie 15 m tief tauchen. Sie bevorzugen Fisch (Sardinen, Sardellen), wobei sie ihre Beute in Buchten treiben. Im freien Wasser werden die Fische von mehreren Pinguinen umkreist. Anschließend fangen sie abwechselnd ihre Beute. Galápagos-Pinguine sind Höhlenbrüter. Die Höhlen befinden sich meist in tiefen Guanoschichten, die mit Pflanzenmaterial gepolstert werden. Der Brutzyklus ist unregelmäßig und scheint von der Wassertemperatur abhängig zu sein. Es kann sein, dass die Paare bis zu dreimal jährlich brüten oder sich während der Brutzeit mausern, was für Pinguine ungewöhnlich ist. Ein Gelege besteht aus zwei Eiern, die im Abstand von wenigen Tagen gelegt werden. Die Brutzeit beträgt ca. 40 Tage, wobei die Jungen zeitversetzt schlüpfen. In den ersten Wochen bleibt immer ein Elterntier mit im Nest, während das andere Nahrung beschafft, später gehen beide Elternteile gleichzeitig auf Futtersuche.[NEWLINE]Feinde haben die Galápagos-Pinguine nicht nur im Wasser (beispielsweise Haie oder Seelöwen), sondern auch an Land (Sumpfohreule, Galápagosbussard). Eier und Küken sind zudem durch Schlangen und die Rote Klippenkrabbe gefährdet. Die größte Gefahr ist El Niño, der durch das Ausbleiben von Nahrung Bruterfolge einer ganzen Saison zunichtemachen und auch viele Alttiere töten kann. Da der Lebensraum des Galápagos-Pinguins nur auf die Inselgruppe beschränkt ist und es deshalb sowie nur wenige Exemplare gibt, gilt die Art als stark gefährdet.
TEXT.Polish: Pingwin równikowy (Spheniscus mendiculus) - gatunek du¿ego ptaka wodnego z rodziny pingwinów (Spheniscidae), zamieszkuj¹cy wy³¹cznie wyspy Galapagos. Jest to jedyny gatunek pingwina gnie¿d¿¹cy siê na pó³kuli pó³nocnej.

TEXT.English: The Galápagos tortoise or Galápagos giant tortoise (Chelonoidis nigra) is the largest living species of tortoise, reaching weights of over 400 kg (880 lb) and lengths of over 1.8 meters (5.9 ft). With life spans in the wild of over 100 years, it is one of the longest-lived vertebrates. A captive individual lived at least 170 years.[PARAGRAPH:2]The tortoise is native to seven of the Galápagos Islands, a volcanic archipelago about 1,000 km (620 mi) west of the Ecuadorian mainland. Spanish explorers who discovered the islands in the 16th century named them after the Spanish galápago, meaning tortoise.[PARAGRAPH:2]Shell size and shape vary between populations. On islands with humid highlands, the tortoises are larger, with domed shells and short necks. On islands with dry lowlands, the tortoises are smaller, with "saddleback" shells and long necks. These island-to-island differences played a role in the inception of Charles Darwin's theory of evolution.[PARAGRAPH:2]Tortoise numbers declined from over 250,000 in the 16th century to a low of around 3,000 in the 1970s. The decline was caused by hunting for tortoise meat and oil, habitat clearance for agriculture, and introduction of non-native animals such as rats, goats, and pigs. Ten subspecies of the original fifteen survive in the wild. An eleventh subspecies (C. n. abingdoni) has only a single living individual, in captivity, nicknamed Lonesome George. Conservation efforts beginning in the 20th century have resulted in thousands of captive-bred juveniles being released onto their home islands, and it is estimated that numbers exceeded 19,000 at the start of the 21st century. Despite this rebound, the species as a whole is classified as "Vulnerable" by the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN).
TEXT.German: Die Galápagos-Riesenschildkröte (Chelonoidis nigra) ist die größte rezente Landschildkröte, die ausschließlich auf dem Galápagos-Archipel lebt. Die Männchen sind deutlich größer als die Weibchen, haben einen längeren Schwanz, einen flacheren Rückenpanzer und längere Fußnägel. Frei lebende Tiere erreichen eine Panzerlänge von 134 cm und können bis zu 290 kg schwer werden, in Gefangenschaft sogar über 400 kg.[NEWLINE]Zahlreiche Pflanzen stehen auf dem Speiseplan der Galápagos-Riesenschildkröte. Besonders gern frisst sie Opuntien, aber auch andere Kakteen, Beeren, Gräser und Kräuter. Zur Paarungszeit legen die Weibchen bis zu 17 Eier in eine Nisthöhle, aus der sich die Jungtiere nach dem Schlüpfen selbstständig graben. Riesenschildkröten können weit über 100 Jahre alt werden.[NEWLINE]Die Galápagos-Riesenschildkröte ist eine bedrohte Tierart. Einige Unterarten sind bereits ausgestorben. Ihre Feinde sind vor allem Ziegen, Schweine und andere Tiere, welche die Gelege zerstören und Jungtiere töten. Eingeschleppte Pflanzen verdrängen die heimischen Arten und zerstören somit den Lebensraum der Schildkröte.
