TEXT.English: The Galleass is a large, fast, heavily armed three-masted Mediterranean galley with a forecastle and aftcastle from the 16th and 17th centuries. As converted for military use they were higher and larger than regular ("light") galleys. They had as many as thirty-two oars, each worked by up to 5 men. Much effort was made in Venice to make these galleasses as fast as they could be so they could compete with regular galleys. The gun-deck usually ran over the rowers' heads, although pictures showing the opposite arrangement exist. Galleasses usually carried more sails than true galleys, and were far deadlier; a galley caught broadside lay all but helpless, but coming broadside to a galleass, as with a ship of the line, merely exposed an attacker to her gunfire. The galleass exemplified an intermediate type between the galley and the true man-of-war. Relatively few galleasses were built, one disadvantage was that, being more reliant on sails, their position at the front of the galley line at the start of a battle could not be guaranteed, but they featured at the Battle of Lepanto (7 October 1571), their firepower helping to win victory for the Christian fleet, and some sufficiently seaworthy galleasses accompanied the Spanish Armada in 1588 (e.g. La Girona). In the Mediterranean, with its shallower waters, less dangerous weather and fickle winds, galleasses and galleys alike continued in use, particularly in Venice and Turkey, long after they became regarded as obsolete elsewhere. Later, "round ships" and galleasses were replaced by galleons and ships of the line which originated in northern Europe.
TEXT.German: Die Galeasse ist eine große, schnelle, schwer bewaffnete, dreimastige, mediterrane Galeere. Mit der Erfindung der Stückpforte wurde es möglich eine größere Zahl von Geschützen in der Breitseitenaufstelleung zu installieren; dies jedoch nur bei Segelschiffen, denn bei Geleeren war die Breitseite mit den Ruderern belegt. So baute man Geleeren mit einem weiteren Deck um Geschütze aufzunehmen, die Geleasse.
TEXT.Italian: La galea è stata la prima nave appositamente progettata per la guerra. Introdotta dai Greci, quest'imbarcazione si muoveva grazie alla presenza di file di remi su ciascun lato, utilizzati da rematori ben addestrati. Questi uomini erano professionisti con un ottimo salario o cittadini patriottici, non schiavi e prigionieri come si crede. Un grosso "rostro" di bronzo, montato sulla prua della nave, veniva utilizzato per colpire e affondare le navi nemiche. A causa del suo scafo lungo e stretto, la galea era molto instabile al di fuori delle acque placide: di conseguenza, l'equipaggio non perdeva mai di vista la costa, proprio per evitare pericoli durante la navigazione.
TEXT.Spanish: La galera fue el primer barco diseñado para la guerra. Inventadas por los griegos, las galeras contaban con bancos de remos a ambos lados, manejados por marineros avezados. Los remeros eran profesionales muy bien remunerados o patriotas, no los esclavos y prisioneros que aparecen en las películas. Un enorme espolón de bronce instalado en la proa de la nave se utilizaba para embestir y hundir las embarcaciones enemigas. Debido a su casco alargado y de poco calado, la galera solo era estable en las aguas más tranquilas, y como consecuencia de ello, raramente se alejaba de la costa durante largos periodos de tiempo, no fuera a sucumbir en alguna tormenta.
TEXT.Polish: Galeas (galeasa; w³. galeazza, tur. mahon) - okrêt wios³owo-¿aglowy u¿ywany od koñca XVI wieku do po³owy XVIII wieku. Okrêty o d³ugoœci dochodz¹cej do 80 metrów, szerokoœci - 16 m, wypornoœci - 1000 ton. Obok wiose³ napêd stanowi³o o¿aglowanie ³aciñskie rozmieszczone na trzech masztach. Artyleria tych wielkich okrêtów porównywalna by³a niekiedy z liniowcami - dochodzi³a do 60 dzia³. Ciê¿kie dzia³a (30-40) umieszczano na nadbudówkach rufowej i dziobowej. Na œródokrêciu ustawiano jedynie lekkie dzia³a - st¹d galeasy nie prowadzi³y g³ównego ognia burtami, jak to np. czyni³y fregaty czy liniowce. Za³oga siêga³a 700 ludzi, w tym oko³o 400 wioœlarzy umieszczonych pod pok³adem (na jedno wios³o przypada³o ich 5-8).

TEXT.English: By the late 15th century, oar-powered vessels had all but disappeared from the world's oceans, to be replaced by sailing vessels of various types. The galleon was one such vessel. Galleons were three- or four-masted ships, built high in both the forecastle and the stern. Developed in the 15th and 16th century, these versatile ships were mainly used as cargo vessels, although they were sometimes outfitted as light warships as well. Ships of this type served European nations well into the 1700s.
TEXT.French: A la fin du XVe siècle, les bateaux à rames avaient totalement disparu et avaient été remplacés par différents types de navires à voiles. Le galion était un de ceux-là. C'était un navire à trois ou quatre mâts, dont le gaillard d'avant et la poupe étaient surélevés. Créés au XVe et XVIe siècles, ces navires polyvalents étaient essentiellement utilisés pour le commerce, même si certains étaient équipés pour la guerre. Les états européens utilisèrent ces navires avec succès tout au long du XVIIIe siècle.
TEXT.German: Die bis dahin üblichen Ruderschiffe waren im späten 15. Jahrhundert fast vollständig durch verschiedene Segelschiffe ersetzt worden, zu denen auch die Galeone gehörte. Als besonderes Merkmal besaßen Galeonen neben den drei bis vier Masten auch auffällig hohe Bug- und Heckaufbauten. Diese vielseitigen Schiffe wurden überwiegend als Frachtschiffe, zum Teil aber auch als leichte Kriegsschiffe eingesetzt und bevölkerten die Meere Europas bis ins 18. Jahrhundert.
TEXT.Italian: Alla fine del XV secolo, le imbarcazioni a remi scomparvero completamente dai mari, per essere sostituite da navi a vela di vari tipi. Il galeone era una di questi; era una nave a tre o quattro alberi con poppa e prua molto alte. Sviluppate nel corso del XV e XVI secolo, queste versatili imbarcazioni erano usate soprattutto per il trasporto, anche se talvolta venivano impiegate in battaglia come navi da guerra leggere. Navi di questo tipo furono utilizzate in tutta Europa fino al 1700.
TEXT.Spanish: Hacia finales del siglo XV, los barcos de remos prácticamente habían desaparecido de los océanos del mundo, reemplazados por diferentes embarcaciones de vela. El galeón era una de estas embarcaciones Los galeones eran barcos de tres o cuatro palos y gran altura, tanto en la popa como en la proa. Inventadas entre los siglos XV y XVI, estas versátiles embarcaciones fueron utilizadas sobre todo como naves de carga, aunque a veces sirvieran también como barcos de guerra ligeros. Este tipo de barcos estuvo en servicio en las marinas europeas hasta bien entrado el siglo XVIII.

TEXT.English: The galley was the first ship designed for war. Introduced by the Greeks, galleys were powered by banks of oars on each side, manned by well-trained oarsmen. These oarsmen were highly paid professionals or patriotic citizens, not slaves and prisoners as depicted in fiction. A huge, bronze "beak" mounted at the bow of the ship was used to ram and sink enemy ships. Because of its long, narrow hull, the galley was very unstable in all but the calmest waters, and as a consequence its crew rarely ventured out of sight of land for long periods of time, lest the ship be caught in a storm and sunk.
TEXT.French: La galère fut le premier navire conçu pour la guerre. Créée par les Grecs, elle était propulsée par plusieurs rangs de rameurs bien entraînés, installés de chaque côté du bateau. Contrairement à ce que l'on pense, ces rameurs étaient des professionnels ou des volontaires, et non des esclaves ou des prisonniers. Un énorme "éperon" en bronze était fixé sur la proue pour éperonner et couler les navires ennemis. La longue coque étroite du bateau le rendait instable dès que la mer s'agitait un peu, et les équipages évitaient généralement de s'aventurer trop longtemps loin des côtes, de peur qu'une tempête survienne et coule le navire.
TEXT.German: Die von den Griechen in der Antike entworfene und gebaute Triere war das erste Kriegsschiff überhaupt. Auf beiden Seiten des Schiffes befanden sich Ruderbänke, an denen erfahrene Ruderer für volle Fahrt sorgten. Entgegen der häufig vertretenen Theorie, dass es sich dabei um Sklaven oder Gefangene handelte, bestand die Rudermannschaft normalerweise aus gut bezahlten, fachkundigen Seeleuten oder patriotischen Bürgern. Am Bug befand sich ein riesiger, meist aus Bronze gefertigter Schnabel, mit dessen Hilfe feindliche Schiffe gerammt und versenkt werden konnten. Da die Triere wegen ihres langen, schmalen Rumpfs bei rauer See sehr instabil wurde, entfernte sie sich selten weit von der Küste, denn jeder Sturm hätte ausgereicht, um sie zum Kentern zu bringen.
TEXT.Italian: La galea è stata la prima nave appositamente progettata per la guerra. Introdotta dai Greci, quest'imbarcazione si muoveva grazie alla presenza di file di remi su ciascun lato, utilizzati da rematori ben addestrati. Questi uomini erano professionisti con un ottimo salario o cittadini patriottici, non schiavi e prigionieri come si crede. Un grosso "rostro" di bronzo, montato sulla prua della nave, veniva utilizzato per colpire e affondare le navi nemiche. A causa del suo scafo lungo e stretto, la galea era molto instabile al di fuori delle acque placide: di conseguenza, l'equipaggio non perdeva mai di vista la costa, proprio per evitare pericoli durante la navigazione.
TEXT.Spanish: La galera fue el primer barco diseñado para la guerra. Inventadas por los griegos, las galeras contaban con bancos de remos a ambos lados, manejados por marineros avezados. Los remeros eran profesionales muy bien remunerados o patriotas, no los esclavos y prisioneros que aparecen en las películas. Un enorme ?espolón? de bronce instalado en la proa de la nave se utilizaba para embestir y hundir las embarcaciones enemigas. Debido a su casco alargado y de poco calado, la galera solo era estable en las aguas más tranquilas, y como consecuencia de ello, raramente se alejaba de la costa durante largos periodos de tiempo, no fuera a sucumbir en alguna tormenta.

TEXT.English: A galiot, galliot or galiote, is a term for three different types of historical naval vessels that sailed on different seas, and for a type of French flat-bottom river boat or barge.
TEXT.French: Une galiote, galliot ou galiote, est un terme désignant trois types différents de navires historiques qui naviguaient sur différentes mers, et aussi un type de bateau à fond plat français pour la rivière ou une barge.

TEXT.English: Sintashta is situated in the steppe just east of the Ural Mountains. The site is named for the adjacent Sintashta River, a tributary to the Tobol. The shifting course of the river over time has destroyed half of the site, leaving behind thirty one of the approximately fifty or sixty houses in the settlement.
TEXT.French: Sintashta est située dans la steppe juste à l'est des montagnes de l'Oural. Le site tire son nom de la rivière Sintashta adjacente, un affluent du Tobol. Le cours changeant de la rivière au fil du temps a détruit la moitié du site, ne laissant que trente et une des environ cinquante ou soixante maisons dans la colonie.

TEXT.English: Emperor Gaozong of Tang (21 July 628 - 27 December 683), personal name Li Zhi, was the third emperor of the Tang dynasty in China, ruling from 649 to 683 (although after January 665 much of the governance was in the hands of his second wife Empress Wu (later known as Wu Zetian)). Emperor Gaozong was the son of Emperor Taizong and Empress Zhangsun.
TEXT.French: L'empereur Gaozong de Tang (21 juillet 628 - 27 décembre 683), de son nom personnel Li Zhi, fut le troisième empereur de la dynastie Tang en Chine, régnant de 649 à 683 (bien qu'après janvier 665, une grande partie du pouvoir fut aux mains de sa seconde épouse l'impératrice Wu (plus tard connue sous le nom de Wu Zetian)). L'empereur Gaozong était le fils de l'empereur Taizong et de l'impératrice Zhangsun.

TEXT.English: The Garamantines were a group of Berber tribes living in North central Africa on the fringe of the Sahara desert that herded cattle and irrigated farmland. They conducted raids against towns to the North and against the nomadic Saharan people known to the Greeks as the Troglodytai. The Garamantines reached dominance in the second and third century AD and are often referred to as one of the first great Berber nations. They fought on foot, from horseback and from chariots. Much of the evidence for their equipment comes from their own rock art and Egyptian paintings of Libyan soldiers. Herodotos refers to the Garamantes as a fierce and aggressive tribe that would hunt down the Troglodytai but also says that they are a people who know little of war. Herodotos made the Garamantines famous for his fanciful tale of the cattle they raised which supposedly had horns so long they had to graze backwards.

The gastraphetes (English translation: "belly-releaser") was a hand-held crossbow used by the Ancient Greeks. It was described in the 1st century AD by the Greek author Heron of Alexandria in his work Belopoeica, which draws on an earlier account of the famous Greek engineer Ctesibius (fl. 285-222 BC). Heron identifies the gastraphetes as the forerunner of the later catapult, which places its invention some unknown time prior to c. 420 BC.

A hunter-gatherer society is one whose primary subsistence method involves the direct procurement of edible plants and animals from the wild, foraging and hunting without significant recourse to the domestication of either. Hunter-gatherers obtain most from gathering rather than hunting; up to 80% of the food is obtained by gathering. The demarcation between hunter-gatherers and other societies which rely more upon domestication (see agriculture and pastoralism and neolithic revolution) is not clear-cut, as many contemporary societies combine both strategies to sustain their population.
TEXT.German: Da der Mensch neben Fleisch auch pflanzliche Nahrung verdauen kann, wurde zur Bereicherung des Speiseplans schon in der Vorzeit alles Essbare gesammelt, was die Natur im Umfeld hergab: Beeren, Nüsse, Gemüse, Wurzeln, Honig, Eier, aber auch Kleintiere, Maden, Raupen und Insekten. Es wurden immer neue Nahrungsquellen erschlossen, wobei aber wegen der Vergiftungsgefahr bei unbekannten Pflanzen und Kleintieren stets mit Vorsicht vorgegangen werden musste.
TEXT.Polish: Ludy zbieracko-³owieckie - typ spo³eczeñstwa lub gospodarki polegaj¹cy na zdobywaniu po¿ywienia przez zbieranie jadalnych roœlin i polowanie bez znacz¹cego wysi³ku w kierunku udomowienia jednych czy drugich. Przy czym najczêœciej udzia³ zbieractwa jest bardziej znacz¹cy. Od pocz¹tku istnienia ludzkoœci a¿ po schy³ek epoki mezolitu by³a to jedyna forma gospodarki stosowana przez ludzi. Pierwsi ³owcy-zbieracze ¿yli wy³¹cznie na otwartej sawannie i zamiast polowania przeszukiwali okolicê - zdobywali miêso zwierz¹t pad³ych lub upolowanych przez drapie¿niki. Techniki ³owieckie rozwinê³y siê póŸniej, g³ównie w œrodkowym i górnym paleolicie.
TEXT.Russian: Общество охотников-собирателей - это социум, основной метод существования которого заключается в том, чтобы напрямую добывать съедобные растения и животных из дикой природы, добывать пищу и охотиться без значительного использования одомашнивания. Охотники-собиратели получают больше всего от собирания, чем от охоты; до 80% пищи получают путем сбора. Разграничение между охотниками-собирателями и другими обществами, которые больше полагаются на одомашнивание (см. Сельское хозяйство и скотоводство и Неолитическая революция), не является четким, поскольку многие современные общества сочетают обе стратегии для поддержания своего населения.

TEXT.English: The Gatling gun is one of the best known early rapid-fire weapons and a forerunner of the modern machine gun. It is well known for its use by the Union forces during the American Civil War in the 1860s, which was the first time it was employed in combat. Later it was also famously used in the assault on San Juan Hill during the Spanish-American War.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Gatling gun's operation centred on a cyclic multi-barrel design which facilitated cooling and synchronized the firing/reloading sequence. Each barrel fired a single shot when it reached a certain point in the cycle, after which it ejected the spent cartridge, loaded a new round, and in the process, cooled down somewhat. This configuration allowed higher rates of fire to be achieved without the barrel overheating.
TEXT.Polish: Kartaczownica Gatlinga jeden z prekursorów karabinu maszynowego. W odró¿nieniu od poprzednich broni tego typu, wielolufowy karabin Gatlinga zapewnia³ du¿¹ szybkostrzelnoœæ i ³atwoœæ ponownego ³adowania. Z technicznego punktu widzenia ta konstrukcja, nie jest karabinem maszynowym, gdy¿ ogieñ z niej prowadzony jest rêcznie, a nie automatycznie. Skonstruowany zosta³ w roku 1861 przez Richarda Gatlinga, wypar³ wczeœniejsz¹ kartaczownicê Agera. Zasadnicza idea broni by³a znana ju¿ w XVIII wieku kilkanaœcie umieszczonych obok siebie luf, odpalanych kolejno, mia³o zapewniæ prowadzenie nieprzerwanego ognia. Na przeszkodzie w realizacji tego pomys³u sta³y jednak brak odpowiednich nabojów i ograniczenia technologiczne, których pokonanie mo¿liwe by³o dopiero w drugiej po³owie XIX wieku. Gatling wykorzysta³ pojawienie siê nabojów zespolonych z metalow¹ ³usk¹ i opracowa³ nowatorski system odpalania ³adunków z poszczególnych luf, po³¹czony z ruchem samych luf, podajnika i zamka. Dziêki temu jego broñ mia³a teoretyczn¹ szybkostrzelnoœæ oko³o 1200 strza³ów na minutê, a szybkostrzelnoœæ praktyczna dochodzi³a do 200 strz./min. Obs³ugê karabinu stanowi³o 4 ¿o³nierzy.

TEXT.English: During the wars of the 19th century in the Southern Cone, the cavalries on all sides were composed almost entirely of gauchos. In Argentina, gaucho armies such as that of Martín Miguel de Güemes, slowed Spanish advances. Furthermore, many caudillos relied on gaucho armies to control the Argentine provinces.
TEXT.French: Pendant les guerres du 19e siècle dans le cône sud, les cavaleries de tous les côtés étaient composées presque entièrement de gauchos. En Argentine, des armées de gauchos telles que celle de Martín Miguel de Güemes ralentissaient les avancées espagnoles. De plus, de nombreux caudillos comptaient sur les armées gauchos pour contrôler les provinces argentines.

TEXT.English: In the context of the wars between Russia and the Muslim peoples of the Caucasus, starting as early as the late 18th century's Sheikh Mansur's resistance to Russian expansion, the word usually appears in the form gazavat.
TEXT.French: Dans le contexte des guerres entre la Russie et les peuples musulmans du Caucase, débutant dès la résistance du cheikh Mansur à l'expansion russe à la fin du XVIIIe siècle, le mot apparaît généralement sous la forme gazavat.

TEXT.English: The invention of the gear, along with many other new developments in machinery and parts development pushed the science of engineering to new heights, prompting deeper specialization into the development and repair of many new forms of mechanical wizardry. Those who maintained this knowledge at the cutting edge were often drafted into the service of the state to maintain the most complex equipment.
TEXT.French: L'invention de l'engrenage, ainsi que de nombreux autres développements dans la machinerie et la fabrication de pièces, a porté la science de l'ingénierie à de nouveaux sommets, favorisant une spécialisation plus poussée dans le développement et la réparation de nombreuses nouvelles formes de technologies mécaniques. Ceux qui maîtrisaient cette connaissance de pointe étaient souvent réquisitionnés au service de l'État pour entretenir les équipements les plus complexes.

TEXT.English: The Genoese crossbowmen (Italian: Balestrieri genovesi) were a famous military corps of the Middle Ages, which acted both in defence of the Republic of Genoa, and as mercenaries for other Italian or European powers.
TEXT.French: Les arbalétriers génois (italien : Balestrieri genovesi) étaient un corps militaire célèbre du Moyen Âge, qui agissait à la fois pour la défense de la République de Gênes et comme mercenaires pour d'autres puissances italiennes ou européennes.

TEXT.English: Genseric was King of the Vandals and Alans (428-477) who established the Vandal Kingdom was one of the key players in the troubles of the Western Roman Empire in the 5th century. During his nearly 50 years of rule, he raised a relatively insignificant Germanic tribe to the status of a major Mediterranean power - which, after he died, entered a swift decline and eventual collapse.
TEXT.French: Genseric fut roi des Vandales et des Alains (428-477) qui établit le Royaume vandale, et fut l'un des acteurs clés des troubles de l'Empire romain d'Occident au Ve siècle. Pendant ses presque 50 ans de règne, il éleva une tribu germanique relativement insignifiante au rang de grande puissance méditerranéenne - qui, après sa mort, connut un déclin rapide et un effondrement éventuel.

TEXT.English: The Right Honourable George Cadle Price, P.C. (15 January 1919 - 19 September 2011), was a Belizean statesman who served twice as the head of government of Belize from 1961-84 and 1989-93. He served as First Minister and Premier under British rule until independence in 1981 and was the nation's first prime minister after independence that year. He is considered to have been one of the principal architects of Belizean independence. Today he is referred to by many as the "Father of the Nation." Price effectively dominated Belizean politics from the early 1960s until his 1996 retirement from party leadership, serving as the nation's head of government under various titles for most of that period.

German.Text: Panzer V "Panther":Panzer V "Panther":Panzer V "Panther":Panzer V "Panther":Panzer V "Panther":Panzer V "Panther":Panzer V "Panther":Panzer V "Panther"

TEXT.English: The word "Panzer" is short for the German word Panzerkampfwagen, which translates to Armored Fighting Vehicle (or Tank) in English. The first Panzers were developed during the 1930s and used by German forces fighting in the Spanish Civil War, but they are most famous for their use during World War II as part of the German Blitzkrieg. Early Panzer models were technologically inferior to those used by Allied forces (especially the Soviet T-34 tank), and many German victories were won more due to the skill of their commanders than to the weaponry the Panzers carried. The Panzer V (known as the Panther) and the Panzer VI (or Tiger) developed during the war made significant improvements to the earlier designs and were a match for any Allied tanks. In the end, heavy bombing of German factories disrupted production and prevented large numbers of these weapons from being produced.
TEXT.French: Le terme "Panzer" est l'abréviation du mot allemand Panzerkampfwagen, qui signifie "véhicule de combat blindé" ou "char". Les premiers Panzers furent conçus dans les années 1930 et utilisés par les forces allemandes lors de la guerre civile d'Espagne, mais prouvèrent véritablement leur efficacité pendant la guerre éclair (Blitzkrieg) menée par les Allemands durant la Deuxième Guerre mondiale. Les premiers modèles mis en service étant techniquement inférieurs aux chars utilisés par les forces alliées (surtout au T-34 soviétique), la plupart des victoires remportées par l'Allemagne étant davantage dues aux compétences des généraux qu'à l'armement des Panzers. Le Panzer V ("Panther") et le Panzer VI ("Tiger"), développés au cours de la guerre, étaient dotés d'améliorations significatives et leur puissance, sans commune mesure avec celle des premiers modèles, surpassait nettement tous les chars alliés. La production des Panzers fut interrompue suite au bombardement intensif des usines d'assemblement allemandes.
TEXT.German: Die ersten deutschen Panzer bzw. "Panzerkampfwagen" wurden in den 1930er Jahren entwickelt und während des Spanischen Bürgerkriegs erstmals eingesetzt. Im 2. Weltkrieg ermöglichten Panzer der deutschen Armee die so genannten "Blitzkriege". Die ersten deutschen Panzer waren den Modellen der Alliierten (beispielsweise dem sowjetischen T-34) technisch klar unterlegen. Nicht zuletzt deshalb verdankten die Deutschen einen Großteil ihrer Siege eher ihren fähigen Panzerkommandeuren, als der Bewaffnung ihrer Panzer. Erst die während des Krieges gebauten Panzer V (Panther) und Panzer VI (Tiger) waren den alliierten Panzern ebenbürtig. Allerdings verhinderte die gezielte Bombardierung deutscher Panzerfabriken die flächendeckende Produktion dieser neuen Waffen.
TEXT.Italian: "Panzer" è l'abbreviazione della parola tedesca Panzerkampfwagen, che significa veicolo d'assalto corazzato (o carro armato). I primi panzer vennero sviluppati negli anni' 30 e vennero utilizzati dalle forze Tedesche durante la Guerra Civile Spagnola, ma sono sicuramente più noti per il ruolo ricoperto nel Blitzkrieg della Seconda Guerra Mondiale. I primi modelli di panzer erano tecnologicamente inferiori a quelli utilizzati dalle forze alleate (specialmente rispetto al carro armato T-34 sovietico) e molte vittorie tedesche erano da attribuirsi unicamente alla grande abilità dei propri comandanti. Il panzer V (noto con il nome di Panther) e il panzer VI (Tiger) vennero sviluppati durante la guerra e riuscirono a raggiungere le prestazioni dei carri nemici; alla fine, però, i massicci bombardamenti degli alleati distrussero la maggior parte delle fabbriche e ne fermarono la produzione.
TEXT.Spanish: La palabra "Panzer" es una abreviatura de la palabra alemana "Panzerkampfwagen", que en español viene a ser algo así como "vehículo blindado de combate" (o tanque). Los primeros Panzers se desarrollaron durante los años 30 del s. XX y ya los usaron las fuerzas alemanas que lucharon en la Guerra Civil española, aunque son más famosos por su utilización en la Segunda Guerra Mundial como parte de la "Blitzkrieg" alemana. Los primeros modelos Panzer eran inferiores tecnológicamente a los que usaban las fuerzas aliadas (especialmente el blindado T-34 soviético) y muchas victorias alemanas de entonces se debieron más a la habilidad de sus comandantes que al armamento que llevaban los Panzers. El Panzer V (conocido como "Panther") y el Panzer VI (o "Tiger") desarrollados durante la guerra introdujeron mejoras importantes a los primeros diseños y ya fueron un rival digno de cualquier tanque aliado. Al final, el bombardeo intensivo de las fábricas alemanas interrumpió la producción y evitó que se dispusiera de cantidades ingentes de estas armas.

TEXT.Polish: Geronimo w³aœciwie Goyahkla lub Goyathlay - jeden z wodzów Indian Chiricahua. Chocia¿ by³ cz³owiekiem pogodnym, przywi¹zanym do rodziny i indiañskim szamanem, zas³yn¹³ przede wszystkim ze zwyciêskich walk podjazdowych na meksykañsko-amerykañskim pograniczu i przypisywanego mu okrucieñstwa. Nie pochodzi³ z rodziny wodzów, ale liczne sukcesy wojenne zyska³y mu wielu zwolenników. Zna³ dobrze hiszpañski i jêzyk Komanczów, ale z jednymi i drugimi zmuszony by³ czêœciej walczyæ, ni¿ rozmawiaæ, unikaj¹c pocz¹tkowo konfliktów z Amerykanami.

TEXT.English: The Epic of King Gesar is the central epic poem of Tibet and much of Central Asia. With about 140 Gesar ballad singers surviving today (including singers of Tibetan, Mongolian, Buryat and Tu ethnicities), it is prized as one of the few living epics. The epic, believed to be approximately 1000 years old, concerns the fearless king Gesar (Geser), who ruled the legendary Kingdom of Ling. When the child is twelve a horse race is held to determine who will become the King of Ling and who will marry the beautiful daughter, 'Brug mo, of a neighbouring chieftain. The hero-child, who in many versions is known as Joru during these early years, returns to Ling, wins the race, marries 'Brug mo, and ascends the golden throne. He thenceforth assumes the title "Gesar". Once he is king, his first major campaign is against the man-eating demon of the north, Klu bTsan. While he is on this campaign, his wife is kidnapped by Gur dKar (literally: "white tent"), the King of Hor. When Gesar returns from a long absence to find this out, he uses his magic to enter the king of Hor's palace, kills him and retrieves his wife. These two episodes - (the demon of the north, and the war with Hor) constitute the first two of four great campaigns against "the four enemies of the four directions". The next two are King Sa dam of 'Jang (sometimes located in Yunnan), and king Shing khri of Mon (sometimes located in the southern Himalayan region). After this he goes on to defeat the "18 great forts", which are listed differently according to different versions and different bards, but nearly always include, sTag gZig (Tajik), Kha che (Muslim) adversaries. Many (in fact an open-ended number) of other "forts" (Tibetan: rdzong) are defeated besides, sometimes listed as forty. When Gesar reaches his eighties, he briefly descends to Hell as a last episode before he leaves the land of men and ascends once more to his celestial paradise.
TEXT.Polish: Epopeja o Królu Gesarze jest najwiêkszym poematem epickim Tybetu i wiêkszej czêœci Azji Œrodkowej. Jest uwa¿ana za ostatni¹ "¿yw¹ epopejê", jako ¿e wœród Tybetañczyków i Mongo³ów znaleŸæ mo¿na ok. 140 pieœniarzy, którzy zajmuj¹ siê t¹ ballad¹. Uwa¿a siê, ¿e pieœñ o nieustraszonym królu Gesarze, który rz¹dzi³ legendarnym Królestwem Ling, ma ponad 1000 lat. Opowiada ona dzieje ¿ycia legendarnych, czêœciowo historycznych lub ca³kiem historycznych bohaterów œrodkowej Azji. Korzenie tej legendy siêgaj¹ pocz¹tków buddyzmu tybetañskiego, zawiera ona równie¿ wiele alegorii do nauk buddyzmu Wad¿rajany.

TEXT.English: In the time of Ancient Rome, gladiators were slaves put into service to fight.
TEXT.French: À l'époque de la Rome antique, les gladiateurs étaient des esclaves mis au service du combat.
TEXT.Italian: Al tempo dell'antica Roma i gladiatori erano schiavi costretti a combattere.
TEXT.Spanish: En los tiempos de la antigua Roma, los gladiadores eran esclavos forzados a luchar.
TEXT.Polish: Gladiator jest niewolnikiem tocz¹cym walkê na arenie w staro¿ytnym Rzymie. Zwyczaj walk gladiatorów wywodzi siê od etruskiego zwyczaju oddawania czci zmar³ym poprzez walki zamiast ofiar ludzkich. W Imperium Rzymskim walki gladiatorów pojawi³y siê oko³o 260 roku p.n.e. i sta³y siê rozrywk¹, ale nabra³y te¿ charakteru politycznego, s³u¿¹c do zdobywania popularnoœci wœród ludu. Gladiatorzy byli czêsto jeñcami wojennymi lub niewolnikami, lecz czasem rekrutowali siê spoœród by³ych ¿o³nierzy. Byli skoszarowani w ludi i szkoleni pod okiem lanisty (nauczyciela). Najs³ynniejsza szko³a gladiatorów mieœci³a siê w Kapui, szkoli³ siê tam m.in. Spartakus. Walki gladiatorów by³y jedn¹ z najpopularniejszych rzymskich rozrywek. Wielu bogatych Rzymian mia³o swoich gladiatorów i p³aci³o fortuny na ich szkolenie. Z tego powodu gladiatorzy nie ginêli na arenie tak czêsto, jak siê dziœ s¹dzi. Najlepsi z nich stawali siê czêsto bardzo s³awni (podobnie jak dzisiaj sportowcy). Przed wejœciem na arenê gladiatorzy sk³adali przysiêgê, ¿e nie bêd¹ oszczêdzali siê w walce. Walki czêsto toczy³y siê na œmieræ i ¿ycie pokonany przeciwnik móg³ prosiæ o ³askê podnosz¹c do góry palec wskazuj¹cy, na co obserwuj¹cy walkê t³um odpowiada³ wyci¹gniêciem w górê kciuka (co oznacza³o darowanie ¿ycia), lub skierowaniem go w dó³ (œmieræ). Jest to jednak kwestia sporna, niektórzy naukowcy uwa¿aj¹ ¿e kierowali kciuk w dó³ aby darowaæ ¿ycie, a ku swojemu gard³u kiedy chcieli œmierci gladiatora.

TEXT.English: Gobir was one of the seven original kingdoms of Hausaland, tracing a lineage back to the 11th century. The seat of the dynasty was at Alkalawa, in northwestern Hausaland. Gobir is particularly remembered as the chief opponent of Fulani Islamic reformer Usman dan Fodio. Bawa, a ruler of Gobir, appears to have invited dan Fodio to the area in 1774; dan Fodio made his home in the small town of Degel, and began preaching. Dan Fodio was given some role in the education of Bawa's nephew and later successor, Yunfa (r.1803-8), but also publicly attacked what he saw as the abuses of the Hausa elite, particularly the burden they placed on the poor.

Goliath was a giant Philistine warrior defeated by the young David, the future king of Israel, in the Bible's Books of Samuel (1 Samuel 17).The original purpose of the story was to show David's identity as the true king of Israel. Post-Classical Jewish traditions stressed Goliath's status as the representative of paganism, in contrast to David, the champion of the God of Israel. Christian tradition gave him a distinctively Christian perspective, seeing in David's battle with Goliath the victory of God's king over the enemies of God's helpless people as a prefiguring of Jesus' victory over sin on the cross and the Church's victory over Satan.

Historically, Fijians were known as the canoe building experts of the Pacific, using them to trade with Tonga. They were usually large double-hulled canoes, called a Drua (pronounced nDroo-ah), with each side being similar except one was shorter and served as a type of outrigger. These were united by beams, with a platform on it that extended beyond the sides.
TEXT.French: Historiquement, les Fidjiens étaient connus comme les experts en construction de pirogues du Pacifique, les utilisant pour commercer avec Tonga. Il s'agissait généralement de grandes pirogues à double coque, appelées Drua (prononcé nDroo-ah), chaque côté étant similaire sauf qu'un côté était plus court et servait de balancier. Elles étaient reliées par des poutres, avec une plateforme qui s'étendait au-delà des côtés.

TEXT.English: Alaric was likely born about 370 on an island named Peuce (the Fir) at the mouth of the Danube in present day Romania. He headed the Visigothic troops serving Emperor Theodosius I. After the emperor's death (395) the troops rebelled and chose Alaric as their leader (see Visigoths). Alaric devastated Thrace, Macedonia, and Greece. Stopped, but not defeated, by Stilicho, he retired northward, and by an agreement with the Eastern emperor, Arcadius, occupied Epirus. In 401 he invaded Italy, where after some indecisive warfare he agreed to withdraw. Stilicho persuaded (407) the Romans to buy Alaric's alliance, but shortly afterward Emperor Honorius had Stilicho executed for treason. Alaric again invaded (408) Italy and laid seige to Rome. Raising the seige after an agreement with the Roman senate, Alaric again turned on Rome (409) and forced the city to accept a puppet emperor, Attalus, whom he himself deposed the next year for disregarding his advice. After the failure of renewed negotiations with Honorius (who all the while held out at Ravenna) Alaric stormed and sacked Rome (410) and then marched south to attack Sicily and Africa. A storm destroyed his fleet, and Alaric, having turned back, died of an illness. His brother Ataulf was elected his successor. It is said that Alaric was buried with his treasures near Cosenza in the bed of the Busento River, which was temporarily diverted from its course. That the secret of his burial place might be kept, the slaves employed in the labor were killed.
TEXT.Polish: Alaryk I (ur. ok. 370, zm. 410) od 395 król Wizygotów z rodu Baltów którym cesarz Walens zezwoli³ osiedliæ siê na terenie Cesarstwa rzymskiego w Mezji. Pierwszy wódz plemion germañskich, który zdoby³ Rzym. Alaryk i jego wspó³plemieñcy walczyli jako "sprzymierzeñcy" w armii cesarza Teodozjusza I w walkach z uzurpatorem Eugeniuszem. Po œmierci Teodozjusza zbuntowani Wizygoci zerwali wczeœniejsze porozumienie z Rzymem i obrali na swojego króla Alaryka pochodz¹cego z rodu Baltów. Wiosn¹ 395 armia wizygocka pod wodz¹ Alaryka ruszy³a przez Tracjê i Macedoniê na Ateny, które zosta³y przez nich prawdopodobnie zdobyte i z³upione. Wizygoci pomaszerowali na po³o¿one w po³udniowo-zachodniej Grecji Elis, gdzie obóz wizygocki zosta³ otoczony przez wojska wodza rzymskiego Stylichona. Z niewiadomych przyczyn Stylichon pozwoli³ Wizygotom wycofaæ siê. Cesarz Cesarstwa Wschodniego Arkadiusz próbowa³ przeci¹gn¹æ Alaryka na swoj¹ stronê przez mianowanie go najwy¿szym zwierzchnikiem wojskowym w prowincji Illiricum. W 401 Alaryk przekroczy³ Alpy i przyst¹pi³ do oblê¿enia Mediolanu, w którym zamkn¹³ siê cesarz Honoriusz. Przyby³y z pomoc¹ Stylichon stoczy³ z Wizygotami bitwê pod Polencj¹ 6 kwietnia 402; po starciu tym Alaryk zobowi¹za³ siê opuœciæ granice Italii. Wizygoci ponownie najechali Italiê ju¿ w nastêpnym roku i jeszcze raz zostali zatrzymani przez Stylichona, tym razem pod Weron¹. W wyniku traktatu musieli wystawiæ zbrojny kontyngent armii pomocniczej; przydzielono im te¿ ziemie nad rzek¹ Saw¹. Alaryk na rozkaz cesarza najecha³ Iliriê Wschodni¹, któr¹ mia³ zdobyæ dla Honoriusza w³adcy Cesarstwa Zachodniego. Illiria nie zosta³a zdobyta, lecz Alaryk za¿¹da³ od Rzymu wyp³acenia ogromnego odszkodowania za poniesione straty; odszkodowanie zosta³o przyznane przez senat. Zamordowanie Stylichona, poplecznika Alaryka, i antygermañskie pogromy w miastach Italii spowodowa³y ponowny najazd Wizygotów jesieni¹ 408; Alaryk oblega³ Rzym i wymusi³ na mieœcie ogromn¹ kontrybucjê (5 tys. funtów z³ota i 30 tys. funtów srebra). 24 sierpnia 410 Wizygoci zdobyli Rzym, który przez trzy dni ³upili (jednak wbrew powszechnej opinii nie zniszczyli ani nie wyrz¹dzili olbrzymich szkód miastu g³ównie ze wzglêdu na fakt, ¿e byli chrzeœcijanami). Alaryk na czele Wizygotów pomaszerowa³ na po³udnie Italii z zamiarem zaokrêtowania swoich ludzi na statki i przewiezienia ich do Afryki. Trzydniowa burza w Cieœninie Mesyñskiej zniszczy³a flotê. Wizygoci udali siê z powrotem na pó³noc. Podczas drogi powrotnej pod koniec 410 Alaryk nieoczekiwanie zmar³. Wed³ug legendy pochowano go w korycie rzeki Busento, w pobli¿u miasta Cosenza, a wraz z nim maj¹tek jaki zdoby³ w Italii.

TEXT.English: Such super-sized bombards had been employed in Western Europe siege warfare since the beginning of the 15th century, and were introduced to the Ottoman army in 1453 by the gunfounder Orban (from Brasov, Kingdom of Hungary) on the occasion of the Siege of Constantinople.
TEXT.French: De tels super-canons de siège furent employés dans la guerre de siège en Europe occidentale dès le début du XVe siècle, et furent introduits dans l'armée ottomane en 1453 par le fondeur d'artillerie Orban (originaire de Brașov, Royaume de Hongrie) à l'occasion du siège de Constantinople.
TEXT.Polish: Bombarda - machina oblê¿nicza miotaj¹ca kamienie, a od XIV wieku odprzodowe dzia³o du¿ego kalibru i krótkiej lufie.
TEXT.Spanish: Gran bombarda

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Farmer[COLOR_REVERT] allows to place a plant or animal resource on any terrain that has no bonus on it. Even if the bonus has not yet been revealed.[PARAGRAPH:2]You need to already have access to the resource to place it either in your own nation or via trade.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grand Agriculteur[COLOR_REVERT] permet de placer une ressource végétale ou animale sur n'importe quel terrain ne disposant d'aucun bonus, même si le bonus n'a pas encore été révélé.[PARAGRAPH:2]Vous devez déjà avoir accès à la ressource pour la placer, que ce soit dans votre propre nation ou via le commerce.
TEXT.Polish: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Wielki Farmer[COLOR_REVERT] pozwala na sadzenie roœlin i rozpoczynanie hodowli zwierz¹t na dowolnym terenie Twojego imperium.
TEXT.Russian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Великий фермер[COLOR_REVERT] позволяет размещать на пустующие клетки на любой местности культурные растения и одомашненных животных, даже если указанные ресурсы еще не открыты.[PARAGRAPH:2]У вас уже должен быть доступ к ресурсу, чтобы иметь возможность использовать его в вашей стране, либо торговать им.

German.Text: Großer General:Großen Generals:Großen General:Großen General:Große Generäle:Großen Generäle:Großen Generälen:Großen Generäle

TEXT.English: Hunting is the practice of killing or trapping any animal, or pursuing it with the intent of doing so. Hunting wildlife or feral animals is most commonly done by humans for food, recreation, or trade. In present-day use, lawful hunting is distinguished from poaching, which is the illegal killing, trapping or capture of the hunted species. The species that are hunted are referred to as game and are usually mammals and birds.
TEXT.Spanish: Un cazador extraordinariamente experimentado.

German.Text: Großer Spion:Großen Spions:Großen Spion:Großen Spion:Große Spione:Großen Spione:Großen Spionen:Großen Spione
Großer Staatsmann:Großen Staatsmannes:Großen Staatsmann:Großen Staatsmann:Große Staatsmänner:Großen Staatsmänner:Großen Staatsmännern:Große Staatsmänner

TEXT.English: Phalanxes were well-trained citizen-soldiers of ancient Greece. Armed with spears and durable armor, they fulfilled the heavy infantry role in most engagements. Phalanxes are tightly packed groupings of eight or sixteen rows of soldiers, who move and attack in unison, scattering less densely organized enemy forces. Phalanxes worked well against the forces of the day, but broke down when facing more mobile and well-trained professional soldiers. The Roman legions victory over the Macedonian phalanx at Pydna in 168 BC effectively ended the phalanx's battlefield usefulness.
TEXT.French: La phalange est une formation de combat de la Grèce antique composée de citoyens-soldats bien entraînés. Ces "hoplites" étaient équipés de lances et de solides armures, et les phalanges formaient l'infanterie lourde de l'époque. La phalange est une formation serrée composée de huit à seize rangs de soldats, marchant et combattant à l'unisson avec pour objectif d'éparpiller les troupes ennemies moins organisées. Formation puissante contre l'ennemi de l'époque, la phalange se trouva surclassée par des soldats professionnels, mieux entraînés et plus mobiles. Cette formation disparut ainsi après la victoire des légions romaines sur les phalanges macédoniennes, à Pydna en 168 av. J.-C.
TEXT.German: In der antiken Phalanx kämpften gut ausgebildete Soldaten der griechischen Armee. Diese, mit Speeren und robusten Rüstungen ausgestatteten, Krieger bildeten die schwere Infanterie der griechischen Truppen. Eine Phalanx besteht aus 8-16 Reihen von Soldaten, die als Einheit vorrücken, um auf diese Weise weniger gut organisierte Gegner aufzureiben. Den mobilen und perfekt ausgebildeten Soldaten der römischen Armeen hatte die Phalanx allerdings nur wenig entgegenzusetzen. Mit dem Triumph der römischen Legionen über die mazedonische Phalanx im Jahr 168 vor Christus endete das Zeitalter der Phalanx schließlich.
TEXT.Italian: Le falangi della antica Grecia erano composte da cittadini-soldati molto ben addestrati. Armati di lance e armature resistenti, ricoprivano il ruolo di fanteria pesante nella maggior parte degli scontri. Le falangi erano gruppi compatti, formati da otto o sedici soldati, che si muovevano e attaccavano contemporaneamente per sbaragliare nemici in minor numero e male organizzati. Le falangi erano efficaci contro le unità militari di quell'epoca, ma divennero obsolete quando si trovarono a fronteggiare soldati professionisti, ben addestrati e più mobili. La vittoria delle Legioni Romane sulle falangi Macedoni durante la battaglia di Pidna del 168 a. C. ne sancì definitivamente l'inutilità sul campo di battaglia.
TEXT.Spanish: Las falanges consistían en ciudadanos-soldados bien entrenados de la antigua Grecia. Armados con lanzas y armadura duradera, asumían el papel de infantería pesada en la mayoría de los combates. Las falanges eran grupos apiñados de ocho o dieciséis filas de soldados que se movían y atacaban al unísono, dispersando a las fuerzas enemigas menos concentradas. Las falanges funcionaban bien contra las fuerzas de la época, pero se descomponían al enfrentarse a soldados profesionales con más movilidad y mejor entrenamiento. La victoria de las legiones romanas sobre las falanges macedonias en Pidna, en el año 168 a. C., supuso el fin de la utilidad de la falange en el campo de batalla.

TEXT.English: The original grenadier was a specialized assault soldier designed to attack enemy fortifications. The grenadier was equipped with grenades, small metal balls filled with gunpowder. The grenadiers would approach the enemy's works, light and throw their grenades, and then rush the works in the resulting confusion and panic. [PARAGRAPH:1]As time progressed, the early grenades were abandoned, primarily because improvements in musketry and massed fire techniques made it highly likely that the grenadier would get shot while in the act of throwing the grenade. The term "grenadier" remained, however, and it was used to denote elite troops until the First World War.
TEXT.French: Les premiers grenadiers étaient des soldats spécialisés dans l'attaque de forteresses. Ils étaient équipés de grenades, de petites boules en métal remplies de poudre à canon. Le grenadier s'approchait des positions ennemies, allumait et lançait les grenades, puis donnait l'assaut alors que régnaient la confusion et la panique. [PARAGRAPH:1]Plus tard, ces grenades primitives seront abandonnées, les progrès réalisés dans le domaine des armes à feu et des techniques de tir groupés rendant l'approche extrêmement difficile : les grenadiers risquaient en effet de se faire tuer en lançant les grenades. Le terme "grenadier" a néanmoins perduré et a désigné, jusqu'à la Première Guerre mondiale, les troupes d'élites.
TEXT.German: Ursprünglich waren Grenadiere Offensiveinheiten für Angriffe auf feindliche Festungen. Die mit einer Frühform der Granate bewaffneten Grenadiere näherten sich einer feindlichen Stellung und sorgten mit ihren Granaten für Verwirrung und Panik. [PARAGRAPH:1]Aufgrund verbesserter Musketen wurden die Grenadiere bald überflüssig, zumal immer mehr Grenadiere im Sperrfeuer der Verteidiger fielen. Lediglich der Begriff "Grenadier" blieb als Bezeichnung für Elitetruppen bis zum 1. Weltkrieg erhalten.
TEXT.Italian: I granatieri erano dei soldati d'assalto specializzati nell'attaccare le fortificazioni nemiche. Il granatiere era equipaggiato con delle granate, piccole sfere di metallo piene di polvere da sparo. I granatieri si avvicinavano alle costruzioni nemiche, accendevano le loro munizioni e poi le scagliavano gettando i rivali nel panico e nella confusione. [PARAGRAPH:1]Con il passare del tempo, vennero abbandonate le prime granate rudimentali in favore dei moschetti e di altre armi da fuoco. Il termine "granatiere" è rimasto in voga e veniva usato per identificare le truppe d'élite fino alla Prima Guerra Mondiale.
TEXT.Spanish: Originalmente, los granaderos eran soldados de asalto especializados en el ataque a las fortificaciones enemigas que iban equipados con granadas, pequeñas esferas de metal llenas de pólvora. Se aproximaban a las posiciones enemigas, encendían sus granadas, las lanzaban y, a continuación, aprovechando la confusión y el pánico provocados, lanzaban su ataque. [PARAGRAPH:1]Con el paso del tiempo, estas granadas primitivas fueron abandonándose, principalmente porque los avances en el diseño de los mosquetes y las técnicas de fuego coordinado hacían muy probable que el granadero fuera abatido mientras estaba lanzando la granada. Sin embargo, el término "granadero" pervivió y se empleó como sinónimo de soldado de elite hasta la Primera Guerra Mundial.

TEXT.Polish: Grivpanvar to partyjski Rycerz, silniejszy ni¿ zwyk³a wersja tej jednostki.

TEXT.English: The grizzly bear (Ursus arctos horribilis), also known as the silvertip bear, the grizzly, or the North American brown bear, is a subspecies of brown bear (Ursus arctos) that generally lives in the uplands of western North America. This subspecies is thought to descend from Ussuri brown bears which crossed to Alaska from eastern Russia 100,000 years ago, though they did not move south until 13,000 years ago.[PARAGRAPH:2]Except for cubs and females, grizzlies are normally solitary, active animals, but in coastal areas, the grizzly congregates alongside streams, lakes, rivers, and ponds during the salmon spawn. Every other year, females (sows) produce one to four young (commonly two) which are small and weigh only about 500 grams (1 lb). A sow is protective of her offspring and will attack if she thinks she or her cubs are threatened.

In 1769 the Spanish took 22 Wayuus captive in order to put them to work building the fortifications of Cartagena. The reaction of the Indians was unexpected. On May 2, 1769, at El Rincón, near Río de la Hacha, they set their village afire, burning the church and two Spaniards who had taken refuge in it. They also captured the priest. The Spanish immediately dispatched an expedition from El Rincón to capture the Indians. At the head of this force was Jos Antonio de Sierra, a mestizo who had also headed the party that had taken the 22 Guajiro captives. The Guajiros recognized him and forced his party to take refuge in the house of the curate, which they then set afire. Sierra and eight of his men were killed.

The guanaco (Lama guanicoe) is a camelid native to South America that stands between 107 and 122 cm (3.5 and 4 feet) at the shoulder and weighs about 90 kg (200 lb). The colour varies very little (unlike the domestic llama), ranging from a light brown to dark cinnamon and shading to white underneath. Guanacos have grey faces and small straight ears. The name guanaco comes from the South American language Quechua word wanaku (old spelling, huanaco). Young guanacos are called chulengo(s).
TEXT.French: Le guanaco (Lama guanicoe) est un camélidé originaire d'Amérique du Sud mesurant entre 107 et 122 cm (3,5 et 4 pieds) au garrot et pesant environ 90 kg (200 lb). Sa couleur varie très peu (contrairement au lama domestique), allant du brun clair au cannelle foncé et blanchissant sur le dessous. Les guanacos ont un visage gris et de petites oreilles droites. Le nom guanaco vient du mot wanaku en quechua (orthographe ancienne : huanaco). Les jeunes guanacos sont appelés chulengo(s).
TEXT.German: Guanakos (Lama guanicoe) oder auch Huanakos sind wildlebende Paarhufer aus der Familie der Kamele, die hauptsächlich im westlichen und südlichen Südamerika zu Hause sind. Sie bringen etwa 100 bis 120 kg auf die Waage bei einer Schulterhöhe von etwa 120 cm und einer Kopf-Rumpf-Länge von 120 bis 220 cm. Wie bei anderen Lamas ist ihr Fell wollig und dicht. Die Oberseite ist hellbraun, die Unterseite weiß und das Gesicht oft schwarz gefärbt.[PARAGRAPH:2]Guanakos bevorzugen offenes Grasland, in harten Wintern manchmal auch Wälder. Sie sind in Höhen bis zu 4000 m anzutreffen. Guanakos verfügen über einen aus mehreren Kammern zusammengesetzten Magen, der ihnen das Verdauen der Gräser ermöglicht, die ihre Hauptnahrungsquelle darstellen. Sie leben in Verbänden von etwa 15 Tieren, die von einem männlichen Leittier angeführt werden.[PARAGRAPH:2]Bei den Guanakos handelt es sich um die wilde Stammform des domestizierten Lamas. Man nimmt heute an, dass sowohl Lama als auch Alpaka von ihm abstammen.
TEXT.Polish: Gwanako (Lama guanicoe) gatunek po³udniowoamerykañskiego, roœlino¿ernego ssaka z rodziny wielb³¹dowatych (Camelidae). ¯yje w niewielkich stadach w Andach i w Patagonii. D³ugoœæ cia³a 153 - 200 cm, wysokoœæ w k³êbie 90 - 125 cm. D³uga, p³owa sierœæ na grzbiecie i bokach, krótsza, jasna na brzuchu. Koñczyny smuk³e, szyja d³uga, cienka, ogon bardzo krótki d³ugoœci 22 - 25 cm, zaokr¹glony i puszysty. Masa cia³a 80 - 120 kg. Gwanako, podobnie jak wigoñ, wystêpuje na rozleg³ych przestrzeniach. Gwanako ¿yje w ma³ych stadach, licz¹cych najwy¿ej 20 - 30 osobników. Jeden samiec pe³ni funkcjê przewodnika i opiekuna takiej grupy.

TEXT.English: Guan Yu was a general serving under the warlord Liu Bei during the late Eastern Han Dynasty and Three Kingdoms era of China. He played a significant role in the civil war that led to the collapse of the Han Dynasty and the establishment of the Kingdom of Shu, of which Liu Bei was the first emperor. As one of the best known Chinese historical figures throughout East Asia, Guan Yu's true life stories have largely given way to fictionalized ones, mostly found in the historical novel Romance of the Three Kingdoms or passed down the generations, in which his deeds and moral qualities have been lionized. Guan Yu was deified as early as the Sui Dynasty and is still being worshipped by Chinese people today, especially in southern China. He is respected as the epitome of loyalty and righteousness.
TEXT.Polish: Guan Yu (ur. w Xiezhou w Shanxi, zm. w grudniu 219 w pobli¿u dzisiejszego Dangyangu)? dowódca w s³u¿bie Liu Beia, po œmierci stopniowo uznany za boga chroni¹cego Cesarstwo Chiñskie i jego ludnoœæ. Guan Yu urodzi³ siê w miejscowoœci Xiezhou w komanderii Hedong, w dzisiejszej prowincji Shanxi. Data jego urodzin i pochodzenie s¹ nieznane. Z niejasnych dla historyków powodów boj¹c siê o swoje ¿ycie, uciek³ do komanderii Zhuo (czêœæ dzisiejszej prowincji Hebei), gdzie do³¹czy³ do Liu Beia, który wówczas formowa³ swoj¹ prywatn¹ armiê. Wed³ug Kroniki Trzech Królestw Liu Bei, Guan Yu i Zhang Fei mieli byæ dla siebie jak bracia. Wspólnie brali oni udzia³ w kampaniach Liu Beia na wschodzie. Cao Cao uczyni³ go wówczas Markizem (tinghou) Hanshou, i czasami Guan Yu znany jest w³aœnie pod tytu³em. Niemniej nadal czu³ siê on bardziej zwi¹zany z Liu Beiem i wkrótce potem uciek³ do niego. Nanyang), i rozci¹gaj¹cej siê dalej na po³udnie na tereny dzisiejszych prowincji Hubei i Hunan. W roku 215 Sun Quan za¿¹da³ od Liu Beia oddania mu prowincji Jing, która mia³a rzekomo kiedyœ do niego nale¿eæ. W zwi¹zku z tym przyj¹³ on tytu³ króla (wang) Hanzhongu, a Guan Yu nada³ tytu³ Genera³a Stra¿y Przedniej (qian jiangjun). To zachowanie mia³o swoje Ÿród³o prawdopodobnie tak¿e w za¿enowaniu faktem, ¿e ostatni sukces w Hanzhongu zosta³ osi¹gniêty bez niego i zwi¹zanym z tym poczuciem pewnej utraty znaczenia. W takich warunkach dysponuj¹cy flot¹ Guan Yu doszczêtnie rozbi³ armiê Yu Jina, z której wielu ¿o³nierzy potonê³o, a jego samego wzi¹³ do niewoli. Si³y Cao Rena nadal broni³y siê jednak w Xiangyangu i jego bliŸniaczym mieœcie Fen (dzisiaj tworz¹ jedno miasto), zaœ w nadziei na ostateczny sukces Guan Yu zacz¹³ œci¹gaæ rezerwy z linii Jangcy. Tym samym zlekcewa¿y³ on jednak mo¿liwe zagro¿enie ze strony si³ Sun Quana, którymi dowodzi³ Lu Meng. TEXT.English: City guard, city watch, town guard or town watch was a law enforcement formation found in some countries and historical periods, usually subordinate to the local municipal government. Historically many cities had their own guard formations, which doubled as police and military force in times of need.
TEXT.French: La garde urbaine, la police municipale ou la garde de ville était une formation de maintien de l'ordre présente dans certains pays et périodes historiques, généralement subordonnée au gouvernement municipal local. Historiquement, de nombreuses villes avaient leurs propres formations de garde, qui faisaient double emploi de force de police et militaire en temps de besoin.
TEXT.Italian: Le guardie erano formazioni di rinforzo alla legge in alcuni paesi e periodi storici, solitamente subordinate al governo municipale locale. Storicamente molte città avevano le loro guardie, che avevano funzioni sia di polizia sia di esercito.
TEXT.Polish: W pewnych miejscach i okresach historycznych stra¿ miejska czy gwardia miejska by³y formacjami stworzonymi to egzekwowania prawa, z regu³y podporz¹dkowane lokalnym w³adzom miejskim. Historycznie wiele miast posiada³o swoje w³asne oddzia³y stra¿y miejskiej, które w zale¿noœci od potrzeb s³u¿y³y jako policja lub si³y wojskowe.

TEXT.English: Guaycuru or Guaykuru is a generic term for several ethnic groups indigenous to the Gran Chaco region of South America, speaking several related Mataco-Guaycuru languages. The name is written guaycur (or guaicur) in Spanish (plural guaycurúes or guaicurúes), and guaicuru in Portuguese (plural guaicurus). It was originally an offensive epithet given to some Mbaya tribes of Paraguay by the Guarani, meaning "savage" or "barbarian", which later got extended to the whole group. It has also been used in the past to include other tribes of the region, but is now restricted to those speaking a Mataco-Guaycuru language.
The guerrilla army uses ambush (draw enemy forces to terrain unsuited to them) and mobility (advantage and surprise) in attacking vulnerable targets in enemy territory.
TEXT.French: L'armée de guérilla utilise l'embuscade (attirer les forces ennemies sur un terrain inadapté) et la mobilité (avantage et surprise) pour attaquer des cibles vulnérables sur le territoire ennemi.
TEXT.Polish: Wojna partyzancka - forma walki zbrojnej jednej ze stron, polegaj¹ca na dzia³aniach nieregularnych, odwrotach, przemarszach i innych formach walki, przy poparciu ludnoœci przeciwko okupantowi lub rodzimym rz¹dom. Jest to równie¿ wojna, w której s¹ atakowane ma³e oddzia³y wroga. Dzia³ania partyzantki to szybkie ataki nêkaj¹ce, przeprowadza siê je z ukrycia, z przygotowaniem zasadzek.

TEXT.English: Artillery was the only option for long-range, earthborn destruction until the creation of the Guided Missile. Created by German scientists during WWII, the first Guided Missile, the V, was essentially a long-range flying bomb. The V Missile, and the technology behind it, was rapidly upgraded during the Cold War, and later missiles became more precise with more formidable ranges. Capable of carrying a nuclear or conventional explosive payload, modern Guided Missiles fill a wide range of defense needs.
TEXT.French: L'artillerie constitue longtemps le seul moyen de détruire un objectif à distance, jusqu'à la création du missile guidé. Créé par des scientifiques allemands pendant la Deuxième Guerre mondiale, le premier missile guidé, le V, est essentiellement une bombe volante de longue portée. Le Missile V et la technologie qui l'a généré sont rapidement améliorés pendant la guerre froide. Les missiles suivants deviennent plus précis tout en bénéficiant de plus amples portées. Capables de transporter une charge nucléaire ou conventionnelle, les missiles guidés modernes comblent la plupart des besoins défensifs.
TEXT.German: Bis zur Erfindung der Lenkrakete war Artillerie die einzige Möglichkeit, auf lange Distanz vom Boden aus ein Ziel zu zerstören. Die erste Lenkrakete, die V-Waffe, wurde von deutschen Wissenschaftlern während des Zweiten Weltkriegs erfunden und war im Prinzip eine Langstrecken-Flugbombe. Die V-Waffe und die ihr zugrunde liegende Technologie wurden während des Kalten Krieges rapide verbessert, und spätere Raketen wurden auf extreme Reichweiten immer zielgenauer. Da sie mit nuklearer oder konventioneller Sprengladung ausgerüstet werden können, erfordern moderne Lenkraketen eine breit gefächerte Verteidigung.
TEXT.Italian: Fino alla creazione del Missile teleguidato, l'artiglieria era l'unica opzione disponibile per la distruzione a lunga distanza. Gli scienziati tedeschi crearono il primo Missile teleguidato, il V, durante la Seconda Guerra Mondiale: si trattava fondamentalmente di una bomba volante dal grande raggio d'azione. Il missile V e la tecnologia che impiegava vennero rapidamente aggiornati durante la Guerra Fredda, e i missili successivi ottennero maggiore precisione e raggi d'azione formidabili. I moderni Missili teleguidati sono in grado di trasportare ordigni nucleari o convenzionali e soddisfano molte necessità difensive.
TEXT.Spanish: La artillería fue la única opción de ataque a larga distancia para las armas terrestres hasta la aparición de los misiles guiados. Inventados por científicos alemanes durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial, los primeros misiles guiados, las armas V, eran en esencia bombas volantes de largo alcance. Las armas V, y la tecnología que había detrás, experimentaron un acelerado proceso de desarrollo durante la Guerra Fría, y los misiles fueron haciéndose cada vez más precisos y aumentando su alcance. Capaces de llevar cabezas nucleares o convencionales, los misiles guiados modernos desempeñan un importantísimo papel en los sistemas de defensa.

TEXT.English: The Guide is skilled at going over any and all sort of terrain and finding what is on and in it.
TEXT.French: Le guide est habile à parcourir tous types de terrains et à découvrir ce qui s'y trouve, à la surface comme en profondeur.
TEXT.Italian: Il Bruto è il primo guerriero disponibile, un uomo disarmato in grado di picchiare i nemici.
TEXT.Spanish: El Guía es hábil atravesando cualquier tipo de terreno, y en su reconocimiento.
TEXT.Polish: Rozpoznanie - jest produktem wiedzy dotycz¹cej dzia³alnoœci i mo¿liwoœci prowadzenia dzia³añ przez aktualnego lub potencjalnego przeciwnika, obszaru prowadzenia dzia³añ i warunków hydrometeorologicznych. W znaczeniu rzeczowym - to zespó³ si³ i œrodków przeznaczonych do zdobywania (pozyskiwania), gromadzenia informacji, przetwarzania ich w dane rozpoznawcze oraz rozpowszechniania tych danych do zainteresowanych odbiorców.
