TEXT.English: Gulls (often informally called seagulls) are birds in the family Laridae. They are most closely related to the terns (family Sternidae) and only distantly related to auks, skimmers, and more distantly to the waders. Until the twenty-first century most gulls were placed in the genus Larus, but this arrangement is now known to be polyphyletic, leading to the resurrection of several genera.[PARAGRAPH:2]Gulls are typically medium to large birds, usually grey or white, often with black markings on the head or wings. They typically have harsh wailing or squawking calls, stout, longish bills, and webbed feet. Most gulls, particularly Larus species, are ground-nesting carnivores, which will take live food or scavenge opportunistically. Live food often includes crabs and small fish. Gulls have prophylactic unhinging jaws which allow them to consume large prey. Apart from the kittiwakes, gulls are typically coastal or inland species, rarely venturing far out to sea The large species take up to four years to attain full adult plumage, but two years is typical for small gulls. Large White-Headed Gulls are typically long-lived birds, with a maximum age of 49 years recorded for the Herring Gull.[PARAGRAPH:2]Gulls nest in large, densely packed noisy colonies. They lay two to three speckled eggs in nests composed of vegetation. The young are precocial, being born with dark mottled down, and mobile upon hatching.[PARAGRAPH:2]The larger gull species in particular are resourceful, inquisitive and intelligent birds, demonstrating complex methods of communication and a highly developed social structure. For example, many gull colonies display mobbing behaviour, attacking and harassing would-be predators and other intruders. Certain species (e.g. the Herring Gull) have exhibited tool use behaviour, using pieces of bread as bait with which to catch goldfish, for example. Many species of gull have learned to coexist successfully with humans and have thrived in human habitats. Others rely on kleptoparasitism to get their food. Gulls have been observed preying on live whales, landing on the whale as it surfaces to peck out pieces of flesh.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Möwen[COLOR_REVERT] sind mittelgroße bis große Vögel, die mit etwa 55 Arten fast weltweit verbreitet sind. Sie halten sich meist in Küstennähe auf.[NEWLINE]Das Gefieder der Möwen ist meist weiß-grau, oft sind Teile des Kopfes, des Rückens und der Flügel schwarz gefärbt. Die Flügel sind lang und schmal, der kräftige, schlanke Schnabel ist vorn leicht nach unten gekrümmt. Die Zehen sind durch Schwimmhäute verbunden. Die Vögel sind recht lautstark, was durch ihre meist große Zahl noch verstärkt wird. Möwen sind sehr gute Segelflieger und halten auch starkem Wind stand. Ihre Nahrung finden sie meist am Strand, manchmal tauchen sie auch danach. Sie sind Allesfresser und vertilgen neben lebender Nahrung (z.B. Fische, Krebstiere, Weichtiere) teilweise auch Abfälle und Aas. Einige Arten rauben auch Nester aus, während besonders die kleineren oft Insekten und Würmer verzehren. Ihren Flüssigkeitsbedarf decken Möwen teilweise mit Meerwasser, wobei sie das Salz in Salzdrüsen sammeln und dann durch die Nasenlöcher ausscheiden. Ausgewachsene Möwen haben kaum natürliche Feinde. Lediglich Eier und Jungtiere werden von Waschbären, Mardern, Füchsen oder Greifvögeln gefressen. Bei Bedrohung greifen Möwen in der Gruppe an und können die meisten Feinde verjagen.[NEWLINE]Da die Menschen immer mehr in die Brutgebiete der Möwen vordringen, haben sich die Tiere an das Zusammenleben angepasst. Sie sind nicht scheu, deshalb fühlen sich manche Menschen von ihnen gestört oder gar bedroht. In der Regel verhalten sie sich jedoch nicht aggressiv. Die Nähe dient ausschließlich der Nahrungssuche, denn die klugen Vögel sind opportunistisch und wissen genau, wo sie Essen stibitzen können. Es ist trotzdem nicht ratsam und mancherorts auch verboten, Möwen zu füttern, da das natürliche Nahrungsangebot ausreichend ist.
TEXT.Polish: Mewa (niem. Mowe) zool. ptak nadwodny z rodziny mew (Laridae), wystêpuj¹cy przy oceanach, morzach, wiêkszych zbiornikach i ciekach wodnych w ok. 80 gatunków, o mocnym, lekko zakrzywionym na koñcu dziobie, d³ugich skrzyd³ach i jasnym upierzeniu..

TEXT.English: A gunship is an armed helicopter. They are the cavalry of the modern army, designed to reconnoiter enemy positions, deploy special forces deep behind enemy lines, and so forth. However, modern gunships are armed with armor-piercing missiles and heavy, quick-firing machine guns; with these, a gunship can wreck havoc on enemy tanks and troops.[PARAGRAPH:1:1]Gunships first saw extensive service in the Vietnam War. The Soviet Union employed gunships in Afghanistan, and the US has used them to great effect in all its recent conflicts.[PARAGRAPH:1:1]Ground troops defend themselves from gunships with SAMs (surface-to-air missiles). When the CIA supplied Afghan guerillas with such weapons during the Afghanistan war; the Afghans used the SAMs with such devastating effect that they virtually crippled the Soviet war effort.
TEXT.French: Les hélicoptères de combat sont des hélicoptères disposant d'un armement. Ils forment la cavalerie moderne et sont conçus pour effectuer des missions de reconnaissance, pour transporter des forces spéciales derrière les lignes ennemies, etc. Certains hélicoptères de combat modernes disposent également de missiles perforants et de mitrailleuses lourdes à tir rapide. Ils peuvent ainsi anéantir des blindés ou des troupes d'infanterie. [PARAGRAPH:1:1]La première utilisation massive des hélicoptères de combat remonte à la guerre du Viêt-Nam. L'Union Soviétique a utilisé ces appareils en Afghanistan et les Etats-Unis les ont engagés dans tous les conflits récents.[PARAGRAPH:1:1]Les troupes terrestres se défendent contre les hélicoptères avec des missiles sol-air. Lors de la guerre d'Afghanistan, la CIA avait fourni ce type d'armes aux résistants afghans qui les ont si bien utilisés, qu'ils ont pratiquement paralysé l'effort de guerre des Soviétiques.
TEXT.German: Kampfhubschrauber sind gepanzerte Helikopter. Als Kavallerie moderner Armeen dienen sie primär der Ortung und Zerstörung feindlicher Stellungen und dem Truppentransport. Moderne Kampfhubschrauber sind mit panzerbrechenden Raketen und schweren MGs bestückt.[PARAGRAPH:1:1]Kampfhubschrauber kamen erstmals während des Vietnamkriegs flächendeckend zum Einsatz. Die Sowjetunion setzte Kampfhubschrauber erstmals in Afghanistan ein. Heute gehören sie zu den wichtigsten taktischen Waffen der amerikanischen Streitkräfte.[PARAGRAPH:1:1]Die größte Gefahr droht Kampfhubschraubern von Boden-Luft-Raketen. Als die CIA in den 80er Jahren afghanische Rebellen mit Raketenwerfern versorgte, verzeichneten die russischen Truppen beträchtliche Verluste an Kampfhubschraubern.
TEXT.Italian: L'elicottero da guerra è un velivolo armato pesantemente e rappresenta la cavalleria degli eserciti moderni. Questi velivoli sono stati concepiti per identificare la posizione dei nemici, schierare le truppe nel cuore delle linee nemiche e via discorrendo. I moderni elicotteri da guerra sono equipaggiati con missili perforanti e pesanti mitragliatrici a ripetizione: con questo arsenale, gli elicotteri sono in grado di seminare distruzione tra i carri armati e i soldati nemici. [PARAGRAPH:1:1]Gli elicotteri da guerra vennero usati seriamente per la prima volta durante la Guerra del Vietnam. L'Unione Sovietica utilizzò elicotteri da combattimento in Afghanistan, mentre gli Stati Uniti li hanno impiegati in tutte le recenti operazioni militari.[PARAGRAPH:1:1]Le truppe di terra si difendono da questi elicotteri utilizzando i SAM (missili terra-aria): l'utilizzo di queste armi rovinò i piani dell'Unione Sovietica, quando missili terra-aria vennero forniti all'Afghanistan dalla CIA.
TEXT.Spanish: El helicóptero de combate es un vehículo aéreo artillado. Forman la caballería de los ejércitos modernos, encargados de misiones tales como el reconocimiento de las posiciones enemigas, el despliegue de las fuerzas especiales tras sus líneas y cosas así. Sin embargo, los modernos helicópteros de combate están armados con ametralladoras pesadas de gran cadencia de fuego. Con ellas pueden sembrar el caos entre los tanques y las tropas enemigas.[PARAGRAPH:1:1] Los helicópteros de combate empezaron a utilizarse exhaustivamente en la Guerra de Vietnam. La Unión Soviética los utilizó en Afganistán y EE. UU. ha hecho buen uso de ellos en todos los conflictos en los que ha participado en los últimos años.[PARAGRAPH:1:1] Las tropas de tierra se defienden de ellos con misiles tierra-aire. Cuando, durante la guerra de Afganistán, la CIA equipó a los guerrilleros con estas armas, los afganos emplearon los misiles con un efecto tan devastador que acabaron por desbaratar virtualmente la maquinaria bélica soviética.

TEXT.English: The Gurkhas are a Nepalese ethnic group who originally claimed to be descendents of the northern India Rajputs, but who took their famous name from the small state of Gurkha in Nepal, which they conquered in the early sixteenth century. For 200 years, the Gurkhas expanded eastward, seeking to conquer all of Nepal. They succeeded, and by the mid-eighteenth century, the entire country was theirs and Hinduism was named the state religion. The Gurkhas attempted to invade Tibet but ultimately failed, and as war with the British broke out in India, they found their control waning. They did, however, discover a surprisingly fruitful partnership with the British occupational forces in India.

Gustav II Adolf (9 December 1594 - 6 November 1632, O.S.); widely known in English by his Latinised name Gustavus Adolphus or as Gustav II Adolph, or as Gustavus Adolphus the Great (Swedish: Gustav Adolf den store, Latin: Gustavus Adolphus Magnus, a formal posthumous distinction passed by the Riksdag of the Estates in 1634); was the King of Sweden from 1611 to 1632 and is credited as the founder of Sweden as a Great Power (Swedish: Stormaktstiden). He led Sweden to military supremacy during the Thirty Years War, helping to determine the political as well as the religious balance of power in Europe.

Gwanggaeto the Great was the nineteenth monarch of Goguryeo, the northernmost of the Three Kingdoms of Korea. His full posthumous name roughly means "Very Greatest King, Broad Expander of Territory, buried in Gukgangsang.", sometimes abbreviated to Hotaewang or Taewang. He selected Yeongnak as his era name, and was called King Yeongnak the Great during his reign. Under Gwanggaeto, Goguryeo once again became a major power of East Asia, having enjoyed such a status in the 2nd century CE. Upon King Gwanggaeto's death at thirty-nine years of age in 413, Goguryeo controlled all territory between the Amur and Han Rivers (two thirds of modern Korea, Manchuria, and parts of the Russian Maritime province and Inner Mongolia). In addition, in 399, Silla submitted to Goguryeo for protection from raids from Baekjae. Gwanggaeto captured the Baekje capital in present-day Seoul and made Baekje its vassal. Many consider this loose unification under Goguryeo to have been the only true unification of the Three Kingdoms. Gwanggaeto's accomplishments are recorded on the Gwanggaeto Stele, erected in 414 at the site of his tomb in Ji'an along the present-day Chinese-North Korean border. Today, King Gwanggaeto the Great is one of two rulers of Korea who were given the title 'Great' after their name (the other one being King Sejong the Great of Joseon, who created the Korean alphabet). He is regarded by Koreans as one of the greatest heroes of their history, and is often taken as a potent symbol of Korean nationalism.
TEXT.Polish: Kwanggetho Wielki by³ dziewiêtnastym monarch¹ Kogurjo, wysuniêtego najbardziej na pó³noc jednego z Trzech Królestw Korei. Panowa³ w latach 391-412 n.e. Za jego czasów znacznie powiêkszono terytorium królestwa, przy³¹czaj¹c pó³wysep Liaotung i znaczne obszary Mand¿urii, w kierunku po³udniowym zaœ, opieraj¹c granice na rzece Han. Swój protektorat roztoczy³ tak¿e nad pozosta³ymi pañstwami koreañskimi, Paekche i Sill¹.

TEXT.English: Gyges was the founder of the third or Mermnad dynasty of Lydian kings and reigned from 716 BC to 678 BC (or from c. 680-644 BC). He was succeeded by his son Ardys II.
TEXT.French: Gyges fut le fondateur de la troisième dynastie Mermnade des rois lydiens et régna de 716 av. J.-C. à 678 av. J.-C. (ou d'environ 680 à 644 av. J.-C.). Il fut succédé par son fils Ardys II.
TEXT.Polish: Gyges (716-678 p.n.e. lub 680-644 p.n.e.) by³ królem Lidii i za³o¿ycielem dynastii Mermnadów (Soko³ów), do której nale¿a³ m.in. Krezus. W zasadzie Gyges by³ uzurpatorem, gdy¿ w³adzê nad Lidi¹ przej¹³ po zamordowaniu jej króla Kandaulesa, przedstawiciela dynastii Heraklidów, nie maj¹c do tego ¿adnych legitymistycznych podstaw.

TEXT.English: Haast's Eagle (Harpagornis moorei) was a species of massive eagles that once lived on the South Island of New Zealand. The species was the largest eagle known to have existed. Its prey consisted mainly of gigantic flightless birds that were unable to defend themselves from the striking force and speed of these eagles, which at times reached 80 km/h (50 mph). The Haast's Eagle became extinct about 1400, when its major food sources, the moa, were hunted to extinction by humans living on the island and much of its dense-forest habitat was cleared.
TEXT.German: Der Haastadler (Harpagornis moorei) war der größte Greifvogel der Neuzeit. Er war auf der Südinsel Neuseelands heimisch, wo er hauptsächlich Moas und andere große flugunfähige Vögel jagte. Haastadler erreichten eine enorme Spannweite von 3 Metern und ein Gewicht von 10 - 18 kg. Trotz ihres riesigen Körpers konnten sie im Sturzflug Geschwindigkeiten bis zu 80 km/h erreichen, was ihrer Beute ein Entkommen nahezu unmöglich machte.[PARAGRAPH:2]Es wird heute angenommen, dass er bei der Besiedlung Neuseelands von den Vorfahren der heutigen Maori als Menschenfresser gefürchtet und im Gegensatz zu seinen Beutetieren gezielt ausgerottet wurde. Aber auch das Verschwinden seiner Hauptbeute und die Abholzung seines Lebensraums trugen dazu bei, dass er wohl im Laufe des 15. Jahrhunderts ausstarb.
TEXT.Polish: Orze³ Haasta (Harpagornis moorei) - gatunek du¿ego, wymar³ego ptaka drapie¿nego z rodziny jastrzêbiowatych (Accipitridae), zamieszkuj¹cy niegdyœ Now¹ Zelandiê. Jedyny przedstawiciel rodzaju Harpagornis. Najciê¿szy znany orze³ jaki kiedykolwiek wystêpowa³ na Ziemi. Charakteryzowa³ siê potê¿nymi szponami, w¹sk¹ czaszk¹ i stosunkowo krótkimi skrzyd³ami, co sugeruje, ¿e by³ to ptak leœny. Samice by³y ciê¿sze od samców.

TEXT.English: Internationally, both governmental and non-state actors engage in cybercrimes, including espionage, financial theft, and other cross-border crimes. Activity crossing international borders and involving the interests of at least one nation state is sometimes referred to as cyberwarfare. The international legal system is attempting to hold actors accountable for their actions through the International Criminal Court.[PARAGRAPH:2]A report (sponsored by McAfee) estimates that the annual damage to the global economy is at $445 billion; however, a Microsoft report shows that such survey-based estimates are "hopelessly flawed" and exaggerate the true losses by orders of magnitude. Approximately $1.5 billion was lost in 2012 to online credit and debit card fraud in the US.
TEXT.Russian: На международном уровне как правительственные, так и негосударственные субъекты участвуют в киберпреступлениях, в том числе в шпионаже, финансовых кражах и других трансграничных преступлениях. Деятельность, пересекающая международные границы и затрагивающая интересы как минимум одного национального государства, иногда называется кибервойной. Международная правовая система пытается привлечь участников к ответственности за свои действия через Международный уголовный суд.[PARAGRAPH:2]По оценкам доклада (авторами которого является McAfee), ежегодный ущерб мировой экономике составляет 445 миллиардов долларов; однако, отчет Microsoft показывает, что такие основанные на опросе оценки "безнадежно ошибочны" и преувеличивают истинные потери на порядки величины. Приблизительно 1,5 миллиарда долларов было потеряно в 2012 году из-за мошенничества с кредитными и дебетовыми картами в США в Интернете.

TEXT.English: The Haida specialize in pouncing on their neighbours in waterborne attacks. In attacking small boats they were particularly proficient.
TEXT.French: Les Haida sont spécialisés dans les attaques rapides sur leurs voisins par voie fluviale. Ils étaient particulièrement habiles pour attaquer les petites embarcations.

TEXT.English: The Haitian Revolution (1791-1804) was a slave revolt in the French colony of Saint-Domingue, which culminated in the elimination of slavery there and the founding of the Republic of Haiti. The Haitian Revolution was the only slave revolt which led to the founding of a state. The signal to begin the revolt was given by Dutty Boukman, a high priest of vodou and leader of the Maroon slaves, during a religious ceremony at Bois Caïman on the night of 14 August. Within the next ten days, slaves had taken control of the entire Northern Province in an unprecedented slave revolt. Whites kept control of only a few isolated, fortified camps. The slaves sought revenge on their masters through "pillage, rape, torture, mutilation, and death". Because the plantation owners had long feared such a revolt, they were well armed and prepared to defend themselves. Nonetheless, within weeks, the number of slaves who joined the revolt reached some 100,000.
TEXT.Polish: Haitañski Rebeliant to mobilna jednostka, ktróra œwietnie nadaje sie do szybkich ataków na ty³y wroga.

TEXT.English: Hajduk is a term most commonly referring to outlaws, brigands, highwaymen or freedom fighters in Southeastern Europe, and parts of Central and Eastern Europe. In Balkan folkloric tradition, the hajduk (hajduci or haiduci in the plural) is a romanticised hero figure who steals from, and leads his fighters into battle against, the Ottoman or Habsburg authorities. They are comparable to the English legend of Robin Hood and his merry men, who stole from the rich (which as in the case of the hajduci happened to be also foreign occupants) and gave to the poor, while defying unjust laws and authority.

In 1881, European anthropologists took eleven Kawéskar people from Patagonia to be exhibited in the Bois de Boulogne in Paris, and in the Berlin Zoological Garden. Only four survived to return to Chile. Early in 2010, the remains of five of the seven who died in Europe were repatriated from the University of Zurich, Switzerland, where they had been held for studies. Upon the return of the remains, the president of Chile formally apologized for the state having allowed these indigenous people to be taken out of the country to be exhibited and treated like animals.

An anti-aircraft vehicle, also known as a self-propelled anti-aircraft gun (SPAAG) or self-propelled air defense system (SPAD), is a mobile vehicle with a dedicated anti-aircraft capability. The Russian equivalent of SPAAG is ZSU, for zenitnaya samokhodnaya ustanovka, ("anti-aircraft self-propelled mount"). Specific weapon systems used include machine guns, autocannons, larger guns, or missiles, and some mount both guns and longer-ranged missiles (Pantsir-S1). Platforms used include both trucks and heavier combat vehicles such as APCs and tanks, which add protection from aircraft, artillery, and small arms fire for front line deployment. Anti-aircraft guns are usually mounted in a quickly-traversing turret with a high rate of elevation, for tracking fast-moving aircraft. They are often in dual or quadruple mounts, allowing a high rate of fire. Today, missiles (generally mounted on similar turrets) have largely supplanted anti-aircraft guns.
TEXT.Russian: Зенитный комплекс, также известный как самоходная зенитная установка (ЗСУ) или самоходная система противовоздушной обороны (ССПВО), представляет собой мобильную машину со специальным зенитным потенциалом. Американский аналог ЗСУ - SPAD, что означает «самоходная противовоздушная система». Конкретные используемые системы вооружения включают пулеметы, автопушки, более крупные орудия или ракеты, а на некоторых устанавливаются как орудия, так и ракеты большей дальности (Панцирь-С1). Используемые платформы включают как грузовики, так и более тяжелые боевые машины, такие как БТР и танки, которые обеспечивают дополнительную защиту от огня самолетов, артиллерии и стрелкового оружия для развертывания на передовой. Зенитные орудия обычно устанавливаются в быстроходной башне с большой скоростью возвышения для отслеживания быстро движущихся самолетов. Они часто бывают двойными или четверными, что обеспечивает высокую скорострельность. Сегодня ракеты (обычно устанавливаемые на аналогичные башни) в значительной степени вытеснили зенитные орудия.

TEXT.English: Hamilcar Barca was a Carthaginian general. He was assigned the command in Sicily in 247 in the First Punic War. From mountain bases near Palermo he made repeated raids on the Romans and relieved the Punic garrison in Lilybaeum. However, the Carthaginians were defeated, and Hamilcar Barca negotiated the terms of the peace that led to Carthage's withdrawal from Sicily. The Carthaginian mercenaries shortly afterward revolted and besieged Carthage, but Hamilcar defeated them in 238. After that his popularity made him virtual dictator. He then set out (237) to conquer Spain as a new base against Rome and had won considerable territory when he died. Hamilcar was probably the ablest general and statesman that Carthage had before his son Hannibal.
TEXT.Polish: Hamilkar Barkas (ok. 280 p.n.e. - 229 p.n.e.), przedstawiciel Barkidów - potê¿nego rodu kartagiñskiego, wódz kartagiñski, ojciec Hannibala Barkasa - wielkiego wodza kartagiñskiego. W 247 p.n.e., w ostatnich latach I wojny punickiej, Hamilkar zosta³ dowódc¹ kartagiñskiej armii na Sycylii, broni¹cej siê w portowych miastach Drepanum, dzisiejsze Trapani i Lilibeum. Jego dzia³ania wojenne nie ogranicza³y siê wy³¹cznie do obrony, bowiem Hamilkar równie¿ urz¹dza³ najazdy na po³udniowe wybrze¿a Italii. W 241 p.n.e., kiedy Gajusz Lutacjusz Katulus zablokowa³ oba porty, a flota kartagiñska ponios³a pora¿kê w bitwa pod Aegus¹, Hamilkar wynegocjowa³ koñcz¹cy wojnê pokój. W myœl pokojowych ustaleñ Kartagina zobowi¹za³a siê oddaæ Rzymowi Sycyliê, zwolniæ bez okupu jeñców oraz zap³aciæ w ci¹gu 20 lat kontrybucjê w wysokoœci 2200 talentów eubejskich. Po zawarciu uk³adu pokojowego Hamilkar odes³a³ swoje wojska Giskonowi, a sam wróci³ do Kartaginy. W latach 241 p.n.e.- 237 p.n.e. w Kartaginie trwa³a rewolta weteranów - najemników z Sycylii, którymi dowodzili Celt Autharitus, Kampañczyk Spendios i Libijczyk Mathos. Na czele dziesiêciotysiêcznej armii z³o¿onej z obywateli Kartaginy senat postawi³ najpierw Hannona, a po jego niepowodzeniach, Hamilkara Barkasa, któremu uda³o siê pokonaæ przeciwnika pod Utyk¹ i nad rzek¹ Bagradas. W 237 p.n.e. Hamilkar wyprawi³ siê ze swoimi synami Hannibalem, Hasdrubalem, Magonem oraz ze swym ziêciem Hasdrubalem Piêknym na czele sformowanej przez siebie armii na Pó³wysep Iberyjski. W trakcie dzia³añ wojennych w pd.-wsch. czêœæ pó³wyspu, Hamilkar zdoby³ dla Kartaginy kopalnie z³ota i srebra w górach Morena oraz kraj Deitanów z oœrodkiem religijnym w Elche de la Sierra. W Hiszpanii Hamilkar za³o¿y³ miasto Acra Leuce, prawdopodobnie dzisiejsze Alicante. Zgin¹³ zim¹ 228/229 w nurtach rzeki Jukar w czasie bitwy z Celtyberami z plemienia Oretanów z okolic dzisiejszej La Manchy. Dowództwo po Hamilkarze przej¹³ jego ziêæ Hazdrubal.

TEXT.English: The Indus Valley Civilization (also known as the Harappan culture) has its earliest roots in cultures such as that of Mehrgarh, approximately 6000 BCE. The two greatest cities, Mohenjo-daro and Harappa, emerged circa 2600 BCE along the Indus River valley in Punjab and Sindh. The civilization, with a possible writing system, urban centers, and diversified social and economic system, was rediscovered in the 1920s after excavations at Mohenjo-daro in Sindh near Larkana, and Harappa, in west Punjab south of Lahore. A number of other sites stretching from the Himalayan foothills in east Punjab, India in the north, to Gujarat in the south and east, and to Pakistani Balochistan in the west have also been discovered and studied. Although the archaeological site at Harappa was damaged in 1857 when engineers constructing the Lahore-Multan railroad (as part of the Sind and Punjab Railway), used brick from the Harappa ruins for track ballast, an abundance of artifacts has nevertheless been found. The bricks discovered were made of red sand, clay, stones and were baked at very high temperature.

The Harpy Eagle is considered one of the largest raptors in the world. A predatory bird with huge feet and talons used for hunting monkeys, sloths, porcupines, reptiles and large birds, often plucking its prey out of the trees. Mature adults have a black upper body, white and black banded underside and a grey neck and head with a divided crest. At maturity, the body length is around 35-40 in (89-102 cm) and weighs up to 15.5 lb (7 kg). For an idea of scale, that's the equivalent 7 bags of sugar, and their hind talons can be up to the size of grizzly bear claws![NEWLINE][H1]Behaviour[\H1][NEWLINE]These eagles build huge nests of fresh green twigs and branches in the tallest, or emergent, trees in the rainforest. Some researchers think the greener twigs help to fumigate the nest against insects and parasites, and provide a cooler environment for their young. Harpy Eagles usually lay only 1-2 eggs in a clutch and have a slow reproduction rate, over twenty years a pair may only successfully fledge three chicks.[NEWLINE][H1]Habitat[\H1][NEWLINE]Harpy Eagles occur typically below 900 m but locally up to 2,000 m, preferring large expanses of uninterrupted lowland tropical forest; they will also hunt in open areas adjacent to forest patches. Though their range is extensive, (including Argentina, Belize, Brazil, Costa Rica, Ecuador, Mexico, Paraguay and Venezuela) Harpy Eagles are generally rare, sparsely distributed and thought to be locally or regionally extinct in large parts of their former range, notably most of central and north Central America.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: World Land Trust
TEXT.Polish: Harpia wielka (Harpia harpyja) - gatunek du¿ego ptaka drapie¿nego z rodziny jastrzêbiowatych (Accipitridae); jedyny przedstawiciel rodzaju Harpia. Zamieszkuje lasy tropikalne w Ameryce Po³udniowej i Œrodkowej, od po³udniowego Meksyku do pó³nocnej Argentyny. Najpotê¿niejszy ptak drapie¿ny Nowego Œwiata. Wiêkszym od harpii ptakiem drapie¿nym by³ wymar³y orze³ Haasta. Pióra stanowi³y czêst¹ ozdobê strojów Indian.

TEXT.English: The Hashishin were the legendary assassins of the 12th-century Middle East. Supposedly conditioned through religion and drugs into fanatics, these assassins would follow any order, no matter how extreme.
TEXT.French: Les Hashishins étaient les légendaires assassins du Moyen-Orient du 12e siècle. Supposés conditionnés par la religion et les drogues en fanatiques, ces assassins obéissaient à tout ordre, peu importe son extrémité.
TEXT.Italian: Gli Hashishin erano leggendari assassini presenti nel Medioriente durante il 12° secolo. Condizionati per mezzo di droghe e fanatismo religioso, questi assassini seguivano ogni ordine, anche quelli più folli.
TEXT.Russian: Хашишины были легендарными убийцами Ближнего Востока XII века. Эти убийцы, предположительно одурманенные религиозной пропагандой и наркотиками, сделавшие их фанатиками, выполняли любой приказ, каким бы жестким и беспощадным он ни был.

TEXT.English: Hayk is the legendary patriarch and founder of the Armenian nation. His story is told in the History attributed to Moses of Chorene (5th to 7th century). In Moses' account, Hayk son of Torgoma gives birth to Armaneak while living in Babylon, but after the arrogant Titanid Bel makes himself king over all, Hayk emigrates to the Ararat region with an extended household of at least 300 and settles, founding a village he names Haykashen. On the way he also leaves a detachment in another settlement with his grandson Kadmos. Bel sends one of his sons to entreat him to return, but he is refused. Bel then marches against him with a massive force, but Hayk is warned by Kadmos of his approach. He assembles his own army on the shore of Lake Van and tells them they must defeat and kill Bel, or die trying, rather than become his slaves. Hayk then discovers Bel's host in a mountain pass (that Moses locates at the site of Dastakert), with Bel himself in the vanguard. During Dyutsaznamart ("Battle of the Giants"), near Julamerk, southeast of Lake Van, dated to August 11, 2492 BC, Hayk slays Bel with an impossible shot using a long bow, sending his force into disarray.
TEXT.Polish: Haik to legendarny patriarcha i za³o¿yciel ormiañskiego narodu. Wed³ug legendy Haik by³ synem Togarmy, wnukiem Gomera, prawnukiem Jafeta i praprawnukiem Noego. Wg tej ludowej etymologii to na jego czeœæ Ormianie nazwali siê Hajami, a kraj Haik lub Hajastan.

TEXT.English: Hayreddin Barbarossa was an Ottoman admiral of the fleet who was born in the island of Midilli (Lesbos) and died in Constantinople (Istanbul), the Ottoman capital. Barbarossa's naval victories secured Ottoman dominance over the Mediterranean during the mid 16th century, from the Battle of Preveza in 1538 until the Battle of Lepanto in 1571.
TEXT.French: Hayreddin Barbarossa était un amiral ottoman de la flotte, né sur l'île de Midilli (Lesbos) et décédé à Constantinople (Istanbul), capitale ottomane. Les victoires navales de Barbarossa assurèrent la domination ottomane sur la Méditerranée au milieu du 16e siècle, de la bataille de Prévéza en 1538 jusqu'à la bataille de Lépante en 1571.

TEXT.English: The pursuit of head-hunting is central to Jivaro culture. The Jivaro warrior's collection of heads is one of the most important indicators of his status and martial prowess.
TEXT.French: La pratique de la chasse aux têtes est centrale dans la culture Jivaro. La collection de têtes du guerrier Jivaro est l'un des indicateurs les plus importants de son statut et de sa prouesse martiale.
TEXT.Italian: La caccia delle teste è molto importante nella cultura Jivaro; la collezione di teste di un guerriero Jivaro è uno degli indicatori più importanti del suo status sociale.

TEXT.English: The Healer provides his patients with medicinal herbs, which were very effective in healing the allergies, and raising and renewing the body vitality.
TEXT.French: Le guérisseur fournit à ses patients des herbes médicinales, très efficaces pour guérir les allergies, augmenter et renouveler la vitalité du corps.

TEXT.English: The Heavy Axeman is better armored than it's lighter counterpart, thus increasing combat survivability.
TEXT.French: Le Combattant à la Hache Lourde est mieux protégé que son homologue plus léger, augmentant ainsi sa survie au combat.
TEXT.Italian: Il guerriero con ascia corazzato ha un'armatura più pesante del normale guerriero, incrementando la resistenza in combattimento.
TEXT.Spanish: El Soldado con hacha pesada tiene una mejor armadura que su homólogo ligero, lo que aumenta su resistencia en combate.
TEXT.Polish: Siekiera lub topór to najstarsze i nadal u¿ywane z³o¿one narzêdzie. Od ponad czternastu tysiêcy lat jest on u¿ywany do kszta³towania i podzia³u drewna, r¹bania lasów, jako broñ obuchowo-sieczna czy te¿ jako symbol heraldyczny. Jest rozwiniêciem pomys³u kija z obci¹¿onym koñcem, który da³ pocz¹tek takim wynalazkom jak: maczuga, m³otek, motyka, topór ciesielski itp. Zmienia³ siê materia³ i zastosowanie, ale zasada dzia³ania pozosta³a nie zmieniona. Pocz¹tkowo wykonywany z kamienia i rogu, br¹zu a nastêpnie stali. Siekiery z kamienia ³upanego umieszczane by³y w rozczepionym stylisku, obwi¹zywanym dla wzmocnienia sznurami lub rzemieniami. Siekiery neolityczne posiada³y ju¿ czêsto wywiercony otwór dla mocowania trzonka. Pierwsze siekiery z br¹zu - tzw. siekiery tulejowe, posiada³y szeroki, rurowaty otwór ze strony przeciwleg³ej do ostrza, do niego prostopad³y, i wymaga³y specjalnie ukszta³towanego, wygiêtego prawie pod k¹tem prostym styliska. Dla wzmocnienia osadzenia takiej siekierki, by³a ona zwykle przywi¹zywana do styliska, czemu s³u¿y³y niewielkie pierœcienie z boków nasady, formowane ju¿ w czasie odlewania narzêdzia. W wielu kulturach epoki br¹zu siekierki stanowi³y prawdopodobnie œrodek p³atniczy.

TEXT.English: The pike, due to its unwieldy nature, was always intended to be used in a deliberate, defensive manner, often in conjunction with other missile and melee weapons. However, better-trained troops were capable of using the pike in an aggressive attack with each rank of pikemen being trained to hold their pikes so that they presented enemy infantry with four or five layers of spearheads bristling from the front of the formation.
TEXT.French: Après l'effondrement de l'Empire romain d'Occident, la ville de Rome se retrouva placée sous la protection des Byzantins. Toutefois, les Byzantins ne firent pas grand-chose pour aider Rome, et le pape dut former sa propre armée pour défendre la ville sainte. Les piquiers pontificaux sont des lanciers lourds. Ils sont inspirés des mercenaires de la garde suisse du Vatican, même si cette garde apparut en fait sept siècles après les événements de ce scénario.
TEXT.German: Mit dem Scheitern des Römischen Reiches stand die Stadt Rom theoretisch unter dem Schutze Konstantinopels. Die Byzantiner waren taten jedoch recht wenig, um Rom zu unterstützen, und der Papst sah sich gezwungen, eine eigene Armee aufzubauen, um die Heilige Stadt zu verteidigen. Päpstliche Pikeniere sind schwere Speerkämpfer. Sie basieren lose auf der Schweizer Garde, die den Vatikan in den letzten fünf Jahrhunderten verteidigt hat (auch wenn die Garde eigentlich erst etwa 700 Jahre nach den Ereignissen dieses Szenarios in Erscheinung trat).
TEXT.Italian: Con la caduta dell'Impero Romano d'Occidente, la città di Roma era nominalmente sotto la protezione di Bisanzio. I Bizantini però fecero ben poco per supportare Roma e il papa dovette creare un proprio esercito per difendere la Città Santa. I picchieri papali sono lancieri pesanti. Si basano indicativamente sulle unità mercenarie della Guardia Svizzera che hanno difeso il Vaticano negli ultimi cinque secoli (anche se la Guardia è apparsa circa 700 anni dopo gli eventi di questo scenario).
TEXT.Spanish: Con la desaparición del Imperio Romano de occidente, la ciudad de Roma quedó nominalmente bajo la protección de Bizancio. Sin embargo, los bizantinos no hicieron gran cosa para proteger Roma, y los Papas tuvieron que reclutar sus propios ejércitos para defender la Ciudad Santa. Los piqueros papales son lanceros pesados. Estas unidades se basan en los mercenarios de la Guardia Suiza que llevan cinco siglos defendiendo la ciudad del Vaticano (a pesar de que la auténtica Guardia no apareció hasta 700 años después de los sucesos de este escenario).
TEXT.Polish: Pikinierzy - jedna z formacji wojskowych z prze³omu XV i XVI wieku i pierwsza nowoczesna piechota tamtej epoki. Ich charakterystyczna broñ - d³uga pika (pocz¹tkowo d³ugoœci 2,5 m a póŸniej nawet 5,5 m) sia³a w ich sprawnych rêkach spustoszenie w szeregach przeciwnika.

Spanish.Text: Soldado con espada pesada:Soldados con espada pesada

TEXT.English: Tarkhan is an ancient Central Asian title used by various Indo-Europeans (i.e. Iranian and Tokharian), Turkic peoples, and by the proto-Mongols and Mongols. Its use was common among the successors of the Mongol Empire.
TEXT.French: Tarkhan est un titre ancien d'Asie centrale utilisé par divers Indo-Européens (c.-à-d. Iraniens et Tokhariens), les peuples turcs, ainsi que par les proto-Mongols et Mongols. Son usage était courant parmi les successeurs de l'Empire mongol.

TEXT.English: In Classical Antiquity, an oracle was a person or agency considered to provide wise counsel or prophetic predictions or precognition of the future, inspired by the gods. As such it is a form of divination.
TEXT.French: Dans l'Antiquité classique, un oracle était une personne ou une instance considérée comme fournissant des conseils avisés ou des prédictions prophétiques ou la précognition de l'avenir, inspiré par les dieux. En tant que tel, il s'agit d'une forme de divination.

TEXT.English: The Hemudu culture (5500 BC to 3300 BC) was a Neolithic culture that flourished just south of the Hangzhou Bay in Jiangnan in modern Yuyao, Zhejiang, China. The culture may be divided into an early and late phases, before and after 4000 BC respectively. The site at Hemudu, 22 km north-west of Ningbo, was discovered in 1973. Hemudu sites were also discovered on the islands of Zhoushan. Hemudu are said to have differed physically from inhabitants of the Yellow River sites to the north. Scholars view the Hemudu Culture as a source of the proto-Austronesian cultures.

Hendrik Witbooi (c. 1830 - 29 October 1905) was a chief of the Khowesin people, a sub-tribe of the Khoikhoi. He lived in present-day Namibia. Witbooi is regarded as one of the national heroes of Namibia. His face is portrayed on the obverse of all N$50, N$100 and N$200 Namibian dollar banknotes.
TEXT.French: Hendrik Witbooi (vers 1830 - 29 octobre 1905) était un chef du peuple Khowesin, une sous-tribu des Khoïkhoï. Il vivait dans l'actuelle Namibie. Witbooi est considéré comme l'un des héros nationaux de la Namibie. Son visage figure sur l'avers de tous les billets de banque namibiens de 50, 100 et 200 dollars.

TEXT.English: Henry de Bourbon or Henri IV in French (Pau, 13 December 1553 Paris, 14 May 1610), ruled as Henry III, King of Navarre, from 1572 to 1610, and as Henry IV, King of France, from 1589 to 1610. He was the first monarch of the Bourbon branch of the Capetian dynasty in France. His parents were Antoine de Bourbon, duc de Vendme, and Jeanne d'Albret, who was to become queen of Navarre on 25 May 1555. As a Huguenot, Henry was involved in the Wars of Religion before ascending the throne in 1589. Before his coronation as king of France at Chartres, he changed his faith from Calvinism to Catholicism, and in 1598 he enacted the Edict of Nantes, which guaranteed religious liberties to the Protestants and thereby effectively ended the civil war. One of the most popular French kings, both during and after his reign, Henry showed great care for the welfare of his subjects and displayed an unusual religious tolerance for the time. He was assassinated by a fanatical Catholic, Franois Ravaillac. Henry was nicknamed Henry the Great (Henri le Grand), and in France is sometimes called le bon roi Henri ("good king Henry") or le Vert galant ("the Green gallant"), a reference to his constant womanising. He also gave his name to the Henry IV style of architecture, which he patronised. He is the eponymous subject of the royal anthem of France, Marche Henri IV.
TEXT.Polish: Henryk IV Burbon (1553-1610), król Navarry od 1562, a od 1589 Francji, pocz¹tkowo by³ zwolennikiem i przywódc¹ hugonotów, aby zostaæ królem francuskim musia³ przejœæ na katolicyzm. W 1598 r. wyda³ edykt nantejski, który przyzna³ hugonotom wolnoœæ wyznania i swobody polityczne. Henryk IV, wydaj¹c ten dokument, przyczyni³ siê do zakoñczenia ponad 30-letniej wojny domowej we Francji.

TEXT.English: Sir Henry Parkes was a dominant political figure in Australia during the second half of the 19th century, often called the father of Australian federation. He served five terms as premier of New South Wales between 1872 and 1891. Parkes became politically prominent in 1849 as a spokesman for ending the transportation of convicts to Australia from England. The following year he launched the Empire, a newspaper he ran until 1858 and through which he campaigned for fully representative government. He first held public office in 1854 and served almost without interruption as a representative and often as a minister or premier until 1894. Parkes's educational work resulted in the Public Schools Act of 1866 and the Public Instruction Act of 1880, which introduced compulsory free education and severed connections between the church and the public schools. In his ministries between 1872 and 1887 he established New South Wales as a free-trade colony. He was knighted in 1877. In his fourth administration (188789) he carried through measures to improve railways and public works and to limit Chinese immigration. Parkes first spoke for federation in 1867 and later presided over the National Australasian Convention in 1891. He withdrew support from the resulting Commonwealth of Australia Bill, however, and federation was postponed until 1901. After the elections of 1891 Parkes lost his position of political leadership. His autobiography, Fifty Years in the Making of Australian History, appeared in 1892.
TEXT.Polish: Sir Henry Parkes by³ dominuj¹c¹ osobistoœci¹ polityczn¹ w drugiej po³owie XIX wieku w Australii, czêsto nazywany jest ojcem Australijskiej Federacji. S³u¿y³ jako premier Nowej Po³udniowej Walii przez 5 kadencji w latach 1872 - 1891. Parkes zosta³ dzia³aczem politycznym w 1849 przemawiaj¹c za zaprzestaniem transportowania skazañców z Anglii do Australii. W nastêpnym roku za³ozy³ gazetê Empire, któr¹ wydawa³ a¿ do 1858 i poprzez któr¹ opowiada³ siê utworzeniem w pe³nii reprezentatywnego rz¹du. Po raz pierwszy na oficjalny urz¹d zosta³ powo³any w 1854 i s³u¿y³ na urzêdowych stanowiskach prawie nieprzerwanie a¿ do 1894, kilkukrotnie jako premier.

TEXT.English: The founder of the Portuguese empire, Prince Henry of Portugal was a patron of explorers, and he was one of the earliest geographers. In honor of the discoveries he inspired, he came to be called Henry the Navigator. Henry was born in Oporto on March 4, 1394, the third surviving son of King John I of Portugal. In 1415 Prince Henry distinguished himself in a campaign in which the Portuguese captured the Moroccan citadel of Ceuta on the African coast across the straits from Gibraltar. While he was in Ceuta he became interested in the continent of Africa and decided to send out expeditions to explore its coasts. From 1418 the prince sponsored numerous voyages of exploration. The Portuguese explored the islands of the Azores, Madeira, and the Cape Verde Islands, and the African coast as far as present-day Sierra Leone. Prince Henry set up a base near Cape St. Vincent, the southwestern tip of Portugal, not far from the port of Lagos. There, on a rocky promontory called Sagres, Henry created a small court of his own called Vila do Infante. The most brilliant scholars did pioneer work here in navigation, ship design, astronomy, and mapmaking. From Sagres he sent out most of his expeditions. The prince expended his entire fortune on these projects. He was in debt when he died in Vila do Infante on Nov. 13, 1460.
TEXT.Polish: Henryk ¯eglarz, port. Dom Henrique o Navegador (ur. 4 marca 1394 w Porto, zm. 13 listopada 1460 w Sagres) infant, trzeci syn króla Portugalii Jana I Dobrego i Filipy Lancaster. Uwa¿any za twórcê portugalskiego imperium kolonialnego. W 1415 otrzyma³ tytu³ ksiêcia Viseu i pana Covilha, a w 1417 zosta³ wielkim mistrzem Zakonu Rycerzy Chrystusa. Uwa¿any jest za patrona rozwoju floty portugalskiej i odkryæ geograficznych, za³o¿yciela uniwersytetu w Lizbonie oraz szko³y kartografii i astronomii w Sagres, uznawanej za pierwsz¹ akademiê morsk¹ na œwiecie. Przypisuje mu siê tak¿e wynalazek karaweli, choæ nie ma na to bezpoœrednich dowodów. Przydomek ¯eglarz nadano mu kilkaset lat po jego œmierci, chocia¿ nigdy nie p³ywa³ na statkach. By³ protektorem ¿eglarzy i odkrywców. Z jego inicjatywy podjêto wiele wypraw ¿eglarskich, g³ównie wzd³u¿ zachodniego wybrze¿a Afryki.

TEXT.English: Henry the Lion (German: Heinrich der Löwe; 1129 - 6 August 1195) was a member of the Welf dynasty and Duke of Saxony, as Henry III, from 1142, and Duke of Bavaria, as Henry XII, from 1156, which duchies he held until 1180. He was one of the most powerful German princes of his time, until the rival Hohenstaufen dynasty succeeded in isolating him and eventually deprived him of his duchies of Bavaria and Saxony during the reign of his cousin Frederick I Barbarossa and of Frederick's son and successor Henry VI.

The Hereros were cattle grazers, occupying most of central and northern South-West Africa. During the Scramble for Africa, South-West Africa was claimed by Germany in August 1884. At that time, it was the only overseas German territory deemed suitable for white settlement. German colonists arriving in the following years occupied large areas of land, ignoring any claims by the Herero and other natives. There was continual resistance by the natives. In 1903, some of the Khoi and Herero tribes rose in revolt and about 60 German settlers were killed. Troops were sent from Germany to re-establish order, but only succeeded in dispersing the rebels, led by Chief Samuel Maharero.

Hernando Arias de Saavedra (September 10, 1561 - 1634), commonly known as Hernandarias, was a soldier and politician of criollo ancestry. He was the first person born in the Americas to become a governor of a European colony in the New World, serving two terms as governor of Governorate of the Río de la Plata, 1597-1599 and 1602-1609, and one of the Governorate of Paraguay 1615-1617.
TEXT.French: Hernando Arias de Saavedra (10 septembre 1561 - 1634), communément appelé Hernandarias, était un soldat et homme politique d'ascendance criollo. Il fut la première personne née aux Amériques à devenir gouverneur d'une colonie européenne dans le Nouveau Monde, servant deux mandats comme gouverneur du Gouvernement du Río de la Plata, 1597-1599 et 1602-1609, et un du Gouvernement du Paraguay 1615-1617.

TEXT.English: Hernan Cortes was a Spanish conquistador who led an expedition that caused the fall of the Aztec empire and brought large portions of mainland Mexico under the King of Castile, in the early 16th century. Corts was part of the generation of Spanish colonizers that began the first phase of the Spanish colonization of the Americas. Born in Medelln, Extremadura, Spain, to a family of lesser nobility, Corts chose to pursue a livelihood in the New World. He went to Hispaniola and later to Cuba, where he received an encomienda and, for a short time, became alcalde (magistrate) of the second Spanish town founded on the island. In 1519, he was elected captain of the third expedition to the mainland, an expedition which he partly funded. His enmity with the governor of Cuba, Diego Velzquez de Cullar, resulted in the recall of the expedition at the last moment, an order which Corts ignored. Arriving on the continent, Corts executed a successful strategy of allying with some indigenous peoples against others. He also used a native woman, Doa Marina, as interpreter; she would later bear Corts a son. When the Governor of Cuba sent emissaries to arrest Corts, he fought them and won, using the extra troops as reinforcements. Corts wrote letters directly to the king asking to be acknowledged for his successes instead of punished for mutiny. After he overthrew the Aztec empire, Corts was awarded the title of Marqus del Valle de Oaxaca, while the more prestigious title of Viceroy was given to a high-ranking nobleman, Antonio de Mendoza. Corts returned to Spain in 1541 where he died peacefully but embittered. Because of the controversial undertakings of Corts and the scarcity of reliable sources of information about him, it has become difficult to assert anything definitive about his personality and motivations. Early lionizing of the conquistadors did not encourage deep examination of Corts. Later reconsideration of the conquistadors' character in the context of modern anti-colonial sentiment and greatly expanded concern for human rights, as typified by the Black Legend, also did little to expand understanding of Corts as an individual. As a result of these historical trends, descriptions of Corts tend to be simplistic, and either damning or idealizing.
TEXT.Polish: Hernan Cortes ur. najprawdopodobniej ok. 1485 w Medellin, Prowincja Badajoz, Estremadura, zm. 2 grudnia 1547 w Castilleja de la Cuesta, Prowincja Sewilla) hiszpañski konkwistador, znany przede wszystkim jako zdobywca Meksyku. Jego czyny zosta³y opisane we wspomnieniach Bernala Diaza del Castillo. Maj¹c dziewiêtnaœcie lat przyby³ na Hispaniolê w Indiach Zachodnich. W 1511 uczestniczy³ w ekspedycji Diego de Vel¹zqueza, która podbi³a dla Hiszpanii Kubê. Na Kubie CortŸs spêdzi³ 8 lat by³ wtedy sekretarzem i przyjacielem jej gubernatora Vel¹zqueza; w tym czasie o¿eni³ siê z Catalin¹ Xuarez. W tym okresie dotar³y na Kubê wiadomoœci o z³otodajnych, bogatych terenach po drugiej stronie Morza Karaibskiego. CortŸs zorganizowa³ ekspedycjê przy pomocy Vel¹zqueza, z którym jednak zaraz po opuszczeniu Kuby (18 lutego 1519) popad³ w konflikt. Dalsza ekspedycja pozosta³a wiêc jego osobistym przedsiêwziêciem. W 1519 CortŸs wyl¹dowa³ na wybrze¿u Meksyku, w miejscu, gdzie dziœ le¿y miasto Veracruz. Po kilku miesi¹cach zawar³ przymierze z lokalnymi plemionami Indian Tlaxcala, Huejotzincan i innymi. Na ich czele ruszy³ na podbój imperium Azteków. Bez walki wszed³ do ich stolicy Tenochtitlan 8 listopada 1519, po czym uwiêzi³ króla Azteków Montezumê II. Wiosn¹ 1520 CortŸs pokona³ i przy³¹czy³ do swojego oddzia³u wys³any przez Vel¹zqueza korpus, który mia³ go powstrzymaæ. Po œmierci Montezumy II pod koniec czerwca 1520 oddzia³y CortŸsa zosta³y wyparte z miasta wskutek buntu Azteków, bêd¹cego reakcj¹ na pogrom lokalnej ludnoœci zapocz¹tkowany pod jego nieobecnoœæ przez Pedro de Alvarado. W ci¹gu kilku miesiêcy armia CortŸsa opanowa³a tereny wokó³ Tenochtitlan i w maju 1521 przyst¹pi³a do oblê¿enia miasta. Po wyczerpuj¹cych walkach 13 sierpnia 1521 Hiszpanie opanowali Tenochtitlan. Oznacza³o to upadek imperium Azteków i opanowanie przez Hiszpaniê ogromnej czêœci Ameryki Œrodkowej. Po podbiciu Meksyku CortŸs zorganizowa³ jeszcze jedn¹ wyprawê do Gwatemali i Hondurasu, które jednak nie mia³y wiêkszego znaczenia. Nied³ugo póŸniej (1540) CortŸs wróci³ do Hiszpanii, gdzie jednak jego zas³ugi dla Korony nie zosta³y odpowiednio nagrodzone? prawdopodobnie wskutek intryg. Mia³ on nadziejê na przedstawienie swoich pretensji królowi. Przez siedem lat czeka³ na audiencjê. Nie doczekawszy jej, 2 grudnia 1547 CortŸs zmar³ w Hiszpanii, zapomniany i niedoceniony. Pochowany zosta³ w koœciele San Isidro del Campo we wsi Santiponce ko³o Sewilli. W roku 1566 szcz¹tki CortŸsa zabrano do Meksyku, gdzie parokrotnie zmieniano miejsce pochówku. Obecnie spoczywaj¹ w koœciele Jesus Nazareno w stolicy Meksyku. Jest to jedyne miejsce w tym kraju, gdzie uczczono pamiêæ CortŸsa.

TEXT.English: Hezbollah is a Shi'a Islamist militant group and political party based in Lebanon. Hezbollah's paramilitary wing is the Jihad Council, and its political wing is Loyalty to the Resistance Bloc party in the Lebanese parliament. After the death of Abbas al-Musawi in 1992, the group has been headed by Hassan Nasrallah, its Secretary-General.
TEXT.French: Hezbollah est un groupe militant islamiste chiite et un parti politique basé au Liban. L'aile paramilitaire de Hezbollah est le Conseil du Jihad, et son aile politique est le parti Bloc de la Loyauté à la Résistance au parlement libanais. Après la mort d'Abbas al-Musawi en 1992, le groupe est dirigé par Hassan Nasrallah, son secrétaire général.

TEXT.English: Hiawatha, who lived (depending on the version of the story) in the 1100s, 1400s, or 1500s, was variously a leader of the Onondaga and Mohawk nations of Native Americans. Hiawatha was a follower of The Great Peacemaker, a prophet and spiritual leader who was credited as the founder of the Iroquois confederacy, (referred to as Haudenosaunee by the people). If The Great Peacemaker was the man of ideas, Hiawatha was the politician who actually put the plan into practice. Hiawatha was a skilled and charismatic orator, and was instrumental in persuading the Iroquois peoples, the Senecas, Cayugas, Onondagas, Oneidas, and Mohawks, a group of Native North Americans who shared similar languages, to accept The Great Peacemaker's vision and band together to become the Five Nations of the Iroquois confederacy. Later, the Tuscarora nation joined the Confederacy and they became the Six Nations.
TEXT.Polish: Hiawatha - ¿yj¹cy (wed³ug ró¿nych przekazów) w XII, XV lub XVI wieku wódz irokeski, wed³ug ustnych przekazów irokeskich uczeñ Wielkiego Rozjemcy Deganewidy, za³o¿yciela Konfederacji Piêciu Narodów. Wraz z Deganewid¹ mia³ rozpaliæ Wieczny P³omieñ, wokó³ którego zbiera³a siê Wielka Rada Konfederacji Piêciu Narodów.

TEXT.English: Toyotomi Hideyoshi (153698) was a Japanese warrior and dictator. He entered the service of Nobunaga as his sandal holder and rose to become his leading general. After Nobunaga's death Hideyoshi ruled as civilian dictator. He set out to unify Japan, violently disrupted by a century of civil strife. Hideyoshi subdued the military Buddhist sects, conquered Kyushu, and in 1584 came to terms with Ieyasu. By 1590, with the defeat of the Hojo clan, Hideyoshi was ruler of a united Japan. Although best remembered for his military exploits, Hideyoshi as a civil administrator decreed a land survey, revised the land tax, developed a code of maritime law, and encouraged foreign trade. He at first received Christian missionaries cordially. Then, believing them a political danger because of their proselytizing zeal, he proscribed (1587) their activities and persecuted some of them. In 1592 he attempted to conquer China but succeeded only in occupying part of Korea; just before his death he ordered withdrawal from Korea. He erected monuments, reconstructed Kyoto and Osaka, and encouraged the arts. During the last decade of his life, he ruled mainly from Kyoto, where he had a luxurious residence at Momoyama.
TEXT.Polish: Toyotomi Hideyoshi (ur. 2 lutego 1536 lub 17 marca 1537, zm. 18 wrzeœnia 1598) japoñski przywódca polityczny i militarny z okresu Azuchi-Momoyama. Jedna z najwa¿niejszych postaci w historii tego kraju. Kontynuowa³ proces jednoczenia pañstwa, rozpoczêty przez Nobunagê Odê. Wielokrotnie w ci¹gu ¿ycia zmienia³ nazwiska. Od 1573 znany jako Hideyoshi Hashiba, najbardziej popularne nazwisko przyj¹³ pod koniec ¿ycia. W 1585 zosta³ nominowany regentem (kampaku), a rok póŸniej g³ównym ministrem (dajo-daijin). W 1591 (lub 1592) przekaza³ w³adzê swojemu siostrzeñcowi, Hidetsugu, a siebie zacz¹³ nazywaæ taiko. By³ to tytu³ odnosz¹cy siê do by³ych regentów. Nigdy natomiast nie nosi³ tytu³u szoguna.

TEXT.English: "Highwaymen" is the name given to mounted robbers who preyed on travellers. They were especially known in Great Britain and Ireland, operating from the Elizabethan era to the early 19th century. Highwaymen would work alone, in pairs, or in gangs, and stop horses and coaches for their money and valuables. Some highwaymen later earned reputations as romantic heroes, in the style of Robin Hood. After the development of turnpikes and railways, which made escape for the highwaymen difficult, they disappeared.
TEXT.Italian: I banditi erano ladri a cavallo che depredavano i viaggiatori. Erano particolarmente noti in Gran Bretagna e Irlanda, dove operarono dall'epoca elisabettiana agli inizi del 19° secolo. I banditi lavoravano da soli, in coppia o in bande; fermavano cavalli e carrozze per rubare soldi e oggetti di valore. Alcuni banditi guadagnarono in seguito una reputazione come eroi romantici, in stile Robin Hood. Dopo lo sviluppo delle autostrade a pedaggio e delle ferrovie, che resero difficile la fuga per i banditi, essi scomparvero.
TEXT.Polish: Zbójnik, zbójnicy - tradycyjne okreœlenie cz³onków góralskich band rozbójniczych, dzia³aj¹cych na terenach Karpat. Termin zbójnika jest mniej negatywny ni¿ pokrewne: rabuœ, bandyta, rozbójnik. Czasem zbójnik mo¿e byæ przedstawiany jednoczeœnie jako pozytywny bohater (czego przyk³adem jest legenda Janosika, którego pierwowzorem by³ Juraj Janosik).W ludowych opowieœciach zbójnicy byli obroñcami wyzyskiwanych górali. Dzia³alnoœæ zbójnika okreœlana jest terminem: zbójnictwo. Dzisiaj mylnie okreœla siê tym terminem obrabowywanie bogatych i obdarowywanie biednych.

TEXT.English: Guru is a Sanskrit term for "teacher" or "master", particularly in Indian religions. The Hindu guru-shishya tradition is the oral tradition or religious doctrine or experiential wisdom transmitted from teacher to student. In the United States, the word guru is a newer term, most often used to describe a teacher from the Hindu tradition. In the West some derogatory interpretations of the word have been noted, reflecting certain gurus who have allegedly exploited their followers' naiveté, due to the use of the term in certain new religious movements.
The Hi-Tech Hovercraft is an armored unit that can cross water. It is held up by very quickly spinning fan blades which create a cushion of air underneath it.
TEXT.French: L'aéroglisseur haute technologie est une unité blindée capable de traverser l'eau. Il est soutenu par des pales de ventilateur tournant très rapidement qui créent un coussin d'air en dessous.
TEXT.Italian: L'Hovercraft hi-tech è un'unità corazzata in grado di attraversare gli specchi d'acqua. Si muove grazie ad un cuscinetto d'aria creato da potenti ventole sotto il veicolo.
TEXT.Polish: Poduszkowiec (ang. hovercraft) - pojazd poruszaj¹cy siê na poduszce powietrznej. Poduszka ta powstaje gdy wentylator zasysa powietrze z otoczenia i wt³acza je pod spód pojazdu. Powietrze sprê¿ane jest wewn¹trz komory powsta³ej pomiêdzy dnem maszyny, gruntem i elastycznym fartuchem. Gdy komora wype³ni siê powietrzem i poduszkowiec uniesie siê na odpowiedni¹ wysokoœæ, nadmiar powietrza wydostaje siê na zewn¹trz. Wentylator musi mieæ wystarczaj¹c¹ wydajnoœæ aby uzupe³nia³ ubytek powietrza. Dziêki temu wysokoœæ poduszki powietrznej pozostaje sta³a.
TEXT.Russian: Высокотехнологичное судно на воздушной подушке - это бронированный юнит, способный пересекать водные просторы. Он поддерживается очень быстро вращающимися лопастями вентилятора, создающего под ним воздушную подушку.

TEXT.English: Hi-Tech marines were elite troopers of the Transhuman Navy tasked with warding off boarding parties on enemy capital ships, as well as conducting boarding action against rebel vessels. The HT marine's weapons consisted of a DC-15A blaster rifle, a PLX-1 rocket launcher, a commando pistol based on the design of a DC-15S, and V-1 thermal detonators. This infantry unit would enter an enemy ship and would either capture or critically damage essential systems on that ship. On boarding parties, they would be more reliable, due to their quick sharpshooting and automatic DC-15A blaster rifles, than a clone pilot armed with a blaster pistol. The Marines were cross-trained to fight on a variety of environments in ground and water, making them extremely versatile. They specialized in boarding and capturing enemy ships as well as shore assault.

Having endured subjugation by the Earth Empire in the past, Verpine engineers designed the IX-6 to deter incursion into the Roche asteroid belt. When the new Empire came to rise years later, Verpine increased the production of the droids and spread them throughout their hives, as well as continued to sell them to other interested parties.
TEXT.French: Ayant subi la subjugation par l'Empire Terrestre dans le passé, les ingénieurs Verpine ont conçu le IX-6 pour dissuader toute incursion dans la ceinture d'astéroïdes de Roche. Lorsque le nouvel Empire s'éleva des années plus tard, les Verpine augmentèrent la production des droïdes et les dispersèrent dans leurs ruches, tout en continuant à les vendre à d'autres parties intéressées.
TEXT.Russian: Пережив покорение Земной империей в прошлом, инженеры Verpine разработали IX-6, чтобы предотвратить вторжение в пояс астероидов Рош. Когда новая Империя возникла спустя годы, Верпин увеличил производство дроидов и распространил их по всему улью, а также продолжил продавать их другим заинтересованным сторонам.

TEXT.English: The Landsknecht were a Renaissance style of German mercenary (although the individual members came from all over Europe) which were renowned for employing a tactic known as the "pike square." In the pike square, each soldier would be equipped with an eighteen foot long pike, and would stand in a tight, and sometimes hollow, box formation. If attacked from any side, the pikemen would simply lower their weapons and brace their pikes into the ground. This tactic was devastating to enemy cavalry and infantry. Surpassing the Swiss mercenaries organizations on which they based their tactics, the Landsknecht eventually became one of the most successful style of mercenary in Europe due to their willingness to integrate newer technology such as arquebuses and gunpowder artillery into their military formations.
TEXT.French: Les lansquenets étaient des sortes de mercenaires allemands (même si les soldats qui les composaient venaient de toute l'Europe), réputés pour employer la tactique dite du "hérisson". Pour cette tactique, les soldats étaient équipés d'une pique de 5 mètres et formaient un carré plus ou moins étroit. S'ils se faisaient attaquer, les piquiers abaissaient simplement leurs armes en enfonçant le manche dans la terre pour leur donner plus de résistance. Cette tactique était dévastatrice pour la cavalerie et l'infanterie ennemies. Surpassant les mercenaires suisses dont ils s'inspiraient, les lansquenets finirent par compter parmi les mercenaires les plus redoutables d'Europe notamment grâce à l'intégration de nouvelles technologies comme les arquebuses et l'artillerie dans leurs formations militaires.
TEXT.German: Die Landsknechte waren deutsche Söldner der Renaissance (obwohl einzelne Mitglieder überallher aus Europa stammten) und berühmt für eine als "Igel" bekannte Taktik. Beim Igel war jeder Soldat mit einer mehr als 5 Meter langen Pike bewaffnet und stand dicht in einer manchmal hohlen Quadratformation. Bei einem Angriff senkten die Pikeniere einfach ihre Waffen, die sie hinten in den Boden rammten. Diese Taktik war für feindliche Kavallerie und Infanterie verheerend. Die Landsknechte stellten auch die Schweizer Söldnerorganisationen, an denen sie sich taktisch orientierten, in den Schatten und wurden schließlich zum erfolgreichsten Söldnertypus in Europa, da sie bereit waren, neue Technologien wie Arkebusen oder Schießpulver-Artillerie in ihre Kampfgruppen zu integrieren.
TEXT.Italian: I Lanzichenecchi erano un tipo rinascimentale di mercenari tedeschi (anche se i singoli soldati provenivano da tutta Europa) conosciuti per l'impiego di una tattica chiamata "quadrato di picche". Ogni soldato del quadrato era armato con una picca lunga oltre tre metri e stava in formazione con gli altri in un quadrato, talvolta vuoto. Quando venivano attaccati, i soldati non facevano altro che abbassare le armi verso il nemico e piantarne la parte finale a terra. Una tattica devastante nei confronti di cavalleria e fanteria. Superando addirittura i mercenari svizzeri, da cui avevano appreso la tattica, i Lanzichenecchi divennero alla fine i mercenari di maggior successo in Europa grazie alla loro disponibilità a integrare nuove tecnologie, come archibugi e artiglieria, nelle proprie formazioni militari.
TEXT.Spanish: Los lansquenetes, versión renacentista del mercenario alemán (aunque sus miembros procedían de toda Europa), eran famosos por emplear la táctica conocida como "cuadrado de picas". En el cuadrado de picas los soldados, equipados con una pica de seis metros,se organizaban en una formación cerrada y, a veces, hueca por dentro. Si eran atacados desde cualquier dirección, los piqueros bajaban las armas y apoyaban la parte baja del astil en el suelo. Esta táctica era devastadora frente a la caballería y la infantería enemigas. Los lansquenetes copiaron las tácticas de las unidades mercenarias suizas y las mejoraron. Entre esto y su disposición a integrar la tecnología más moderna (como los arcabuces y la artillería con pólvora) en sus estrategias, se convirtieron en las unidades mercenarias más eficaces de Europa.

TEXT.English: A Hoplomachus was a type of gladiator in ancient Rome, armed to resemble a Greek hoplite (soldier with heavy armor and helmet, a round shield, a spear and a sword). The hoplomachus would wear a bronze helmet, a manica on his right arm, loincloth (subligaculum), heavy padding on his legs, and a pair of high greaves reaching to mid-thigh. His weapons were the spear and a short sword. He was often pitted against the murmillo (armed like a Roman soldier), perhaps as a re-enactment of Rome's wars in Greece and the Hellenistic East. The name hoplomachus means 'armored fighter'. The small, round shield, or hoplon, was as much a weapon as a sword or spear, not unlike the original hoplites (who carried a larger shield), who used it primarily for defensive purposes, but also employed it in their charges, using it to ram their opponents at the onset of a fight. They wear no shoes so the sand will chafe their feet and give them a challenge.
Horseman is a cavalryman armed with a javelin while scouting and with a long spear while in a battle.
TEXT.French: Un cavalier est un soldat monté armé d'un javelot lors de la reconnaissance et d'une longue lance en bataille.
TEXT.Polish: JeŸdziec jest kawalerzyst¹ uzbrojonym w oszczep.

Ïðèâû÷íûå ê ñóðîâîìó êëèìàòó, ýòè æèâîòíûå áîëüøå íå íóæäàþòñÿ â ïîñòîÿííîì óõîäå.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ýëèòíûå âîèíû Ìóëêàðíà îòëîâèëè è ïðèðó÷èëè íåìàëî äëèííîøåðñòíûõ êîíåé.
