German.Text: Berittener Bogenschütze:Berittenen Bogenschützen:Berittenen Bogenschützen:Berittenen Bogenschützen:Berittene Bogenschützen:Berittenen Bogenschützen:Berittenen Bogenschützen:Berittenen Bogenschützen

TEXT.English: A horse archer (or horsed archer or mounted archer) is a cavalryman armed with a bow. Because using a bow requires a horseman to let go of the reins with both hands, horse archers need superb equestrian skills. Horse archery is typically associated with steppe nomads. [PARAGRAPH:1]The weapon of choice for horse archers was the recurve bow, because it was compact enough to shoot from a horse and retained sufficient range and penetrating power. The most serious threat to horse archers was arrows, and they could wheel away out of bowshot after every attack. Mounted archers therefore needed little or no armor and could ride light, fast mounts such as ponies. This made them cheap to equip and increased their strategic mobility. [PARAGRAPH:1]A drawback of horse archers was that the movements of a running horse disturbed the accuracy of the shot. After the invention of the stirrup, horse archers would stand up in their stirrups to absorb the motion of the horse. Another method to facilitate accurate shooting was to time shots between the strides of the horse. [PARAGRAPH:1]Horse archers were eventually made obsolete by the development of modern firearms.
TEXT.French: Les archers montés, ou archers à cheval, sont des cavaliers armés d'un arc. Ces guerriers devaient être des cavaliers hors pair, car ils devaient, pour tirer, lâcher les rênes des deux mains. L'archer à cheval est un concept directement associé aux nomades de la steppe. [PARAGRAPH:1]L'arme de prédilection des archers montés est l'arc recourbé, suffisamment court pour tirer à cheval, et disposant d'une portée et d'une puissance de pénétration raisonnables. La menace la plus sérieuse pour les archers montés était justement les flèches, et ils se repliaient fréquemment après chaque assaut. De ce fait, les archers montés n'avaient pas besoin d'armure et disposaient de montures légères et rapides, comme des poneys. Ils coûtaient donc peu cher à équiper et avaient une grande mobilité. [PARAGRAPH:1]Un des problèmes des archers montés était que le balancement des chevaux lancés au galop limitait la précision du tir. Après l'invention des étriers, les archers pouvaient tirer en se tenant debout sur ces derniers pour limiter le balancement. Une autre méthode utilisée pour améliorer la précision consistait à faire coïncider le tir avec la foulée du cheval. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les archers montés disparurent avec l'apparition des armes à feu modernes.
TEXT.German: Berittene Bogenschützen sind mit Bögen bewaffnete Einheiten der Kavallerie. Da ein Bogenschütze aufgrund seiner Waffe die Zügel nicht festhalten kann, muss er ein perfekter Reiter sein. Nicht zuletzt deshalb setzen vor allem Nomadenvölker berittene Bogenschützen ein. [PARAGRAPH:1]Die bevorzugte Waffe der berittenen Bogenschützen war der kompakte Recurve-Bogen. Dieser konnte auch von einem Reiter abgefeuert werden und hatte eine bemerkenswerte Reichweite und Durchschlagskraft. Die größte Gefahr drohte einem berittenen Bogenschützen durch die Pfeile anderer Bogenschützen. Um diesen auszuweichen, trugen berittene Bogenschützen meist nur leichte Rüstungen und setzten ausschließlich leichte und wendige Pferde ein. [PARAGRAPH:1]Da die Bewegungen des Pferdes die Treffsicherheit der Bogenschützen beeinträchtigten, ritten diese nach der Erfindung der Steigbügel stehend, um die Bewegungen des Pferdes auf diese Weise auszugleichen. Andere Bogenschützen stimmten ihre Schüsse auf die Schrittfrequenz des Pferdes ab, um ihre Treffsicherheit zu verbessern. [PARAGRAPH:1]Einhergehend mit der Entwicklung moderner Schusswaffen verloren die Bogenschützen schließlich an Bedeutung.
TEXT.Italian: Un arciere a cavallo è un soldato di cavalleria armato di arco; per scoccare le frecce con l'arco, il soldato a cavallo deve lasciare le redini e quindi deve avere delle abilità equestri notevoli. Gli arcieri a cavallo sono tipici delle popolazioni nomadi delle steppe. [PARAGRAPH:1]L'arma preferita era l'arco ricurvo, che consentiva una buona maneggevolezza insieme a una potenza di penetrazione sufficiente a trapassare armature. Il pericolo maggiore per questo tipo di unità erano le frecce; gli arcieri a cavallo avevano bisogno di poca armatura ed erano in grado di cavalcare animali rapidi. Queste caratteristiche rendevano estremamente economiche queste unità e ne aumentavano il valore strategico. [PARAGRAPH:1]Uno degli svantaggi degli arcieri a cavallo è la precisione: il movimento degli equini rendeva particolarmente difficile prendere la mira. Dopo l'invenzione delle staffe, gli arcieri le usavano per alzarsi in piedi e assorbire le vibrazioni del movimento. Un altro metodo consisteva nello scoccare le frecce a intervalli regolari coincidenti con il passo del cavallo. [PARAGRAPH:1]Gli arcieri a cavallo divennero obsoleti con lo sviluppo delle armi da fuoco moderne
TEXT.Spanish: El arquero a caballo (o arquero montado) es un jinete armado con un arco. Como tiene que soltar las riendas para poder usar su arco, ha de ser un jinete extraordinario. Los arqueros a caballo son típicos de los pueblos nómadas de las estepas. [PARAGRAPH:1]El arma preferida por los arqueros a caballo era el arco compuesto, porque era lo bastante compacto como para dispararse desde un caballo sin menoscabo de su alcance y capacidad de penetración. La mayor amenaza para ellos la representaban otros arqueros, y siempre podían conjurarla situándose más allá de su alcance después de cada ataque. Por ello, los arqueros a caballo apenas necesitaban armadura, y podían emplear monturas ligeras, como los ponis. Esto los convertía en tropas baratas y aumentaba su movilidad estratégica. [PARAGRAPH:1]Su principal desventaja era que el movimiento del caballo reducía la precisión del arquero. Tras la invención del estribo, los jinetes empezaron a levantarse sobre ellos para absorber el movimiento del caballo. Otro método que permitía aumentar la precisión consistía en aprovechar entre zancada y zancada del caballo para disparar. [PARAGRAPH:1]La aparición de las armas de fuego modernas acabó por dejar obsoletos a los arqueros a caballo.

TEXT.English: Mounted knights armed with lances proved ineffective against formations of pikemen combined with crossbowmen whose weapons could penetrate most knights' armor. The invention of pushlever and ratchet drawing mechanisms enabled the use of crossbows on horseback, leading to the development of new cavalry tactics. Knights and mercenaries deployed in triangular formations, with the most heavily armored knights at the front. Some of these riders would carry small, powerful all-metal crossbows of their own. Crossbows were eventually replaced in warfare by more powerful gunpowder weapons, although early guns had slower rates of fire and much worse accuracy than contemporary crossbows.
TEXT.Spanish: El Ballestero a caballo.

TEXT.English: A hospital ship is a ship designated for primary function as a floating medical treatment facility or hospital. Most are operated by the military forces (mostly navies) of various countries, as they are intended to be used in or near war zones. Although attacking a hospital ship is a war crime, belligerent navies have the right to board such ships for inspections.
TEXT.French: Un navire-hôpital est un navire désigné pour sa fonction principale en tant qu'installation flottante de traitement médical ou hôpital. La plupart sont exploités par les forces militaires (principalement des marines) de divers pays, car ils sont destinés à être utilisés dans ou à proximité des zones de guerre. Bien que l'attaque d'un navire-hôpital soit un crime de guerre, les marines belligérantes ont le droit de monter à bord de ces navires pour des inspections.
TEXT.Russian: Корабль-госпиталь - это судно, предназначенное для выполнения основных функций в качестве плавучей больницы или спасательного плавсредства. Большинство из них эксплуатируются в вооруженных силах (в основном ВМФ) различных стран, поскольку они предназначены для использования в зонах боевых действий или вблизи них. Хотя нападение на госпитальное судно является военным преступлением, патрульные и пограничные службы имеют право подняться на борт таких судов для инспекций.

TEXT.English: The Hovercraft is an armored unit that can cross water. It is held up by very quickly spinning fan blades which create a cushion of air underneath it.
TEXT.French: L'aéroglisseur est une unité blindée capable de traverser l'eau. Il est soutenu par des pales de ventilateur tournant très rapidement qui créent un coussin d'air en dessous.
TEXT.Italian: L'Hovercraft è un'unità corazzata in grado di attraversare gli specchi d'acqua; rimane sospesa grazie a potenti ventole che creano un cuscino d'aria sotto il veicolo.
TEXT.Polish: Poduszkowiec (ang. hovercraft) - pojazd poruszaj¹cy siê na poduszce powietrznej. Poduszka ta powstaje gdy wentylator zasysa powietrze z otoczenia i wt³acza je pod spód pojazdu. Powietrze sprê¿ane jest wewn¹trz komory powsta³ej pomiêdzy dnem maszyny, gruntem i elastycznym fartuchem. Gdy komora wype³ni siê powietrzem i poduszkowiec uniesie siê na odpowiedni¹ wysokoœæ, nadmiar powietrza wydostaje siê na zewn¹trz. Wentylator musi mieæ wystarczaj¹c¹ wydajnoœæ aby uzupe³nia³ ubytek powietrza. Dziêki temu wysokoœæ poduszki powietrznej pozostaje sta³a.

TEXT.English: The Hover Artillery is an artillery unit that can cross oceans. It is held up by use of liquid metals controlled by magnetic fields powered by a small fusion core.
TEXT.French: L'artillerie aéroglisseur est une unité d'artillerie capable de traverser les océans. Elle est soutenue par l'utilisation de métaux liquides contrôlés par des champs magnétiques alimentés par un petit coeur de fusion.
TEXT.Italian: L'aeroscafo da artiglieria può attraversare gli oceani; rimane sospesa sull'acqua grazie a un insieme di metalli liquidi controllati da campi magnetici creati da un piccolo nucleo a fusione.
TEXT.Polish: Poduszkowiec (ang. hovercraft) - pojazd poruszaj¹cy siê na poduszce powietrznej. Poduszka ta powstaje gdy wentylator zasysa powietrze z otoczenia i wt³acza je pod spód pojazdu. Powietrze sprê¿ane jest wewn¹trz komory powsta³ej pomiêdzy dnem maszyny, gruntem i elastycznym fartuchem. Gdy komora wype³ni siê powietrzem i poduszkowiec uniesie siê na odpowiedni¹ wysokoœæ, nadmiar powietrza wydostaje siê na zewn¹trz. Wentylator musi mieæ wystarczaj¹c¹ wydajnoœæ aby uzupe³nia³ ubytek powietrza. Dziêki temu wysokoœæ poduszki powietrznej pozostaje sta³a.
TEXT.Russian: САУ на воздушной подушке - это артиллерийский расчет, способный пересекать океаны. Он поддерживается за счет использования жидких металлов, контролируемых магнитными полями, питаемыми компактным термоядерным реактором.

TEXT.English: The peak of stealth warfare, they wield the silent and lethal coilgun which fires a projectile through magnetic forces rather than gunpowder. The pellets they fire are even of a special material to avoid generating a sonic boom as they leave the barrel. They train by firing at a complex set of satellite targets from the ground. This is the most lethal human assassin ever to be devised. Many of them may well be equipped with bionic enhancements to steady their hands and enhance the acuity of their eyesight, perhaps even adding new forms of visual input allowing them to see units cloaked in invisibility fabrics much like they, themselves are.
TEXT.Russian: На пике стелс-войны они вооружены бесшумной и смертоносной пушкой Гаусса, стреляющей с помощью магнитных сил, а не пороха. Гранулы, которыми они стреляют, тоже сделаны из специального материала для избежания появления звукового удара, когда они покидают ствол. Они тренируются, стреляя с земли по сложному набору спутниковых целей. Это самый смертоносный убийца из когда-либо придуманных. Многие из них вполне могут быть оснащены бионическими усовершенствованиями для стабилизации рук и улучшения зрения, возможно, даже с добавлением новых форм визуального ввода, позволяющих им видеть отрядов, замаскированных невидимой тканью, так же, как они сами.

TEXT.English: In Quechua, a Native American language of South America, a wak'a is an object that represents something revered, typically a monument of some kind. The term huaca can refer to natural locations, such as immense rocks. Some huacas have been associated with veneration and ritual. Andean cultures believed every object has a physical presence and two camaquen (spirits), one to create it and another to animate it. They would invoke its spirits for the object to function
TEXT.French: En quechua, langue amérindienne d'Amérique du Sud, un wak'a est un objet qui représente quelque chose de vénéré, typiquement un monument quelconque. Le terme huaca peut également désigner des endroits naturels, comme d'immenses rochers. Certaines huacas ont été associées à la vénération et au rituel. Les cultures andines croyaient que chaque objet possède une présence physique et deux camaquen (esprits), l'un pour le créer et l'autre pour l'animer. Ils invoquaient ses esprits pour que l'objet fonctionne.

TEXT.English: The standing army of the Inca was formed primarily by nobles, but the emperor could raise an army of able-bodied men from the general populace at will. Military discipline was strictly enforced when they troops were on the march and at the range of their various projectile weapons. Once they had loosed their missiles they closed in hand-to-hand fighting. The Inca used a wide variety of weapons: wooden sword-shaped clubs, star-headed maces, slings, spears, a sophisticated halberd, and bolas. They wore cotton armor that breathed well, allowed for free movement, and dissipated the force of blows. Incan spears were sharpened lengths of wood, hardened in fire. Their halberd had a bronze-bladed axe head opposite a hook and crowned by a stabbing point allowing the huaminca a variety of arms and tactics.

The chief example of architecture is the Chavín de Huantar temple. The temple's design shows complex innovation to adapt to the highland environments of Peru. To avoid the temple's being flooded and destroyed during the rainy season, the Chavín people created a successful drainage system. Several canals built under the temple acted as drainage. The Chavín people also showed advanced acoustic understanding. During the rainy season water rushes through the canals and creates a roaring sound and creates a noise like a jaguar, a sacred animal. The temple was built of white granite and black limestone, neither of which is found near the Chavín site. This meant that leaders organized many workers to bring the special materials from far away rather than use local rock deposits.

Huitzilopochtli's name is a cognate of the Nahuatl words huitzilin, hummingbird, and opochtli, left. Aztecs believed that dead warriors were reincarnated as hummingbirds and considered the south to be the left side of the world; thus, his name meant the resuscitated warrior of the south. His other names included Xiuhpilli (Turquoise Prince) and Totec (Our Lord). Huitzilopochtli is presented as the deity who guided the long migration the Aztecs undertook from Aztlan, their traditional home, to the Valley of Mexico. During the journey his image, in the form of a hummingbird, was carried upon the shoulders of priests, and at night his voice was heard giving orders. Thus, according to Huitzilopochtli's command, Tenochtitlan, the Aztec capital, was founded in AD 1325 on a small, rocky island in the lake of the Valley of Mexico. The god's first shrine was built on the spot where priests found an eagle poised upon a rock and devouring a snake, an image so important to Mexican culture that it is portrayed on the national flag of Mexico. Successive Aztec rulers enlarged the shrine until the year Eight Reed (1487), when an impressive temple was dedicated by the emperor Ahuitzotl. Representations of Huitzilopochtli usually show him as a hummingbird or as a warrior with armour and helmet made of hummingbird feathers. In a pattern similar to that found in many hummingbirds, his legs, arms, and the lower part of his face were painted one colour (blue) and the upper half of his face was another (black). He wore an elaborate feathered headdress and brandished a round shield and a turquoise snake.
TEXT.Polish: Huitzilopochtli (nah.: "koliber z po³udnia", "koliber z lewej strony") - wed³ug wyobra¿eñ azteckich po³udnie le¿a³o po lewej stronie, zgodnie z drog¹ s³oñca od wschodu do zachodu) najwa¿niejsze bóstwo Azteków, ich plemienny bóg-opiekun. Na jego rozkaz Aztekowie, prowadz¹cy przez d³ugi czas koczowniczy tryb ¿ycia, osiedlili siê i za³o¿yli miasto Tenochtitlan. Wed³ug wierzeñ azteckich by³ bogiem wojny i s³oñca w zenicie a tak¿e uosobieniem dziennego nieba, lata i po³udnia. W mitach o stworzeniu œwiata wystêpuje jako czwarty syn Pana i Pani Dwoistoœci Ometecuhtli (Tonacatecuhtli) i Omecihuatl (Tonacacihuatl), który narodzi³ siê bez cia³a i w tej postaci istnia³ 600 lat. Rodzeñstwo jeszcze nienarodzonego Huitzilopochtli chcia³o zabiæ matkê (uwa¿ali siê za okrytych hañb¹ z uwagi na jej ci¹¿ê), jednak Huitzilopochtli narodzi³ siê uzbrojony i pokona³ wszystkich przeciwników, m.in. swoj¹ siostrê Coyolxauhqui (z³ote dzwonki), której odciêt¹ g³owê podrzuci³ w niebo stwarzaj¹c ksiê¿yc. Potrzebowa³ si³y jako bóg-s³oñce, by odbywaæ swoj¹ wêdrówkê po niebie i codziennie zwyciê¿aæ bóstwa gwiazd Centzon Huitznauna. Trzeba by³o go "karmiæ" krwi¹ ludzk¹ i jeszcze drgaj¹cymi ludzkimi sercami. W ofierze sk³adano jeñców wojennych. Dla zapewnienia sobie odpowiedniej iloœci ofiar, Aztekowie prowadzili wiosn¹ tzw. kwietne wojny. Huitzilopochtli przedstawiany by³ z pomalowanym na niebiesko cia³em i ¿ó³tymi pasami na twarzy, dobrze uzbrojony i w stroju przyozdobionym piórami kolibra. Na jego czeœæ obchodzono pod koniec roku œwiêto Panquetzaliztli (podniesienie sztandaru), podczas którego staczano ceremonialne walki a tych którzy je przegrywali sk³adano mu w ofierze.

TEXT.English: The humpback whale (Megaptera novaeangliae) is a species of baleen whale. One of the larger rorqual species, adults range in length from 12-16 metres (39-52 ft) and weigh approximately 36,000 kilograms (79,000 lb). The humpback has a distinctive body shape, with unusually long pectoral fins and a knobbly head. An acrobatic animal known for breaching and slapping the water with its tail and pectorals, it is popular with whale watchers off the coasts of Australasia and the Americas. Males produce a complex song lasting 10 to 20 minutes, which they repeat for hours at a time. Its purpose is not clear, though it may have a role in mating
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Buckelwal[COLOR_REVERT] (Megaptera novaeangliae) gehört zu den Bartenwalen und ist besonders für seinen Gesang bekannt.[NEWLINE]Mit durchschnittlich 13 Metern ist der Buckelwal vergleichsweise klein und kräftig. Die Oberseite ist schwarz, auf der Unterseite variiert die Färbung von weiß bis schwarz. Auf der Schnauze befinden sich arttypische Hautknoten und der Rest des Körpers ist oft von Seepockennarben und goldgelben Kieselalgen übersät. Buckelwale sind in allen Ozeanen anzutreffen, wobei sie sich oft in Küstennähe aufhalten. Weil sie sich im Sommer in den Polarmeeren und im Winter in den tropischen und subtropischen Gewässern aufhalten, legen die Wale bei ihren Wanderungen tausende Kilomenter zurück. Dabei erreichen sie Geschwindigkeiten von bis zu 11 km/h. Gefressen wird nur in den Sommerquartieren, wobei die Nahrung fast ausschließlich aus Krill besteht. Bei der Nahrungssuche zeigen sie ein charakteristisches Tauchverhalten: Sie bilden einen Buckel und heben die Schwanzflosse vollständig aus dem Wasser. Sie können auch akrobatische Sprünge ausführen. Der Gesang der Buckelwale ist sehr facettenreich und umfasst laut einer Studie 622 verschiedene Laute. Dabei erreichen die meist männlichen Tiere eine Lautstärke von 190 Dezibel. Forscher beobachteten weiterhin, dass Buckelwale die Jagd der Orcas stören und damit den potenziellen Opfern das Leben retten.[NEWLINE]Aufgrund seiner geringen Größe und des küstennahen Lebensraums lässt sich der Buckelwal leichter jagen als andere Großwale. Ab dem 17. Jahrhundert wurden die Tiere deshalb stark bejagt. Mittlerweile haben sich die Bestände aber erholt.

TEXT.English: The M998 High Mobility Multipurpose Wheeled Vehicle (HMMWV or Humvee) is a military 4WD motor vehicle. There are at least 17 variants of the HMMWV in service with the United States armed forces. HMMWV serve as cargo/troop carriers, automatic weapons platforms, ambulances (four litter patients or eight ambulatory patients), M220 TOW missile carriers, M119 howitzer prime movers, M-1097 Avenger Pedestal Mounted Stinger platforms, MRQ-12 direct air support vehicles, S250 shelter carriers, and in other roles. It is capable of fording 2.5 ft (76 cm) normally, or 5 ft (1.5 m) with the deep-water fording kits installed.
TEXT.Polish: Humvee to to nazwa potoczna, wywodz¹ca siê od skrótu HMMWV, czyli High Mobility Multi-Purpose Wheeled Vehicle, okreœlaj¹ca samochód terenowy opracowany dla armii Stanów Zjednoczonych przez AM General Corporation (firmê wywodz¹c¹ siê z Willis-Overland Company). PóŸniej zaczêto produkowaæ go w wersji cywilnej, a pierwszy taki egzemplarz otrzyma³ Arnold Schwarzenegger. Charakteryzuje siê sta³ym napêdem na 4 ko³a, oparciem konstrukcji na stalowej ramie, niezale¿nym zawieszeniem wszystkich kó³, du¿¹ zdolnoœci¹ do pokonywania przeszkód terenowych, wodoszczelnoœci¹ ca³ej konstrukcji. Opcjonalnie montowany jest system elektronicznej regulacji ciœnienia w oponach. W wersji wojskowej jest to auto zdolne do przewo¿enia czterech ¿o³nierzy, niewielkiego ³adunku oraz ci¹gniêcia niewielkiego dzia³a artyleryjskiego b¹dŸ przeciwlotniczego. Mo¿e byæ wyposa¿ony w 12,7 mm wielkokalibrowy karabin maszynowy Browning M2HB, granatnik automatyczny Mk 19 lub wyrzutniê ppk BGM-71 TOW. Montowany jest na obrotnicy w stropie nadwozia. Pojazd stosuje siê jako transporter piechoty, pojazd lekkiego wsparcia oraz jako sanitarkê. Pojazd HMMWV wykorzystano te¿ w systemie M1097 Avenger jako samobie¿n¹ wyrzutniê rakiet przeciwlotniczych FIM-92 Stinger.

TEXT.English: Like other Native peoples, the Huron needed siege weapons when they battled rival villages. One technique they developed was the mantlet, similar in function to those used in Roman and medieval armies. Two warriors would carry the mantlet (essentially a moveable wooden wall) to protect themselves from enemy arrow or musket fire until they reached their enemy's town walls, where the mantlet was used as a ladder to scale the walls and breach the town.
TEXT.French: Comme d'autres peuples autochtones, les Hurons avaient besoin d'armes de siège lorsqu'ils combattaient des villages rivaux. Une technique qu'ils développèrent fut le mantelet, semblable dans sa fonction à ceux utilisés par les armées romaines et médiévales. Deux guerriers portaient le mantelet (essentiellement un mur mobile en bois) pour se protéger des flèches ou des coups de mousquet ennemis jusqu'à atteindre les remparts de la ville ennemie, où le mantelet servait d'échelle pour escalader les murs et percer la ville.

TEXT.English: Within the Germanic tribes that overran the Western Roman Empire and brought in the Dark Ages, including the Goths, tribal leaders kept a personal retinue of warriors known as huskarls. These men served their chiefs fanatically in return for a large share in any plunder the tribe could grab. Huskarls trained for battle continuously and had few other duties. A chief had to be successful in acquiring plunder, however, or risk being removed or abandoned. As the Dark Ages progressed, huskarls were absorbed into the feudal system as vassals of lords. They remained a lord's or king's personal fighting force but often became responsible for their own support on lands given to them by their chief. This system replaced much of the sharing of plunder.

Huyan Zhuo is a descendant of Huyan Zan, a general who lived in the early Song dynasty. He serves in the Song imperial army as a general, just like his ancestor. He is respected for his bravery in battle and mastery of combat skills. He wields a pair of steel clubs in battle, which earns him the nickname "Double Clubs". His choice of colour is black, as evident from his flags and armour. He rides a black stallion in battle.

Hybrid Gunships are the primary heavy air transport and combat vehicle used by the future armies. A typical hybrid gunship is equipped with a 20mm M61 Vulcan turret on the front of the aircraft under the cockpit. This is fired by the gunner, while the pilot may fire a forward machine gun and launch missiles.
TEXT.French: Les avions hybrides d'attaque sont les principaux véhicules de transport aérien lourd et de combat utilisés par les armées futures. Un avion hybride typique est équipé d'une tourelle M61 Vulcan de 20 mm à l'avant de l'appareil sous le cockpit. Cette tourelle est actionnée par le tireur, tandis que le pilote peut tirer avec une mitrailleuse avant et lancer des missiles.
TEXT.Russian: Гибридные вертолеты являются основной тяжелой авиационной транспортной и боевой машиной, используемой будущими армиями. Оба типа гибридных вертолетов, версия с тяжелым четырехдвигательным двигателем и более легкая версия оснащены 20-миллиметровой турелью M61 Vulcan на передней части самолета под кабиной, стреляют из спаренных пушек, в то время как пилот может запустить передний пулемет и запустить ракеты.

TEXT.English: The invention of the wheel was a major technological innovation that gave rise to chariot warfare. At first, equines, both horses and onagers, were hitched to wheeled carts by means of a yoke around their necks in a manner similar to that of oxen. However, such a design is incompatible with equine anatomy, limiting both the strength and mobility of the animal. By the time of the Hyksos invasions of Egypt, c. 1600 BC, horses were pulling chariots with an improved harness design that made use of a breastcollar and breeching, which allowed a horse to move faster and pull more weight.

Hail, Basileu! Before you stand your Hypaspistai: the elite of the elite and your personal guard. They are armed and armored in the finest equipment of the traditional hoplite: aspis, greaves, cuirass, helmet, spear, and sword. They are the best and richest of your men; far too worthy to risk in unwise actions. And yet they are without a doubt capable of multiplying the power of your army. Forming the right wing of the battle line or leading the assault on fortifications their heavy armor and weapons allow them to stand against even the hardiest of opponents and triumph with ease. They should be deployed where the fighting will be at its absolute thickest or nearby to fight with and to protect you.[NEWLINE]Historically, the Hypaspistai (shield-bearers) first appear with Alexandros at the beginning of his reign as his elite troops and bodyguard. He used them extensively throughout his anabasis for special missions, assault of fortifications, and in support of light troops in rough terrain; however, details of the unit seem to disappear by the time Alexandros reaches India and remain as such until appearing in various sources for the three remaining Diadochoi kingdoms in different forms and perhaps briefly in Epeiros with Pyrrhos. Such examples of their deployment count them as possibly numbering a fifth of the 10,000 Argyraspides corps of the Seleukid kings or as the military police and closest guard of the Makedonian kings. Yet, despite their prowess, the Hypaspistai were either forced to evolve past the antiquated hoplite model as in the east or vanish with the fall of their kingdom as in the west.
TEXT.Italian: Storicamente gli Hypaspistai (portatori di scudi) comparvero all'inizio del regno di Alessandro Magno come truppe d'élite e guardie del corpo. Venivano usati molto in missioni speciali, assalti, fortificazioni e come supporto alle truppe leggere nei terreni più accidentati; tuttavia, scomparvero quasi del tutto quando Alessandro raggiunse l'India. Soldati simili esistevano con nomi diversi all'interno dei successivi regni ellenistici, forse anche in Epiro durante il regno di Pirro. Probabilmente costituivano circa un quinto dei 10000 Argiraspidi dei re Seleucidi, oltre alle forze di polizia e alle guardie del corpo dei re di Macedonia. Nonostante la loro forza, gli Hypaspistai furono costretti ad evolversi dall'antiquato modello di oplite o a scomparire con la caduta dei regni ellenistici.

TEXT.English: Ian Douglas Smith, GCLM, ID (8 April 1919 - 20 November 2007) was a politician, farmer and fighter pilot who served as Prime Minister of Rhodesia (or Southern Rhodesia) from 1964 to 1979.[n 1] His country's first native-born premier, he led the predominantly white government that unilaterally declared independence from the United Kingdom in 1965, following prolonged dispute over the terms. He remained Prime Minister for almost all of the 14 years of international isolation that followed, and oversaw Rhodesia's security forces during most of the Bush War, which pitted the unrecognised administration against communist-backed black nationalist guerrilla groups. Smith, who has been described as personifying white Rhodesia, remains a highly controversial figure-supporters venerate him as a man of integrity and vision "who understood the uncomfortable truths of Africa", while critics describe an unrepentant racist whose policies and actions caused the deaths of thousands and contributed to Zimbabwe's later crises.

The use of atomic bombs at Nagasaki and Hiroshima at the end of World War II changed the world's standards for measuring military power. Nuclear weapons can eradicate ground forces and armored divisions, and flatten cities with their awesome explosive power. In the years following World War II, arsenals of nuclear weapons were rapidly built by opposing nations, each fearing the capabilities of the other. This massive arms buildup has acted as a deterrent to full-scale war, since all the governments involved are aware of the consequences should such a war take place. The threat imposed by the huge nuclear arsenals of the world powers may one day be eradicated by the development of the Strategic Defense Initiative, or SDI, a system designed to destroy enemy missiles in flight before they can reach their targets.
TEXT.French: L'utilisation de bombes atomiques à Nagasaki et à Hiroshima, à la fin de la Deuxième Guerre mondiale, a modifié les standards servant à mesurer la puissance militaire d'une nation. Les armes nucléaires sont capables d'éradiquer les forces terrestres, les divisions blindées et d'anéantir des villes entières. Dans les années qui suivirent la Deuxième Guerre mondiale, des nations opposées ont constitué d'immenses stocks d'armes nucléaires, chacune craignant le potentiel de l'autre. Le but de cette course aux armements était de dissuader l'adversaire de se lancer dans une guerre totale, chaque gouvernement étant conscient des conséquences d'un tel affrontement. Les Etats-Unis travaillent aujourd'hui sur le projet Strategic Defense Initiative (SDI), un système conçu pour détruire en vol les missiles ennemis avant qu'ils n'aient atteint leurs objectifs.
TEXT.German: Die Atombombenangriffe auf Nagasaki und Hiroshima Ende des 2. Weltkrieges veränderten die bis dahin weltweit herrschenden Vorstellungen von militärischer Macht für immer. Mit ihrer verheerenden Schlagkraft können Atomwaffen nicht nur Bodentruppen und Panzerdivisionen vernichten, sondern sogar ganze Städte dem Erdboden gleichmachen. Nach dem 2. Weltkrieg rüsteten verfeindete Nationen in aller Welt ihre Atomwaffenarsenale in rasanter Geschwindigkeit auf, da jedes Land die Schlagkraft der anderen fürchtete. Dieses massive Wettrüsten hatte vor allem eine abschreckende Wirkung, denn alle beteiligten Regierungen waren sich der Folgen eines möglichen Atomkrieges durchaus bewusst. Die von den riesigen Atomwaffenarsenalen der Weltmächte ausgehende Bedrohung könnte eines Tages möglicherweise durch die Verwirklichung der strategischen Verteidigungsinitiative (kurz SDI) entschärft werden: Dieses Konzept sieht vor, dass feindliche Atomraketen noch während des Zielanflugs unschädlich gemacht werden, so dass sie ihr Ziel nicht erreichen können.
TEXT.Italian: Il bombardamento nucleare di Nagasaki e Hiroshima, alla fine della Seconda Guerra Mondiale, cambiò gli standard di valutazione del potere militare in tutto il mondo. Gli armamenti atomici possono annientare forze di terra e divisioni corazzate e distruggere intere città con il loro enorme potenziale esplosivo. Negli anni che seguirono il secondo conflitto mondiale, nazioni contrapposte costituirono degli arsenali di armamenti nucleari, nel timore di un reciproco attacco. Questi enormi arsenali sono serviti da deterrente per conflitti su vasta scala, dato che tutti i governi coinvolti sono consapevoli delle terribili conseguenze che una guerra del genere potrebbe provocare. La minaccia costituita dagli armamenti nucleari in mano ai governi del mondo potrà forse un giorno essere sradicata con lo sviluppo dell'SDI (Programma di Strategia Difensiva), un sistema progettato per distruggere i missili nemici in volo, prima che raggiungano il bersaglio.
TEXT.Spanish: El uso de bombas atómicas en Hiroshima y Nagasaki a finales de la Segunda Guerra Mundial cambió el concepto que el mundo tenía sobre el potencial bélico. Las armas nucleares, con su asombroso poder destructivo, pueden erradicar fuerzas terrestres y divisiones acorazadas, así como arrasar ciudades enteras. En los años posteriores a la Segunda Guerra Mundial, las diferentes potencias, en un ambiente de mutua desconfianza, acumularon rápidamente arsenales de armas nucleares. Esta enorme carrera armamentística ha tenido un efecto disuasorio, ya que los gobiernos involucrados son conscientes de las consecuencias que podría tener una guerra así. La amenaza derivada de los enormes arsenales nucleares de las potencias mundiales podría ser erradicada algún día gracias al desarrollo de la Iniciativa de Defensa Estratégica (o SDI), un sistema diseñado para destruir los misiles enemigos en vuelo antes de que lleguen a su objetivo.

TEXT.English: Idris Alooma (1580-1617) was mai (king) of the Kanem-Bornu Empire, located mainly in Chad and Nigeria. His name is more properly written Idris Alawma or Idris Alauma. An outstanding statesman, under his rule(1564-1596) Kanem-Bornu touched the zenith of its power.Idris is remembered for his military skills, administrative reforms, and Islamic piety. His feats are mainly known through his chronicler Ahmad bin Fartuwa.
TEXT.French: Idris Alooma (1580-1617) était mai (roi) de l'Empire Kanem-Bornu, situé principalement au Tchad et au Nigeria. Son nom s'écrit plus justement Idris Alawma ou Idris Alauma. Homme d'État exceptionnel, sous son règne (1564-1596), Kanem-Bornu atteignit le sommet de sa puissance. Idris est reconnu pour ses compétences militaires, ses réformes administratives et sa piété islamique. Ses exploits sont principalement connus grâce à son chroniqueur Ahmad bin Fartuwa.
TEXT.Polish: W³adca i król (1580-1617) imperium Kanem-Bornu zlokalizowanego na terenie Czadu i Nigerii.

TEXT.English: The Illinois Confederation, sometimes referred to as the Illiniwek or Illini, were a group of 12-13 Native American tribes in the upper Mississippi River valley of North America. The tribes were the Kaskaskia, Cahokia, Peoria, Tamaroa, Moingwena, Michigamea, Chepoussa, Chinkoa, Coiracoentanon, Espeminkia, Maroa, and Tapouara. At the time of European contact in the 17th century, they were believed to number over 10,000 people. The Illinois spoke various dialects of the Miami-Illinois language, one of the Algonquian languages family. They occupied a broad inverted triangle from modern-day Iowa to near the shores of Lake Michigan in modern Chicago south to modern Arkansas. By the mid-18th century, only five principal tribes remained-the Cahokia, Kaskaskia, Michigamea, Peoria, and Tamaroa.

Imam Shamil was an Avar political and religious leader of the Muslim tribes of the Northern Caucasus. He was a leader of anti-Russian resistance in the Caucasian War and was the third Imam of the Caucasian Imamate (1834-1859). He was a member of the Naqshbandi Sufi order.
TEXT.French: L'Imam Shamil était un chef politique et religieux avar des tribus musulmanes du Caucase du Nord. Il fut un leader de la résistance anti-russe durant la guerre du Caucase et fut le troisième imam de l'Imamat du Caucase (1834-1859). Il était membre de l'ordre soufi Naqshbandi.

TEXT.English: City must have a population of at least 10 and will lose 2 population points to train 1 immigrant. The Immigrant will add 1 population point when joined to a city having a population of less than 7. The maintenance cost of 2 gold per turn ends when the immigrant joins a city.
TEXT.French: La Ville doit avoir une population d'au moins 2, et perdra 2 de population pour entrainer un immigrant. L'Immigrant ajoute 1 de population à une ville de population inférieure à 7. Le cout d'entretien de 2 or par tour s'applique jusqu'à ce que l'immigrant a rejoint une ville.
TEXT.Russian: Город должен иметь население не менее 10 горожан и потеряет 2 жителей после обучения 1 иммигранта. Иммигрант добавит 1 жителя, когда присоединится к городу с населением менее 7 горожан. Стоимость содержания состапвляет 2 золота за ход и прекращается, когда иммигрант присоединяется к городу.

TEXT.English: An impala is a medium-sized African antelope. The name impala comes from the Zulu language meaning "gazelle". They are found in savannas and thick bushveld in Kenya, Tanzania, Swaziland, Mozambique, northern Namibia, Botswana, Zambia, Zimbabwe, southern Angola, northeastern South Africa and Uganda. Impalas can be found in numbers of up to 2 million in Africa.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Impalas[COLOR_REVERT] sind afrikanische Antilopen. Die Gattung umfasst zwei Arten: die Schwarzfersenantilope und die Schwarznasenimpala.[NEWLINE]Impalas sind in den offenen Landschaften im Süden und Osten Afrikas anzutreffen. Der Körperbau ist schlank, die Beine lang. Bei männlichen Tieren bilden sich leierartige Hörner. Auffällig ist die schwarze Fersenzeichnung. Schwarznasenimpalas haben zusätzlich einen dunklen Streifen auf der Stirn. Weibchen und Jungtiere leben in kleinen Herden, Männchen in Junggesellengruppen. Die Nahrung ist pflanzlich und besteht meist aus harten Gräsern und weichen Pflanzenteilen. Weibchen bringen in der Regel ein einzelnes Jungtier zur Welt, welches anfangs versteckt wird. Impalas sind sehr schnell, auf der Flucht können sie auch bis zu 12 m weit springen. Bei Prellsprüngen schlagen sie in der Luft mit den Hinterbeinen aus. Natürliche Feinde sind Leoparden, Geparden, Afrikanische Wildhunde und Hyänen.[NEWLINE]Trotz illegaler Bejagung und Ausweitung landwirtschaftlicher Nutzflächen gelten die Impalas insgesamt als "nicht gefährdet".
TEXT.Polish: Impala (Aepyceros melampus) - pospolity gatunek ssaka z rodziny krêtorogich, który wystêpuje w po³udniowej Afryce. D³ugoœæ cia³a od 130-180 cm, ogona od 30 do 45 cm, wysokoœæ w k³êbie 90 cm, ciê¿ar 50-65 kg. D³ugoœæ rogów samca 50-75 cm, samice nie posiadaj¹ rogów. Impala przebywa w stadach do 25 osobników, którym przewodzi samiec. W porze suchej tworz¹ siê stada licz¹ce nawet setki osobników.

TEXT.English: The Inca "Quechuas" were South American warriors who, between 1440 and 1530, conquered most of the Andes and coastlines, what would become Peru and Ecuador. These lightly armed and fast infantry were equipped with a variety of clubs and thick sticks, including: light throwing pointed sticks and a heavy, crushing mace-like weapon. Quechua were also adept at using the so-called "bola", two balls tied to a string, which they used to good effect for hunting fowl and small game [PARAGRAPH: 1] The Incas were conquered, in the middle of the 16th century by the Spaniards. Despite the extremely small number of people, the Spaniards were armed with firearms, cavalry and cannons - weapons unknown to the Incas. Unlike other original Americans, the Incas resisted the invaders, but once again the Spaniards took advantage of the tribes' mutual dislike, provoking a multitude of smaller tribes to rise up against the Inca lords.
TEXT.Polish: Inkascy "Quechua" byli po³udniowo-amerykañskimi wojownikami, którzy pomiêdzy latami 1440 a 1530 podbili wiêkszoœæ Andów i wybrze¿y, terenów dziesiejszego Peru i Ekwadoru. Ta lekko uzbrojona i szybka piechota, by³a wyposa¿ona w ró¿nego rodzaju maczugi i grube kije, w³¹czaj¹c w to: lekkie rzucane, zaostrzone kije i ciê¿k¹, mia¿d¿¹c¹ broñ, podobn¹ do maczug. Keczua byli tak¿e biegli w pos³ugiwaniu siê tzw. "bola", dwiema kulami, przywi¹zanymi do sznurka, których u¿ywali z dobry skutkiem do polowania na ptactwo i ma³¹ zwierzynê.[PARAGRAPH:1]Inkowie zostali podbici, w po³owie XVI wieku przez Hiszpanów. Mimo niezwykle ma³ej iloœci ludzi, Hiszpanie byli uzbrojeni w broñ paln¹, konnicê i dzia³a - broñ nieznan¹ przez Inków. TEXT.English: Modern infantry is given the challenging task of taking and holding terrain, which often involves dangerous,close range fighting. Organized into small squads, their strength lies in their training and equipment (rifle, grenades, helmet, and other critical gear). Often individuals in the squad are trained to be specialists, allowing them access to anti-tank weapons or light machine guns. Experienced in concealment and patrolling close to the enemy, these hard-fighting men play an important and versatile role in modern military conflict.
TEXT.French: L'infanterie moderne a pour tâche de prendre et d'occuper le terrain, ce qui implique souvent de mener de dangereux combats rapprochés. Organisée en petites escouades, sa force repose sur l'entraînement et l'équipement des soldats (fusil, grenades, casques...). Au sein d'une escouade, les soldats sont souvent spécialisés, notamment dans le maniement d'armes (armes antichars, mitrailleuses légères). Ces soldats, spécialistes de la dissimulation et du combat rapproché, jouent un rôle important dans la guerre moderne.
TEXT.German: Aufgabe der modernen Infanterie ist vor allem die Eroberung und Sicherung des eigenen Territoriums, wobei es häufig zu gefährlichen Nahkampfgefechten kommen kann. Die Infanteristen sind in kleine Einsatztrupps eingeteilt, die sich vor allem durch ihre Ausbildung und Ausrüstung (Gewehre, Granaten, Helme sowie anderes hilfreiches Gerät) auszeichnen. Oft haben einzelne Mitglieder dieser Trupps eine Spezialausbildung absolviert, durch die sie dazu befähigt sind, Panzerabwehrwaffen oder leichte Maschinengewehre zu bedienen. Wegen ihrer umfangreichen Erfahrung im Hinblick auf die erfolgreiche Täuschung feindlicher Einheiten und das Patrouillieren in deren unmittelbarer Nähe nehmen diese versierten Kämpfer in modernen Militärkonflikten eine wichtige und vielseitige Rolle ein.
TEXT.Italian: La fanteria moderna deve assolvere il difficile compito di conquistare il terreno e mantenere la posizione, manovra che spesso implica pericolosi combattimenti a distanza ravvicinata. Organizzata in piccole squadre, la forza della fanteria risiede nel suo addestramento e nel suo equipaggiamento (fucile, granate, elmetto e altri strumenti fondamentali). Spesso, alcuni individui ricevono un addestramento specialistico in modo da imparare a usare armi anticarro o mitragliatrici leggere. Esperti nel nascondersi e nell'effettuare un pattugliamento vicino al nemico, questi intrepidi uomini ricoprono un ruolo importante e versatile nei conflitti militari moderni.
TEXT.Spanish: La infantería moderna tiene asignada la complicada tarea de conquistar y defender el terreno, lo que significa que a menudo se ve envuelta en peligrosos combates cuerpo a cuerpo. Organizada en pequeños pelotones, su fuerza reside en su instrucción y equipamiento (fusil, granadas, casco y otros elementos de gran importancia). A menudo, en el seno de un pelotón hay especialistas, entrenados en el uso de armas anti-tanque o ametralladoras ligeras. Expertos en camuflaje y en operar cerca de las líneas enemigas, estas aguerridas unidades desempeñan un papel importante y versátil en la guerra moderna.

TEXT.English: Inigo Arista was a Basque leader considered the first King of Pamplona. He is thought to have risen to prominence after the defeat of local Frankish partisans in 816, and his rule is usually dated from shortly after the defeat of a Carolingian army in 824. He is first attested by chroniclers as a rebel against the Emirate of Córdoba from 840 until his death a decade later. Remembered as the nation's founder, he would be referred to as early as the 10th century by the nickname "Arista", coming either from Basque Aritza or Latin Aresta.
TEXT.Polish: Inigo Iniguez Aritza - król Nawarry 824-851 Pochodzi³ z rodu hrabiów Arista, spokrewnionych z wizygockim rodem Banu Qasi. Inigo Iniguez Aritza stan¹³ na czele buntu wymierzonego przeciwko ekspansji Franków na terenie Pirenejów i ograniczaniu suwerennoœci lokalnych plemion. W 816 roku pokona³ frankofilskiego wodza Velasco i rozpocz¹³ jednoczenie pirenejskich górali. W latach 822-824 zorganizowa³ organizm pañstwowy ze stolic¹ w Pampelunie, który sta³ siê zal¹¿kiem królestwa Nawarry. W czasie swoich rz¹dów wielokrotnie zmuszony by³ walczyæ o niezale¿noœæ. Ho³d lenny próbowali od niego wymusiæ w³adcy: Asturii, Akwitanii i Kordoby. Inigo zdo³a³ jednak odeprzeæ najazd Franków w 824 roku w Roncesvalles. Pokonany zosta³ dopiero w 842 roku przez Abd ar-Rahmana II. Najazd Maurów nie zachwia³ jednak jego panowaniem. Nawarra przetrwa³a próbê czasu i sta³a siê jednym z wa¿niejszych pañstw bior¹cych udzia³ w rekonkwiœcie.

TEXT.English: The 27th (Inniskilling) Regiment of Foot was an Irish infantry regiment of the British Army, formed in 1689 and amalgamated with the 108th (Madras Infantry) Regiment of Foot into The Royal Inniskilling Fusiliers during the Childers Reforms in 1881. The regiment was raised as local militia at Enniskillen by Colonel Zachariah Tiffin in June 1689, to fight against James II in the Williamite war in Ireland. They served successfully, most notably at the Battle of Newtownbutler, and their performance gained them a place on the English establishment in 1690 as a regular infantry regiment, as such they then fought at the Battle of the Boyne.

TEXT.English: The Inuit peoples major use of the Inuit harpoon was to hunt sea mammals located at breathing holes in the sea ice as well as in the open water. There were also times when the Inuit harpoon was used in certain arctic areas to hunt for fish as well.
TEXT.French: L'utilisation principale du harpon inuit par les peuples inuit était de chasser les mammifères marins localisés aux trous d'air dans la banquise ainsi que dans les eaux libres. Parfois, le harpon inuit était également utilisé dans certaines zones arctiques pour la pêche.

TEXT.English: The Fragrant Concubine, known as Iparhan, is a figure in Chinese legend who was taken as a consort by the Qianlong Emperor during the 17th century. Although the stories about her are believed to be mythical, they may have been based on an actual concubine from western China who entered the harem of the emperor in 1760 and who carried the court title of Rong Fei. Some people insist, however, that Imperial Consort Rong (whose original name may have been Maimur Azum) and Imperial Consort Xiang were different women. Han Chinese and Uyghur tellings of the legend of the Fragrant Concubine diverge greatly, and her experience represents a powerful symbol for both peoples. The story became greatly popular during the early 20th century and has since been adapted into several plays, films, and books. Although accounts vary as to some details, the basic story amongst Han Chinese recounts the discovery by the Qianlong Emperor of an Uyghur girl named Iparhan, granddaughter of Apak Khoja, a local leader in the oasis city of Kashgar. Even more remarkable than her beauty was the scent her body naturally produced; captivated, the Emperor sought her as an Imperial Consort for his harem. She was given as a gift to the Emperor and carefully escorted all the way to Beijing, washing every day along the road in camel's milk to preserve her mysterious fragrance. Upon her arrival to the imperial palace, the Fragrant Concubine, was gifted with a garden and a luxurious room of her own as a sign of the Emperor's devotion. Homesick and distraught, she remained disconsolate as the Emperor made ever-increasing efforts to recreate her distant village, building her a mosque, miniature oasis, and bazaar outside her windows in an effort to bring her happiness. Finally she relented and came to love him when he sent messengers to Kashgar to return with an jujube tree bearing golden fruit, and the Fragrant Concubine became the emperor's cherished consort until her death. An enduring symbol of national unity and reconciliation, her body was brought back to her home of Kashgar, where she is now entombed, in a procession of 120 bearers in a journey that took over three years. Contemporary Uyghur renditions of the legend are considerably less romantic. Stolen from her husband, a Muslim leader who had resisted the army of the Qing, and spirited away to Beijing, Iparhan arms herself with daggers up her sleeves, on guard against the hated advances of the Emperor. Some accounts cast her even more explicitly as a nationalist resistance figure who had risen during Uch Turpan Rebellion (1765) as one of the national leaders but was soon captured by Qing troops and delivered to Emperor. It was suggested that in addition to maintaining her purity Iparhan planned to kill the Emperor in revenge for his conquest of her homeland of East Turkestan (Xinjiang). The Emperor, besotted, cannot resist the allure of her beauty, and in the end his mother the Empress Dowager arranges for her murder at the hands of loyal palace eunuchs in the face of Iparhan's unyielding resistance and the threat posed to her son.
TEXT.Polish: Iparhan, to postaæ z chiñskich legend, która zosta³a zmuszona do poœlubienia cesarza Qianlong w XVII wieku. Mimo, ¿e opowieœci o niej uwa¿a siê za mityczne, mog¹ byæ wzorowane na lasoch autentycznej konkubiny z zachodnich Chin, która wesz³a do cesarskiego haremu w 1760 i która u¿ywa³a dworskiego tytu³u Rong Fei.

TEXT.English: Ironclads were the forerunners of future generations of armored naval vessels. Instead of the simple wooden hulls found on the other ships at the time, ironclads were covered with strong metal plating. This plating made them nearly impervious to large-caliber explosive shells that would easily penetrate and destroy wooden vessels. Ironclads made their first appearance during the American Civil War, and quickly gained dominance over other ships of that era. Perhaps the most famous naval battle of the Civil War was the battle between the Confederate ironclad "Merrimack", and the Union ironclad "Monitor", which lasted for several hours before the "Merrimack" was forced to withdraw.
TEXT.French: Le cuirassé à vapeur est l'ancêtre des navires blindés. Plutôt que d'avoir une simple coque en bois comme les navires de l'époque, le cuirassé à vapeur était couvert de solides plaques de métal. Celles-ci lui permettaient de résister aux obus explosifs de gros calibre qui détruisaient facilement les navires en bois. Les cuirassés à vapeur firent leur apparition au cours de la Guerre Civile américaine et prirent rapidement l'ascendant sur les autres navires de l'époque. La plus célèbre bataille navale de la Guerre Civile opposa le cuirassé confédéré, le "Merrymack", et celui de l'Union, le "Monitor." La confrontation dura plusieurs heures avant que le "Merrymack" soit forcé de se retirer.
TEXT.German: Panzerschiffe waren die Vorläufer aller späteren Stahlschiffe. Statt des einfachen hölzernen Schiffrumpfes, der bei anderen zeitgenössischen Schiffen üblicherweise vorhanden war, waren die Unterbauten der Panzerschiffe durch dicke Metallplatten geschützt. Auf diese Weise konnten selbst großkalibrige Explosivgeschosse keine Lecks in den Rumpf schlagen, wie dies bei herkömmlichen Holzkonstruktionen der Fall war. Die ersten Panzerschiffe wurden im amerikanischen Bürgerkrieg eingesetzt und gewannen schnell an Bedeutung. Das wohl berühmteste Seegefecht, das je zwischen zwei Panzerschiffen stattgefunden hat, lieferten sich die "Merrimack" aufseiten der Konföderierten und die "Monitor" aufseiten der Union: Die erbitterte Schlacht dauerte mehrere Stunden, bis die "Merrimack" schließlich den Rückzug antreten musste.
TEXT.Italian: Le corazzate furono i precursori delle future navi da guerra. Al posto dello scafo in legno, che caratterizzava le altre imbarcazioni dell'epoca, le corazzate erano ricoperte da grosse piastre di metallo. Questo accorgimento le rendeva praticamente immuni ai colpi di artiglieria, che avrebbero facilmente distrutto le navi di legno. Le corazzate fecero la loro prima comparsa durante la Guerra Civile Americana e assunsero un ruolo dominante rispetto alle altre imbarcazioni del periodo. Forse la battaglia navale più famosa della guerra di Secessione fu quella tra la fregata Merrimack dei Confederati e la Monitor dell'Unione, che durò parecchie ore, prima che la Merrimack fosse costretta a ritirarsi.
TEXT.Spanish: Estas naves fueron las precursoras de generaciones futuras de barcos de guerra blindados. En lugar de los cascos de madera característicos de los barcos de su tiempo, los buques blindados estaban revestidos de fuertes planchas de metal. Estas planchas los volvían prácticamente invulnerables a los proyectiles de gran calibre que podían agujerear y destruir los barcos de madera. Los buques blindados hicieron su primera aparición durante la Guerra de Secesión y no tardaron en descollar entre los demás barcos de su tiempo. Puede que la batalla naval más famosa de la Guerra de Secesión fuera la que enfrentó al buque blindado confederado "Merrimack" con el de la Unión, "Monitor" y que se prolongó varias horas hasta que el "Merrimack" se vio obligado a emprender la retirada.

TEXT.French: Guerrier avec gourdin en bois de fer
TEXT.Italian: Guerriero con mazza di legno ferro

TEXT.French: Le lancier en bois de fer Mapuche.
TEXT.Polish: Araukanie nigdy nie zostali ujarzmieni przez Inków ani hiszpañskich konkwistadorów, dziêki czemu ich pañstwo istnia³o obok potêgi hiszpañskiej, a póŸniej niepodleg³ego Chile a¿ do roku 1871.

TEXT.English: The first steam-powered screw frigates were built in the mid-1840s, and at the end of the decade the French Navy introduced steam power to its line of battle. The desire for change came from the ambition of Napoleon III to gain greater influence in Europe, which required a challenge to the British at sea. The introduction of the steam ship-of-the-line led to a building competition between France and Britain. By the end of the 1850s it was clear that France was unable to match British building of steam warships, and to regain the strategic initiative a dramatic change was required. The result was the first ocean-going ironclad, the La Gloire, begun in 1857 and launched in 1859. Britain's venture into iron was not in the form of an ironclad (a wooden hull armour plated) but the world's first all iron ship, (iron hull, armour plated) HMS Warrior. The Royal Navy had not been keen to sacrifice their advantage in steam ships of the line, but was determined that the first British iron ship would outmatch the French ships in every respect, particularly speed. A fast iron ship would have the advantage of being able to choose a range of engagement which could make her invulnerable to enemy fire. The British specification was more a large, powerful frigate than a ship-of-the-line. The resulting vessel was Warrior, built and launched in 1860, Britain's first iron warship. Warrior was a successful design; her weapons and armor were more effective than that of La Gloire, and with the largest set of steam engines yet fitted to a ship she could steam at 14.3 knots.
TEXT.Polish: W 1783 francuski arystokrata, markiz Claude FranCois Jouffroy d'Abbans (1751-1832), zbudowa³ ³ódŸ, której wios³a by³y napêdzane maszyn¹ parow¹. Wynalazca nazwa³ ³ódŸ Pyroscaphe (ognisty statek) i pomyœlnie przeprowadzi³ na rzece próby pierwszego parowca. Pierwszy parowiec wyp³yn¹³ w rejs w 1807 roku. Pocz¹tkowo parowce by³y doœæ niebezpieczne, gdy¿ czêsto zdarza³y siê eksplozje niewystarczaj¹co wytrzyma³ych kot³ów. Udoskonalono je w drugiej po³owie XIX wieku i wtedy rejsy parowcami sta³y siê regularne.

TEXT.English: Major-General Sir Isaac Brock KB (6 October 1769 13 October 1812) was a British Army officer and administrator. Brock was assigned to Canada in 1802. Despite facing desertions and near-mutinies, he commanded his regiment in Upper Canada (present-day Ontario) successfully for many years. He was promoted to major general, and became responsible for defending Upper Canada against the United States. While many in Canada and Britain believed war could be averted, Brock began to ready the army and militia for what was to come. When the War of 1812 broke out, the populace was prepared, and quick victories at Fort Mackinac and Detroit crippled American invasion efforts. Brock's actions, particularly his success at Detroit, earned him a knighthood, membership in the Order of the Bath, accolades and the epithet "The Hero of Upper Canada". His name is often linked with that of the Native American leader Tecumseh, although the two men collaborated in person only for a few days. Brock died at the Battle of Queenston Heights, which was nevertheless a British victory. Canadians regard Brock as one of their greatest military heroes, since he helped save the Canadian colonies when all seemed hopeless. He was even voted #28 on The Greatest Canadian television show, despite not actually being a Canadian.
TEXT.Polish: Isaac Brock (ur. 6 paŸdziernika 1769, zm. 13 paŸdziernika 1812) brytyjski genera³ i administrator, bohater narodowy Kanady. Urodzi³ siê w Saint Peter Port na wyspie Guernsey, jako ósmy syn œrednio zamo¿nej rodziny. Rozpocz¹³ karierê w armii brytyjskiej w 1785 jako chor¹¿y (ang. ensign), w wieku lat 15. W 1791 otrzyma³ stopieñ kapitana i zosta³ przeniesiony do 49 pu³ku piechoty (49th Regiment of Foot). W 1797 otrzyma³ stopieñ podpu³kownika (lieutenant colonel) i obj¹³ dowództwo nad pu³kiem. W 1799 jego pu³k bra³ udzia³ w walkach w Holandii. W 1801 pu³k Brocka mia³ wzi¹æ udzia³ w szturmie Kopenhagi, do którego jednak nie dosz³o gdy¿ bitwa o miasto zosta³a rozstrzygniêta na morzu. W 1802 Brock wraz ze swoim pu³kiem zosta³ wys³any do Kanady. W 1807 awansowa³ na genera³a brygady (brigadier general), a w 1811 na genera³a-majora (major general), po czym zosta³ wyznaczony tymczasowym gubernatorem-porucznikiem prowincji Górna Kanada. Podczas wojny brytyjsko-amerykañskiej dowodzi³ si³ami brytyjskimi broni¹cymi prowincjê i dziêki serii œmia³ych operacji zdo³a³ powstrzymaæ amerykañskie próby inwazji w pierwszym roku wojny. Zgin¹³ w zwyciêskiej bitwie pod Queenston Heights. Jego imieniem nazwany zosta³ Uniwersytet Brock w St. Catharines.

TEXT.English: Islam is a monotheistic and Abrahamic religion articulated by the Qur'an, an Islamic holy book considered by its adherents to be the verbatim word of God (Allah), and for the vast majority of adherents, also by the teachings, normative example and way of life (or sunnah); it also is composed of prophetic traditions (or hadith) of Muhammad (c. 570-8 June 632 CE), considered by most of them to be the last prophet of God. An adherent of Islam is called a Muslim (sometimes spelled Moslem).
TEXT.French: L'islam est une religion monothéiste abrahamique formulée par le Coran, un livre sacré islamique considéré par ses adeptes comme la parole verbatim de Dieu (Allah), et pour la grande majorité d'entre eux, également par les enseignements, l'exemple normatif et le mode de vie (ou sunnah) ; il est aussi composé des traditions prophétiques (ou hadith) de Mahomet (vers 570-8 juin 632 ap. J.-C.), considéré par la plupart d'entre eux comme le dernier prophète de Dieu. Un adepte de l'islam est appelé musulman (parfois orthographié Moslem).

TEXT.English: Ismail I was Shah of Iran (Persia) (1501) and the founder of the Safavid dynasty which survived until 1736. Isma'il started his campaign in Iranian Azerbaijan in 1500 as the leader of the Safaviyya, a Twelver Shia militant religious order, and unified all of Iran by 1509. Born in Ardabil, Iranian Azerbaijan, he was the king (shah) of the Safavid dynasty from 1501 to 1524.
TEXT.French: Ismail Ier fut le Shah d'Iran (Perse) (1501) et le fondateur de la dynastie safavide qui survécut jusqu'en 1736. Isma'il commença sa campagne en Azerbaïdjan iranien en 1500 en tant que chef des Safaviyya, un ordre religieux militant chiite duodécimain, et unifia toute l'Iran en 1509. Né à Ardabil, en Azerbaïdjan iranien, il fut roi (shah) de la dynastie safavide de 1501 à 1524.

TEXT.English: Isokelekel (Pohnpeian: "shining noble," "wonderful king"), also called Idzikolkol, was a semi-mythical hero warrior from Kosrae who conquered the Saudeleur Dynasty of Pohnpei, an island in the modern Federated States of Micronesia, sometime between the early 16th century and early 17th century.[note 1] Some Kosraean variants name this hero Nanparatak, with features closer to Ulithian tales of the same archetype. He is considered the father of modern Pohnpei.

Ithobaal I (or Ethbaal; Biblical Ethbaal, 1 Kings 16:31) was a king of Tyre who founded a new dynasty. During his reign, Tyre expanded its power on the mainland, making all of Phoenicia its territory as far north as Beirut, including Sidon, and even a part of the island of Cyprus. At the same time, Tyre also built new overseas colonies: Botrys (now Batrun) near Byblos, and Auza in Libya. Primary information related to Ithobaal comes from Josephuss citation of the Phoenician author Menander of Ephesus, in Against Apion i.18. Here it is said that the previous king, Phelles, was slain by Ithobalus, the priest of Astarte, who reigned thirty-two years, and lived sixty-eight years; he was succeeded by his son Badezorus (Baal-Eser II). Ithobaal held close diplomatic contacts with king Ahab of Israel. First Kings 16:31 relates that his daughter Jezebel married Ahab (874 853 BC), and Phoenician influence in Samaria and the other Israelite cities was extensive. In the 1 Kings passage, Ithobaal is labeled king of the Sidonians. At this time Tyre and Sidon were consolidated into one kingdom.
TEXT.Polish: Ethbaal I (zm. 855 p.n.e.), w³adca fenicki, król Tyru; panowa³ od 887 p.n.e. Przed wst¹pieniem na tron by³ kap³anem Astarte. Podczas jego panowania, Tyr rozszerzy³ swoje granice, jednocz¹c ca³¹ Fenicjê a¿ po Bejrut na pó³nocy, a nawet zdobywaj¹c czêœæ Cypru. W tym samym czasie za³o¿ono nowe kolonie: Botrys niedaleko Byblos i Auza w Libii. Wed³ug Biblii by³ ojcem Jezebel, ¿ony króla Izraela Achaba.

TEXT.English: Itzcoatl was a king of the Aztecs (1428-40) who strengthened the authority of the monarchy and was responsible for forging the Triple Alliance with the neighboring cities of Texcoco and Tlacopan, which made the Aztecs the dominant power of the valley of Mexico and laid the foundations for their later imperial expansion. According to the Madrid Codex, Itzcoatl ordered the burning of all historical codices because it was "not wise that all the people should know the paintings". Among other purposes, this allowed the Aztec state to develop a state-sanctioned history and mythos that venerated Huitzilopochtli.
TEXT.Polish: Itskoatl (nahuatl: w¹¿ z obsydianu) - czwarty w³adca (tlatoani) Azteków, rz¹dz¹cy w latach 1427 (albo 1428) do 1440. Stworzy³ podwaliny póŸniejszego Imperium, za jego rz¹dów Aztekowie odrzucili zwierzchnictwo Tepaneków.

TEXT.English: The Ancestral Puebloans were an ancient Native American culture that spanned the present-day Four Corners region of the United States, comprising southeastern Utah, northeastern Arizona, northwestern New Mexico, and southwestern Colorado. It is believed that the Ancestral Puebloans developed, at least in part, from the Oshara Tradition, who developed from the Picosa culture. They lived in a range of structures that included small family pit houses, larger clan type structures, grand pueblos, and cliff sited dwellings. The Ancestral Puebloans possessed a complex network that stretched across the Colorado Plateau linking hundreds of communities and population centers. They held a distinct knowledge of celestial sciences that found form in their architecture. The Kiva, a congregational space that was used for ceremonial purposes chiefly, were an integral part of this ancient peoples community structure.

Ivan IV, known as Ivan the Terrible, was the Grand Prince of Moscow, the Czar of Russia from 1547 until his death in 1584. Contrary to popular belief, the epithet "Grozny" (terrible) is associated with might, power and strictness, rather than poor performance, horror or cruelty. Some authors more accurately translate it into modern English as Ivan the Awesome. Ivan was intelligent, devout, and impulsive; given to rages, and according to the suspicions of some, probably had episodic outbreaks of mental illness. One notable outburst resulted in the death of his groomed and chosen heir Ivan Ivanovich resulting in the passing of the Tsardom to a less than ideal younger son the mentally retarded Feodor I of Russia. His long reign saw the conquest of the Khanates of Kazan, Astrakhan, and Siberia, transforming Russia into a multiethnic and multiconfessional state spanning almost 1 billion acres.
TEXT.Polish: Iwan IV wst¹pi³ na tron w wieku 16 lat. W 1555 r. przeprowadzi³ gruntown¹ reformê systemu prawnego pañstwa i usprawni³ jego administracjê. Ofiarami tej reformy byli bojarzy, którzy zostali wysiedleni na wyznaczone tereny zwane ziemszczyzn¹ i przeœladowani. Prowadzi³ niezwykle agresywn¹ politykê wobec swoich s¹siadów. Za jego panowania Rosja zdoby³a Kazañ, Astrachañ i zachodni¹ Syberiê, doprowadzi³ te¿ do nawi¹zania kontaktów handlowych z Angli¹. Uderzy³ te¿ na pañstwo zakonu kawalerów mieczowych w Inflantach zdobywaj¹c w 1558 roku Dorpat i Narwê, rozpoczynaj¹c wojny inflanckie. Kontynuowa³ ekspansjê Rosji na wschodnie ziemie Wielkiego Ksiêstwa Litewskiego. W czasie wojny litewsko-rosyjskiej 1558-1570 zdoby³ w 1563 roku Po³ock, rozkazuj¹c utopiæ w DŸwinie wszystkich tamtejszych ¯ydów. W 1582 roku zawar³ rozejm w Jamie Zapolskim z królem Polski, Stefanem Batorym, koñcz¹cy wojnê o Inflanty toczon¹ z pañstwem polsko-litewskim. Iwan IV zas³yn¹³ jako cz³owiek okrutny. Pocz¹wszy od 1560 roku z jego polecenia stracono tysi¹ce ludzi, w 1581 roku w napadzie sza³u zamordowa³ drugiego syna, Iwana. Czynami tymi zapracowa³ na przydomek "GroŸny". Po œmierci Iwana IV tron obj¹³ jego trzeci syn, Fiodor I. Iwan IV by³ w³adc¹ o rozleg³ych zainteresowaniach intelektualnych. Siêga³ po pióro, i to nie tylko gwoli polemik ze swymi przeciwnikami, skoro przypisuje siê mu autorstwo utworów liturgicznych i udzia³ w redagowaniu kronik. Car popiera³ rozwój sztuki, zw³aszcza architektury i malarstwa. W okresie jego rz¹dów pojawi³ siê w Rosji druk. By³ siedmiokrotnie ¿onaty; trzy z jego ¿on zmar³y za jego ¿ycia, z trzema siê rozwiód³, ostatnia, Maria Nagoj, prze¿y³a go. Iwan IV doprowadzi³ swoj¹ represyjn¹ polityk¹ do politycznego i gospodarczego kryzysu pañstwa. W 1565 roku wprowadzi³ opriczninê, czyli carsk¹ policjê, odpowiedzialn¹ za liczne masakry ludnoœci i rabunki; zlikwidowa³ j¹ w 1572 roku widz¹c, ¿e wymknê³a mu siê spod kontroli. Rezultatem dzia³ania opriczniny by³a œmieræ ok. 100 tys. ludzi. Do jego niew¹tpliwych zas³ug nale¿¹ reforma armii na wzór zachodni i utworzenie zbioru praw, tzw. Carski Sudiebnik. Zmar³ w 1584 roku podczas rozgrywania partii szachów, co zosta³o udokumentowane przez przebywaj¹cego wówczas w Moskwie pos³a angielskiego.
TEXT.Russian: Иван IV, известный как Иван Грозный, был великим князем московским, царем всея Руси с 1547 года до своей смерти в 1584 году. Вопреки распространенному мнению, эпитет «Грозный» (страшный) связан с мощью, силой и строгостью, а не с самодурством, ужасом или жестокостью. Некоторые авторы более точно переводят его на современный английский как «Иван Великолепный». Иван был умным, набожным и в то же время крайне импульсивным; приведенный в ярость, и согласно некоторым догадкам, вероятно, имел эпизодические вспышки психического заболевания. Одна заметная вспышка привела к гибели его любимца и избранного им наследника Ивана Ивановича, что привело к передаче Царства менее способному младшему сыну - умственно отсталому Федору I в России. Его долгое правление привело к завоеванию Казанских, Астраханских и Сибирских ханств, превратив Россию в многонациональное и многоконфессиональное государство, охватывающее почти 1 млрд. акров.

TEXT.English: The Jungle Warfare Special Operations Iwia Battalion No. 60, recruited from local warrior tribes like the Shuar, Zaparo, Kichwa and Achuar.
TEXT.French: Le Bataillon des opérations spéciales de guerre en jungle Iwia n° 60, recruté parmi des tribus guerrières locales telles que les Shuar, Zaparo, Kichwa et Achuar.

TEXT.English: The Capayanes were an indigenous people nowadays extinct that lived in Argentine territory. The etymology of the name started to this people seems to be the word rune simi Kapak ñan (Great way), that is to say usually so called " Way of the Inca ", the explanation for this would be in that the territory that they were living age sedates of a knot of communications very importantly in the south of the Tawantinsuyu. The majority of the authors considers the capayan due to the cultural common features (for example the use of the language kakan) as one of the parts of the pazioca ("diaguitas"), in the same way that it were the calchaquíes, olongastas, quilmes, though they would have differed for the genetic and cultural influence of the neighbors huarpes and after 1480 for the presence of Mitmakuna deported persons up to the region for the Incas, many of such mitimaes would have trade and manufacture of alcoholic maize drink and churumata.
Jacob Kettler was a Baltic German Duke of the Duchy of Courland and Semigallia (1642-1682). Under his rule, the duchy was brought to its greatest peak in wealth and engaged in colonization.
TEXT.French: Jacob Kettler était un duc balto-allemand du duché de Courlande et Semigallia (1642-1682). Sous son règne, le duché atteignit son plus grand apogée de richesse et s'engagea dans la colonisation.

TEXT.English: The so-called Liangzhu culture of ancient China used their skill at crafting the local jade, so as to make their axemen peerless among their rivals.
TEXT.French: La culture dite Liangzhu de la Chine ancienne utilisait son savoir-faire dans le travail du jade local afin de rendre ses bûcherons inégalés face à leurs rivaux.

TEXT.English: The Jadids were Muslim modernist reformers within the Russian Empire in the late 19th and early 20th century. They normally referred to themselves by the Turkic terms Taraqqiparvarlar ('progressives'), Ziyalilar ('intellectuals'), or simply Yäslär/Yoshlar ('youth'). Jadids maintained that Muslims in the Russian Empire had entered a period of decay that could only be rectified by the acquisition of a new kind of knowledge and modernist, European-modeled cultural reform. Although there were substantial ideological differences within the movement, Jadids were marked by their widespread use of print media in promoting their messages and advocacy of the usul ul-jadid or "new method" of teaching in the maktabs of the empire, from which the term Jadidism is derived. A leading figure in the efforts to reform education was the Crimean Tatar Ismail Gasprinski who lived from 1851-1914. Intellectuals such as Mahmud Khoja (author of the famous play "The Patricide" and founder of one of Turkestan's first Jadid schools) carried Gaspirali's ideas back to Central Asia.

Jadwiga was a queen of Poland (138499) whose marriage to Jogaila, grand duke of Lithuania (Wladyslaw II Jagiello of Poland), founded the centuries-long union of Lithuania and Poland. Jadwiga was the daughter of Louis I, king of both Hungary and Poland, and Elizabeth of Poland. After Louis died on September 11, 1382, his elder daughter, Maria, was elected queen of Hungary, but the Poles opted to end the personal union between the two countries by choosing Jadwiga as their queen, though she was then but a child of nine years. On October 15, 1384, she was crowned rex (king) of Poland. The Polish magnates further promoted her marriage to Jogaila in order to produce a union of territories larger than the former one with Hungary, and this new entity altered the balance of power in central Europe. The marriage also opened the way to the Christian conversion of the largely pagan Lithuanians. Jogaila was baptized in Krakw on February 15, 1386, married to Jadwiga on February 18, and crowned on March 4. While Jadwiga lived, however, she and her husband ruled jointly, with Jadwiga remaining the leading personality in the realm. She died in childbirth and without heir; her husband was then able to assert his authority in Poland. A patron of religion and scholarship, Jadwiga sought to promote the religious development of the nations that she had united, founded a special college for Lithuanians in Prague, and financed the restoration of the university at Krakw, which was effected after her death and later named the Jagiellonian University. Chiefly Jadwiga's work, the university was modeled after the University of Paris and became the centre of Polish civilization and influence. Jadwiga was canonized by Pope John Paul II in Krakw on June 8, 1997. Many legends surrounding her are known, and she was said to have been a very generous and able leader.
TEXT.Polish: Jadwiga Andegaweñska (1374 - 1399) by³a trzeci¹ z kolei córk¹ wêgierskiego króla Ludwika Wielkiego i El¿biety Boœniaczki. Mimo ¿e potocznie mówimy o niej "królowa", formalnie tytu³ ten przys³ugiwa³ ¿onie króla i nie niós³ ze sob¹ ¿adnych praw do sprawowania rz¹dów w pañstwie.
