Warunkiem zawarcia ma³¿eñstwa mia³ byæ chrzest Litwina i w³¹czenie jego ksiêstwa do Królestwa Polskiego. Jagie³³o, który po chrzcie przyj¹³ imiê W³adys³awa, zobowi¹za³ siê tak¿e d¹¿yæ do odzyskania utraconego przez Polskê Pomorza. W roku 1386 roku dosz³o do planowanego ma³¿eñstwa i od tego czasu oboje ma³¿onkowie zasiadali na po³¹czonych tronach Polski i Litwy, wspólnie podejmuj¹c dotycz¹ce kraju decyzje. Jadwiga bowiem, nawet po œlubie bra³a czynny udzia³ w ¿yciu politycznym: doprowadzi³a do zgody Jagie³³y i jego zbuntowanego brata Witolda, przejê³a prowadzenie korespondencji z okupuj¹cymi Pomorze Krzy¿akami, poprowadzi³a wyprawê na Ruœ Halick¹. Polska królowa utrzymywa³a tak¿e w³asny, niezale¿ny od mê¿a dwór, otaczaj¹c siê jako osoba gruntownie wykszta³cona i niezwykle pobo¿na uczonymi zarówno œwieckim jak i duchownymi. Przyczyni³a siê tak¿e, z pomoc¹ Jagie³³y, do restauracji podupadaj¹cego Uniwersytetu Jagielloñskiego, oddaj¹c na ten cel wszystkie swoje klejnoty i kosztownoœci. Zas³ynê³a równie¿ jako fundatorka wielu koœcio³ów, o³tarzy oraz kolegium psa³terzystów przy Katedrze na królewskim zamku - Wawelu. Sama by³a posiadaczk¹ spisanego specjalnie dla niej "Psa³terza Floriañskiego", który jest jednym z pierwszych znanych zabytków piœmiennictwa polskiego. Jadwiga zmar³a w roku 1399 podczas porodu. Mia³a wówczas zaledwie dwadzieœcia piêæ lat, a mimo to zapisa³a siê w historii Polski jako dobra w³adczyni. Mimo ¿e dopiero w roku 1986 zosta³a beatyfikowana w 1997 og³oszona przez papie¿a Jana Paw³a II œwiêt¹, jej osoba ju¿ przez jej wspó³czesnych otaczana by³a szczególn¹ czci¹. Wedle legendy tu¿ przed zgonem przemówi³a do niej figura Chrystusa umieszczona na ufundowanym przez ni¹ o³tarzu bocznym w Katedrze Wawelskiej.

TEXT.English: Orang Asli kept to themselves until the first traders from India arrived in the first millennium AD. Living in the interior they bartered inland products like resins, incense woods and feathers for salt, cloth and iron tools. The rise of the Malay sultanates, coinciding with trade in Orang Asli slaves, forced the group to retreat further inland to avoid contact with outsiders. The arrival of British colonists brought further inroads in the lives of Orang Asli. They were targeted by Christian missionaries and became subjects of anthropological research.

Jaipongan, also known as Jaipong, is a popular traditional dance of Sundanese people, West Java, Indonesia. The dance was created by Gugum Gumbira, based on traditional Sundanese Ketuk Tilu music and Pencak Silat movements.
TEXT.French: Le Jaipongan, également appelé Jaipong, est une danse traditionnelle populaire du peuple soundanais en Java occidental, Indonésie. Cette danse a été créée par Gugum Gumbira, basée sur la musique traditionnelle soundanaise Ketuk Tilu et les mouvements de Pencak Silat.

TEXT.English: Sir James Brooke, Rajah[note] of Sarawak, KCB (29 April 1803 - 11 June 1868), was a British adventurer whose exploits in the Malay Archipelago made him the first White Rajah of Sarawak. Born in India and briefly educated in England, he served in the Bengal Army, was wounded, and resigned his commission. He bought a ship and sailed out to the Malay Archipelago, where by helping to crush a rebellion, he became governor of Sarawak. He then vigorously suppressed piracy in the region, and in the ensuing turmoil, restored the Sultan of Brunei to his throne, for which the Sultan made Brooke the Rajah of Sarawak. He ruled until his death.

James I the Conqueror was King of Aragon, Count of Barcelona, and Lord of Montpellier from 1213 to 1276; King of Majorca from 1231 to 1276; and Valencia from 1238 to 1276. His long reign saw the expansion of the House of Aragon in three directions: Languedoc to the north, the Balearic Islands to the south, and Valencia to the southwest. By a treaty with Louis IX of France, he wrested the county of Barcelona from nominal French suzerainty and integrated it into his crown. His part in the Reconquista was similar in Mediterranean Spain to that of his contemporary Ferdinand III of Castile in Andalusia.

Jan Frans Willems (11 March 1793 - 24 June 1846), Flemish writer and father of the Flemish movement. Willems was born in the Belgian city of Boechout, while that was under French occupation. He started his career in the office of a notary in Antwerp. He devoted his leisure to literature, and in 1810 he gained a prize for poetry with an ode in celebration of the peace of Tilsit. He hailed with enthusiasm the foundation of the United Kingdom of the Netherlands, and the revival of Flemish literature; and he published a number of spirited and eloquent writings in support of the claims of the native tongue of the Netherlands.

Similar to the European knights, Japanese samurai were landowners who volunteered military service in exchange for a larger warlord's protection. Their handsome lacquer armor gave them durable protection on the battlefield. The warrior code of "Bushido" placed exacting restrictions on their behavior, both on the field of battle and off. One such tenet was that samurai of opposing forces must seek each other out and battle one on one. While their armor provided some safety from early gunpowder weapons, soon more advanced weaponry and skilled marksmen relegated them to administrative and leadership roles. The samurai caste was abolished in 1868.
TEXT.French: Equivalent des chevaliers européens, les samouraïs japonais étaient des nobles guerriers qui se mettaient volontairement au service d'un seigneur contre sa protection. Leurs superbes armures laquées leur offraient une bonne protection sur le champ de bataille. Ces guerriers s'astreignaient à des règles de comportement très strictes, sur et hors du champ de bataille, règles définies par le "Bushidô," le code de leur caste. Ainsi, lors des batailles, les samouraïs devaient se battre entre eux en duel. Si leurs armures les protégeaient convenablement des tirs des premières armes à feu, l'apparition d'armes plus performantes et de tireurs d'élite les relégua rapidement à des tâches administratives ou de direction. La caste des samouraïs fut abolie en 1868.
TEXT.German: Ähnlich wie die Ritter in Europa waren die japanischen Samurai im Wesentlichen Grundbesitzer, die im Austausch für die Gewährung umfangreicherer Protektion seitens ihrer Lehnsherren freiwillig ihre militärischen Dienste zur Verfügung stellten. Ihre kleidsame Lackrüstung bot ihnen auf dem Schlachtfeld guten Schutz. Die Samurai hielten sich an den strengen Ehrenkodex des "Bushido", der sowohl ihr Verhalten im Kampf als auch im Privatleben klar regelte. Eine der hierin enthaltenen Vorschriften besagt, dass sich feindlich gegenüberstehende Samurai stets herausfordern und grundsätzlich Mann gegen Mann bekämpfen müssen. Ihre Rüstung bot zwar einen gewissen Schutz gegen die ersten Schusswaffen, doch fortgeschrittene Waffentechnik und fähige Schützen drängten sie in Verwaltungs- und Führungsrollen zurück. Im Jahre 1868 wurde die Kaste der Samurai abgeschafft.
TEXT.Italian: Simili ai cavalieri europei, i samurai Giapponesi erano dei proprietari terrieri che fornivano volontariato militare in cambio di protezione dei grandi signori della guerra. Grazie alla loro bellissima armatura laccata, erano molto resistenti sul campo di battaglia. Il codice del guerriero, il "Bushido", imponeva ai samurai un comportamento integerrimo in combattimento e nella vita di tutti i giorni. Una regola fondamentale era che in combattimento i samurai dovevano affrontarsi uno contro uno. Inizialmente, le loro armature riuscivano a proteggere i samurai dalle prime armi da fuoco, ma ben presto l'avvento di armi più potenti e di tiratori scelti li relegò a ruoli amministrativi e di comando. La casta dei samurai venne abolita nel 1868.
TEXT.Spanish: Similares a los caballeros europeos, los samuráis japoneses eran terratenientes que se presentaban voluntariamente al servicio militar a cambio de la protección de un señor más poderoso. Sus bellas armaduras lacadas les daban una protección duradera en el campo de batalla. El código del ?bushido? del guerrero sometía su comportamiento a unas rígidas reglas, tanto dentro como fuera del campo de batalla. Una de ellas era que los samuráis de los ejércitos enfrentados debían buscarse los unos a los otros y combatir individualmente. Aunque su armadura les daba cierta protección ante las primeras armas de pólvora, los avances en armamento y la mejora en la puntería de los tiradores pronto les relegó a tareas administrativas y de liderato. La casta samurái fue abolida en el año 1868.

TEXT.English: Mohammed Yasser Abdel Rahman Abdel Raouf Arafat al-Qudwa was a Palestinian leader. He was Chairman of the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO), President of the Palestinian National Authority (PNA), and leader of the Fatah political party and former paramilitary group, which he founded in 1959. Originally opposed to Israel's existence, he modified his position in 1988 when he accepted UN Security Council Resolution 242. Arafat and his movement operated from several Arab countries. In the late 1960s and early 1970s, Fatah faced off with Jordan in a brief civil war. Forced out of Jordan and into Lebanon, Arafat and Fatah were major targets of Israel's 1978 and 1982 invasions of that country.

A javelin is a light spear designed primarily to be thrown, historically as a ranged weapon, but today predominantly for sport. The javelin is almost always thrown by hand, unlike the bow and arrow and slingshot, which shoot projectiles from a mechanism. However, hurling devices do exist to assist the javelin thrower in achieving greater distance. The word javeline comes from Middle English and it derives from Old French javelin, a diminutive of javelot, which meant spear. The word javelot probably originated from one of the Celtic languages.

Jayavarman II was the founder of the Khmer, or Cambodian, empire and outstanding member of the series of rulers of the Angkor period (8021431). Among Jayavarman II's accomplishments were the deification of the Cambodian monarchy, the establishment of the devaraja cult as the official state religion, and the reunification of the old kingdom of Chenla, which he expanded and formed into the Khmer empire. Possibly of Khmer descent, Jayavarman II came from Java, where he had been in captivity or exile, to succeed to the throne as Java's vassal around 800. An unwilling puppet, he defied the Javanese and asserted Khmer independence in 802, when he also was installed under Hindu rites as devaraja, or god-king. He established a series of capitals, first at Indrapura, on the lower Mekong River east of Kmpng (Kompong) Cham; then, moving northwards, at Hariharalaya, southeast of present-day Siemrab (Siem Reap); and then at Mahendraparvata, in the region just north of the Tonle Sap (Great Lake), not far from Angkor, the next seat of the Khmer empire, which remained its capital for 600 years.
TEXT.Polish: D¿ajawarman II (ok. 770 - 850)- za³o¿yciel królestwa Angkoru (pañstwo Khmerów) w Kambod¿y, panuj¹cy w latach 802 - 850. Odpar³ atak Czamów i zjednoczy³ pañstwa Czenli. Wszyscy póŸniejsi w³adcy Angkoru swoje prawa do tronu uzasadniali pochodzeniem od D¿ajawarma II, jednak w praktyce owa zasada nie by³a przestrzegana. W niektórych przypadkach dla udowodnienia ci¹g³oœci dynastycznej wystarcza³o przejêcie haremu po zmar³ym lub usuniêtym w³adcy. Wybudowa³ now¹ stolicê, która otrzyma³a nazwê Hariharalaja (stara nazywa³a siê Indrapura). Po rozszerzeniu granic królestwa za³o¿y³ kolejn¹ w Amendrapurze. Ustanowi³ kult dewarad¿y (króla-boga) wznosz¹c w 820 r. jego oœrodek w mieœcie Mahendra, na wzgórzu Phnom Kulen. Przyj¹³ tytu³ maharad¿y (w³adcy wszechœwiata) wypowiadaj¹c tym samym pos³uszeñstwo królowi Jawy i po³o¿enie kresu wasalnej zale¿noœci Kambod¿y. Zmar³ w Hariharalajanie (dzisiejszy Roluos) w 850 r.

TEXT.English: Jayavarman VII was a ruler of the Khmer (Cambodian) empire of Angkor (r. 1181 1215). Born into the royal family of Angkor, he settled in the Champa kingdom (present-day central Vietnam) in his young adulthood and engaged in military campaigns. In his late fifties he led his people in a struggle for independence after their subjugation by the Cham. He was crowned king of a reconstituted Khmer empire at 61. He ruled more than 30 years and brought the empire to its zenith in terms both of territorial extent and of royal architecture and construction. Champa, southern Laos, and portions of the Malay Peninsula and Myanmar (Burma) came under his control. He built temples, hospitals, and rest houses, and rebuilt the city of Angkor (now called Angkor Thom). His dedication to both the spiritual and physical needs of the people has made him a national hero to modern Cambodians.
TEXT.Polish: D¿ajawarman VII król Kambod¿y z dynastii angkorskiej panuj¹cy w latach 1181-1218, ostatni z tzw. "królów-budowniczych". Za jego panowania kraj dokona³ najwiêkszej ekspansji terytorialnej. W sk³ad Kambod¿y, poza terenami Khmerów, wesz³a ca³a Czampa, ziemie dzisiejszego Laosu i Tajlandii, czêœæ Pó³wyspu Malajskiego, a¿ po przesmyk Kra oraz Birma. Wybudowa³ now¹ stolicê, Angkor Thom (poprzedni¹ Jaszodharapurê, zrujnowa³a inwazja Czamów), która w okresie œwietnoœci liczy³a ok. 1 mln mieszkañców. Kaza³ wybudowaæ tak¿e wiele œwi¹tyñ: Bajon, Banteai Kdei, Ta Prohm, Preah Khan, Neak Pean i inne. Za jego panowania nast¹pi³ wielki rozkwit nie tylko architektury, ale tak¿e sztuki, rzeŸby, poezji i nauki, a buddyzm sta³ siê religi¹ dominuj¹c¹. Przedstawiany na p³askorzeŸbach jako oty³y mê¿czyzna z w³osami zwi¹zanymi w kok na czubku g³owy.

TEXT.English: The first jeep prototype (the Bantam BRC) was built for the Department of the Army by American Bantam in Butler, Pennsylvania, followed by two other competing prototypes produced by Ford and Willys-Overland. The American Bantam Car Company actually built and designed the vehicle that first met the Army's criteria, but its engine did not meet the Army's torque requirements. Plus, the Army felt that the company was too small to supply the number needed and it allowed Willys and Ford to make second attempts on their designs after seeing Bantam's vehicle in action. Quantities (1,500) of each of the three models were then extensively field tested. During the bidding process for 16,000 "jeeps," Willys-Overland offered the lowest bid and won the initial contract. Willys thus designed what would become the standardized jeep.
TEXT.Polish: Historia zaczyna siê od wojskowych samochodów terenowych modeli Willys MA i MB (produkowanego na licencji tak¿e jako Ford GPW), nazywanych powszechnie "jeep". Nazwa ta by³a uto¿samiana przez firmê Willys ze swoim produktem, jednak¿e w 1948 roku Komisja Handlu zakaza³a Willysowi twierdziæ, ¿e jest twórc¹ jeepa - za którego uznano firmê Bantam. Mimo to, w 1950 roku Willys zastrzeg³ nazwê Jeep jako markê. W ten sposób rozpoczê³a siê jego kariera w "cywilu". Jednak pierwszy model cywilny, pojawi³ siê jeszcze w 1945 roku. By³ to Jeep CJ2A (CJ - Civilian Jeep).

TEXT.English: The introduction of jet engines to fighter aircraft changed the way man wages war in the skies. The primary impact was that of speed, since even early jet engines were able to outperform their rotary peers by three to one. While this improvement was certainly appreciated by their pilots (speed advantages often translate to more options in air combat), it was some time before the nature of this change was fully understood. Dogfighting became a significantly more difficult task, since the window to 'take a shot' was reduced to an instant. The introduction of guided missiles helped address this, as well as increase engagement ranges to beyond what the pilot could visually see. Though missiles dramatically changed air combat, cannons still remained a staple of the vehicles' arsenal. Missiles could be jammed, and early attempts were fraught with unreliability. Without a backup weapon, pilots were often at the mercy of inferior planes, but ones where the pilot wasn't relying on shaky, emerging technologies.
TEXT.French: La découverte des moteurs à réaction modifia profondément la manière de mener une guerre aérienne. Le principal changement concernait la vitesse : même les premiers modèles d'avions à réaction allaient trois fois plus vite que leurs homologues à hélices. Si cette révolution fut certainement appréciée dans un premier temps par les pilotes (en combat aérien, l'avantage de la vitesse multiplie les options), ils réalisèrent également la nature profonde du changement. Le combat entre chasseurs était devenu plus difficile, les "fenêtres de tir" étant extrêmement courtes. Le problème fut résolu avec l'apparition des missiles guidés, qui permirent en outre d'augmenter la portée des combats aériens au-delà du champ de vision des pilotes. Bien que les missiles aient révolutionné le combat aérien, le canon est resté un élément fondamental de l'arsenal des chasseurs. Un missile pouvait être brouillé ou présenter un défaut de fonctionnement. Sans leurs armes secondaires, les pilotes se retrouvaient fréquemment à la merci d'avions moins puissants, dont le fonctionnement ne reposait pas entièrement sur des technologies encore émergentes.
TEXT.German: Die Einführung des Düsenantriebs für Jagdflugzeuge kennzeichnete einen bedeutenden Wendepunkt in der Geschichte des Luftkampfes. Die wichtigste Rolle spielte dabei die Geschwindigkeit, denn schon die ersten Düsenantriebe waren dreimal so leistungsfähig wie ihre Rotorkollegen. Diese Verbesserung wurde von den Piloten zweifellos begrüßt (Geschwindigkeitsvorteile brachten häufig auch neue Luftkampfoptionen mit sich), dennoch sollte es noch eine Weile dauern, bis man tatsächlich die ganze Tragweite dieser Neuerung erfasste. Luftkämpfe waren erheblich schwieriger geworden, da sich das Zeitfenster für einen Schuss auf einen kurzen Augenblick reduziert hatte. Die Einführung der Lenkraketen half bei der Lösung dieses Problems und erhöhte auch die Kampfreichweite über das reelle Sichtfeld des Piloten hinaus. Doch obwohl Raketen den Luftkampf maßgeblich veränderten, blieben die Bordkanonen ein wichtiger Bestandteil im Waffenarsenal der Flugzeuge, da die Raketen ohne weiteres auch blockieren konnten - und die ersten Versuche auf diesem Gebiet demonstrierten die Unzuverlässigkeit der Abschusssysteme zur Genüge. Ohne Ersatzwaffe waren die Kampfflieger oft unterlegenen Flugzeugen wehrlos ausgeliefert, deren Piloten nicht auf instabile, unausgereifte Technologien angewiesen waren.
TEXT.Italian: L'introduzione dei motori a reazione nei caccia ha cambiato il modo di affrontare la guerra nei cieli. La caratteristica principale risiede nella velocità, dal momento che perfino i primi motori a reazione erano in grado di superare quelli tradizionali con un rapporto di tre a uno. Questo miglioramento è stato sicuramente apprezzato dai piloti (i vantaggi nella velocità si traducono spesso in ulteriori opzioni nel combattimento aereo), ma c'è voluto del tempo prima che venisse compresa appieno la natura di questo combattimento. Lo scontro nei cieli è diventato sensibilmente più difficile, poiché il tempo per aprire il fuoco con successo si è ridotto a un istante. L'introduzione dei missili guidati ha risolto il problema, come pure l'aumento della portata d'attacco al di là del limite visivo dei piloti. I missili hanno cambiato radicalmente il combattimento aereo, ma i cannoni sono rimasti comunque un elemento fondamentale nell'arsenale dei velivoli: i missili potevano essere ingannati dalle interferenze e i primi modelli erano inaffidabili. Senza un'arma di supporto, i piloti erano spesso alla mercé di aerei inferiori, ma che non si affidavano a tecnologie nascenti e poco collaudate.
TEXT.Spanish: La instalación de motores a reacción en los cazas cambió el modo en que el hombre combatía en los cielos. El cambio más evidente fue el de la velocidad, ya que incluso los motores a reacción más primitivos triplicaban la efectividad de sus equivalentes de hélice. Aunque es indudable que esta mejora fue apreciada por los pilotos (la velocidad superior suele traducirse en ventajas tácticas), hubo de pasar algún tiempo para que se entendiera del todo la naturaleza de este cambio. La dificultad de los duelos aéreos aumentó notablemente, ya que la oportunidad para disparar al enemigo quedó reducida a un instante. La aparición de los misiles guiados supuso una gran ayuda, además de incrementar el alcance de los enfrentamientos más allá del campo visual de los pilotos. Aunque los misiles supusieron un cambio dramático en el combate aéreo, las ametralladoras siguieron formando parte fundamental del arsenal de los aviones. Los misiles pueden ser interferidos electrónicamente, y los primeros modelos adolecían de una falta de fiabilidad terrible. Sin un arma de reserva, los pilotos solían quedar a merced de aviones de inferior calidad pero cuyos pilotos no dependían por entero de tecnologías incipientes y poco fiables.

TEXT.English: The Jet Engine introduced wild new speeds and aeronautic design factors that require a new breed of technician to design and repair these craft.
TEXT.French: Le moteur à réaction a introduit des vitesses folles et des facteurs de conception aéronautique nécessitant une nouvelle génération de techniciens pour concevoir et réparer ces appareils.
TEXT.Polish: Pierwszy nowoczesny silnik turboodrzutowy opatentowa³ w 1930 roku Anglik Frank Whittle. 27 sierpnia 1939 odby³ swój pierwszy lot Heinkel He 178, pierwszy samolot z silnikiem turboodrzutowym.

TEXT.English: In Judaism, a rabbi is a teacher of Torah. The word "master" literally means "great one". The basic form of the rabbi developed in the Pharisaic and Talmudic era, when learned teachers assembled to codify Judaism's written and oral laws. In more recent centuries, the duties of the rabbi became increasingly influenced by the duties of the Protestant Christian minister, hence the title "pulpit rabbis", and in 19th-century Germany and the United States rabbinic activities including sermons, pastoral counselling, and representing the community to the outside, all increased in importance.

Emperor Jimmu was the first Emperor of Japan, according to legend. His accession is traditionally dated as 660 BCE. According to Japanese mythology, he is a descendant of the sun goddess Amaterasu, through her grandson Ninigi, as well as a descendant of the storm god Susanoo. He launched a military expedition from Hyuga near the Inland Sea, captured Yamato, and established this as his center of power. In modern Japan, Jimmu's accession is marked as National Foundation Day on February 11.
TEXT.French: Selon la légende, l'empereur Jimmu fut le premier empereur du Japon. Son accession est traditionnellement datée de 660 av. J.-C. Selon la mythologie japonaise, il est descendant de la déesse du soleil Amaterasu, par son petit-fils Ninigi, ainsi que du dieu de la tempête Susanoo. Il lança une expédition militaire depuis Hyuga près de la mer intérieure, captura Yamato et établit ce lieu comme son centre de pouvoir. Au Japon moderne, l'accession de Jimmu est commémorée le 11 février lors de la Journée nationale de la Fondation.

TEXT.English: Joan of Arc is a national heroine of France, a peasant girl who, believing that she was acting under divine guidance, led the French army in a momentous victory at Orlans that repulsed an English attempt to conquer France during the Hundred Years' War. Captured a year afterward, Joan was burned by the English and their French collaborators as a heretic. She became the greatest national heroine of her compatriots. Her achievement was a decisive factor in the later awakening of French national consciousness. Joan was the daughter of a tenant farmer at Domrmy, on the borders of the duchies of Bar and Lorraine. In her mission of expelling the English and their Burgundian allies from the Valois kingdom of France, she felt herself to be guided by the voices of St. Michael, St. Catherine, and St. Margaret. She possessed many attributes characteristic of the female visionaries who were a noted feature of her time. These qualities included extreme personal piety, a claim to direct communication with the saints, and a consequent reliance upon individual experience of God's presence beyond the ministrations of the priesthood and the confines of the institutional church. But to these were added remarkable mental and physical courage, as well as a robust common sense. Known as La Pucelle, or the Maid of Orlans, Joan became in the following centuries a focus of unity for the French people, especially at times of crisis.
TEXT.Polish: Joanna d'Arc, Dziewica Orleañska (ur. prawdopodobnie 6 stycznia 1412 w DomrŸmy-la-Pucelle, zm. 30 maja 1431 w Rouen) francuska bohaterka narodowa, œwiêta Koœcio³a katolickiego, patronka Francji. Podczas wojny stuletniej poprowadzi³a armiê francusk¹ do kilku wa¿nych zwyciêstw twierdz¹c, ¿e dzia³a kierowana przez Boga. Poœrednio przyczyni³a siê do koronacji Karola VII. Zosta³a schwytana przez Burgundczyków i przekazana Anglikom, os¹dzona przez s¹d koœcielny i spalona na stosie w wieku 19 lat. 24 lata póŸniej papie¿ Kalikst III dokona³ rewizji decyzji s¹du koœcielnego. Uniewinni³ j¹ i uzna³ za mêczennicê. Zosta³a beatyfikowana w 1909 roku i kanonizowana w 1920. Joanna twierdzi³a, ¿e otrzyma³a widzenie od Boga, podczas którego dosta³a polecenie wydobycia ojczyzny spod panowania angielskiego w trakcie wojny stuletniej. Chc¹c wypróbowaæ jej prawdomównoœæ, niekoronowany król Karol VII wys³a³ j¹ do oblê¿onego Orleanu. Po doprowadzeniu do zniesienia oblê¿enia miasta w ci¹gu zaledwie dziewiêciu dni uzyska³a powszechny szacunek i przezwyciê¿y³a lekcewa¿¹c¹ postawê weteranów. Kilka kolejnych zwyciêstw doprowadzi³o do koronacji Karola VII w Reims i rozstrzygnê³o spór o sukcesjê tronu Francji.

TEXT.English: John Frum (also called John Brum, Jon Frum, or John From) is a figure associated with cargo cults on the island of Tanna in Vanuatu. He is often depicted as an American World War II serviceman who will bring wealth and prosperity to the people if they follow him. He is sometimes portrayed as black, sometimes as white. Quoting David Attenborough's report of an encounter: "'E look like you. 'E got white face. 'E tall man. 'E live 'long South America."

Sir John Monash was a civil engineer and soldier, best known for his role as commander of the Australian army corps in France during World War I. Monash attended Scotch College and Melbourne University, obtaining degrees in the arts, civil engineering, and law. Active in the prewar militia, he commanded an infantry brigade at the Battle of Gallipoli during the Dardanelles Campaign in Turkey, and in 191617 he commanded a division on the Western Front. Monash was not a frontline general. Instead, his extensive and successful business experience led him to emphasize planning and organization. He favoured using technical and mechanical resourcestanks, artillery, and aircraftto relieve the infantry as much as possible of the burden of fighting its way forward. In March 1918 he took command of the Australian Corps, and on July 4 he tested his theory of the semimobile managed battle in a small-scale attack at Le Hamel, France. Its outstanding success led Monash to develop a more comprehensive plan for a sustained offensive, which shaped the general British plan as well. From August 8 until its withdrawal from the line in October, the Australian Corps was in almost continuous combat as the spearhead of the British Expeditionary Force's advance to victory. Monash served as head of the State Electricity Commission of Victoria and as president of the Zionist Federation in Australia. He recalled his war experiences in The Australian Victories in France in 1918 (1920) and War Letters (1933). Monash is generally considered among the best corps commanders of World War I, though his capacities at higher levels remained untested.

Jego rodzice przed emigracj¹ do Australii mieszkali w Krotoszynie, jednak oboje uwa¿ali niemiecki za swój jêzyk ojczysty. W okresie, gdy John Monash by³ dzieckiem, rodzina utrzymywa³a siê ze sklepu prowadzonego przez jego ojca. Monash studiowa³ na University of Melbourne, gdzie uzyska³ licencjat z in¿ynierii l¹dowej, a nastêpnie magisterium z prawa (wiele lat póŸniej, w 1921, na tej samej uczelni obroni³ pracê doktorsk¹ w dziedzinie in¿ynierii). W 1894 wraz ze wspólnikiem za³o¿y³ w³asn¹ firmê œwiadcz¹c¹ us³ugi budowlane i doradcze. W 1905 spó³ka zosta³a rozwi¹zana, ale wkrótce potem Monash uruchomi³ kolejny biznes z innymi partnerami. Ju¿ od czasów studenckich s³u¿y³ w ochotniczych milicjach obywatelskich. Jako oficer rezerwy australijskiej armii doszed³ do stopnia pu³kownika i dowódcy brygady, która jednak w czasach pokoju nie by³a mobilizowana, a jej ¿o³nierze, ³¹cznie z dowódc¹, mogli równolegle pracowaæ w cywilnej gospodarce. Brygady Piechoty, któr¹ skierowano do Egiptu. PóŸniej wraz ze swymi ¿o³nierzami wzi¹³ udzia³ w bitwie o Gallipoli, gdzie dowodzi³ jednym z odcinków frontu. W maju 1918 jako pierwszy Australijczyk zosta³ g³ównodowodz¹cym si³ australijskich bior¹cych udzia³ w wojnie (wszyscy jego poprzednicy byli Brytyjczykami). Zgodnie z jego ¿yczeniem, na p³ycie nagrobnej umieszczone zosta³o wy³¹cznie jego imiê i nazwisko, bez ¿adnych tytu³ów czy informacji o uzyskanych odznaczeniach.

TEXT.English: A hunting dog refers to a canine that hunts with or for humans. There are several types of hunting dogs developed for various tasks. The major categories of hunting dogs include hounds, terriers, dachshunds, cur type dogs, and gun dogs. Among these categories further divisions can be made based upon the dogs' skill sets.
TEXT.French: Un chien de chasse désigne un chien qui chasse avec ou pour les humains. Il existe plusieurs types de chiens de chasse développés pour diverses tâches. Les principales catégories comprennent les limiers, terriers, teckels, chiens de type bâtard, et chiens d'arrêt. Parmi ces catégories, on peut faire des subdivisions supplémentaires selon les compétences des chiens.

TEXT.English: Jose Ballivian (May 5, 1805 - October 6, 1852) was a Bolivian general during the Peruvian-Bolivian War and the 11th president of Bolivia from September 27, 1841 to December 23, 1847.
TEXT.French: Jose Ballivian (5 mai 1805 - 6 octobre 1852) était un général bolivien pendant la guerre péruvo-bolivienne et le 11e président de la Bolivie du 27 septembre 1841 au 23 décembre 1847.

TEXT.English: Dr. Jose Gaspar Rodriguez de Francia y Velasco (January 6, 1766 - September 20, 1840) was a Paraguayan lawyer and politician, and the first dictator (1814 - 1840) of Paraguay following its independence from Spanish Viceroyalty of the Río de la Plata. His official title was "Supreme and Perpetual Dictator of Paraguay," but he was popularly known as El Supremo.

Jos Alberto "Pepe" Mujica Cordano is an Uruguayan politician who was the 40th President of Uruguay between 2010 and 2015. A former urban guerrilla fighter with the Tupamaros, he was imprisoned for 13 years during the military dictatorship in the 1970s and 1980s. A member of the Broad Front coalition of left-wing parties, Mujica was Minister of Livestock, Agriculture, and Fisheries from 2005 to 2008 and a Senator afterwards. As the candidate of the Broad Front, he won the 2009 presidential election and took office as President on 1 March 2010.

Jos Protasio Rizal Mercado was a Filipino nationalist and polymath during the tail end of the Spanish colonial period of the Philippines. An ophthalmologist by profession, Rizal became a writer and a key member of the Filipino Propaganda Movement which advocated political reforms for the colony under Spain. He was executed by the Spanish colonial government for the crime of rebellion after an anti-colonial revolution, inspired in part by his writings, broke out. Though he was not actively involved in its planning or conduct, he ultimately approved of its goals which eventually led to Philippine independence. He is widely considered one of the greatest heroes of the Philippines, and is implied by Philippine law to be one of the national heroes. He was the author of the novels Noli Me Tangere, and El Filibusterismo, and a number of poems and essays.

Joze Pucnik (9 March 1932 - 11 January 2003) was a Slovenian public intellectual, sociologist and politician. During the Communist regime of Josip Broz Tito, Pucnik was one of the most outspoken Slovenian critics of dictatorship and lack of civil liberties in Yugoslavia. He was imprisoned for a total of seven years, and later forced into exile. After returning to Slovenia in the late 1980s, he became the leader of the Democratic Opposition of Slovenia, a platform of democratic parties that defeated the Communists in the first free elections in 1990 and introduced a democratic system and market economy to Slovenia. He is also considered one of the fathers of Slovenian independence from Yugoslavia.

Juan Jos Flores y Aramburu (July 19, 1800 - October 1, 1864) was a Venezuelan military general who became Supreme Chief, and later the first President of the new Republic of Ecuador. He later served two more terms from 1839 to 1843 and from 1843 to 1845, and is often referred to as "The Founder of the Republic".
TEXT.French: Juan Jos Flores y Aramburu (19 juillet 1800 - 1 octobre 1864) était un général militaire vénézuélien qui devint chef suprême, puis le premier président de la nouvelle République de l'Équateur. Il servit également deux mandats supplémentaires de 1839 à 1843 et de 1843 à 1845, et est souvent appelé « Le Fondateur de la République ».

TEXT.English: Juan Manuel de Rosas (30 March 1793 - 14 March 1877), nicknamed "Restorer of the Laws", was a politician and army officer who ruled Buenos Aires Province and briefly the Argentine Confederation. Although born into a wealthy family, Rosas independently amassed a personal fortune, acquiring large grants of land in the process. Rosas enlisted his workers in a private militia, as was common for rural proprietors, and took part in the factious disputes that had led to numerous civil wars in his country. Victorious in warfare, personally influential, and with vast landholdings and a loyal private army, Rosas became the quintessential caudillo, as provincial warlords in the region were known. He eventually reached the rank of brigadier general, the highest in the Argentine army, and became the undisputed leader of the Federalist Party.

Juan Domingo Peron was an Argentine military officer and politician. After serving in several government positions, including those of Minister of Labour and Vice President of the Republic, he was three time elected as President of Argentina, serving from June 1946 to September 1955, when he was overthrown by a coup d'état, and from October 1973 to July 1974.
TEXT.French: Juan Domingo Peron était un officier militaire et homme politique argentin. Après avoir occupé plusieurs postes gouvernementaux, y compris ceux de ministre du Travail et vice-président de la République, il fut élu président de l'Argentine à trois reprises, servant de juin 1946 à septembre 1955, lorsqu'il fut renversé par un coup d'État, puis d'octobre 1973 à juillet 1974.
TEXT.Polish: Juan Domingo Perón Sosa (ur. 8 paŸdziernika 1895 roku w Lobos, zm. 1 lipca 1974 roku w Buenos Aires) - argentyñski wojskowy i polityk, minister i wiceprezydent w latach 40., prezydent Argentyny w latach 1946-1955 i 1973-1974. Pochodzi³ z rodziny katolickiej. W 1911 zosta³ uczniem szko³y wojskowej, po ukoñczeniu której podj¹³ s³u¿bê w argentyñskiej armii. W 1930 zosta³ prywatnym sekretarzem ministra wojny, do 1936 by³ wyk³adowc¹ historii na akademii wojskowej. W 1938 zosta³ wys³any do Europy jako obserwator wojskowy. Przebywa³ m.in. we W³oszech Benita Mussoliniego. Nale¿a³ do spisku oficerów, który dokona³ w maju 1943 zamachu stanu przeciwko prezydentowi Ramonowi Castillo. Zosta³ wówczas wyznaczony przez juntê na ministra pracy i spraw socjalnych, a w 1944 na wiceprezydenta i ministra wojny. W wyniku walki o w³adzê w paŸdzierniku 1945 zosta³ aresztowany, ale po kilku dniach uwolniony wskutek demonstracji popieraj¹cego go ruchu zwi¹zkowego CGT.

TEXT.English: A judge presides over court proceedings, either alone or as a part of a panel of judges. The powers, functions, method of appointment, discipline, and training of judges vary widely across different jurisdictions. The judge is supposed to conduct the trial impartially and in an open court. The judge hears all the witnesses and any other evidence presented by the parties of the case, assesses the credibility and arguments of the parties, and then issues a ruling on the matter at hand based on his or her interpretation of the law and his or her own personal judgment. In some jurisdictions, the judge's powers may be shared with a jury. In inquisitorial systems of criminal investigation, a judge might also be an examining magistrate.
TEXT.Spanish: Entrena a los Políticos para poder promulgar ciertas Ordenanzas.
TEXT.Polish: Sêdziowie pozwalaj¹ na ustanawianie specjalnych Rozporz¹dzeñ w miastach.

TEXT.English: Jules Albert Wijdenbosch (born 2 May 1941 in Paramaribo) is a Surinamese politician who was President of Suriname from 1996 to 2000. He was a member of the National Democratic Party, which held absolute power in Suriname during the 1980s. He was Prime Minister from April 1987 until January 1988, Vice President from January 1991 until September 1991, and President from September 1996 until August 2000. He is now the leader of Democratic National Platform 2000. He left a bridge bearing his name.

Gaius Julius Civilis was the leader of the Batavian rebellion against the Romans in 69 AD. His nomen shows that he (or one of his male ancestors) was made a Roman citizen (and thus, the tribe a Roman vassal) by either Augustus or Caligula. He was twice imprisoned on a charge of rebellion, and narrowly escaped execution. During the disturbances that followed the death of Nero, he took up arms under pretence of siding with Vespasian and induced the inhabitants of his native country to rebel. The Batavians, who had rendered valuable service under the early emperors, had been well treated in order to attach them to the cause of Rome. They were exempt from tribute, but were obliged to supply a large number of men for the army, and the burden of conscription and the oppressions of provincial governors were important incentives to revolt. The Batavians were immediately joined by several neighbouring German tribes, the most important of whom were the Frisii.

Jüri Uluots (13 January 1890 - 9 January 1945) was an Estonian prime minister, journalist, prominent attorney and distinguished Professor and Dean of the Faculty of Law at the University of Tartu. Uluots was born in Kirbla Parish, Lääne County in 1890 and studied law at St. Petersburg University in 1910 - 1918. He subsequently taught Roman and Estonian law at the University of Tartu until 1944. Uluots was also an editor of the Kaja newspaper from 1919-1920, and editor-in-chief of Postimees from 1937-38.

Al-Kahina (Classical Arabic for "female seer"; modern Maghreb Arabic l-Kahna, commonly romanised as Kah(i)na, also known as Dihya or Kahya) was a 7th century female Berber religious and military leader, who led indigenous resistance to Arab expansion in Northwest Africa, the region then known as Numidia, known as the Maghreb today. She was born in the early 7th century and died around the end of the 7th century probably in modern day Algeria. In later centuries, Kahina's legend was used to bolster the claims of Berbers in al-Andalus against Arab claims of ethnic supremacyin the early modern age, she was used by French colonials, Berber nationalists, Arab Nationalists, Zionists, North African Israelis, North African Feminists, and Maghrebi nationalists alike for their own didactic purposes.
TEXT.Polish: Kahina ¿y³a w drugiej po³owie VII wieku. Pochodzi³a z berberskiego szczepu Garawa (Jrawa). Wed³ug niektórych szczep ten zosta³ ca³kowicie zjudaizowany, a sama Kahina by³a ¯ydówk¹. ta teoria ma jednak równie wielu zwolenników, co i przeciwników. Pomys³, ¿e Garawa byli zjudaizowani pochodzi od œredniowiecznego historyka Ibn Chalduna. Ale tunezyjski hagiograf al-Maliki uwa¿a, ¿e uwielbienie, jakim cieszy³a siê Kahina by³o bardziej zbli¿one do kultu chrzeœcijañskiej Matki, Dziewicy i Œwiêtej, a nie do ¿ydowskich zwyczajów religijnych. H.Z. Hirschberg zauwa¿y³ natomiast, ¿e w przekazywanych ustnie legendach algierskich ¯ydów, Kahya by³a przedstawiana jako wilko³ak i przeœladowca ¯ydów. Wed³ug ró¿nych Ÿróde³, Kahina by³a córk¹ Tabat, choæ niektórzy mówi¹ te¿ o Matiya. Jej pochodzenie i przesz³oœæ wci¹¿ s¹ owiane tajemnic¹ i stanowi¹ Ÿród³o sporów dla historyków i hagiografów. Pewne jest tylko to, ¿e by³a najpotê¿niejsz¹ w³adczyni¹ berbersk¹ owych czasów. To ona stawi³a opór ekspansji arabskiej w latach 690-701. Arabski wódz Hasan ibn al-Numan z dynastii Umajjadów po zdobyciu w 697 roku Kartaginy, zacz¹³ siê rozgl¹daæ za nowymi wyzwaniami. Do jego uszu dosz³o, ¿e najpotê¿niejszym monarch¹ w Afryce Pó³nocnej jest królowa Berberów al-Kahinat. Ruszy³ wiêc na Numidiê (bo tak w³aœnie nazywa³o siê pierwsze pañstwo Imazighen czyli Berberów). Armie spotka³y siê w pobli¿u Meskiana (dzisiejsza Algieria). Hasan poniós³ tak sromotn¹ klêskê, ¿e na kolejnych 4 czy 5 lat da³ Numidii spokój. Ale powróci³ i pokona³ j¹. Wed³ug niektórych relacji, Kahina zmar³a w walce z najeŸdŸc¹, z mieczem w rêku. Wed³ug innych, pope³ni³a samobójstwo po³ykaj¹c truciznê, by unikn¹æ niewoli u wroga. Najprawdopodobniej mia³o to miejsce w roku 690 lub 700 lub 702 lub 703. W póŸniejszych wiekach legenda Kahiny by³a ideologicznie wykorzystywana przez ró¿ne grupy do potwierdzenia i uzasadnienia ich w³asnych roszczeñ? powo³ywali siê na ni¹ berberyjscy i arabscy nacjonaliœci, ¯ydzi i feministki z Afryki Pó³nocnej. Amerykañski pisarz Manly Wade Wellman napisa³ nawet historyczn¹ powieœæ fantasy p.t. Cahena, inspirowan¹ jej postaci¹.

TEXT.English: Sir Kai Ho was a Hong Kong barrister, physician and essayist in Colonial Hong Kong. He played a key role in the relationship between the Hong Kong local community and the British colonial government. He is remembered as a supporter of the Reform Movement and as a teacher of student Sun Yat-sen, who would become the founding father of the Republic of China. Kai Tak Airport, Hong Kong, was named after him and his son-in-law Au Tak, though he died in 1914, long before the idea of an aerodrome was first mentioned in 1925.

The ancient-Chamorro society had four classes: chamorri (chiefs), matua (upper class), achaot (middle class), and mana'chang (lower class).:20-21 The matua were located in the coastal villages, which meant they had the best access to fishing grounds, whereas the mana'chang were located in the interior of the island. Matua and mana'chang rarely communicated with each other, and matua often used achaot as intermediaries. There were also "makåhna" (similar to shamans), skilled in healing and medicine. Belief in spirits of ancient Chamorros called "Taotao mo'na" still persists as a remnant of pre-European culture. Their society was organized along matrilineal clans.:21

Kalaripayattu is a martial art which originated as a style in Kerala The martial art of Kalaripayattu had its origins in 1362 CE. The word kalari first appears in Sangam literature to describe both a battlefield and combat arena. The word kalari tatt denoted a martial feat, while kalari kozhai meant a coward in war. Each warrior in the Sangam era received regular military training. It is considered to be one of the oldest fighting systems in existence. It is now practiced in Kerala, in contiguous parts of Tamil Nadu. It was originally practiced in northern and central parts of Kerala and the Tulunadu region of Karnataka.

The Kallawaya are an itinerant group of traditional healers living in the Andes of Bolivia. They live in the Bautista Saavedra region, a mountainous area north of La Paz. They are members of the Mollo culture and are direct descendants of Tiwanaku culture. According to the UNESCO Safeguarding Project, the Kallawaya can be traced to the pre-Inca period. The Kallawaya performed brain surgery as early as 700 CE and knew how to effectively prevent and treat malaria with quinine before the Europeans. They also helped to save thousands of lives during the construction of the Panama Canal.

Kallawaya people, an itinerant group of healers, were of the Mollo culture. The Mollo were defined by their ceramics. Shoe pots, grave pots, vases, and dipping vessels have been found and these are either plain or painted black and white on red clay. They created a unique drinking cup with a built-in straw. Some of these ceramics can be found today as far away as the Naprstek Museum in Prague.
TEXT.French: Le peuple Kallawaya, un groupe itinérant de guérisseurs, appartenait à la culture Mollo. Les Mollo se distinguaient par leur céramique. Des pots en forme de chaussures, des urnes funéraires, des vases et des récipients pour tremper ont été découverts, parfois bruts, parfois peints en noir et blanc sur argile rouge. Ils ont créé une coupe à boire unique avec une paille intégrée. Certaines de ces céramiques se trouvent encore aujourd'hui aussi loin qu'au Musée Naprstek à Prague.

TEXT.English: Kim-un Kamuy (also called Metotush Kamuy and Nuparikor Kamuy) is the Ainu kamuy (god) of bears and mountains.
TEXT.French: Kim-un Kamuy (aussi appelé Metotush Kamuy et Nuparikor Kamuy) est le kamuy (dieu) aïnou des ours et des montagnes.
TEXT.Polish: Kim-un Kamuy jest bogiem Ainu, opiekunem gór i niedŸwiedzi.

TEXT.English: Kandake or Kentake was the title for queens regnant of the ancient Kingdom of Kush in the Nile Valley. It is a derivative of Candace, a Meroitic language term for "queen" or "queen-mother".
TEXT.French: Kandake ou Kentake était le titre des reines régnantes du royaume antique de Koush dans la vallée du Nil. Il dérive de Candace, un terme en langue méroïtique signifiant « reine » ou « reine-mère ».

German.Text: Graues Riesenkänguru:Grauen Riesenkängurus:Grauen Riesenkänguru:Graue Riesenkänguru:Graue Riesenkängurus:Grauen Riesenkängurus:Grauen Riesenkängurus:Grauen Riesenkängurus

TEXT.English: The Eastern Grey Kangaroo (Macropus giganteus) is a marsupial found in southern and eastern Australia, with a population of several million. It is also known as the Great Grey Kangaroo and the Forester Kangaroo. Although a big Eastern Grey male typically masses around 66 kg (weight 145 lb.) and stands almost 2 m (6 ft.) tall, the scientific name, Macropus giganteus (gigantic large-foot), is misleading, as the Red Kangaroo of the semi-arid inland is, at 85 kg, larger.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Eastern Grey is easy to recognise: its soft grey coat is distinctive, and it is usually found in moister, more fertile areas than the Red. Red Kangaroos, though sometimes grey-blue in colour, have a totally different face to Grey Kangaroos. Red Kangaroos have distinctive markings in black and white beside their muzzles and along the sides of their face. Grey Kangaroos do not have these markings, and their eyes seem large and wide open. Where their ranges overlap, it is much more difficult to distinguish between Eastern Grey and Western Grey Kangaroos, which are closely related. They have a very similar body shape and facial structure, and their noses/muzzles are fully covered with fine hair (though that is not obvious at a distance, their noses do look noticeably different to the noses of Reds and Wallaroos). The Eastern Grey's colouration is a light-coloured grey or brownish-grey, with a lighter silver or cream, sometimes nearly white, belly. The Western-grey is a dark dusty brown colour, with more contrast especially around the head. Indigenous Australian names include iyirrbir (Uw Oykangand and Uw Olkola) and kucha (Pakanh). The highest ever recorded speed of any kangaroo was 64 kilometres per hour (40 mph) set by a large female Eastern Grey Kangaroo.
TEXT.German: Das Östliche Graue Riesenkänguru (Macropus giganteus) ist mit einer Kopf-Rumpf-Länge von 85 bis 140 cm und einer Schwanzlänge von 75 bis 100 cm das zweitgrößte Beuteltier aus der Familie der Kängurus. Männchen werden bis zu 55 kg schwer, Weibchen sind in der Regel zierlicher gebaut und nur halb so schwer. Graue Riesenkängurus verfügen über die typischen muskulösen Hinterbeine, die ihnen weite Sprünge ermöglichen, und im Vergleich dazu nur relativ kurze Vorderbeine. Sie tragen ein dichtes, silbergraues Fell, das in der Helligkeit je nach Lebensraum variiert.[NEWLINE]Wie aus dem Namen schon zu ersehen ist, leben Östliche Graue Riesenkängurus im Osten und Südosten Australiens, aber auch auf der Insel Tasmanien. Sie bewohnen vor allem offene Wälder und Grasländer, aber auch bewaldete Gebirgsregionen. Die Tiere leben in kleinen Gruppen von 10 bis 30 Tieren zusammen, im Gegensatz zu Roten Riesenkängurus sind in diesen Gruppen meist mehrere Männchen und Weibchen mit ihrem Nachwuchs organisiert, wobei zwischen den Männchen eine Rangordnung besteht, die durch Kämpfe ausgefochten wird. Als dämmerungs- und nachtaktive Tiere dösen sie tagsüber meist im Schatten von Bäumen. Graue Riesenkängurus ernähren sich hauptsächlcih von Pflanzen, vorwiegend von Gräsern und Blättern. Bei der Nahrungssuche bewegen sie sich auf allen Vieren fort, auf der Flucht oder Wanderung hingegen typisch springend auf den Hinterbeinen.[NEWLINE]Ausgewachsene Riesenkängurus haben kaum natürliche Feinde, da sie sich mit Tritten ihrer kräftigen Hinterbeine gut zur Wehr setzen und außerdem mit ihren schnellen Sprüngen leicht Raubtieren entkommen können. Sie haben die Ankunft der Europäer besser verkraftet als viele kleinere Känguruarten, trotzdem stellt ihre einzige ernstzunehmende Bedrohung der Mensch dar. Sie werden zwar wegen ihres Fleisches und manchmal auch wegen ihres Felles gejagt, die Jagd ist jedoch streng reglementiert.
TEXT.Polish: Kangur szary (Macropus fuliginosis, czasami pisane Macropus fuliginosus) du¿y torbacz z rodziny kangurowatych. Doros³e samce osi¹gaj¹ wysokoœæ w pozycji stoj¹cej oko³o dwóch metrów i wagê 65 kg. Zamieszkuje suche zaroœla i lasy. Od¿ywia siê g³ównie traw¹ i innymi roœlinami zielnymi. Ci¹¿a trwa zaledwie 36 dni, a m³ode pozostaj¹ w torbie przez 9 miesiêcy. ¯yje w du¿ych grupach, w których przewa¿aj¹ samice i m³ode. Wci¹¿ jeszcze bardzo liczny w Australii, lecz rzadko eksponowany w europejskich kolekcjach.[PARAGRAPH:2]Chroniony od 1983 roku. Zezwolenia na eksport dopuszczalne jest tylko w stanach Australii Po³udniowej i Nowej Po³udniowej Walii. W 1978 roku gatunek liczy³ 295000 osobników.

German.Text: Rotes Riesenkänguru:Roten Riesenkängurus:Roten Riesenkänguru:Rote Riesenkänguru:Rote Riesenkängurus:Roten Riesenkängurus:Roten Riesenkängurus:Roten Riesenkängurus

TEXT.English: The Red Kangaroo (Macropus rufus) is the largest of all kangaroos, the largest mammal native to Australia, and the largest surviving marsupial. It is found across mainland Australia, avoiding only the more fertile areas in the south, the east coast, and the northern rainforests.[PARAGRAPH:2]This species is a very large kangaroo with long, pointed ears and a squared-off muzzle. Males have short, red-brown fur, fading to pale buff below and on the limbs. Females are smaller than males and are blue-grey with a brown tinge, pale grey below, although arid zone females are coloured more like males. It has two forelimbs with small claws, two muscular hind-limbs, which are used for jumping, and a strong tail which is often used to create a tripod when standing upright.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Red Kangaroo's legs work much like a rubber band. The males can leap over 9 metres (30 ft) in one leap.[PARAGRAPH:2]Males grow up to a body length of 3 metres (9.8 ft) long and weigh up to 135 kilograms (300 lb). Females reach a body length of up to 1.1 metres (3.6 ft) long and weigh up to 35 kilograms (77 lb). Tails can be from 0.9 to 1 metre (3.0 - 3.3 ft) long. The average Red Kangaroo stands approximately 1.5 metres (4.9 ft) tall. Accounts of sizes greater than this are not uncommon, with some large males reportedly reaching approximately 2 metres (6 ft 7 in).[PARAGRAPH:2]The Red Kangaroo maintains its internal temperature at a point of homeostasis about 36 °C (97 °F) using a variety of physical, physiological, and behavioural adaptations. These include having an insulating layer of fur, being less active and staying in the shade when temperatures are high, panting, sweating, and licking its forelimbs.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Red Kangaroo's range of vision is approximately 300°, due to the position of its eyes.
TEXT.German: Das Rote Riesenkänguru (Macropus rufus) ist mit einer Kopf-Rumpf-Länge von bis zu 1,6 m und einer Schwanzlänge von 1,2 m das größte lebende Beuteltier und das größte Säugetier Australiens. Es verfügt über kräftige Hinterbeine, mit denen es weite Sprünge ausführen kann, und einen ebenso kräftigen Schwanz, der allein das komplette Körpergewicht tragen kann. Männliche Kängurus tragen das typische rötlich-braune Fell, während das der Weibchen eher blaugrau gefärbt ist. Außerdem sind die Männchen deutlich größer und schwerer als die Weibchen.[NEWLINE]Rote Riesenkängurus bewohnen die Steppen, Halbwüsten und Buschländer Australiens. Sie leben in lockeren kleinen Gruppen von mehreren Weibchen und einem Männchen zusammen und verbringen bis zu 10 Stunden täglich mit dem Fressen. Hauptsächlich verzehren sie Gras, aber auch Blätter und Baumrinde stehen auf dem Speiseplan. Die heißeste Zeit des Tages verbringen sie ruhend im Schatten der Bäume, weswegen sie Habitate ohne jeglichen Baumbewuchs meiden. Bei der Nahrungssuche bewegen sie sich auf allen Vieren fort, auf der Flucht oder Wanderung hingegen typisch springend auf den Hinterbeinen. Rote Riesenkängurus können bis zu 9 m weit und 3 m hoch springen und Geschwindigkeiten von bis zu 60 km/h erreichen.[NEWLINE]Ausgewachsene Riesenkängurus haben kaum natürliche Feinde, da sie sich mit Tritten ihrer kräftigen Hinterbeine gut zur Wehr setzen und außerdem mit ihren schnellen Sprüngen leicht Raubtieren entkommen können. Sie haben auch die Ankunft der Europäer besser verkraftet als viele kleinere Känguruarten. Sie werden nur noch selten wegen ihres Fleisches gejagt, ihr Bestand muss aber kontrolliert werden, da sie die größten Nahrungskonkurrenten für Rinder- und Schafherden sind.
TEXT.Polish: Kangur rudy, kangur czerwony (Macropus rufus) torbacz z rodziny kangurowatych. Du¿y ssak roœlino¿erny, najwiêkszy z torbaczy. Wystêpuje pospolicie w ca³ej Australii z wyj¹tkiem czêœci po³udniowego i wschodniego wybrze¿a oraz pó³nocnych lasów równikowych.[PARAGRAPH:2]Du¿y lub bardzo du¿y kangur o sierœci od br¹zowo-rudawej barwy na grzbiecie do p³owej na brzuchu i koñczynach. D³ugie, spiczasto zakoñczone uszy, têpo zakoñczony pysk. Samice wyraŸnie mniejsze, o sierœci z wiêkszym udzia³em koloru szarego.

TEXT.English: The Kangxi Emperor was the fourth emperor of the Qing dynasty, the first to be born on Chinese soil south of the Shanhai Pass near Beijing, and the second Qing emperor to rule over China proper, from 1661 to 1722. The Kangxi Emperor's reign of 61 years makes him the longest-reigning emperor in Chinese history (although his grandson, the Qianlong Emperor, had the longest period of de facto power) and one of the longest-reigning rulers in the world. However, since he ascended the throne at the age of seven, actual power was held for six years by four regents and his grandmother, the Grand Empress Dowager Xiaozhuang.

Kanishka I was the emperor of the Kushan dynasty in the second century (c. AD 127-163). He is famous for his military, political, and spiritual achievements. A descendant of Kushan empire founder Kujula Kadphises, Kanishka came to rule an empire in Bactria extending from Turfan in the Tarim Basin to Pataliputra on the Gangetic plain. The main capital of his empire was located at Puruapura in Gandhara, with two other major capitals at Kapisa and Mathura.
TEXT.French: Kanishka Ier fut empereur de la dynastie Kushan au IIe siècle (vers 127-163 ap. J.-C.). Il est célèbre pour ses accomplissements militaires, politiques et spirituels. Descendant de Kujula Kadphises, fondateur de l'empire Kushan, Kanishka régna sur un empire en Bactriane s'étendant de Turfan dans le bassin du Tarim jusqu'à Pataliputra sur la plaine du Gange. La capitale principale de son empire était située à Puruapura dans le Gandhara, avec deux autres grandes capitales à Kapisa et Mathura.

TEXT.English: Pombero's original name in the Guaran language is Karai Pyhare, literally "The man of the Night", he is said to be a primarily nocturnal creature. In some parts of Argentina he is known primarily by the Spanish translation of his name, Señor de la noche.
TEXT.French: he is said to be a primarily nocturnal creature. In some parts of Argentina he is known primarily by the Spanish translation of his name

TEXT.English: Violence is one of the leading causes of Yanomami death. Up to half of all of Yanomami males die violent deaths in the constant conflict between neighboring communities over local resources. Often these confrontations lead to the Yanomami leaving their villages in search of new ones. Women are often victims of physical abuse and anger. Inter-village warfare is common, but does not too commonly affect women. When Yanomami tribes fight and raid nearby tribes, women are often raped, beaten, and brought back to the shabono to be adopted into the captor's community. Wives may be beaten frequently, so as to keep them docile and faithful to their husbands. Sexual jealousy causes much of the violence. Women are beaten with clubs, sticks, machetes, and other blunt or sharp objects. Burning with a branding stick occurs often, and symbolizes a male's strength or dominance over his wife.

Karikala Chola, the greatest among the early Chola kings of the Sangam age in South India, had been the son of Ilamcetcenni and ruled around 120 C.E. Karikala led the Chola empire successfully in campaigns to unify the three Dravidian kingdoms. His name meant "the man with the charred leg," an injury he received during a fight to escape capture from a scheming competitor for his throne. He had earned praise for the beauty of his war chariots. In the Battle of Venni, Karikala crushed the Pandya and Chera forces, leading to the unifying of the three kingdoms into one under Karikala's rule. His legendary campaign into northern India may have been royal hype, since no records exist of the campaign. In any case, his skill as a commander had been acclaimed. Karikala's Chola garnered great wealth in trade with the Roman empire. He used that wealth to fund his military campaigns and to build his cities. He is reputed to have decorated the capital city of Kanchipuram with gold. He earned lasting fame by building dikes along the banks of Kaveri. He built the Grand Anaicut, the oldest dam in the world, and irrigation canals as well as tanks. His innovations and projects with irrigation greatly aiding agriculture in his kingdom. He left a legacy as an able and just king, promoting commerce and administering justice. He appears to have been sincerely mourned by the people of Chola at his death.

Mohammad Karim Khan Zand was the founder of the Zand Dynasty, ruling from 1751 to 1779. He ruled all of Iran except for Khorasan. He also ruled over some Caucasian lands and occupied Basra for some years.
TEXT.French: Mohammad Karim Khan Zand fut le fondateur de la dynastie Zand, régnant de 1751 à 1779. Il régna sur toute l'Iran sauf le Khorasan. Il gouverna également certaines terres du Caucase et occupa Bassorah pendant plusieurs années.

TEXT.English: Caroleans (Swedish: karoliner) were the soldiers of the Swedish kings Charles XI and Charles XII whose notable tactics differed from that of Western Europe through a greater reliance upon pikes, bayonets, and the spirit of the offensive.
TEXT.French: Les Caroles (suédois : karoliner) étaient les soldats des rois suédois Charles XI et Charles XII dont les tactiques remarquables différaient de celles de l'Europe occidentale par une plus grande dépendance aux piques, baïonnettes et à l'esprit de l'offensive.

TEXT.English: Sulaiman Khan Karrani (reigned: 1566-1572) was a ruler of Bengal since the death of his elder brother Taj Khan Karrani. According to the Riyaz-us-Salatin, he shifted the seat of government from Gaur to Tanda.Sulaiman, his brother Taj and Sulaiman's sons Bayazid and Daud Khan Karrani ran a short-lived Afghan vassal state of Mughal emperor Akbar in Bengal. They dominated the area while Sulaiman paid homage to the Akbar. The Afghans defeated by Akbar began to flock under his flag. The Afghans were not technically the rulers of Bengal, the post was primarily nominal.
TEXT.Polish: Sulejman Wspania³y - su³tan osmañski w latach 1520-1566. By³ synem Selima I GroŸnego i Ayse Hafsy (Hafizy). W czasach jego panowania Imperium Osmañskie osi¹gnê³o szczyt swojej potêgi. Prowadzi³ liczne wojny, w wyniku których rozszerzy³ jego terytorium (najwiêkszy, jeœli chodzi o obszar przy³¹czonych ziem, zdobywca osmañski). Przeprowadzi³ reformê administracji, armii, finansów. By³ mecenasem kultury oraz poet¹ (pisa³ pod pseudonimem Muhibbi).

TEXT.English: Túpac Katari or Catari (also Túpaj Katari) (c. 1750-November 15, 1781), born Julian Apasa Nina, was an early leader of the independence activists in Bolivia and a leader of an indigenous rebellion against the Spanish Empire in the early 1780s. His wife was Bartolina Sisa. A member of the Aymara, Apasa took the name "Tupac Katari" to honor two earlier rebel leaders: Tomas Katari, and Túpac Amaru II. ("Katari" means "serpent, large snake" in Aymara; "Amaru" means the same in Quechua, the language of Tupac Amaru. "Tupac" means "brilliant, resplendent" in both languages.) He raised an army of some 40,000 and laid siege to the city of La Paz in 1781. Katari and his wife, Bartolina Sisa set up court in El Alto and maintained the siege for 184 days, from March to June and from August to October. Sisa was a commander of the siege, and played the crucial role following Katari's capture in April. The siege was broken by the Spanish colonial troops who advanced from Lima and Buenos Aires.

The Katipunan (abbreviated to KKK) was a Philippine revolutionary society founded by anti-Spanish Filipinos in Manila in 1892, whose primary aim was to gain independence from Spain through revolution. The society was initiated by Filipino patriots Andrés Bonifacio, Teodoro Plata, Ladislao Diwa, and others on the night of July 7, when Filipino writer Jos Rizal was to be banished to Dapitan. Initially, the Katipunan was a secret organization until its discovery in 1896 that led to the outbreak of the Philippine Revolution.

TEXT.Spanish: Unidad naval primitiva.

TEXT.English: So strong is the Persian aptitude for versifying everyday expressions that one can encounter poetry in almost every classical work, whether from Persian literature, science, or metaphysics. In short, the ability to write in verse form was a pre-requisite for any scholar. For example, almost half of Avicenna's medical writings are in verse.
TEXT.French: L'aptitude perse à versifier les expressions courantes est si forte qu'on peut trouver de la poésie dans presque toutes les oeuvres classiques, qu'elles soient issues de la littérature persane, scientifique ou métaphysique. En bref, la capacité à écrire en vers était un prérequis pour tout érudit. Par exemple, près de la moitié des écrits médicaux d'Avicenne sont en vers.

TEXT.English: Khaemwaset was the fourth son of Ramesses II, and the second son by his queen Isetnofret. He is by far the best known son of the king, and his contributions to Egyptian society were remembered for centuries after his death. Khaemwaset has been described as "the first Egyptologist" due to his efforts in identifying and restoring historic buildings, tombs and temples. Khaemwaset grew up with his brothers during a time of foreign conflict. He apparently was present at the Battle of Kadesh, at the siege of Qode (Naharin), the siege of Dapur in Syria and earlier in Nubia. After this initial period where Khaemwaset may have had some military training, or at least was present at the battlefield, he became a Sem-Priest of Ptah in Memphis. This appointment occurred in c. Year 16 of Ramesses II's reign. He would have initially been a deputy to the High Priest of Ptah in Memphis named Huy. Khaemwaset restored the monuments of earlier kings and nobles, such as Shepseskaf, Sahure and Nyuserre Ini. He also restored the pyramid of Unas at Saqqara. He seems to have undertaken these tasks during his later tenure as Sem-Priest and some of the inscriptions mention his title as 'Chief of the Artificers' or 'Chief of Crafts'. Hence, some of these restorations were undertaken after Khaemwaset's promotion as the High Priest of Ptah in Memphis about the 45th year of the reign of Ramesses II. Khaemwaset held the position of Crown Prince to the throne between Year 50 and Year 55 of his father's reign when he died. In later periods of Egyptian history, Khaemwaset was remembered as a wise man, and portrayed as the hero in a cycle of stories dating to Greco-Roman times. These stories often mix history with magic and fantasy, as in the case of one tale where the Prince goes into Nubia to duel with a Nubian sorcerer.
TEXT.Polish: Chaemuaset ksi¹¿ê i nastêpca tronu staro¿ytnego Egiptu, syn Ramzesa II i królowej Isetnofret, odnowiciel zabytków memfickich. By³ czwartym z kolei synem w³adcy i jego drugim ze zwi¹zku z Isetnofret. By³ równie¿ ulubionym synem Ramzesa, po œmierci starszego brata zosta³ przez ojca ustanowiony nastêpc¹ tronu. Piastowa³ godnoœci Wielkiego Kap³ana Ptaha i Wielkorz¹dcy Memfis. Mia³ 5 lat, kiedy ojciec zabra³ go na wyprawê wojenn¹ do Nubii. Z kultem Ptaha zwi¹zany by³ od ok. 15 roku panowania Ramzesa II, pocz¹tkowo jako kap³an sem. Jako arcykap³an celebrowa³ 9 pierwszych jubileuszy (œwi¹t sed) swojego ojca. Niew¹tpliwie bardzo kocha³ swoj¹ matkê, której wystawi³ wiele pomników w Memfis. By³ "cz³owiekiem wielkiej kultury" (Grimal), studiowa³ hieroglify papirusów teologicznych, anna³y i dzieje przodków oraz nauki tajemne, sprawdza³ poprawnoœæ list w³adców, rekonstruowa³ i uzupe³nia³ inskrypcje. Wybudowa³ w Memfis Serapeum ogromny, podziemny grobowiec dla mumii œwiêtych byków, kolejnych wcieleñ boga Apisa. Odnowi³ i ponownie ustawi³ monumenty wczeœniejszych w³adców m.in. Kawaba, Szepseskafa, Sahure, Niuserre Ini. Dokona³ równie¿ odnowy piramidy Unisa w Sakkara. Nazywany wspó³czeœnie "pierwszym archeologiem" ze wzglêdu na swoje zainteresowania i du¿y wk³ad w odkrywaniu pami¹tek przesz³oœci oraz renowacjê zabytków staroegipskich. Zmar³ jeszcze przed ojcem w 55 roku jego panowania w wieku ok. 55 lat.

TEXT.English: Qaan is a title in the Mongolian language equal to the status of emperor and used to refer to someone who rules a khaganate or empire. The title was adopted by Ögedei Khan from the Turkic title kaan. It may also be translated as Khan of Khans, equivalent to King of Kings. In modern Mongolian, the title became Khaan with the 'g' sound becoming almost silent or non-existent (i.e. a very light voiceless velar fricative); the g in modern Turkish Kagan is also silent. Since the division of the Mongol Empire, emperors of the Yuan dynasty held the title of Khagan and their successors in Mongolia continued to have the title. Kagan and Kaan are common Turkish names in Turkey.

Khalid ibn al-Walid was one of the most successful commanders in military history. He is noted for his military prowess, commanding the forces of the Islamic prophet Muhammad and those of his immediate successors of the Rashidun Caliphate; Abu Bakr and Umar (Umar ibn al-Khattab). He has the distinction of being undefeated in over a hundred battles, against the numerically superior forces of the Byzantine Roman Empire, Sassanid Persian Empire, and their allies. His strategic achievements include the conquest of the Persian Empire's Iraq and Roman Syria within three years from 633 to 636. He is also remembered for his decisive victories at Yamamah, Ullais and Yarmouk. Khaled ibn Walid was from the Meccan tribe of Quraysh, who initially opposed Muhammad. He played a vital role in Qurayshi victory at the Battle of Uhud. He converted to Islam, however, and joined Muhammad after the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah and participated in various expeditions for him, such as the Battle of Mu'tah. After Muhammad's death, he played a key role in commanding Medinan forces for Abu Bakr in the Ridda wars, the capture of the Sassanid Arab client Kingdom of Al-Hirah, and the defeat of the Sassanid Persian forces during his conquest of Iraq. He then crossed the desert to capture the Byzantine Arab client state of the Ghassanids during his conquest of Roman Syria. Even though Umar later relieved him of high command, he remained the effective leader of the forces arrayed against the Byzantines during the early stages of the ByzantineArab Wars. Under his command, Damascus was captured in 634 and the key Arab victory against the Roman Byzantine forces was achieved at the Battle of Yarmouk (636), which led to the conquest of the Bilad al-Sham (Levant).
TEXT.Polish: Chalid ibn al-Walid (592-642) dowódca wojsk muzu³mañskich w czasie panowania pierwszego kalifa Abu Bakra. Ws³awi³ siê wieloma podbojami, z których najwa¿niejsze to podbicie Persji. Na podbój Persji przeprowadzi³ swoje wojska przez serce Pustyni Syryjskiej, czego dokona³ dziêki znajomoœci lokalizacji wodopojów i wykorzystaniu wielb³¹dów jako Ÿród³a po¿ywienia i wody. Po przekroczeniu pustyni rozpocz¹³ oblê¿enie Damaszku, którego mieszkañcy poddali siê we wrzeœniu 635 roku. W roku 636 pokona³ dwa razy wiêksz¹ armiê cesarza bizantyjskiego Herakliusza w bitwie nad rzek¹ Jarmuk. Nastêpnie zosta³ odwo³any przez nowego kalifa Omara I.

TEXT.English: The Semang are a Negrito ethnic group of the Malay Peninsula. They are found in Perak, Kedah and Pahang of Malaysia. During the colonial British administration, Orang Asli living in the northern Malay Peninsula were classified as Sakai. Lowland Semang tribes are also known as Sakai, although this term is considered to be derogatory by the Semang people. They have been recorded to have lived here since before the 3rd century. They are ethnologically described as nomadic hunter-gatherers. See also Bajaus and Aetas.

The Semangs live in caves or leaf-shelters that form between branches. A loincloth for the men, made of tree bark hammered out with a wooden mallet from the bark of the terap, a species of wild bread-fruit tree, and a short skirt of the same for the women, is the only dress worn; some go naked. In 1906 the Thai King Chulalongkorn adopted a Semang orphan boy named Khanung.
TEXT.French: Les Semangs vivent dans des grottes ou des abris feuillus formés entre les branches. Les hommes portent un pagne fait d'écorce d'arbre battue au maillet en bois, provenant de l'écorce du terap, une espèce d'arbre à pain sauvage, et les femmes un court jupon du même matériau, ce qui constitue leur unique vêtement ; certains sont nus. En 1906, le roi thaï Chulalongkorn adopta un orphelin semang nommé Khanung.

TEXT.English: Kharavela was a king of Kalinga in present-day Odisha, India. The best known king of the Mahameghavahana dynasty, he ruled somewhere around first or second century BCE. His name is also transliterated as Kharabea. The main source of information about Kharavela is his rock-cut Hathigumpha inscription. The inscription is undated, and only 4 of its 17 lines are completely legible. Different scholars have interpreted it differently, leading to a number of speculations about Kharavela's reign. The inscription credits the king with several welfare activities, patronage of arts, repair works and military victories. Although it exaggerates his achievements, historians agree that Kharavela was one of the strongest rulers of Kalinga.

Kharkhul (English name:Khara Khula; died 1634) was a Choros-Oirat prince and tayishi of the Choros tribe. He is best known for forming and leading a coalition of the Four Oirats in battle against Ubasi Khun Tayishi, the Khalkha prince who ruled the Altan Khanate in present-day northwest Mongolia.
TEXT.French: Kharkhul (nom anglais : Khara Khula ; mort en 1634) était un prince Choros-Oirat et tayishi de la tribu Choros. Il est surtout connu pour avoir formé et dirigé une coalition des Quatre Oirats au combat contre Ubasi Khun Tayishi, prince Khalkha qui régnait sur le Khanat d'Altan dans l'actuelle Mongolie du nord-ouest.

TEXT.English: Khingila was the foundation king of the Hephthalite Empire, a contemporary of Khushnavaz (fl. 484) in Khwarezm. According to the Syrian compilation of Church Historian Zacharias Rhetor, bishop of Mytilene, the need for new grazing land to replace that lost to the Wusun led Khingila's "Uar-Chionites" to displace the Sabirs to the west, who in turn displaced the Saragur, Ugor and Onogur, who then asked for an alliance and land from Byzantium.
TEXT.French: who in turn displaced the Saragur

TEXT.English: The Khitan people were a nomadic people originally from Mongolia, Manchuria (or Northeast China), and the Russian Far East from the 4th century that spoke a language distantly related to the Mongolic languages. As the Liao dynasty, they dominated a vast area north of and including parts of China, but left few relics that have survived until today.
TEXT.French: Les Khitans étaient un peuple nomade originaire de Mongolie, de Mandchourie (ou nord-est de la Chine) et de l'Extrême-Orient russe à partir du IVe siècle, parlant une langue vaguement apparentée aux langues mongoliques. Sous la dynastie Liao, ils dominaient une vaste région au nord et englobant des parties de la Chine, mais ont laissé peu de vestiges encore visibles aujourd'hui.

TEXT.English: The Khmer Empire, was the powerful Khmer Hindu-Buddhist empire in Southeast Asia. The empire, which grew out of the former Kingdom of Funan and Chenla, at times ruled over and/or vassalized most of mainland Southeast Asia, parts of modern-day Laos, Thailand, and southern Vietnam. Its greatest legacy is Angkor, in present-day Cambodia, which was the site of the capital city during the empire's zenith.
TEXT.French: L'Empire khmer était un puissant empire hindou-bouddhiste khmer en Asie du Sud-Est. Cet empire, issu des anciens royaumes du Funan et de Chenla, domina à certaines époques une grande partie de l'Asie du Sud-Est continentale, incluant des parties du Laos, de la Thaïlande et du sud du Vietnam actuels. Son plus grand héritage est Angkor, au Cambodge actuel, site de la capitale à l'apogée de l'empire.

TEXT.English: "Khoisan" is a unifying name for two groups of peoples of Southern Africa, who share physical and putative linguistic characteristics distinct from the Bantu majority of the region. Culturally, the Khoisan are divided into the foraging San, or Bushmen, and the pastoral Khoi, or more specifically Khoikhoi, previously known as Hottentots.
TEXT.French: "Khoisan" est un nom unificateur pour deux groupes de peuples d'Afrique australe, qui partagent des caractéristiques physiques et linguistiques supposées distinctes de la majorité bantoue de la région. Sur le plan culturel, les Khoisan sont divisés en San, chasseurs-cueilleurs, ou Bushmen, et les Khoi pastoraux, ou plus précisément les Khoikhoi, auparavant appelés Hottentots.

TEXT.English: Grand Ayatollah Sayyid Ruhollah Musavi Khomeini was an Iranian Shia Muslim religious leader, revolutionary, politician, the founder of the Islamic Republic of Iran and the leader of the 1979 Iranian Revolution which saw the overthrow of the Pahlavi monarchy and Mohammad Reza Pahlavi, the Shah of Iran. Following the revolution, Khomeini became the country's Supreme Leader, a position created in the constitution of the Islamic Republic as the highest-ranking political and religious authority of the nation, which he held until his death. He was succeeded by Ali Khamenei.

Khonvoum is the supreme god and creator of the Bambuti Pygmy people in central Africa. He is the 'great hunter', god of the hunt, and carries a bow made of two snake which appears to mortals as a rainbow. He rulesthe heavens and when the sun sets, he gathers pieces of the stars and throws it at the sun so that it may rise the next day in its full splendor. He contacts people by means of the mythical elephant Gor (the thunderer) or through a chameleon. Khonvoum created black and white people from black and white clay, and the Pygmies from red clay. For them he also created the jungle with its lush vegetation and animal life.
TEXT.Polish: Khomvoum jest g³ównym bogiem plemienia pigmejów Bambuti w centralnej Afryce.

TEXT.English: Seuserenre Khyan, Khian or Khayan was a king of the Hyksos Fifteenth dynasty of Egypt. His royal name Seuserenre translates as "The one whom Re has caused to be strong." Khyan bears the titles of an Egyptian king, but also the title ruler of the foreign land (heqa-khaset). The later title is the typical designation of the Hyksos rulers. Khyan is one of the better attested kings from the Hyksos period, known from many seals and seal impressions. Remarkable are objects with his name found at Knossos and Hattusha indicating diplomatic contacts with Crete and the Hittites. A sphinx with his name was bought on the art market at Bagdad and might demonstrate diplomatic contacts to Babylon.

Kikkuli was the Hurrian "master horse trainer" of the "land Mitanni" and author of a chariot horse training text written in the Hittite language, dating to the Hittite New Kingdom (around 1400 BC). The text is notable both for the information it provides about the development of Indo-European languages and for its content.
TEXT.French: dating to the Hittite New Kingdom (around 1400 BC). The text is notable both for the information it provides about the development of Indo-European languages and for its content.

TEXT.English: The Klamath tribes of northern California and Oregon were among the last of the Native American tribes to fight the American settlers trying to take their lands. Late in the 1800s, they fought a war in very difficult terrain, holding off a much superior force for many months. In this bitter struggle, the natives proved especially effective with their rifles.
TEXT.Spanish: El Fusilero klamath.

TEXT.English: A knarr is a type of Norse merchant ship used by the Vikings. The knarr (Old Norse: knorr, plural knerrir) was constructed using the same clinker-built method as longships, karves, and faerings.
TEXT.French: Un knarr est un type de navire marchand nordique utilisé par les Vikings. Le knarr (vieux norrois : knorr, pluriel knerrir) était construit selon la même méthode à clin que les drakkars, karves et faerings.

TEXT.English: Knights were heavily armored, mounted men-at-arms found primarily in medieval Europe. Like the samurai of ancient Japan, knights followed a strict code that covered their behavior both in battle and in their personal pursuits. Fighting astride powerful horses, armored knights had a distinct advantage over enemies on foot and remained the dominant force on the battlefield when battles were fought primarily hand-to-hand. Occasionally, brilliant infantry tactics allowed knights to be outmaneuvered, but it wasn't until the development of gunpowder that knights were rendered obsolete.
TEXT.French: Les chevaliers étaient des soldats de l'Europe féodale issus de la noblesse, qui se battaient à cheval et portaient de lourdes armures. A l'instar des samouraïs du Japon médiéval, ils obéissaient à un code strict qui déterminait leur comportement pendant et en dehors des batailles. Se battant à cheval, les chevaliers en armure avaient un avantage évident sur l'infanterie ennemie.
