Ils dominèrent ainsi les champs de bataille à une époque où l'essentiel des combats se faisait au corps à corps. Même s'il arrivait parfois que l'infanterie, grâce à des manoeuvres tactiques, parvienne à prendre l'ascendant sur les chevaliers, ce n'est qu'avec l'invention de la poudre que ces derniers devinrent obsolètes.
TEXT.German: Ritter waren schwer gepanzerte, berittene Kämpfer, die vor allem im mittelalterlichen Europa eingesetzt wurden. Wie die Samurai im antiken Japan hatten sich auch die Ritter einen strengen Kodex auferlegt, der nicht nur ihr Verhalten im Kampf, sondern auch ihr privates Leben regelte. Ihre kräftigen Pferde verschafften den gepanzerten Rittern einen klaren Vorteil gegen feindliche Fußtruppen, und in einer Zeit, in der vorwiegend Mann gegen Mann gekämpft wurde, spielten die Ritter die beherrschende Rolle auf dem Schlachtfeld. Gelegentlich wurden Ritter durch die Anwendung geradezu meisterhafter Infanterietaktiken überlistet, doch die Ära der Ritter endete erst mit der Erfindung des Schießpulvers.
TEXT.Italian: I cavalieri erano gli uomini d'armi senza macchia e senza paura dell'Europa medievale. Come i samurai del Giappone feudale, i cavalieri seguivano un rigido codice di comportamento, sia in battaglia sia nella vita privata. In sella a possenti destrieri, i cavalieri in armatura avevano un netto vantaggio sui loro avversari appiedati e rimasero la forza principale degli eserciti che combattevano all'arma bianca. Talvolta, tattiche particolarmente brillanti potevano sconfiggerli, ma i cavalieri divennero obsoleti solo con l'invenzione della polvere da sparo.
TEXT.Spanish: Los caballeros eran jinetes acorazados, característicos principalmente de la Europa del medievo. Al igual que los samuráis del Japón antiguo, los caballeros se regían por un estricto código de conducta, aplicable tanto a su comportamiento en batalla como a sus asuntos personales. Al luchar a lomos de poderosas monturas, los caballeros disfrutaban de una considerable ventaja sobre sus enemigos de a pie y dominaron los campos de batalla mientras se luchó principalmente cuerpo a cuerpo. De vez en cuando, el uso de alguna táctica ingeniosa permitía que la infantería derrotara a los caballeros, pero su decadencia no llegaría hasta la aparición de la pólvora.

TEXT.English: The koala (Phascolarctos cinereus) is an arboreal herbivorous marsupial native to Australia, and the only extant representative of the family Phascolarctidae.[PARAGRAPH:2]The koala is found in coastal regions of eastern and southern Australia, from Adelaide to the southern part of Cape York Peninsula. Populations also extend for considerable distances inland in regions with enough moisture to support suitable woodlands. The koalas of South Australia were largely exterminated during the early part of the 20th century, but the state has since been repopulated with Victorian stock. The koala is not found in Tasmania or Western Australia.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Koala[COLOR_REVERT] (Phascolarctos cinereus) ist ein Säugetier, das ausschließlich in Australien lebt. Aufgrund seines Körperbaus sieht er dem Bären ähnlich, ist jedoch ein Beuteltier. Größe und Gewicht der Tiere unterscheiden sich je nach Region und Ernährungsangebot teilweise stark. Sie werden maximal 85 cm groß und 14 kg schwer. Das wollige Fell ist bräunlich bis silbergrau, wobei es bei Koalas der kälteren Regionen dichter und dunkler ist. Es lässt Regenwasser von der Oberfläche abperlen. Die Greifhände haben scharfe Krallen und zwei Daumen, mit denen sie gut in den Bäumen klettern können. An den Füßen sind zwei Zehen miteinander verwachsen. Mit den verschmolzenen Krallen können sie Zecken entfernen. Der Beutel des Koalaweibchens ist nach unten hin geöffnet. Des Weiteren hat der Koala keinen Bauchnabel, was auf die besondere Art von Trächtigkeit und Geburt zurückzuführen ist.[NEWLINE]Da Koalas nachtaktiv sind, können sie gut hören. Noch wichtiger ist der Geruchssinn, der u.a. bei der Nahrungssuche hilft. Koalas fressen neben Rinde und Früchten des Eukalyptusbaums vor allem die Blätter, doch manche enthalten zu viele Toxine, was die empfindliche Nase erkennt. Mit der Nase erspüren Koalas auch Feinde und können fremde Duftmarkierungen bestimmen. Meist halten sie sich in den Bäumen auf, wo sie bis zu 20 Stunden täglich schlafen, um Energie zu sparen. Am Boden laufen sie auf allen Vieren. Zur Kommunikation benutzen die Tiere unterschiedliche Laute, von Bellen und Grunzen bis zu Klicklauten oder Schnurren.[NEWLINE]Feinde der Koalas sind Dingos, Raubvögel, Warane und Pythons. Doch auch die zahlreichen Buschbrände sind eine Bedrohung. Durch den Menschen kommen weitere Gefahrenquellen wie Autos, Schwimmbecken oder der Einsatz von Pestiziden hinzu.
TEXT.Polish: Koala (Phascolarctos cinereus) gatunek torbacza z rodziny koalowatych, nadrzewne zwierzê roœlino¿erne, zamieszkuj¹ce wschodni¹ Australiê. Koala schodzi na ziemiê tylko po to, by przejœæ na kolejne drzewo. ¯yje samotnie lub w niewielkich grupach z³o¿onych z samca i kilku samic. Jest jedynym wspó³czeœnie ¿yj¹cym przedstawicielem rodzaju Phascolarctos.[PARAGRAPH:2]Koala wystêpuje wzd³u¿ wybrze¿a Queensland, Nowej Po³udniowej Walii oraz Wiktorii. Wiêkszoœæ swego ¿ycia spêdza na najwy¿szych ga³êziach drzew eukaliptusowych. Jest zwierzêciem aktywnym noc¹.

TEXT.English: Warfare among tribal chieftains in Hawaii was common, with fierce battles raging frequently. By the 1780s, warfare was institutionalized, with formal rules and rituals. The chiefs built temples to pray, sacrifice, and perform ceremonies before launching campaigns. Warriors were known as koa, and gave their name to the koa tree, whose hard wood provided for many of their weapons. Hawaiian chieftains were practice of lua, a type of martial arts, and participated in annual festivals to test their abilities. The warrior code was brutal, and punishment was harsh and violent. An enemy captured in battle might have his entrails removed and every bone methodically broken while still alive.[PARAGRAPH:1]Warriors usually wore a loincloth and shaved and oiled their skin to prevent enemies from gripping them in combat. Nobles also wore a cape, as well as helmets made of wicker or gourds for protection. These warriors used a variety of weapons such as the ihe (short spear), pololu (long spear), pahoa (wooden dagger), and other weapons.
TEXT.French: La guerre entre les chefs tribaux à Hawaii était commun, avec féroces batailles font rage souvent. Par les années 1780, la guerre a été institutionnalisée, avec les règles formelles et les rites. Les chefs ont construit des temples pour prier, le sacrifice, et effectuer des cérémonies avant le lancement de campagnes. Guerriers étaient connus comme koa, et a donné son nom à l'arbre koa, dont les bois durs fournis pour beaucoup de leurs armes. Hawaiian chefs étaient pratique de la lua, un type d'arts martiaux, et participé à des festivals annuels de tester leurs capacités. Le guerrier code a été brutale, et de la répression est sévère et violent. Un ennemi capturé dans la bataille pourrait avoir enlevé ses entrailles et les os brisés méthodiquement tout encore en vie.[PARAGRAPH:1]Guerriers généralement portaient un pagne et rasé huilé leur peau et pour empêcher les ennemis de préhension eux dans le combat. Nobles portait aussi une cape, ainsi que les casques en osier ou gourdes pour la protection. Ces guerriers utilisé une variété d'armes telles que les ihe (lance courte), pololu (longue lance), pahoa (poignard en bois), et d'autres armes.
TEXT.German: Warfare unter den Stämmen Häuptlinge auf Hawaii war häufig mit heftigen Kämpfe wüteten häufig. Mit dem 1780er, Kriegsführung war institutionalisiert, mit formalen Regeln und Rituale. Die Häupter gebaut Tempel zu beten, opfern, und Zeremonien vor dem Start Kampagnen. Krieger wurden bekannt als koa, und gab ihr den Namen zu koa Baum, dessen hartem Holz, die für viele ihrer Waffen. Hawaiian Häuptlinge wurden Praxis der lua, eine Art von Kampfkunst, und nahm an jährlichen Festivals zu testen ihre Fähigkeiten. Der Krieger Code war brutal, und die Strafe war hart und gewalttätig. Ein Feind gefangen in der Schlacht hätte seine Eingeweide entfernt, und alle Knochen gebrochen, während methodisch noch am Leben.[PARAGRAPH:1]Warriors Regel trug einen Lendenschurz und rasiert und geölt ihre Haut, um zu verhindern, Feinde Greifen von ihnen im Kampf. Nobles trug einen Umhang, sowie Helme aus Rattan oder Kürbisse für den Schutz. Diese Krieger verwendet eine Vielzahl von Waffen wie die ihe (kurz Speer), pololu (lange Speer), pahoa (Holz Dolch), und andere Waffen.
TEXT.Italian: La guerra tra i capi tribali nelle Hawaii era comune, con feroci battaglie che infuriavano frequentemente. Per il 1780s, la guerra è stata istituzionalizzata, con regole formali e rituali. Capi costruito templi a pregare, di sacrificio, e di eseguire le cerimonie prima di lanciare campagne. Guerrieri erano conosciuti come koa, e ha dato il nome alla koa albero, il cui legno duro di molte delle loro armi. Hawaiian notabili erano pratica di lua, un tipo di arti marziali, e ha partecipato a festival annuale per verificare la loro capacità. Il codice è stato brutale guerriero, e la punizione fu duro e violento. Un nemico catturato in battaglia potrebbe avere rimosso il suo viscere e metodicamente ogni osso rotto, mentre ancora vivo.[PARAGRAPH:1]Warriors solitamente indossava una loincloth e rasato e oleato loro pelle per evitare che i nemici da loro presa in combattimento. Nobili anche indossato un mantello, come pure i caschi di vimini o gourdes per la protezione. Questi guerrieri utilizzato una varietà di armi, come il ihe (breve lancia), pololu (lunga lancia), pahoa (pugnale di legno), e di altre armi.
TEXT.Spanish: La guerra entre los jefes tribales en Hawai era común, con feroces batallas azotan con frecuencia. Por los 1780s, la guerra fue institucionalizada, con reglas formales y rituales. Los jefes construido templos de oración, sacrificio, y realizar ceremonias antes de la iniciación de campañas. Warriors se conoce como koa, y dio su nombre a la koa árbol, cuya madera dura para siempre muchas de sus armas. Hawaiian eran jefes de lua práctica, un tipo de artes marciales, y ha participado en festivales anuales de poner a prueba sus habilidades. El código guerrero fue brutal, y el castigo era duro y violento. Un enemigo capturado en la batalla podría haber eliminado sus entrañas y metódicamente cada hueso roto mientras siguen vivos.[PARAGRAPH:1]Warriors generalmente llevaba una taparrabos y afeitado y su piel engrasada para evitar que los enemigos de prensión ellos en combate. Nobles también llevaba una capa, así como los cascos hechos de mimbre o calabazas para la protección. Estos guerreros utilizan una variedad de armas, como la ihe (lanza corta), pololu (lanza larga), pahoa (daga de madera), y otras armas.

TEXT.English: Theodoros Kolokotronis (3 April 1770 - 4 February 1843) was a Greek general and the pre-eminent leader of the Greek War of Independence against the Ottoman Empire. Kolokotronis' greatest success was the defeat of the Ottoman army under Mahmud Dramali Pasha at the Battle of Dervenakia in 1822. In 1825, he was appointed commander-in-chief of the Greek forces in the Peloponnese. Today, Kolokotronis ranks among the most revered of the protagonists of the War of Independence.
TEXT.French: Théodoros Kolokotronis (3 avril 1770 - 4 février 1843) était un général grec et le principal chef de la Guerre d'indépendance grecque contre l'Empire ottoman. Le plus grand succès de Kolokotronis fut la défaite de l'armée ottomane commandée par Mahmud Dramali Pacha lors de la bataille de Dervenakia en 1822. En 1825, il fut nommé commandant en chef des forces grecques dans le Péloponnèse. Aujourd'hui, Kolokotronis est parmi les protagonistes les plus vénérés de la Guerre d'indépendance.
TEXT.Polish: Theodoros Kolokotronis (3 April 1770 - 4 February 1843) - grecki genera³ z czasów walki o niepodleg³oœæ z Imperium Ottomañskim.

TEXT.English: The main body of the float was composed of nine balsa tree trunks up to 14 m (45 ft) long, 60 cm (2 ft) in diameter, lashed together with 30 mm (1.14 in) hemp ropes. Cross-pieces of balsa logs 5.5 m (18 ft) long and 30 cm (1 ft) in diameter were lashed across the logs at 91 cm (3 ft) intervals to give lateral support. Pine splashboards clad the bow, and lengths of pine 25 mm (1 in) thick and 60 cm (2 ft) wide were wedged between the balsa logs and used as centreboards.
TEXT.French: Le corps principal du radeau était composé de neuf troncs d'arbres de balsa mesurant jusqu'à 14 m (45 pi) de long, 60 cm (2 pi) de diamètre, liés ensemble avec des cordes de chanvre de 30 mm (1,14 po). Des traverses en balsa de 5,5 m (18 pi) de long et 30 cm (1 pi) de diamètre étaient attachées aux troncs à intervalles de 91 cm (3 pi) pour assurer un support latéral. Des pare-éclaboussures en pin recouvraient la proue, et des longueurs de pin de 25 mm (1 po) d'épaisseur et 60 cm (2 pi) de largeur étaient calées entre les troncs de balsa et utilisées comme dérives.

German.Text: Lachender Hans:Lachenden Hans:Lachenden Hans:Lachenden Hans:Lachende Hänse:Lachenden Hänse:Lachenden Hänsen:Lachenden Hänse

TEXT.English: Kookaburras (genus Dacelo) are terrestrial kingfishers native to Australia and New Guinea. They are large to very large, with a total length of 28 - 42 cm (11 - 17 in). The name is a loanword from Wiradjuri guuguubarra, and is onomatopoeic of its call. The single member of the genus Clytoceyx, though commonly referred to as the Shovel-billed Kookaburra, is not treated in this article.[PARAGRAPH:2]Kookaburras are best known for their unmistakable call, which sounds uncannily like loud, echoing human laughter good-natured, but rather hysterical, merriment in the case of the renowned Laughing Kookaburra (Dacelo novaeguineae); and maniacal cackling in the case of the slightly smaller Blue-winged Kookaburra (D. leachii). They are generally not closely associated with water, and can be found in habitats ranging from humid forest to arid savanna, but also in suburban and residential areas near running water and where food can be searched for easily.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Jägerliest[COLOR_REVERT] (Dacelo novaeguineae) ist ein Vogel aus der Familie der Eisvögel, der bei uns besser unter dem Namen Lachender Hans bekannt ist. Er kommt hauptsächlich im Osten und Südosten von Australien vor. Dort wird er Kookaburra genannt.[NEWLINE]Der Lachende Hans hat ein markantes weißes bis elfenbeinfarbenes Federkleid. Oberseite und Flügel sind dunkelbraun bis braun, genau wie der Überaugenstreif, der ihn gegen das grelle Sonnenlicht schützt. Er verfügt über einen kräftigen Schnabel und scharfe Krallen. Während der Kopf im Vergleich zum Körper ziemlich groß ist, sind Flügel und Schwanz relativ kurz. Seinen Namen hat dem Lachenden Hans seine an lautes Gelächter erinnernde Stimme eingebracht, die besonders zur Revierverteidigung eingesetzt wird.[NEWLINE]Der Vogel erfreut sich in Australien großer Beliebtheit, weil er Mäuse, Ratten und giftige Schlangen vertilgt. Der Lachende Hans ist aber auch als vorwitziger Dieb bekannt, der Campern dreist die mitgebrachten Speisen klaut. Da er sein Gelächter immer zu bestimmten Zeiten erschallen lässt, spielte der Lachende Hans auch schon in der Mythologie der Aborigines eine besondere Rolle.
TEXT.Polish: Kukabura (Dacelo novaeguineae), du¿y ptak z rodziny zimorodków, osi¹gaj¹cy d³ugoœæ cia³a do 43 cm. Wystêpuje we wschodniej i po³udniowej Australii. Zamieszkuje tereny o niezbyt gêstym zadrzewieniu. Ubarwienie cia³a w tonacji bia³obr¹zowej, skrzyd³a i grzbiet ciemne, bia³o nakrapiane. Charakterystyczn¹ cech¹ wygl¹du jest potê¿ny dziób, dolna czêœæ be¿owa, górna ciemniejsza, niebieskawa. Od¿ywia siê du¿ymi owadami, jaszczurkami i wê¿ami. Wydaje donoœny g³os, przypominaj¹cy histeryczny œmiech cz³owieka. GnieŸdzi siê w dziuplach starych drzew.

TEXT.English: The Kora, Khora or Cora were one of the ten indigenous tribes of the Great Andamanese people, originally living on the eastern part of North Andaman Island in the Indian Ocean. The tribe is now extinct, although some of the remaining Great Andamanese on Strait Island claim to have Kora ancestors. The tribe spoke a distinctive Kora language, closely related to the other Great Andamanese languages. The native name for the language was Aka-Kora, also spelled Aka-Khora or Aka-Cora (Aka- being a prefix for "tongue"); and this name is often used for the tribe itself. They were divided between shore-dwellers (aryoto) and forest-dwellers (eremtaga) subtribes.

The hwacha was an anti-personnel weapon developed by the Koreans, and it is believed to have been one of the first gunpowder-based anti-personnel weapons ever created. The hwacha was a platform constructed to launch large numbers of fire arrows (or "Shin Ki Chon") at enemy targets. Hwachas were mounted on carts and wheelbarrows. A typical hwacha platform held seven or more rows of fifteen arrows and could fire from 150 to 200 fire arrows at once. The fire arrows had hollow tips and the shafts were fitted with narrow pipes. The tips and pipes were filled with gunpowder and each was equipped with a fuse. [PARAGRAPH:2]When lit, the fire arrows' fuses would first ignite the powder in the pipes, causing the arrows to shoot off like rockets. The fuses would continue to burn until they reached the gunpowder in the arrows' heads, which would then explode - with luck, somewhere near enemy soldiers. However, the weapons were extremely inaccurate and the Koreans had to fire off huge volleys to ensure significant damage to their targets. [PARAGRAPH:2]The Shin Ki Chon fire arrows were first developed in Korea and China around 1400 AD, and the hwacha dates from shortly after this period. The fire arrows could travel as far as one kilometer, an amazing range for artillery weapons at that time. Given their famous inaccuracy, the hwacha was best used against massed enemy formations at medium range: even if not precisely on target when they exploded, shrapnel from the fire arrows could still significantly hurt the enemy. Hwacha also were useful shock weapons, due to the noise and light produced by the rocket-like exploding arrows, and even seasoned troops could break and run the first time they encountered the strange new weapon. [PARAGRAPH:2]The best-known use of hwacha historically was during the Japanese invasion of Korea in 1592-98. The Japanese samurai typically advanced in dense groups - easy targets for the hwacha. At the Battle of Haengju, 3400 Koreans were able to defeat 30,000 Japanese with the help of 40 hwacha. [PARAGRAPH:2]The hwacha eventually became obsolete when more efficient metal projectiles (like bullets and artillery shells) replaced the fire arrows. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.French: Le Hwacha est une arme antipersonnel développée par les Coréens. On suppose qu'il est l'une des premières armes antipersonnel à poudre. Le Hwacha est un plateau construit pour lancer de nombreuses flèches de feu (ou "Shin Ki Chon") sur des cibles ennemies. Il est monté sur des chariots et des brouettes. Un plateau Hwacha classique contient au moins sept rangées de quinze flèches et peut tirer de 150 à 200 flèches simultanément. Les flèches de feu se composent de pointes creuses et les tiges sont faites avec d'étroits tubes. Les pointes et les tiges sont remplies de poudre et comportent toutes deux une mèche. [PARAGRAPH:2]Une fois allumées, les mèches des flèches de feu vont d'abord enflammer la poudre des tiges, faisant partir les flèches telles des fusées. Les mèches continuent ensuite à brûler jusqu'à ce qu'elles atteignent la poudre des pointes des flèches, qui explosent alors, de préférence près des soldats ennemis. Cependant, ces armes ne sont pas du tout précises et les Coréens doivent envoyer énormément de flèches pour être certains d'endommager suffisamment leurs cibles. [PARAGRAPH:2]Les flèches de feu Shin Ki Chon sont d'abord développées en Corée et en Chine vers 1400 ap. J.-C. et le Hwacha est créé peu de temps après. Les flèches de feu peuvent parcourir jusqu'à un kilomètre, ce qui est une distance incroyable pour les armes d'artillerie de l'époque. En raison de son célèbre manque de précision, le Hwacha est surtout utilisé contre les formations ennemies de masse situées à moyenne distance : même si les flèches n'explosent pas précisément sur la cible, leurs éclats peuvent blesser sévèrement l'ennemi. Le Hwacha est aussi une arme choc très utile en raison du bruit et de l'éclat produits par les flèches explosant comme des fusées. Même des troupes aguerries peuvent se disperser et prendre la fuite la première fois qu'elles sont confrontées à cette nouvelle arme étrange. [PARAGRAPH:2]L'utilisation la plus connue du Hwacha remonte à l'invasion japonaise de la Corée de 1592 à 1598. Les samouraïs japonais avancent généralement en groupes denses, et représentent des cibles faciles pour le Hwacha. Lors de la bataille de Haengju, 3400 Coréens parviennent à vaincre 30 000 Japonais à l'aide de 40 Hwacha. [PARAGRAPH:2]Le Hwacha finit par devenir obsolète lorsque des projectiles métalliques plus efficaces, tels que les balles et les obus d'artillerie, remplacent les flèches de feu. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.German: Die Hwach'a war eine von den Koreanern entwickelte Anti-Personen-Waffe, die vermutlich erste Schwarzpulver-basierte Waffe überhaupt. Sie besaß einen Aufbau, der es ermöglichte, eine große Anzahl Brandpfeile ("Shin Ki Chon") auf feindliche Ziele abzufeuern. Hwach'as waren auf Wagen oder Schubkarren montiert. Eine herkömmliche Hwach'a enthielt sieben oder mehr Halterungsreihen für je fünfzehn Pfeile und konnte somit zwischen 150 und 200 Brandpfeile auf einmal abschießen. Die Pfeile besaßen Hohlspitzen und ihre Schäfte waren im Innern mit schmalen Röhrchen bestückt. Die Spitzen und Röhrchen wurden mit Schwarzpulver gefüllt und jeder einzelne Pfeil wurde mit einer Lunte versehen. [PARAGRAPH:2]Nach dem Anzünden setzten die Lunten zunächst das Schießpulver in den Röhrchen in Brand, was dazu führte, dass die Pfeile wie Raketen losschossen. Dann brannten die Lunten weiter, bis sie das Schießpulver in den Pfeilspitzen erreichten und diese zur Explosion brachten - mit etwas Gück in der Nähe feindlicher Soldaten. Der Nachteil dieser Waffe war allerdings, dass sie sehr ungenau war, daher mussten die Koreaner enorme Salven abfeuern, um eine maßgebliche Auswirkung auf die Zielobjekte sicherzustellen. [PARAGRAPH:2]Die "Shin Ki Chon"-Brandpfeile wurden erstmals um 1400 nach Christus in Korea und China entwickelt, die Hwach'a folgte kurz darauf. Ein Brandpfeil konnte eine Entfernung von bis zu einem Kilometer überwinden - eine bemerkenswerte Reichweite für die Artilleriewaffen dieser Zeit. Wegen ihrer Ungenauigkeit ließ sich die Hwach'a am besten gegen konzentrierte feindliche Formationen in mittlerer Entfernung einsetzen, denn selbst wenn die Pfeile ihr Ziel nicht unmittelbar erreichten, konnten die bei der Explosion freigesetzten Splitter dem Gegner immer noch erheblichen Schaden zufügen. Abgesehen davon eigneten sich die Hwach'as wegen der Geräusche und Lichteffekte der raketenähnlichen, explodierenden Pfeile auch als Schockwaffen und konnten selbst erfahrene Truppen dazu bringen, die Flucht zu ergreifen, wenn sie es zum allerersten Mal mit dieser merkwürdigen neuen Waffengattung zu tun bekamen. [PARAGRAPH:2]Das bekannteste geschichtliche Ereignis, bei dem Hwach'as zum Einsatz kamen, war die japanische Invasion in Korea in der Zeit von 1592-1598. Die japanischen Samurai rückten üblicherweise in dicht gedrängten Gruppen vor - leichte Beute für die Hwach'a: In der Schlacht bei Haengju gelang es einer zahlenmäßig eindeutig unterlegenen Streitmacht von 3.400 Koreanern mithilfe von 40 Hwach'as, eine Armee von 30.000 Japanern zu besiegen. [PARAGRAPH:2]Mit der Verfügbarkeit leistungsfähigerer Metallprojektile (wie Kugeln und Artilleriegranaten), welche die Brandpfeile ersetzten, waren die Hwach'as schließlich überholt und wurden allgemein ausgemustert. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Italian: La hwacha era un'arma antiuomo sviluppata dai Coreani e si ritiene che sia stata una delle prime armi antiuomo a utilizzare la polvere da sparo. La hwacha era costituita da una piattaforma progettata per scagliare numerose frecce incendiarie (o "Shin Ki Chon") contro i bersagli nemici. Le hwacha erano montate su carri o carriole. Una tipica piattaforma hwacha conteneva sette o più file di quindici frecce e poteva sparare da 150 a 200 frecce incendiarie alla volta. Le frecce avevano le punte cave e le aste erano riempite di piccoli tubi. Le punte e i tubi erano a loro volta pieni di polvere da sparo collegata a una miccia. [PARAGRAPH:2]Una volta accesa la miccia, si sarebbe incendiata dapprima la polvere da sparo nei tubicini, facendo partire via le frecce come razzi. La miccia nel frattempo avrebbe continuato a bruciare fino a raggiungere la punta della freccia, che con un po' di fortuna sarebbe esplosa vicino ai soldati nemici. Si trattava comunque di un'arma poco precisa e bisognava scagliare intere piattaforme per provocare danni significativi. [PARAGRAPH:2]Le frecce incendiarie Shin Ki Chon furono prodotte in Corea e in Cina nel 1400 d.C. mentre la hwacha risale a poco dopo. Le frecce potevano percorrere anche un chilometro, una portata eccezionale per l'artiglieria del tempo. Considerata la loro famigerata imprecisione, le hwacha erano utilizzate contro larghe formazioni nemiche a media distanza: anche se quando esplodevano non colpivano direttamente un bersaglio, i frammenti delle frecce potevano infliggere danni significativi. Le hwacha erano utili anche per scioccare il nemico con il rumore e le luci provocati dalla detonazione delle frecce-razzo. Persino truppe esperte potevano vacillare e rompere la formazione la prima volta che incontravano questa strana arma. [PARAGRAPH:2]L'utilizzo più efficace della hwacha si ebbe storicamente nell'invasione Giapponese della Corea del 1592-98. I samurai giapponesi di solito avanzavano in gruppi compatti: il bersaglio ideale di una hwacha. Nella battaglia di Haengju, 3.400 Coreani sconfissero 30.000 Giapponesi grazie a 40 hwacha. [PARAGRAPH:2]La hwacha divenne obsoleta con l'introduzione dei più precisi proiettili metallici (come le pallottole e i proiettili d'artiglieria), che rimpiazzarono le frecce incendiarie. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Spanish: La hwacha, un arma antipersonal desarrollada por los coreanos, puede que fuera una de las primeras armas de pólvora usadas contra soldados en toda la historia. Se trataba de una plataforma construida para lanzar gran cantidad de flechas de fuego (o "shin ki chon") contra objetivos enemigos. Estas armas se montaban en carros o carretillas. Una plataforma de hwacha típica tenía siete o más filas de quince flechas y podía disparar entre ciento cincuenta y doscientas flechas a la vez. Las flechas de fuego tenían la punta hueca y los astiles tenían un fino tubo al final. La punta y los tubos se rellenaban de pólvora y a la flecha se le ponía una mecha. [PARAGRAPH:2]Cuando se encendían, las mechas inflamaban la pólvora de los tubitos y las flechas salían disparadas como cohetes. Las mechas seguían ardiendo hasta llegar a la pólvora de la punta, que entonces explotaba... con un poco de suerte, cerca de los soldados enemigos. Sin embargo, estas armas eran sumamente imprecisas y los coreanos tenían que lanzarlas en grandes cantidades para asegurarse de que hacían daño significativo a sus enemigos. [PARAGRAPH:2]Las flechas de fuego (shin ki chon) se inventaron en Corea y China alrededor del año 1400 a. C. y la hwacha data de poco después. Las flechas podían alcanzar distancias de hasta un kilómetro, un alcance asombroso para la artillería de la época. Habida cuenta de su famosa falta de precisión, las hwachas se usaban contra formaciones enemigas masivas a media distancia: aunque no explotasen sobre sus objetivos, la metralla de las explosiones podía causar daños significativos. También eran útiles como armas de choque debido al ruido y la luz producidos por la explosión de las flechas, e incluso unas tropas experimentadas podían darse a la fuga la primera vez que se encontraban con este arma extraña y nueva. [PARAGRAPH:2]El uso más famoso de las hwachas se produjo durante la invasión japonesa de Corea (1592-98). Normalmente, los samuráis japoneses avanzaban en formaciones cerradas: objetivos fáciles para las hwachas. En la batalla de Haengju, tres mil cuatrocientos coreanos pudieron vencer a treinta mil japoneses con la ayuda de cuarenta hwachas. [PARAGRAPH:2]Este arma quedaría obsoleta cuando los proyectiles metálicos, más eficaces (como las balas y los obuses), reemplazaron a las flechas. [PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: The kris is an asymmetrical dagger with distinctive blade-patterning achieved through alternating laminations of iron and nickelous iron (pamor). While most strongly associated with the culture of Indonesia the kris is also indigenous to Malaysia, Thailand, Brunei, Singapore and the southern Philippines where it is known as kalis with variants existing as a sword rather than a dagger. The kris is famous for its distinctive wavy blade, although many have straight blades as well.
TEXT.French: Le kris est un poignard asymétrique avec un motif de lame distinctif obtenu par des laminations alternées de fer et de fer nickelé (pamor). Bien qu'il soit principalement associé à la culture indonésienne, le kris est également indigène en Malaisie, Thaïlande, Brunei, Singapour et dans le sud des Philippines où il est appelé kalis, avec des variantes existant sous forme d'épée plutôt que de poignard. Le kris est célèbre pour sa lame ondulée distinctive, bien que beaucoup aient aussi des lames droites.

TEXT.English: Krum the Fearsome was khan of Bulgaria from sometime after 796 but before 803 until his death in 814. During his reign the Bulgarian territory doubled in size, spreading from the middle Danube to the Dnieper and from Odrin to the Tatra Mountains. His able and energetic rule brought law and order to Bulgaria and developed the rudiments of state organization.
TEXT.French: Krum le Redoutable fut khan de Bulgarie d'une date après 796 mais avant 803 jusqu'à sa mort en 814. Pendant son règne, le territoire bulgare a doublé en taille, s'étendant du Danube moyen au Dniestr et d'Odrin aux montagnes Tatra. Son règne habile et énergique a apporté la loi et l'ordre en Bulgarie et développé les rudiments de l'organisation étatique.
TEXT.Polish: Krum (Korum) Zwyciêzca lub Straszny, (ur.?, zm. 814) - kolejny w³adca Bu³garii po chanie Kardamie oraz za³o¿yciel nowej dynastii. Jego ród prawdopodobnie wywodzi³ siê z Protobu³garów panoñskich. By³ pierwszym w³adc¹ nosz¹cym tytu³ Chan Subigi.

TEXT.English: Kubrat was the Bulgars ruler credited with establishing the confederation of Old Great Bulgaria in c. 635 AD. In the Nominalia of the Bulgarian khans Kubrat is mentioned as Kvrt, and the descendant of the Dulo clan. Kubrat spent his early life at the Byzantine Empire imperial palace in Constantinople.
TEXT.French: Kubrat était le dirigeant des Bulgares crédité d'avoir établi la confédération de la Grande Bulgarie Ancienne vers 635 ap. J.-C. Dans les Nominalia des khans bulgares, Kubrat est mentionné sous le nom de Kvrt, descendant du clan Dulo. Kubrat a passé sa jeunesse au palais impérial de l'Empire byzantin à Constantinople.

TEXT.English: Kuchum Khan was the last khan (ruled 1563-1598) of the Khanate of Sibir. Kuchum Khan's attempt to spread Islam and his cross-border raids met with vigorous opposition from the Russian Tsar Ivan the Terrible (reigned 1547-1584), who sent a force of Cossacks to confront him head-on (ca. 1580). Kuchum is particularly noted for the vigorous resistance he offered to the Russian invaders.
TEXT.French: Kuchum Khan fut le dernier khan (régna de 1563 à 1598) du Khanat de Sibérie. Sa tentative de diffusion de l'Islam et ses raids transfrontaliers rencontrèrent une forte opposition de la part du tsar russe Ivan le Terrible (régna de 1547 à 1584), qui envoya une force de cosaques pour l'affronter directement (vers 1580). Kuchum est particulièrement connu pour la résistance vigoureuse qu'il opposa aux envahisseurs russes.

TEXT.English: Q'uq'umatz was a deity of the Postclassic K'iche' Maya. Q'uq'umatz was the Feathered Serpent divinity of the Popol Vuh who created humanity together with the god Tepeu. Q'uq'umatz is considered to be the rough equivalent of the Aztec god Quetzalcoatl, and also of Kukulkan of the Yucatec Maya tradition. It is likely that the feathered serpent deity was borrowed from one of these two peoples and blended with other deities to provide the god Q'uq'umatz that the K'iche' worshipped. Q'uq'umatz may have had his origin in the Valley of Mexico; some scholars have equated the deity with the Aztec deity Ehecatl-Quetzalcoatl, who was also a creator god. Q'uq'umatz may originally have been the same god as Tohil, the K'iche' sun god who also had attributes of the feathered serpent, but they later diverged and each deity came to have a separate priesthood.

Kujula Kadphises was a Kushan prince who united the Yuezhi confederation during the 1st century CE, and became the first Kushan emperor. According to the Rabatak inscription, he was the grandfather of the great Kushan king Kanishka I.
TEXT.French: Kujula Kadphises était un prince kouchan qui a unifié la confédération des Yuezhi au 1er siècle de notre ère et devint le premier empereur kouchan. Selon l'inscription de Rabatak, il était le grand-père du grand roi kouchan Kanishka I.

TEXT.English: Kukulkan is closely related to Gukumatz of the K'iche' Maya tradition and Quetzalcoatl of Aztec mythology. In Yucatn, references to the deity Kukulkan are confused by references to a named individual who bore the name of the god. Because of this, the distinction between the two has become blurred. Although heavily Mexicanised, Kukulkan has his origins among the Maya of the Classic Period, when he was known as Waxaklahun Ubah Kan, the War Serpent, and he has been identified as the Postclassic version of the Vision Serpent of Classic Maya art. The cult of Kukulkan/Quetzalcoatl was the first Mesoamerican religion to transcend the old Classic Period linguistic and ethnic divisions. Regardless, although Kukulkan was mentioned as a historical person by Maya writers of the 16th century, the earlier 9th century texts at Chichen Itza never identified him as human and artistic representations depicted him as a Vision Serpent entwined around the figures of nobles. At Chichen Itza, Kukulkan is also depicted presiding over sacrifice scenes. According to later Mesoamerican chroniclers, Kukulcan was a mysterious stranger with a craggy face. He was opposed to sacrified, and was considered to be something of a culture hero, for he taught people crafting, painting, and writing. However, jealous rivals caused several scandals to occur under Kukulcan's name, and Kukulcan in self-disgust traveled to the edge of the sea, where he departed in a raft of snakes. There are several other different versions of the figure of Kukulcan, some sympathetic, describing him as a culture hero and a benevolent leader, and others that describe him in a less positive light, saying that he was a warrior and military aggressor. Regardless, the figure of Kukulcan, or Quetzalcoatl, as he is known amongst the Nahua peoples, continues to this day to inspire even the descendants of the Nahua and Maya peoples.
TEXT.Polish: Kukulkan (Kukulcan, Tepeu Gucumatz) w kulturze Majów odpowiednik azteckiego boga Quetzalcoatla, a tak¿e inkaskiego Wirakoczy; Zielony Pierzasty W¹¿, stworzyciel œwiata i krzewiciel cywilizacji - uto¿samiany z twórc¹ kultury Majów Itzamn¹. Kukulkan jako bóg i w³adca czterech elementów: ziemi, wiatru, wody oraz ognia - reprezentowanych kolejno przez jego atrybuty czyli kukurydzê, sêpa, rybê i jaszczurkê uznawany by³ tak¿e za bóstwo odrodzenia i zmartwychwstania, natomiast w kulturze Tolteków za podniesionego do rangi bóstwa za³o¿yciela cywilizacji, twórcê medycyny i pierwszego systemu kalendarzowego, nauczyciela rolnictwa i rybo³ówstwa. Niekiedy nazywany tak¿e "Bogiem B". Kukulkan wed³ug legend Majów odp³yn¹³ na wschód sk¹d powróci tu¿ przed koñcem œwiata, przedstawiany jest zwykle jako postaæ z du¿ym nosem, czasami z atrybutami charakterystycznymi dla Itzamny czyli wê¿em i muszlami. Kukulkanowi poœwiêcona jest œwi¹tynia-piramida El Castillo w staro¿ytnym mieœcie Majów ChichŸn Itza.

TEXT.English: Originally a revolutionary league working for the overthrow of the Chinese monarchy, the Nationalists became a political party in the first year of the Chinese republic (1912). The party participated in the first Chinese parliament, which was soon dissolved by a coup d'état (1913). This defeat moved its leader, Sun Yat-sen, to organize it more tightly, first (1914) on the model of a Chinese secret society and, later (1923-24), under Soviet guidance, on that of the Bolshevik party. The Nationalist Party owed its early successes largely to Soviet aid and advice and to close collaboration with the Chinese communists (1924-27).
TEXT.Italian: Il Kuomintang è l'unità taiwanese che sostituisce la fanteria. Inizia con le promozioni Pattuglia I, Pattuglia II e Dedicazione.

TEXT.English: Some traces remain of the presence of the Kushans in the area of Bactria and Sogdiana. Archaeological structures are known in Takht-I-Sangin, Surkh Kotal (a monumental temple), and in the palace of Khalchayan. Various sculptures and friezes are known, representing horse-riding archers, and significantly men with artificially deformed skulls, such as the Kushan prince of Khalchayan (a practice well attested in nomadic Central Asia). The Chinese first referred to these people as the Yuezhi and said they established the Kushan Empire, although the relationship between the Yuezhi and the Kushans is still unclear. On the ruins of ancient Hellenistic cities such as Ai-Khanoum, the Kushans are known to have built fortresses. The earliest documented ruler, and the first one to proclaim himself as a Kushan ruler, was Heraios. He calls himself a "tyrant" on his coins, and also exhibits skull deformation. He may have been an ally of the Greeks, and he shared the same style of coinage. Heraios may have been the father of the first Kushan emperor Kujula Kadphises.

Nubia was known as "Ta-Seti", or the Land of the Bow, by the Egyptians. The skills of the Nubian Archers were well known in the ancient world. In rise of Nations, these archers make up one line of unique units for the Nubians. The Kushite Archer, named after the first Nubian Kingdom of Kush, makes their appearance in the Classical Age, continuing to the Gunpowder Age with the Apedemak Archer, named after the Nubian God of War.
TEXT.Polish: Nubia - kraina historyczna znajduj¹ca siê w pó³nocno-wschodniej Afryce, w po³udniowym Egipcie i pó³nocnym Sudanie. Zajmuje œrodkowy bieg Nilu pomiêdzy Asuanem a Chartumem (miêdzy VI a I katarakt¹). W staro¿ytnoœci zwana Kusz, zamieszkana by³a przez lud spokrewniony z Egipcjanami, który w po³owie II tysi¹clecia p.n.e. uleg³ wymieszaniu z nap³ywaj¹cymi od po³udnia plemionami.

TEXT.English: The Fatimid military was based largely on the Kutama Berber tribesmen brought along on the march to Egypt, and they remained an important part of the military even after Tunisia began to break away. After their successful establishment in Egypt, local Egyptian forces were also incorporated into the army, so the Fatimid Army were reinforced by North African soldiers from Algeria to Egypt in the Eastern North. (and of succeeding dynasties as well).
TEXT.French: L'armée fatimide reposait en grande partie sur les tribus berbères Kutama amenées lors de la marche vers l'Égypte, et elles restèrent une part importante de l'armée même après que la Tunisie commença à se séparer. Après leur établissement réussi en Égypte, les forces égyptiennes locales furent également incorporées dans l'armée, ainsi l'armée fatimide fut renforcée par des soldats nord-africains de l'Algérie à l'Égypte dans le Nord-Est. (ainsi que des dynasties successeurs).

TEXT.English: Kwame Nkrumah PC (September 18 or 21, 1909 - 27 April 1972) led Ghana to independence from Britain in 1957 and served as its first prime minister and president. Nkrumah first gained power as leader of the colonial Gold Coast, and held it until he was deposed in 1966.
TEXT.French: Kwame Nkrumah PC (18 ou 21 septembre 1909 - 27 avril 1972) a conduit le Ghana à l'indépendance du Royaume-Uni en 1957 et en a été le premier premier ministre et président. Nkrumah a d'abord pris le pouvoir en tant que leader de la Côte d'Or colonial, et l'a conservé jusqu'à sa déposition en 1966.

TEXT.English: Labarna I was the traditional first King of the Hittites, the traditional founder of the Hittite Old Kingdom (fl. ca. 1600 1450 BC), though his existence is sometimes questioned by modern scholars. Labarna was not the first in line to the throne. PU-Sarruma designated Labarna as his successor after his own sons revolted against him. Upon PU-Sarruma's death, Labarna and Papahdilmah, one of PU-Sarruma's sons, contended for the throne, with Labarna emerging victorious. What little is known about him is culled mainly from the Edict of Telipinu, which states that he overwhelmed his enemies and "made them borders of the sea", a statement which may refer to conquests as far as the Mediterranean coast in the south, and the Black Sea in the north. He installed his sons as governors in several cities including Tuwanuwa, Hupisna, Landa, and Lusna (the identities of these cities are uncertain, but thought to perhaps be Tyana, Heraclea Cybistra, Laranda, and Lystra). Through his conquests, he was responsible for laying the groundwork for the Hittite empire that was to come.
TEXT.Polish: Labarna I znany jako Hattusili I z Kussary (w³aœciwie Labarna lub Tabarnas) król hetycki w okresie 1650-1620 p.n.e. Podczas swojego panowania podbi³ Anatoliê i pó³nocn¹ Syriê. Przeniós³ stolicê z Nesy do Hattusy i najprawdopodobniej wtedy przyj¹³ imiê Hattusili. Pañstwo Hattusili od po³udnia s¹siadowa³o z Kizzuwatna i królestwem Arzawa, od pó³nocnego zachodu z Troj¹, od pó³nocy z azjanickimi plemionami Kaska, od wschodu z Hurytami, a od po³udniowego wschodu z Amorytami. Hattusili I skierowa³ ekspansjê terytorialn¹ pañstwa hetyckiego przede wszystkim na tereny pó³nocnej Syrii i pó³nocnej Mezopotamii (w czasie jednej z wypraw przekroczy³ nawet Eufrat). Na terytorium Syrii poprowadzi³ kilka wypraw wojennych, zdobywaj¹c i ³upi¹c liczne miasta: Zaruna, Hassu, Hahhu i Zippasna. Jego najwytrwalszym syryjskim przeciwnikiem by³o le¿¹ce w krainie Jamchad bogate miasto Halab (Aleppo), które wystêpowa³o jako sojusznik innych miast atakowanych przez Hetytów. Hattusilis wyznaczy³ na króla swego adoptowanego syna Mursili.

TEXT.English: The earliest identified Nigerian culture is the Nok culture that thrived between 1500 BC and 200 AD on the Jos Plateau in northeastern Nigeria. Information is lacking from the first millennium BC following the Nok ascendancy, but by the 2nd millennium BC there was active trade from Ancient Egypt via Nubia through the Sahara to the forest with the savanna people acting as intermediaries in exchanges of various goods.
TEXT.French: La première culture nigériane identifiée est la culture Nok qui s'est développée entre 1500 av. J.-C. et 200 ap. J.-C. sur le plateau de Jos dans le nord-est du Nigeria. Il manque des informations du premier millénaire av. J.-C. après l'ascension Nok, mais au IIe millénaire av. J.-C., il y avait un commerce actif entre l'Égypte antique via la Nubie, passant par le Sahara jusqu'à la forêt, avec les peuples de la savane en tant qu'intermédiaires dans les échanges de différentes marchandises.

TEXT.English: The lance had been used for centuries by mounted troops but was rediscovered by light cavalry units during the 18th century. Firearms caused armor to be abandoned, so lancer units generally had no armor at all, increasing their speed and mobility. Lancer units used their lances for the charge, then switched to sabres or firearms at close quarters. The most famous lancers were the Polish Uhlan units, first raised in the 1720's. The lance was eventually dropped as a weapon given the decreasing use of horse cavalry in the face of powerful firearms and cavalry units were replaced by armored vehicles.
TEXT.Italian: La lancia era stata usata per secoli dalle truppe a cavallo, ma fu riscoperta dalle unità di cavalleria leggera durante il 18° secolo. Le armi da fuoco resero le armature inutili; per questo motivo i lancieri non portavano armature, rendendoli più leggeri e veloci. I lancieri a cavallo usavano le loro lance per le cariche, quindi passavano a sciabole ed armi da fuoco per i combattimenti ravvicinati. I lancieri più famosi erano gli Ulani polacchi, creati introno al 1720. La lancia divenne obsoleta quando la cavalleria iniziò a perdere importanza, lasciando il posto ai veicoli corazzati a motore.
TEXT.Polish: Lansjerzy w dawnych armiach lekka kawaleria uzbrojona w lance. W wojsku polskim odpowiednikiem lansjerów byli u³ani. W XVII wieku jazda europejska z wyj¹tkiem polskiej i hiszpañskiej zarzuci³a u¿ywanie lanc, jednak w XVIII wieku broñ ta znów zdoby³a popularnoœæ. W XIX wieku pu³ki uzbrojone w lance zwano zwykle u³anami - jedynie Francja i Anglia zachowa³y nazwê lansjerów.

TEXT.English: Landing Ship, Tank was the military designation for naval vessels created during World War II to support amphibious operations by carrying significant quantities of vehicles, cargo, and landing troops directly onto an unimproved shore.
TEXT.French: Le Landing Ship, Tank (LST) était la désignation militaire des navires créés pendant la Seconde Guerre mondiale pour soutenir les opérations amphibies en transportant des quantités importantes de véhicules, cargaisons, et troupes de débarquement directement sur une côte non préparée.
TEXT.Polish: Pomocnicza jednostka p³ywaj¹ca marynarki wojennej, s³u¿¹ca do zaopatrywania okrêtów lub transportu wojsk i uzbrojenia. Mo¿e to byæ statek nosz¹cy banderê handlow¹, doraŸnie wcielony pod rozkazy marynarki wojennej, statek handlowy pod bander¹ wojenn¹ albo okrêt specjalnie zbudowany lub przystosowany do celów zaopatrzenia.

TEXT.English: Lapu-Lapu (fl. 1521) was a ruler of Mactan in Visayas. Modern Philippine society regards him as the first Filipino hero because he was the first native to resist Spanish colonization. He is best known for the Battle of Mactan that happened at dawn on April 27, 1521, and where he slayed Ferdinand Magellan. The battle halted the Magellan expedition and delayed Spanish occupation of the islands by over forty years until the expedition of Miguel López de Legazpi in 1564. Monuments to Lapu-Lapu have been built in Manila and Cebu while the Philippine National Police and the Bureau of Fire Protection use his image.

Lars Porsena (Etruscan: Pursenas; sometimes spelled Lars Porsenna) was an Etruscan king known for his war against the city of Rome. He ruled over the city of Clusium (Etruscan: Clevsin). There are no established dates for his rule, but Roman sources often place the war at around 508 BC.
TEXT.French: Lars Porsena (étrusque : Pursenas ; parfois orthographié Lars Porsenna) était un roi étrusque connu pour sa guerre contre la ville de Rome. Il régna sur la ville de Clusium (étrusque : Clevsin). Il n'existe pas de dates établies pour son règne, mais les sources romaines situent souvent la guerre vers 508 av. J.-C.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Litigate[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE]Take legal action and drive all corporations from the city.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]mettre en litige[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE]Prendre des mesures juridiques et conduire toutes les entreprises de la ville au procès.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]L'unità può intraprendere azioni legali e [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rimuovere[COLOR_REVERT] tutte le corporazioni dalla città (azione [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]querela[COLOR_REVERT])
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Puede tomar acciones legales
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zaskar¿[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE]Legalnym sposobem wypêdŸ wszystkie korporacje ze swojego miasta.

TEXT.English: The Viceroyalty of the Río de la Plata was the last to be organized and the one with the shortest life of the Viceroyalty of the Spanish Empire in the Americas. The Viceroyalty was established in 1776 from several former Viceroyalty of Perdependencies that mainly extended over the Río de la Plata Basin, roughly the present-day territories of Argentina, Bolivia, Paraguay and Uruguay, extending inland from the Atlantic Coast. Buenos Aires, located on the western shore of the Río de la Plata estuary flowing into the Atlantic Ocean, opposite the Portuguese outpost of Colonia del Sacramento, was chosen as the capital. Usually considered one of the late Bourbon Reforms, the organization of this viceroyalty was motivated on both commercial grounds (Buenos Aires was by then a major spot for illegal trade), as well as on security concerns brought about by the growing interest of competing foreign powers in the area. The Spanish Crown wanted to protect its territory against Great Britain and the Kingdom of Portugal.

The Leidang is an Icelandic unique unit, a replacement for the Heavy Axeman. Because of the Norse specialization in seaborne raids, it starts with the Amphibious promotion. Its other starting promotion, City Raider I, is for much the same reason. Thus it makes an ideal "Marine" for the Medieval and Renaissance eras.
TEXT.French: Le Leidang est une unité unique islandaise, qui remplace l'Accolade lourdée. En raison de la spécialisation des Nordiques dans les raids en mer, elle commence avec la compétence Amphibie. Son autre compétence de départ, City Raider I, est pour une raison semblable. Elle constitue donc un "marine" idéal pour les périodes médiévales et de la Renaissance.
TEXT.Italian: Il Leidang è l'unità unica islandese che sostituisce il guerriero con ascia corazzato. Le sue promozioni, Anfibio e Razziatore I, derivano dal fatto che i popoli norreni di discendenza vichinga erano specializzati nei raid dal mare contro le città nemiche. Per questo motivo il Leidang è un perfetto "Marine" per le età medievali e rinascimentali.

TEXT.English: Leonidas was a Spartan king whose stand against the invading Persian army at the pass of Thermopylae in central Greece is one of the enduring tales of Greek heroism, invoked throughout Western history as the epitome of bravery exhibited against overwhelming odds. A member of the Agiad house, Leonidas succeeded his half brother, Cleomenes I, as king, probably in 490. He was married to Cleomenes' daughter, Gorgo, and may have supported Cleomenes' aggressions against other Greek cities. In 480 Leonidas commanded the small Greek force that resisted the advance through Thermopylae of the vast army of the Persian king Xerxes. For two days Leonidas withstood Persian attacks, and it is quite possible the Greek army, defending a narrow pass, could have won. However, a Greek turncoat showed the Persians a way around the pass; once Leonidas knew the battle was lost, he then ordered most of his troops to retreat, and he and his 300-member royal guard fought to the last man. This episode made a deep impression on the Greek imagination and gave rise to the legend that Spartans never surrendered.
TEXT.Polish: Leonidas od oko³o 490 p.n.e. król Sparty, syn Anaksandridasa II i jego pierwszej ¿ony. Poœlubi³ Gorgo - córkê swojego przybranego brata Kleomenesa I z któr¹ mia³ syna Pleistarchusa. W 480 p.n.e. dowodzi³ obron¹ przesmyku termopilskiego, stoj¹c na czele 300 Spartan i kilku tysiêcy ¿o³nierzy z innych greckich pañstw. Przez trzy dni odpiera³ ataki wielotysiêcznej armii króla Persji, Kserksesa, która nie mog³a w w¹skim przejœciu wykorzystaæ swojej liczebnej przewagi. W wyniku zdrady pasterza Efialtesa, wrogie oddzia³y zasz³y od ty³u greckich ¿o³nierzy. Leonidas odes³a³ wtedy wojska pañstw sprzymierzonych i wraz z trzystoma Spartanami, tylu¿ Helotami oraz siedmioma setkami Tespijczyków broni³ w¹wozu do koñca. Poœwiêcenie Leonidasa i jego wojowników da³o czas reszcie ¿o³nierzy na wycofanie siê.

TEXT.English: Leopold II was the second King of the Belgians, and is chiefly remembered for the founding and exploitation of the Congo Free State. Born in Brussels the second (but eldest surviving) son of Leopold I and Louise of Orléans, he succeeded his father to the throne on 17 December 1865, reigning for 44 years until his death, the longest of any Belgian monarch.
TEXT.French: Leopold II fut le deuxième roi des Belges, principalement connu pour avoir fondé et exploité l'État indépendant du Congo. Né à Bruxelles, second (mais le plus âgé survivant) fils de Léopold Ier et Louise d'Orléans, il succéda à son père le 17 décembre 1865 et régna pendant 44 ans jusqu'à sa mort, ce qui en faisait le roi belge ayant régné le plus longtemps.
TEXT.Polish: Leopold II, w³aœc. Leopold Ludwik Filip Maria Wiktor (ur. 9 kwietnia 1835 w Brukseli, zm. 17 grudnia 1909 w Laeken) - król Belgów w latach 1865-1909, z dynastii Koburgów. Tron belgijski obj¹³ po swoim ojcu Leopoldzie I. W 1885 zosta³ w³adc¹ Wolnego Pañstwa Konga, kolonii w œrodkowej Afryce (obecnie Demokratyczna Republika Konga). Przez wiele lat by³a to jego prywatna w³asnoœæ, w której panowa³o niewolnictwo, a Leopold II prowadzi³ rabunkow¹ gospodarkê pozyskuj¹c kauczuk i koœæ s³oniow¹. TEXT.English: Leopold I was from 21 July 1831 the first King of the Belgians, following Belgium's independence from the Netherlands. He was the founder of the Belgian line of the House of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha. His children included Leopold II of Belgium and Carlota of Mexico, Empress-Consort of Maximilian I of Mexico. He was a maternal uncle and adviser of Queen Victoria.
TEXT.French: Léopold Ier fut le premier roi des Belges à partir du 21 juillet 1831, après l'indépendance de la Belgique vis-à-vis des Pays-Bas. Il était le fondateur de la lignée belge de la maison de Saxe-Cobourg et Gotha. Ses enfants incluaient Léopold II de Belgique et Carlota du Mexique, impératrice-consort de Maximilien Ier du Mexique. Il était l'oncle maternel et conseiller de la reine Victoria.
TEXT.Polish: Leopold I, w³aœc. Leopold Jerzy Krystian Fryderyk (ur. 16 grudnia 1790 w Coburgu, zm. 10 grudnia 1865 w Laeken) - ksi¹¿ê Sachsen-Coburg-Gotha, król Belgów 1831-1865, wolnomularz. Leopold mia³ ogromny wp³yw na politykê Wielkiej Brytanii. W 1816 o¿eni³ siê z jedyn¹ córk¹ ksiêcia-regenta Jerzego, a w 1837 na tronie brytyjskim zasiad³a jego siostrzenica - Wiktoria Hanowerska. Leopold jeszcze przed akcesj¹ Wiktorii korespondowa³ z ni¹ regularnie i listownie doradza³ jej w wielu sprawach. W 1840 zaaran¿owa³ ma³¿eñstwo Wiktorii (córki swojej siostry Wiktorii) z Albertem (synem swojego brata Ernesta).

TEXT.English: Léopold Sédar Senghor (9 October 1906 - 20 December 2001) was a Senegalese poet, politician, and cultural theorist who for two decades served as the first president of Senegal (1960-80). Senghor was the first African elected as a member of the Académie française. Before independence, he founded the political party called the Senegalese Democratic Bloc. He is regarded by many as one of the most important African intellectuals of the 20th century.
TEXT.French: Léopold Sédar Senghor (9 octobre 1906 - 20 décembre 2001) était un poète, homme politique et théoricien culturel sénégalais qui a été président du Sénégal pendant deux décennies (1960-80). Senghor fut le premier Africain élu membre de l'Académie française. Avant l'indépendance, il a fondé le parti politique appelé le Bloc Démocratique Sénégalais. Il est considéré par beaucoup comme l'un des intellectuels africains les plus importants du XXe siècle.

TEXT.English: Leo I was a king of Armenia (reigned 1199 - 1219), who rallied the Armenians after their dispersion by the Seljuq Turks and consolidated the kingdom in Cilicia, southeastern Asia Minor. Through his friendly relations with the German emperors Frederick I Barbarossa and Henry VI, he was crowned by Pope Celestine III's legate, Cardinal Conrad von Wittelsbach, and allied Lesser Armenia to the West, despite overtures from the Byzantine emperor.
TEXT.French: Léon Ier fut un roi d'Arménie (règne de 1199 à 1219), qui rassembla les Arméniens après leur dispersion par les Turcs seldjoukides et consolida le royaume en Cilicie, dans le sud-est de l'Asie Mineure. Grâce à ses relations amicales avec les empereurs allemands Frédéric Barberousse et Henri VI, il fut couronné par le légat du pape Célestin III, le cardinal Conrad de Wittelsbach, et unifia la Petite Arménie à l'Ouest, malgré les propositions de l'empereur byzantin.
TEXT.Polish: Ksi¹¿ê Leon II zosta³ pierwszym królem Ma³ej Armenii (1199-1219), konsoliduj¹c rozproszonych w Cylicji ormian po rozbiciu ich królestwa przez Turków Seld¿uckich. Dziêki swoim przyjacielskim kontaktom z niemieckimi cesarzami Fryderykiem I Barbaross¹ oraz Henrykiem VI, zosta³ koronowany przez legata papie¿a Celestyna III, kardyna³a Konrada Wittelsbacha, i zwi¹za³ w ten sposób losy Armenii Mniejszej z Zachodem.

TEXT.English: The Levitation Artillery is an artillery unit that can cross oceans. It is held up by by antigravity technology, and can theoretically pass through space.
TEXT.French: L'Artillerie de lévitation est une unité d'artillerie capable de traverser les océans. Elle est maintenue en l'air par une technologie antigravitationnelle et peut théoriquement traverser l'espace.
TEXT.Italian: L'artiglieria a levitazione può attraversare gli oceani; rimane sospesa grazie a una tecnologia antigravità, e teoricamente può attraversare la materia.
TEXT.Polish: Antygrawitacja - hipotetyczne i nigdy niezaobserwowane w sposób potwierdzony naukowo oddzia³ywanie fizyczne. Temat najczêœciej jest wykorzystywany w science fiction. Oddzia³ywanie to mia³oby byæ analogiczne do grawitacji, lecz powoduj¹ce odpychanie zamiast przyci¹gania mas. Wed³ug teorii inflacyjnej w czasie swego powstawania Wszechœwiat przez pewien czas znajdowa³ siê w stanie fa³szywej pró¿ni posiadaj¹cej ujemne ciœnienie, który to stan zasadniczo ró¿ni siê od efektu antygrawitacji, jako ¿e Ÿród³em odpychaj¹cych si³ jest przestrzeñ, a nie rozk³ad masy.
TEXT.Russian: Антигравитационная гаубица - это артиллерийское подразделение, способное пересекать океаны. Оно поддерживается антигравитационными технологиями и теоретически может проходить через космические клетки.

TEXT.English: Liberty ships were cargo ships built in the United States during World War II. Though British in conception, they were adapted by the U.S. as they were cheap and quick to build, and came to symbolize U.S. wartime industrial output. Based on vessels ordered by Britain to replace ships torpedoed by German U-boats, they were purchased for the U.S. fleet and for lend-lease provision to Britain. Eighteen American shipyards built 2,751 Libertys between 1941 and 1945, easily the largest number of ships produced to a single design. In 1943, three new Liberty ships were being completed every day. The immense effort to build Liberty ships, the sheer number of ships built, and the fact that some of the ships survived far longer than the original design life of five years, make them the subject of much study. More than 2,400 Liberty ships survived the war. Of these, 835 made up the postwar cargo fleet. Only two operational Liberty ships, the SS John W. Brown and the Jeremiah O'Brien, remain today. The John Brown has had a long career as a school ship and many internal modifications, while the Jeremiah O'Brien remains largely in its original condition. Both are museum ships that still put out to sea regularly.
TEXT.Polish: Statki typu Liberty - jednostki p³ywaj¹ce budowane masowo w Kanadzie i USA podczas II wojny œwiatowej w celu zast¹pienia strat wojennych. Statki charakteryzowa³y siê bardzo uproszczon¹ konstrukcj¹. W polskim ¿argonie marynarskim by³y popularnie nazywane Liberciakami. W sumie wybudowano 2751 statków tego typu.

TEXT.English: A liburnian or liburna was a type of small galley used for raiding and patrols, particularly by the Illyrians and the Roman navy. A stone tablet (Stele di Novilara) found near ancient Pisaurum (Pesaro) shows a liburnian in the scene of a naval battle. Dated to the 5th or 6th century BC, the image possibly depicts an imaginary battle between Liburnian and Picene fleets. The liburnian was presented as light type of the ship with one row or the oars, one mast, one sail and prow twisted outwards. Under the prow there was a rostrum made for striking the enemy ships under the sea.

The Zapotecs sacked and burned everything and everyone.[PARAGRAPH:1]This cult and others, as well as the Zapotec military orders of the [BOLD]Coyote[\BOLD], the Jaguar, and the Eagle, were introduced into important Mayan cities to the south in Yucatán, such as Chichén Itzá and Mayapán, indicating the broad influence of the Zapotecs.
TEXT.French: Les Zapotèques ont tout pillé et brûlé, tout et tout le monde.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ce culte et d'autres, ainsi que l'ordre militaire zapotèque des [GRAS]Coyote[\GRAS], du Jaguar et de l'Aigle, ont été introduits dans des villes mayas importantes au sud du Yucatán, comme Chichén Itzá et Mayapán, témoignant de la large influence des Zapotèques.
TEXT.Polish: Zapotekowie -? grupa rdzennych mieszkañców Meksyku, zamieszkuj¹cych œrodkowo-wschodni¹ czêœæ obecnego stanu Oaxaca. W czasach prekolumbijskich stworzyli jedn¹ z trzech wielkich kultur mezoamerykañskich. Najwa¿niejszym oœrodkiem tej kultury by³o miasto Monte Alb¹n. Pozosta³e to: Lambityeco, Dainzu, Mitla, Yagul, San Jose Mogote i Zaachila.

TEXT.English: The essence of air defence is to detect hostile aircraft and destroy them. The critical issue is to hit a target moving in three-dimensional space; an attack must not only match these three coordinates, but must do so at the time the target is at that position. This means that projectiles either have to be guided to hit the target, or aimed at the predicted position of the target at the time the projectile reaches it, taking into account speed and direction of both the target and the projectile.
TEXT.Polish: Dzia³o przeciwlotnicze - armata s³u¿¹ca do zwalczania samolotów, œmig³owców i innych statków powietrznych przeciwnika. Stosowane by³y kalibry od 20 do 130 mm, przy czym do kalibrów mniejszych, poni¿ej 35 lub 40 mm stosuje siê okreœlenie dzia³ko przeciwlotnicze. W razie potrzeby wykorzystywana jak zwyk³a artyleria do strzelania "na wprost" przeciw pojazdom naziemnym. Szczególnie armaty przeciwlotnicze o najwiêkszych kalibrach stosowane s¹ skuteczne w tej roli jako broñ przeciwpancerna. Najbardziej znanym przyk³adem jest niemieckie dzia³o przeciwlotnicze kalibru 88 mm z drugiej wojny œwiatowej.

TEXT.English: Artillery is a general term covering several varieties of large-caliber weapons including mortars and field guns. Mortars fire an explosive projectile in a high arc, and are particularly effective against small, concealed targets. Field guns, long-range weapons that fire their projectiles in a flat arc, are used primarily for their ability to penetrate hard targets. Powerful enough to batter opposing forces even behind the strongest fortifications, artillery is also able to move quickly from one firing position to another. This is an important capability when fighting a moving battle or when avoiding enemy fire.
TEXT.French: "Artillerie" est un terme générique qui recouvre différents types d'armes de gros calibre, dont les mortiers ou les canons de campagne. Les mortiers envoient des projectiles explosifs par un tir courbe et sont particulièrement efficaces contre de petites cibles dissimulées. Les canons de campagne sont des armes à longue portée qui tirent à plat et sont particulièrement efficaces contre les cibles solides. Suffisamment puissante pour réduire des troupes ennemies, même protégées par des fortifications, l'artillerie est aussi capable de se déplacer rapidement d'une position à une autre. Cette caractéristique est particulièrement importante dans les batailles de mouvement, ou pour éviter les tirs ennemis.
TEXT.German: Der Begriff Artillerie umschreibt verschiedene Waffen großen Kalibers, einschließlich Mörsern und Feldgeschützen. Mörser feuern explosive Geschosse in hohem Bogen ab und eignen sich besonders für Angriffe auf kleine, verdeckte Ziele. Feldgeschütze sind Fernbereichswaffen, die ihre Geschosse in flachem Bogen abschießen und hauptsächlich eingesetzt werden, um solide, befestigte Ziele zu durchdringen. Die Artillerie ist nicht nur effizient genug, um selbst massiv befestigte feindliche Truppen zu beschießen, sondern kann sich darüber hinaus auch schnell von einer Abschussposition zur nächsten fortbewegen. Dies ist insbesondere dann von Vorteil, wenn es gilt, feindlichem Beschuss auszuweichen oder sich bei einer Schlacht zu bewegen.
TEXT.Italian: Artiglieria è un termine generico che comprende diverse categorie di armi di grosso calibro, tra cui mortai e cannoni da campo. I mortai sparano un proiettile esplosivo con traiettoria ad arco e sono particolarmente efficaci contro obiettivi piccoli e nascosti. I cannoni da campo, armi a lunga gittata che sparano proiettili ad arco piatto, vengono invece impiegati principalmente per la loro capacità di penetrare obiettivi resistenti. Abbastanza potente da colpire il nemico dietro le fortificazioni più efficaci, l'artiglieria è anche in grado di spostarsi rapidamente da una postazione di tiro a un'altra. Ciò è indispensabile per combattere una battaglia in movimento o evitare il fuoco nemico.
TEXT.Spanish: Artillería es un término genérico que engloba varios tipos de armas de gran calibre, entre las que se incluyen los morteros y los cañones de campaña. Los morteros disparan un proyectil explosivo con una trayectoria curva muy pronunciada y son especialmente efectivos contra objetivos pequeños y camuflados. Los cañones de campaña, armas de largo alcance que disparan sus proyectiles en línea recta, se utilizan principalmente por su capacidad de penetración contra objetivos de gran dureza. Capaz de desencadenar duros ataques contra enemigos refugiados en las fortificaciones más poderosas, la artillería cuenta con la ventaja adicional de poder trasladarse con rapidez. Ésta es una característica importante cuando se trata de una batalla de movimiento o de esquivar el fuego enemigo.
TEXT.Polish: Artyleria - to jeden z podstawowych rodzajów wojsk, na uzbrojenie którego wchodz¹ dzia³a (armaty, haubice, moŸdzierze) oraz wyrzutnie rakietowe, a w przesz³oœci tak¿e machiny miotaj¹ce. Zadaniem artylerii jest zwalczanie celów naziemnych, powietrznych i nawodnych ogniem dzia³ i pociskami rakietowymi. Wykonuj¹c swoje zadania, artyleria s³u¿y zwykle do wsparcia innych rodzajów wojsk lub dzia³a samodzielnie. W sk³ad artylerii wchodzi tak¿e sprzêt i s³u¿by umo¿liwiaj¹ce skuteczne wykonywanie zadañ ogniowych: systemy kierowania ogniem, systemy rozpoznania i wykrywania celów (w tym radary artyleryjskie), s³u¿by pomiarowe i inne.

TEXT.English: The hoplite-style warfare was very influential and influenced several other nations in the Mediterranean. So was the hoplite warfare the dominant fighting style on the Italian Peninsula up to the early 3rd century BC, namely by the Etruscans and the Early Roman army. The Romans later changed their fighting style to a more flexible Manipel organization, and reequipped their soldiers with longer oval shields (scutum), swords and heavy javelins (pilum). In the end only the triarii would keep a long spear (hasta) as their main weapon. Though the Italian tribes, namely the socii fighting with the Romans, later adopted the new Roman fighting style, some continued to fight as hoplites. Local levied troops or mercenaries serving under Pyrrhus of Epirus or Hannibal (namely Etruscans) where equipped and fought as hoplites.

Spanish.Text: Soldado con espada ligera:Soldados con espada ligera

TEXT.English: Light tanks tend to be smaller, faster, and lighter vehicles, and cheaper to produce. Some light tanks are able to move over land rapidly compared to heavier tanks and are maneuverable through obstacles such as jungle thickets, while maintaining lethality against enemy infantry.
TEXT.French: Les chars légers ont tendance à être plus petits, plus rapides, plus légers et moins coûteux à produire. Certains chars légers peuvent se déplacer rapidement sur la terre par rapport à des chars plus lourds et être maniables à travers des obstacles comme la végétation dense, tout en conservant leur létalité contre l'infanterie ennemie.
TEXT.Polish: Czo³g lekki wyró¿niany by³ w najbardziej rozpowszechnionej historycznej klasyfikacji czo³gów w zale¿noœci od ich masy, jako g¹sienicowy wóz bojowy l¿ejszy od czo³gów œrednich i ciê¿kich. Podstawowym wyznacznikiem tej kategorii by³a masa, od kilku do oko³o 11-15 ton, rzadziej zdarza³y siê konstrukcje ciê¿sze - do ponad 20 ton (pocz¹wszy od koñcowego okresu II wojny œwiatowej). Czo³gi lekkie do koñca II wojny œwiatowej z regu³y uzbrojone by³y w armaty ma³ego kalibru, od 20 mm do 45 mm, typowo 37 mm, oraz karabiny maszynowe albo tylko karabiny maszynowe. Od koñcowego okresu II wojny œwiatowej, uzbrajane s¹ w armaty kalibru 75 mm lub wiêkszego, o zredukowanych jednak parametrach w stosunku do armat przenoszonych przez ciê¿sze pojazdy.

TEXT.English: A lithobolos or stone thrower was an artillery weapon used in ancient warfare and medieval warfare. These machines threw stones of 10 lb to 180 lb in weight. They looked alike and differed only in size: the dimensions being calculated by a complex mathematical formula based on the spring diameter.
TEXT.French: Un lithobolos ou lance-pierre était une arme d'artillerie utilisée dans la guerre antique et médiévale. Ces machines lançaient des pierres de 10 à 180 livres. Elles se ressemblaient et ne differaient que par la taille : leurs dimensions étant calculées par une formule mathématique complexe basée sur le diamètre du ressort.

TEXT.English: The littoral combat ship (LCS) is a class of relatively small surface vessels intended for operations in the littoral zone (close to shore). It was envisioned to be a networked, agile, stealthy surface combatant capable of defeating anti-access and asymmetric threats in the littorals.
TEXT.French: Le navire de combat en littoral (LCS) est une classe de navires de surface relativement petits conçus pour les opérations en zone côtière (près du rivage). Il était prévu comme une unité de combat de surface agile, furtive et connectée capable de vaincre les menaces anti-acces et asymétriques dans les eaux côtières.
TEXT.Polish: Littoral Combat Ship - amerykañski program i seria stosunkowo niewielkich oraz relatywnie tanich okrêtów walki przybrze¿nej (wody przybrze¿ne), których zastosowanie bojowe opiera siê na wykorzystaniu przystosowanych do konkretnych rodzajów misji modu³owych pakietów wyposa¿enia "plug-and-fight". Sam zaœ okrêt niewyposa¿ony w modu³y, nazywany jest jedynie "Sea frame" - okrêtem szkieletowym.
TEXT.Russian: Сторожевик представляет собой класс относительно небольших надводных кораблей, предназначенных для действий в прибрежной зоне. Он задумывался как сетевой, маневренный, незаметный надводный эсминец, способный противостоять труднодоступным и асимметричным угрозам на побережье.

TEXT.English: Liutprand was the King of the Lombards from 712 to 744 and is chiefly remembered for his Donation of Sutri, in 728, and his long reign, which brought him into a series of conflicts, mostly successful, with most of Italy. He is often regarded as the most successful Lombard monarch.
TEXT.French: Liutprand fut roi des Lombards de 712 à 744. Il est surtout connu pour sa Donation de Sutri en 728 et pour son long règne, marqué par une série de conflits, principalement victorieux, avec la majorité de l'Italie. Il est souvent considéré comme le roi lombard le plus réussi.

TEXT.English: The llama (Lama glama) is a South American camelid, widely used as a meat and pack animal by Andean cultures since pre-Hispanic times.[PARAGRAPH:2]The height of a full-grown, full-size llama is 1.7 to 1.8 m (5.5 to 6.0 ft) tall at the top of the head, and can weigh between 130 to 200 kilograms (280 to 450 lb). At birth, a baby llama (called a cria) can weigh between 9 and 14 kilograms (20 and 30 lb). Llamas can live for a period of about 20-30 years depending on how well they are taken care of. Llamas are very social animals and live with other llamas as a herd. The wool produced by a llama is very soft and lanolin-free. Llamas are intelligent and can learn simple tasks after a few repetitions. When using a pack, llamas can carry about 25% to 30% of their body weight for several miles.[PARAGRAPH:2]Llamas appear to have originated from the central plains of North America about 40 million years ago. They migrated to South America about 3 million years ago. By the end of the last ice age (10,000 - 12,000 years ago), camelids were extinct in North America. As of 2007, there were over 7 million llamas and alpacas in South America and, due to importation from South America in the late 20th century, there are now over 158,000 llamas and 100,000 alpacas in the US and Canada.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lamas[COLOR_REVERT] (Lama glama) gehören zu den Kamelen. Im Gegensatz zu Dromedaren und Trampeltieren haben sie jedoch keine Höcker. Die Fellfarbe ist unterschiedlich und kann die Farben Weiß, Braun oder Schwarz aufweisen. Wie alle Kamele haben Lamas Sohlenpolster an den Füßen und eine gespaltene Oberlippe. Ausgewachsene Tiere erreichen eine durchschnittliche Schulterhöhe von 120 cm und können bis zu 150 kg schwer werden.[NEWLINE]Lamas ernähren sich ausschließlich pflanzlich. Auf ihrem Speiseplan stehen Blätter, Gräser, Flechten und Pilze. Wenn sie sich bedroht oder belästigt fühlen, spucken sie. Das Bespucken der Lamas untereinander dient der Verdeutlichung der Rangordnung. Dabei schleudern sie nicht immer nur Speichel, sondern teilweise auch Mageninhalt auf den Gegner.[NEWLINE]Lamas sind in den südamerikanischen Anden zu Hause, wo sie als Lasttiere gehalten werden. Die Menschen nutzen zudem die Wolle und das Fleisch. Auch in Europa werden Lamas gezüchtet, um deren Wolle zu verarbeiten.
TEXT.Polish: Lama (Lama glama) udomowiony ssak parzystokopytny z rodziny wielb³¹dowatych, wraz z gwanako i blisko z nimi spokrewnionymi alpak¹ i wikuni¹ okreœlane wspóln¹ nazw¹ lamy. Wystêpuje w Ameryce Po³udniowej. Lamy wykorzystywane s¹ g³ównie jako zwierzêta juczne oraz do produkcji we³ny i miêsa. Doros³e lamy osi¹gaj¹ do 250 kg wagi i 119 cm wysokoœci w k³êbie.
