TEXT.English: A llanero is a Venezuelan or Colombian herder. The name is taken from the Llanos grasslands occupying western Venezuela and eastern Colombia. The Llanero were originally part Spanish and Indian and have a strong culture including a distinctive form of music. During the wars of independence, Llaneros served in both armies and provided the bulk of the cavalry during the war. In 1819, an army of Llaneros, led by Simón Bolívar and José Antonio Páez, defeated the Spanish with a surprise attack when they crossed over the Orinoco plains and the Andes mountains.
Locust swarms have always devastated crops and pasture.
TEXT.French: Les essaims de sauterelles ont toujours dévasté les récoltes et les pâturages.
TEXT.Polish: Stada Szarañczy od zawsze niszczy³y uprawy.

TEXT.English: Log Ram is a device that is designed to break or circumvent city walls and other fortifications in siege warfare. Some have been operated close to the fortifications, while others have been used to attack from a distance. From antiquity, siege engines were constructed largely of wood and tended to use mechanical advantage to fling stones and similar missiles.
TEXT.French: Le bélier en rondins est un dispositif conçu pour briser ou contourner les murs de la ville et autres fortifications lors des sièges. Certains étaient utilisés à proximité des fortifications, tandis que d'autres attaquaient à distance. Depuis l'Antiquité, les engins de siège étaient principalement construits en bois et utilisaient un avantage mécanique pour lancer des pierres et missiles similaires.
TEXT.Polish: Taran to dawna machina oblê¿nicza lub sprzêt oblê¿niczy s³u¿¹cy do rozbijania i wywa¿ania bram i murów zamków i innych obleganych umocnieñ, u¿ywana w staro¿ytnoœci i œredniowieczu. W najprostszej wersji taran stanowi³ po prostu ciê¿k¹ belkê niesion¹ przez kilku lub kilkunastu ¿o³nierzy, którzy uderzali ni¹ w bramê. Belka bywa³a zakoñczona ¿elaznym okuciem, czasami w formie baraniego ³ba.

TEXT.English: Longbowmen were highly skilled archers capable of firing up to six arrows a minute over long distances into massed enemy formations. Using bows constructed from a type of wood called Yew, they used arrows specifically designed to penetrate chainmail armor -- even plate if close enough. Frequently they would comprise approximately four-fifths of an army, and their devastating attacks helped to reverse the dominance of knights in warfare. Only lightly-armored, they enjoyed a great mobility advantage should their opponents survive their barrages.[PARAGRAPH:2]Once gunpowder began to find applications in the military, their use began to wane. Guns allowed foot soldiers the same effectiveness against knights, but without the decades of training required to be proficient with the longbow.
TEXT.French: Les archers longs étaient particulièrement adroits et pouvaient tirer jusqu'à six flèches par minute sur des troupes ennemies compactes situées à bonne distance. Ils utilisaient des arcs en bois d'if et des flèches spécialement conçues pour traverser les cotes de mailles, voire même, à courte distance, les armures de plaques. Jusqu'à quatre cinquièmes des armées étaient composés d'archers, leurs attaques dévastatrices ayant mis fin à la prédominance des chevaliers sur le champ de bataille. N'ayant pas de lourde armure, les archers bénéficiaient d'une grande mobilité, leur permettant de fuir si l'ennemi franchissait leur tir de barrage.[PARAGRAPH:2]Leur déclin correspond à l'apparition des armes à feu. Les canons étaient en effet tout aussi efficaces contre les chevaliers, mais ne nécessitaient pas, contrairement à l'arc, des années d'entraînement.
TEXT.German: Langbogenschützen waren hervorragend ausgebildete Bogenschützen, die bis zu sechs Pfeile pro Minute über große Entfernungen hinweg auf feindliche Truppenformationen abschießen konnten. Ihre Bögen waren aus Eibenholz gefertigt, und die Pfeile wurden speziell entwickelt, um Kettenpanzer - bei geringerem Abstand auch Plattenpanzer - zu durchdringen. Meist waren vier Fünftel der Fußsoldaten in einer Armee Langbogenschützen, deren vernichtenden Angriffe letztlich auch dazu führten, dass die bis dahin nahezu uneingeschränkte Dominanz der Ritter auf dem Schlachtfeld endete. Weil sie lediglich leicht gerüstet waren, hatten die Langbogenschützen einen bedeutenden Mobilitätsvorteil gegenüber gegnerischen Kämpfern, die ihrem Sperrfeuer entkommen konnten.[PARAGRAPH:2]Nachdem Schießpulver für militärische Zwecke entdeckt worden war, wurden nach und nach immer weniger Langbogenschützen im Kampf eingesetzt, denn durch die Nutzung von Schusswaffen war es Fußsoldaten auch ohne die jahrelange Ausbildung zum versierten Langbogenschützen möglich, genauso effizient gegen Ritter zu Felde zu ziehen.
TEXT.Italian: Gli arcieri con arco lungo erano unità altamente addestrate, in grado di scoccare fino a sei frecce al minuto, su lunghe distanze, contro formazioni nemiche ammassate. Usando archi costruiti in legno di tasso, essi usavano frecce progettate specificamente per penetrare l'armatura a maglie e perfino quella a placche, se vicini a sufficienza. Spesso, costituivano i quattro quinti dell'esercito e i loro attacchi devastanti aiutarono a rovesciare il dominio dei cavalieri in battaglia. Protette solo in modo leggero, queste unità godevano di una grande mobilità, nel caso in cui i loro avversari fossero sopravvissuti ai loro tiri di sbarramento.[PARAGRAPH:2]Quando la polvere da sparo trovò applicazione in ambito militare, l'impiego degli arcieri cominciò a ridursi. Le armi da fuoco consentirono ai fanti la medesima efficacia contro i cavalieri, ma senza i decenni di addestramento richiesti per essere efficaci con l'arco lungo.
TEXT.Spanish: Eran arqueros extremadamente hábiles, capaces de disparar hasta seis flechas por minuto contra grandes formaciones enemigas. Armados con arcos de madera de tejo, utilizaban unas flechas diseñadas especialmente para perforar cotas de malla... e incluso corazas a corta distancia. A menudo formaban aproximadamente las cuatro quintas partes del ejército y sus devastadores ataques contribuyeron a eclipsar la preponderancia de los caballeros en el campo de batalla. Utilizaban solo armadura ligera, lo que les proporcionaba una gran movilidad, para el caso de que el enemigo sobreviviera a sus descargas.[PARAGRAPH:2]El uso bélico de la pólvora significó el principio de su decadencia. Las armas de fuego proporcionaban a los soldados la misma eficacia contra la caballería pesada, pero sin las décadas de entrenamiento necesarias para aprender a manejar el arco largo.

TEXT.English: The loons (North America) or divers (UK/Ireland) are a group of aquatic birds found in many parts of North America and northern Eurasia (Europe, Asia and debatably Africa). All living species of loons are members of the genus (Gavia), family (Gaviidae) and order (Gaviiformes).[PARAGRAPH:2]The loon, the size of a large duck or small goose, resembles these birds in shape when swimming. Like ducks and geese but unlike coots (which are Rallidae) and grebes (Podicipedidae), the loon's toes are connected by webbing. The bird may be confused with cormorants (Phalacrocoracidae), not too distant relatives of divers and like them are heavy set birds whose bellies unlike those of ducks and geese are submerged when swimming. Flying loons resemble a plump goose with a seagull's wings, relatively small in proportion to the bulky body. The bird holds its head pointing slightly upwards during swimming, but less so than cormorants do. In flight the head droops more than in similar aquatic birds.[PARAGRAPH:2]Male and female loons have identical plumage. Plumage is largely patterned black-and-white in summer, with grey on the head and neck in some species. All have a white belly. This resembles many sea-ducks (Merginae) notably the smaller goldeneyes (Bucephala)? but is distinct from most cormorants which rarely have white feathers, and if so usually as large rounded patches rather than delicate patterns. All species of divers have a spear-shaped bill.[PARAGRAPH:2]Males are larger on average, but relative size is only apparent when the male and female are together.[PARAGRAPH:2]In winter plumage is dark gray above, with some indistinct lighter mottling on the wings, and a white chin, throat and underside. The species can then be distinguished by certain features, such as size and colour of head, neck, back and bill, but often reliable identification of wintering divers is difficult even for experts particularly as the smaller immature birds look similar to winter-plumage adults, making size an unreliable means of identification.[PARAGRAPH:2]Gaviiformes are among the few groups of birds in which the young moult into a second coat of down feathers after shedding the first one, rather than growing juvenile feathers with downy tips that wear off as is typical in many birds. This trait is also found in tubenoses (Procellariiformes) and penguins (Sphenisciformes), both relatives of the loons.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Seetaucher[COLOR_REVERT] sind tag- und nachtaktive, an Gewässer gebundene Zugvögel. Es existieren fünf Arten, die in der Taiga und Tundra der Holarktis leben. Die gemäßigten Breiten erreichen sie nur zu Zugzeiten bzw. in den Winterquartieren.[NEWLINE]Die größten Arten der Seetaucher werden bis zu 91 cm lang und können maximal 6,4 kg wiegen. Damit sind sie deutlich schwerer als Gänse. Seetaucher besitzen einen stromlinienförmigen Körper und kräftige Füße. Zwischen den Zehen befinden sich Schwimmhäute. Das dichte Gefieder ist bei fast allen Arten schachbrettartig schwarz-weiß gefärbt. Kopf und Hals sind bei beiden Geschlechtern farbenprächtig. Das Ruhekleid in den Wintermonaten ist schlichter. Wie der Name schon sagt, können Seetaucher ausgezeichnet tauchen und bis zu acht Minuten unter Wasser bleiben. Dort erbeuten sie hauptsächlich Fische, die meist direkt vor Ort verspeist werden. Zur Brutzeit heulen sie sehr laut und melodisch, um ihr Revier abzugrenzen. Beim Sterntaucher rufen sogar beide Partner. Seetaucher leben monogam. Sie brüten nicht jedes Jahr, sondern setzen etwa alle vier Jahre einmal aus. Ein Gelege umfasst meist zwei Eier. Erwachsene Seetaucher haben kaum Fressfeinde. Nur Seeadler können ihnen gefährlich werden. Jungtiere werden gelegentlich von Raubvögeln, Ottern oder großen Fischen gejagt.[NEWLINE]Die Inuit nutzen Haut und Federn der Seetaucher seit geraumer Zeit zur Herstellung von Kleidung, was aber die Bestände nicht gefährdet. Bestandsrückgänge sind durch Zerstörung von Ufern, Verschmutzung von Gewässern und Auslegung von Netzen verursacht. In Schottland galt der gehörte Revierruf des Seetauchers als schlechtes Omen.
TEXT.Polish: Nury rodzina (Gaviidae) oraz rz¹d (Gaviiformes) ptaków z podgromady ptaków nowoczesnych Neornithes. Nury obejmuj¹ gatunki wodne, latem spotykane na wodach œródl¹dowych, a zimuj¹ce nad morzami. Zamieszkuj¹ pó³nocn¹ strefê pó³kuli pó³nocnej.

TEXT.English: King of Ophir. And the children of Ophir, that is, Send (Sindh?), appointed to be their king Lophoron (?), who built Ophir with stones of gold; now, all the stones that are in Ophir are of gold. And the children of Havilah appointed to be their king Havîl, who built Havilah, that is, Hend (India).
TEXT.French: Roi d'Ophir. Et les enfants d'Ophir, c'est-à-dire Send (Sindh ?), ont nommé pour roi Lophoron (?), qui construisit Ophir avec des pierres d'or ; maintenant, toutes les pierres qui se trouvent à Ophir sont en or. Et les enfants de Havila nommèrent pour roi Havîl, qui construisit Havila, c'est-à-dire Hend (Inde).

TEXT.English: Horatio Nelson, also known as Lord Nelson, was a British flag officer famous for his service in the Royal Navy, particularly during the Napoleonic Wars. He won several victories, including the Battle of Trafalgar in 1805, during which he was killed. Nelson was born into a moderately prosperous Norfolk family, and joined the navy through the influence of his uncle, Maurice Suckling. He rose rapidly through the ranks and served with leading naval commanders of the period before obtaining his own command in 1778. He developed a reputation in the service through his personal valour and firm grasp of tactics, but suffered periods of illness and unemployment after the end of the American War of Independence. The outbreak of the French Revolutionary Wars allowed Nelson to return to service, where he was particularly active in the Mediterranean. He fought in several minor engagements off Toulon, and was important in the capture of Corsica and subsequent diplomatic duties with the Italian states. In 1797 he distinguished himself while in command of HMS Captain at the Battle of Cape St Vincent. Shortly after the battle, Nelson took part in the Battle of Santa Cruz de Tenerife, where he was badly wounded and forced to return to England to recuperate. The following year he won a decisive victory over the French at the Battle of the Nile and remained in the Mediterranean to support the Kingdom of Naples against a French invasion.[PARAGRAPH:2]In 1801 he was dispatched to the Baltic and won another victory, this time over the Danes at the Battle of Copenhagen. He subsequently commanded the blockade of the French and Spanish fleets at Toulon, and after their escape chased them to the West Indies and back but failed to bring them to battle. After a brief return to England, he took over the Cdiz blockade in 1805. On 21 October 1805 the Franco-Spanish fleet came out of port and Nelson's fleet engaged them at the Battle of Trafalgar. The battle was Britain's greatest naval victory, but Nelson was hit by a French sniper and mortally wounded. His body was brought back to England where he was accorded a state funeral. Nelson was noted for his ability to inspire and bring out the best in his men: the 'Nelson touch'. His grasp of strategy and unconventional tactics produced a number of decisive victories. Some aspects of his behaviour were controversial during his lifetime and after: he began a notorious affair with Emma, Lady Hamilton while both were married, which lasted until his death. Also, his actions during the Neapolitan campaign resulted in allegations of excessive brutality. Nelson could at times be vain, insecure and overly anxious for recognition, but he was also zealous, patriotic and dutiful, as well as courageous. He was wounded several times in combat, losing most of one arm and the sight in one eye. His death at Trafalgar secured his position as one of England's most heroic figures. Numerous monuments, including Nelson's Column in Trafalgar Square, London, have been created in his memory and his legacy remains highly influential.

TEXT.English: The Lord of Sipan (El Señor de Sipan) is the name given to the first of several Moche mummies found at Huaca Rajada, Sipan, Peru by archaeologist Walter Alva. The site was discovered in 1987.Some archaeologists consider this find to be one of the most important archaeological discoveries in South America in the last 30 years, as the main tomb was found intact and untouched by thieves. By 2007, fourteen tombs had been located and identified at Huaca Rajada. The Royal Tombs Museum of Sipan was constructed in nearby Lambayeque to hold most of the artifacts and interpret the tombs. It opened in 2002 and Dr. Alva is director.

Lord is a title with various meanings. It can denote a prince or a feudal superior (especially a feudal tenant who holds directly from the king, i.e., a baron). The title today is mostly used in connection with the peerage of the United Kingdom or its predecessor countries, although some users of the title do not themselves hold peerages, and use it 'by courtesy'. The title may also be used in conjunction with others to denote a superior holder of an otherwise generic title, in such combinations as "Lord Mayor" or "Lord Chief Justice". The title is primarily taken by men, while women will usually take the title 'lady'. However, this is not universal, as the Lord of Mann and female Lord Mayors are examples of women who are styled 'lord'.

Lorenzo de' Medici (1 January 1449 9 April 1492) was an Italian statesman and de facto ruler of the Florentine Republic during the Italian Renaissance. He succeeded (1469) his father, Piero de' Medici, as head of the Medici family and as virtual ruler of Florence. One of the towering figures of the Italian Renaissance, he was an astute politician, firm in purpose, yet pliant and tolerant; a patron of the arts, literature, and learning; and a reputable scholar and poet. Without adopting any official title, he subtly managed to conduct the affairs of the Florentine state. His lavish public entertainments contributed to his popularity, but, in combination with his mediocre success as a businessman, they helped to drain his funds. His growing control of the government alarmed Pope Sixtus IV, who helped to foment the Pazzi conspiracy (1478) against Lorenzo and his brother, Giuliano de' Medici. Giuliano was stabbed to death during Mass at the cathedral, but Lorenzo escaped with a wound, and the plot collapsed. Lorenzo retaliated against the Pazzi, and Sixtus excommunicated him and laid an interdict on Florence. An honorable peace was made not long afterward. In 1480, in order to retrieve his huge financial losses, Lorenzo used his political power to gain control over the public funds of Florence. The city, however, flourished, and Lorenzo, who played an important role on the international scene, constantly worked to preserve general peace by establishing a balance of power among the Italian states. Through his credit with Pope Innocent VIII he obtained a cardinal's hat for his son Giovanni (later Pope Leo X). In spite of the attacks of Girolamo Savonarola, Lorenzo allowed him to continue his preaching. Lorenzo spent huge sums to purchase Greek and Latin manuscripts and to have them copied, and he urged the use of Italian in literature. His brilliant literary circle included Poliziano, Ficino, Luigi Pulci, and Giovanni Pico della Mirandola. He was a patron of Sandro Botticelli, Ghirlandaio, Filippino Lippi, Andrea del Verrocchio, Michelangelo, and other famed artists. His own poetrylove lyrics, rustic poems, carnival songs, sonnets, and odesshows a delicate feeling for nature. His son Piero de' Medici succeeded him as head of the family but was expelled from Florence two years later.
TEXT.Polish: Wawrzyniec Medyceusz (w³. TEXT.English: Although Paraguay is a landlocked country, it has a strong naval tradition by virtue of the fact that it has access to the Atlantic Ocean through the Paraguay-Parana rivers. The Paraguayan Navy has twelve bases. The main base is the Puerto Sajonia in Asuncion, followed by Bahia Negra, Ciudad del Este, Encarnacion, Salto del Guaira. It also has facilities in Puerto Sajonia for helicopters and airplanes in SGAS. Naval personnel including Marine Corps aviation personnel, and the naval guard equal about 1,950. The Marine Corps have 800 marines, of which 400 are assigned to one commando unit with the rest being organized into a single battalion consisting of three companies.

Ludovít Velislav Stúr was the leader of the Slovak national revival in the 19th century, and the author of the Slovak language standard, eventually leading to the contemporary Slovak literary language. Stúr was an organizer of the Slovak volunteer campaigns during the 1848 Revolution. He was also a politician, poet, journalist, publisher, teacher, philosopher, linguist and member of the Hungarian Parliament.
TEXT.French: Ludovít Velislav Stúr fut le leader de la renaissance nationale slovaque au XIXe siècle et l'auteur de la norme de la langue slovaque, conduisant à la langue littéraire slovaque contemporaine. Stúr organisa les campagnes de volontaires slovaques lors de la révolution de 1848. Il fut également politicien, poète, journaliste, éditeur, enseignant, philosophe, linguiste et membre du Parlement hongrois.

TEXT.English: Lugal-Zage-Si of Umma (reigned c. 2294 - 2270 BC short chronology) was the last Sumerian king before the conquest of Sumer by Sargon of Akkad and the rise of the Akkadian Empire, and was considered as the only king of the third dynasty of Uruk. He eventually united Sumer briefly as a single kingdom.
TEXT.French: Lugal-Zage-Si d'Umma (règne vers 2294 - 2270 av. J.-C. en chronologie courte) fut le dernier roi sumérien avant la conquête de Sumer par Sargon d'Akkad et l'essor de l'Empire akkadien, et était considéré comme le seul roi de la troisième dynastie d'Uruk. Il unifia brièvement Sumer en un royaume unique.
TEXT.Polish: Lugalzagesi - w³adca sumeryjskiego miasta-pañstwa Umma, panuj¹cy ok. 2350 r p.n.e. Jeden z pierwszych sumeryjskich w³adców, który podj¹³ próbê zjednoczenia ca³ego Sumeru. W Sumeryjskiej liœcie królów wystêpuje jako jedyny przedstawiciel III dynastii z Uruk.

TEXT.English: Luís Alves de Lima e Silva

Spanish.Text: Luís Alves de Lima e Silva

TEXT.Polish: Luís Alves de Lima e Silva
TEXT.Italian: Luís Alves de Lima e Silva

TEXT.English: Luís Alves de Lima e Silva, Duke of Caxias (August 25, 1803May 7, 1880), was a Brazilian military leader and statesman. In more than one occasion, he served as Prime Minister of the Brazilian Empire. Considered one of the most important heroes in Brazilian military history, Caxias fought in the Argentina-Brazil War, the War of Tatters, Platine War, and, most notably, in the War of Triple Alliance. He was the only Brazilian not related to the House of Braganza to receive the honorary title of Duke (the others being Auguste de Beauharnais, Duke of Santa Cruz and the Duchesses of Gois and Cear, illegitimate daughters of Emperor Pedro I), and the only Duke to be created in the reign of Emperor Pedro II. Caxias entered the military while in adolescence, and rapidly rose to the ranks of General and Baron, subsequently becoming Marshal, Count, Marquis, Senator, and Aide-de-Camp to the Emperor. He was twice Minister of War and also President of the Council, exerting great political influence as a conservative leader. Caxias was superseded as commander of the Brazilian Forces by the Count d'Eu after the capture of Asuncin, and received the title of Duke in 1869. The Brazilian holiday Dia do Soldado (Portuguese, "Day of the Soldier") is celebrated on his birthday, August 25, and the cities of Duque de Caxias and Caxias do Sul are named in his honor. He is honoured as the Patron of the Brazilian Army.
TEXT.Polish: Luís Alves de Lima e Silva, ks. Caxias, (sierpieñ 25, 1803 - maj 7, 1880), by³ brazylijskim dowódc¹ wojskowym i politykiem. S³u¿y³ tak¿e jako premier Cesarstwa Brazylii. TEXT.English: The nomadic Lule of the plains, who in addition to their own language, spoke Tonocote, the local lingua franca and the language of Spanish catechism.
TEXT.French: Les nomades Lule des plaines, qui en plus de leur propre langue, parlaient le tonocote, la lingua franca locale et la langue du catéchisme espagnol.

TEXT.English: Lutakawi was Zuni Governor. The Zuni were and are a traditional people who live by irrigated agriculture and raising livestock. Their success as a desert agri-economy is due to careful management and conservation of resources, as well as a complex system of community support. Many contemporary Zuni also rely on the sale of traditional arts and crafts. Some Zuni still live in the old-style Pueblos, while others live in modern flat-roofed houses made from adobe and concrete block. Their location is relatively isolated, but they welcome respectful tourists.

A lynx (plural lynx or lynxes) is any of the four species within the Lynx genus of medium-sized wildcats. There is considerable confusion about the best way to classify felids at present, and some authorities classify them as part of the genus Felis.[PARAGRAPH:2]Neither the caracal, sometimes called the Persian lynx or African lynx, nor the jungle cat, called the swamp lynx, is a member of the Lynx genus.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]Appearance[/H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Lynx have short tails and the characteristic tufts of black hair on the tips of their ears. They have a ruff under the neck, which has black bars, is not very visible, and resembles a bow tie. They have large, padded paws for walking on snow, and long whiskers on the face.[PARAGRAPH:2]Their body colour varies from medium brown, to goldish, to beige-white, and is occasionally marked with dark brown spots, especially on the limbs. All species of lynx also have white fur on their chests, bellies and on the insides of their legs, which are extensions of the chest and belly fur. Also, the lynx's colouring, fur height and paw size varies by its climate range in the Southwestern United States, the fur and colour are short-haired, dark and the paws are smaller and less padded; as the lynx ranges to its colder northern climates, the fur gets progressively thicker (for warmth), the colour gets lighter (for camouflage) and its paws enlarge and become more padded (for snowy environments). The paws may become larger than a human hand or foot.[PARAGRAPH:2]The smallest species are the bobcat and the Canada lynx, while the largest is the Eurasian lynx, with considerable variations within species.

Macaws are small to large, often colourful New World parrots. Of the many different Psittacidae (true parrots) genera, six are classified as macaws: Ara, Anodorhynchus, Cyanopsitta, Primolius, Orthopsittaca, and Diopsittaca. Previously, the members of the genus Primolius were placed in Propyrrhura, but the former is correct in accordance with ICZN rules. Macaws are native to Mexico, Central America, South America, and formerly the Caribbean. Most species are associated with forests, especially rainforests, but others prefer woodland or savannah-like habitats.[PARAGRAPH:2]Large, dark (usually black) beaks, and relatively bare, light coloured, medial (facial patch) areas distinguish macaws. Sometimes the facial patch is smaller in some species, and limited to a yellow patch around the eyes and a second patch near the base of the beak in the members of the genus Anodorhynchus, or Hyacinth Macaw. A macaw's facial feather pattern is as unique as a fingerprint.[PARAGRAPH:2]Some of the macaw species are known for their impressive size. The largest parrot in length and wingspan is the Hyacinth Macaw. The heaviest macaw is the Buffon's, although the heaviest parrot is the flightless Kakapo. While still relatively large parrots, the macaws of the genera Cyanopsitta, Orthopsittaca and Primolius are significantly smaller than the members of Anodorhynchus and Ara. The smallest member of the family, the Red-shouldered Macaw, is no larger than some parakeets of the genus Aratinga.[PARAGRAPH:2]Macaws, like other parrots, toucans and woodpeckers, are zygodactyl, having their first and fourth toes pointing backwards.
TEXT.German: Bei den (Eigentlichen) Aras (Ara) handelt es sich um besonders farbenprächtige Papageien. Sie bilden eine eigene Gattung innerhalb der Neuweltpapageien (Arini). Die Bezeichnung Ara leiteten schon die Indianer von den Rufen der Tiere ab.[PARAGRAPH:2]In Größe und Farbe unterscheiden sich die einzelnen Arten zum Teil sehr stark, beide Geschlechter tragen aber jeweils ein gleichermaßen farbenprächtiges Kleid. Gemein ist allen Aras die Gesichtsmaske, die aus einer größeren, wenig bis gar nicht befiederten Hautfläche besteht. Sie verfügen über eine breiten Kopf, einen sehr großen, kräftigen Schnabel und einen langen Schwanz, der sich aus unterschiedlich langen, übereinanderliegenden Federn zusammensetzt.[PARAGRAPH:2]Aras sind in Süd- und Mittelamerika heimisch. Dort leben sie hauptsächlich in tropischen und subtropischen Wäldern, manche Arten findet man auch in den Savannen. Sie ernähren sich von Samen, Nüssen, Früchten, Beeren und Knospen. Ihr speziell geformter Schnabel ist perfekt zum Knacken von Nüssen und hartschaligen Früchten geeignet.[PARAGRAPH:2]Für die meisten Menschen ist der Ara der Papagei überhaupt. Ihre Farbenpracht, ihre Intelligenz und ihre Begabungen ziehen viele Tierliebhaber in ihren Bann.

TEXT.English: The Maccabees, also spelled Machabees, were the leaders of a Jewish rebel army that took control of Judea, which at the time had been a province of the Seleucid Empire. They founded the Hasmonean dynasty, which ruled from 164 BCE to 63 BCE. They reasserted the Jewish religion, partly by forced conversion, expanded the boundaries of Judea by conquest and reduced the influence of Hellenism and Hellenistic Judaism.
TEXT.French: Le Maccabees étaient un mouvement national juif de libération qui a combattu pour l'indépendance d'Antiochus IV Epiphanes. Le Maccabees a fondé la dynastie de Hasmonean de l'Israel. Dans 167 AVANT JéSUS CHRIST, après qu'Antiochus ait interdit la pratique juive, un prêtre de Modiin, Mattathias le Hasmonean, a étincelé une révolte en refusant d'adorer les dieux grecs. Après la mort de Mattathias, son fils Judah Maccabee a mené une armée des juifs contre la dynastie de Seleucid. Le terme Maccabees est employé pour décrire l'armée de Judah Maccabee.[PARAGRAPH:1]La révolte a inclus beaucoup de différentes batailles. Dans beaucoup, les forces de Maccabeean ont gagné la victoire pour leur usage de la tactique de guérillero. Après la révolte, le Maccabees a nettoyé le temple, et a déclaré Judah Maccabee un prêtre. Une armée syrienne a été envoyée pour détruire la révolte, mais est retournée après la mort d'Antiochus.[PARAGRAPH:1]Après la révolte, le Maccabees étaient incertain si continuer de combattre, voyant leur succès militaire dans la révolte. Ceux qui ont continué à combattre ont été menés par Judah Maccabee. Judah Maccabee est mort dans 160 AVANT JéSUS CHRIST dans la bataille. Judah a été réussi par son plus jeune frère Jonathan, qui était déjà un haut prêtre. Jonathan a fait des traités avec des nations étrangères, causant plus de conflits entre ceux qui ont voulu la puissance politique d'excédent religieux de liberté. Dans 142 AVANT JéSUS CHRIST, Jonathan est mort. Il a été réussi par le dernier fils de Mattathias, Simon. Que la même année, Demetrius, roi de la Syrie, a accordé aux juifs l'indépendance de Syrie et Simon a continué à a trouvé la dynastie de Hasmonean.[PARAGRAPH:1]Chaque année, juifs célèbrent Hannukah pour célébrer et identifier la victoire de Judah Maccabee sur le Seleucids et les miracles relatifs.
TEXT.German: Das Maccabees waren eine jüdische nationale Befreiungbewegung, die für Unabhängigkeit von Antiochus IV Epiphanes kämpfte. Das Maccabees gründete die Hasmonean Dynastie von Israel. In 167 BC, nachdem Antiochus jüdische Praxis verbot, funkte ein Priester von Modiin, Mattathias das Hasmonean, ein Aufruhr, indem er ablehnte, griechische Götter anzubeten. Nach Tod Mattathiass führte sein Sohn Judah Maccabee eine Armee der Juden gegen die Seleucid Dynastie. Die Bezeichnung Maccabees wird verwendet, um die Armee von Judah Maccabee zu beschreiben.[PARAGRAPH:1]Der Aufruhr schloß viele einzelne Schlachten ein. In vielen gewannen die Maccabeean Kräfte Sieg für ihren Gebrauch von Bandenkämpfertaktiken. Nach dem Aufruhr reinigte das Maccabees den Bügel und erklärte Judah Maccabee ein Priester. Eine syrische Armee wurde gesendet, um den Aufruhr zu zerstören, aber zurückging nach dem Tod von Antiochus.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nach dem Aufruhr waren das Maccabees unsicher, ob man fortfährt zu kämpfen und ihren militärischen Erfolg im Aufruhr sieht. Die, die fortfuhren zu kämpfen, wurden von Judah Maccabee geführt. Judah Maccabee starb in 160 BC in der Schlacht. Judah wurde von seinem jüngeren Bruder Jonathan gefolgt, der bereits ein hoher Priester war. Jonathan bildete Verträge mit den fremden Nationen und verursachte mehr Debatten zwischen denen, die politische Energie des frommen Freiheit überschusses wünschten. In 142 BC, starb Jonathan. Er wurde vom letzten Sohn von Mattathias, Simon gefolgt. Daß das gleiche Jahr, Demetrius, König von Syrien, den Juden Unabhängigkeit von Syrien und von Simon bewilligte, gingen an zu fanden die Hasmonean Dynastie.[PARAGRAPH:1]Jedes Jahr, Juden feiern Hannukah, um Judah Maccabees Sieg über dem Seleucids und den in Verbindung stehenden Wundern zu feiern und zu erkennen.
TEXT.Italian: Il Maccabees era un movimento nazionale ebreo di liberazione che ha combattuto per indipendenza da Antiochus IV Epiphanes. Il Maccabees ha fondato il Dynasty di Hasmonean dell'Israele. In 167 BC, dopo che Antiochus proibisse alla pratica ebrea, un priest da Modiin, Mattathias il Hasmonean, ha scintillato una sommossa rifiutando di adorare i dii greci. Dopo la morte del Mattathias, il suo figlio Judah Maccabee ha condotto un esercito degli ebrei contro il Dynasty di Seleucid. Il termine Maccabees è usato per descrivere l'esercito di Judah Maccabee.[PARAGRAPH:1]La sommossa ha incluso molte diverse battaglie. In molti, le forze di Maccabeean hanno vinto la vittoria per il loro uso delle tattiche del guerrigliero. Dopo la sommossa, il Maccabees ha pulito il tempiale ed ha dichiarato Judah Maccabee un priest. Un esercito siriano è stato trasmesso per distruggere la sommossa, ma ha rinviato dopo la morte di Antiochus.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dopo la sommossa, il Maccabees era incerto se continuare il combattimento, vedente il loro successo militare nella sommossa. Coloro che ha continuato a combattere sono stati condotti da Judah Maccabee. Judah Maccabee è morto BC in 160 nella battaglia. Judah è stato riuscito dal suo fratello più giovane Jonathan, che era già un alto priest. Jonathan ha fatto i trattati con le nazioni straniere, causanti più dispute fra coloro che ha desiderato l'alimentazione politica dell'eccedenza religiosa di libertà. In 142 BC, Jonathan morto. È stato riuscito dall'ultimo figlio di Mattathias, Simon. Che lo stesso anno, Demetrius, re della Siria, ha assegnato agli ebrei l'indipendenza dalla Siria e da Simon ha continuato a ha trovato il dynasty di Hasmonean.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ogni anno, ebrei celebra Hannukah per celebrare e riconoscere la vittoria del Judah Maccabee sopra il Seleucids ed i miracoli relativi.
TEXT.Spanish: El Maccabees era un movimiento nacional judío de la liberación que luchó para la independencia de Antiochus IV Epiphanes. El Maccabees fundó la dinastía de Hasmonean de Israel. En 167 A.C., después de que Antiochus prohibiera práctica judía, un sacerdote de Modiin, Mattathias el Hasmonean, chispeó una rebelión rechazando adorar a dioses griegos. Después de la muerte de Mattathias, su hijo Judah Maccabee condujo a ejército de judíos contra la dinastía de Seleucid. El término Maccabees se utiliza para describir al ejército de Judah Maccabee.[PARAGRAPH:1]La rebelión incluyó muchas batallas individuales. En muchos, las fuerzas de Maccabeean ganaron la victoria para su uso de las táctica del guerrilla. Después de la rebelión, el Maccabees limpió el templo, y declaró a Judah Maccabee un sacerdote. Enviaron para destruir la rebelión, pero volvió un ejército sirio después de la muerte de Antiochus.[PARAGRAPH:1]Después de la rebelión, el Maccabees era inseguro si continuar luchando, viendo su éxito militar en la rebelión. A Judah Maccabee condujeron los que continuaron luchando. Judah Maccabee murió en 160 A.C. en batalla. A su hermano más joven Jonatán tuvo éxito a Judah, que era ya sacerdote alto. Jonatán hizo tratados con las naciones extranjeras, causando más conflictos entre los que desearon energía política del excedente religioso de la libertad. En 142 A.C., Jonatán muerto. Al hijo pasado de Mattathias lo tuvo éxito, Simon. Que el mismo año, Demetrius, rey de Siria, concedió a judíos independencia de Siria y de Simon fue encendido a encontró la dinastía de Hasmonean.[PARAGRAPH:1]Cada año, judíos celebra Hannukah para celebrar y para reconocer la victoria de Judah Maccabee sobre el Seleucids y los milagros relacionados.
TEXT.Polish: Powstanie Machabeuszów ew. Machabeuszy mia³o miejsce w Judei w latach 167-160 p.n.e. Po wojnach diadochów zwierzchnictwo nad Jerozolim¹ przejêli Seleucydzi. Gdy w roku 168 p.n.e. TEXT.English: Judas Maccabeus was a Jewish guerrilla leader who defended his country from invasion by the Seleucid king Antiochus IV Epiphanes, preventing the imposition of Hellenism upon Judaea, and preserving the Jewish religion. The son of Mattathias, an aged priest who took to the mountains in rebellion when Antiochus attempted to impose the Greek religion on the Jews, Judas took over the rebel leadership on his father's death and proved to be a military genius, overthrowing four Seleucid armies in quick succession and restoring the Temple of Jerusalem. This deed is celebrated in the Jewish festival of lights, Hanukka. On Antiochus' death in 164 BCE, the Seleucids offered the Jews freedom of worship, but Judas continued the war, hoping to free his nation politically as well as religiously. Although he himself was killed two years later, his younger brothers took over the fight, finally securing the independence of Judaea.
