TEXT.English: A maceman is a medieval infantryman armed with a heavy club called a "mace." The mace is usually constructed of wood and metal; the head of the mace is faced with spikes, spines or knobs, allowing the weapon to more easily penetrate armor. [PARAGRAPH:1]The mace was a weapon of the feudal ages. The weapon is brutally powerful but also heavy and unweildy, making it perfect for taking on slow-moving, heavily-armored targets such as knights and armored infantry. [PARAGRAPH:1]Like so many other medieval warriors, the maceman was made obsolete by the advent of gunpowder. The armor of the day was unable to stop musket balls from penetrating; it simply slowed the wearers down, making them easier targets. Once soldiers began removing their armor, the mace was replaced by lighter melee weapons or the macemen were retrained as musketmen themselves.
TEXT.French: Les soldats avec masse, qui font partie de l'infanterie médiévale, utilisent une sorte de grosse massue appelée "masse". Celle-ci est généralement en bois et en métal, et possède une tête couverte de pointes, de piques ou de protubérances, qui permettent à l'arme de pénétrer plus facilement les armures. [PARAGRAPH:1]La masse était utilisée à l'époque féodale. C'était une arme puissante mais lourde et difficile à manier, idéale pour attaquer des cibles lentes équipées de grosses armures, comme les chevaliers ou l'infanterie lourde. [PARAGRAPH:1]Comme de nombreuses armes médiévales, la masse devint obsolète avec l'apparition des armes à feu. Incapables de résister aux tirs des mousquets, les armures de l'époque ne faisaient que ralentir leurs porteurs, faisant d'eux des cibles faciles. Après l'abandon des armures, les soldats avec masse remplacèrent leur arme par des armes de combat rapproché plus légères, ou furent reconvertis en arquebusiers.
TEXT.German: Die Streitkolbenträger mittelalterlicher Armeen waren mit schweren Knüppeln, so genannten "Streitkolben", bewaffnet. Bei diesen handelte es sich um mit Dornen oder Stacheln besetzte Metallkeulen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Da der Streitkolben Rüstungen mühelos durchschlug, eignete er sich aufgrund seines Gewichts vor allem für Angriffe auf Ritter und andere langsame Infanterieeinheiten. [PARAGRAPH:1]Die Erfindung des Schießpulvers bedeutete das Ende der Streitkolbenträger, da diese den Kugeln einer Muskete nichts entgegenzusetzen hatten. An die Stelle des Streitkolbens traten nun leichtere Nahkampfwaffen und Musketen.
TEXT.Italian: I soldati con mazza erano unità di fanteria medievale armati di grosse clave, più comunemente note come "mazze". La mazza era generalmente realizzata in legno e metallo; la testa della mazza era dotata di punte o borchie, che permettevano all'arma di perforare facilmente le armature. [PARAGRAPH:1]La mazza è stata l'arma utilizzata durante il Feudalesimo: terribilmente potente, l'ideale per colpire unità dalla scarsa mobilità, come cavalieri e fanteria corazzata. [PARAGRAPH:1]Come molti altri guerrieri medievali, i soldati con mazza vennero resi obsoleti con la scoperta della polvere da sparo. Le vecchie armature non potevano fermare i proiettili sparati dai moschetti e servivano soltanto a rallentare chi le indossava, in modo da offrire bersagli più facili. Quando i soldati cominciarono a liberarsi delle armature, la mazza venne sostituita da armi di combattimento corpo a corpo. I soldati con mazza vennero addestrati a loro volta come moschettieri.
TEXT.Spanish: El macero es un soldado de infantería medieval armado con un garrote pesado llamado "maza". La maza está normalmente hecha de madera y metal; su cabeza está rematada con púas, pinchos o bolas, lo que permite al arma penetrar la armadura con más facilidad. [PARAGRAPH:1]La maza era un arma de la edad feudal. Es brutalmente poderosa, pero también pesada y difícil de manejar, lo que la hacía perfecta para atacar a objetivos lentos como caballeros e infantería con armadura. [PARAGRAPH:1]Como muchos otros guerreros medievales, el macero quedó obsoleto con la llegada de la pólvora. La armadura de la época era incapaz de detener las balas de mosquete y simplemente ralentizaba a los que la llevaban, haciéndoles blancos fáciles. Cuando los soldados empezaron a quitarse la armadura, la maza fue sustituida por otras armas ligeras de lucha cuerpo a cuerpo, y comenzó a entrenarse a los maceros en el uso de mosquetes.

TEXT.English: Many WWII-era divisions had a heavy weapons unit composed of a number of heavy machine guns, and perhaps a battery of 8cm field mortars. While such units were sometimes attached on the company level to a battalion, there were also entire battalions of machineguns attached at the division or corps level. The defensive ability of massed machineguns was first illustrated with deadly earnest during WWI by windrows of dead. By WWII the typical machinegun's rate of fire and increased and its bulk decreased, thus making it even deadlier and more mobile.
TEXT.French: Pendant la Deuxième Guerre mondiale, de nombreuses divisions disposaient d'une unité regroupant des mitrailleuses de gros calibre et parfois même des mortiers de 80 mm. Certaines de ces unités étaient rattachées à un bataillon, mais il existait également des bataillons entiers de mitrailleuses au sein d'une division ou d'un corps d'armée. L'efficacité défensive de ces regroupements de mitrailleuses avait été testée au cours de la Première Guerre mondiale et s'était avérée redoutable. Les mitrailleuses de la Deuxième Guerre mondiale disposaient d'une cadence de tir très supérieure et étaient beaucoup moins volumineuses, ce qui les rendait à la fois plus puissantes et plus mobiles.
TEXT.German: In vielen Divisonen gab es während des 2. Weltkriegs eine Einheit mit schweren Waffen, wie schweren MGs oder 8-cm-Feldmörsern. Diese Einheiten waren nicht selten auf Kompanieebene einem Bataillon unterstellt. Es gab aber auch reine MG-Bataillons, die bestimmten Divisionen oder Korps unterstellt waren. Die Effektivität massierter MG-Verbände wurde erstmals in den Grabenkriegen des 1. Weltkriegs offensichtlich. Die im 2. Weltkrieg eingesetzten MGs hatten bereits eine deutlich höhere Kadenz und waren wesentlich leichter.
TEXT.Italian: Molte divisioni della Seconda Guerra Mondiale erano munite di armamento pesante, in genere mitragliatori pesanti e in alcuni casi addirittura di mortai da 8 centimetri. Queste unità venivano aggregate come compagnia nei battaglioni, aumentando la potenza di fuoco pesante. L'abilità difensiva di un gran numero di mitragliatrici pesanti fu dimostrata ampiamente durante la Prima Guerra Mondiale. Durante la Seconda Guerra Mondiale, le mitragliatrici divennero più rapide nello sparare e più leggere, in modo da essere più letali e più facili da spostare.
TEXT.Spanish: Durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial, muchas divisiones contaban con un destacamento de armas pesadas compuesto por una serie de ametralladoras pesadas y, en algunos casos, una batería de morteros de campaña de 80 mm. Aunque estas unidades estaban a veces asociadas a un batallón, también existían batallones enteros de ametralladoras asociados a una división. La capacidad defensiva de las unidades de ametralladoras quedó patente con mortal claridad durante la Primera Guerra Mundial. Al estallar la Segunda Guerra Mundial, la cadencia de fuego de las ametralladoras normales había aumentado, al tiempo que había descendido su peso, lo que las convertía en armas aún más móviles y letales.

TEXT.English: Machined parts manufacture and industrial manufacturing practices along with gunpowder have introduced a new, stronger, smarter breed of specialized mechanical repair personnel.
TEXT.French: La fabrication de pièces usinées et les pratiques industrielles, ainsi que la poudre à canon, ont introduit une nouvelle génération de personnel spécialisé en réparation mécanique, plus fort et plus intelligent.
TEXT.Polish: Maszynista pojazdu trakcyjnego - osoba posiadaj¹ca odpowiednie kompetencje i upowa¿niona do prowadzenia poci¹gów, w tym lokomotyw, lokomotyw manewrowych, poci¹gów roboczych (budowlanych), kolejowych pojazdów specjalnych lub poci¹gów przeznaczonych do kolejowego przewozu pasa¿erów lub towarów. Maszynista pracuje w kabinie sterowniczej lokomotywy lub zespo³u trakcyjnego, ewentualnie na specjalnym stanowisku w wagonie sterowniczym, sk¹d jest w stanie prowadziæ poci¹g.

TEXT.English: Strictly speaking, the Guanches were the indigenous peoples of Tenerife, where the population seems to have lived in relative isolation up to the time of the Castilian conquest, around the 14th century (though Genoese, Portuguese, and Castilians may have visited there from the second half of the 8th century onwards). The name came to be applied to the indigenous populations of all the seven Canary Islands, those of Tenerife being the most important or powerful.
TEXT.French: À proprement parler, les Guanches étaient les peuples indigènes de Tenerife, où la population semble avoir vécu en relative isolement jusqu'à la conquête castillane vers le XIVe siècle (même si Génois, Portugais et Castillans auraient pu visiter l'île dès la seconde moitié du VIIIe siècle). Le nom fut ensuite appliqué aux populations indigènes des sept îles Canaries, celles de Tenerife étant les plus importantes ou puissantes.

TEXT.English: Magi is a term, used since at least the 6th century BCE, to denote followers of Zoroastrianism or Zoroaster. The earliest known usage of the word Magi is in the trilingual inscription written by Darius the Great, known as the Behistun Inscription. Old Persian texts, pre-dating the Hellenistic period, refer to a Magus as a Zurvanic, and presumably Zoroastrian, priest.
TEXT.French: Les Mages sont un terme utilisé depuis au moins le 6e siècle av. J.-C. pour désigner les adeptes du zoroastrisme ou de Zoroastre. La première utilisation connue du mot Mage se trouve dans l'inscription trilingue écrite par Darius le Grand, appelée inscription de Behistun. Les textes vieux perses, antérieurs à la période hellénistique, désignent le Mage comme un prêtre zurvanique, et probablement zoroastrien.

TEXT.English: According to Braunstein (1983), among the Chaco groups several bands constitute a 'tribe', identified by a common name and associated by marriage and exchange. He states that tribes have been preferably endogamous, with uxirolocal postmarital residence. Among the Pilaga, tribes have identified with names of regional animals and these traditional denominations persist in present times.
TEXT.French: Selon Braunstein (1983), parmi les groupes du Chaco, plusieurs bandes constituent une 'tribu', identifiée par un nom commun et associée par mariage et échanges. Il affirme que les tribus étaient préférentiellement endogames, avec une résidence post-maritale uxirolocale. Parmi les Pilaga, les tribus s'identifient par des noms d'animaux régionaux et ces dénominations traditionnelles persistent encore aujourd'hui.

TEXT.English: Aatsista-Mahkan or Running Rabbit (c. 1833 - probably 24 January 1911) was a chief of the Siksika First Nation. He was the son of Akamukai (Many Swans), chief of the Biters band, and following the death of his father in 1871, Aatsista-Mahkan took control of the band. He was known for his generosity and kindness, and for his loyal protection of his family.
TEXT.French: Aatsista-Mahkan ou Lapin Courant (vers 1833 - probablement 24 janvier 1911) fut un chef de la Première Nation Siksika. Il était le fils d'Akamukai (Nombreux Cygnes), chef de la bande des Mordeurs, et après la mort de son père en 1871, Aatsista-Mahkan prit le contrôle de la bande. Il était connu pour sa générosité, sa bonté et sa loyale protection de sa famille.
TEXT.Polish: Aatsista-Mahkan lub Running Rabbit (c. 1833 - probably 24 January 1911) by³ wodzem plemienia Siksika.

TEXT.English: In the 17th century, the buccaneer John Esquemeling recorded the use of mahogany or cedrela on Hispaniola for making canoes: "The Indians make these canoes without the use of any iron instruments, by only burning the trees at the bottom near the root, and afterwards governing the fire with such industry that nothing is burnt more than what they would have..."
TEXT.French: Au XVIIe siècle, le boucanier John Esquemeling a enregistré l'usage de l'acajou ou du cèdre à Hispaniola pour fabriquer des pirogues : "Les Indiens fabriquent ces pirogues sans utiliser d'instruments en fer, en brûlant seulement les arbres à la base près des racines, puis en contrôlant le feu avec tant d'habileté que rien n'est brûlé au-delà de ce qu'ils veulent..."

TEXT.English: Mahout is the traditional name for one who trains and handles a domesticated elephant, a practice that has occurred for more than 3,000 years. In Hindu culture, elephants were highly respected as a manifestation of the elephant god Ganesh, the god of good luck. Having elephants participate in a festival or procession was required for every celebratory occasion, and being the mahout who cared for a great elephant on such an occasion was a great honor.

A unique dance routine using rifles performed by the Mahsud tribe of Pashtuns in South Waziristan. Originally it was used to dance at the time of war, but later on became a cultural dance. The dancers dance empty handed and require only large drums. Nowadays though it is danced with the guns in the dancers hand; loaded guns are taken in one hand, up to the beat of the drum the dancers move forward in a circle. After taking two and half steps, each dancer turns about, and cocks the gun. All the dancers do this in a uniform manner and by completing the turning steps they fire in the air simultaneously. The sound of each of the guns goes on one time and seems to be a single big bang.

Most historians believe maize was domesticated in the Tehuacan Valley of Mexico. The Olmec and Mayans cultivated it in numerous varieties throughout Mesoamerica, cooked, ground or processed through nixtamalization. Beginning about 2500 BC, the crop spread through much of the Americas. The region developed a trade network based on surplus and varieties of maize crops. After European contact with the Americas in the late 15th and early 16th centuries, explorers and traders carried maize back to Europe and introduced it to other countries. Maize spread to the rest of the world because of its ability to grow in diverse climates. Sugar-rich varieties called sweet corn are usually grown for human consumption as kernels, while field corn varieties are used for animal feed, various corn-based human food uses (including grinding into cornmeal or masa, pressing into corn oil, and fermentation and distillation into alcoholic beverages like bourbon whiskey), and as chemical feedstocks.

Piracy in the Strait of Malacca has for long[clarification needed] been a threat to ship owners and the mariners who ply the 900 km-long (550 miles) sea lane. In recent years[vague], coordinated patrols by Indonesia, Malaysia, and Singapore along with increased security on vessels have sparked a dramatic downturn in piracy, according to the International Maritime Bureau (IMB). The Strait of Malacca's geography makes the region very susceptible to piracy. It was and still is an important passageway between China and India, used heavily for commercial trade. The strait is on the route between Europe, the Suez Canal, the oil-exporting countries of the Persian Gulf, and the busy ports of East Asia. It is narrow, contains thousands of islets, and is an outlet for many rivers, making it ideal for pirates to hide in to evade capture.

The Maniq are a hunting and gathering society. They build temporary huts of bamboo with roofs made of banana leaves. They hunt many types of animals and consume many different kinds of vegetables and fruits. They wear simple clothes made of materials such as bamboo leaves. They are familiar with many different species of medicinal herbs.
TEXT.French: Les Maniq sont une société de chasseurs-cueilleurs. Ils construisent des huttes temporaires en bambou avec des toits en feuilles de bananier. Ils chassent de nombreux types d'animaux et consomment différents types de légumes et fruits. Ils portent des vêtements simples faits de matériaux comme les feuilles de bambou. Ils connaissent de nombreuses espèces d'herbes médicinales.

TEXT.English: At its height, the Mali Empire stretched half-way across Africa, and included many subordinate tribes. To keep order, the Mali employed a huge standing army. During war, the Mali often fought as "skirmishers" - soldiers who fan out in loose formation to protect the main force's flanks or front. The Mali skirmishers were lightly-armed archers in that force, famed for their courage and their marksmanship.
TEXT.French: A son apogée, l'Empire du Mali s'étendait sur la moitié de l'Afrique, et comprenait de nombreuses tribus soumises. Pour maintenir l'ordre, le Mali entretenait une immense armée permanente et, lors des conflits, menait souvent une guerre d'escarmouche : des soldats se déployaient en formation relâchée pour protéger les flancs ou l'avant du gros de l'armée. Ces unités étaient des archers légèrement armés, réputés pour leur courage et leur adresse au tir.
TEXT.German: In seiner Blütezeit erstreckte sich das Großreich Mali über halb Afrika und herrschte über zahlreiche untergeordnete Stämme. Um die Ordnung zu sichern, unterhielten die Mali eine gewaltige Armee. Die Soldaten kämpften nicht selten als so genannte "Plänkler". Sie schwärmten also in loser Formation aus, um die Flanken und die Front ihrer Hauptstreitmacht zu schützen. Die Plänkler der Mali waren für ihren Mut und ihre Treffsicherheit berühmte leicht gepanzerte Bogenschützen.
TEXT.Italian: Nel suo momento di massimo splendore, l'Impero del Mali si estendeva per più di metà Africa e includeva moltissime tribù subordinate. Per mantenere l'ordine venne assemblato un potente esercito: durante la guerra, ci furono molti scontri tra "combattenti" che si muovevano liberamente per proteggere il gruppo principale. I combattenti del Mali erano soldati armati di archi leggeri e famosi per il loro coraggio e la loro mira.
TEXT.Spanish: En su apogeo, el imperio de Malí se extendía por la mitad de África e incluía en su seno a numerosas tribus sometidas. Para mantener el orden, los malíes utilizaban un ejército permanente de enormes dimensiones. En la guerra, solían luchar como "hostigadores": soldados desplegados en formación abierta para cubrir los flancos o el frente del grueso del ejército. Los hostigadores malíes eran arqueros poco armados, famosos por su valor y su puntería.

TEXT.English: The term mambises refers to the guerrilla Cuban independence soldiers who fought against Spain in the Ten Years War (1868-1878) and War of Independence (1895-1898). The term is found applied in different history texts to any person who fought for independence during the wars of independence including soldiers of Chinese, American, and Spanish origin.
Mamluk meaning "property" or "owned slave" of the king, also transliterated as mamlouk, mamluq, mamluke, mameluk, mameluke, mamaluke or marmeluke) is an Arabic designation for slaves.
TEXT.French: Le terme Mamelouk signifie "propriété" ou "esclave possédé" du roi, également translittéré en mamlouk, mamluq, mamluke, mameluk, mameluke, mamaluke ou marmeluke) est une désignation arabe pour les esclaves.

TEXT.English: The Manchu people overthrew the Ming dynasty in the middle of the seventeenth century. They established the Ch'ing dynasty and tried to remain separate from the general populace of China. They had been a nomadic people once, riding and fighting from horseback, and tending crops and herds. The Ch'ing dynasty ruled China for about 300 years.

Manco Capac was a legendary culture hero of the Incas, the founder of their Empire. There are several versions of his story. The best-known source, The Royal Commentaries of the Inca by Inca Garcilaso de 1a Vega, relates that the sun god was distressed that the people of earth did not live in a civilized way. As he crossed the sky each day, he saw that they wore only leaves and animal skins for clothing, lived in caves, and gathered wild plants and berries for food. So the sun god decided to send his son Manco Capac and daughter Mama Ocllo to teach the people how to improve their way of life. He gave his children a golden rod and told them to push it into the ground wherever they stopped to rest. When they reached a spot where the rod sank completely into the ground with a single push, they should build a sacred city of the sun, to be named Cuzco. Setting out from Lake Titicaca, Manco Capac and Mama Ocllo wandered across the land and finally came to a valley where the golden rod sank easily into the soil. There they gathered all the people from near and far and taught them how to build homes, weave cloth, make tools, and grow crops. They also taught the people how to use weapons so that they could defend themselves and defeat others.
TEXT.Polish: Manco Capac wed³ug mitologii inkaskiej legendarny za³o¿yciel królewskiej dynastii Inków i pierwszy Sapa Inca. Manco Capac jest bohaterem wielu legend. Poniewa¿ Inkowie nie znali pisma, mity i historia na jego temat, ta byæ mo¿e prawdziwa i ta zmyœlona, nie zosta³y spisane. W zwi¹zku z tym ró¿nic w przekazach o legendarnym za³o¿ycielu królewskiej dynastii jest tak du¿o, jak i samych póŸniej spisanych wersji tego mitu. Niezmienne jednak w nich jest to, ¿e Manco Capac by³ pierwszym Ink¹, za³o¿ycielem Cuzco, a jego ¿on¹ by³a Mama Ocllo. Wed³ug peruwiañskiego historyka i kronikarza Inków Garcilaso de la Vega to sam bóg s³oñca Inti wys³a³ swoje dzieci na ziemiê. Z jeziora Titicaca Manco Capac i Mama Ocllo wyruszyli w drogê i za³o¿yli miasto Cuzco. Miejscowa ludnoœæ otacza³a ich wielk¹ czci¹, a Manco Capaca obwo³a³a ksiêciem i pierwszym Ink¹. Wed³ug innej wersji Manco wyszed³ ze œrodkowej spoœród trzech jaskiñ znajduj¹cych siê w jednym ze wzgórz w pobli¿u póŸniejszego miasta Cuzco. Razem z nim wynurzyli siê te¿ jego trzej bracia i cztery siostry. Czwórka braci nosi³a oprócz w³asnych imion imiê Ayar, siostry z kolei mia³y imiê zbiorowe Mama (Matka). Oœmioro rodzeñstwa opuœci³o grotê, udaj¹c siê w œwiat ze z³ot¹ lask¹ s³u¿¹c¹ do wypróbowywania w³aœciwoœci ziemi (z czasem taka z³ota pa³eczka, o d³ugoœci oko³o 60 cm, zakoñczona gwiazd¹, sta³a siê oznak¹ godnoœci królewskiej). Bóg "S³oñce" da³ swoim dzieciom z³oty prêt (Tupayawri), aby spad³ na ¿yzne miejsce w ziemi, takie, na którym mo¿na wznieœæ miasto. W drodze liczba braci zaczê³a siê przerzedzaæ. Sól Dzikiej Quinoi okaza³ siê bardzo silny i niepos³uszny: strzela³ kamieniami ze swej procy do gór i razi³ je tak mocno, ¿e tworzy³y siê w nich g³êbokie przepaœcie i urwiska. Rodzeñstwo przestraszy³o siê jego mocy i postanowi³o nak³oniæ go do powrotu do rodzinnej groty. Pomys³ zrealizowali i krn¹brny brat zamkniêty zosta³ w górze, gdzie, jak g³osi legenda, siedzi po dziœ dzieñ. Ayar Oco pokaza³ bratu Manco, jak powinna siê odbywaæ ceremonia wtajemniczenia m³odzieñców i przemieni³ siê w kamieñ na górze Huanacauri. Tam lud wzniós³ mu póŸniej œwi¹tyniê i modli³ siê do niego. Trzeci brat Wojownik Dzikiej Quinoi uda³ siê na miejsce, które przy pomocy z³otej pa³eczki wybrano jako odpowiednie miejsce na za³o¿enie miasta Cuzco i przemieni³ siê tam w inny œwiêty kamieñ. Ostatecznie trzech braci zosta³o zamienionych w kamienie. Pozosta³ tylko Manco Capac, który sp³odzi³ dziecko. Urodzi³a mu je jego siostra Czysta Matka. By³ to Sinchi Roca, który po Manco jako drugi Inka zasiada³ na tronie. Z ¿on¹, dzieckiem i trzema pozosta³ymi siostrami przyby³ Manco w obrane miejsce. Jedna z sióstr, Œwiêta Matka przepêdzi³a kamieniami z miejsca, do którego dotarli miejscowe legendarne szczepy Hualla i Alcahuiza. Z czasem zbudowano tam miasto Cuzco i œwi¹tyniê s³oñca.

TEXT.English: Mandawuy Djarrtjuntjun Yunupingu (formerly Tom Djambayang Bakamana Yunupingu, skin name Gudjuk), AC, (17 September 1956 - 2 June 2013) was an Aboriginal Australian musician and educator. From 1986 he was the front man of the Aboriginal rock group Yothu Yindi as a singer-songwriter and guitarist. In 1989 he became assistant principal of the Yirrkala Community School - his former school - and was principal for the following two years. He helped establish the Yolngu Action Group and introduced the Both Ways system, which recognised traditional Aboriginal teaching alongside Western methods. Yothu Yindi released six albums, Homeland Movement (March 1989), Tribal Voice (October 1991), Freedom (November 1993), Birrkuta - Wild Honey (November 1996), One Blood (June 1999), Garma (November 2000). The group's top 20 ARIA Singles Chart appearances were "Treaty" (1991) and "Djäpana (Sunset Dreaming)" (1992). He was appointed Australian of the Year for 1992 by the National Australia Day Council. In April 1998 he was awarded an honorary doctorate by the Queensland University of Technology. In December 2012 Yothu Yindi were inducted into the ARIA Hall of Fame. In 2007 he was diagnosed with advanced renal failure and died in 2013, aged 56.

Alongside the ton-tigi were horon cavalrymen. These horon were from elite society and included princes or other kinds of nobility. Because of the high price of Arab horses, Mandekalu horsemen were equipped by the ton-tigi or the mansa with their mount. Cavalry fought with lances, sabers and long swords. Imported chain mail and iron helmets would also be available to Mali's early cavalry. With control of trade routes from the Savannah to North Africa, the Mandekalu were able to build up a standing cavalry of around 10,000 horsemen by the reign of Mansa Musa. With such a force, the mansa was able to project his power from modern Senegal to the borders of present-day Nigeria.

[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mangonel[COLOR_REVERT] is especially effective when assaulting cities, can bombard enemy city fortifications, and has a chance to withdraw from combat when losing. When attacking another unit, they cause collateral damage to other enemy units sharing the target's space.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Le mangonneau[COLOR_REVERT] est particulièrement efficace lors des assauts contre les villes, peut bombarder les fortifications ennemies, et a une chance de se retirer du combat en cas de défaite. Lorsqu'il attaque une autre unité, il cause des dégâts collatéraux aux autres unités ennemies partageant l'espace de la cible.

TEXT.English: Maniq language may refer to two languages spoken by the Maniq people (Mani')
TEXT.French: La langue Maniq peut désigner deux langues parlées par le peuple Maniq (Mani').

TEXT.English: A man of war (also man-of-war, man'o'war or simply man) is an armed naval vessel. The term often refers to a ship armed with cannon and propelled primarily by sails, as opposed to a galley, which is propelled primarily by oars. The man of war was developed in the Mediterranean in the 15th century from earlier roundships with the addition of a second mast to form the carrack. The 16th century saw the carrack evolve into the galleon and then the ship of the line. The man'o'war (or men-o'-war) were some of the most powerful ships from the 16th?19th centuries. They were developed in England in the mid-16th century by Henry VIII.
TEXT.Polish: A man of war jest to uzbrojony okrêt wojenny. Termin czêsto odnosi siê do statków uzbrojonych w armaty i napêdzany przede wszystkim przez ¿agle, w przeciwieñstwie do galery, która jest napêdzana przede wszystkim przez wios³a. Man of War zosta³ opracowany w basenie Morza Œródziemnego w 15 wieku z wczeœniejszych statków tylko dodano drugi maszt, tworz¹c Carrack. W 16 wieku Carrack ewoluowa³ w galeon, a nastêpnie w Man'o'war by³y jednymi z najpotê¿niejszych statków wieków 16-19th. Zosta³y one opracowane w Anglii w po³owie 16 wieku przez Henryka VIII.

TEXT.English: Mansa Sakura or Mansa Sakoura was the sixth mansa of the Mali Empire. A slave at birth, Sakura was freed and became a general in the army of Sundiata Keita, legendary founder of the Mali Empire. After a debilitating struggle for succession between Sundiata's sons Ouati Keita and Khalifa Keita and his grandson Abu Bakr, Sakura seized control of the throne himself in about 1285. Near-contemporary historian Ibn Khaldun records that under Sakura's leadership, the Empire made a number of new conquests (most notably of Gao), becoming the dominant political, economic, and military force in the Western Sudan. Sakura performed the Hajj but was killed (c. 1300) at Tadjoura near Djibouti by Danakil warriors hungry for his gold.
TEXT.Polish: Mansa Sakura by³ szóstym w³adc¹ Imperium Mali. Urodzi³ siê jako niewolnik, zosta³ wyzwolony, a nastêpnie zosta³ genera³em w wojsku Sundiaty Keity, legendarnego za³o¿yciela Imperium Mali. Po wykañczaj¹cej wojnie o sukcesjê miêdzy synami i wnukami Sundiaty, Sakura zagarn¹³ tron Mali dla siebie oko³o 1285 roku. Prawie wspó³czesny historyk Ibn Khaldun zapisa³, ¿e pod wodz¹ Sakury Imperium dokona³o wielu podbojów (szczególnie Gao), staj¹c siê dominuj¹c¹ polityczn¹, ekonomiczn¹ i militarn¹ si³¹ w zachodnim Sudanie. Sakura zosta³ zabity (ok. 1300) w Tadjoura niedaleko D¿ibuti podczas odbywania pielgrzymki had¿d¿.

TEXT.English: [H1]Manuelito[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]President of the Mexico[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1818 - 1893[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Manuelito was a prominent Navajo leader who rallied his nation against the oppression of the United States military. For several years he led a group of warriors in resisting federal efforts to forcibly remove the Navajo people to Bosque Redondo, New Mexico via the Long Walk in 1864. After being relocated to Bosque Redondo, Manuelito was among the leaders who signed the 1868 treaty, ending a period of imprisonment in United States government internment camps and establishing a reservation for the Navajo. Manuelito was also an advocate for education for Navajo children.[PARAGRAPH:1]He married a daughter of Narbona (1766 - August 30, 1849), and went to live at their camp near the Chuska Mountains. Narbona's reputation as a wealthy and powerful headman impressed Manuelito. He especially admired Narbona's fearless attitude, although Narbona tried to teach him the value of peace as well as war. Manuelito spent his days shooting arrows and competing with other young men in countless foot races and wrestling matches, always winning. He dressed in well-fitting buckskins and a finely woven blanket. He couldn't wait for his first battle. When word came in the winter of 1835 that 1000 Mexicans (from New Mexico) were coming to attack the Navajos, Manuelito fought his first in what would be many violent battles. There he earned the name Hashkeh Naabaah (Angry Warrior). In the years that followed, Manuelito led one raiding party after another, joining forces with other leaders such as Ganado Mucho and Barboncito to attack not only the hated Mexicans, but also the Hopis in Arizona, the Puebloan peoples of New Mexico, the Utes, the Comanches, and the Apaches. Food supplies, livestock, and women and children were all fair game, and eventually Manuelito married one of his many Mexican slaves, Juanita.
TEXT.Polish: Manuelito (1818-1893) - wódz Nawahów z czasów Wielkiej Wêdrówki Nawahów. 21 wrzeœnia 1861 r. na terenie Fortu Wingate dosz³o do zatargu Indian z ¿o³nierzami przy okazji wyœcigu konnego Manuelita z jednym z oficerów. Nastêpnego dnia wojsko zaatakowa³o obozuj¹cych wokó³ fortu Indian. Rozpoczê³a siê d³ugotrwa³a wojna. Wiosn¹ 1862 r. na tereny Nawahów wkroczy³y oddzia³y, którymi dowodzi³ James Carleton. Chcia³ on rozwi¹zaæ problem Indian umieszczaj¹c ich w rezerwatach. Najpierw rozprawi³ siê z Apaczami Mescalero umieszczaj¹c ich w rezerwacie Bosce Redondo nad Pecos River, potem zaj¹³ siê Nawahami. Kluczem do sukcesu by³o pozbawienie Indian zapasów, dlatego wojsko niszczy³o zbiory i zabija³o zwierzêta Indian. wprowadzono nagrody pieniê¿ne za zdobyte na Indianach zwierzêta, potem równie¿ za skalpy wojowników. Stopniowo kapitulowa³y poszczególne grupy Nawahów, które umieszczano w rezerwacie w Bosce Redondo. Na wolnoœci pozosta³ ze swymi ludŸmi tylko wódz Manuelito. Tymczasem jesieni¹ zaczêli pojawiaæ siê Indianie, którzy nie mog¹c znieœæ warunków panuj¹cych w rezerwacie uciekali i wracali do swej ojczyzny. Ich opowieœci napawa³y wolnych Nawahów groz¹ i zachêca³y do dalszego oporu. W rezerwacie nie dostawali ubrañ, koców, wystarczaj¹cej iloœci jedzenia, nie by³o tam drzew do palenia ognisk, ¿yli w jamach wygrzebanych w ziemi, ziemia by³a ja³owa i nie nadawa³a siê do uprawy, panowa³y choroby, na które wielu umar³o. Genera³ Carleton chcia³ zakoñczyæ sprawê z Nawahami i stara³ siê zmusiæ do kapitulacji Manuelita, który przez wiosnê i lato 1865 r. wymyka³ siê ¿o³nierzom.

TEXT.English: In the fifteenth century, the Inca empire expanded to incorporate the Chachapoyas region. Although fortifications such as the citadel at Kuélap may have been an adequate defense against the invading Inca, it is possible that by this time the Chachapoyas settlements had become decentralized and fragmented after the threat of Huari invasion had dissipated. The Chachapoyas were conquered by Inca ruler Tupac Inca Yupanqui around AD 1475. The defeat of the Chachapoyas was fairly swift; however, smaller rebellions continued for many years. Using the mitmac system of ethnic dispersion, the Inca attempted to quell these rebellions by forcing large numbers of Chachapoya people to resettle in remote locations of the empire.

Marhathegnoz ("Warhorse-thanes"), whose name also means "Companion Cavalry" are a heavy cavalry unit composed of the Germanic tribes' best warriors, by foot or horseback. Those Thegnoz have joined the retinue of a chieftain or other powerful lord who can provide them with the finest Celtic warhorses and wargrear at his disposal. Their original training has been augmented by years of warfare gaining glory and wealth through battle prowess and weapon skill. They are extremely wealthy and powerful men, but still fiercely loyal to their lord who brings them victory. Marhathegnoz can be used most effectively as shock troops whose charges can break the enemy line and destory their flanks, but they are also useful for overrunning heavy infantry and slaughtering lighter cavalry. Historically, Germanic tribes did not frequently use cavalry and their warriors mainly fought on foot, however, some tribes were known for their use of cavalry and many peoples praised the good quality of Germanic cavalry. Germanic horsemen did not use saddles by choice, nor stirrups because they were unknown in Europe at that time, later introduced by invading peoples from the east. The Germanic tribes were among the first peoples to copy the stirrup because they recognized its potential, for with a stirrup the warrior could not only mount his horse more easily but he could also "step up" on his horse to throw a spear.

The Marines Corps is a branch of the military service whose training prepares them to carry out integrated land, sea, and air operations. The first marines were commissioned during the American Revolution, only to be inactivated after the war. Congress permanently reestablished the Marine Corps in July, 1798. Legendary for their toughness, rigid codes of behavior, and adaptability, they have played an important role in almost every major war and conflict of the 19th and 20th centuries.
TEXT.French: Le Corps des Marines des Etats-Unis est une des branches des forces armées américaines. Leur entraînement les prépare à mener des opérations intégrées terrestres, maritimes ou aériennes. Les premiers Marines ont été institués au cours de la Révolution Américaine, pour être supprimés tout de suite après la guerre. Le Corps des Marines a ensuite été rétabli définitivement par le Congrès américain en juillet 1798. Réputés pour leur détermination, leur discipline stricte et leur faculté d'adaptation, les Marines ont joué un rôle important dans la plupart des conflits armés majeurs du XIXe et du XXe siècle.
TEXT.German: Das "U.S. Marine Corps" ist ein eigenständiger Militärdienst, dessen Angehörige für die integrierte Durchführung militärischer Operationen sowohl an Land als auch zu Wasser und in der Luft ausgebildet werden. Die ersten Marines wurden während der amerikanischen Revolution in Dienst gestellt, allerdings wurde dieses Corps nach dem Krieg wieder aufgelöst. Im Juni 1798 beschloss der Kongress der Vereinigten Staaten von Amerika die erneute und diesmal dauerhafte Einrichtung des U.S. Marine Corps. Seither kam den Marines - nicht zuletzt wegen ihres legendären Durchhaltevermögens, ihrer enorm hohen Belastbarkeit, ihres strengen Verhaltenskodex und ihrer Anpassungsfähigkeit - in fast jedem wichtigen Krieg oder sonstigen militärischen Konflikt des 19. und 20. Jahrhunderts eine tragende Rolle zu.
TEXT.Italian: I marines sono un corpo speciale dell'esercito addestrato per affrontare operazioni combinate di terra, aria e mare. Le prime unità di marines furono create durante la Rivoluzione Americana, per essere congedate subito dopo la guerra. Nel luglio del 1798, il Congresso decise la costituzione permanente di questo corpo dell'esercito. Leggendari per la loro tenacia, per il rigido codice comportamentale e per le loro capacità di adattamento, i marines hanno giocato un ruolo importante in tutte le principali guerre del XIX e del XX secolo.
TEXT.Spanish: El cuerpo de infantes de marina es una rama de las fuerzas armadas entrenada para llevar a cabo operaciones integradas por tierra, mar y aire. Los primeros marines aparecieron durante la Guerra de Independencia Americana, pero fueron desmovilizados al acabar el conflicto. El Congreso restableció de forma permanente el cuerpo de marines en julio de 1798. Legendarios por su dureza, sus rígidos códigos de conducta y su adaptabilidad, han desempeñado un papel fundamental en casi todas las guerras y conflictos importantes de los siglos XIX y XX.

TEXT.English: The escaped slaves of the Caribbean region became known as Maroons. They formed their own communities in the inaccessible jungles, and in many cases proved impossible to recapture.
TEXT.French: Les esclaves évadés de la région des Caraïbes sont devenus connus sous le nom de Marrons. Ils formèrent leurs propres communautés dans les jungles inaccessibles et se révélèrent souvent impossibles à reprendre.
TEXT.Italian: Gli schiavi che scappavano nelle regioni Caraibiche divennero noti come Maroon. Formarono le loro comunità nelle giungle più inaccessibili e in molti casi non vennero più ricatturati.

TEXT.English: The central unit of Maasai society is the age-set. Young boys are sent out with the calves and lambs as soon as they can toddle, but childhood for boys is mostly playtime, with the exception of ritual beatings to test courage and endurance. Girls are responsible for chores such as cooking and milking, skills which they learn from their mothers at an early age. Every 15 years or so, a new and individually named generation of Morans or Il-murran (warriors) will be initiated. This involves most boys between 12 and 25, who have reached puberty and are not part of the previous age-set. One rite of passage from boyhood to the status of junior warrior is a painful circumcision ceremony, which is performed without anaesthetic. This ritual is typically performed by the elders, who use a sharpened knife and makeshift cattle hide bandages for the procedure. The Maa word for circumcision is emorata. The boy must endure the operation in silence. Expressions of pain bring dishonor, albeit temporarily. Any exclamations can cause a mistake in the delicate and tedious process, which can result in lifelong scarring, dysfunction, and pain. The healing process will take 3-4 months, during which urination is painful and nearly impossible at times, and boys must remain in black clothes for a period of 4-8 months.
TEXT.Polish: Maroon zbiegli niewolnicy z terenów archipelagu karaibskiego.

TEXT.English: Masinissa was the first King of Numidia. During his younger years he fought in the Second Punic War (218-201 BC), first against the Romans as an ally of Carthage and later switching sides. With Roman support, he united the eastern and western Numidian tribes and founded the Kingdom of Numidia. He is most famous for his role as a Roman ally in the Battle of Zama and as husband of Sophonisba, a Carthaginian noblewoman whom he allowed to poison herself to avoid being paraded in a triumph in Rome.

Mata'afa is a high chief title in Samoa under the country's Matai system of socio-political governance where individuals are bestowed with family names. The historical seat of the Mata'afa title is in Amaile in the Atua district at the east end of Upolu island.
TEXT.French: Mata'afa est un titre de chef suprême à Samoa selon le système Matai de gouvernance sociopolitique du pays, où les individus reçoivent des noms de famille. Le siège historique du titre Mata'afa est à Amaile dans le district d'Atua, à l'extrémité est de l'île d'Upolu.

TEXT.English: Mata'afa Iosefo (1832 - 6 February 1912) was a Paramount Chief of Samoa who was one of the three rival candidates for the kingship of Samoa during colonialism. He was also referred to as Tupua Malietoa To'oa Mata'afa Iosefo. The matai chiefly title Mata'afa is one of four highest titles in Samoa. From the late 19th century, Iosefo (first name) played a pivotal role during the country's colonial era when Germany, Great Britain and the United States were vying for control of the Samoa Islands. Each western power had their own chiefly candidate for the 'kingship' of Samoa, and Mata'afa was Germany's preferred candidate.

Mata'pang (died 1680) was a Chamorro chief of the village of Tumon on the island of Guam. The chief's name meant "to be made pure by cleansing," in the ancient Chamorro language. Mata'pang is best known for murdering the Spanish priest Blessed Diego Luis de San Vitores, the first Christian missionary on Guam, and his Filipino companion, Saint Pedro Calungsod. Both were later beatified by the Roman Catholic Church; Calungsod was canonized on 19 October 2012.
TEXT.French: Mata'pang (décédé en 1680) était un chef Chamorro du village de Tumon sur l'île de Guam. Le nom du chef signifiait "être purifié par le nettoyage" en ancien langage Chamorro. Mata'pang est surtout connu pour avoir assassiné le prêtre espagnol Béatifié Diego Luis de San Vitores, premier missionnaire chrétien à Guam, et son compagnon philippin, Saint Pedro Calungsod. Tous deux furent ensuite béatifiés par l'Église catholique romaine ; Calungsod fut canonisé le 19 octobre 2012.

TEXT.English: If you want to take an Akkadian city, you will need overwhelming superiority of numbers, or else a miracle... The Akkadian Matnu is the best city defence archer in the known world.
TEXT.French: Si vous souhaitez prendre une ville akkadienne, vous aurez besoin d'une supériorité numérique écrasante ou d'un miracle... Le Matnu akkadien est le meilleur archer de défense urbaine au monde connu.

TEXT.English: Zimbabwe was formerly known as Southern Rhodesia (1898), Rhodesia (1965), and Zimbabwe Rhodesia (1979). The first recorded use of "Zimbabwe" as a term of national reference was in 1960, when it was coined by the black nationalist Michael Mawema, whose Zimbabwe National Party became the first to officially use the name in 1961. The term Rhodesia-derived from the surname of Cecil Rhodes, the primary instigator of British colonisation of the territory during the late 19th century-was perceived as inappropriate because of its colonial origin and connotations. According to Mawema, black nationalists held a meeting in 1960 to choose an alternative name for the country, and the names Machobana and Monomotapa were proposed before his suggestion, Zimbabwe, prevailed. A further alternative, put forward by nationalists in Matabeleland, had been "Matopos", referring to the Matopos Hills to the south of Bulawayo.

Mato-tope (also known as Ma-to-toh-pe or Four Bears, from mato "bear" and tope "four") (c.1795 - July 30, 1837) was the second chief of the Mandan tribe to be known to whites as "Four Bears", a name he earned after charging the Assiniboine tribe during battle with the strength of four bears. Four Bears lived in the first half of the 19th century on the upper Missouri River in what is now North Dakota.
TEXT.French: 1837) was the second chief of the Mandan tribe to be known to whites as "Four Bears"

TEXT.English: Maues was an Indo-Scythian king who invaded the Indo-Greek territories. Maues had his capital in Sirkap and minted most of his coins in Taxila. Maues did not manage however to conquer the Punjab territories of the Indo-Greeks east of the Jhelum, which remained under Greek control. After his death the Indo-Greeks regained most of their territory.
TEXT.French: Maues était un roi indo-scythmique qui a envahi les territoires indo-grecs. Maues avait sa capitale à Sirkap et frappait la plupart de ses pièces à Taxila. Maues ne réussit cependant pas à conquérir les territoires du Pendjab des indo-grecs à l'est du Jhelum, qui restèrent sous contrôle grec. Après sa mort, les indo-grecs récupérèrent la plupart de leur territoire.

TEXT.English: Maui is the great hero of Polynesian mythology. Stories about his exploits are told in nearly every Polynesian land. Maui in most cases is regarded as a demi-god, or as fully divine; in some places, he regarded as merely human. In Hawaiian and Maori mythology, for example, Maui is a culture hero, but in Tahitan mythology, he is a deified priest. In most of the cases, he is credited to teaching man things like how to make fire or sail. Oftentimes, he is also credited to the creation of various islands the Polynesians lived on.
TEXT.Polish: Maui bohater mitologii hawajskiej i ca³ej Polinezji (znany na Nowej Zelandii, wyspach Samoa, Tahiti i Tonga). Posiada cechy boga-stwórcy (wydoby³ okoliczne wyspy z morza, podniós³ sklepienie nieba, spowolni³ bieg s³oñca), herosa kulturowego (zdoby³ dla ludzi ogieñ) i trickstera (z upodobaniem stosowa³ podstêpy i przemienia³ sw¹ postaæ, g³ównie na ptasi¹). Z kolei jego wyprawa do krainy zmar³ych celem zdobycia nieœmiertelnoœci (nieudana) spokrewnia go z bohaterami epickimi takimi jak Gilgamesz.

TEXT.English: Warfare among the Mayans was a bloody and constant affair, serving both economic and religious purposes. Most leaders demanded tribute from conquered city-states in order to increase their own standing. Yet equally important was the capture of victims for sacrifice. This was the domain of the dreaded Holkan. Elite warriors armed with slingshots, stones and razor-sharp spears, the Holkans were trained specifically to capture enemies alive, to provide fodder for ever-hungry sacrificial altars.
TEXT.French: Pour les Mayas, la guerre est une activité sanglante et permanente, qui sert des buts à la fois économiques et religieux. Le tribut payé par les villes conquises leur permet d'augmenter leur train de vie et les prisonniers capturés sont offerts en sacrifice aux dieux. Ces captures sont effectuées par les redoutables holkans. Guerriers d'élite armés de lance-pierres et de lances aiguisées comme des lames de rasoir, les holkans sont spécialement entraînés pour capturer leurs ennemis vivants, afin de les offrir en sacrifice à leurs insatiables divinités.
TEXT.German: Krieg unter den Maya war eine blutige und dauerhafte Angelegenheit, die zugleich wirtschaftlichen und religiösen Zwecken diente. Die meisten Staatsoberhäupter verlangten Tribut von eroberten Stadtstaaten, um ihr eigenes Ansehen zu erhöhen. Die Gefangennahme von Opfern war jedoch ebenso wichtig. Dies war das Spezialgebiet der gefürchteten Holkan. Die Holkan waren Elitekrieger, ausgerüstet mit Schleudern, Steinen und rasiermesserscharfen Speeren, die dazu gefertigt wurden, Feinde lebendig gefangen zu nehmen, damit diese als Futter für die nimmersatten Altäre dienen konnten.
TEXT.Italian: Per i Maya la guerra era una questione sanguinosa e continua, che aveva scopi sia economici sia religiosi. Molti capi pretendevano dei tributi dalle città-stato conquistate in modo da poter incrementare la propria posizione. Altrettanto importante era la cattura di vittime per i sacrifici. Era qui che entravano in gioco i temuti Holkan. Ottimi guerrieri armati con fionde, pietre e lance affilatissime, gli Holkan erano addestrati a catturare vivi i nemici, in maniera da procurare offerte per gli assetati altari sacrificali.
TEXT.Spanish: Entre los mayas, la guerra era una realidad sangrienta y constante, al servicio de fines tanto económicos como religiosos. La mayoría de los líderes exigía tributos a las ciudades-estado conquistadas para mejorar su posición. Igualmente importante era la captura de víctimas para los sacrificios. Aquí es donde entraba en juego el temido holkan. Guerrero de élite armado con hondas, piedras y lanzas afiladas como navajas, el holkan estaba entrenado específicamente para capturar vivos a los enemigos que servirían de combustible a los siempre voraces altares.

TEXT.English: Swords in the ancient Middle East were mainly of the straight type. They were originally made of copper, followed by bronze and finally iron. Among most ancient communities such as the Persians, Hebrews, and Syrians, the sword was short and equivalent to the Roman gladius. The straight blade remained the primary type of sword until as late as the Crusades. There did however exist longswords, slightly curved swords, and sickle-like swords similar to the Egyptian khopesh. Some blades were of such a size that it is difficult to classify them as either swords or daggers, and they are thus referred to by archaeologists as dagger-swords. Prior to the founding of Islam, swords were imported from Ubulla, a town along the Tigris river in Yemen. Middle Eastern swords retained their straight double-edge shape during the time of the Prophet Muhammed. With the exception of their curved handles, they were nearly identical to medieval European arming swords in both function and design. They typically had a cruciform hilt and favoured cut and thrust techniques. Swords of this type were often paired with a shield or buckler but could also be wielded on their own. The sword used by Muhammed was distinct in that its tip split into two points.

With the proliferation of the horseless carriage, entire generations of people were suddenly in need of mechanical knowledge so they could maintain their own vehicles. Mechanicing became a common hobby yet still there were to be masters of the craft that would become a major profession. Once these internal combustion engines were applied to vehicles of war, it became indespensable to have a strong force of dedicated mechanics to support them.
TEXT.French: Avec la prolifération de la voiture sans cheval, des générations entières ont soudainement eu besoin de connaissances mécaniques pour entretenir leurs propres véhicules. La mécanique devint un passe-temps courant, mais il y avait encore des maîtres de cet art qui allaient devenir une grande profession. Une fois ces moteurs à combustion interne appliqués aux véhicules de guerre, il devint indispensable de disposer d'une importante force de mécaniciens dévoués pour les soutenir.
TEXT.Polish: In¿ynieria mechaniczna - ca³oœæ wiedzy dotycz¹cej projektowania, wytwarzania i eksploatacji maszyn, wyj¹wszy z tego maszyny elektryczne i energetyczne, które s¹ domen¹ in¿ynierii elektrycznej i in¿ynierii energetycznej oraz maszyn matematycznych, które s¹ domen¹ in¿ynierii elektronicznej.

TEXT.English: The introduction of armored tanks meant that armies could quickly break through enemy defensive positions and move aggressively forward on the battlefield. Such a quick advance, however, left the ground won in the advance largely undefended. Mechanized infantry, which was first used during World War II, was designed to move in quickly and defend the conquered area behind the tanks. Infantry were mounted in armored vehicles, such as half-tracks and Armored Personnel Carriers (APCs), to carry them quickly and safely along with the rapidly-advancing armored divisions.
TEXT.French: Avec l'apparition des chars d'assaut, une armée pouvait rapidement briser les lignes ennemies et s'enfoncer sur le champ de bataille. Cependant, une telle progression laissait sans défense le terrain conquis. L'infanterie mécanisée, apparue durant la Deuxième Guerre mondiale, a été conçue pour se déplacer rapidement et occuper le terrain conquis par les chars. L'infanterie est embarquée dans des véhicules blindés de transport de troupes, à chenilles (type half-track) ou à roues (type VAB, véhicules de l'avant blindé), pour être transportée rapidement et en toute sécurité derrière les divisions blindées.
TEXT.German: Seit der Verfügbarkeit von Panzerfahrzeugen war es Armeen möglich, zügig feindliche Stellungen zu durchbrechen und aggressiv auf dem Schlachtfeld vorzustoßen. Solch rasantes Vorgehen ließ die gerade eroberten Territorien größtenteils ungeschützt zurück. Die mechanisierte Infanterie, die erstmals im 2. Weltkrieg eingesetzt wurde, diente dazu, die Gebiete hinter den vorrückenden Panzern möglichst schnell zu besetzen und zu halten: Gepanzerte Begleitfahrzeuge, z.B. Halbkettenfahrzeuge und gepanzerte Truppentransportfahrzeuge (APCs), folgten den vorausfahrenden Panzerdivisionen und gewährleisteten den raschen und sicheren Transport der an Bord befindlichen Infanteristen.
TEXT.Italian: L'introduzione del carro armato permise di sbaragliare le posizioni difensive nemiche e consentì repentini spostamenti sui campi di battaglia. Tuttavia, questa rapida avanzata lasciava senza difese il terreno conquistato. La fanteria meccanizzata, impiegata per la prima volta durante la Seconda Guerra Mondiale, fu ideata per difendere velocemente le zone nelle quali erano passati i carri armati. I fanti salivano a bordo di veicoli corazzati, come i semicingolati o i veicoli blindati portatruppe (APC), e venivano portati rapidamente e senza rischio dietro alle divisioni corazzate che avanzavano.
TEXT.Spanish: La aparición de los tanques blindados supuso que los ejércitos pudieran atravesar rápidamente las posiciones defensivas enemigas y realizar maniobras agresivas en el campo de batalla. Pero un avance tan rápido dejaba prácticamente indefenso el territorio conquistado. La infantería mecanizada, empleada por primera vez en la Segunda Guerra Mundial, se creó con el propósito de avanzar con rapidez tras los tanques y defender el territorio conquistado por ellos. La infantería marchaba en vehículos blindados, como los semiorugas y los transportes blindados de tropas (APC), lo que le permitía avanzar, de forma rápida y protegida, junto con las veloces divisiones blindadas.

TEXT.English: From the 10th to late 7th centuries BCE, the western parts of Media fell under the domination of the vast Neo-Assyrian Empire based in northern Mesopotamia, but which stretched from Cyprus to Ancient Iran, and from the Caucasus to Egypt and Arabia. Assyrian kings such as Tiglath-Pileser III, Sargon II, Sennacherib, Esarhaddon, Ashurbanipal and Ashur-etil-ilani imposed Vassal Treaties upon the Median rulers, and also protected them from predatory raids by marauding Scythian and Cimmerian hordes.

Medical Lab Techs are medical analysts that can solve nearly any physical alement with the pinnacle of scientific analysis and application of futuristic tools of care provision. They are uniquely capable of analyzing and adjusting DNA sequences, making them capable of forcing the body to regenerate or in creating biological response entities to unravel bacterial or viral infections.
TEXT.French: Les techniciens de laboratoire médical sont des analystes médicaux capables de résoudre presque tous les troubles physiques grâce à l'analyse scientifique de pointe et à l'application d'outils futuristes de soins. Ils sont spécialement capables d'analyser et de modifier des séquences d'ADN, ce qui leur permet de forcer le corps à se régénérer ou de créer des entités de réponse biologique pour combattre les infections bactériennes ou virales.
TEXT.Russian: Медицинские техники - квалифицированные аналитики, способные решить практически любой физический элемент с помощью вершин научного анализа и применения футуристических инструментов оказания медицинской помощи. Они обладают уникальной способностью анализировать и корректировать последовательности ДНК, что делает их способными заставлять организм регенерировать или создавать объекты биологической реакции для выявления бактериальных или вирусных инфекций.

TEXT.English: It did not take long for the drug revolution in medicine to find equivalent application in veterinary science as well. Between this and the new firepower provided by guns which could be easily carried with little distraction to a healer's craft, battlefield veterinarians reached a new degree of strength and utility. However, this all took place amidst what was to become the decline of the use of animals on the battlefield as air power and the internal combustion engine would soon begin to rapidly obsolete mounted forces.
TEXT.Polish: Pierwsze zapiski historyczne o leczeniu zwierz¹t pochodz¹ z roku 3000 p.n.e. z Mezopotamii i dotycz¹ pierwszego w historii lekarza weterynarii o imieniu Urlugaledinna. W staro¿ytnej Grecji leczeniu zwierz¹t poœwiêca³ uwagê Hipokrates. Oko³o 500 p.n.e. jako pierwszy dokonywa³ sekcji zwierz¹t dla celów naukowych Alkmeon z Krotonu. Arystoteles opisa³ niektóre choroby zwierz¹t, m.in. wœciekliznê psów i nosaciznê koni.

TEXT.English: While the term is generally reserved for Native American Shamans and African Witchdoctors, the Medicine Man in C2C represents any and all highly advanced intuitive or spiritual medical practice involving the highest degree of herbal wisdoms and cultural knowledge regarding healing and control of disease, both physical and psychological. The Babylonians had similar 'soothsayers' and seers that would practice medicine as well. Spirituality and medical practice tended to go hand in hand in the earliest forms of developing civilizations.

Medic is a general term for a person involved in medicine, especially emergency or first-response medicine, such as an Emergency Medical Technician, Paramedic, or a military member trained in battlefield medicine. It may also refer to a medical student or, in limited settings, a physician. Unless in a paramedical setting, the term is not applied to a nurse.
TEXT.French: Le terme « médecin » désigne une personne impliquée dans la médecine, en particulier les soins d'urgence ou les premiers secours, comme un technicien en soins d'urgence, un ambulancier, ou un militaire formé à la médecine de terrain. Il peut aussi désigner un étudiant en médecine ou, dans certains cas, un médecin. Le terme ne s'applique pas aux infirmiers sauf dans un contexte paramédical.
TEXT.Polish: Felczer (z niem. Feldscher (chirurg polowy) z szw. fœltskœr (chirurg polowy, wykonuj¹cy proste zabiegi)) - zawód pomocniczy uprawniaj¹cy do œwiadczenia pomocy medycznej chorym. Kwalifikacje felczera s¹ ni¿sze ni¿ kwalifikacje lekarza. Nie wymaga siê od niego ukoñczenia wy¿szych studiów medycznych, a jedynie szko³y œredniej (np. liceum felczerskiego) i zdobycia odpowiednich kwalifikacji na poziomie œrednim. W Polsce od wielu lat nie kszta³ci siê nowych felczerów, jednak¿e osoby, które w przesz³oœci wykszta³ci³y siê w tym zawodzie mog¹ go dalej wykonywaæ. Ponadto felczerzy z innych krajów Unii Europejskiej mog¹ po uznaniu ich kwalifikacji przez odpowiednie organy pracowaæ w Polsce w swoim zawodzie.
TEXT.Russian: Медик - это общий термин для человека, занимающегося медициной, особенно неотложной медицинской помощи или первой помощи, например, техник неотложной медицинской помощи, фельдшер или военнослужащий, обученный медицине на поле боя. Это также может относиться к студенту-практиканту, ординатору или, в некоторых случаях, к врачу. Этот термин не применяется к медсестре, за исключением парамедицинских учреждений.

TEXT.English: Méhariste is a French word that roughly translates to camel cavalry. The word is most commonly used as a designation of military units. With their local tribal links plus mobility and flexible tactics, the Compagnies Méharistes provided an effective means of policing the desert. A similar camel corps was subsequently raised to cover the southern Sahara, operating from French West Africa and falling within the Armee Coloniale. From the 1930s onwards the Méharistes formed part of the Compagnies Sahariennes which also included motorised French and (from 1940) Foreign Legion units. Following the establishment of a French Mandate over Syria in 1920, three méhariste companies were organised in that country as part of the French Army of the Levant.

The Homeric name for the Lydians was "Meiones", cited among the allies of the Trojans during the Trojan War, and from this name "Maeonia" and "Maeonians" derive and while these Bronze Age terms have sometimes been used as alternatives for Lydia and the Lydians, nuances have also been brought between them.
TEXT.French: Le nom homérique pour les lydiens était "Meiones", cité parmi les alliés des Troyens durant la guerre de Troie, et de ce nom dérivent "Maeonia" et "Maeoniens". Bien que ces termes de l'âge du bronze aient parfois été utilisés comme synonymes pour la Lydie et les lydiens, des nuances ont aussi été établies entre eux.

TEXT.English: The Menalamba rebellion was a rebellion that emerged in central Madagascar in response to the French capture of the royal palace in the capital city of Antananarivo in September 1895. In December 1895, two months after the French capture of Antananarivo, popular resistance to French rule emerged in the form of the menalamba ("red shawl") uprising. This guerrilla war against foreigners, Christianity, and political corruption, quickly spread throughout the island and was principally conducted by common peasants who wore shawls smeared with the red laterite soil of the highlands. The resistance movement gained ground until it was effectively put down by the French military at the end of 1897. Members of Ranavalona's court were accused of encouraging the rebels and many leading figures were executed, including the queen's uncle Ratsimamanga (brother of her favored adviser, Ramisindrazana) and her Minister of War, Rainandriamampandry. Ramisindrazana, the queen's aunt, was exiled to Reunion because the French were reluctant to execute a woman.

Menelik II was Emperor of Ethiopia from 1889 until his death in 1913. He was originally ras or ruler of Shoa in central Ethiopia. After the death in 1868 of Emperor Tewodros II, Menelik, with Italian support, gained steady strength. He seized the throne after Emperor Johannes IV died. In 1889, Menelik concluded the Treaty of Uccialli with Italy. However, when he learned that the Italian version of the treaty was different from his amharic version, essentially making Ethiopia a protectorate of Italy, he denounced the agreement. The Italian invasion that followed in 189596 was crushed by Meneliks great victory near Adwa with great assistance from his wife Empress Taitu. Italy was forced to renounce all claim to Ethiopia and to pay an indemnity. Menelik took important steps to strengthen and modernize his domain. He made Addis Ababa his capital, constructed a railroad, attempted to end the slave trade, and curbed the feudal nobility. His conquests doubled the size of the country and brought the present day southern Ethiopia, which was largely Muslim, into the realm. Gradually his health failed, and the end of his reign was marked by intrigue and maneuvering for the succession due to his lack of a living male heir. He was succeeded as emperor by his grandson Lij Yasu.
TEXT.Polish: Menelik II(ur. 17 sierpnia 1844 w Ankober w Szeua (prowincja Etiopii), zm. 12 grudnia 1913 w Addis Abebie)? cesarz etiopski w latach 1889 - 1913, odznaczony Orderem Salomona. Jako potomek dynastii salomoñskiej (wed³ug legendy pochodz¹cej od staro¿ytnego króla Salomona i królowej Saby) po œmierci w 1855 swojego ojca Hajle Menekota króla Szeua uwiêziony przez cesarza Teodora II (Tewodrosa). Po ucieczce z niewoli rozpocz¹³ jako w³adca Szeua (od 1865) starania o zdobycie tronu etiopskiego. Po samobójstwie Teodora II w 1868 i po zajêciu Mekdeli przez brytyjskie wojska ekspedycyjne kontynuowa³ walkê z jego nastêpc¹ Janem IV (Johannesem). Jan IV zgin¹³ w 1889 r. w bitwie pod Gallabat podczas wojny z derwiszami. Po œmierci Jana IV zosta³ wybrany 4 listopada 1889 przez Etiopski Sejm Szlachecki i wkrótce koronowany na cesarza Etiopii. Odpar³ próby skolonizowania Etiopii pokonuj¹c oddzia³y w³oskie 1 marca 1896 w bitwie pod Adu¹ i podpisa³ z W³ochami traktat koñcz¹cy wojnê w³osko-abisyñsk¹, który zapewnia³ Abisynii pe³n¹ suwerennoœæ oraz kontrybucje wojenne. Menelik II zjednoczy³ ca³y kraj, przeniós³ stolicê do Addis Abeby i zwróci³ siê w stronê Zachodu. TEXT.French: [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Les Missions commerciales nécessitent l'ouverture des frontières[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Per effettuare [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]missioni commerciali[COLOR_REVERT] l'accordo [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]confini aperti[COLOR_REVERT] deve essere in vigore

TEXT.English: One of the most famous legendary wizards was the figure of Merlin, who, though now most famous in England, had his origins in Celtic myths. He was an enchanter and wise man in Arthurian legend and romance of the Middle Ages, linked with personages in ancient Celtic mythology (especially with Myrddin in Welsh tradition). He appeared in Arthurian legend as an enigmatic figure, fluctuations and inconsistencies in his character being often dictated by the requirements of a particular narrative or by varying attitudes of suspicious regard toward magic and witchcraft. Thus, treatments of Merlin reflect different stages in the development of Arthurian romance itself. Geoffrey of Monmouth, in Historia regum Britanniae (113538), adapted a story, told by the Welsh antiquary Nennius (flourished c. 800), of a boy, Ambrosius, who had given advice to the legendary British king Vortigern. In Geoffrey's account Merlin-Ambrosius figured as adviser to Uther Pendragon (King Arthur's father) and afterward to Arthur himself. In a later work, Vita Merlini, Geoffrey further developed the story of Merlin by adapting a northern legend about a wild man of the woods, gifted with powers of divination. Early in the 13th century, Robert de Borron's verse romance Merlin added a Christian dimension to the character, making him the prophet of the Holy Grail (whose legend had by then been linked with Arthurian legend). The author of the first part of the Vulgate cycle) made the demonic side of Merlin's character predominate, but in later branches of the Vulgate cycle, Merlin again became the prophet of the Holy Grail, while his role as Arthur's counsellor was filled out; it was Merlin, for example, who advised Uther to establish the knightly fellowship of the Round Table and who suggested that Uther's true heir would be revealed by a test that involved drawing a sword from a stone in which it was set. It also included a story of the wizard's infatuation with the Lady of the Lake, which eventually brought about his death.
TEXT.Polish: Merlin - jeden z bohaterów legend arturiañskich. Wielki czarodziej. Latynizuj¹c to imiê, Geoffrey wymyœla formê Merlinus, choæ prawid³owa by³aby raczej "Merdinus". Ta ostatnia jednak zbyt kojarzy³aby siê z ordynarnym s³owem merde. W najbardziej rozpowszechnionej wersji legendy, Merlin by³ synem inkuba i œmiertelnej kobiety (kambionem)? szatan sp³odzi³ go by czyni³ z³o na œwiecie, lecz Merlin zosta³ ochrzczony i wykorzysta³ odziedziczon¹ szatañsk¹ moc do czynienia dobra. Wed³ug innej wersji Merlin by³ stworzony przez Mab królow¹ magii lecz urodzi³a go kobieta, która potem zmar³a. Istniej¹ dwie wersje legendy o Merlinie. Jeden z nich, o imieniu Joram stwierdzi³, ¿e pomóc mo¿e tylko ch³opiec bez ojca, a jego krew zostanie zmieszana z zapraw¹. Tym ch³opcem by³ Merlin. Zabrano i postawiono go przed murem. W³adca poleci³ wykopaæ studniê, do której natychmiast nap³ynê³a woda. Ma³o tego! Powiedzia³, ¿e w tych wodach mieszkaj¹ dwa smoki. Jeden mlecznobia³y, zaœ drugi? krwawoczerwony.
