TEXT.English: Rurales was the name commonly used to designate the Mexican Guardia Rural (Rural Guard): a force of mounted police or gendarmerie that existed between 1861 and 1914. In modern Mexico the name is applied to members of a part-time rural defence corps.[PARAGRAPH:1]The image of the Rurales as a ruthless and efficient organisation, which seldom took prisoners under the notorious ley fuga and inevitably got its man, was deliberately fostered under the Porfirian regime. However, research during the 1970s involving detailed examination of the records of the corps indicated that the Rurales were neither as effective nor as brutal as regime publicists had suggested. Never numbering more than about 4,000 men located in small detachments, the Rurales were too thinly spread to ever completely eliminate unrest in the Mexican countryside. They did however impose a superficial order, especially in the central regions around Mexico City, which encouraged the foreign investment sought by Díaz and his científico advisers. To a certain extent the regime saw the Rurales as a counterweight to the much larger Federal army and in the later years of the regime they were increasingly used to control industrial unrest, in addition to their traditional task of patrolling country areas.
TEXT.Italian: Rurales era il nome comune della Guardia Rurale Messicana (Guardia Rurale), un corpo di polizia a cavallo che esisteva dal 1861 al 1914. Nel Messico moderno, il nome si riferisce ai membri part-time di un corpo di difesa rurale.[PARAGRAPH:1]L'immagine dei Rurales come un'organizzazione senza scrupoli ed efficiente, che spesso catturava i prigionieri in fuga e prendeva sempre il proprio uomo, fu deliberatamente esaltata sotto il regime Profiriano. Comunque, le ricerche durante gli anni 70 riguardo le registrazioni del corpo indicarono che i Rurales non erano né efficienti né brutali come il regime sosteneva. Erano sempre meno di 4,000 uomini distribuiti in piccole pattuglie; i Rurales erano troppo dispersi sul territorio per eliminare completamente le agitazioni nella campagna messicana. In ogni caso riuscivano ad imporre un ordine superficiale, specialmente nelle regioni centrali attorno a Città del Messico, che incoraggiò gli investimenti stranieri voluti da Dìaz e sai suoi consiglieri scientifici. A un certo punto il regime vedeva i Rurales come un sostituto al più grande esercito federale, e negli anni terminali del regime vennero usati sempre più spesso per controllare le proteste operaie, oltre al loro ruolo tradizionale di pattugliare le aree rurali.
TEXT.Polish: Rurales to radzaj oddzia³ów paramilitarnych operuj¹cych w Meksyku pod koniec XIX wieku.

TEXT.English: Michiel de Ruyter was a Dutch seaman and one of his country's greatest admirals. His brilliant naval victories in the Second and Third Anglo-Dutch wars enabled the United Provinces to maintain a balance of power with England. Employed at sea at the age of nine, De Ruyter by 1635 had become a merchant captain. After serving as rear admiral of a Dutch fleet assisting Portugal against Spain in 1641, he returned to the merchant service for the next 10 years, fighting against the Barbary pirates off the north African coast. With the outbreak of the First Anglo-Dutch War (165254), he accepted a naval command, serving with distinction under Maarten Tromp and attaining the rank of vice admiral in 1653 after his victory off Texel. De Ruyter's successes in battle have been attributed to his development of an effective combat order, stressing fleet discipline. In 1659 De Ruyter supported Denmark against Sweden in the Baltic in the First Northern War (165560). He fought against the English (166465) off the Guinea Coast of Africa, helping to restore the Dutch West India Company's commercial dominance in the area, but he was unsuccessful in subsequent campaigns against the English in the West Indies. Returning to the United Provinces in 1665, De Ruyter was named lieutenant admiral of Holland and worked closely with Johan De Witt to strengthen the Dutch navy. In the Second Anglo-Dutch War (166567), his greatest victories were in the Four Days' Battle (June 1666) and in the raid on the Medway (June 1667), in which much of the English fleet was destroyed; the latter victory accelerated the Anglo-Dutch peace negotiations that had begun at Breda in April 1667. De Ruyter's blaming Admiral Cornelis Tromp for the defeat in the St. James's Day battle in August 1666 resulted in the withdrawal of Tromp's commission and his resignation from the navy until 1673, when the two distinguished commanders were reconciled. De Ruyter's performance in the Third Anglo-Dutch War (167274) has been considered his greatest achievement: his victories over larger Anglo-French forces off Solebay (1672) and Ostend and Kijkduin (1673) prevented an invasion of the Dutch Republic from the sea. In 167576 he fought against the French in the Mediterranean and was mortally wounded off Sicily. The pious De Ruyter was very much loved by his sailors and soldiers; from them his most significant nickname derived: Bestevaer (older Dutch for 'grandfather'.) He is honoured by a statue in his birthplace Vlissingen, where he stands looking over the sea. Almost every town in the Netherlands has a street named after him.
TEXT.Polish: Michiel Adriaenszoon de Ruyter (ur. 24 marca 1607, zm. 29 kwietnia 1676) by³ najs³ynniejszym admira³em w historii Holandii, uwa¿any za jednego z najznakomitszych morskich dowódców w dziejach œwiata. Walczy³ z Angli¹ w pierwszych trzech wojnach angielsko-holenderskich, odnosz¹c szereg wielkich zwyciêstw.

TEXT.English: The Midewiwin (also spelled Midewin and Medewiwin) or the Grand Medicine Society is a secretive religion of some of the indigenous peoples of the Maritimes, New England and Great Lakes regions in North America. Its practitioners are called Midew and the practices of Midewiwin referred to as Mide. Occasionally, male Midew are called Midewinini, which sometimes is translated into English as "medicine man".
TEXT.French: Les Midewiwin (également orthographié Midewin et Medewiwin) ou Grande Société de Médecine est une religion secrète de certains peuples autochtones des Maritimes, de la Nouvelle-Angleterre et des Grands Lacs en Amérique du Nord. Ses pratiquants sont appelés Midew et les pratiques de Midewiwin sont désignées sous le nom de Mide. Parfois, les hommes Midew sont appelés Midewinini, traduction anglaise parfois rendue par « homme-médecine ».

TEXT.English: The Mikoyan-Gurevich (MiG) 29 (codename 'Fulcrum') represents the pinnacle of Soviet jet fighter technology.
TEXT.French: Le Mikoyan-Gurevich (MiG) 29 (nom de code 'Fulcrum') représente le sommet de la technologie soviétique des chasseurs à réaction.
TEXT.Italian: Il Mikoyan-Gurevich (MiG) 29 (nome in codice 'Fulcrum') rappresenta l'apice della tecnologia sovietica nei caccia a reazione.

TEXT.English: A militia generally is an army or other fighting force that is composed of non-professional fighters; citizens of a nation or subjects of a state or government that can be called upon to enter a combat situation, as opposed to a professional force of regular, full-time military personnel, or historically, members of the fighting nobility class (e.g., knights or samurai). It was common for militias to engage guerrilla warfare or defense instead of attacking.
TEXT.French: Une milice est généralement une armée ou force de combat composée de combattants non professionnels ; des citoyens d'une nation ou sujets d'un État ou gouvernement pouvant être appelés en situation de combat, par opposition à une force professionnelle de militaires réguliers à temps plein, ou historiquement, membres de la noblesse combattante (ex. chevaliers ou samouraïs). Il était courant que les milices pratiquent la guérilla ou la défense plutôt que l'attaque.

TEXT.English: Mindaugas was the first known Grand Duke of Lithuania and the only King of Lithuania. Little is known of his origins, early life, or rise to power; he is mentioned in a 1219 treaty as an elder duke, and in 1236 as the leader of all the Lithuanians. The contemporary and modern sources discussing his ascent mention strategic marriages along with banishment or murder of his rivals. He extended his domain into regions southeast of Lithuania proper during the 1230s and 1240s. In 1250 or 1251, during the course of internal power struggles, he was baptised as a Roman Catholic; this action enabled him to establish an alliance with the Livonian Order, a long-standing antagonist of the Lithuanians. During the summer of 1253 he was crowned King of Lithuania, ruling between 300,000 and 400,000 subjects.

Jalal ad-Din Mingburnu was the last ruler of the Khwarezmian Empire. Following the defeat of his father, Ala ad-Din Muhammad II by Genghis Khan in 1220, Jalal ad-Din Mengübirti came to power but he rejected the title shah that his father had assumed and called himself simply sultan. Jalal ad-Din retreated with the remaining Khwarazm forces, while pursued by a Mongol army and at the battle of Parwan, north of Kabul, defeated the Mongols.
TEXT.French: Jalal ad-Din Mingburnu fut le dernier souverain de l'Empire Khwarezmien. Suite à la défaite de son père, Ala ad-Din Muhammad II, par Gengis Khan en 1220, Jalal ad-Din Mengübirti prit le pouvoir mais rejeta le titre de shah que son père avait porté et se déclara simplement sultan. Jalal ad-Din recula avec les forces khwarezmiennes restantes, poursuivi par une armée mongole, et battit les Mongols à la bataille de Parwan, au nord de Kaboul.

TEXT.English: The minke whales are the second smallest baleen whale; only the pygmy right whale is smaller. Upon reaching sexual maturity (6-8 years of age), males measure an average of 6.9 m (23 ft) and females 7.4 m (24 ft) in length, respectively. Reported maximum lengths vary from 9.1 to 10.7 m (30 to 35 ft) for females and 8.8 to 9.8 m (29 to 32 ft) for males. Both sexes typically weigh 4-5 t (3.9-4.9 long tons; 4.4-5.5 short tons) at sexual maturity, and the maximum weight may be as much as 10 t (9.8 long tons; 11 short tons).
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zwergwal[COLOR_REVERT] (Balaenoptera acutorostrata), auch Minkwal, Minkewal oder Nördlicher Zwergwal genannt, gehört zu den Furchenwalen und lebt in allen großen Weltmeeren.[NEWLINE]Für einen Bartenwal ist der Zwergwal recht klein, er erreicht eine maximale Länge von 9,8 m, wobei die Weibchen größer sind als die Männchen. Der lange Körper ist stromlinienförmig, die Schnauze ist spitz. Im Oberkiefer sitzen ca. 300 Barten. Die Anzahl der Kehlfurchen liegt bei 50 bis 70. Auf dem Rücken befindet sich eine hohe, sichelförmige Finne. Der Rücken ist dunkelbraun bis schwarz, der Bauch deutlich heller. Nördliche Zwergwale leben sowohl ozeanisch als auch küstennah. Im Winter bevorzugen sie wärmere Gewässer, im Sommer wandern vor allem die Männchen bis in den nordpolaren Treibeisgürtel. Zwergwale leben einzeln oder in kleinen, lockeren Gruppen. Die Nahrung besteht hauptsächlich aus Krill und kleinen Schwarmfischen. Zwergwale können recht schnell schwimmen und ähnlich wie Delfine auch aus dem Wasser springen. Ein Tauchgang dauert meist 6 bis 12 Minuten. Zwergwale sind neugierig und nähern sich kleinen Booten.[NEWLINE]Wegen ihrer Neugier ließen sich die Tiere stets einfach jagen. Nachdem Großwale in den 1960er Jahren fast ausgerottet wurden, stieg man auf Zwergwale um. Seit 1985 gibt es jedoch ein Walfangmoratorium. Bei indigenen Völkern in Grönland und Russland sind die Tiere aber immer noch Bestandteil der Nahrung. Japan ist das einzige Land, das seit 2019 wieder kommerziell Zwergwale jagen darf, da die Art nicht gefährdet ist.

TEXT.English: Once considered an obsolete class of ship, the Cruiser made an impressive comeback in the final decades of the twentieth century. Experiments in ship-mounted missile systems had begun as early as World War II and by the end of the war, the United States Navy had outfitted a slew of Cruisers with surface-to-air missile capabilities. In the 1980s, these early experiments in ship-mounted missile armaments culminated in AEGIS-equipped Ticonderoga-class Missile Cruisers. More than simply reviving the Cruiser class, the "Tico," with its 127 missile arsenal and its phase-array radar, turned the Cruiser into one of the most ferocious ships at sea.
TEXT.French: Jadis considéré un navire obsolète, le croiseur fait un retour impressionnant dans les dernières décennies du vingtième siècle. Les premiers navires armés de missiles apparaissent lors de la deuxième guerre mondiale et à la fin de la guerre, la marine américaine a équipé un grand nombre de croiseurs de missiles sol-air. Dans les années 1980, ces premières expériences donnent naissance aux croiseurs Ticonderoga, équipés du système de combat AEGIS. En plus de faire revivre la classe des croiseurs, le "Tico," avec son arsenal de 127 missiles et son radar à commande de phase, fait du croiseur l'un des plus féroces navires de guerre.
TEXT.German: Der Kreuzer galt einst als veraltet, aber in den letzten Jahrzehnten des 20. Jahrhunderts ist ihm ein beeindruckendes Comeback gelungen. Experimente mit Raketensystemen auf Schiffen wurden bereits im Zweiten Weltkrieg durchgeführt und gegen Ende des Kriegs hatte die U.S. Navy bereits zahlreiche Kreuzer mit Boden-Luft-Raketen ausgestattet. In den 1980ern fanden die Experimente bezüglich mit Raketen bestückter Schiffe ihren Höhepunkt in Raketenkreuzern der Ticonderoga-Klasse mit AEGIS-Kampfsystem. Mit seinen 127 Raketen und seinem Phased-Array-Radar wurde der Kreuzer zu einem der gefährlichsten Schiffe auf See.
TEXT.Italian: Una volta era considerata una classe di nave obsoleta, ma l'Incrociatore ebbe una seconda giovinezza a partire dagli ultimi decenni del ventesimo secolo. Gli esperimenti con sistemi missilistici montati su navi erano cominciati già ai tempi della Seconda Guerra Mondiale e, alla fine del conflitto, gli Stati Uniti avevano equipaggiato una manciata di incrociatori con sistemi terra-aria. Negli anni '80 questi esperimenti culminarono negli incrociatori lanciamissili di classe Ticonderoga, dotati di sistema di lancio AEGIS. Più che far rivivere la classe degli incrociatori, i "Tico", col loro arsenale di 127 missili e un radar multifunzionale, trasformarono l'Incrociatore nella più grande nave di tutti i mari.
TEXT.Spanish: Considerado en su momento un tipo de nave obsoleta, el crucero experimentó un impresionante resurgir en las últimas décadas del siglo XX. Los experimentos con sistemas de lanzamisiles navales habían comenzado durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial y, hacia el final de la guerra, la marina de los Estados Unidos había equipado con lanzamisiles tierra-aire una partida de anticuados cruceros. En la década de los 80, estos primeros experimentos culminaron en la aparición de los cruceros portamisiles de clase Ticonderoga equipados con AEGIS. Más que revisar la clase crucero, el "Tico," con su arsenal de 127 misiles y su sistema de radar de fase, reformuló este tipo de naves, convirtiéndola en una de las más temibles de los océanos.

German.Text: Mobile Artillerie:Mobilen Artillerie:Mobilen Artillerie:Mobile Artillerie:Mobile Artillerien:Mobilen Artillerien:Mobilen Artillerien:Mobilen Artillerien

Spanish.Text: Pieza de artillería autopropulsada:Piezas de artillería autopropulsada

TEXT.English: The campaigns of World War II brought to the forefront a key predicament in the development of mobile howitzers: how should new artillery reconcile the need for maneuverability with the demand for destructive power? Militaries the world round would have to wait until the 1960s for a machine that was both mobile and truly powerful.[PARAGRAPH:1]The M109 Paladin, capable of launching a 155mm-caliber artillery shell over nine miles and moving at speeds of 40mph, has become the world standard in self-propelled howitzers. But with the Paladin beginning to show its age, a new machine, the Crusader, capable of firing every six seconds and coordinating eight hits simultaneously, may soon find a spot at the top of the howitzer hierarchy.
TEXT.French: Les campagnes de la Deuxième Guerre mondiale mettent en avant un problème épineux dans le développement des obusiers mobiles : comment gagner en puissance de feu sans perdre en mobilité ? Les armées du monde entier doivent attendre les années 1960 pour disposer d'une machine à la fois mobile et vraiment puissante.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le M109 Paladin, capable de projeter un obus de 155mm à plus de 14 km et d'atteindre une vitesse de 65 km/h, est devenu un standard mondial. Le Crusader, successeur du Paladin, capable de tirer toutes les six secondes et de coordonner huit tirs simultanément, le remplacera bientôt au sommet de la hiérarchie des obusiers.
TEXT.German: Die Kampagnen des Zweiten Weltkriegs stellten die Entwicklung mobiler Haubitzen vor ein heikles Problem: Wie sollte die neue Artillerie die notwendige Beweglichkeit mit der erforderlichen Zerstörungskraft unter einen Hut bringen? Die Militärmächte der gesamten Welt würden bis zu den 60er Jahren auf eine derart bewegliche und gleichzeitig zerstörerische Maschine warten müssen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die M109 Paladin, die eine 155mm-Kaliber-Artilleriegranate über 15 km weit schießen kann und bis zu 65 km/h schnell ist, hat sich zum weltweiten Standard entwickelt, was Haubitzen mit Eigenantrieb betrifft. Wenn die Paladin ihre Alterschwäche nicht mehr verbergen kann, wird ein neues Gerät ihren Platz an der Spitze der Haubitzen-Hierarchie einnehmen: der Crusader, der im 6-Sekundentakt feuern und acht Treffer gleichzeitig koordinieren kann.
TEXT.Italian: Le campagne della Seconda Guerra Mondiale evidenziarono un problema chiave nello sviluppo di obici mobili: come poteva fare la nuova artiglieria a conciliare il bisogno di manovrabilità con quello di potere distruttivo? Gli eserciti di tutto il mondo avrebbero dovuto aspettare gli anni '60 per ottenere un mezzo sia mobile che davvero potente.[PARAGRAPH:1]L'M109 Paladin, in grado di sparare un proiettile d'artiglieria da 155 mm a 15 chilometri e di spostarsi a 64 km/h, è diventato lo standard mondiale per quanto riguarda gli obici semoventi. Ma il Paladin comincia a mostrare i segni dell'età e si è fatto avanti un nuovo mezzo nella scalata alla gerarchia degli obici, il Crusader, in grado di fare fuoco ogni sei secondi e di coordinare il puntamento di otto bersagli simultaneamente.
TEXT.Spanish: Las campañas de la Segunda Guerra Mundial sacaron a la luz un elemento clave en el futuro de la artillería: ¿cómo reconciliar la maniobrabilidad que necesitaba el arma con la potencia destructiva? Los ejércitos de todo el mundo tendrían que esperar hasta la década de los 60 para que apareciera una máquina dotada al mismo tiempo de movilidad y potencia suficiente.[PARAGRAPH:1]El M109 Paladin, capaz de disparar proyectiles de 155 mm a más de quince kilómetros de distancia y de desplazarse a una velocidad superior a los 60 km/h, se ha convertido en el estándar de la artillería móvil. Pero ahora que el Paladin empieza a envejecer, es muy posible que una nueva máquina, el Crusader, capaz de disparar cada seis segundos y coordinar ocho disparos simultáneamente, no tarde en reemplazarlo en el trono de la artillería.

TEXT.English: Surface-to-Air Missile (SAM) systems have been in development since the end of World War II. And while the versatility of modern SAMs keeps numerous systems in use, the "Stinger" missile remains the most popular and effective low-altitude SAM available, thanks to its ability to be transported by both infantry and mobile units. The Avenger Air Defense System (a Humvee emboldened with eight "Stinger" missiles) and the M6 Linebacker (an armored fighting vehicle with a single "quad-pod" of Stingers), both employed by the United States, successfully fuse high mobility and surface-to-air suppression.
TEXT.French: Les missiles sol-air ont été développés à la fin de la Deuxième Guerre mondiale. L'excellente faculté d'adaptation des SAM fait que de nombreux systèmes sont encore employés de nos jours. Cependant, le missile "Stinger" reste le missile SAM de basse altitude le plus populaire et le plus efficace, grâce au fait qu'il peut être transporté par des unités mobiles et d'infanterie. L'Avenger Air Defense System (un humvee doté de huit missiles Stinger) et le M6 Linebacker (véhicule de combat blindé doté de quatre tubes pour missiles Stinger), tous deux employés par les Etats-Unis, combinent avec succès une grande mobilité et une puissante force de frappe antiaérienne.
TEXT.German: Boden-Luft-Raketensysteme werden seit dem Ende des Zweiten Weltkriegs entwickelt. Während aufgrund der Vielseitigkeit moderner Boden-Luft-Raketen zahlreiche Systeme eingesetzt werden, ist die "Stinger" weiterhin die populärste und effektivste verfügbare Tiefflug-Boden-Luft-Rakete, da sie sowohl von Infanterie- als auch von mobilen Einheiten transportiert werden kann. Das Avenger-Luftverteidigungssystem (ein Humvee, der mit 8 Stinger-Raketen ausgestattet ist) und der M6 Linebacker (ein Panzer-Kampffahrzeug, das über einen Werfer mit vier Stinger-Raketen verfügt), beide von den USA eingesetzt, kombinieren erfolgreich hohe Mobilität mit Boden-Luft-Abwehr.
TEXT.Italian: I sistemi SAM (Surface-to-Air Missile) furono sviluppati a partire dalla fine della Seconda Guerra Mondiale. E mentre la versatilità dei moderni SAM mantiene in uso molti sistemi, lo "Stinger" rimane il più popolare ed efficace SAM da bassa quota disponibile, grazie al fatto che può essere trasportato sia da unità mobili che di fanteria. L'Avenger Air Defense System (un Humvee dotato di otto missili "Stinger") e l'M6 Linebacker (un mezzo corazzato da combattimento con 4 tubi di lancio per Stinger), entrambi impiegati dagli Stati Uniti, fondono con successo grande mobilità e efficacia antiaerea.
TEXT.Spanish: Los sistemas de misiles tierra-aire (SAM) han estado desarrollándose desde el final de la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Y, aunque la versatilidad de la mayoría de los SAM modernos les permite seguir en uso, el más popular y eficaz de los misiles de baja altitud es el "Stinger", que puede ser transportado tanto por la infantería como por las unidades móviles. El sistema de defensa aérea Avenger (un humvee equipado con ocho misiles Stinger) y el M6 Linebacker (un vehículo acorazado con un lanzador cuádruple de Stingers), vehículos empleados por el ejército de los Estados Unidos, combinan de manera brillante la movilidad y la capacidad de ataque tierra-aire.

TEXT.English: A trebuchet is a type of siege engine most frequently used in the Middle Ages. It is sometimes called a counterweight trebuchet or counterpoise trebuchet, to distinguish it from an earlier weapon called the traction trebuchet, where men pulling ropes provided the power.
TEXT.French: Un trébuchet est un type d'engin de siège utilisé principalement au Moyen Âge. Il est parfois appelé trébuchet à contrepoids pour le distinguer du trébuchet à traction, arme plus ancienne où des hommes tiraient sur des cordes pour fournir la force.

TEXT.English: A gangster' is a criminal who is a member of a gang. Some gangs are considered to be part of organized crime. Gangsters are also called mobsters, a term derived from mob and the suffix -ster. Gangs provide a level of organization and resources that support much larger and more complex criminal transactions than an individual criminal could achieve. Gangsters have been active for many years in countries around the world.
TEXT.Spanish: Coche de mafioso.

TEXT.English: Tracking in hunting and ecology is the science and art of observing animal tracks and other signs, with the goal of gaining understanding of the landscape and the animal being tracked (quarry). A further goal of tracking is the deeper understanding of the systems and patterns that make up the environment surrounding and incorporating the tracker.
TEXT.French: Le pistage en chasse et en écologie est la science et l'art d'observer les traces animales et autres signes, afin de mieux comprendre le paysage et l'animal suivi (la proie). Un autre objectif du pistage est une compréhension plus profonde des systèmes et des modèles qui composent l'environnement entourant et intégrant le pisteur.

TEXT.English: Modern armor's goal is to provide versatile firepower that can operate in any battlefield condition, while at the same time ensuring the safety of its crew. Sophisticated electronics allows modern tanks to operate in any weather, day or night, with no significant performance degradation. Capable of nearly 50 mph in rugged terrain, these fighting vehicles are often in the 50-60 ton range. Though their firepower varies, most of these advanced tracked vehicles are equipped with 100mm+ cannons, in addition to other smaller caliber machine guns. Depending on the assignment, some versions include "reactive" armor, which helps to thwart the advanced armor-penetrating munitions seen on today's battlefields.
TEXT.French: L'objectif des blindés modernes est de fournir une puissance de feu polyvalente, capable d'intervenir quelles que soient les conditions de bataille tout en offrant une protection efficace à l'équipage. Des systèmes électroniques sophistiqués permettent aux blindés d'agir par tous types de temps, de jour comme de nuit, sans perdre de leur efficacité. Pouvant se déplacer à près de 80 km/h sur des terrains accidentés, ces véhicules de combat pèsent souvent dans les 50 à 60 tonnes. Bien que leur puissance de feu soit variable, la plupart des blindés sont équipés de canons de plus de 100mm et de mitrailleuses. Certains modèles disposent également de blindages "réactifs", capables de neutraliser les projectiles perforants modernes.
TEXT.German: Die Hauptaufgabe des Kampfpanzers besteht darin, in jeder Kampfsituation seine vielseitig einsetzbare Feuerkraft zur Verfügung zu stellen und gleichzeitig die Sicherheit seiner Besatzung zu gewährleisten. Dank hoch entwickelter Elektronik ist es modernen Panzern möglich, Tag und Nacht bei jeder Witterung ohne nennenswerte Leistungseinbußen zu operieren. Mit einer Spitzengeschwindigkeit von nahezu 80 Stundenkilometern auf schwergängigem Gelände besitzen diese Kampffahrzeuge häufig ein Gefechtsgewicht von 50-60 Tonnen. Ihre Feuerkraft variiert je nach Fahrzeugtyp, aber die meisten modernen Kettenfahrzeuge sind mit mindestens 100-mm-Kanonen ausgestattet, und das zusätzlich zu den kleinkalibrigeren MGs. Je nach Einsatzbestimmung verfügen manche dieser Gefährte außerdem über eine "reaktive" (Mehrschicht-)Panzerung, die dazu dient, die modernen Durchschlagsgeschosse abzuwehren, welche auf den Kriegsschauplätzen der heutigen Zeit zum Einsatz kommen.
TEXT.Italian: L'obiettivo delle unità corazzate moderne è di fornire una potenza di fuoco versatile, che possa operare in qualsiasi condizione sul campo di battaglia, assicurando al tempo stesso l'incolumità dell'equipaggio. Sofisticati apparecchi elettronici consentono ai carri armati moderni di operare in qualsiasi condizione meteorologica, di giorno o di notte, senza penalizzazioni significative dal punto di vista delle prestazioni. In grado di viaggiare a circa 80 Km/h su terreno accidentato, questi veicoli da combattimento pesano spesso fra le 50 e le 60 tonnellate. Malgrado la loro potenza di fuoco sia variabile, la maggior parte di questi sofisticati veicoli corazzati è equipaggiata con cannoni da oltre 100mm, oltre a mitragliatrici di calibro minore. A seconda dell'assegnazione, alcune versioni dispongono di una corazza "reattiva", che può respingere le munizioni in grado di penetrare la corazza, tipiche dei campi di battaglia odierni.
TEXT.Spanish: El objetivo de los carros blindados modernos es proporcionar una potencia de fuego versátil, capaz de operar en cualquier condición, garantizando al mismo tiempo la seguridad de su dotación. Unos sistemas electrónicos muy sofisticados permiten a los tanques modernos operar en cualquier clima, de día o de noche, sin merma apreciable de su capacidad. Capaces de alcanzar una velocidad de 80 km/h a campo abierto, estos vehículos suelen pesar entre cincuenta y sesenta toneladas. Aunque su potencia de fuego varía, la mayoría de los vehículos de oruga modernos están equipados con cañones de 100 mm o más, además de ametralladoras de menor calibre. Según la misión asignada, algunas versiones cuentan con blindaje "reactivo", que ayuda a contrarrestar la potencia de las municiones penetrantes que se emplean en los campos de batalla de nuestros tiempos.

TEXT.English: The Lockheed Martin F-35 Lightning II is a single-seat, single-engine, stealth-capable military strike fighter, a multi-role aircraft that can perform close air support, tactical bombing, and air-to-air combat. The F-35 has three different models; one is the conventional takeoff and landing variant, the second is short-takeoff and vertical-landing variant, and the third is a carrier-based variant.
TEXT.French: Le Lockheed Martin F-35 Lightning II est un avion militaire d'attaque monoplace à moteur unique et furtif, un appareil polyvalent capable d'appui aérien rapproché, de bombardement tactique et de combat aérien. Le F-35 existe en trois versions : décollage et atterrissage conventionnels, décollage court et atterrissage vertical, et version embarquée sur porte-avions.
TEXT.Polish: Lockheed F-35 Lightning II to amerykañski jednomiejscowy, jednosilnikowy myœliwiec wielozadaniowy zbudowany przez korporacjê Lockheed Martin w ramach projektu Joint Strike Fighter, który mia³ na celu zbudowanie maszyny spe³niaj¹cej wymagania wszystkich rodzajów amerykañskich si³ zbrojnych. Wersja prototypowa samolotu by³a znana pod nazw¹ X-35 JSF, ale 7 lipca 2006 roku maszyna dosta³a now¹ oficjaln¹ nazwê Lightning II. F-35 Lightning II jest zdolny do wykonywania misji bliskiego wsparcia, bombardowañ, oraz typowo myœliwskich zadañ walki powietrznej. Projekt samolotu jest finansowany wspólnie przez rz¹dy Stanów Zjednoczonych, Wielkiej Brytanii i innych krajów zainteresowanych zakupem tej maszyny. F-35 Lightning II zosta³ zbudowany pod kierownictwem firmy Lockheed Martin, przy wspó³pracy z BAE Systems i Northrop Grumman
TEXT.Russian: Локхид Мартин F-35 Лайтнинг II - это одноместный, одномоторный, малозаметный военный ударный истребитель, многоцелевой самолет, который может осуществлять непосредственную поддержку с воздуха, осуществлять тактическую бомбардировку и вести бой воздух-воздух. У F-35 есть три разные модели; один - вариант с обычным взлетом и посадкой, второй - вариант с укороченным взлетом и вертикальной посадкой, третий - флотский вариант с предусмотренной посадкой на авианосец.

TEXT.English: The Modern Flamethrower is an infantry unit that roasts its enemies with napalm and phosphorous.
TEXT.French: Le lance-flammes moderne est une unité d'infanterie qui rôtit ses ennemis avec du napalm et du phosphore.
TEXT.Italian: Il lancia-fiamme moderno è un'unità di fanteria equipaggiata con armi al napalm e al fosforo.
TEXT.Polish: Czêœæ plecakowa typowego miotacza sk³ada siê ze zbiornika mieszanki zapalaj¹cej oraz butli z materia³em pêdnym. Zbiornik po³¹czony jest giêtkim przewodem do czêœci rêcznej (przypominaj¹cej strzelbê), posiadaj¹c¹ spust i po³¹czony z nim zawór, a u wylotu specjalne urz¹dzenie zap³onowe. Po otwarciu zaworu butli sprê¿ony gaz dostaje siê do przestrzeni ponad paliwem i wywiera na nie nacisk, sprawiaj¹c, ¿e poprzez w¹¿ dostaje siê ono do czêœci rêcznej. W tym momencie miotacz jest gotowy do u¿ycia. Naciœniêcie spustu powodowa³o otwarcie zaworu w czêœci rêcznej z równoczesnym zadzia³aniem urz¹dzenia zap³onowego i fala ognia wydostawa³a siê z rury. Mo¿liwe by³o oddanie kilku krótkich lub jednego d³ugiego strza³u.
TEXT.Russian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Современный огнеметчик[COLOR_REVERT]- это пехотный отряд, который поджаривает врагов напалмом и фосфором.

TEXT.English: The Modern Frigate is an enhanced version of the Destroyer; while the Stealth Destroyer is an effective strike and anti-stealth unit, it has the disavantage of being unable to detect subs. The Modern Frigate is designed primarily as an escort and patrol ship. Its weaponry makes it an effective anti-sub and anti-air unit ideally suited to protect your missile cruisers and carriers.
TEXT.French: La frégate moderne est une version améliorée du destroyer ; alors que le destroyer furtif est une unité d'attaque et anti-furtivité efficace, il ne peut pas détecter les sous-marins. La frégate moderne est principalement conçue comme un navire d'escorte et de patrouille. Son armement la rend efficace anti-sous-marin et anti-aérien, idéale pour protéger vos croiseurs à missiles et porte-avions.
TEXT.Russian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Современный фрегат[COLOR_REVERT] - это улучшенная версия [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Эсминца[COLOR_REVERT]; в то время как [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Стелс-эсминец[COLOR_REVERT] является эффективным ударным и кораблем анти-стелс, не способный обнаруживать подводные лодки. Современный фрегат разработан в первую очередь как сторожевой и патрульный корабль. Его вооружение делает его эффективным противолодочным и противовоздушным отрядом, идеально подходящим для прикрытия на марше ваших ракетных крейсеров и авианосцев.

TEXT.English: The Modern Hovercraft is an armored unit that can cross water. It is held up by very quickly spinning fan blades which create a cushion of air underneath it.
TEXT.French: Le hovercraft moderne est une unité blindée capable de traverser l'eau. Il est soutenu par des pales de ventilateur tournant très rapidement qui créent un coussin d'air en dessous.
TEXT.Italian: L'Hovercraft moderno è un'unità corazzata in grado di attraversare gli oceani; rimane sospesa grazie a potenti ventole che creano un cuscino d'aria sotto il veicolo.
TEXT.Polish: Poduszkowiec (ang. hovercraft) - pojazd poruszaj¹cy siê na poduszce powietrznej. Poduszka ta powstaje gdy wentylator zasysa powietrze z otoczenia i wt³acza je pod spód pojazdu. Powietrze sprê¿ane jest wewn¹trz komory powsta³ej pomiêdzy dnem maszyny, gruntem i elastycznym fartuchem. Gdy komora wype³ni siê powietrzem i poduszkowiec uniesie siê na odpowiedni¹ wysokoœæ, nadmiar powietrza wydostaje siê na zewn¹trz. Wentylator musi mieæ wystarczaj¹c¹ wydajnoœæ aby uzupe³nia³ ubytek powietrza. Dziêki temu wysokoœæ poduszki powietrznej pozostaje sta³a.

TEXT.English: An imperial guard or palace guard is a special group of troops (or a member thereof) of an empire, typically closely associated directly with the Emperor or Empress. Usually these troops embody a more elite status than other imperial forces, including the regular armed forces, and maintain special rights, privileges and traditions. Because the head of state often wishes to be protected by the best soldiers available, their numbers and organisation may be expanded to carry out additional tasks. In the post-colonial period, the term has been used colloquially and derisively to describe the staff of a person, usually a politician or corporate executive officer, that acts to prevent direct communication with the person.
TEXT.Italian: Unità per la difesa della capitale. Solo una è permessa per ogni civiltà.
TEXT.Spanish: Unidad defensora de la capital. Solo se permite una por civilización.
TEXT.Polish: Wspó³czesny Stra¿nik Imperium to doborowa jednostka. Zwykle stacjonuje
TEXT.Russian: Императорская гвардия или дворцовая стража - это особая группа войск (или отдельная часть) империи, обычно тесно связанная непосредственно с Императором или Императрицей. Как правило эти войска олицетворяют более элитный статус, чем другие имперские силы, включая регулярные вооруженные силы, и поддерживают особые права, привилегии и традиции. Поскольку глава государства часто желает, чтобы его защищали лучшие солдаты, их количество и организация могут быть расширены для выполнения дополнительных задач. В постколониальный период этот термин использовался в разговорной речи и насмешливо для описания человека, обычно из охраны политика или должностного лица корпорации, препятствующего общению с ним простых граждан.

TEXT.English: Modern infantry is given the challenging task of taking and holding terrain, which often involves dangerous,close range fighting. Organized into small squads, their strength lies in their training and equipment (rifle, grenades, helmet, and other critical gear). Often individuals in the squad are trained to be specialists, allowing them access to anti-tank weapons or light machine guns. Experienced in concealment and patrolling close to the enemy, these hard-fighting men play an important and versatile role in modern military conflict.
TEXT.French: L'infanterie moderne a pour tâche de prendre et d'occuper le terrain, ce qui implique souvent de mener de dangereux combats rapprochés. Organisée en petites escouades, sa force repose sur l'entraînement et l'équipement des soldats (fusil, grenades, casques...). Au sein d'une escouade, les soldats sont souvent spécialisés, notamment dans le maniement d'armes (armes antichars, mitrailleuses légères). Ces soldats, spécialistes de la dissimulation et du combat rapproché, jouent un rôle important dans la guerre moderne.
TEXT.German: Aufgabe der modernen Infanterie ist vor allem die Eroberung und Sicherung des eigenen Territoriums, wobei es häufig zu gefährlichen Nahkampfgefechten kommen kann. Die Infanteristen sind in kleine Einsatztrupps eingeteilt, die sich vor allem durch ihre Ausbildung und Ausrüstung (Gewehre, Granaten, Helme sowie anderes hilfreiches Gerät) auszeichnen. Oft haben einzelne Mitglieder dieser Trupps eine Spezialausbildung absolviert, durch die sie dazu befähigt sind, Panzerabwehrwaffen oder leichte Maschinengewehre zu bedienen. Wegen ihrer umfangreichen Erfahrung im Hinblick auf die erfolgreiche Täuschung feindlicher Einheiten und das Patrouillieren in deren unmittelbarer Nähe nehmen diese versierten Kämpfer in modernen Militärkonflikten eine wichtige und vielseitige Rolle ein.
TEXT.Italian: La fanteria moderna deve assolvere il difficile compito di conquistare il terreno e mantenere la posizione, manovra che spesso implica pericolosi combattimenti a distanza ravvicinata. Organizzata in piccole squadre, la forza della fanteria risiede nel suo addestramento e nel suo equipaggiamento (fucile, granate, elmetto e altri strumenti fondamentali). Spesso, alcuni individui ricevono un addestramento specialistico in modo da imparare a usare armi anticarro o mitragliatrici leggere. Esperti nel nascondersi e nell'effettuare un pattugliamento vicino al nemico, questi intrepidi uomini ricoprono un ruolo importante e versatile nei conflitti militari moderni.
TEXT.Spanish: La infantería moderna tiene asignada la complicada tarea de conquistar y defender el terreno, lo que significa que a menudo se ve envuelta en peligrosos combates cuerpo a cuerpo. Organizada en pequeños pelotones, su fuerza reside en su instrucción y equipamiento (fusil, granadas, casco y otros elementos de gran importancia). A menudo, en el seno de un pelotón hay especialistas, entrenados en el uso de armas anti-tanque o ametralladoras ligeras. Expertos en camuflaje y en operar cerca de las líneas enemigas, estas aguerridas unidades desempeñan un papel importante y versátil en la guerra moderna.
TEXT.Polish: Od wieku XIII systematycznie wzrasta³o znaczenie piechoty. Wprowadzenie prochu w Europie by³o momentem prze³omowym w ca³ej historii wojskowoœci. W wieku XVI piechota uzbrojona w broñ paln¹ i piki mog³a z powodzeniem powstrzymaæ szar¿ê wrogiej kawalerii. Coraz szersze stosowanie muszkietu spowodowa³o, ¿e piechota, nazywana w epoce nowo¿ytnej infanteria, uleg³a podzia³owi na pikinierów i strzelców (muszkieterów). W XVI w. piechurzy formowali siê na polu walki w zwarte czworoboki. W celu zapewnienia ci¹g³oœci ognia stosowali tzw. kontrmarsz, który polega³ na kolejnym oddawaniu salwy przez poszczególne szeregi ¿o³nierzy. Ci, którzy oddali strza³ wycofywali siê na ty³ kolumny w celu ponownego za³adowania broni. Pikinierzy natomiast os³aniali strzelców przed atakiem jazdy wroga. Wynalezienie bagnetu spowodowa³o od drugiej po³owy XVII wieku spadek przydatnoœci pikinierów, halabardników oraz innych jednostek przeznaczonych do walki wrêcz. W razie zaistnienia koniecznoœci takiej walki, ka¿dy piechur móg³ j¹ podj¹æ u¿ywaj¹c muszkietu lub karabinu z bagnetem. Dodatkowo stopniowy rozwój broni palnej zmniejszy³ skutecznoœæ szar¿y kawaleryjskiej, któr¹ mog³a powstrzymaæ dobrze wykonana salwa piechoty. Wszystko to spowodowa³o, ¿e liczba pikinierów w oddziale wydatnie zmniejszy³a siê na pocz¹tku XVIII wieku, by pod koniec tego stulecia praktycznie znikn¹æ z pól bitew. Formacjê piechurów uzbrojonych w broñ bia³¹ (piki, kosy), pojawia³y siê jeszcze sporadycznie w XIX wieku, g³ównie w czasie powstañ i rewolucji, by³y to jednak wyj¹tki od regu³y i praktycznie mo¿na powiedzieæ, ¿e XVIII i XIX stulecie to epoka zdominowana przez broñ paln¹.

TEXT.English: One of the most capable of the monarchs during this period was Sultan Mohammed Terab, one of Ahmad Bukr's sons. He led a number of successful campaigns. In 1785-1786 (AH 1200), he led an army against the Funj, but got no further than Omdurman. Here he was stopped by the Nile, and found no means of getting his army across the river. Unwilling to give up his project, Terab remained at Omdurman for months and the army began to grow disaffected. According to some stories Tayrab was poisoned by his wife at the instigation of disaffected chiefs, and the army returned to Darfur. While he tried to have his son succeed him, the throne instead went to his brother Abd al-Rahman.

The Mohawk were among the four Iroquois tribes that allied with the British during the American Revolutionary War. They had a long trading relationship with the British and hoped to gain support to prohibit colonists encroaching into their territory in the Mohawk Valley. Joseph Brant acted as a war chief and successfully led raids against British and ethnic German colonists in the Mohawk Valley, who had been given land by the British administration near the rapids at present-day Little Falls, New York.

On the other side the Georgians were facing a numerically significantly superior foe but had the strategic as well as tactical advantage. King David's decisive reforms turned the Georgian army into a well organised and structured military force which saw little analogue in that period. The smallest formations would be equivalents of nowadays squads and platoons, then a "group of 100" and so forth all led by servants of higher status and different rank. The most crucial and core component was the Monaspa guard or royal guard which consisted of 5,000 well trained and heavily armed mounted warriors which would be used as shock cavalry together with the nobility. In this particular engagement they were further reinforced with hundreds of crusaders sent by Baldwin II of Jerusalem. The Crusaders, the Kipchak cavalry and a small portion of infantry were deployed in the center of the Georgian army around the king's banner while the rest were equally split in two major wings initially out of sight for the Seljuqs. Each formation was headed by a great and dense line of horsemen. The heavy cavalry would smash into the enemy ranks with their lances joined by the infantry which would entangle the Seljuq main body in fights while the cavalry was to regroup and carry out repeated attacks till the enemy broke. At the sign of collapse David would then send forward his Kipchak cavalry. Initially the king and all his entourage stayed in the center but would immediately switch to their respective positions when the battle commenced.

The equestrian skill of a Mongol was notoriously keen. Having been taught to ride on horseback from the age of three, and by five given bow and arrows to use from horseback for hunting and war, it was a natural way for the Mongols to conduct war. The Mongol's harsh, nomadic lifestyle prepared them well for the rigors of war; they often thrived in conditions that would be considered intolerable by any other troops of its time. When the need arose, Mongol horsemen could go up to ten days at a time without cooking food, during which they would sustain themselves by drinking the blood and milk of their horses.
TEXT.French: Les Mongols sont réputés être d'excellents cavaliers. Ils apprennent à monter à cheval dès l'âge de trois ans et à tirer à l'arc depuis le dos d'un cheval dès cinq ans. C'est donc devenu très naturellement leur manière de pratiquer la guerre. Peuple nomade, leurs conditions de vie difficiles les aident à supporter les rigueurs de la guerre, mieux que n'importe quelle armée de l'époque. Quand la situation l'impose, un cavalier mongol peut rester dix jours sans manger, ne se nourrissant que du lait et du sang de son cheval.
TEXT.German: Die Mongolen waren für ihre Reitkunst berühmt. Bereits im Alter von nur 3 Jahren lernten die mongolischen Kinder reiten. 2 Jahre später bekamen sie Pfeil und Bogen, um zu jagen und zu kämpfen. Die nomadisch lebenden Mongolen waren perfekt auf die Härte des Krieges vorbereitet. Nicht selten lebten sie unter Bedingungen, die für andere Truppen ihrer Zeit unerträglich gewesen wären. Mongolische Reiter kamen zehn Tage lang ohne Nahrung aus und ernährten sich in dieser Zeit vom Blut und der Milch ihrer Pferde.
TEXT.Italian: L'abilità equestre dei Mongoli era ben nota: imparavano ad andare a cavallo all'età di tre anni e già a cinque venivano dotati di arco e frecce per andare a caccia o combattere. Per i Mongoli, andare in guerra diventava una cosa quasi normale. La vita dura e nomade dei Mongoli li preparò bene per gli stenti della guerra: riuscivano a sopravvivere in condizioni intollerabili per qualsiasi altro soldato dell'epoca. Se necessario, i cavallerizzi Mongoli potevano non mangiare nulla per dieci giorni, nutrendosi del sangue e del latte dei loro cavalli.
TEXT.Spanish: La destreza de los jinetes mongoles era famosa. Para los mongoles, que aprendían a montar a la edad de tres años y que a los cinco recibían arco y flechas para cazar y hacer la guerra a lomos de sus monturas, era la forma más natural de luchar. Su forma de vida, rigurosa y nómada, los preparaba para los rigores de la guerra. A menudo salían victoriosos en condiciones que cualquier otro ejército de su tiempo hubiese encontrado intolerables. Cuando era necesario, los jinetes mongoles podían pasar hasta diez días sin cocinar, sustentándose únicamente con la sangre y la leche de sus caballos.

TEXT.English: Monks are holy men, who work for their god to bring salvation to the people. They do often good things, they care about the poor and weak, but they if they are attacked, they are also strong and able to put up a fight.[PARAGRAPH:2]Concept WarriorsOfGod by The_J, Monk graphics is the Generic Male Missionary by Refar. Made into a module for RoM by Dancing Hoskuld.
TEXT.French: Les moines sont des hommes saints, qui travaillent pour leur dieu afin d'apporter le salut aux gens. Ils font souvent de bonnes actions, s'occupent des pauvres et des faibles, mais s'ils sont attaqués, ils sont aussi forts et capables de se défendre.[PARAGRAPH:2]Concept WarriorsOfGod par The_J, graphisme des moines inspiré du Missionnaire masculin générique par Refar. Adapté en module pour RoM par Dancing Hoskuld.
TEXT.German: Mönche sind heilige Männer, die sich um das Seelenheil der Bevölkerung kümmern. Sie tuen oft gute Dinge, sie kümmern sich um die Armen und Schwachen, aber wenn sie angegriffen werden, sind sie trotzdem stark und wehrhaft.[PARAGRAPH:2]Concept WarriorsOfGod by The_J, Monk graphics is the Generic Male Missionary by Refar. Made into a module for RoM by Dancing Hoskuld.
TEXT.Polish: Zakon mniszy, zakon kontemplacyjny - katolicka i prawos³awna forma ¿ycia zakonnego, polegaj¹ca w pierwotnej wersji na ca³kowitym odciêciu siê od œwiata zewnêtrznego i ¿ycie w ca³kowitym odosobnieniu lub w nielicznej zamkniêtej wspólnocie, poœwiêcone prawie wy³¹cznie modlitwie i kontemplacji Boga. Pocz¹tkowo ¿ycie mnisze wi¹za³o siê z form¹ pustelnicz¹. Najstarsze oœrodki ¿ycia pustelniczego powsta³y w ramach Koœcio³a Koptyjskiego w Egipcie. W protestantyzmie zakony mnisze nie wystêpuj¹ wcale.

TEXT.English: A mortar is a weapon that fires explosive projectiles known as (mortar) bombs at low velocities, short ranges, and high-arcing ballistic trajectories. It is typically muzzle-loading with a short barrel, generally less than 15 times its caliber.
TEXT.French: Un mortier est une arme qui tire des projectiles explosifs appelés bombes (de mortier) à basse vitesse, courte portée, et trajectoires balistiques courbes. Il est généralement à chargement par la bouche avec un canon court, généralement moins de 15 fois son calibre.
TEXT.Polish: W XIV wieku bombardy du¿ego kalibru o krótkiej lufie (1,5 - 2 kalibrów) zaczêto nazywaæ moŸdzierzami. Posiada³y ³o¿a klocowe i sta³y k¹t podniesienia lufy 60-80 stopni. W XV wieku zastosowano lufy z czopami i kliny do zmiany k¹ta podniesienia lufy (moŸdzierz wisz¹cy). Pierwsze moŸdzierze posiada³y znaczny kaliber (do 880 mm). Pod koniec XVII wieku znormalizowano kalibry oraz wprowadzono œrubowy mechanizm podniesienia lufy. MoŸdzierze tej budowy dotrwa³y do po³owy XIX wieku, a u¿ywane by³y jeszcze w czasie I wojny œwiatowej. W po³owie XIX wieku wprowadzono ³adowanie od ty³u i lufy gwintowane, przekszta³caj¹c je stopniowo w moŸdzierz oblê¿niczy. MoŸdzierze oblê¿nicze po II wojnie œwiatowej zosta³y wyparte przez lotnictwo.
TEXT.Spanish: Mortero.

TEXT.English: The first motorcycle was designed and built by the German inventors Gottlieb Daimler and Wilhelm Maybach in Bad Cannstatt (since 1905 a city district of Stuttgart) in 1885. The first petroleum-powered vehicle, it was essentially a motorised bicycle, although the inventors called their invention the Reitwagen ("riding car"). However, if a two-wheeled vehicle with steam propulsion is considered a motorcycle, then the first one may have been American. One such machine was demonstrated at fairs and circuses in the eastern U.S. in 1867, built by Sylvester Howard Roper of Roxbury, Massachusetts.[PARAGRAPH:2]In 1894, Hildebrand and Wolfmuller became the first motorcycle available for purchase. In the early period of motorcycle history, many producers of bicycles adapted their designs to accommodate the new internal combustion engine. As the engines became more powerful, and designs outgrew the bicycle origins, the number of motorcycle producers increased. Until the First World War, the largest motorcycle manufacturer in the world was Indian, producing over 20,000 bikes per year. By 1920, this honour went to Harley-Davidson, with their motorcycles being sold by dealers in 67 countries. In 1928, DKW took over as the largest manufacturer.
TEXT.Polish: Motocykl to jednoœladowy pojazd samochodowy bez nadwozia, posiadaj¹cy dwa (lub wiêcej) ko³a jezdne, wyposa¿ony w silnik spalinowy o pojemnoœci powy¿ej 50 cm3 (do II wojny œwiatowej - powy¿ej 100 cm3), przeznaczony do przewozu jednej lub dwóch osób (niekiedy trzech, w przypadku zainstalowania wózka bocznego, tzw. kosza). Pierwszy motocykl zbudowa³ Gottlieb Daimler w 1885. Pierwsze motocykle by³y rowerami, do których wmontowano silnik spalinowy napêdzaj¹cy paskiem klinowym tylne ko³o.

TEXT.English: While technically the definition of a Motor Pool is a collection or fleet of vehicles, this particular unit represents the support operations FOR a fleet of vehicles, which is a common department in modern militaries. It is at these bases of operation that military vehicles are brought and stored for maintenance - refueling, repairs and tuning. So this unit gives recognition to the dedicated soldiers trained to maintain motor pool operations and uphold the roles of military mechanics.
TEXT.French: Bien que techniquement un parc automobile soit une collection ou une flotte de véhicules, cette unité représente les opérations de soutien POUR une flotte de véhicules, un service commun dans les armées modernes. C'est sur ces bases que les véhicules militaires sont amenés et stockés pour maintenance — ravitaillement, réparations et réglages. Cette unité rend hommage aux soldats dévoués formés à la maintenance des parcs automobiles et au travail des mécaniciens militaires.
TEXT.Polish: Warsztat - pomieszczenie przeznaczone do wykonywania pracy o charakterze wytwórczym lub us³ugowym z niezbêdnym wyposa¿eniem

TEXT.English: The Motuans are native inhabitants of Papua New Guinea, living along the southern coastal area of the country. Their indigenous language is known as Motu, like several other languages of the region an Austronesian language. They and the Koitabu people are the original inhabitants and owners of the land on which Port Moresby - the national capital city - stands. The largest Motuan village is Hanuabada, northwest of Port Moresby.
TEXT.French: Les Motuans sont des habitants autochtones de Papouasie-Nouvelle-Guinée, vivant le long de la côte sud du pays. Leur langue indigène est appelée Motu, comme plusieurs autres langues de la région, une langue austronésienne. Ils et les Koitabu sont les habitants originels et propriétaires des terres où se trouve Port Moresby, la capitale nationale. Le plus grand village Motuan est Hanuabada, au nord-ouest de Port Moresby.

TEXT.English: The mouflon (Ovis aries orientalis group) is a subspecies group of the wild sheep Ovis aries. Populations of Ovis aries can be partitioned into the mouflons (orientalis group) and urials or arkars (vignei group). The mouflon is thought to be one of the two ancestors for all modern domestic sheep breeds.
TEXT.French: Le mouflon (groupe Ovis aries orientalis) est un groupe de sous-espèces du mouton sauvage Ovis aries. Les populations d'Ovis aries peuvent être divisées en mouflons (groupe orientalis) et en urials ou arkars (groupe vignei). Le mouflon est considéré comme l'un des deux ancêtres de toutes les races modernes de moutons domestiques.

TEXT.English: Lasting traces of Adena culture are still seen in their substantial earthworks. Once Adena mounds numbered in the hundreds, but only a small number of Adena earthen monuments still survive today. These mounds generally ranged in size from 20 feet (6.1 m) to 300 feet (91 m) in diameter and served as burial structures, ceremonial sites, historical markers and possibly gathering places. These mounds were built using hundreds of thousands of baskets full of specially selected and graded earth. According to archaeological investigations, Adena mounds were usually built as part of burial ritual, in which the earth of the mound was piled immediately atop a burned mortuary building. These mortuary buildings were intended to keep and maintain the dead until their final burial was performed. Before the construction of the mounds, some utilitarian and grave goods would be placed on the floor of the structure, which was burned with the goods and honored dead within. The mound would then be constructed, and often a new mortuary structure would be placed atop the new mound. After a series of repetitions, mound/mortuary/mound/mortuary, a quite prominent earthwork would remain. In the later Adena period, circular ridges of unknown function were sometimes constructed around the burial mounds. Adena mounds stood in isolation from domestic living areas.

The Regiment of Mounted Grenadiers (Spanish: Regimiento de Granaderos a Caballo) is a name applied to Argentine Army regiments of two different time periods: a historic regiment that operated from 1812 to 1826, and a modern cavalry unit that was organized in 1903. First commanded by Argentine national hero Jos de San Martín in 1812, the historic Mounted Grenadiers fought in the Argentine War of Independence and the Cisplatine War, subsequently becoming the Presidential Honor Guard in 1825. Refusing to replenish its membership with soldiers who had not fought in the Argentine War of Independence, the regiment was forced to disband in 1826.

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP or Mounties; French: Gendarmerie royale du Canada, GRC) is both the federal police force and the national police of Canada. The RCMP was created as the North West Mounted Police (NWMP) in 1873, given the "Royal" title in 1904, becoming the Royal North West Mounted Police (RNWMP). In 1920 it was renamed to the Royal Canadian Mounted Police Force when the RNWMP was merged with the Dominion Police. Among themselves, the Mounties universally refer to their organization as "The Force" and members of the force are referred to as "Members."[PARAGRAPH:1]It has been theorized that the international popularity of the force lies in it being representative of a symbol of the balance of civilization and the frontier. That is, the RCMP is a police force that operates in the seemingly wild frontier, but operates under the behest of a central, if somewhat removed, bureaucratic authority back in the settled regions. In addition, the existence of the RCMP in Canada and the complete lack of any analogous organization in the Western United States during the frontier period has often been cited as both a cause and effect of cultural differences between Canada and the United States.
TEXT.Polish: Kanadyjska Królewska Policja Konna, Royal Canadian Mounted Police/Gendarmerie Royale du Canada, w skrócie RCMP/GRC kanadyjska policja federalna bêd¹ca wykonawcz¹ i pomocnicz¹ agencj¹ kanadyjskiego federalnego ministerstwa bezpieczeñstwa publicznego - Ministry of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness. W przeciwieñstwie do swoich odpowiedników w innych krajach, np. FBI w USA, RCMP spe³nia tak¿e funkcje na poziomie prowincjonalnym, samorz¹dowym, a nawet korporacyjnym. Osiem z dziesiêciu prowincji Kanady i wszystkie trzy Terytoria (wyj¹tkiem s¹ posiadaj¹ce swe policje prowincjonalne Ontario i Quebec), 198 miast, 192 samorz¹dy indiañskie i 172 przedsiêbiorstwa (np. wiele lotnisk) korzysta z kontraktowych us³ug RCMP.
