TEXT.English: Babur (born Feb. 15, 1483, principality of Fergana died Dec. 26, 1530, Agra, India) was Emperor (1526 - 30) and founder of the Mughal dynasty of India. A descendant of Genghis Khan and Timur, he came from a tribe of Mongol origin but was Turkish in language and upbringing. In his youth he tried for 10 years (1494 - 1504) to gain control of Samarkand, Timur's old capital. Those efforts ended in his losing his own principality in Fergana (modern Uzbekistan), but he consoled himself by seizing and holding Kabul (1504). After four failed attempts, he successfully occupied Delhi (1525). Surrounded by enemy states, Babur (the name means "Tiger") persuaded his homesick troops to stand their ground, and over the next four years he defeated his foes. His grandson Akbar consolidated the new empire. Babur was also a gifted poet and a lover of nature who constructed gardens wherever he went. The Babur-nameh, his prose memoirs, has become a world classic of autobiography.
TEXT.Polish: Babur, Zahir ud-din Muhammad (1483-1530), za³o¿yciel indyjskiej, muzu³mañskiej dynastii Wielkich Mogo³ów, potomek Timura i Czyngis-chana. W 1494 opanowa³ i rz¹dzi³ Fergan¹, po jej utracie i nieudanych próbach odzyskania schroni³ siê w Afganistanie. W 1504 podporz¹dkowa³ sobie Kabul i Kandahar, w 1519 Pend¿ab, który p³aci³ mu trybut. W 1526 pokona³ pod Panipatem su³tana delhijskiego Ibrahima Lodiego, zaj¹³ Delhi i Agrê. W 1527 pokona³ pod Chanw¹ koalicjê radŸputów i opanowa³ Nizinê Hindustañsk¹. W 1529 zdoby³ Gwalior i dotar³ do granic Bengalu i Himalajów. Wybitny wódz, polityk, protektor nauki i sztuki. Autor pamiêtników Baburname, traktatu o sprawowaniu rz¹dów i utworów poetyckich.

TEXT.English: Muhammad Ahmad bin Abd Allah was a religious leader of the Samaniyya order in Sudan who, on June 29, 1881, proclaimed himself the Mahdi (or Madhi), the messianic redeemer of the Islamic faith. His proclamation came during a period of widespread resentment among the Sudanese population of the oppressive policies of the Turco-Egyptian rulers, and capitalized on the messianic beliefs popular among the various Sudanese religious sects of the time. More broadly, the Mahdiyya, as Muhammad Ahmad's movement was called, was influenced by earlier Mahdist movements in West Africa, as well as Wahhabism and other puritanical forms of Islamic revivalism that developed in reaction to the growing military and economic dominance of the European powers throughout the 19th century.

Muhammad ibn Saud was the emir of Ad-Diriyyah and is considered the founder of the First Saudi State and the Saud dynasty, which are technically named for his father - Saud ibn Muhammad ibn Muqrin (died 1725). Ibn Saud's family (then known as the Al Muqrin) traced its descent to the tribe of Banu Hanifa but, despite popular misconceptions, Muhammad ibn Saud was neither a nomadic bedouin nor was he a tribal leader. Rather, he was the chief (emir) of an agricultural settlement near modern-day Riyadh, called Diriyah. Furthermore, he was a competent and ambitious desert warrior.

Arguably the best-known mujahideen outside the Islamic world, various loosely aligned Afghan opposition groups initially rebelled against the government of the pro-Soviet Democratic Republic of Afghanistan (DRA) during the late 1970s. At the DRA's request, the Soviet Union brought forces into the country to aid the government from 1979. The mujahideen fought against Soviet and DRA troops during the Soviet War in Afghanistan (1979-1989) Afghanistan's resistance movement originated in chaos and, at first, regional warlords waged virtually all of its fighting locally. As warfare became more sophisticated, outside support and regional coordination grew. The basic units of mujahideen organization and action continued to reflect the highly decentralized nature of Afghan society and strong loci of competing mujahideen and tribal groups, particularly in isolated areas among the mountains. Eventually, the seven main mujahideen parties allied as the political bloc called Islamic Unity of Afghanistan Mujahideen.

[H1]Mungo Man[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mungo Man[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] between 68,000 and 40,000 BC[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Earliest Aborginal known person to have lived in that time frame.[PARAGRAPH:1]was an early human inhabitant of the continent of Australia, who is believed to have lived between 68,000 and 40,000 years ago, during the Pleistocene epoch. The remains are the oldest anatomically modern human remains found in Australia to date. His exact age is a matter of ongoing dispute.Although the term "black" is also used to refer to people of African ancestry, this does not imply any relation or connection between the two cultures. Genetically, Indigenous Australians are closer to East Asians and Europeans than they are to Africans.
TEXT.French: L'homme de Mungo et la femme de Mungo sont un ensemble de fossiles correspondant à des habitants de l'Australie qui auraient vécu, il y a environ 40 000 ans au Pléistocène. Ils ont été découverts au bord du lac Mungo, au sud de la Nouvelle-Galles du Sud. Ces fossiles sont les plus anciens restes humains trouvés en Australie mais leur âge est encore sujet à polémique. De récentes études de l'ADN mitochondrial mettraient en doute l'origine unique du genre humain ce qui prête aussi à controverse.
TEXT.Polish: Pierwsi osadnicy, którzy pojawili siê na kontynencie Sahul, musieli pokonaæ za pomoc¹ œrodków nawigacji morskiej ok. 300 km, jakie dzieli³y Sundê od Sahula. Subkontynent Sunda (a zw³. wyspy Indonezji) by³ zasiedlony ju¿ przez Homo erectusa, natomiast Sahul zosta³ skolonizowany dopiero przez pierwszych Homo sapiens najprawdopodobniej ok. 40 000 lat temu. Najwczeœniejsze œlady cz³owieka na terenie Australii pochodz¹ z okresu miêdzy 40 000 i 30 000 lat temu i zosta³y odkryte na dawnych pla¿ach jeziora Mungo (Nowa Po³udniowa Walia) oraz na terasach rzeki Swan w po³udniowo-zachodniej Australii (39 5001800 lat temu).

TEXT.English: The Murri are the Indigenous Australians of modern-day Queensland, North West New South Wales. Collections of tribes and extended family groups throughout geographic regions of Australia have different names, such as the Yugarabul, the Jagera peoples from Coorparoo, Kwiambal peoples from Northern New South Wales and the Koori people of parts of New South Wales and Victoria. The term is their preferred term, expressing pride in their heritage and race.
TEXT.French: Les Murri sont les Aborigènes d'Australie de l'actuelle Queensland et du nord-ouest de la Nouvelle-Galles du Sud. Des collections de tribus et de groupes familiaux étendus à travers différentes régions géographiques d'Australie portent divers noms, tels que les Yugarabul, les peuples Jagera de Coorparoo, les Kwiambal du nord de la Nouvelle-Galles du Sud et les Koori dans certaines parties de la Nouvelle-Galles du Sud et du Victoria. Le terme Murri est leur appellation préférée, exprimant la fierté de leur héritage et de leur origine.

TEXT.English: Mursili II (also spelled Mursilis II) was a king of the Hittite Empire (New kingdom) ca. 1321 1295 BC. He was the younger son of Suppiluliuma I, one of the most powerful rulers. This prince assumed the throne after the premature death of Arnuwanda II who, like their father, fell victim to the plague which ravaged the Hatti in the 1320s BC. He was greeted with contempt by Hatti's enemies and faced numerous rebellions early in his reign, the most serious of which were those initiated by the Kaskas in the mountains of Anatolia, but also by the Arzawa kingdom in southwest Turkey because he was perceived to be an inexperienced ruler who only became king due to the early death of Arnuwanda II. While Mursili II was a young and inexperienced king, he was almost certainly not a child when he took the Hittite throne and must have reached an age to be capable of ruling in his own right. Had he been a child, other arrangements would have been made to secure the stability of the Empire; Mursili after all had two surviving elder brothers who served as the viceroys of Carchemish (ie: Sarri-Kush) and Aleppo respectively. Mursili II would prove to be more than a match for his successful father, Suppiluliuma I, in his military deeds and diplomacy. The Annals for the first ten years of his reign have survived and record that he carried out punitive campaigns against the Kaska tribes in the first two years of his reign in order to secure his kingdom's northern borders. The king then turned to the West to resist the aggression of Uhhaziti, king of Arzawa who was attempting to lure away Hittite allies into his camp. The Annals also reveal that an "omen of the sun," or solar eclipse, occurred in his tenth year as king, just as he was about to launch his campaign against the Kaska peoples. While Mursili II's highest confirmed date was his twenty-second year, he is believed to have lived beyond this date for a few more years and died after a reign of around 25 to 27 years. He was succeeded by Muwatalli.
TEXT.Polish: Mursilis II (ur. 1321 p.n.e. - zm. 1295 p.n.e.), w³adca hetycki, syn Suppiluliumy I. Panowa³ w latach oko³o 1345 - 1315 p.n.e. Odziedziczy³ tron po przedwczesnej œmierci swojego starszego brata - Arnuwandy II, który podobnie jak ich ojciec pad³ ofiar¹ plagi (która spustoszy³a kraj Hetytów w latach dwudziestych XIV w. p.n.e.). By³ s³awnym w³adc¹ - uciszy³ bunty ksi¹¿¹t syryjskich oraz umocni³ granice pañstwa Hetytów od strony kraju Arzawa i ludu Kaska. Po jego œmierci tron odziedziczy³ jego starszy syn Muwatalli II, który walczy³ z faraonem Ramzesem II pod Kadesz. Jego m³odszy syn - Hattusili III równie¿ zosta³ królem Hetytów.

TEXT.English: One of the most important developments in the history of warfare was the invention of firearms. Originally developed in the 14th century, firearms evolved quickly, and by the late 17th century flintlock muskets had become commonplace in battle. Musketmen, who were relatively inexpensive to equip and train, proved a deadly foe for the knights who had dominated the battlefield for so many years. Armies were often comprised of a combination of musketmen, cannon, and knights, each complementing the strengths and weaknesses of the others. Large forces of musketmen within a fortress or behind city walls proved an exceedingly difficult obstacle to an attacking army. Muskets were the primary firearms in use until they were replaced by repeating rifles in the mid-19th century.
TEXT.French: L'invention des armes à feu fut l'une des évolutions les plus importantes de l'histoire de la guerre. Créées au XIVe siècle, celles-ci évoluèrent rapidement, et à la fin du XVIIe siècle, l'utilisation de mousquets à silex sur les champs de bataille s'était généralisée. Les arquebusiers coûtaient peu à former et à équiper, et étaient redoutablement efficaces face aux chevaliers, qui avaient pourtant dominé les champs de bataille pendant des siècles. Les armées étaient souvent composées d'arquebusiers, de canons et de chevaliers, et chacun de ces éléments compensait les faiblesses des autres. De plus, une forteresse ou une ville fortifiée défendue par un grand nombre d'arquebusiers devenait pratiquement inexpugnable. Les mousquets furent les principales armes à feu jusqu'à leur remplacement par les fusils à répétition, au milieu du XIXe siècle.
TEXT.German: Eine der historisch wichtigsten kriegstechnischen Erfindungen waren Feuerwaffen. Die im 14. Jahrhundert begonnene Entwiclung schritt rasch voran, und im späten 17. Jahrhundert war der Einsatz von Steinschlossmusketen im Gefecht alltäglich geworden. Die Ausbildung und Ausrüstung der Musketiere war vergleichsweise kostengünstig und sie erwiesen sich für die Ritter, die so viele Jahre lang das Kampfgeschehen dominiert hatten, als tögliche Gegner. Häufig wurden Musketiere, Kanonen und Ritter, deren Stärken und Schwächen sich gut ergänzten, in einem Truppenverband zusammengeschlossen. Größere Musketiertruppen in einer Festung oder hinter Stadtmauern Posten stellten für angreifende Streitmächte ein nahezu unüberwindbares Hindernis dar. Lange Zeit waren Musketen die vorherrschenden Schusswaffen auf dem Schlachtfeld, bis sie Mitte des 19. Jahrhunderts von den Repetiergewehren abgelöst wurden.
TEXT.Italian: Uno dei più importanti sviluppi nella storia bellica fu l'invenzione delle armi da fuoco. Originariamente sviluppate nel quattordicesimo secolo, le armi da fuoco progredirono rapidamente e verso la fine del diciassettesimo secolo i moschetti con otturatore a selce erano ormai comuni sul campo di battaglia. I moschettieri, che erano relativamente economici da equipaggiare e da addestrare, si rivelarono un nemico micidiale per i cavalieri, che avevano dominato il campo di battaglia per così tanti anni. Gli eserciti comprendevano spesso una parte di moschettieri, cannoni e cavalieri, ciascuno dei quali compensava i punti di forza e di debolezza degli altri. Le ampie formazioni di moschettieri all'interno di una fortezza o dietro le mura della città si rivelarono un ostacolo estremamente ostico per un esercito all'assalto. I moschetti erano la principale arma da fuoco in uso, fino a quando non furono sostituiti dai fucili a ripetizione, alla metà del diciannovesimo secolo.
TEXT.Spanish: La invención de las armas de fuego fue uno de los descubrimientos más importantes en la historia de la guerra. Desarrolladas originalmente en el siglo XIV, las armas de fuego evolucionaron con rapidez, y a finales del siglo XVII, los mosquetes de chispa eran habituales en la batalla. Los soldados con mosquete, que eran relativamente baratos de equipar y entrenar, resultaron ser un enemigo mortal para los caballeros, que habían dominado el campo de batalla durante tantos años. Los ejércitos estaban a menudo compuestos por una combinación de mosqueteros, cañones y caballeros, cada uno complementando los puntos fuertes y débiles de los otros. Las fortalezas y las murallas, defendidas por grandes contingentes de soldados con mosquete, eran un tremendo obstáculo para los ejércitos atacantes. Los mosquetes fueron las armas principales de fuego hasta que fueron sustituidos por los rifles de repetición a mediados del siglo XIX.

TEXT.English: The Kingdom of Lunda (c. 1665-1887), was a pre-colonial African confederation of states in what is now the Democratic Republic of Congo, north-eastern Angola and northwestern Zambia. Its central state was in Katanga. Initially the core of what would become the Lunda kingdom was a simple village called a gaand in the KiLunda language. It was ruled over by a king called the Mwaanta Gaand or Mwaantaangaand. One of these rulers, Ilunga Tshibinda, came from the kingdom of Luba where his brother ruled and married a princess from an area to the south. Their son became the first paramount ruler of the Luunda creating the title of Mwanta Yaav (1665).

Myrrh is the aromatic resin of a number of small, thorny tree species of the genus Commiphora, which is an essential oil termed an oleoresin. Myrrh resin is a natural gum. It has been used throughout history as a perfume, incense and medicine. Myrrh mixed with wine can also be ingested. When a tree wound penetrates through the bark and into the sapwood, the tree bleeds a resin. Myrrh gum, like frankincense, is such a resin. When people harvest myrrh, they wound the trees repeatedly to bleed them of the gum. Myrrh gum is waxy and coagulates quickly. After the harvest, the gum becomes hard and glossy. The gum is yellowish and may be either clear or opaque. It darkens deeply as it ages, and white streaks emerge.

Nabopolassar (c.658 - 605 BC) was the first king of the Neo-Babylonian Empire. He ruled over Babylon for 20 years (625 - 605 BC). He rose in revolt against the Assyrian Empire (which had ruled Babylon for the previous 200 years) in 627 BC, after the last significant Assyrian king, Ashurbanipal, died in 626 BC. In 625 BC, the Assyrian Empire's grasp on Babylon was now almost nonexistent, so he became its first king that year. Assyria, weakened by internal strife and ineffectual rule following the death of Ashurbanipal, were unable to resist the alliance of Babylonians, Medes and Scythians, who combined to sack the Assyrian capital of Nineveh in 612 BC, at the Battle of Nineveh after a prolonged siege. Nabopolassar was left in control of Nineveh and destroyed the remnants of the Assyrian Empire in 605 BC. At the same time, Nabopolassar waged war against Egypt from 610 BC until his death. In 608 BC, Nabopolassar took the Assyrian city of Harran, where Assyrian forces had retreated after the fall of Nineveh. Later that year, his son Nebuchadnezzar succeeded him to the throne of Babylonia and won the Battle of Carchemish, fought against Pharaoh Necho of Egypt, shortly before Nabopolassar died. For the last five years of his very productive life, Nebopolassar was leading the Babylonian army in a successful war against Egypt. Once victory was claimed, Nebopolassar, now in his fifties, gave up the throne in favor of his son, Nebuchadnezzar II. Within months of his abdication in 605 BC, Nebopolassar died of natural causes. He was about 53 years old.
TEXT.Polish: Nabopolassar (? - ok. 605 p.n.e.); od ok. 625 p.n.e. król imperium nowobabiloñskiego i za³o¿yciel XI (chaldejskiej) dynastii babiloñskiej. Ojciec Nabuchodonozora II. Pochodzi³ prawdopodobnie z plemienia Bit-Jakini.Inskrypcje z okresu jego panowania podaj¹, ¿e by³ w³adc¹ Kraju Nadmorskiego pod panowaniem Asyrii. W zachowanych tekstach sam nazywa siebie cz³owiekiem ludu, niczyim synem. Nabopolassar by³ mo¿nym Chaldejczykiem, który po œmierci Aszurbanipala przej¹³ w 626 p.n.e. w³adzê w Babilonie i uniezale¿ni³ siê od s³abn¹cej Asyrii. Przez ponad 10 lat Asyryjczycy i Babiloñczycy walczyli ze sob¹ ze zmiennym szczêœciem. Pocz¹tkowo w walce z Asyri¹ odniós³ kilka zwyciêstw, m.in. pod Arraph¹ czy Gablini oraz klêsk jak samodzielny atak na Aszur. Po zdobyciu przez Medów dowodzonych przez króla Kyaksaresa miasta Aszur w 614 p.n.e. postanowi³ zawrzeæ sojusz z tym irañskim plemieniem w celu dokonania podzia³u upadaj¹cej Asyrii. W sojuszu z Medami po³o¿y³ kres istnieniu imperium asyryjskiego, wspólnie oblegaj¹c i burz¹c w 612 p.n.e. stolice wroga - Niniwê i Kalchu (Nimrud). W latach 610 p.n.e.-607 p.n.e. prowadzi³ z Egiptem zwyciêsk¹ wojnê. W roku 607 p.n.e. przekaza³ dowództwo armii swojemu synowi i nastêpcy Nabuchodonozorowi II, który w 605 p.n.e. rozbi³ armie faraona Necho II.

TEXT.English: In Mesoamerican folk religion, a Nagual or Nahual (both pronounced [na'wal]) is a human being who has the power to transform either spiritually or physically into an animal form: most commonly jaguar and puma but also other animals such as a donkeys, birds, or dogs and coyotes.
TEXT.French: Dans la religion populaire mésoaméricaine, un Nagual ou Nahual (prononcé [na'wal]) est un être humain ayant le pouvoir de se transformer spirituellement ou physiquement en forme animale : le plus souvent en jaguar ou puma mais aussi en d'autres animaux comme des ânes, oiseaux, chiens et coyotes.

TEXT.English: Nakharar (Armenian: "holder of the primacy") was a hereditary title of the highest order given to houses of the ancient and medieval Armenian nobility. Medieval Armenia was divided into large estates, which were the property of an enlarged noble family and were ruled by a member of it, to whom the title of nahapet "chief of the family" or tanuter "master of the house" was given. Other members of a nakharar family in their turn ruled over smaller portions of the family estate. Nakharars with greater authority were recognized as ishkhans (princes).

At the time of the arrival of the Europeans Querandi stood out as great runners hunting, or rather, they captured by running down, Pampan deer, ñandúes, and even guanacos, although to facilitate their activity they had invented two devices (one that would become a classic in Argentina): the bolas, and the more primitive one consisting of a stone tied to a cord made with leather or sinews called by the Spaniards a stone-lost boleadora. They would also hunt tinamous, deer, quail[verification needed] and ñandúes with the help of their bows and arrows and their bolas. They also made pottery.

Nanotechnology ("nanotech") is the manipulation of matter on an atomic, molecular, and supramolecular scale. The earliest, widespread description of nanotechnology referred to the particular technological goal of precisely manipulating atoms and molecules for fabrication of macroscale products, also now referred to as molecular nanotechnology. A more generalized description of nanotechnology was subsequently established by the National Nanotechnology Initiative, which defines nanotechnology as the manipulation of matter with at least one dimension sized from 1 to 100 nanometers. This definition reflects the fact that quantum mechanical effects are important at this quantum-realm scale, and so the definition shifted from a particular technological goal to a research category inclusive of all types of research and technologies that deal with the special properties of matter that occur below the given size threshold
TEXT.Polish: W teorii s¹ to mechanizmy bardzo ma³e (kilka nanometrów) s³u¿¹ce do celów medycznych, tudzie¿ bojowych. Mog¹ dzia³aæ jak Chmura Naprawcza (reperowaæ struktury budynków i pojazdów). Specjaliœci od Nanotechnologii czêsto krytykuj¹ pomys³y pisarzy gatunków Cyberpunk czy Wojennej Fantastyki ¿e Nanoboty ( popularna nazwa Nanomaszyn) mog¹ byæ u¿ywane do celów przestêpczych lub wojny, choæ inni specjaliœci twierdz¹ ¿e: "Armia i Ulica znajd¹ zastosowanie do wszystkiego". Obecnie najbardziej prawdopodobne jest zastosowanie In¿ynierów z ksi¹¿ek naukowych Dexlera. s¹ to Nanomaszyny stworzone z Bia³ek, min kultur E-coli.
TEXT.Russian: Нанотехнология («нанотех») - это манипулирование веществом в атомном, молекулярном и супрамолекулярном масштабе. Самое раннее, широко распространенное описание нанотехнологий относится к конкретной технологической цели точного манипулирования атомами и молекулами для изготовления макромасштабных продуктов, также называемой сейчас молекулярной нанотехнологией. Более обобщенное описание нанотехнологий было впоследствии установлено Национальной инициативой по нанотехнологиям, которая определяет нанотехнологию как манипулирование веществом, имеющим по меньшей мере один размер размером от 1 до 100 нанометров. Это определение отражает тот факт, что квантово-механические эффекты важны в этом масштабе квантовой области, и поэтому определение перешло от конкретной технологической цели к категории исследований, включающей все виды исследований и технологий, которые имеют дело с особыми свойствами материи, которые происходят ниже заданного порога размера.

TEXT.English: The time has finally arrived where the formless begins to trump form. Where the meek shall inherit the Earth. The miniature minds of many add into a massive mind of one. This particular Nanite Cloud is tasked to find and repair all manner of biological and technological systems, repairing flesh and silicon at mind numbing speeds by recombinating at the molecular level. The cloud simply extends to coat the injured and 'flesh' out whatever happens to be missing or disfunctional. Humans live in terror of that which they have created has now created. But at least this particular swarm is entirely benevolent. Not all such microscopic forces will prove to be so kind.
TEXT.Polish: W teorii s¹ to mechanizmy bardzo ma³e (kilka nanometrów) s³u¿¹ce do celów medycznych, tudzie¿ bojowych. Mog¹ dzia³aæ jak Chmura Naprawcza (reperowaæ struktury budynków i pojazdów). Specjaliœci od Nanotechnologii czêsto krytykuj¹ pomys³y pisarzy gatunków Cyberpunk czy Wojennej Fantastyki ¿e Nanoboty ( popularna nazwa Nanomaszyn) mog¹ byæ u¿ywane do celów przestêpczych lub wojny, choæ inni specjaliœci twierdz¹ ¿e: "Armia i Ulica znajd¹ zastosowanie do wszystkiego". Obecnie najbardziej prawdopodobne jest zastosowanie In¿ynierów z ksi¹¿ek naukowych Dexlera. s¹ to Nanomaszyny stworzone z Bia³ek, min kultur E-coli.
TEXT.Russian: Наконец пришло время, когда бесформенное начинает диктовать условия форме, когда малые унаследуют Землю, а миниатюрные умы многих превосходят единый сверхразум. Этому конкретному Облаку Нанитов поручено находить и восстанавливать всевозможные биологические и технологические системы, восстанавливая плоть и кремний с невероятной скоростью, рекомбинируя на молекулярном уровне. Облако просто простирается, чтобы покрыть раненых и «измазать» все, что случается отсутствующим или неработающим. Люди живут в ужасе от того, что они создали. Но, по крайней мере, этот особый рой совершенно доброжелателен. Далеко не все подобные микроскопические силы окажутся такими благими.

TEXT.English: Naram-Sin, reigned ca. 2254-2218 BCE, middle chronology, was the third successor and grandson of King Sargon of Akkad. Under Naram-Sin the Akkadian Empire reached its zenith. He was the first Mesopotamian king known to have claimed divinity for himself, and one of the first to be called "King of the Four Quarters".
TEXT.French: Naram-Sin, qui régna vers 2254-2218 av. J.-C. selon la chronologie moyenne, fut le troisième successeur et petit-fils du roi Sargon d'Akkad. Sous Naram-Sin, l'Empire akkadien atteignit son apogée. Il fut le premier roi mésopotamien connu à avoir revendiqué la divinité pour lui-même, et l'un des premiers à être appelé « Roi des Quatre Quartiers ».

TEXT.English: [H1]Narbona[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Navajo Chieftain[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] c. 1766 - August 31, 1849[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Narbona was one of the wealthiest Navajo of his time due to the amount of sheep and horses his outfit, or extended family group, owned. He was not a "chief" of all of the Navajo, the independent minded Navajo having no central authority, but he was very influential due to his status in the tribe, gained from both his wealth, high personal reputation and age at the time he negotiated with the Americans.[PARAGRAPH:1]Narbona had become one of the most prominent leaders in the aftermath of the massacre of 24 Navajo leaders in March 1822 at Jemez Pueblo who had been travelling under flag of truce to a peace conference with the new Mexican government. In February 1829 he lead the Navajo in battle against a Mexican expedition into the Chuska Mountains led by Captain Blas de Hinojos and defeated it utterly. The site of the battle, Copper Pass (Beesh Lichii'I Bigiizh), is now known as Narbona Pass.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1849, Narbona had ridden with several hundred of his warriors to meet with a delegation led by Col. John M. Washington to discuss terms for peace between the Navajo and the "New Men", Americans who had driven the Mexicans from what is now the Southwestern United States. The US party was composed of both US Regulars and local New Mexican auxiliaries.[PARAGRAPH:1]After several misunderstandings, translators managed to work out an acceptable list of terms for peace between the two parties. As the peace council broke up, Sadoval, a young Navajo warrior of some distinction, began riding his horse to and fro, exhorting the 200-300 Navajo warriors in attendance to break the new treaty immediately, starting with the massacre of Col. Washington's command. At this point, a New Mexican officer claimed that he noticed a horse that belonged to him being ridden by one of the Navajo warriors. Navajos were great raiders of livestock, so it is entirely possible that this horse did indeed belong to the Americans. Washington, put in the position of backing one of his troopers, demanded that the horse be immediately turned over. The Navajo refused, and the horse and its rider departed.[PARAGRAPH:1]Washington commanded his troops to unlimber their cannon and prepare to fire if the Navajo refused to return the, now absent, property the Americans were claiming was stolen. The Navajo again denied his request, and the cannon as well as some rifles were fired.[PARAGRAPH:1]Narbona was mortally wounded in the fusillade. As a final indignity, according to eyewitnesses, he was also scalped by one of the New Mexico militiamen. He was buried by his sons in the traditional Navajo fashion, bound in a "death knotted" blanket and cast into a crevice. Two of his finest horses were slaughtered to ensure he would not walk to the afterlife.
TEXT.Polish: Narbona - wódz indian Navajo z prze³omu XVIII i XIX wieku.

TEXT.English: The narwhal, or narwhale (Monodon monoceros), is a medium-sized toothed whale and possesses a large "tusk" from a protruding canine tooth. It lives year-round in the Arctic waters around Greenland, Canada, and Russia. It is one of two living species of whale in the Monodontidae family, along with the beluga whale. The narwhal males are distinguished by a long, straight, helical tusk, which is an elongated upper left canine. The narwhal was one of many species described by Carolus Linnaeus in his publication Systema Naturae in 1758.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Narwal[COLOR_REVERT] (Monodon monoceros) ist ein Zahnwal und bildet zusammen mit dem Weißwal die Familie der Gründelwale. Er bewohnt den Arktischen Ozean von Grönland bis zur Küste Sibiriens.[NEWLINE]Die Grundfarbe des Narwals ist Hellbraun bis Weiß, wogegen Kopf, Nacken und Rücken fast schwarz sind. Das Gewicht eines Männchens beträgt eineinhalb Tonnen, Weibchen sind etwas leichter. Ein erwachsener Narwal misst vier bis fünf Meter, dazu kommt vorwiegend bei Männchen ein maximal drei Meter langer Stoßzahn. Dabei handelt es sich meist um einen Eckzahn, der durch die Oberlippe bricht. Normalerweise bildet sich noch ein zweiter Zahn, der aber nicht durchbricht. Über die Funktion des Stoßzahns wurde lange spekuliert. Da er 10 Millionen Nervenenden enthält, dient er vermutlich zum Messen von Wassertemperatur und -druck bzw. auch des Salzgehalts des Wassers. Da Narwale Warmblüter sind, besitzen sie eine dicke Speckschicht unter der Haut, die sie vor Kälte schützt. Die Kommunikation und die Sinneswahrnehmung erfolgen über Schallwellen, die von Menschen als "Gesänge" wahrgenommen werden. Die Ernährung besteht aus Fischen, Tintenfischen und Krebstieren, die regelrecht eingesaugt werden. Da sie stets in der Nähe des Packeises leben, nutzen sie ihre Stirn, um die Eisdecke zu durchbrechen. Die größten Fressfeinde sind die Großen Schwertwale. Bei Gefahr verfallen Narwale deshalb in eine Regungslosigkeit und lassen sich lautlos im Wasser absinken. Umweltbelastungen in Form von Schwermetallen oder Pestiziden stellen eine weitere Bedrohung dar, da sich die Stoffe in Organen und im Fettgewebe anreichern.[NEWLINE]Die Inuit jagen den Narwal bis heute zu Nahrungszwecken und wegen des Stoßzahnes. Die Jagd ist jedoch streng reglementiert. Im Mittelalter hielt man den Zahn für das Horn des Einhorns. Er ist seit dem 13. Jahrundert als Reliquie im Besitz sakraler Institutionen Europas nachweisbar.

TEXT.English: The Dog Soldiers were the elite of the Cheyenne warriors and some of the most feared fighters in the American West. Members of a prestigious fraternal society, the Dog Soldiers each received a "Dog Sash" upon entrance into the group. While at first merely emblems of membership, the "Dog Sash" soon became a symbol of iron will in combat. This reputation stemmed from the Dog Soldier habit of, during particularly brutal combat, staking themselves to the ground by way of their "Dog Sash" and not moving from the spot until victory or death had overtaken them.
TEXT.French: Les soldats chiens étaient l'élite des guerriers cheyennes et comptaient parmi les guerriers les plus redoutés de l'Ouest américain. Membres d'une prestigieuse confrérie, ces soldats cheyennes recevaient chacun un long pagne appelé "ceinture du chien" en entrant dans ce groupe. Au départ, il ne s'agissait que d'un emblème communautaire, mais la "ceinture du chien" devint rapidement synonyme d'ardeur guerrière. En effet, lorsque les soldats chiens livraient une bataille difficile, ils se "clouaient" au sol grâce à leur pagne et des flèches, et ne bougeaient plus jusqu'à la victoire ou la mort.
TEXT.German: Dog Soldiers waren die Elitekrieger der Cheyenne und gehörten zu den gefürchtetsten Kämpfern im amerikanischen Westen. Bei seiner Aufnahme in die Bruderschaft erhielt jeder Dog Soldier eine Schärpe aus Büffelleder, den so genannten "Dog Sash". Während er anfangs lediglich ein Mitgliedszeichen war, wurde der Dog Sash bald zum Zeichen eisernen Kampfeswillens. Dieser Ruf rührte vom Brauch der Dog Soldiers, ihre Schärpe bei besonders aussichtslosen Kämpfen mit einem Holzpflock am Boden festzunageln und sich nicht von der Stelle zu rühren, bis sie entweder siegreich oder tot waren.
TEXT.Italian: I Soldati cane erano l'élite dei guerrieri Cheyenne e fra i più temuti combattenti del West. Membri di una prestigiosa società, i Soldati cane ricevevano una fascia, quando entravano a far parte del gruppo. Mentre all'inizio si trattava solo di un simbolo di appartenenza, più tardi diventò quello di una volontà incrollabile in combattimento. Questa reputazione originava dall'abitudine dei Soldati cane, durante combattimenti particolarmente brutali, di fissare a terra un piolo per poi legarvisi con la fascia: in tal modo non si sarebbero mossi da quel punto fino alla vittoria o alla morte.
TEXT.Spanish: Los guerreros indios conocidos como "soldados perros", flor y nata de los cheyennes, se encontraban entre los más temidos luchadores del oeste americano. Miembros de una prestigiosa sociedad fraternal, recibían una "faja de perro" al ingresar en el grupo. Aunque al principio solo era un emblema que marcaba la pertenencia al grupo, estas "fajas de perro" no tardaron en convertirse en un símbolo de voluntad de hierro. Esta fama derivaba de la práctica de los soldados perros de atarse al suelo con sus fajas y no moverse del sitio hasta conseguir la victoria o caer en el intento.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Navajo Riflemen[COLOR_REVERT] are Navajo culture unit. With hidden nationality and "stealth" they are excellent strike units. They got bonus when fighting with mounted units and in desert terrain.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Les tireurs d'élite Navajo[COLOR_REVERT] sont une unité de la culture Navajo. Avec leur nationalité cachée et leur capacité de "furtivité"
TEXT.Polish: Nawahowie, Nawaho - najwiêksze plemiê indiañskie Ameryki Pó³nocnej licz¹ce blisko 300 tys. osób (2000 r.). Wiêkszoœæ z nich (oko³o 173 tys.) zamieszkuje rezerwat po³o¿ony na terenie stanów Arizona, Nowy Meksyk oraz Utah. Rezerwat (ang. The Navajo Indian Reservation) ma powierzchniê ponad 70 tys. km2, czyli równ¹ powierzchni np. Czech. Dine Bikeyah, a wiêc Kraj Nawahów jest wiêkszy ni¿ 10 z 50 stanów USA. Siedziba w³adz Kraju Nawaho znajduje siê w Window Rock.

TEXT.English: Sican iconography is dominated by the Sican Deity It decorates all artistic media of the Sican, including ceramics, metal works, and textiles. The icon is most commonly represented with a mask face and upturned eyes. Sometimes it may be shown with avian features, such as beaks, wings, and talons, which are evident in Early Sican ceramics. These avian features are related to Naylamp, the key figure in Sican mythology.
TEXT.French: L'iconographie Sican est dominée par la divinité Sican. Elle décore tous les supports artistiques des Sican, y compris la céramique, les ouvrages métalliques et les textiles. L'icône est le plus souvent représentée avec un visage masqué et des yeux tournés vers le haut. Parfois, elle peut présenter des traits aviaires, comme des becs, des ailes et des serres, visibles dans la céramique Sican ancienne. Ces traits aviaires sont liés à Naylamp, figure centrale de la mythologie Sican.

TEXT.English: The context of the head taking, though, is still being widely worked out. There is some contention about whether the trophy heads were taken during territorial warfare, were taken in staged ritualistic battles. The biggest problem that occurs with the idea of territorial conquest and warfare, at least in an early Nasca state, is that there is little to no archaeological evidence of any kind to support it, and so was most likely not the context in which the actual early Nasca trophy heads were found. Archaeological evidence does, however, shows an interesting increase in head hunting, between early and late Nasca times, right around when Cahuachi was finally abandoned, and when a more militaristic lifestyle became prevalent in late Nasca art. This can be taken to mean that while early Nasca times revolved around a religious center, they were stable and able to create Cahuchi, and therefore there was less violent conquest and territorial warfare than at other times.

Ndlela kaSompisi (died Feb 1840) was a key general to Zulu Kings Shaka and Dingane, and also served as Dingane's induna - his chief advisor. Senzangakona, Shaka and Dingane's father, was married to Bibi, a sister of Ndlela. Mpande was married to Ndlela's daughter Msukilethe. He was general of Dingane's forces at the Battle of Blood River, a significant defeat for the Zulus as the spears and large numbers of Zulus were unable to breach the Boer lager of Andries Pretorius defended with muskets. Neither Shaka nor Dingane had children. Mindful of the lineage of the Zulu kings, Ndlela repeatedly defied Dingane's request that he assassinate Mpande, half-brother of Shaka and Dingane as he was a threat to Dingane's power. He argued that it would diminish his greatness and that, in any case, Mpande did not aspire to the throne. The Battle of Maqongqe where the forces of Mpande and Dingane clashed in 1840 culminated in Dingane calling Ndlele a traitor. Dingane ordered his death through slow strangling with a cow hide throng, but by Ndlela's inaction he had preserved the blood line of the Zulu monarchy, as Mpande succeeded Dingane and Mpande's son Cetshwayo in turn succeeded him. All subsequent Zulu monarchs are descended from Mpande. Regardless, Ndlela is considered by Zulus to be one of their great leaders who tried his best to keep the state together.
TEXT.Polish: Ndlela kaSompisi (zm. luty 1840) by³ g³ównym genera³em na s³u¿bie królów Zulusów Czaki i Dingane, s³uzy³ równie¿ jako g³ówny doradca Dingany. Senzangakona, ojciec Czaki i Dingane by³ ¿onaty z Bibi, siostr¹ Ndleli. By³ g³ównodowodz¹cym si³ami zuluskim w bitwie pod Krwaw¹ Rzek¹, która przynios³a zwyciêstwo Burom i œmieræ trzech tysiêcy zuluskich wojowników.

TEXT.English: The Neanderthal (short for Neanderthal Man, also spelled Neandertal) is an extinct member of the Homo genus that is known from Pleistocene specimens found in Europe and parts of western and central Asia. Neanderthals are either classified as a subspecies (or race) of humans (Homo sapiens neanderthalensis) or as a separate species (Homo neanderthalensis).
TEXT.French: Le Néandertalien (abrégé en Homme de Néandertal, aussi orthographié Neandertal) est un membre éteint du genre Homo connu par des spécimens du Pléistocène trouvés en Europe et dans certaines parties de l'Asie de l'Ouest et centrale. Les Néandertaliens sont classés soit comme une sous-espèce (ou race) des humains (Homo sapiens neanderthalensis) soit comme une espèce distincte (Homo neanderthalensis).
TEXT.Polish: Cz³owiek neandertalski, neandertalczyk wymar³y przedstawiciel rodzaju Homo (cz³owiek), znany z plejstocenu (ok. 400 000 do ok. 24 500 lat temu), w zale¿noœci od autorów klasyfikowany jako podgatunek cz³owieka rozumnego Homo sapiens neanderthalensis lub odrêbny od niego gatunek Homo neanderthalensis.
TEXT.Russian: Неандерталец (лат. Homo neanderthalensis или лат. Homo sapiens neanderthalensis) - вымерший или ассимилированный представитель рода людей, известный по плейстоценовым экземплярам, найденным в Европе и некоторых частях западной и центральной Азии. Неандертальцы классифицируются как подвид (или раса) людей (Homo sapiens neanderthalensis) или как отдельный вид (Homo neanderthalensis).

TEXT.English: The Neanderthal (short for Neanderthal Man, also spelled Neandertal) is an extinct member of the Homo genus that is known from Pleistocene specimens found in Europe and parts of western and central Asia. Neanderthals are either classified as a subspecies (or race) of humans (Homo sapiens neanderthalensis) or as a separate species (Homo neanderthalensis).

TEXT.English: Nebuchadnezzar was the most famous of the kings of Babylon, the second of that name, ruling from c.605 bc through to 562 bc. His father, Nabopolassar, ejected the Assyrians to restore Babylon's independence and to found the Neo-Babylonian kingdom. During his father's reign Nebuchadnezzar defeated the Egyptian Pharaoh Necho at Carchemish in 605 bc, thus giving him control over a wide area of western Asia. It was also the start of intensified conflict between Babylonia and Egypt that eventually led to the defeat of Nebuchadnezzar's army three years later. This defeat may have stimulated further trouble for Nebuchadnezzar in the form of a revolt in Judaea which was finally crushed in 597 bc when Zedekiah was installed as a puppet king. Further revolts over the following decade led Nebuchadnezzar to lay siege to Jerusalem, finally destroying it in 586 bc. Nebuchadnezzar was responsible for building a great palace and the hanging gardens in Babylon, one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
TEXT.Polish: Nabuchodonozor I czwarty król Babilonii z II dynastii z Isin, syn i nastêpca Ninurty-nadin-szumi; panowa³ przez 22 lata (1126-1105 p.n.e.). Jego zwyciêstwo w wojnie z Elamitami, którzy od pokoleñ byli jednym z najwiêkszych zagro¿eñ dla Babilonii, uczyni³o z niego jedn¹ z najwa¿niejszych postaci w historii Babilonii, o niemal legendarnym statusie podobnym do tego, jaki osi¹gn¹³ przed nim Sargon Wielki. TEXT.English: Nelson Mandela is a former President of South Africa, the first to be elected in a fully representative democratic election, who held office from 199499. Before his presidency, Mandela was an anti-apartheid activist, and the leader of the African National Congress's armed wing Umkhonto we Sizwe. The South African courts convicted him on charges of sabotage, as well as other crimes committed while he led the movement against apartheid. In accordance with his conviction, Mandela served 27 years in prison, spending many of these years on Robben Island. He is currently a celebrated elder statesman who continues to voice his opinion on topical issues. In South Africa he is often known as Madiba, an honorary title adopted by elders of Mandela's clan. The title has come to be synonymous with Nelson Mandela. Following his release from prison on 11 February 1990, Mandela supported reconciliation and negotiation, and helped lead the transition towards multi-racial democracy in South Africa. Since the end of apartheid, many have frequently praised Mandela, including former opponents. Mandela has received more than one hundred awards over four decades, most notably the Nobel Peace Prize in 1993.
TEXT.Polish: (ur. 18 lipca 1918 w Transkei)? po³udniowoafrykañski polityk, prezydent Republiki Po³udniowej Afryki w latach 1994 - 1999, jeden z przywódców ruchu przeciw apartheidowi, dzia³acz na rzecz praw cz³owieka, laureat pokojowej nagrody Nobla, Honorowy Obywatel Kanady (2001), Honorowy Obywatel Rzymu (1983). Spanish.Text: Navío de las Indias Orientales:Navíos de las Indias Orientales

TEXT.English: The term "East Indiaman" describes a vessel designed to transport goods between Europe, India, Indonesia and China during the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries. The East Indiaman was an armed merchantman; although primarily designed for the transport of goods and passengers, it was nevertheless outfitted with cannon in order to protect itself against pirates or to open up hostile ports of call. In fact, the East Indiamen were among the most heavily armed ships of their time, and were sometimes acquired by state navies for use as warships.[PARAGRAPH:1]Because the East Indiaman was designed to carry cannon, the East Indiaman was inevitably slower than its descendants: the Ship of the Line and the Frigate. Yet the strengths of the East Indiamen ensured that the European trade companies that employed them could protect their profitable monopolies on all trade between Europe, the Americas, Africa and India.
TEXT.French: L'East Indiaman est un vaisseau conçu pour transporter des marchandises entre l'Europe, l'Inde, l'Indonésie et la Chine au cours des dix-huitième et dix-neuvième siècles. L'East Indiaman est un bateau armé ; même s'il est avant tout conçu pour le transport de marchandises et de passagers, il est néanmoins équipé de canons, pour se protéger des pirates ou pour attaquer les ports d'escales hostiles. D'ailleurs, les East Indiaman figurent parmi les bateaux les plus puissamment armés de leur époque et les marines nationales les utilisent parfois comme bateaux de guerre.[PARAGRAPH:1]L'East Indiaman étant conçu pour transporter des canons, il est inévitablement plus lent que ses descendants, le galion de guerre et la frégate. Mais grâce à ces navires, les sociétés commerciales européennes ont longtemps pu jouir de la rentabilité générée par le commerce entre l'Europe, les Amériques, l'Afrique et l'Inde.
TEXT.German: Der Begriff "Ostindienfahrer" beschreibt ein Schiff, das entworfen wurde, um im 18. und 19. Jahrhundert Güter zwischen Europa, Indien, Indonesien und China zu transportieren. Der Ostindienfahrer war ein bewaffneter Kauffahrer; obwohl er primär für den Transport von Gütern und Passagieren entworfen wurde, war er dennoch mit Kanonen bestückt, um sich gegen Piraten zu verteidigen oder einen Weg in feindliche Häfen zu bahnen. Tatsächlich gehörten die Ostindienfahrer zu den am schwersten bewaffneten Schiffen ihrer Zeit und wurden manchmal von staatlichen Flotten als Kriegsschiffe gekauft.[PARAGRAPH:1]Da der Ostindienfahrer für die Bestückung mit Kanonen entworfen war, war er unausweichlich langsamer als seine Nachfolger, das Linienschiff und die Fregatte. Die Stärken des Ostindienfahrers sorgten jedoch dafür, dass europäische Handelsgesellschaften, die ihn verwendeten, ihr profitables Gesamtmonopol auf den Handel zwischen Europa, den amerikanischen Kontinenten, Afrika und Indien verteidigen konnten.
TEXT.Italian: Il nome "East Indiaman" indica un vascello progettato per trasportare beni tra Europa, India, Indonesia e Cina durante il diciottesimo e diciannovesimo secolo. L'East Indiaman era un mercantile armato; nonostante fosse progettato principalmente per il trasporto di merci e passeggeri, era dotato di cannoni per potersi proteggere dai pirati o per attaccare porti ostili. In verità l'East Indiaman era tra le navi più pesantemente armate del proprio tempo, e alle volte fu acquistata dalle marine nazionali per essere usata come nave da guerra.[PARAGRAPH:1]Essendo l'East Indiaman progettata per essere armata con cannoni, era inevitabilmente più lenta delle sue discendenti: la Nave da prima linea e la Fregata. Nonostante ciò, i pregi dell'East Indiaman fecero in modo che le compagnie commerciali europee che la utilizzavano potessero proteggere i propri lucrosi monopoli sul commercio tra Europa, America, Africa e India.
TEXT.Spanish: El término "navío de las Indias Orientales" describe un barco diseñado para transportar mercancías entre Europa, la India, Indonesia y China en los siglos XVIII y XIX. Se trataba de un mercante armado; aunque estaba diseñado principalmente como transporte de mercancías y pasajeros, contaba con cañones para protegerse de los piratas o entrar en los puertos hostiles. De hecho, estos navíos se contaban entre los barcos mejor armados de su época y, en muchas ocasiones, fueron adquiridos por otros países para emplearlos como barcos de guerra.[PARAGRAPH:1]Como estaba diseñado para llevar cañones, el Navío de las Indias Orientales era más lento que sus sucesores: el Buque de guerra y la Fragata. Sin embargo, sus ventajas garantizaron que las compañías que los empleaban pudieran proteger sus lucrativos monopolios sobre el comercio entre Europa, las Américas, África y la India.

TEXT.English: New Zealand soldiers served with distinction in the major conflicts in the 20th Century, including the Second Boer War, World War I, World War II, the Korean War, the Malayan Emergency, Borneo Confrontation and the Vietnam War. Since the 1970s, deployments have tended to be assistance to multilateral peacekeeping efforts. Considering the small size of the force, operational commitments have remained high since the start of the East Timor deployment in 1999. New Zealand personnel also served in the First Gulf War, Iraq and are currently serving in several UN and other peacekeeping missions. They have just been withdrawn from East Timor, RAMSI in the Solomons and Afghanistan.

In the past, the Dayak were feared for their ancient tradition of headhunting practices (the ritual is also known as Ngayau by the Dayaks). Often, a war leader had at least three lieutenants (called manuk sabong) who in turn had some followers. Among the most prominent legacy during the colonial rule in the Dutch Borneo (present-day Kalimantan) is the Tumbang Anoi Agreement held in 1874 in Damang Batu, Central Kalimantan (the seat of the Kahayan Dayaks). It is a formal meeting that gathered all the Dayak tribes in Kalimantan for a peace resolution. In the meeting that is reputed taken several months, the Dayak people throughout the Kalimantan agreed to end the headhunting tradition as it believed the tradition caused conflict and tension between various Dayak groups. The meeting ended with a peace resolution by the Dayak people.

The word Azande means the people who possess much land, and refers to their history as conquering warriors. Variant spellings include Adio (Makaraka), Zande, Zandeh, A-Zandeh and Sandeh. The name Niam-Niam (or Nyam-Nyam) was frequently used by foreigners to refer to the Azande in the 18th and early 19th century. This name is probably of Dinka origin, and means great eaters in that language (as well as being an onomatopoeia), supposedly referring to cannibalistic propensities. This name for the Azande was in use by other tribes in South Sudan, and later adopted by westerners. Today the name Niam-Niam is considered pejorative.

Lukeni lua Nimi (also Ntinu Nimi a Lukeni; circa 1380-1420) was the first king and founder of the Kingdom of Kongo. He was the offpsring of his father Nimi and the Mwene Mbata's daughter, according to traditions recorded by Giovanni Cavazzi da Montecuccolo in the mid 17th century. Although he probably ruled in the valley of the Kwilu River in modern day Democratic Republic of Congo, he is credited with conquering the region of modern day Mbanza Kongo, displacing a local ruler named Mwene Mpangala and building his capital there. He probably ruled in the late 14th century.
TEXT.Polish: Lukeni lua Nimi(1380-1420) by³ zalo¿ycielem i pierwszym królem Kongo. Wed³ug tradycji, spisanej przez Giovanniego Cavazzi da Montecuccolo w po³owie XVII wieku, by³ synem Nimi i córki Mwene Mbata. Mimo, ¿e prawdobodobnie w³ada³ w dolinie rzeki Kwilu - w dzisiejszych czasach na terenie DemoKratycznej Republiki Konga, uwa¿a siê, ¿e zdoby³ równie¿ okolice Mbanza Kongo, miasta po³o¿onego w dzisiejszym Zairze, usuwaj¹c lokalnego w³adcê Mwene Mpangala i wyznaczaj¹c tam swoj¹ stolicê.

TEXT.English: The XM1203 Non-Line-of-Sight Cannon (NLOS Cannon) was a mobile 155 mm cannon intended to provide improved responsiveness and lethality to the "unit of action" (UA) commander as part of the US Army's Future Combat Systems project. This self-propelled armored artillery piece provided networked, extended-range targeting, and precision attack of point and area targets in support of other combat units with a suite of munitions that include special purpose capabilities. The Non-Line-of-Sight Cannon provided sustained fire for close support and destructive fire for tactical standoff engagement. The NLOS Cannon used technology from the canceled XM2001 Crusader.
TEXT.Russian: Пушка XM1203 Non-Line-of-Sight Cannon (САУ NLOS) является самоходной 155-мм гаубицей, предназначенной для обеспечения повышенной точности и летальности «боевого расчета» (АЕ) в рамках проекта «Боевые Системы Будущего» армии США. Эта самоходная артиллерийская установка обеспечивала сетевое целеуказание с увеличенной дальностью и высокоточную атаку точечных и площадных целей в поддержку других боевых единиц с помощью набора боеприпасов, которые включают средства специального назначения. Пушка вне зоны видимости обеспечивала непрерывный огонь для непосредственной поддержки и разрушительный огонь для тактического противостояния. Для САУ NLOS использовалась технология устаревшей гаубицы XM2001 Crusader.

TEXT.English: Nobility is a state-privileged status which is generally hereditary, but which may also be personal only. Titles of nobility are usually associated with present or former monarchies. The term originally referred to those who were "known" or "notable" and was applied to the highest social class in pre-modern societies. In the feudal system (in Europe and elsewhere), the nobility were generally those who held a fief, often land or office, under vassalage, i.e., in exchange for allegiance and various, mainly military, services to the Monarch and at lower levels to another nobleman. It rapidly came to be seen as a hereditary caste, sometimes associated with a right to bear a hereditary title and, for example in pre-revolutionary France, enjoying fiscal and other privileges. While noble status formerly conferred significant privileges, today, in most Western countries, noble status is a purely honorary dignity. In the United Kingdom, where some peerage titles, until recently, guaranteed a seat in the Upper House of the Parliament, there are still some residual privileges. Nobility is a historical, social and often legal notion, distinct from socio-economic status which is mainly based on income and possessions. Being wealthy or influential does not automatically make one a noble, nor are all nobles wealthy and influential (aristocratic families have lost their fortunes in various ways, and the concept of the 'poor nobleman' is almost as old as nobility itself). Countries without a feudal tradition do not have a nobility as such.
TEXT.Polish: Nobility is a state-privileged status which is generally hereditary, but which may also be personal only. Titles of nobility are usually associated with present or former monarchies. The term originally referred to those who were "known" or "notable" and was applied to the highest social class in pre-modern societies. In the feudal system (in Europe and elsewhere), the nobility were generally those who held a fief, often land or office, under vassalage, i.e., in exchange for allegiance and various, mainly military, services to the Monarch and at lower levels to another nobleman. It rapidly came to be seen as a hereditary caste, sometimes associated with a right to bear a hereditary title and, for example in pre-revolutionary France, enjoying fiscal and other privileges. While noble status formerly conferred significant privileges, today, in most Western countries, noble status is a purely honorary dignity. In the United Kingdom, where some peerage titles, until recently, guaranteed a seat in the Upper House of the Parliament, there are still some residual privileges. Nobility is a historical, social and often legal notion, distinct from socio-economic status which is mainly based on income and possessions. Being wealthy or influential does not automatically make one a noble, nor are all nobles wealthy and influential (aristocratic families have lost their fortunes in various ways, and the concept of the 'poor nobleman' is almost as old as nobility itself). Countries without a feudal tradition do not have a nobility as such.

TEXT.English: Their function is still unknown, but scientific field work has started in 2005 to systematically investigate the archaeological sites and to understand the sculptures within their archaeological context. For the most part, the terracotta is preserved in the form of scattered fragments. That is why Nok art is well known today only for the heads, both male and female, whose hairstyles are particularly detailed and refined. The statues are in fragments because the discoveries are usually made from alluvial mud, in terrain made by the erosion of water. The terracotta statues found there are hidden, rolled, polished, and broken. Rarely are works of great size conserved intact making them highly valued on the international art market.

The Nootka lived in northwestern North America. Their common name is probable misinterpretation on the part of Captain Cook, who promoted the word meaning "come around" as the name for the Nootka people. The Nootka wore clothing of cedar bark that shed the rains of their Pacific Northwest home and also furs for the winter cold. They hunted whales and other sea creatures with two-headed harpoons that were designed to drive home even if one head was deflected or broken. In war they wielded heavy clubs and maces, some decorated with the striking surface protruding like a thick stone tongue from the mouth of a frightfully stylized man.
TEXT.Spanish: El Guerrero con garrote nutka.

TEXT.English: Norberto Romualdez y López (June 6, 1875 - November 4, 1941) (often referred to as Norberto Romualdez, Sr. to distinguish him from his son with the same name) was a Philippine writer, politician, jurist, and statesman. He was the first Lopez-Romualdez to attain national prominence, and is deemed the "Father of the Law on the National Language". He was the eldest son of Doña Trinidad Lopez-Romualdez, the Romualdez grand matriarch, and uncle of Imelda Romualdez Marcos, the daughter of his youngest brother Vicente Orestes Lopez Romualdez.

The legendary religious zeal of the Normans was exercised in religious wars long before the First Crusade carved out a Norman principality in Antioch. They were major foreign participants in the Reconquista in Iberia. In 1018, Roger de Tosny travelled to the Iberian Peninsula to carve out a state for himself from Moorish lands, but failed. In 1064, during the War of Barbastro, William of Montreuil led the papal army and took a huge booty.
TEXT.French: Le zèle religieux légendaire des Normands s'est manifesté lors des guerres religieuses bien avant que la Première Croisade ne crée une principauté normande à Antioche. Ils furent d'importants participants étrangers à la Reconquista en Iberie. En 1018, Roger de Tosny voyagea en péninsule ibérique pour se tailler un État dans des terres mauresques, mais échoua. En 1064, lors de la guerre de Barbastro, Guillaume de Montreuil mena l'armée papale et prit un énorme butin.

TEXT.English: An aircraft carrier is a warship designed to deploy and recover aircraft, acting as a sea-going airbase. Aircraft carriers thus allow a naval force to project air power great distances without having to depend on local bases for staging aircraft operations. They have evolved from wooden vessels used to deploy a balloon into nuclear powered warships that carry dozens of fixed and rotary wing aircraft.[PARAGRAPH:1]The US Navy built the first aircraft carrier to be powered by nuclear reactors. USS Enterprise is powered by eight nuclear reactors and was the second surface warship (after USS Long Beach) to be powered in this way. Subsequent supercarriers starting with USS Nimitz took advantage of this technology to increase their endurance utilizing only two reactors. The only other nation to have followed the US lead is France with Charles de Gaulle although nuclear power is used for submarine propulsion by France, Great Britain, China and the former Soviet Union.
TEXT.Polish: Lotniskowce? klasa okrêtów, której g³ównym zadaniem jest prowadzenie operacji bojowych za pomoc¹ bazuj¹cych na nich samolotów i przystosowana do tego celu konstrukcyjnie, przede wszystkim przez posiadanie pok³adu startowego. Pierwsze okrêty tej klasy powsta³y pod koniec I wojny œwiatowej, nastêpnie odegra³y du¿¹ rolê w walkach II wojny œwiatowej, szczególnie na Pacyfiku. W chwili obecnej tylko USA posiadaj¹ wiêksz¹ flotê lotniskowców, ponadto Francja, Rosja i Brazylia maj¹ nieliczne lotniskowce uderzeniowe, a Wielka Brytania, Indie, Hiszpania, W³ochy oraz Tajlandia lekkie lotniskowce dla samolotów V/STOL. Lotniskowiec porusza siê wraz z tzw. grup¹ uderzeniow¹, sk³adaj¹c¹ siê z fregat, niszczycieli, okrêtów podwodnych. Grupa taka jest w stanie samodzielnie prowadziæ dzia³ania wojenne na wielkim obszarze.

TEXT.English: A nuclear submarine is a ship powered by atomic energy that travels primarily underwater, but also on the surface of the ocean. Previously, conventional submarines used diesel engines that required air for moving on the surface of the water, and battery-powered electric motors for moving beneath it. The limited lifetime of electric batteries meant that even the most advanced conventional submarine could only remained submerged for a few days at slow speed, and only a few hours at top speed. On the other hand, nuclear submarines consume a relatively small amount of fuel. Because they carry their energy source with them, current generations of nuclear submarines will never need to be refuelled throughout their 25-year lifespans, meaning they can sail around the world 40 times without surfacing. This ability, combined with advanced weapons technology, makes nuclear submarines one of the most useful warships ever built.
TEXT.Polish: Okrêt podwodny z napêdem j¹drowym - okrêt podwodny, który do napêdu i do zasilania urz¹dzeñ pok³adowych w energiê elektryczn¹ wykorzystuje energiê j¹drow¹ wytwarzan¹ w si³owni okrêtowej mieszcz¹cej jeden b¹dŸ wiêcej reaktorów. Dzia³anie tego rodzaju napêdu opiera siê najczêœciej na wytwarzaniu w reaktorze j¹drowym energii cieplnej, która czêœciowo odbierana jest z niego przez kr¹¿¹cy w pierwszym obiegu moderator. Moderatorem w zale¿noœci od rodzaju reaktora jest kr¹¿¹ca w obiegu woda albo ciek³y metal, który w wymienniku przekazuje energiê ciepln¹ wodzie kr¹¿¹cej w drugim obiegu, zamieniaj¹c j¹ w przegrzan¹ parê. Ta, kr¹¿¹c w systemie rur pod bardzo wysokim ciœnieniem, przekazuje energiê turbinie, ulegaj¹c przy tym sch³odzeniu, przez co powraca do stanu ciek³ego. Napêdzana przez parê turbina za pomoc¹ systemu przek³adni napêdza wa³ napêdowy, albo te¿ za pomoc¹ odpowiedniego generatora wytwarza energiê elektryczn¹ niezbêdn¹ do napêdu wa³u za pomoc¹ silnika elektrycznego.

TEXT.English: An Austronesian-speaking group linked to the archaeological construct known as the Lapita cultural complex reached and colonised Tonga around 1500-1000 BCE. Scholars have much debated the exact dates of the initial settlement of Tonga, but recently it has been thought that the first settlers came to the oldest town, Nukuleka, about 826 BCE,?8 years. Not much is known before European contact because of the lack of a writing system, but oral history has survived and been recorded after the arrival of the Europeans. The Tongan people first encountered Europeans in 1616 when the Dutch vessel Eendracht made a short visit to trade.

Ñusta Huillac was a Kolla leader who rebelled against the Spanish in Chile in 1780. She was nicknamed La Tirana (Spanish for "The Tyrant") because of her mistreatment of prisoners. She fell in love with Vasco de Almeida, one of her prisoners, and pleaded with her people for him. After her father's death, she became the leader of a group of Inca who were brought to Chile to mine silver in Huantajaya.
TEXT.French: Ñusta Huillac était une chef Kolla qui se révolta contre les Espagnols au Chili en 1780. Elle fut surnommée La Tirana (en espagnol "La Tyranne") en raison de son mauvais traitement des prisonniers. Elle tomba amoureuse de Vasco de Almeida, l'un de ses prisonniers, et implora son peuple pour lui. Après la mort de son père, elle devint la dirigeante d'un groupe d'Incas amenés au Chili pour exploiter l'argent à Huantajaya.

TEXT.English: Chief Obafemi Jeremiah Oyeniyi Awolowo was a Nigerian nationalist and statesman who played a key role in Nigeria's independence movement, the First and Second Republics and the Civil War. He is most notable as the outstanding first premier of the Western Region but was also a successful federal commissioner for finance and vice president of the Federal Executive Council in the Civil War and was thrice a major contender for his country's highest office. A native of Ikenne in Ogun State of south-western Nigeria, he started his career, like some of his well-known contemporaries, as a nationalist in the Nigerian Youth Movement in which he rose to become Western Provincial Secretary. Awolowo was responsible for much of the progressive social legislation that has made Nigeria a modern nation. He was the first Leader of Government Business and Minister of Local Government and Finance, and first Premier of the Western Region under Nigeria's parliamentary system, from 1952 to 1959. He was the official Leader of the Opposition in the federal parliament to the Balewa government from 1959 to 1963. In recognition of all these, Awolowo was the first individual in the modern era to be named Leader of the Yorubas (Yoruba: Asiwaju Awon Yoruba or Asiwaju Omo Oodua).
The Obsidian Axeman is a warrior wielding a stick topped with an Obsidian blade.
TEXT.French: Le Guerrier avec hache d'obsidienne est un guerrier armé d'un bâton surmonté d'une lame d'obsidienne.
TEXT.Italian: Quest'unità utilizza un'ascia sormontata da una lama in ossidiana.

Pierwsze narzêdzia obsydianowe by³y produkowane ju¿ w najstarszej ludzkiej kulturze olduwajskiej w paleolicie dolnym. W Mezopotamii wyrabiano z niego narzêdzia, broñ, rzeŸby, ozdoby. By³ popularny i ceniony przez Azteków i Majów - rytualne no¿e, groty strza³, zwierciad³a.

TEXT.English: The Obsidian Maceman is a warrior wielding a stick topped with an Obsidian ball.
TEXT.French: Le Guerrier avec masse d'obsidienne est un guerrier brandissant un bâton terminé par une tête en obsidienne.
TEXT.Italian: Quest'unità utilizza un bastone di legno con in punta una sfera di ossidiana.

By³ popularny i ceniony przez Azteków i Majów - rytualne no¿e, groty strza³, zwierciad³a.

TEXT.English: The Obsidian Spearman is a warrior wielding a stick topped with an Obsidian point.
TEXT.French: Le Guerrier avec lance d'obsidienne est un guerrier tenant un bâton terminé par une pointe en obsidienne.
TEXT.Italian: Quest'unità utilizza una lancia in legno con una punta in ossidiana.

By³ popularny i ceniony przez Azteków i Majów - rytualne no¿e, groty strza³, zwierciad³a.

TEXT.English: The Obsidian Swordsman is a warrior wielding a wooden club lined with Obsidian blades on either side.
TEXT.French: Le Guerrier avec épée d'obsidienne est un guerrier armé d'une épée dont la lame est faite en obsidienne.
TEXT.Italian: Quest'unità utilizza una spada di legno potenziata con lame in ossidiana.

By³ popularny i ceniony przez Azteków i Majów - rytualne no¿e, groty strza³, zwierciad³a.

TEXT.English: The Odawa had disputes and warfare with other tribes, particularly over the lucrative fur trade. For example, the tribe once waged war against the Mascouten. In the mid-17th century the Odawa allied with other Algonquian tribes around the Great Lakes against the powerful Mohawk (of present-day New York) and their Iroquois allies in the Beaver Wars. The traditional balance of power in the region had been destroyed by the European introduction of guns and other weapons, changing economic risks and rewards. This disruption produced novel disastrous unintended consequences. All indigenous peoples on both sides were disrupted or decimated; some groups, such as the Iroquoian Erie, were exterminated as tribes. By the mid-17th century, the tribes were more severely affected by disease than warfare. Lacking acquired immunity to the new European infectious diseases, they suffered epidemics with high fatalities.

Odysseus was a legendary Greek king of Ithaca and the hero of Homer's epic poem, the Odyssey. Odysseus also plays a key role in Homer's Iliad and other works in the Epic Cycle. King of Ithaca, husband of Penelope, father of Telemachus, and son of Lartes and Anticlea, Odysseus is renowned for his guile and resourcefulness, and is hence known by the epithet Odysseus the Cunning. He is most famous for the ten eventful years he took to return home after the ten-year Trojan War and his famous Trojan horse trick.
TEXT.Polish: Odyseusz w mitologii greckiej król Itaki; bohater Odysei Homera. Uchodzi³ za syna herosa Laertesa i jego ma³¿onki Antyklei. Wed³ug mitu by³ najprzebieglejszym z królów bior¹cych udzia³ w wojnie trojañskiej, autorem podstêpu, dziêki któremu Grecy wygrali wojnê? konia trojañskiego. W podró¿y powrotnej do Itaki prze¿y³ wiele przygód. Tu³a³ siê przez 10 lat po morzach i oceanach, zanim wróci³ do swej ¿ony Penelopy. Obok Heraklesa i Tezeusza jest najbardziej znanym bohaterem greckich mitów i legend. Synem Odyseusza by³ Telemach.

TEXT.English: An offshore platform or oil rig is a large structure used to house workers and machinery needed to drill and/or produce oil and natural gas through wells in the ocean bed. Depending on the circumstances, the platform may be attached to the ocean floor, consist of an artificial island, or be floating. Generally, oil platforms are located on the continental shelf, though as technology improves, drilling and production in deeper waters becomes both feasible and profitable. A typical platform may have around thirty wellheads located on the platform and directional drilling allows reservoirs to be accessed at both different depths and at remote positions up to 5 miles (8 kilometres) from the platform. Larger lake- and sea-based oil platforms and oil rigs are some of the largest moveable man-made structures in the world.
TEXT.Polish: Platforma wiertnicza to konstrukcja p³ywaj¹ca wyposa¿ona w urz¹dzenie wiertnicze, przeznaczona do wykonywania odwiertów pod dnem morza (oceanu). Sporadycznie bywaj¹ wykorzystywane do eksploatacji takich podmorskich z³ó¿ wêglowodorow (gaz ziemny, ropa naftowa)? w odró¿nieniu od platform wydobywczych. Wiêkszoœæ platform wiertniczych cechuje siê charakterystyczn¹ kratownicow¹ konstrukcj¹ wie¿y wiertniczej oraz mo¿liwoœci¹ zmiany miejsca pracy. Ze wzglêdu na wysokie ryzyko wybuchu i po¿aru a tak¿e trudno dostêpne œrodowisko pracy, platformy wyposa¿a siê w l¹dowiska dla œmig³owców.

TEXT.English: Ogodai Khan was the third son of Genghis Khan and second Great Khan (Khagan) of the Mongol Empire by succeeding his father. He continued the expansion of the empire that his father had begun, and was a world figure when the Mongol Empire reached its furthest extent west and south during the invasions of Europe and Asia. Like all of Genghis' primary sons, he participated extensively in conquests in China, Iran and Central Asia. Under his rule, the Mongols expanded even further than they had under Genghis Khan, and, had he not died from alcoholism, the Mongols may have well expanded into all of the Middle East and especially that of Europe, altering the course of history significantly.
TEXT.Polish: Ugedej (ur. 1185 - zm. 11 grudnia 1241)? trzeci syn Czyngis-chana, w³adca imperium mongolskiego od 1229. Za ¿ycia ojca by³ jednym z dowódców armii mongolskiej, dowodzi³ kampani¹ na terenie dzisiejszego Uzbekistanu i zdoby³ Urgencz. Zosta³ wybrany drugim Wielkim Chanem mongolskim na kuru³taju w 1229 roku. Zosta³ wyznaczony na to stanowisko przez ojca prawdopodobnie w 1219. O jego skromnoœci œwiadczy fakt, i¿ d³ugo wzbrania³ siê przed przyjêciem godnoœci wielkiego chana. W³ada³ pañstwem obejmuj¹cym m.in. Mongoliê i pó³nocne Chiny.
