Niektóre pañstwa zakaz ten obchodz¹ pozbawiaj¹c wczeœniej dan¹ osobê obywatelstwa, czyni¹c z niej bezpañstwowca.

TEXT.English: The Outrigger was an early type of canoe that could go far and fast. It was small though and vulnerable to attack from more military vessels.
TEXT.French: L'Outrigger était un type précoce de pirogue capable de parcourir de longues distances rapidement. Il était cependant petit et vulnérable aux attaques de navires plus militaires.
TEXT.Italian: La piroga con bilanciere era un antico tipo di canoa in grado di muoversi velocemente; tuttavia era piccola e vulnerabile agli attacchi delle navi da guerra.
TEXT.Polish: Outrigger to wczesna jednostka morska, doskonale radzi sobie w misjach rozpoznawczych.
TEXT.Russian: Êàòàìàðàí - íàèáîëåå ðàííèé òèï êàíîý, êîòîðûé ìîã áû ïåðåäâèãàòüñÿ äàëåêî è áûñòðî. Îí áûë íåáîëüøèì è óÿçâèìûì äëÿ àòàê ñ âîåííûõ ñóäîâ..
TEXT.Spanish: La Canoa con batanga es un tipo de canoa antiguo que podía moverse rápido y lejos.

TEXT.English: The oxpeckers are two species of bird which make up the family Buphagidae. Some ornithologists regard them as a subfamily Buphaginae within the starling family Sturnidae but they appear to be quite distinct. Oxpeckers are endemic to the savanna of Sub-Saharan Africa. Both the English and scientific names arise from their habit of perching on large mammals (both wild and domesticated) such as cattle or rhinoceroses, and eating ticks, botfly larvae, and other parasites.[PARAGRAPH:2]According to the more recent studies of Muscicapoidea phylogeny, the oxpeckers are an ancient line related to Mimidae (mockingbirds and thrashers) and starlings but not particularly close to either. Considering the known biogeography of these groups, the most plausible explanation seems that the oxpecker lineage originated in Eastern or Southeastern Asia like the other two. This would make the two species of Buphagus something like living fossils, and elegantly demonstrates that such remnants of past evolution can possess striking and unique autapomorphic adaptations.
TEXT.German: Madenhacker sind Singvögel aus der Familie der Stare, die die Savannen von Mittel- und Ostafrika bevölkern. Sie ernähren sich von Insekten und deren Larven und suchen deshalb die Nähe zu großen Wild- oder Haustieren, mit denen sie symbiotische Beziehungen eingehen. Sie lassen sich von diesen befördern und befreien dafür ihr Fell von Parasiten und Quälgeistern. Außerdem warnen sie ihre Wirte vor Raubtieren in der Nähe.[NEWLINE]Madenhacker verfügen über ein hellbraunes Gefieder, je nach Art über rote oder gelbe Schnäbel und kräftige Füße. Obwohl sie sich gern von ihren Wirten transportieren lassen, sind sie auch gute Flieger. Die Vögel nutzen die Haare ihrer Wirtstiere zur Auskleidung ihrer Nester, die sie in Löchern, meist in Wänden, anlegen.
TEXT.Polish: B¹kojady (Buphagidae)? rodzina ptaków z rzêdu wróblowych, wczeœniej klasyfikowana w randze podrodziny Buphaginae w rodzinie szpakowatych. B¹kojady zamieszkuj¹ sawannê w œrodkowej i po³udniowej Afryce.[PARAGRAPH:2]¯eruj¹ na du¿ych, roœlino¿ernych ssakach kopytnych (bawo³ach, nosoro¿cach, zebrach, antylopach) i na s³oniach. Wyjadaj¹ im ze skóry paso¿yty (g³ównie kleszcze i larwy muchówek) oraz bliznowate tkanki i krew z ran ssaka. Nogi b¹kojadów s¹ krótkie i wyposa¿one w ostre pazury, dziêki czemu mog¹ siê utrzymaæ na grzbiecie i bokach cia³a poruszaj¹cego siê ssaka. B¹kojady nie tylko oczyszczaj¹ skórê zwierz¹t, ale pe³ni¹ równie¿ rolê stra¿ników ostrzegaj¹cych o zagro¿eniu. S¹ towarzyskie, ¿eruj¹ i nocuj¹ w stadach. Gnie¿d¿¹ siê w dziuplach drzew.

TEXT.English: Ozolua, originally called Okpame and later called Ozolua n'Ibaromi (Ozolua the Conqueror), was an Oba of the Kingdom of Benin from 1483 until 1514. He greatly expanded the Kingdom through warfare and increased contact with the Portuguese Empire. He was an important Oba in both history of the Kingdom of Benin and retains importance in the folklore and celebrations of the region.
TEXT.French: Ozolua, initialement appelé Okpame puis Ozolua n'Ibaromi (Ozolua le Conquérant), fut un Oba du Royaume de Bénin de 1483 à 1514. Il étendit grandement le royaume par la guerre et augmenta les contacts avec l'Empire portugais. Il est un Oba important tant dans l'histoire du Royaume de Bénin que dans le folklore et les célébrations régionales.
TEXT.Polish: Ozolua by³ w³adc¹ Królestwa Beninu na prze³omie XV i XVI wieku.

TEXT.English: The North American Aviation P-51 Mustang was an American long-range single-seat World War II fighter aircraft. The Mustang aircraft was economical to produce, was very fast, well-made, and highly durable. Designed and built in just 117 days, the Mustang first flew in Royal Air Force (RAF) service as a fighter-bomber and reconnaissance aircraft before conversion to a bomber escort, employed in raids over Germany, helping ensure Allied air superiority from early 1944. The P-51 was in service with Allied air forces in Europe and also saw limited service against the Japanese in the Pacific War. The Mustang began the Korean War as the United Nations' main fighter, but was relegated to a ground attack role when superseded by jet fighters early in the conflict.
TEXT.French: Le North American Aviation P-51 Mustang était un chasseur américain monoplace à longue portée de la Seconde Guerre mondiale. L'avion Le Mustang était économique à produire, très rapide, bien fait et très durable. Conçue et construite en seulement 117 jours, la Mustang a d'abord volé en service de la Royal Air Force (RAF) en tant que chasseur-bombardier et avion de reconnaissance avant d'être convertie en escorte de bombardiers, utilisée lors de raids au-dessus de l'Allemagne, contribuant à assurer la supériorité aérienne alliée à partir du début de 1944. Le P-51 était en service avec les forces aériennes alliées en Europe et a également vu un service limité contre les Japonais dans la guerre du Pacifique. Le Mustang a commencé la guerre de Corée en tant que combattant principal des Nations Unies, mais a été relégué à un rôle d'attaque au sol lorsqu'il a été remplacé par des chasseurs à réaction au début du conflit.
TEXT.Polish: Samolot myœliwski, myœliwiec - samolot bojowy przeznaczony przede wszystkim do zwalczania innych statków powietrznych i uzyskania przewagi powietrznej, jak i obrony w³asnych samolotów o innym przeznaczeniu, czym ró¿ni siê od bombowców, s³u¿¹cych do atakowania celów naziemnych, g³ównie przy u¿yciu bomb. Myœliwce z za³o¿enia s¹ wzglêdnie ma³e, przewa¿nie jednomiejscowe, a przy tym silnie uzbrojone, szybkie i bardzo zwrotne.

TEXT.English: Currently, the Wari' are peaceful, but before the pacification they warred with neighboring tribes. Their most notable victories occurred over the Karipuna, a Tupi ethnicity, and the Uru-Eu-Wau-Wau. With contact with the Brazilian government in the 20th century, the focus of their warfare shifted and they lost contact with the old wijam (enemy).
TEXT.French: Actuellement pacifiques, les Wari' ont auparavant mené des guerres contre les tribus voisines. Leurs victoires les plus notables furent contre les Karipuna, un groupe ethnique Tupi, et les Uru-Eu-Wau-Wau. Avec le contact établi avec le gouvernement brésilien au XXe siècle, l'objectif de leurs conflits a changé et ils ont perdu le contact avec l'ancien wijam (ennemi).

TEXT.English: Likely related to the arid and extreme nature of the environment, Nazca religious beliefs were based upon agriculture and fertility. Much of Nazca art depicts powerful nature gods, such as the mythical killer whale, the harvesters, the mythical spotted cat, the serpentine creature, and the most prevalent of worshipped figures, the anthropomorphic mythical being. Much as in the contemporary Moche culture based in northwest Peru, shamans apparently used hallucinogenic drugs, such as extractions from the San Pedro cactus, to induce visions. The use of such substances is also depicted in art found on pottery related to the Nazca. Religious events and ceremonies took place in Cahuachi. The people worshipped the nature gods to aid in the growth of agriculture.

In the Zen culture, women were the symbol of fertility, wisdom and respect. Female characters were frequently portrayed in clay and placed in the graves of the dead as a symbol of human and agricultural fertility. The presence of these statuettes in the grave symbolized conception and rebirth in the underworld, in the same way that seeds germinate and grow. During the funeral ceremony, which was attended by the whole community with music and dance, a mound was built over the grave. On top of the mound a tree was planted, and golden bells were hung in the branches. The golden breastplates that important women and chiefs wore during ceremonies symbolized the pregnancy of women and the virility of men. The roundness of the mound, like the roundness of a breastplate, was an allusion to the place where pregnancy and birth took place. Thus, women possessed great social and political significance. When the Zen culture was discovered by the Spaniards in the 16th century, the religious center of Finzenat the river Sin was led by Toto, a female chief who governed several nearby villages.

A pack animal or beast of burden is a working animal used by humans as means of transporting materials by attaching them so their weight bears on the animal's back; the term may be applied to either an individual animal or a species so employed. The term pack animal is sometimes used in contrast to draft animal, which is a working animal that typically pulls a load behind itself (such as a plow or a wheeled cart) rather than carrying cargo directly on its back. Many ungulate species are traditional pack animals, including elephants, camels, the yak, reindeer, goats, water buffalo and llama, and many of the domesticated Equidae (horse family).
TEXT.Polish: Lama jest po³udniowo-amerykañskim krewniakiem wielb³¹da - ró¿ni siê od niego tym, ¿e nie posiada garbu.

TEXT.English: A paddle steamer is a ship or boat driven by a steam engine that uses one or more paddle wheels to develop thrust for propulsion. It is also commonly a type of steamboat. Paddle steamers usually carry the prefix "PS". Although generally associated with steam power, paddleboats or paddlewheelers have also been driven by diesel engines, animal power, or human power. The paddle wheel was the first practical form of mechanical propulsion applied to a boat, but has now been almost entirely superseded by the screw propeller and other, more modern forms of marine propulsion. There are two basic ways to mount paddle wheels on a ship; a single wheel on the rear, known as a stern-wheeler, and a paddle wheel on each side, known as a side-wheeler. Stern-wheelers have generally been used as riverboats in the United States where they still operate for tourist use on the Mississippi River. Side-wheelers are used as riverboats and as coastal craft. While wider than a stern-wheeler, due to the extra width of the paddle wheels and their enclosing sponsons, a side-wheeler has extra manoeuvrability. Due to this extra manoeuvrability side-wheelers were more popular on the narrower, windy rivers of the Murray-Darling system in Australia where a number are still in operation today.

Sustained contact between the Northern Paiute and Euro-Americans came in the early 1840s, although the first contact may have occurred as early as the 1820s. Although the Paiute had adopted the use of horses from other Great Plains tribes, their culture was otherwise largely unaffected by European influences at that point. As Euro-American settlement of the area progressed, several violent incidents occurred, including the Pyramid Lake War of 1860, Owens Valley Indian War 1861-1864, Snake War 1864-1868; and the Bannock War of 1878. These incidents generally began with a disagreement between settlers and the Paiute (singly or in a group) regarding property, retaliation by one group against the other, and finally counter-retaliation by the opposite party, frequently culminating in the armed involvement of the U.S. Army. Many more Paiutes died from newly introduced infectious diseases such as smallpox than in warfare. Sarah Winnemucca's book Life Among the Piutes (1883) gives a first-hand account of this period, although it is not considered to be wholly reliable.

The Paladins, sometimes known as the Twelve Peers, were the foremost warriors of Charlemagne's court, according to the literary cycle known as the Matter of France. They first appear in the early chansons de geste such as The Song of Roland, where they represent Christian valour against the Saracen hordes inside Europe.
TEXT.French: Les Paladins, parfois appelés les Douze Pairs, étaient les principaux guerriers de la cour de Charlemagne, selon le cycle littéraire connu sous le nom de Matière de France. Ils apparaissent pour la première fois dans les premières chansons de geste telles que La Chanson de Roland, où ils représentent la vaillance chrétienne contre les hordes sarrasines en Europe.

TEXT.English: [H1]Jose Doroteo Arango Arambula[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Pancho Villa[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 5 June 1878 - 20 July 1923[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]was one of the most prominent Mexican Revolutionary generals.[PARAGRAPH:1]Against the wishes of Carranza, who wanted to name Manuel Chao as the provisional governor of Chihuahua, Villa was named as the provisional governor of the state of Chihuahua in 1913, after the local military commanders in the region elected him. As Governor of Chihuahua, Villa recruited more experienced generals, such as Toribio Ortega, Porfirio Talamantes and Calixto Contreas, in his military staff and achieved more success than ever. Following his appointment as governor of Chihuahua, Villa's secretary Perez Rul divided his army into two groups, one led by Ortega Contreras and Orestes Pereira and the other led by Talamantes and Contreras' deputy Severianco Ceniceros.
TEXT.Polish: Francisco (Pancho) Villa, w³aœc. Doroteo Arango Arambula (ur. 5 czerwca 1878 w Hacienda de Rio Grande; zm. 20 lipca 1923 w Parral) - meksykañski przywódca partyzantki ch³opskiej, genera³ z okresu rewolucji meksykañskiej. Przeciwnik re¿imów Porfirio Diaza i Victoriano Huerty.

TEXT.English: The panda (Ailuropoda melanoleuca, lit. "black and white cat-foot", also known as panda bear or the giant panda to distinguish it from the unrelated red panda, is a bear native to south central China. It is easily recognized by the large, distinctive black patches around its eyes, over the ears, and across its round body. Though it belongs to the order Carnivora, the panda's diet is over 99% bamboo. Pandas in the wild will occasionally eat other grasses, wild tubers, or even meat in the form of birds, rodents or carrion. In captivity, they may receive honey, eggs, fish, yams, shrub leaves, oranges, or bananas along with specially prepared food.[PARAGRAPH:2]The giant panda lives in a few mountain ranges in central China, mainly in Sichuan province, but also in Shaanxi and Gansu provinces. As a result of farming, deforestation, and other development, the panda has been driven out of the lowland areas where it once lived.
TEXT.Polish: Panda wielka, niedŸwiedŸ bambusowy (Ailuropoda melanoleuca) - gatunek drapie¿nego ssaka z rodziny niedŸwiedziowatych (Ursidae). Panda wielka zamieszkuje lasy bambusowe na wysokoœci 1600-3500 m n.p.m. (zim¹ schodzi do 800 m n.p.m.). Jej przynale¿noœæ do drapie¿nych nie ulega w¹tpliwoœci, jednak w rzeczywistoœci od¿ywia siê pêdami roœlin (najwiêcej ¿ywi siê pêdami bambusu), lecz nie gardzi te¿ rybami i ma³ymi gryzoniami. Klasyfikacja pandy do zwierz¹t drapie¿nych spowodowana jest budow¹ uk³adu pokarmowego. Jest on zbudowany jak u zwierz¹t spo¿ywaj¹cych pokarm miêsny.

TEXT.English: The Amis people generally identify themselves as Pangcah, which means "human" or "people of our kind." Nonetheless, in today's Taiwan, Amis is much more frequently used. This name comes from the word amis, meaning "north." There is still no consensus in the academic circle how "Amis" came to be used to address the Pangcah. One supposition is that it was originally used by the Puyuma to call the Pangcah, as the Pangcah lived to the north of them. Another supposition holds that those who lived in the Taitung Plain called themselves "Amis" because their ancestors had come from the north. The later explanation is recorded in the Banzoku Chosa Hokokusho, indicating this might originate from what is classified by anthropologists as Falangaw Amis, the Amis group located from today's Chenggong to the Taitung Plain. Their closest genetic relative appears to be the Filipinos.

Papua New Guinea is one of the most culturally diverse countries in the world. The Korowai tribe of south-eastern Papua could be one of the last surviving tribes in the world engaging in cannibalism. Although headhunting and cannibalism have been practically eradicated, in the past they were practised in many parts of the country as part of rituals related to warfare and taking in enemy spirits or powers. For example, in 1901, on Goaribari Island in the Gulf of Papua, a missionary, Harry Dauncey, found 10,000 skulls in the island's Long Houses. According to the writer Marianna Torgovnick, "The most fully documented instances of cannibalism as a social institution come from New Guinea, where head-hunting and ritual cannibalism survived, in certain isolated areas, into the Fifties, Sixties, and Seventies, and still leave traces within certain social groups".

Infantry trained in the subtle art of leaping out of aircraft, Paratroopers have been surprising and encircling their opponents since World War II. While the concept of airborne troops had been suggested as far back as Benjamin Franklin (although his troopers were attached to balloons rather than parachutes), the Second World War became the first proving ground for the skyborne infantry. While the ability of Paratroopers to enter otherwise inaccessible territory gave the troops an invaluable tactical advantage, the use of Paratroopers in conjunction with regular troops provided the added bonus of confusion - dug-in troops were often unable to tell if the Paratroopers were the main opposing force.[PARAGRAPH:1]While massive deployments of Paratroopers are no longer considered tactically sound, new forms of drops, such as the HALO (High Altitude-Low Opening), have developed, allowing small groups of soldiers - usually special forces - to be placed precisely behind enemy lines with almost no radar signature.
TEXT.French: Unité d'infanterie entraînée à sauter d'un avion, les parachutistes surprennent et encerclent leurs adversaires depuis la Deuxième Guerre mondiale. Alors que le concept de troupes aéroportées est évoqué depuis Benjamin Franklin (ses troupes étaient alors attachées à des ballons plutôt qu'à des parachutes), la Deuxième Guerre mondiale devient le premier terrain d'expérimentation pour l'infanterie aéroportée. La faculté des parachutistes à pénétrer dans des territoires autrement inaccessibles donne à ces troupes un précieux avantage tactique et, de plus, l'utilisation des parachutistes en conjonction avec les troupes conventionnelles offre un bonus supplémentaire : la confusion. En effet, les troupes retranchées étaient souvent incapables de dire si les parachutistes étaient leurs ennemis.[PARAGRAPH:1]Aujourd'hui, les déploiements massifs de parachutistes ne sont plus considérés comme valables tactiquement et de nouvelles formes de saut en parachute, comme le HALO (High Altitude-Low Opening), se sont développées, permettant à de petits groupes de soldats - généralement des forces spéciales - d'atterrir derrière les lignes ennemies sans se faire repérer par les radars.
TEXT.German: Fallschirmjäger sind Infanteristen, die gelernt haben, aus Flugzeugen abzuspringen, und die ihre Gegner seit dem Zweiten Weltkrieg überraschen und einkreisen. Während das Konzept von Lufttruppen bereits auf Benjamin Franklin zurückgeht (dessen Truppen allerdings noch Ballone anstelle von Fallschirmen verwendeten), kamen Infanterietruppen aus der Luft erstmals im Zweiten Weltkrieg zum Einsatz. Die Fähigkeit von Fallschirmjägern, in ansonsten unzugängliche Gebiete vorzudringen, verschaffte den Truppen einen unschätzbaren taktischen Vorteil. Außerdem sorgte der Einsatz von Fallschirmjägern in Verbindung mit regulären Truppen für zusätzliche Verwirrung - gegnerische Truppen vor Ort konnten oft nicht erkennen, ob Fallschirmjäger den Großteil der gegnerischen Streitkräfte stellten.[PARAGRAPH:1]Der massive Einsatz von Fallschirmjägern gilt zwar nicht mehr als taktisch klug, aber es wurden neue Absprungmethoden entwickelt, wie etwa der HALO (High Altitude - Low Opening; dt. "Große Höhe - tiefe Öffnung"), der es kleinen Gruppen von Soldaten - üblicherweise Spezialeinheiten - ermöglichte, direkt hinter den feindlichen Linien zu landen und dabei vom Radar unentdeckt zu bleiben.
TEXT.Italian: I Paracadutisti, fanti addestrati nell'arte di lanciarsi da un aereo sono impiegati fin dai tempi della Seconda Guerra Mondiale per sorprendere e circondare le truppe nemiche. Mentre il concetto di truppe aviotrasportate compare già ai tempi di Beniamino Franklin (anche se i suoi soldati erano attaccati a palloni aerostatici invece che a paracaduti), la Seconda Guerra Mondiale fu il primo vero terreno di prova per questo tipo di fanti. L'abilità dei paracadutisti di entrare in territori altrimenti inaccessibili diede loro un prezioso vantaggio tattico e l'utilizzo congiunto di paracadutisti e truppe regolari dà il bonus aggiunto per la confusione: le truppe nemiche spesso non capivano se i paracadutisti fossero o no la forza d'attacco principale.[PARAGRAPH:1]L'impiego massiccio di paracadutisti non viene più considerato tatticamente valido ma nel frattempo sono state sviluppate nuove forme di lanci, come per esempio l'HALO (High Altitude-Low Opening), che permettono a piccoli gruppi di soldati, solitamente appartenenti alle forze speciali, di venire spiegati dietro le linee nemiche senza causare alcun allarme radar.
TEXT.Spanish: Los paracaidistas, una rama de la infantería entrenada en el sutil arte de saltar desde un avión, llevan sorprendiendo y rodeando a sus enemigos desde la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Aunque el concepto de tropas aerotransportadas se remonta a Benjamin Franklin (aunque en su idea los soldados llevaban globos en lugar de paracaídas), la Segunda Guerra Mundial se convirtió en el auténtico laboratorio para su uso. La capacidad de los paracaidistas para alcanzar terrenos inaccesibles para otras unidades les proporciona una ventaja táctica de valor incalculable, además de que su uso, junto con tropas regulares, ofrece la ventaja añadida de la confusión. Las tropas atrincheradas a menudo son incapaces de saber si los paracaidistas conforman el grueso del ataque.[PARAGRAPH:1]Aunque en la actualidad el despliegue de paracaídas en grandes cantidades no se considera conveniente desde el punto de vista táctico, se han desarrollado nuevas variedades estratégicas, como el HALO (High Altitude-Low Opening), que permiten que pequeños grupos de soldados, normalmente de las fuerzas especiales, se sitúen con precisión tras las líneas enemigas prácticamente sin dejar rastro en el radar.

TEXT.English: The Park Ranger is a person who protects areas of wilderness from construction. This can be good in some cases, and wasteful in others.
TEXT.French: Le Ranger de Parc ou garde forestier est une personne qui protège les zones sauvages contre l'urbanisation. Cela peut être bénéfique dans certains cas, mais parfois perçu comme un gaspillage.
TEXT.Italian: Il guardaparco è una persona che protegge le riserve naturali; questo può essere sia un bene sia uno spreco.
TEXT.Polish: Leœniczy - pracownik instytucji Pañstwowe Gospodarstwo Leœne Lasy Pañstwowe. Jest pracownikiem S³u¿by Leœnej w nadleœnictwie. Leœniczy jest podw³adnym nadleœniczego i prze³o¿onym podleœniczego. Sprawuje opiekê nad powierzonym mu leœnictwem, w którego sk³ad wchodz¹ lasy nale¿¹ce do Skarbu Pañstwa jak równie¿ mog¹ to byæ lasy prywatne powierzone do prowadzenia przez starostê.

TEXT.English: This is the generic Parrot. It represents the parakeets like the budgerigar, flightless parrots like the New Zealand Kakapo and all the glorously coloured parrots and parakeets of the tropics around the world.
TEXT.French: Voici le perroquet générique. Il représente les perruches comme le cocorico, les perroquets incapables de voler comme le kakapo de Nouvelle-Zélande, ainsi que tous les perroquets et perruches magnifiquement colorés des tropiques dans le monde.
TEXT.Polish: Papugowe (Psittaciformes) - rz¹d ptaków z podgromady ptaków nowoczesnych Neornithes. Najliczniejsze w Ameryce Po³udniowej i Australii. Ptaki te charakteryzuj¹ siê obecnoœci¹: masywnego i hakowato zakoñczonego dzioba; nabrzmia³¹ woskówk¹ u nasady dzioba (u wiêkszoœci gatunków); górn¹ szczêk¹ ruchom¹ wzglêdem czaszki; grubym, miêsistym jêzykiem.

TEXT.English: A partisan is a member of an irregular military force formed to oppose control of an area by a foreign power or by an army of occupation. The term can apply to the field element of resistance movements that opposed German rule several countries during World War II, or those who after the war fought the Soviet Union's Communist rule in Eastern Europe. (Original mod by GIR and Stolenrays.)
TEXT.French: Un partisan est un membre d'une force militaire irrégulière formée pour s'opposer au contrôle d'une zone par une puissance étrangère ou par une armée d'occupation. Le terme peut s'appliquer aux mouvements de résistance opposés à la domination allemande dans plusieurs pays durant la Seconde Guerre mondiale, ou à ceux qui après la guerre ont combattu la domination communiste soviétique en Europe de l'Est. (Mod original par GIR et Stolenrays.)
TEXT.German: Ein Partisan (von italienisch partigiano Parteigänger) ist ein bewaffneter Kämpfer, der nicht zu den regulären Streitkräften eines Staates gehört. (Original mod by GIR and Stolenrays.)
TEXT.Polish: Partyzant (w³. partigiano = stronnik)? ¿o³nierz nieregularnych oddzia³ów prowadz¹cych walki oraz dzia³ania dywersyjne na terenach zajêtych przez wroga.

TEXT.English: The Army of the Guardians of the Islamic Revolution often called Revolutionary Guards or Iranian Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) by the English-speaking or U.S. media, is a branch of Iran's Armed Forces, founded after the Iranian revolution on 5 May 1979. Whereas the regular military (artesh) defends Iran's borders and maintains internal order, according to the Iranian constitution, the Revolutionary Guard (pasdaran) is intended to protect the country's Islamic system. The Revolutionary Guards state that their role in protecting the Islamic system is preventing foreign interference as well as coups by the military or "deviant movements".

The trademark Valdivia piece is the "Venus" of Valdivia: feminine ceramic figures. The "Venus" of Valdivia likely represented actual people, as each figurine is individual and unique, as can be seen by the hairstyles. They were made joining two rolls of clay, leaving the lower portion separated as legs and making the body and head from the top portion. The arms were usually very short, and in most cases were bent towards the chest, holding the breasts or under the chin.
TEXT.French: La pièce emblématique de Valdivia est la "Vénus" de Valdivia : des figurines féminines en céramique. La "Vénus" de Valdivia représentait probablement de vraies personnes, chaque figurine étant individuelle et unique, comme on peut le voir par les coiffures. Elles étaient fabriquées en joignant deux rouleaux d'argile, laissant la partie inférieure séparée en jambes et formant le corps et la tête avec la partie supérieure. Les bras étaient généralement très courts, et dans la plupart des cas pliés vers la poitrine, tenant les seins ou sous le menton.

TEXT.English: The bow and arrow appears around the transition from the Upper Paleolithic to the Mesolithic. At the site of Nataruk in Turkana, Kenya, obsidian bladelets found embedded in a skull and within the thoracic cavity of another skeleton, suggest the use of stone-tipped arrows as weapons. After the end of the last glacial period, use of the bow seems to have spread to every inhabited continent, including the New World, except for Australia.
TEXT.French: L'arc et la flèche apparaissent vers la transition entre le Paléolithique supérieur et le Mésolithique. Sur le site de Nataruk à Turkana, au Kenya, des éclats d'obsidienne retrouvés dans un crâne et dans la cavité thoracique d'un autre squelette suggèrent l'usage de flèches à pointe de pierre comme armes. Après la fin de la dernière période glaciaire, l'utilisation de l'arc semble s'être répandue sur tous les continents habités, y compris le Nouveau Monde, sauf en Australie.

TEXT.English: The Patamar (Portuguese), (English: Pattamar, Patimar, French: Patemar, Patmar), is a type of Indian Dhow. It was traditionally used in the western coast of the Indian subcontinent as a cabotage vessel between Gujarat and Ceylon, usually for the transport of rice. Some can still be seen on the Malabar Coast.
TEXT.French: Le Patamar (portugais), (anglais : Pattamar, Patimar, français : Patemar, Patmar), est un type de dhow indien. Il était traditionnellement utilisé sur la côte ouest du sous-continent indien comme navire caboteur entre le Gujarat et Ceylan, généralement pour le transport du riz. Certains peuvent encore être vus sur la côte de Malabar.

TEXT.English: In response to the steady organization of criminal enterprises, rigid Patrol units begin to form as a pseudo-military branch of the government. With upgraded weaponry, this new breed of law enforcement is ready to take down all offenders.
TEXT.French: En réponse à l'organisation croissante des entreprises criminelles, des unités rigides de patrouille commencent à se former comme une branche pseudo-militaire du gouvernement. Avec un armement amélioré, cette nouvelle génération des forces de l'ordre est prête à arrêter tous les délinquants.

TEXT.English: George Smith Patton, Jr. (also George Smith Patton III) (November 11, 1885 December 21, 1945) was a distinguished though controversial United States Army officer. It was in World War II that he made his mark, commanding both corps and armies as a general in North Africa, Sicily, and the European Theater of Operations. Near the end of the Sicilian campaign, Patton jeopardized his career by slapping a soldier recuperating from "battle fatigue" at a hospital; Patton considered him a coward. The well-publicized incident caused General Eisenhower to relieve him of command. Thus, instead of playing a major part in the invasion of Normandy, he was relegated to being a decoy. However, he was later given command of the U.S. Third Army and ably led it in breaking out of the hedgerows of Normandy and across France. When a surprise major German offensive resulted in American units being surrounded in Bastogne, Patton rapidly disengaged his army from fighting in another sector and moved it over 100 miles in 48 hours to relieve the siege. Regardless, he is considered to be one of the greatest American military commanders of all time.
TEXT.Polish: George Smith Patton, Jr. (ur. 11 listopada 1885 w San Gabriel w stanie Kalifornia, zm. 21 grudnia 1945 w Heidelbergu w Niemczech)? amerykañski genera³ okresu II wojny œwiatowej. By³ postaci¹ bardzo kontrowersyjn¹ ju¿ za ¿ycia, budzi³ skrajne uczucia zarówno u swoich podw³adnych, jak i u prze³o¿onych. Wœród swoich ¿o³nierzy znany by³ jako "Old blood and guts". Znakomity kawalerzysta i szermierz (napisa³ m.in. instrukcjê szermiercz¹ dla kawalerii amerykañskiej), namiêtnie grywa³ w polo. Opowiada³ o swoich bardzo realistycznych wizjach wczeœniejszych wcieleñ. Wierzy³ w reinkarnacjê, uwa¿a³ siê m.in. za wcielenie kartagiñskiego ¿o³nierza, rzymskiego legionisty, napoleoñskiego genera³a i wielu innych postaci. Patton zmar³ 21 grudnia 1945 w szpitalu w Heidelbergu w wyniku obra¿eñ odniesionych w wypadku samochodowym, który mia³ miejsce 9 grudnia 1945.

TEXT.English: Peafowl are two Asiatic species of flying birds in the genus Pavo of the pheasant family, Phasianidae, best known for the male's extravagant eye-spotted tail, which it displays as part of courtship. The male is called a peacock, the female a peahen, and the offspring peachicks. The adult female peafowl is grey and/or brown. Peachicks can be between yellow and a tawny colour with darker brown patches. The term also embraces the Congo Peafowl, which is placed in a separate genus Afropavo.
TEXT.French: Les paons sont deux espèces asiatiques d'oiseaux volants du genre Pavo dans la famille des faisans, Phasianidae, connus surtout pour la queue extravagante ornée d'ocelles du mâle, qu'il déploie lors de la parade nuptiale. Le mâle est appelé paon, la femelle paonne, et les petits paonneaux. La femelle adulte est grise et/ou brune. Les paonneaux vont du jaune au fauve avec des taches brunes plus foncées. Le terme englobe aussi le paon du Congo, classé dans un genre séparé, Afropavo.
TEXT.German: Der Asiatische [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pfau[COLOR_REVERT] ist eine Gattung der Fasanenartigen und umfasst die Arten Blauer Pfau und Ährenträgerpfau (auch Grüner Pfau genannt).[NEWLINE]Die Heimat der Pfauen sind die Regenwälder von Süd- und Ostasien. Vor allem die Hähne fallen durch ihr Prachtkleid mit dem verlängerten Schwanz (Schleppe) auf, der aus ca. 150 Federn besteht, wobei jede Schmuckfeder einen Augenfleck besitzt. Das schillernde Gefieder enthält keine Farbpigmente, vielmehr sorgt die Interferenz des Lichts in winzigen Luftkammern für den Farbeindruck. Sowohl Männchen als auch Weibchen tragen eine kleine Federkrone. Die Tiere leben meist in losen Verbänden mit Hähnen, Hennen und Jungtieren zusammen. Ihre Nahrung besteht u.a. aus Samen, Früchten, Blüten und Insekten. Während der Balz stellen die Hähne ihre Schleppen auf und drehen sich langsam um die eigene Achse, um die Hennen zu beeindrucken. Die weitaus schlichter wirkenden Hennen legen etwa fünf Eier und kümmern sich allein um die Brut und Aufzucht der Jungtiere. Gelegentlich werden erwachsene Pfauen von Tigern oder Leoparden erbeutet.[NEWLINE]In Indien sind Pfauen beliebte Haustiere. Sie jagen nicht nur Mäuse, sondern vertreiben auch Kobras aus ihren Revieren und warnen vor Großkatzen. Die Federn der männlichen Tiere dienen in Asien zur Herstellung edler Stoffe.
TEXT.Polish: Paw (³c. pavo) zool. Pavo cristatus, du¿y ptak z rodziny ba¿antowatych (Phasianidae), pochodz¹cy z Indii, Cejlonu i Pakistanu, którego samiec posiada charakterystyczny wachlarzowato rozk³adany ogon (tren) z³o¿ony z b. mocno wyd³u¿onych piór nadogonowych o metalicznym br¹zowozielonym po³ysku, zakoñczonych okiem w barwach czarnej, niebieskiej, zielonej i ¿ó³tej oraz barwny czubek na g³owie; hodowany powszechnie jako ptak ozdobny.

TEXT.English: Pedro de Aguado (1513 or 1538 - late 16th or early 17th century) was a Spanish Franciscan friar who spent around 15 years in the New Kingdom of Granada, preaching to the Indians. During this time he collected source material for a history of the region, and began a manuscript, Recopilación historial, which he completed in Spain between 1576 and 1583 but was unable to publish. The manuscript was used by other historians, but was not published until the twentieth century.
TEXT.French: Pedro de Aguado (1513 ou 1538 - fin du XVIe ou début du XVIIe siècle) était un moine franciscain espagnol qui passa environ 15 ans dans le Nouveau Royaume de Grenade, prêchant aux Indiens. Pendant ce temps, il recueillit du matériel source pour une histoire de la région et commença un manuscrit, Recopilación historial, qu'il acheva en Espagne entre 1576 et 1583 mais ne put publier. Le manuscrit fut utilisé par d'autres historiens, mais ne fut publié qu'au XXe siècle.

TEXT.English: Pedro de Alvarado y Contreras was a Spanish conquistador and governor of Guatemala. He participated in the conquest of Cuba, in Juan de Grijalva's exploration of the coasts of the Yucatan Peninsula and the Gulf of Mexico, and in the conquest of Mexico led by Hernan Cortés. He is considered the conquistador of much of Central America, including Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador. Although renowned for his skill as a soldier, Alvarado is known also for the cruelty of his treatment of native populations, and mass murders committed in the subjugation of the native peoples of Mexico.

Pedro II Nkanga a Mvika was a ruler of the kingdom of Kongo during the kingdom's first conflict with the Portuguese colony of Angola. He was the founder of the royal House of Nsundi and could trace his descent to one of Afonso I's daughters. Pedro II served in the provincial government of Manikongo Alvaro III Nimi a Mpanzu as Marquis of Wembo and later as Duke of Mbamba. Manikongo Alvaro III had no heir apparent as he was a young man with older uncles whom wished to rule. When he died in 1622, Pedro II was elected as a compromise candidate. King Pedro II's father was from the province of Nsundi, where Pedro himself was born, and thus his royal house is known by that name or simply the Kinkanga kanda. Pedro was widely regarded as a virtuous man and a model Christian. The Jesuits, who had recently arrived in Kongo held him up as a paragon of Christian deportment. No sooner had he come to the throne than the governor of Angola, Joao Correia de Sousa, sent an army into Kongo claiming that he had the right to choose the mwenekongo. Besides that, de Sousa accused Pedro of harboring runaway slaves from Angola during his tenure as Duke of Mbamba. Fresh from a victory against Nambu a Ngongo, a southern neighbor of Kongo, a 20,000 strong Portuguese army with its Imbangala allies entered Mbamba and was met by the Duke at Mbumbi. Although the Duke's men fought bravely and scattered a portion of the Portuguese army, he was badly outnumbered having only his own small force and that of the Marquis of Mpemba who managed to join him. The Portuguese defeated and killed both nobles. They were later eaten by Portugal's Imbangala troops. Pedro II immediately declared Angola an enemy of the state and brought the main army down from Kongo to meet the invaders at Mbanda Kasi. The army of Kongo crushed the Portuguese and the Imbangala and forced them out of Kongo entirely. In the aftermath of this, anti-Portuguese riots broke out all over the kingdom and threatened its long established merchant community. Portuguese throughout the country were humiliatingly disarmed and even forced to give up their clothes. Pedro II set up camp at Mbana Kasi and wrote numerous letters of protest to Rome and the king of Spain (then also ruler of Portugal). As a result of these letters and protests by Portuguese merchants in Kongo and Angola, Joao Correia de Sousa was recalled in disgrace, and some 1,200 slaves were eventually returned from Brazil. Pedro, anxious not to alienate the Portuguese merchant community, and aware that they had generally remained loyal during the war, did as much as he could to preserve their lives and property, leading some of his detractors to call him "King of Portuguese". Pedro also wrote to the Dutch States General proposing that the newly formed West India Company assist him in an attack on Luanda, with the BaKongo attacking by land and the Dutch by sea. Although he died before this alliance could be affected, the steady alliance between Kongo and the Netherlands would persist, eventually coming to fruition in 1641 with the Dutch attack on Luanda.
TEXT.Polish: Pedro II Nkanga a Mvika by³ w³adc¹ królestwa Kongo podczas pierwszego konfliktu z portugalsk¹ koloni¹ w Angoli. By³ za³o¿ycielem królewskiej dynasti Nsundi i wywodzi³ swoje pochodzenie od jednej z córek Alfonsa I. Pedro II s³u¿y³ w prowincjonalnym rz¹dzie Manikongo Alvaro III Nimi a Mpanzu jako markiz Wembo a póŸniej diuk Mbamba. Manikongo Alvaro III nie mia³ bezpoœrednich potomków mia³ za to starszych wujków, którzy pragnêli w³adzy. Kiedy zmar³ w 1622, Pedro II zosta³ wybrany jako kandydat kompromisowy. Pedro by³ uwa¿any za dzielnego cz³owieka i przyk³adnego chrzeœcijanina.

TEXT.Italian: Guerriero con lanciafiamme pen huo qi

TEXT.English: The Pen Huo Qi is a double-piston pump naphtha flamethrower used in 919 CE in China, during the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period. The flamethrower was carefully documented and illustrated in the Chinese military manual known as the Wujing Zongyao, compiled in the year 1044 AD during the Song Dynasty. Among various descriptions of equipment and components of the device, the book also provided instructions for how to keep up maintenance and repair of double-piston flamethrowers.
TEXT.French: Le Pen Huo Qi est un lance-flammes à double piston et pompe à naphte utilisé en 919 après J.-C. en Chine, durant la période des Cinq Dynasties et Dix Royaumes. Le lance-flammes fut soigneusement documenté et illustré dans le manuel militaire chinois connu sous le nom de Wujing Zongyao, compilé en 1044 sous la dynastie Song. Parmi diverses descriptions des équipements et composants de l'appareil, le livre fournit aussi des instructions pour l'entretien et la réparation des lance-flammes à double piston.

TEXT.English: Perahu was king of Punt, his wife was Queen Ati. The majority opinion places Punt in Eastern Africa, based on the fact that the products of Punt (as depicted in the Hatshepsut illustrations) were abundantly found in the Horn of Africa but were less common or sometimes absent in Arabia. These products included gold and aromatic resins such as myrrh, and ebony; the wild animals depicted in Punt include giraffes, baboons, hippopotami, and leopards. Says Richard Pankhurst: "[Punt] has been identified with territory on both the Arabian and the Horn of Africa coasts. Consideration of the articles which the Egyptians obtained from Punt, notably gold and ivory, suggests, however, that these were primarily of African origin. This leads us to suppose that the term Punt probably applied more to African than Arabian territory."

The Immortals were a strong corps deployed by the Persian Empire in the fifth century BC. Gifted soldiers, they drew their moniker from the fact that regardless of the casualties sustained in battle, the unit was restored to full strength, no matter the cost. Equipped with bow and spear, the front rank would advance upon the enemy while rear ranks rained arrows to ease the assault.
TEXT.French: Les Immortels étaient les soldats lourde de l'Empire Perse, au Ve siècle av. J.-C. Combattants hors pair, ils doivent leur nom au fait que leur unité était systématiquement reconstituée après la bataille, quelles qu'aient été les pertes. Equipés d'arcs et de lances, les soldats des premiers rangs avançaient sur l'ennemi tandis que ceux des derniers rangs faisaient pleuvoir les flèches pour faciliter l'attaque.
TEXT.German: Diese Krummsäbelkämpfer wurden im 5. Jahrhundert vor Christus im Persischen Reich. Es handelte sich hierbei um hochbegabte Kämpfer, die ihren Spitznamen "die Unsterblichen" der Tatsache verdankten, dass ihre Reihen ungeachtet aller Verluste, die sie auf dem Schlachtfeld erleiden mochten, stets wieder vollständig aufgefüllt wurden, koste es, was es wolle. Während die vorderen Kampfreihen mit Speeren bewaffnet gegen den Feind vorrückten, ließen die hinteren Reihen Pfeile auf den Gegner hageln, um ihren Kameraden den Nahkampf zu erleichtern.
TEXT.Italian: Gli immortali erano un forte corpo, sviluppato dall'Impero Persiano nel quinto secolo a. C. Soldati di grande talento, gli immortali derivavano il loro soprannome dal fatto che, a prescindere dalle perdite riportate in battaglia, l'unità era riportata alla sua forza massima, senza badare al costo. Equipaggiata con arco e lancia, la fila anteriore avanzava verso il nemico, mentre quelle posteriori lanciavano nugoli di frecce per facilitare l'assalto.
TEXT.Spanish: Los inmortales eran una potente unidad creada por el imperio persa en el siglo V a. C. Estos soldados de enorme valía extraían su sobrenombre del hecho de que, al margen de las bajas sufridas y del coste, la fuerza del regimiento se restauraba en su totalidad al finalizar la batalla. Equipados con arco y lanza, la primera fila avanzaba sobre el enemigo mientras las posteriores allanaban su ataque descargando una lluvia de flechas.

TEXT.English: Pericles was the most prominent and influential Greek statesman, orator and general of Athens during the Golden Age-specifically, the time between the Persian and Peloponnesian wars. He was descended, through his mother, from the powerful and historically influential Alcmaeonid family.
TEXT.French: Périclès fut l'homme d'État, orateur et général grec le plus éminent et influent d'Athènes durant l'Âge d'or – plus précisément entre les guerres médiques et du Péloponnèse. Par sa mère, il descendait de la puissante et historiquement influente famille des Alcmaéonides.
TEXT.Polish: Perykles (ur. ok. 495 p.n.e., zm. 429 p.n.e.) - ateñski polityk, mówca (ta umiejêtnoœæ by³a konieczna do osi¹gniêcia sukcesu politycznego), reformator ateñskiej demokracji. Syn zwyciêzcy spod Mykale Ksantipposa, ze strony matki Agaristy wywodzi³ siê z rodu Alkmeonidów. Paradoksalnie, mimo ¿e w³adza w polis skupiona by³a w jego rêkach, to on stworzy³ demokracjê ateñsk¹. Wyst¹pi³ w roku 463 p.n.e. jako oskar¿yciel Kimona, obali³ z Efialtesem 462 p.n.e. Areopag, przez zaprowadzenie diet dla sêdziów itd. da³ ludowi wiêkszy udzia³ w sprawach pañstwowych i utwierdzi³ umiarkowan¹ demokracjê. W latach 444 - 429 p.n.e., obalaj¹c swego konserwatywnego przeciwnika Tukidydesa, by³ wybierany corocznie na stanowisko stratega czyli dowódcy wojskowego maj¹cego jednoczeœnie wp³yw na politykê Aten. Rozszerzy³ i wzmocni³ ustrój demokratyczny, otacza³ opiek¹ filozofów i artystów. Zaoszczêdzone pieni¹dze przeznacza³ na budowê wspania³ych gmachów (Partenon 447 - 438 p.n.e., Propyleje).

TEXT.English: So strong is the Persian aptitude for versifying everyday expressions that one can encounter poetry in almost every classical work, whether from Persian literature, science, or metaphysics. In short, the ability to write in verse form was a pre-requisite for any scholar. For example, almost half of Avicenna's medical writings are in verse.
TEXT.French: L'aptitude des Perses à versifier les expressions quotidiennes est si forte que l'on rencontre de la poésie dans presque toutes les oeuvres classiques, qu'elles appartiennent à la littérature persane, à la science ou à la métaphysique. En bref, la capacité à écrire en vers était une condition préalable à tout érudit. Par exemple, près de la moitié des écrits médicaux d'Avicenne sont en vers.

TEXT.English: Atahualpa, the last Sapa Inca became emperor when he defeated and executed his older half-brother Huascar in a civil war sparked by the death of their father, Inca Huayna Capac. In December 1532, a party of conquistadors led by Francisco Pizarro defeated and captured the Inca Emperor Atahualpa in the Battle of Cajamarca. The Spanish conquest of the Inca Empire was one of the most important campaigns in the Spanish colonization of the Americas. After years of preliminary exploration and military conflicts, it was the first step in a long campaign that took decades of fighting but ended in Spanish victory and colonization of the region known as the Viceroyalty of Peru with its capital at Lima, which became known as "The City of Kings". The conquest of the Inca Empire led to spin-off campaigns throughout the viceroyalty as well as expeditions towards the Amazon Basin as in the case of Spanish efforts to quell Amerindian resistance. The last Inca resistance was suppressed when the Spaniards annihilated the Neo-Inca State in Vilcabamba in 1572.

Peshmerga are the military forces of the autonomous region of Iraqi Kurdistan. Peshmerga means "one who confronts death" or "one who faces death". "Pesh" means to stand in front of (loosely translated as to confront or face) while "merga" means death. The overall formal head of the peshmerga is the President of Iraqi Kurdistan. The peshmerga force itself is largely divided and controlled separately by the Democratic Party of Kurdistan and the Patriotic Union of Kurdistan, although both pledge allegiance to the Kurdistan Regional Government. Efforts are under way to gather the entire force under the Ministry of Peshmerga Affairs. Peshmerga forces are responsible for defending the land, people and institutions of the Kurdistan Region.

Saint Peter Claver, S.J was a Spanish Jesuit priest and missionary born in Verd?(Catalonia) who, due to his life and work, became the patron saint of slaves, the Republic of Colombia and ministry to African Americans. During the 40 years of his ministry in Colombia it is estimated he personally baptized around 300,000 people. He is also patron saint for seafarers. He is considered a heroic example of what should be the Christian praxis of love and of the exercise of human rights.
TEXT.French: Saint Pierre Claver, S.J., était un prêtre jésuite espagnol et missionnaire né à Verd? (Catalogne). En raison de sa vie et de son oeuvre, il devint le saint patron des esclaves, de la République de Colombie et du ministère aux Afro-Américains. Pendant ses 40 années de ministère en Colombie, on estime qu'il a personnellement baptisé environ 300 000 personnes. Il est également le saint patron des marins. Il est considéré comme un exemple héroïque de la pratique chrétienne de l'amour et de l'exercice des droits humains.

TEXT.English: Petra is a historical and archaeological city in the southern Jordanian governorate of Ma'an that is famous for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system. Another name for Petra is the Rose City due to the color of the stone out of which it is carved. Established possibly as early as 312 BC as the capital city of the Arab Nabataeans, it is a symbol of Jordan, as well as Jordan's most-visited tourist attraction. It lies on the slope of Jebel al-Madhbah (identified by some as the biblical Mount Hor) in a basin among the mountains which form the eastern flank of Arabah (Wadi Araba), the large valley running from the Dead Sea to the Gulf of Aqaba. Petra has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1985.

Petyhorcy was a type of 16-18th century medium-armoured cavalry in Great Duchy of Lithuania and Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth. Initially it was formed from Circassians who came to Lithuania from under the rule of the Russian Tsardom (and hence were sometimes referred to simply as Czerkiesi - Circassians). The name is a corrupted Russian-language reference to a region of "Pyatigorye" ("Five Mountains", Beshtau) in Caucasus, which corresponds to the city of Pyatigorsk.

Pheasants refer to some members of the Phasianinae (Horsfield, 1821) subfamily of Phasianidae in the order Galliformes.[PARAGRAPH:2]Pheasants are characterised by strong sexual dimorphism, males being highly ornate with bright colours and adornments such as wattles and long tails. Males are usually larger than females and have longer tails. Males play no part in rearing the young. Pheasants typically eat seeds and some insects.[PARAGRAPH:2]The best-known is the Common Pheasant, which is widespread throughout the world in introduced feral populations and in farm operations. Various other pheasant species are popular in aviaries, such as the Golden Pheasant (Chrysolophus pictus).
TEXT.German: Fasane (Phasianus colchicus) gehören zur Ordnung der Hühnervögel. Fasane weisen einen deutlichen Sexualdimorphismus auf. Während die Hähne ein farbenprächtiges Gefieder zur Schau tragen, sind Hühner eher unauffällig braun gefärbt, wodurch sie sich aber auch besser tarnen können. Fasanenhähne verfügen außerdem über lange, spitze Schwanzfedern.[PARAGRAPH:2]Fasane stammen ursprünglich aus Mittel- oder Ostasien. Zu Jagdzwecken wurde der Vogel aber auch in Europa, den USA und anderen Teilen der Welt angesiedelt. Fasane leben in gemischten Landschaften, die ihnen sowohl genug Deckung, als auch offene Flächen zur Nahrungssuche bieten.[PARAGRAPH:2]Der Fasan wird als delikates Wildgeflügel geschätzt, seine Federn sind in vielen Kulturen als modische Accessoires begehrt.
TEXT.Polish: Ba¿ant (Phasianus colchicus)? gatunek œredniej wielkoœci, zasadniczo osiad³ego (choæ samce mog¹ koczowaæ) ptaka z rodziny kurowatych (Phasianidae).[PARAGRAPH:2]Pierwotnie nie zamieszkiwa³ Europy poza delt¹ Wo³gi. By³ to ptak azjatycki zamieszkuj¹cy Kaukaz i Zakaukazie oraz pas od Iranu po Mand¿uriê, Chiny i pó³nocn¹ czêœæ Pó³wyspu Indochiñskiego. Introdukowany w ca³ej Europie, Ameryce Pó³nocnej, Japonii, na Hawajach i w Nowej Zelandii. Nie odbywa wêdrówek. Azja Œrodkowa i Po³udniowo-Wschodnia by³a miejscem w którym dawniej dochodzi³o do powstawania i rozprzestrzeniania siê ró¿nych gatunków ba¿antowatych. Za rozprzestrzenienie tego ptaka na zachód by³ odpowiedzialny cz³owiek, który w czasach Staro¿ytnej Grecji i Rzymu (3 300 lat temu) wprowadzi³ go na tereny basenu Morza Œródziemnego, we W³oszech, Francji i Niemczech. Pod koniec œredniowiecza dosz³o do kolejnej fali sztucznego wprowadzania. Wtedy to ba¿anty zaaklimatyzowa³y siê w ca³ej umiarkowanej strefie Europy, a tak¿e w Ameryce Pó³nocnej. Np. w Czechach znano go ju¿ w XI wieku. Antropogeniczna introdukcja powiod³a siê te¿ w Japonii, Nowej Zelandii i na Hawajach. O tak du¿ym sukcesie zasiedlania i umiejêtnoœci przystosowania do nowych obszarów zadecydowa³a du¿a ró¿norodnoœæ warunków jakie panuj¹ na pierwotnych terenach zasiêgu. Jest to zarazem jedyny kurak, który sztucznie odchowywany adaptuje siê bez problemów do œrodowiska naturalnego.[PARAGRAPH:2]To najwiêkszy polny grzebi¹cy ptak Europy. Podobnie jak inne ba¿antowate ma charakterystycznie potê¿ne nogi (d³u¿sze ni¿ u kuropatwy), które pozwalaj¹ na szybkie i wytrwa³e poruszanie siê po ziemi. Rdzawo z³ote plecy z fioletowym po³yskiem, pióra zakoñczone jasno. Pstre barki z ³uskowym rysunkiem, przód br¹zowoczarny z po³yskiem, pióra szaro zakoñczone. Brzuch czarny. Wielkoœci¹ dorównuje kurze domowej. Podobnie jak ona, to ptak towarzyski, tworzy ma³e grupy. Wiek koguta poznaje siê po ostrodze, która s³u¿y w czasie walk z innymi samcami. Na niej od 2 roku ¿ycia dochodzi jeden pierœcieñ, a¿ do koñca ¿ycia, zatem liczba prze¿ytych lat jest o jeden wiêksza ni¿ liczba pierœcieni. Najstarszy ba¿ant, którego zaobserwowanego mia³ 27 lat.
