TEXT.English: The raccoon, Procyon lotor (sometimes spelled racoon), also known as the common raccoon, North American raccoon, northern raccoon and colloquially as coon, is a medium-sized mammal native to North America. It is the largest of the procyonid family, having a body length of 40 to 70 cm (16 to 28 in) and a body weight of 3.5 to 9 kg (8 to 20 lb). The raccoon is usually nocturnal and is omnivorous, with a diet consisting of about 40% invertebrates, 33% plant foods, and 27% vertebrates. It has a grayish coat, of which almost 90% is dense underfur, which insulates against cold weather. Two of its most distinctive features are its extremely dexterous front paws and its facial mask, which are themes in the mythology of several Native American tribes. Raccoons are noted for their intelligence, with studies showing that they are able to remember the solution to tasks up to three years later.[PARAGRAPH:2]The original habitats of the raccoon are deciduous and mixed forests of North America, but due to their adaptability they have extended their range to mountainous areas, coastal marshes, and urban areas, where many homeowners consider them to be pests. As a result of escapes and deliberate introductions in the mid-20th century, raccoons are now also distributed across the European mainland, the Caucasus region and Japan.[PARAGRAPH:2]Though previously thought to be solitary, there is now evidence that raccoons engage in gender-specific social behavior. Related females often share a common area, while unrelated males live together in groups of up to four animals to maintain their positions against foreign males during the mating season, and other potential invaders. Home range sizes vary anywhere from 3 hectares for females in cities to 50 km2 for males in prairies (7 acres to 20 sq mi). After a gestation period of about 65 days, two to five young, known as "kits", are born in spring. The kits are subsequently raised by their mother until dispersion in late fall. Although captive raccoons have been known to live over 20 years, their average life expectancy in the wild is only 1.8 to 3.1 years. In many areas hunting and traffic accidents are the two most common causes of death.
TEXT.Polish: Szop pracz - gatunek œrednich rozmiarów ssaka z rodziny szopowatych (Procyonidae) pochodz¹cy z Ameryki Pó³nocnej. Najwiêkszy przedstawiciel rodziny szopowatych, o ciele d³ugoœci od 40 do 70 cm i masie 3,5-9 kg, zazwyczaj aktywny w nocy. Szop jest wszystko¿erny, a jego dieta zawiera w 40% bezkrêgowce, w 33% - roœliny i w 27% - krêgowce. Sierœæ szopa o szarym kolorze w 90% sk³ada siê z gêstego podszerstka, który chroni przed zimnem. Najbardziej charakterystyczne cechy szopa pracza to niezwykle zrêczne przednie ³apy i czarny wzór maski wokó³ oczu; s¹ one elementami mitologii kilku szczepów Indian. Szopy znane s¹ z inteligencji; badania wykazuj¹, ¿e zwierzêta te przechowuj¹ w pamiêci rozwi¹zania zadañ nawet przez trzy lata.

TEXT.English: Rafael Solares, a Samala chief, captain of Soxtonoxmu, capital village in the Santa Ynez Valley.
TEXT.French: Rafael Solares, chef Samala, capitaine de Soxtonoxmu, village principal de la vallée de Santa Ynez.

TEXT.English: A raft is any flat structure for support or transportation over water. It is the most basic of boat design, characterized by the absence of a hull. Although there are cross-over boat types that blur this definition, rafts are usually kept afloat by using any combination of buoyant materials such as wood, sealed barrels, or inflated air chambers (such as pontoons), and are typically not propelled by an engine. Traditional or primitive rafts are constructed of wood or reeds.
TEXT.French: Un radeau est une structure plate utilisée pour le support ou le transport sur l'eau. C'est le bateau le plus basique, caractérisé par l'absence de coque. Bien que certains types intermédiaires existent, les radeaux sont généralement maintenus à flot par des matériaux flottants tels que bois, tonneaux scellés ou chambres à air gonflées (comme les flotteurs) et ne sont généralement pas propulsés par un moteur. Les radeaux traditionnels ou primitifs sont construits en bois ou en roseaux.
TEXT.Spanish: Una embarcación primitiva.

TEXT.English: Rajaraja Chola I is one of the greatest kings of the Chola Empire, who ruled between 985 and 1014 CE. He laid the foundation for the growth of the Chola empire, by conquering the kingdoms of southern India and the Chola Empire expanded as far as Sri Lanka in the south, and Kalinga (Orissa) in the northeast. He fought many battles with the Chalukyas in the north and the Pandyas in the south. By conquering Vengi, Rajaraja laid the foundations for the Later Chola dynasty. He invaded Sri Lanka and started a century-long Chola occupation of the island. He streamlined the administrative system with the division of the country into various districts and by standardizing revenue collection through systematic land surveys. He built the magnificent Brihadisvara Temple in Thanjavur and through it enabled wealth distribution amongst his subjects. His successes enabled his son Rajendra Chola I to extend the empire even further.

The Rajput was a primarily Hindu warrior caste located in the northwestern region of India once known as Rajputana, now Rajasthan. Taking great pride in their ancestry and its emphasis on military virtues, the Rajput grew in power until 1616, when all the major clans had no choice but to submit to the might of Akbar and his Mughal Empire. The Rajput warriors were known for using the unique and deadly pata, a sword-like weapon where the blade and the gauntlet were integrated into a single piece that was held by the wielder.

Raja Ram Mohan Roy was the founder of the Brahmo Sabha movement in 1828, which engendered the Brahmo Samaj, an influential Bengali socio-religious reform movement. His influence was apparent in the fields of politics, public administration and education as well as religion. He is best known for his efforts to establish the abolishment of the practice of sati, the Hindu funeral practice in which the widow was compelled to sacrifice herself in her husband's funeral pyre in some parts of Bengal. It was he who first introduced the word "Hinduism" into the English language in 1816. For his diverse contributions to society, Raja Ram Mohan Roy is regarded as one of the most important figures in the Bengali renaissance. His efforts to protect Hinduism and Indian rights by participating in British government earned him the title "The Father of the Indian Renaissance". The British government has named a street in memory of Ram Mohan Roy as "Raja Rammohan Way".

The Rapa Nui are believed to have settled Easter Island between 300 and 1200 CE. Previously, the date of arrival was estimated to be around 700-800 CE, but more-recent evidence from radiocarbon dating supports an arrival date as late as 1200 CE. The Rapa Nui People have been found to be of Polynesian origin through genetic analysis of mitochondrial DNA of pre-historic skeletons. Genetic analysis performed by Erik Thorsby and other geneticists in 2007 revealed genetic markers of European and Amerindian origin that suggest that the Rapa Nui had European and Amerindian contributions to their DNA during or before the early 1800s.

The honey badger (Mellivora capensis), also known as the ratel, is a species of mustelid native to Africa, the Middle East and the Indian Subcontinent. Despite its name, the honey badger does not closely resemble other badger species, instead bearing more anatomical similarities to weasels. It is classed as Least Concern by the IUCN due to its extensive range and general environmental adaptations. It is a primarily carnivorous species, and has few natural predators due to its thick skin and ferocious defensive abilities.
TEXT.German: Der Honigdachs (Mellivora capensis), der auch unter dem Namen Ratel bekannt ist, ist eine in Afrika und Asien heimische Marderart. Das Fell der Honigdachse hat eine charakteristische, auffällige Färbung. Die Oberseite ist weißgrau, die Unterseite dagegen schwarz. Es gibt aber in Afrika auch vollständig schwarze Exemplare. Honigdachse erreichen Kopf-Rumpf-Längen von 60 bis 77 cm und ein Körpergewicht von 7 bis 13 kg. Sie haben einen stämmigen Körper und einen breiten Kopf mit einer kurzen, spitzen Schnauze. Beine und Schwanz sind im Vergleich zum Restkörper relativ kurz. Die Vorderbeine des Ratels sind mit scharfen Krallen bewehrt.[NEWLINE]Honigdachse fühlen sich in Grasländern und Steppen, aber auch in gemäßigten Wäldern und sogar in Gebirgsregionen bis 3000 m Höhe heimisch. Sie sind dämmerungs- und nachtaktiv, bei kühler Witterung trifft man sie eventuell aber auch tagsüber an. Sie schlafen in selbstgegrabenen Bauen, von denen sich stets mehrere in ihrem Revier befinden. Honigdachse sind ausgesprochen furchtlos und aggressiv und sie haben kaum natürliche Feinde. Sie können sich mit ihren scharfen Krallen und einem übelriechenden Analsekret (ähnlich wie dem des Stinktiers) ausgezeichnet verteidigen und greifen selbst größere Tiere an, wenn sie sich bedroht fühlen. Honigdachse sind eigentlich Fleischfresser, aber sie haben auch wie ihr Name schon verrät, eine Vorliebe für Honig.[NEWLINE]Honigdachse werden von Menschen oft als Plage angesehen, da sie Bienenstöcke auf der Suche nach Honig zerstören und manchmal auch in Ställe eindringen, um Geflügel zu reißen. Deshalb wird ihnen oft mit Giftködern und Fallen nachgestellt, was dazu geführt hat, dass sie in manchen Regionen selten geworden sind. Sie zählen aber dennoch nicht zu den bedrohten Tierarten.
TEXT.Polish: Ratel, miodo¿er (Mellivora capensis)? gatunek drapie¿nego ssaka z rodziny ³asicowatych, zamieszkuj¹cy lasy, zaroœla, stepy i sawanny Afryki na zachód, wschód i po³udnie od Sahary, oprócz d¿ungli Afryki Œrodkowej, Azjê Po³udniow¹, a¿ po Nepal. Jest jedynym przedstawicielem rodzaju Mellivora. Osi¹ga d³ugoœæ cia³a 60-70 cm, ogona 20-30 cm. Wygl¹dem, wielkoœci¹ i sposobem poruszania siê najbardziej przypomina rosomaka. Mocna budowa cia³a, krótkie i muskularne koñczyny, krótki ogon, sierœæ d³uga, sztywna, ubarwienie grzbietu srebrzystobia³e, spód i boki cia³a brunatnoczarne, na granicy obydwu barw bia³a prêga, w przednich ³apach d³ugie pazury. Skóra na grzbiecie gruba i sztywna stanowi swoist¹ tarczê przed rozmaitymi uk¹szeniami, np. wê¿y, innych drapie¿ników, przed uk³uciami pszczó³, jest ona niezwykle luŸna dziêki rozwiniêtej podskórnej tkance t³uszczowej, co stanowi dodatkowy atut obronny. Ratel prowadzi g³ównie nocny tryb ¿ycia, rzadziej bywa aktywny w dzieñ, ¿yje pojedynczo, czasem parami, za kryjówki s³u¿¹ mu wykopane samodzielnie nory, naturalne zag³êbienia terenu lub nory innych zwierz¹t. Posiada niewielu naturalnych wrogów. W razie zagro¿enia wystrzykuje w stronê intruza cuchn¹c¹ ciecz wydzielan¹ przez gruczo³y umieszczone w okolicy odbytu. Bytuje g³ównie na ziemi, potrafi jednak dobrze wspinaæ siê na drzewa, gdzie wydobywa spod kory i zag³êbieñ w pniach jaszczurki i owady, a tak¿e miód, w wyszukiwaniu którego pomaga mu ptak miodowód, ¿ywi¹cy siê resztkami pozosta³ymi po jego ¿erowaniu. Pomimo stosunkowo du¿ej liczebnoœci na zamieszkanym przez siebie obszarze ratel jest stosunkowo ma³o znanym gatunkiem, rzadko prezentowanym równie¿ w ogrodach zoologicznych.

TEXT.English: raven, any of several species of heavy-billed, dark birds, larger than crows. Closely related, both ravens and crows are species of the genus Corvus. The raven has a heavier bill and shaggier plumage than the crow, especially around the throat. The raven's lustrous feathers also have a blue or purplish iridescence.[PARAGRAPH:2]The common raven (C. corax) is the largest of the perching birds (see passeriform): it reaches a length of up to 66 cm (26 inches) and has a wingspan of more than 1.3 metres (4 feet).[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: http://www.britannica.com
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Raben[COLOR_REVERT] gehören zusammen mit den Krähen zur Familie der Rabenvögel, wobei Raben in der Regel größer sind. Der einzige in Europa lebende Vertreter ist der Kolkrabe (Corvus corax). Mit einer Körperlänge von max. 67 cm übertrifft er sogar den Mäusebussard. Weibchen sind etwas kleiner. Kolkraben besitzen einen großen und kräftigen Schnabel. Das schwarze Gefieder der adulten Tiere glänzt metallisch grün oder blauviolett. Schnabel und Beine sind ebenfalls schwarz.[NEWLINE]Kolkraben sind vor allem auf der nördlichen Halbkugel weit verbreitet, regional gibt es jedoch größere Lücken, die durch Jagd verursacht wurden. Die anpassungsfähigen Vögel kommen in Hochgebirgen, Wäldern, halboffenen Landschaften aller Art und sogar in der Halbwüste vor. Sie ernähren sich vor allem von Fleisch oder Vogeleiern, verzehren aber auch Früchte, Mais oder Nahrungsabfälle. Oft suchen sie ihre Beute im Flug oder von einem Aussichtspunkt, aber auch zu Fuß, wobei potentielle Nahrung mit dem Schnabel "beprobt" wird. Der Schnabel dient auch zum Wegräumen von Holz oder Steinen oder zum Graben. Harte Schalen von Nüssen usw. lassen die Raben aus großer Höhe auf harte Unterlagen fallen, um sie zu zerbrechen. Bei der Aussicht auf frisches Aas stürzen sie sich sofort nach der Tötung des Opfers z.B. durch Jäger auf die Beute. Überschüssige Nahrung wird gern vergraben. Die Lautäußerungen der Kolkraben sind sehr vielfältig, oft imitieren sie Rufe von Krähen und Auerhähnen, auch Hundegebell ahmen sie nach. Wie alle Rabenvögel sind Kolkraben verspielt, lassen sich im Schnee oder Sand herunterrollen, schaukeln (bis zur Riesenfelge), balancieren und spielen mit Gegenständen. Ein Gelege besteht im Schnett aus drei bis sechs Eiern, die vergleichsweise klein sind. Die Jungtiere sind Nesthocker. In Gefangenschaft können Raben 30 Jahre und älter werden, der älteste Tower-Rabe wurde 44 Jahre alt.[NEWLINE]Jahrhundertelang galten Kolkraben als Schädlinge der Jagd und der Landwirtschaft, weshalb sie in Teilen Mittel- und Westeuropas sowie im Osten der USA ausgerottet wurden. Erst mit der Jagdruhe im Zweiten Weltkrieg erholten sich die Bestände, teilweise halfen auch Auswilderungsprogramme. Heute haben sie eine ganzjährige Schonzeit. In der Mythologie spielt der Rabe schon lange eine Rolle. So wird er u.a. im Alten Testament erwähnt, ist Bestandteil von altgriechischen Fabeln, deutschen Märchen, Romanen und der nordischen Mythologie (die Raben Odins). Er galt früher als Unglücksbote (Unglücksrabe) und man glaubte, Raben würden ihre Jungen früh im Stich lassen (Rabeneltern).
TEXT.Polish: Kruk zwyczajny, kruk (Corvus corax) - gatunek du¿ego osiad³ego ptaka z rodziny krukowatych (Corvidae). Wystêpuje na pó³kuli pó³nocnej, jest najbardziej rozpowszechnionym gatunkiem spoœród wszystkich krukowatych. Obecnie wyró¿nia siê dziesiêæ podgatunków, wykazuj¹cych niewielkie odmiennoœci w morfologii - pomimo i¿ niedawne badania wykaza³y znaczne ró¿nice genetyczne wœród populacji z ró¿nych regionów. W Polsce nieliczny ptak lêgowy (lokalnie mo¿e byæ œrednio liczny).

TEXT.English: The razorbill (Alca torda) is a colonial seabird that only comes to land in order to breed. This agile bird chooses one partner for life; females lay one egg per year. Razorbills nest along coastal cliffs in enclosed or slightly exposed crevices. The parents spend equal amounts of time incubating. Once the chick has hatched, the parents take turns foraging for their young and sometimes fly long distances before finding prey.[PARAGRAPH:2]The razorbill is primarily black with a white underside. The male and female are identical in plumage; however, males are generally larger than females. In 1918, the razorbill was protected in the United States by the Migratory Bird Treaty Act. Presently, the major threat for the population is the destruction of breeding sites.
TEXT.Polish: Alka zwyczajna, alka, alka krzywonosa (Alca torda) - gatunek œredniego ptaka morskiego z rodziny alk (Alcidae), jedyny przedstawiciel rodzaju Alca. Zamieszkuje ca³y pó³nocny Atlantyk, w tym ptasie wyspy mórz pó³nocnych. GnieŸdzi siê na wybrze¿ach Atlantyku od wschodnich wybrze¿y Ameryki Pó³nocnej, przez Grenlandiê, Islandiê, wyspê Jan Mayen, Wyspê NiedŸwiedzi¹, Irlandiê, Wyspy Brytyjskie, Wyspy Owcze, Francjê, po³udniowe i wschodnie wybrze¿a Morza Pó³nocnego i Morza Norweskiego a¿ po Pó³wysep Kolski na wschodzie. Zasadniczo to gatunek osiad³y, ale niektóre populacje s¹ wêdrowne. Alki zimuj¹ na zachodnich wybrze¿ach Atlantyku, w Afryce pó³nocno-zachodniej, kanale La Manche, Morzu Œródziemnym, Morzu Pó³nocnym (nieliczne pary na Helgolandzie) oraz na Ba³tyku. M³ode ptaki dolatuj¹ dalej ni¿ doros³e.

TEXT.English: The word razzia is used in French colonial context particularly for raids to plunder and capture slaves from among the people of Western and Central Africa, also known as rezzou when practiced by the Tuareg. The word was adopted from gaziya of Algerian Arabic vernacular and later became a figurative name for any act of pillage, with its verb form razzier.
TEXT.French: Le terme razzia est utilisé dans le contexte colonial français, notamment pour désigner les raids visant à piller et capturer des esclaves parmi les peuples d'Afrique de l'Ouest et centrale, également appelés rezzou lorsqu'ils sont pratiqués par les Touaregs. Le mot est dérivé de gaziya en arabe algérien vernaculaire et est devenu un nom figuré pour tout acte de pillage, avec son verbe razzier.

TEXT.English: Ra is the ancient Egyptian solar deity. By the Fifth Dynasty (2494 to 2345 BCE) he had become a major god in ancient Egyptian religion, identified primarily with the midday sun. In later Egyptian dynastic times, Ra was merged with the god Horus, as Ra-Horakhty ("Ra, who is Horus of the Two Horizons"). He was believed to rule in all parts of the created world: the sky, the earth, and the underworld. He was associated with the falcon or hawk. When in the New Kingdom the god Amun rose to prominence he was fused with Ra as Amun-Ra. During the Amarna Period, Akhenaten suppressed the cult of Ra in favour of another solar deity, the Aten, the deified solar disc, but after the death of Akhenaten the cult of Ra was restored.
TEXT.Russian: Ра - древнеегипетское солнечное божество. Во времена Пятой династии (2494–2345 гг. до н.э.) он стал главным богом древнеегипетской религии, отождествляемой в первую очередь с полуденным солнцем. В более поздние египетские династические времена Ра был объединен с богом Гором, как Ра-Хорахти («Ра, который есть Гор двух горизонтов»). Считалось, что он правил всеми частями сотворенного мира: небом, землей и подземным миром. Он был связан с соколом или ястребом. Когда в Новом Царстве бог Амон приобрел известность, он слился с Ра как Амон-Ра. В период Амарны Эхнатон подавил культ Ра в пользу другого солнечного божества, Атона, обожествленного солнечного диска, однако после смерти Эхнатона культ Ра был восстановлен.

TEXT.English: The use of aerial photography rapidly matured during the First World War, as aircraft used for reconnaissance purposes were outfitted with cameras to record enemy movements and defences. At the start of the conflict, the usefulness of aerial photography was not fully appreciated, with reconnaissance being accomplished with map sketching from the air.
TEXT.French: L'utilisation de la photographie aérienne s'est rapidement développée pendant la Première Guerre mondiale, les avions de reconnaissance étant équipés de caméras pour enregistrer les mouvements et défenses ennemies. Au début du conflit, l'utilité de la photographie aérienne n'était pas pleinement reconnue, la reconnaissance se faisait principalement par esquisses de cartes depuis les airs.

TEXT.English: The red fox (Vulpes vulpes) is the largest of the true foxes and the most geographically spread member of the Carnivora, being distributed across the entire Northern Hemisphere from the Arctic Circle to North Africa, Central America and Asia. Its range has increased alongside human expansion, having been introduced to Australia, where it is considered harmful to native mammal and bird populations. Because of these factors, it is listed as Least Concern for extinction by the IUCN. It is included among the IUCN's list of the "world's 100 worst invasive species".[PARAGRAPH:2]The red fox originated from smaller-sized ancestors from Eurasia during the Middle Villafranchian period, and colonised North America shortly after the Wisconsian glaciation. Among the true foxes, the red fox represents a more progressive form in the direction of carnivory. Apart from its large size, the red fox is distinguished from other fox species by its ability to adapt quickly to new environments and, unlike most of its related species, is not listed as endangered anywhere. Despite its name, the species often produces individuals with abnormal colourings, including albinos and melanists. Forty-five subspecies are currently recognised, which are divided into two categories: the large northern foxes, and the small, primitive southern foxes of Asia and the Middle East.[PARAGRAPH:2]Red foxes are social animals, whose groups are led by a mated pair which monopolises breeding. Subordinates within a group are typically the young of the mated pair, which remain with their parents to assist in caring for new kits. The species primarily feeds on small rodents, though it may also target leporids, game birds, reptiles, invertebrates and young ungulates. Fruit and vegetable matter is also eaten on occasion. Although the red fox tends to displace or even kill smaller predators, it is nonetheless vulnerable to attack from larger predators, such as wolves, coyotes, golden jackals and medium- and large-sized felines.[PARAGRAPH:2]The species has a long history of association with humans, having been extensively hunted as a pest and furbearer for centuries, as well as being prominently represented in human folklore and mythology. Because of its widespread distribution and large population, the red fox is one of the most important furbearing animals harvested for the fur trade.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rotfuchs[COLOR_REVERT] (Vulpes vulpes) ist der häufigste Wildhund Europas und die einzige Fuchsart in Mitteleuropa. Auffälligstes Merkmal des Rotfuchses ist sein an der Oberseite rötliches Fell, die Bauchseite ist weiß. Je nach Verbreitungsgebiet treten auch andere Farbtöne auf. Der häufig vorkommende Birkfuchs hat eine charakteristische weiße Schwanzspitze. Das Winterfell ist dichter als das Sommerfell. Ein männliches Exemplar erreicht in Europa eine Körperlänge von 65 bis 75 cm, zzgl. des Schwanzes von 35 bis 45 cm. Die Weibchen sind etwas kleiner. Der Fußabdruck des Rotfuchses ähnelt dem eines Hundes.[NEWLINE]Das Verbreitungsgebiet ist größer als bei anderen Raubtieren und erstreckt sich von oberhalb des nördlichen Polarkreises bis fast in die Tropen. In Australien wurden Rotfüchse aus England zur traditionellen Fuchsjagd ausgesetzt und erbeuteten dort zahlreiche Beuteltiere. In Tasmanien sollen sie deshalb aus Artenschutzgründen ausgerottet werden. Bei seinen Beutezügen ist der Rotfuchs nicht wählerisch. Er fühlt sich in nahezu jeder Landschaftsform wohl, macht auch vor menschlichen Siedlungen nicht halt. Er begnügt sich mit allem, was einfach zu finden ist (opportunistische Ernährung), von kleinen Säugern und Vögeln bis zu Essensresten. Nachts hält er sich in Parks oder auf Friedhöfen auf, versteckt sich häufig auch in Schuppen oder dichtem Bewuchs entlang der Eisenbahntrassen. Der klassische Unterschlupf ist ein Erdbau, der eine Hauptröhre, einen Kessel und mehrere Fluchtröhren besitzt. Manchmal werden Dachsbaue genutzt, mitunter leben beide Arten auch zusammen. Die Fähe bring vier bis sechs Jungtiere zur Welt, die anfangs blind sind und dunkles Fell haben. Bis in die 1970er Jahre galten Füchse als Einzelgänger, doch englische Studien bei Oxford zeigten, dass die Füchse dort in Familiengruppen leben. Das Sozialleben der Tiere ist kompliziert und noch nicht vollständig erforscht. Natürliche Feinde hat der Rotfuchs nur wenige. Von Stein- und Seeadlern wird er gelegentlich gejagt. Für Uhus sind die Jungtiere eine Beute. Diverse Parasiten können den Rotfuchs befallen, u.a. der Fuchsbandwurm oder Fadenwürmer, die auch für den Menschen gefährlich sind. Neben Staupe und Räude (früher auch Tollwut) ist heute der Straßenverkehr eine wesentliche Todesursache für Füchse.[NEWLINE]Funde auf der Orkneyinsel belegen, dass Füchse bereits in der späten Eiszeit gezüchtet wurden. Fuchsleber galt einst als Brechmittel, bis ins Mittelalter auch als Tuberkulosemittel. Das Fell ist je nach Trend oder Akzeptanz von Pelzen in der Modeindustrie gefragt. In vielen Staaten werden Füchse legal gejagt, was hauptsächlich dem Schutz diverser Vogelarten gilt. In der Bibel ist der Fuchs ein Symbol u.a. für Wildnis und List, in der Ikonografie ist er die Personifikation der Sünde. In mittelalterlichen Geschichten wird er als Reineke bezeichnet. Bis ins 20. Jahrhundert dominierte die negative Darstellung in Märchen und Kinderbüchern.

TEXT.English: The red panda (Ailurus fulgens, or shining-cat), is a small arboreal mammal native to the eastern Himalayas and southwestern China. It is the only extant species of the genus Ailurus. Slightly larger than a domestic cat, it has reddish-brown fur, a long, shaggy tail, and a waddling gait due to its shorter front legs. It feeds mainly on bamboo, but is omnivorous and may also eat eggs, birds, insects, and small mammals. It is a solitary animal, mainly active from dusk to dawn, and is largely sedentary during the day.[PARAGRAPH:2]The red panda has been classified as Vulnerable by IUCN because its population is estimated at fewer than 10,000 mature individuals. Although red pandas are protected by national laws in their range countries, their numbers in the wild continue to decline mainly due to habitat loss and fragmentation, poaching, and inbreeding depression.[PARAGRAPH:2]The red panda has been previously classified in the families Procyonidae (raccoons) and Ursidae (bears), but recent research has placed it in its own family Ailuridae, in superfamily Musteloidea along with Mustelidae and Procyonidae. Two subspecies are recognized.

A tribal chief is the leader of a tribal society or chiefdom. The term is usually distinct from chiefs at still lower levels, such as village headman (geographically defined) or clan chief (an essentially genealogical notion), as the notion "tribal" rather requires an ethno-cultural identity (racial, linguistic, religious etc.) as well as some political (representative, legislative, executive and/or judicial) expression. In certain situations, and especially in a colonial context, the most powerful member of either a confederation or a federation of such tribal, clan or village chiefs would be referred to as a paramount chief. This term has largely fallen out of use, however, and such personages are now often called kings.

The bow seems to have been invented in the later Paleolithic or early Mesolithic periods. The oldest signs of its use in Europe come from the Stellmoor (de) in the Ahrensburg valley (de) north of Hamburg, Germany and dates from the late Paleolithic, about 10,000-9000 BC. The arrows were made of pine and consisted of a mainshaft and a 15-20 centimetres (5.9-7.9 inches) long fore shaft with a flint point. There are no definite earlier bows; previous pointed shafts are known, but may have been launched by spear-throwers rather than bows. The oldest bows known so far come from the Holmegård swamp in Denmark. Bows eventually replaced the spear-thrower as the predominant means for launching shafted projectiles, on every continent except Australasia, though spear-throwers persisted alongside the bow in parts of the Americas, notably Mexico and among the Inuit.

A tribal chief is the leader of a tribal society or chiefdom. The term is usually distinct from chiefs at still lower levels, such as village headman (geographically defined) or clan chief (an essentially genealogical notion), as the notion "tribal" rather requires an ethno-cultural identity (racial, linguistic, religious etc.) as well as some political (representative, legislative, executive and/or judicial) expression. In certain situations, and especially in a colonial context, the most powerful member of either a confederation or a federation of such tribal, clan or village chiefs would be referred to as a paramount chief. This term has largely fallen out of use, however, and such personages are now often called kings.

The reindeer has an important economic role for all circumpolar peoples, including the Saami, Nenets, Khants, Evenks, Yukaghirs, Chukchi, and Koryaks in Eurasia. It is believed that domestication started between the Bronze and Iron Ages. Siberian deer owners also use the reindeer to ride on (Siberian reindeer are larger than their Scandinavian relatives). For breeders, a single owner may own hundreds or even thousands of animals. The numbers of Russian herders have been drastically reduced since the fall of the Soviet Union. The sale of fur and meat is an important source of income. Reindeer were introduced into Alaska near the end of the 19th century; they interbreed with native caribou subspecies there. Reindeer herders on the Seward Peninsula have experienced significant losses to their herds from animals (such as wolves) following the wild caribou during their migrations.

An imperial guard or palace guard is a special group of troops (or a member thereof) of an empire, typically closely associated directly with the Emperor or Empress. Usually these troops embody a more elite status than other imperial forces, including the regular armed forces, and maintain special rights, privileges and traditions. Because the head of state often wishes to be protected by the best soldiers available, their numbers and organisation may be expanded to carry out additional tasks. In the post-colonial period, the term has been used colloquially and derisively to describe the staff of a person, usually a politician or corporate executive officer, that acts to prevent direct communication with the person.
TEXT.Italian: Unità per la difesa della capitale. Solo una è permessa per ogni civiltà.
TEXT.Spanish: Unidad defensora de la capital. Solo se permite una por civilización.
TEXT.Polish: Elitarna jednostka. Œwietnie siê nadaje do obrony stolicy Twojego imperium.
TEXT.Russian: Имперская гвардия или дворцовая гвардия - это особая группа войск (или их подразделений) империи, обычно тесно связанная с Императором или Императрицей. Как правило эти войска обладают более элитарным статусом, чем другие имперские силы, включая регулярные вооруженные силы, и сохраняют за собой особые права, привилегии и традиции. Поскольку глава государства часто хочет быть защищенным лучшими имеющимися солдатами, их численность и организация могут быть расширены для выполнения дополнительных задач. В постколониальный период термин использовался в разговорной и насмешливой форме для характеристики определенной должности или профессии, обычно политического деятеля или корпоративного должностного лица, который препятствует прямому общению с человеком.

TEXT.English: 3D Printers have enabled parts to be made to specifications and on-site. Mechanics are now far more capable of making immediate fixes on location and have therefore not only become capable of extremely rapid repair jobs, but have also been outfitted with dedicated Dropship transportation where the ships can provide the power needed for the mini computer labs necessary to draw up the necessary parts.
TEXT.French: Les imprimantes 3D ont permis la fabrication de pièces conformes aux spécifications directement sur site. Les mécaniciens peuvent désormais effectuer des réparations immédiates, devenant capables de réparations ultra-rapides, et sont équipés de transports Dropship dédiés fournissant l'énergie nécessaire aux mini-laboratoires informatiques pour concevoir les pièces nécessaires.
TEXT.Polish: Drukowanie przestrzenne (ang. 3D printing) - proces wytwarzania trójwymiarowych, fizycznych obiektów na podstawie komputerowego modelu. Pocz¹tkowo by³a to jedynie jedna z metod szybkiego prototypowania u¿ywana zarówno do budowania form i samych prototypów. Wraz z postêpami dok³adnoœci wykonania obiektów przez drukarki 3D, sta³a siê to tak¿e metoda wykonywania gotowych obiektów, w tym zabawek, ubrañ, czekoladek, a nawet protez.
TEXT.Russian: 3D-принтеры позволили изготавливать детали в соответствии со спецификациями и на месте. Механики теперь гораздо более способны делать немедленные исправления на месте и поэтому не только стали способны выполнять чрезвычайно быстрые ремонтные работы, но также были оснащены специальным транспортным средством - десантными кораблями, обеспечивающими их электроэнергией, необходимой для мини-компьютерных лабораторий, необходимых для рисования всевозможных деталей и запчастей.

TEXT.English: The Iraqi Republican Guard was a branch of the Iraqi military from 1969 to 2003, primarily during the presidency of Saddam Hussein. It later became the Republican Guard Corps, and then the Republican Guard Forces Command (RGFC) with its expansion into two corps. The Republican Guard was disbanded in 2003, after the invasion of Iraq by a U.S.-led international coalition.
TEXT.French: La Garde Républicaine irakienne était une branche des forces armées irakiennes de 1969 à 2003, principalement sous la présidence de Saddam Hussein. Elle devint ensuite le Corps de la Garde Républicaine, puis le Commandement des Forces de la Garde Républicaine (RGFC), avec une expansion en deux corps. La Garde Républicaine fut dissoute en 2003, après l'invasion de l'Irak menée par une coalition internationale dirigée par les États-Unis.

TEXT.English: The resin produced by most plants is composed mainly of terpenes and derivatives. The most common terpenes in resin are the bicyclic terpenes alpha-pinene, beta-pinene, delta-3 carene, and sabinene, the monocyclic terpenes limonene and terpinolene, and smaller amounts of the tricyclic sesquiterpenes, longifolene, caryophyllene and delta-cadinene. Some resins also contain a high proportion of resin acids. The individual components of resin can be separated by fractional distillation. Rosins on the other hand are less volatile and consist, inter alia, of diterpenes. Notable examples of plant resins include amber, Balm of Gilead, balsam, Canada balsam, Boswellia, copal from trees of Protium copal and Hymenaea courbaril, dammar gum from trees of the family Dipterocarpaceae, Dragon's blood from the dragon trees (Dracaena species), elemi, frankincense from Boswellia sacra, galbanum from Ferula gummosa, gum guaiacum from the lignum vitae trees of the genus Guaiacum, kauri gum from trees of Agathis australis, labdanum from mediterranean species of Cistus, mastic (plant resin) from the mastic tree Pistacia lentiscus, myrrh from shrubs of Commiphora, sandarac resin from Tetraclinis articulata, the national tree of Malta, styrax (a Benzoin resin from various Styrax species), Spinifex resin from Australian Spinifex grasses, and turpentine, distilled from pine resin. Amber is fossil resin (also called resinite) from coniferous and other tree species. Copal, kauri gum, dammar and other resins may also be found as subfossil deposits. Subfossil copal can be distinguished from genuine fossil amber because it becomes tacky when a drop of a solvent such as acetone or chloroform is placed on it.

The Rhodesian African Rifles (RAR) was the oldest regiment in the Rhodesian Army, formed in May 1940 in the British colony of Southern Rhodesia. The RAR was the successor to the Rhodesia Native Regiment (RNR) and inherited its battle honours. The RNR had fought in East Africa and Portuguese East Africa from 1916 to 1918 during World War 1.
TEXT.French: Les Rhodesian African Rifles (RAR) étaient le régiment le plus ancien de l'armée rhodésienne, formé en mai 1940 dans la colonie britannique de Rhodésie du Sud. Les RAR furent les successeurs du Rhodesia Native Regiment (RNR) et héritèrent de ses décorations. Le RNR combattit en Afrique de l'Est et en Afrique orientale portugaise de 1916 à 1918 pendant la Première Guerre mondiale.

TEXT.English: A Ribauldequin, also known as a rabauld, ribault, ribaudkin, infernal machine or organ gun, was a late medieval volley gun with many small-caliber iron barrels set up parallel on a platform, in use during the 14th and 15th centuries. When the gun was fired in a volley, it created a shower of iron shot. They were employed, specifically, during the early fifteenth century, and continued serving, mostly, as an anti-personnel gun. The name organ gun comes from the multiple barrels with the likeness of pipe organ.[PARAGRAPH:2]As an early type of multiple barrel firearm, the ribauldequin is sometimes considered the predecessor of the 19th century mitrailleuse.[PARAGRAPH:2]The first known ribauldequin was used by the army of Edward III of England in 1339 in France during the Hundred Years War. Edward's ribauldequins had twelve barrels which fired salvoes of twelve balls. Nine-barreled ribaults were used by Milan and other participants in the Italian Wars. Ribauldequins were also used in the Wars of the Roses. During the Second Battle of St Albans, Burgundian soldiers under Yorkist control utilized the weapon against the Lancastrian Army led by Queen Margaret of Anjou. In Eastern Europe, a heavier version of the organ gun was used by Stephen the Great of Moldavia as late as 1475, as attested to by Polish chronicler Bieski.
TEXT.Polish: Kartaczownica Reffye - skonstruowana przez belgijskiego wynalazcê Josepha Montigny i udoskonalona przez Francuza de Reffye kartaczownica salwowa. Kartaczownica Reffye posiada³a kilkanaœcie (najczêœciej 25, maksymalna spotykana liczba to 37) oddzielnych luf zamontowanych na podwoziu artyleryjskim, ³adowanych odtylcowo za pomoc¹ dysku wype³nionego nabojami w ten sposób, ¿e ich rozmieszczenie pasowa³o do rozstawu luf. Po odsuniêciu tylnej czêœci zamka, do broni wsuwano magazynek, po czym ponownie zamykano blok zamka. Po naciœniêciu dŸwigni spustowej nastêpowa³ wystrza³ z wszystkich luf (st¹d nazwa kartaczownica salwowa). Z broni tej mo¿na by³o wystrzeliæ maksymalnie 300 pocisków minutowo. Teoretycznie mitralieza powinna prowadziæ celny ogieñ na odleg³oœæ oko³o 1800 metrów.

TEXT.English: Two developments in the 19th century made early firearms (such as the musket) obsolete. The first was the invention of a spiral groove, or "rifling," inside the barrel of a gun. Second was the development of the repeating rifle, which could fire multiple shots before it required reloading. The rifle was a better weapon than its ancestors, with much more accuracy over a greater range than the musket and a much higher rate of fire.[PARAGRAPH:2]Riflemen were first employed in large numbers during the American Civil War. The rifle gave a strong defensive advantage, since riflemen could fire several times while the attackers advanced to within hand-to-hand distance. This was normally enough to hold any position. Riflemen dominated the battlefield until the appearance of armored attack vehicles.
TEXT.French: Deux inventions du XIXe siècle ont rendu obsolètes les anciennes armes à feu, comme le mousquet. La première est celle des rayures en spirale, gravées à l'intérieur du canon du fusil. L'autre est celle du fusil à répétition, qui permet de tirer plusieurs fois avant qu'il soit nécessaire de recharger. Le fusil est une bien meilleure arme que ses prédécesseurs. Il offre une meilleure précision à longue portée que le mousquet et sa cadence de tir est très supérieure.[PARAGRAPH:2]Les premières grosses formations de fusiliers sont apparues au cours de la Guerre Civile américaine. Le fusil conférait un gros avantage en défense. En effet, le fusilier pouvait tirer plusieurs fois avant que l'attaquant soit suffisamment proche pour engager le combat au corps à corps, ce qui suffisait souvent à tenir la position. Les fusiliers dominèrent les champs de bataille jusqu'à l'apparition des véhicules blindés.
TEXT.German: Zwei technologische Neuerungen des 19. Jahrhunderts führten dazu, dass die frühen Schusswaffen (wie beispielsweise die Muskete) schnell als veraltet galten: Zum einen war dies eine Spiralrille bzw. ein "Drall" im Lauf des Gewehrs und zum anderen das Repetiergewehr, mit dem mehrere Schüsse hintereinander abgegeben werden konnten, ohne dass nachgeladen werden musste. Im Vergleich zu seinen Vorläufermodellen bot das Gewehr spürbare Vorteile, so zum Beispiel eine höhere Zielgenauigkeit, eine größere Reichweite als die Muskete und eine höhere Schussfrequenz.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ausschließlich aus Gewehrschützen bestehende Truppenverbände traten erstmals während des Amerikanischen Bürgerkrieges in Aktion. Das Repetiergewehr, mit dem mehrere Schüsse auf vorrückende Angreifer abgegeben werden konnten, verschaffte ihnen einen enormen Defensivvorteil, so dass sie in der Regel jede Stellung halten konnten. Erst mit der Erfindung der gepanzerten Angriffsfahrzeuge endete ihre Vormachtstellung auf dem Schlachtfeld.
TEXT.Italian: Due invenzioni del XIX secolo contribuirono a rendere obsolete le prime armi da fuoco, come il moschetto: la prima fu l'impiego di un solco elicoidale, detto "rigatura", all'interno della canna, la seconda fu il fucile a ripetizione, che consentiva di sparare più colpi prima di dover ricaricare. Quest'arma era più efficace dei suoi antenati, molto più precisa e con una portata maggiore rispetto al moschetto. I fucilieri furono impiegati in gran numero per la prima volta durante la Guerra Civile Americana. La nuova arma assicurava un forte vantaggio difensivo, dal momento che i fucilieri potevano sparare più volte durante l'avanzata del nemico e ciò era sufficiente per mantenere a lungo qualunque posizione. La supremazia dei fucilieri non fu oscurata fino all'avvento dei veicoli d'assalto corazzati.
TEXT.Spanish: Dos avances del siglo XIX dejaron obsoletas las primeras armas de fuego (como, por ejemplo, los mosquetes). El primero fue la invención del surco en espiral, o ánima rayada, en el cañón de las armas de fuego. El segundo fue el rifle de repetición, que podía disparar varias veces antes de que hiciera falta recargarlo. El rifle era un arma superior a sus predecesoras, dotado de mucha mayor precisión a largas distancias y una cadencia de fuego muy superior a la del mosquete.[PARAGRAPH:2]La primera vez que se utilizaron fusileros en gran número fue en la Guerra de Secesión. El fusil proporcionaba una gran ventaja al defensor, puesto que los fusileros podían disparar varias veces antes de que el enemigo consiguiera alcanzar sus posiciones. Normalmente, con esto bastaba para defender cualquier posición. Los fusileros dominaron los campos de batalla hasta la aparición de los vehículos blindados de ataque.

TEXT.English: The third earliest documented European contact with the Yagua was probably made by the Spanish explorer Francisco de Orellana in January 1542. While exploring in the area of modern day Pebas, Orellana encountered a village called Aparia, and captured two chiefs named Aparia and Dirimara, as well as some others. These names could conceivably have come from the Yagua words (j)apiirya 'red macaw clan' and rimyura 'shaman' respectively. The former could very well be a village name as well as a name applied to an individual; today clan names are still used by many Yaguas as family names. The word for shaman might also be used to refer to an individual, especially one singled out as a 'chief'. Regular European contact began in 1686 with the establishment of a Jesuit mission at San Joaquin de los Omagua, on an island in the Amazon river probably near what is now the mouth of the Ampiyacu River. Though this mission was established to serve the Cambeba people, there was undoubtedly contact with the Yaguas as well. From the 17th century to the last half of the 19th century, contact with the Yaguas was mainly through the Jesuit and Franciscan missionaries. In the early 18th century, Portuguese raiding parties attacked the Spanish missions throughout the Amazon region causing much geographic dispersion of the tribes that were in contact with the Spanish, and inflicting severe casualties.

Police officers performing riot control will often wear protective riotsquad helmets and carry riot shields. These are designed to protect the wearer from those dangers that do not come from direct melee, such as hurled objects. To provide even greater protection, the protective equipment is sometimes bullet-resistant. The front-line officers in a riot control are often fully armoured and carry weapons such as batons, designed to be in direct contact with the crowd. These officers use force and intimidation to subdue rioters and subsequently allow less heavily armoured, more mobile officers to arrest people. In face of a greater threat, the riot police will be backed up with other officers equipped with riot guns to fire tear gas, rubber bullets, plastic bullets or beanbag rounds.
TEXT.Polish: Oddzia³y Prewencji Policji (OPP), Samodzielne Pododdzia³y Prewencji Policji (SPPP)? jednostki organizacyjne polskiej Policji, przeznaczone g³ównie do dzia³añ zespo³owych w ramach pododzia³ów zwartych.

TEXT.English: The Plaquemine culture was an archaeological culture in the lower Mississippi River Valley in western Mississippi and eastern Louisiana. Good examples of this culture are the Medora Site (the type site for the culture and period) in West Baton Rouge Parish, Louisiana, and the Anna, Emerald Mound, Winterville and Holly Bluff sites located in Mississippi. Plaquemine culture was contemporaneous with the Middle Mississippian culture in the Cahokia site in St. Louis, Missouri. It is considered ancestral to the Natchez and Taensa Peoples.

Robbers aren't as politically motivated as their predecessor Mobsters (which obsolete relatively quickly after leaving their mark on the world) and aren't as unified in their efforts. They generally are just career criminals doing the most they can to take what they need to live in comfort and are extremely selfishly guided. However, they can be recruited to work for state purposes but even when they are, their activities will appear much like those of a more common career criminal with a great getaway driver. Banks have become the primary target at this point in time so Robbers are specialized more in getting in and getting out with the goods. There are lots of types of crime criminals can engage in throughout the early modern era, and you never know if one willing to steal is also one willing to commit many other types of offenses... like perhaps murder. In all cases, these individuals go to great lengths to setup and enact the 'perfect crime' so as to avoid getting caught.

Robert Lui (born 23 February 1990) is an Australian professional rugby league footballer currently playing for the Salford Red Devils in the Super League. He is of Torres Strait Islander descent and previously played for the Wests Tigers. Born and raised in Townsville, Queensland. Lui played his junior football with the Upper Ross Rams and later for the Centrals Tigers before being spotted by the Tigers and undertaking a scholarship at Keebra Park High on the Gold Coast, Queensland. In 2007, he made the Queensland Open Schoolboys side and accepted a scholarship with the Australian Institute of Sport. After completing high school, Lui joined the Wests Tigers NYC team in 2008.

Robin Hood was a legendary outlaw hero of a series of English ballads, some of which date from at least as early as the 14th century. Robin Hood was a rebel, and many of the most striking episodes in the tales about him show him and his companions robbing and killing representatives of authority and giving the gains to the poor. Their most frequent enemy was the Sheriff of Nottingham, a local agent of the central government (though internal evidence from the early ballads makes it clear that the action took place chiefly in south Yorkshire, not in Nottinghamshire). Other enemies included wealthy ecclesiastical landowners. Robin treated women, the poor, and people of humble status with courtesy. A good deal of the impetus for his revolt against authority stemmed from popular resentment over those laws of the forest that restricted hunting rights. The early ballads, especially, reveal the cruelty that was an inescapable part of medieval life. Numerous attempts have been made to prove that there was a historical Robin Hood, though references to the legend by medieval writers make it clear that the ballads themselves were the only evidence for his existence available to them. A popular modern belief that he was of the time of Richard I probably stems from a pedigree fabricated by an 18th-century antiquary, William Stukeley. None of the various claims identifying Robin Hood with a particular historical figure has gained much support, and the outlaw's existence may never have been anything but legendary.
TEXT.Polish: Robin Hood bohater œredniowiecznych angielskich legend ludowych, którego faktyczne istnienie nie zosta³o potwierdzone przez Ÿród³a historyczne. Za najbardziej prawdopodobny pierwowzór Robin Hooda uznaje siê Robina Hode'a, dzier¿awcê u arcybiskupa Yorku, wyjêtego spod prawa w 1225 r. Wed³ug Ÿróde³ literackich z XIV-XVI wieku, œwietny ³ucznik, który przewodzi³ grupie ludzi wyjêtych spod prawa i ukrywaj¹cych siê w lasach hrabstw Yorkshire i Nottinghamshire (zw³aszcza w lesie Sherwood). S³awê mia³a mu przynieœæ walka w obronie biednych i uciœnionych, którym rozdawa³ dobra zrabowane w czasie napadów na zamki i klasztory.

TEXT.English: An imperial guard or palace guard is a special group of troops (or a member thereof) of an empire, typically closely associated directly with the Emperor or Empress. Usually these troops embody a more elite status than other imperial forces, including the regular armed forces, and maintain special rights, privileges and traditions. Because the head of state often wishes to be protected by the best soldiers available, their numbers and organisation may be expanded to carry out additional tasks. In the post-colonial period, the term has been used colloquially and derisively to describe the staff of a person, usually a politician or corporate executive officer, that acts to prevent direct communication with the person.
TEXT.Italian: Unità per la difesa della capitale. Solo una è permessa per ogni civiltà.
TEXT.Spanish: Unidad defensora de la capital. Solo se permite una por civilización.
TEXT.Polish: Capitol Defense Unit. Only One allowed per civ.

TEXT.English: The M270 Multiple Launch Rocket System (M270 MLRS) is a MLRS, a type of rocket artillery. The first rocket systems were delivered to the U.S. Army in 1983. The system is in widespread use in the NATO countries and it has also been manufactured in Europe. Some 1,300 M270 systems have been manufactured, along with more than 700,000 rockets. The system has been used in the Gulf wars, where it proved itself as a practical and effective weapons system. The production of the M270 ended in 2003, when a last batch was delivered to the Egyptian army.[PARAGRAPH:2]The system is capable of firing guided and unguided projectiles to a distance of up to 42 km (26.1 miles). Firing ballistic missile, (such as the U.S. Army Tactical Missile System - ATACMS) it is capable of reaching out to 300 km (186 miles) with the warhead reaching a maximal altitude of about 50 km (164,000 ft). The M270 is a very mobile unit, thus well suited for the so called shoot-and-scoot tactic: it can fire its rockets very rapidly and immediately move away to avoid the counter-battery fire.[PARAGRAPH:2]The rockets and ATACMS missiles are contained in interchangeable pods. Each pod contains six standard rockets or one guided ATACMS missile (the two types cannot be mixed). The launcher can hold two pods at a time, which it loads using an integrated crane. All twelve rockets or two ATACMS missiles can be fired in under a minute. One launcher firing twelve rockets can completely blanket one square kilometer with submunitions. For this reason, the MLRS is sometimes referred to as the "Grid Square Removal Service".
TEXT.Polish: M270 MLRS jest typem wyrzutni rakietowej. Pierwszy taki pakiet zosta³ dostarczony do Armi USA w roku 1983. System jest u¿ywany w krajach NATO i te¿ budowany w europie. Niektóre M270 zosta³y zbudowane wraz 700,000 rakietamu. Produkcjê zakoñczono w roku 2003 a ostatnie sztuki posz³y do armi Egipskiej.

TEXT.English: The rockhopper penguins are three closely related taxa of crested penguins that have been traditionally treated as a single species and are sometimes split into two or three species. Not all experts agree on the classification of these penguins. Some consider all three as distinct species, some split the Western and Eastern forms into the Southern Rockhopper Penguin and keeping the Northern Rockhopper as distinct, while other experts lump all 3 calling it simply Rockhopper Penguin.
TEXT.French: Les Gorfou sauteur sont trois taxons étroitement apparentés de manchots huppés qui ont été traditionnellement traités comme une seule espèce et sont parfois divisés en deux ou trois espèces. Tous les experts ne sont pas d'accord sur la classification de ces pingouins. Certains considèrent les trois comme des espèces distinctes, certains divisent les formes occidentales et orientales en pingouin rockhopper sud et en gardant le rockhopper nordique distinct, tandis que d'autres experts regroupent les 3 en l'appelant simplement pingouin rockhopper.
TEXT.German: Felsenpinguine (Eudyptes chrysocome) sind 45 bis 58 Zentimeter große Vögel aus der Familie der Pinguine, die durch einen schmalen gelben Streifen oberhalb der Augen auffallen, dessen längere Federn hinter dem Auge abstehen.[NEWLINE]Felsenpinguine sind von Südamerika bis nach Neuseeland verbreitet. Sie zählen zu den gefährdeten Tierarten, da ihr Bestand hauptsächlich durch den Fischfang in ihren Jagdgründen, aber auch durch Ökotourismus, Meeresverschmutzung und den Klimawandel immer mehr abnimmt.
TEXT.Polish: Pingwin skalny (Eudyptes chrysocome)? gatunek ptaka z rodziny pingwinów (Spheniscidae), wystêpuj¹cy w zachodniej czêœci Oceanu Spokojnego i Indyjskiego. Posiada pomarañczowy dziób i czarno-bia³e upierzenie. Osi¹ga d³ugoœæ 45-58 cm i wa¿y od 2 do 3,4 kg, choæ niektóre okazy wa¿¹ nawet 5 kg. Jego oczy maj¹ czerwon¹ barwê.

TEXT.English: Rollo (c. 846 - c. 932), was a Viking who became the first ruler of Normandy, a region of France. Rollo came from a noble warrior family of Scandinavian origin. After making himself independent of the Norwegian king Harald Fairhair, he sailed off to Scotland, Ireland, England and Flanders on pirating expeditions, and took part in raids along France's Seine river. Rollo won a reputation as a great leader of Viking rovers in Ireland and Scotland, and emerged as the outstanding personality among the Norsemen who had secured a permanent foothold on Frankish soil in the valley of the lower Seine. Charles the Simple, the king of West Francia, ceded them lands between the mouth of the Seine and what is now the city of Rouen in exchange for Rollo agreeing to end his brigandage, and provide the Franks with his protection against further incursion by Norse war bands.

The term "Praetorian" derived from the tent of the commanding general or praetor of a Roman army in the field - the praetorium. It was a habit of many Roman generals to choose from the ranks a private force of soldiers to act as bodyguards of the tent or the person. They consisted of both infantry and cavalry. In time, this cohort came to be known as the cohors praetoria, and various notable figures possessed one, including Julius Caesar, Mark Antony and Augustus (Octavian). As Caesar discovered with the Legio X Equestris, a powerful unit more dangerous than its fellow legions was desirable in the field. When Augustus became the first ruler of the Roman Empire in 27 BC, he decided such a formation was useful not only on the battlefield but in politics also. Thus, from the ranks of the legions throughout the provinces, Augustus recruited the Praetorian Guard.
TEXT.German: Die römischen Legionen bildeten die Streitmächte, welche die Gebiete des entstehenden römischen Imperiums eroberten und über fünf Jahrhunderte lang hielten. Sie wurden in den ersten Kriegen der römischen Republik entwickelt und in den drei punischen Kriegen gegen Karthago perfektioniert. Jede Legion bestand aus 6000 Männern, welche in 60 kleinere Gruppen zu je 100 Mann unterteilt waren, den "Centurien". Beim Angriff war eine Legion seinerzeit kaum aufzuhalten, allerdings besaß sie Schwächen in der Verteidigung. Der Bedeutungsverlust der Legion als Militäreinheit wurde durch die Vernichtung der römischen Armee des Imperators Valens durch gotische Reiterhorden im 4. Jahrhundert beschleunigt. Der Ausdruck "Prätorianer" leitet sich vom Namen des Feldzelts des befehlshabenden Legaten einer Armee ab - dem "Praetorium". Viele römische Generäle hielten sich eine Leibwache von Soldaten aus den Rängen zum Schutz des Zelts und der eigenen Person. Diese erlesenen Truppen bestanden sowohl aus Infanterie als auch aus Kavallerie. Eine solche "Kohorte" zum Schutz des Praetoriums und des Feldherrn wurde als "cohors praetoria" bezeichnet und von vielen angesehenen Führern verwendet, darunter Julius Cäsar, Marcus Antonius und Augustus Cäsar (Octavian). Wie Julius Cäsar mit der "Legio X Equestris" feststellte, waren diese Einheiten im Feld sehr nützlich, da sie sich als kraftvoller und mächtiger als die regulären Legionen erwiesen. Als Augustus im Jahr 27 v.Chr. Herrscher über das römische Imperium wurde, entschied er, eine derartige Eliteeinheit nicht nur in Krieg, sondern auch in der Tagespolitik nutzbringend einzusetzen. Und so rekrutierte Augustus aus den besten Kriegern seiner Armeen in allen Provinzen die "Prätorianische Garde".

TEXT.English: Romulus, along with his twin brother Remus, were the traditional founders of Rome, appearing in Roman mythology as the twin sons of the Vestal Virgin Rhea Silvia, fathered by the god of war, Mars. According to the tradition recorded as history by Plutarch and Livy, Romulus served as the first King of Rome. Romulus slew Remus over a dispute about which one of the two brothers had the support of the local deities to rule the new city and give it his name. The name they gave the city was Rome. Supposedly, Romulus had stood on one hill and Remus another, and a circle of birds flew over Romulus, signifying that he should be king. After founding Rome, Romulus not only created the Roman Legions and the Roman Senate, but also added citizens to his new city by abducting the women of the neighboring Sabine tribes, which resulted in the mixture of the Sabines and Romans into one people, ruled jointly by Romulus and Titus Tatius (the Sabine king). Romulus would become ancient Rome's greatest conqueror, adding large amounts of territory and people to the dominion of Rome. After his death, Romulus was deified as the god Quirinus, the divine persona of the Roman people. He now is regarded as a mythological figure, and it is supposed that his name is a back-formation from the name Rome. Some scholars, notably Andrea Carandini believe in the historicity of Romulus, in part because of the 1988 discovery of the Murus Romuli on the north slope of the Palatine Hill in Rome.

TEXT.English: Rostam is a mythical hero of Iran and son of Zal and Rudaba. In some ways, the position of Rostam in the historical tradition is curiously parallel to that of Surena, the hero of the Carrhae. His figure was endowed with many features of the historical personality of Rostam. The latter was always represented as the mightiest of Iranian paladins, and the atmosphere of the episodes in which he features is strongly reminiscent of the Arsacid period. He was immortalized by the 10th century poet Ferdowsi of Tus in the Shahnameh or Epic of Kings, which contain pre-Islamic folklore and history.
TEXT.Polish: Rostam to mityczny bohater Iranu, syn Zala i Rudabe. W pewien sposób, postaæ Rostama w tradycji historycznej jest zaskakuj¹co analogiczna do postaci Surenasa, bohatera bitwy pod Carrhae. Jego postac otrzyma³a wiele cech historycznej osobowoœci Rostama. Ten ostatni zawsze by³ przedstawiany jako najpotê¿niejszy z paladynów Iranu, a atmosfera epizodów, w których siê pojawia mocno przypomina okres Arsacydów, piwerwszej dynastii królewskiej Partów. Rostam zosta³ uwieczniony przez X wiecznego poetê perskiego Ferdousiego w Szahname, perskim eposie narodowym opowiadaj¹cy tradycyjn¹ historiê Iranu od stworzenia œwiata do upadku dynastii Sasanidów.

TEXT.Italian: Soldato delle forze speciali congiunte giordane

TEXT.English: The Special Operation Forces of the Jordanian Armed Forces were founded on April 15, 1963 on the orders of the late King Hussein. In the early 1970s, Jordan's Special Forces were developed and assigned the tasks of reconnaissance, counter-terrorism, search and evacuation, combat, and the protection of key sites.
TEXT.French: Les Forces d'Opérations Spéciales des Forces armées jordaniennes furent créées le 15 avril 1963 sur ordre du défunt roi Hussein. Au début des années 1970, les forces spéciales jordaniennes se développèrent et reçurent les missions de reconnaissance, contre-terrorisme, recherche et évacuation, combat, et protection des sites clés.

TEXT.English: In 1693, Portuguese militia tried to take control of the gold trade in the interior of sub-saharan Africa by invading the Rozvi empire. The Rozwi were able to successfully defeat these attacks and maintain their control of the gold mines until their empire collapsed. The Rozvi were led by Changamire Dombo, whose power was based in Butua in the southwest of sub-Saharan Africa. The Rozwi were formed from several Shona states that dominated the plateau of present-day Zimbabwe at the time. They drove the Portuguese off the central plateau, and the Europeans retained only a nominal presence at one of the fairs in the eastern highlands.

Ruhanga features in Bantu mythology as the remote creator and sky-God, recognized among the Bahima, the Banyoro, the Batooro, the Bahororo, the Bakiga, the Bamba and all other groups referred to in general as Banyakitara. The Bahima further recognise him as the arbiter of life, sickness, and death. However, unlike creator figures in other religious systems, Ruhanga is generally not a focus of worship. Ruhanga is also considered to be the founder of the Batembuzi dynasty of the Kingdom of Kitara.

Skilled horsemen dwelling in the northern steppes of the Black and Caspian Sea regions, the Cossack hosts had a tradition of fierce independence and, after decades of conflict, finally received privileges from the Russian government in return for military services. In the 16th century there were six major Cossack hosts: the Don, the Greben (in Caucasia), the Yaik (along the Ural River), the Volga, the Dnieper and the Zaporozhian (west of the Dnieper). Under the Russian umbrella, the Cossacks expanded eastward from their settlements in the Don and were early colonizers of Siberia. From the 18th through the 20th centuries, the Czars used Cossacks extensively to suppress revolutionary activities and conduct foreign wars.[PARAGRAPH:2]During the Russian Civil War (1918-20), the Cossacks in southern Russia formed the core of the White armies there and suffered extensively. Under Soviet rule, the Cossack communities ceased to function as distinctive entities.
TEXT.French: Les cosaques sont d'habiles cavaliers vivant dans la steppe, au nord de la Mer Caspienne et de la Mer Noire. Les tribus cosaques ont une tradition d'indépendance, et après avoir combattu les Russes pendant des décennies, ils obtinrent des privilèges contre leur engagement dans l'armée. Au XVIe siècle, il existait six grandes tribus cosaques : celle du Don, celle du Greben (Caucase), celle du Yaik (le long de la rivière Oural), celle de la Volga, du Dniepr et du Zaporozje (ouest du Dniepr). Sous la tutelle russe, les Cosaques se sont étendus à l'est de leurs territoires du Don, et sont devenus ainsi les premiers colonisateurs de la Sibérie. Du XVIIIe au XXe siècle, les Tsars ont beaucoup utilisé les Cosaques pour réprimer les révoltes ou faire la guerre.[PARAGRAPH:2]Au cours de la Guerre Civile russe (1918-20), les Cosaques ont formé au sud de la Russie le gros de l'armée des blancs, et ont été durement réprimés. Sous l'URSS, les tribus cosaques ont cessé de fonctionner comme des entités indépendantes.
TEXT.German: Die Kosaken waren erfahrene Reiter, die in der nördlichen Steppe in den Regionen nahe des Schwarzen Meeres und des kaspischen Meeres beheimatet waren. Nach jahrzehntelangen Auseinandersetzungen gestand die russische Regierung diesen traditionell unabhängigen Kämpfern als Gegenleistung für ihre militärischen Dienste besondere Privilegien zu. Im 16. Jahrhundert gab es sechs bedeutende Kosakenreiche: die Don-, die Greben- (in Kaukasien), die Jaik- (entlang des Flusses Ural), die Wolga-, die Dnjepr- und die Saporzhje-Kosaken (westlich des Dnjepr). Unter russischem Schutz expandierten die Kosaken von ihren Siedlungen am Don in den Osten und gehörten zu den ersten Kolonisten in Sibirien. In der Zeit vom 18. bis 20. Jahrhundert wurden die Kosaken von den Zaren eingesetzt, um revolutionäre Aktivitäten zu unterdrücken und Kriege im Ausland zu führen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Während des russischen Bürgerkrieges (1918-20) bildeten sie in Südrussland das Rückgrat der dortigen weißen Armee und erlitten dementsprechende Verluste. Unter der sowjetischen Herrschaft endete schließlich die Eigenständigkeit der Kosakengemeinschaften.
TEXT.Italian: Abili cavallerizzi che scorrazzavano nelle steppe settentrionali delle regioni del Mar Nero e del Mar Caspio, i Cosacchi avevano una tradizione di fiera indipendenza e, dopo decenni di lotte, ricevettero dei privilegi da parte del governo russo, in cambio di servizi militari. Nel sedicesimo secolo, c'erano sei principali insediamenti Cosacchi: il Don, il Greben (nel Caucaso), lo Yaik (lungo il fiume Ural), il Volga, il Dnieper e lo Zaporozian (a ovest del Dnieper). Sotto la protezione russa, i Cosacchi si espansero a est dai loro insediamenti nel Don e furono i primi colonizzatori della Siberia. Dal diciottesimo al ventesimo secolo, gli Zar si servirono a piene mani dei Cosacchi, per sopprimere le attività rivoluzionarie e condurre guerre all'estero.[PARAGRAPH:2]Durante la Guerra Civile Russa (1918-20), i Cosacchi nella Russia meridionale formarono il nucleo delle armate bianche e riportarono gravi perdite. Sotto il governo sovietico, le comunità di Cosacchi cessarono di operare come entità distinte.
TEXT.Spanish: Hábiles jinetes procedentes de las estepas de las regiones de los mares Negro y Caspio, los cosacos atesoraban una tradición de fiera independencia y, tras décadas de conflicto, acabaron por recibir privilegios del gobierno ruso a cambio de prestaciones militares. En el siglo XVI había seis grandes huestes cosacas: la Don, la Greben (en Caucasia), la Yaik (del río Ural), la Volga, la Dniéper y la Zaporozhia (al oeste del Dniéper). Con el patrocinio de Rusia, los cosacos se expandieron hacia el este desde sus asentamientos en el Don y fueron los primeros colonizadores de Siberia. Entre los siglos XVIII y XX, los zares hicieron gran uso de los cosacos para sofocar las actividades revolucionarias del interior y librar guerras en el extranjero.[PARAGRAPH:2]Durante la Guerra Civil Rusa (1918-1920), los cosacos del sur de Rusia formaron el grueso de los ejércitos blancos de la zona y pagaron un alto precio por ello. Con el régimen soviético, las comunidades cosacas dejaron de funcionar como entidades diferenciadas.

TEXT.English: Rwenzururu is a region in the Rwenzori Mountains of Uganda on the border of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, as well as an armed historical movement to achieve either autonomy or sovereignty for that region. It is also the name of a kingdom declared in that region. It includes the districts of Bundibugyo, Kasese and Ntoroko.
TEXT.French: Rwenzururu est une région des montagnes de Rwenzori en Ouganda, à la frontière de la République démocratique du Congo, ainsi qu'un mouvement armé historique visant à obtenir l'autonomie ou la souveraineté pour cette région. C'est aussi le nom d'un royaume déclaré dans cette région. Elle comprend les districts de Bundibugyo, Kasese et Ntoroko.

TEXT.English: Sheikh Sabah IV Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah GCB (Hon) is the 15th Ruler and 5th Emir of Kuwait and the Commander of the Military of Kuwait. He was sworn in on 29 January 2006 after confirmation by the National Assembly of Kuwait. He is the fourth son of Sheikh Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah.
TEXT.French: Cheikh Sabah IV Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah GCB (honorifique) est le 15e souverain et 5e émir du Koweït et commandant des forces militaires du Koweït. Il fut investi le 29 janvier 2006 après confirmation par l'Assemblée nationale koweïtienne. Il est le quatrième fils du cheikh Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah.

TEXT.English: The sabar, which originated with the Serer people, is a traditional drum from the West African nation of Senegal (also played in the Gambia). It is generally played with one hand and one stick. Among its most renowned exponents was the Senegalese musician Doudou N'Diaye Rose. The sabar was used to communicate with other villages. The different rhythms correspond to phrases and could be heard for over 15 kilometers. Sabar is also recognized as the style of music played while using this drum.
TEXT.French: Le sabar, originaire du peuple sérère, est un tambour traditionnel du Sénégal (également utilisé en Gambie). On y joue généralement avec une main et une baguette. Parmi ses plus grands représentants figure le musicien sénégalais Doudou N'Diaye Rose. Le sabar était utilisé pour communiquer avec d'autres villages. Les rythmes différents correspondent à des phrases et pouvaient être entendus sur plus de 15 kilomètres. Le sabar désigne également le style de musique joué avec ce tambour.

TEXT.English: Sable fur has been a highly valued item in the fur trade since the early Middle Ages, and is generally considered to have the most beautiful and richly tinted pelt among martens. Sable fur is unique because it retains its smoothness in every direction it is stroked. The fur of other animals feels rough stroked opposite the grain. A wealthy 17th-century Russian diplomat once described the sable as "A beast full marvelous and prolific beast that the Ancient Greeks and Romans called the Golden Fleece." Russian sables would typically be skinned over the mouth with no incision being made on the body. The feet would be retained, so as to keep as much fur as possible. Byzantine priests would wear sable for their rituals.

The Sacred Band of Carthage is the name used by Greek historians to refer to an infantry unit of Carthaginian foot citizens that served in Carthaginian armies during the fourth century BC. The presence of Carthaginian citizens fighting as infantry in these armies is unusual as Carthaginian citizens usually only served as officers or cavalry in the Carthaginian armed forces and the bulk of Carthaginian armies were usually made up of mercenaries, infantry from allied communities (who might be Punic colonists) and subject levies. Trained from an early age to be tough phalanx spearmen, these men were from wealthy Carthaginian families, and as such had extremely good equipment. They were trained from birth to be great warriors and they were able to afford high quality armor and weapons. They fought as a traditional phalanx organized in the Hellenic style.

Saddam Hussein Abd al-Majid al-Tikriti was the fifth President of Iraq, serving in this capacity from 16 July 1979 until 9 April 2003. A leading member of the revolutionary Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party, and later, the Baghdad-based Ba'ath Party and its regional organization Ba'ath Party - Iraq Region-which espoused Ba'athism, a mix of Arab nationalism and socialism-Saddam played a key role in the 1968 coup (later referred to as the 17 July Revolution) that brought the party to power in Iraq.
TEXT.French: Saddam Hussein Abd al-Majid al-Tikriti fut le cinquième président de l'Irak, en fonction du 16 juillet 1979 au 9 avril 2003. Membre éminent du parti Baas socialiste arabe révolutionnaire, et plus tard du parti Baas de Bagdad et son organisation régionale Baas - région irakienne -, qui prônaient le baasism, un mélange de nationalisme arabe et de socialisme, Saddam joua un rôle clé dans le coup d'État de 1968 (appelé plus tard Révolution du 17 juillet) qui porta le parti au pouvoir en Irak.

TEXT.English: Said bin Sultan Al-Said was Sultan of Muscat and Oman from March 1807 to 4 June 1856. Said bin Sultan was son of Sultan bin Ahmad, who ruled Oman from 1792 to 1804. Sultan bin Ahmad died in 1804 on an expedition to Basra. He appointed Mohammed bin Nasir bin Mohammed al-Jabry as the Regent and guardian of his two sons, Salim bin Sultan and Said bin Sultan. Sultan's brother Qais bin Ahmad, ruler of Sohar, decided to attempt to seize power. Early in 1805 Qais and his brother Mohammed marched south along the coast to Muttrah, which he easily captured. Qais then started to besiege Muscat. Mohammed bin Nasir tried to bribe Qais to leave, but did not succeed.

Lasting traces of Adena culture are still seen in their substantial earthworks. Once Adena mounds numbered in the hundreds, but only a small number of Adena earthen monuments still survive today. These mounds generally ranged in size from 20 feet (6.1 m) to 300 feet (91 m) in diameter and served as burial structures, ceremonial sites, historical markers and possibly gathering places. These mounds were built using hundreds of thousands of baskets full of specially selected and graded earth. According to archaeological investigations, Adena mounds were usually built as part of burial ritual, in which the earth of the mound was piled immediately atop a burned mortuary building. These mortuary buildings were intended to keep and maintain the dead until their final burial was performed. Before the construction of the mounds, some utilitarian and grave goods would be placed on the floor of the structure, which was burned with the goods and honored dead within. The mound would then be constructed, and often a new mortuary structure would be placed atop the new mound. After a series of repetitions, mound/mortuary/mound/mortuary, a quite prominent earthwork would remain. In the later Adena period, circular ridges of unknown function were sometimes constructed around the burial mounds. Adena mounds stood in isolation from domestic living areas.
The Massagetae culture copied the Byzantine Cataphract, but their cavalry tended to specialize in surprising and routing enemy melee units (who in this theatre were mainly swordsmen and spearmen).
TEXT.French: La culture massagète copiait le cataphracte byzantin, mais leur cavalerie se spécialisait à surprendre et dérouter les unités ennemies de mêlée (principalement épéistes et lanciers dans ce théâtre).
TEXT.Italian: I Massageti copiarono la catafratta dai bizantini, ma la loro cavalleria era specializzata nel sorprendere ed aggirare le unità da nemiche, che erano spesso lancieri e spadaccini.

TEXT.English: Salawat Yulayev is a Bashkir national hero who participated in Pugachev's Rebellion. Salawat Yulayev was at the head of all revolted Bashkortostan from the very beginning of the country war of 1773-1775. He was seized by imperial authorities on November, 24th, 1774, and his father, Yulay Aznalin, was captured even earlier. Put into irons, they were sent to Moscow. Yulay Aznalin was a votchinnik (holder of patrimonial estate), a rich, intelligent and influential man. He was held in general respect among Bashkirs and was a Bauermeister (district foreman). The local authorities gave credence to him; his fidelity to Russian government could not be doubted.
Sambuk is a type of dhow, a traditional wooden sailing vessel. It has a characteristic keel design, with a sharp curve right below the top of the prow. Formerly sambuks had ornate carvings.
TEXT.French: Le sambuk est un type de dhow, un navire de plaisance en bois traditionnel. Il possède une quille caractéristique avec une courbe prononcée juste sous la proue. Autrefois, les sambuks étaient ornés de sculptures décoratives.

TEXT.English: The arbalest (also arblast) was a late variation of the crossbow coming into use in Europe during the 12th century. A large weapon, the arbalest had a steel prod ("bow"). Since an arbalest was much larger than earlier crossbows, and because of the greater tensile strength of steel, it had a greater force. The strongest windlass-pulled arbalests could have up to 22 kN (5000 lbf) of force and be accurate up to 100 m. A skilled arbalestier (arbalester) could loose two bolts per minute.

Spanish.Text: Infantería con misiles tierra-aire:Infantería con misiles tierra-aire

TEXT.English: With the invention of the aircraft it quickly became apparent that mobile infantry units would need some kind of Anti-Aircraft weapons to defend against the new menace from the air. However, when flight was invented the idea that a single person could carry a rocket-based missile to destroy aircraft was unthinkable, and it took years before any were put into service. Throughout World War II, both sides in the conflict used rocket launcher devices in various forms. One form was the M1A1, an American made anti-tank rocket launcher that could be carried by infantry. By the late 1960s, several surface-to-air missile, shoulder fired single operator weapons were available. Many of these could hit an aircraft at over 10,000 feet off the ground. Even today these weapons are not as reliable as their designers had hoped, but when they do hit their target, it almost always results in devastating destruction.
TEXT.French: Avec l'avènement de l'aviation, il devint rapidement évident que l'infanterie mobile devait pouvoir intervenir dans la lutte antiaérienne. Cependant, il était au début inimaginable qu'un individu puisse se déplacer avec sa propre base de lancement de missiles pour détruire les avions. Au cours de la Deuxième Guerre mondiale, les armées des deux camps utilisèrent différentes formes d'engins lance-roquettes. Ainsi, le bazooka américain M1A1 était une arme antichar que pouvait transporter l'infanterie. A la fin des années 1960, plusieurs missiles sol-air, pouvant être tirés à l'épaule et mis en oeuvre par un seul homme, firent leur apparition. Ils pouvaient abattre un avion à 3 000 mètres d'altitude. Ces armes ne sont pas aussi fiables que l'espéraient leurs concepteurs, mais lorsqu'ils atteignent leur cible, l'effet est dévastateur.
TEXT.German: Nach der Erfindung des Flugzeugs war schnell klar, dass für dessen Abwehr mobile Infanterieeinheiten erforderlich sein würden. Allerdings dachte zunächst noch niemand an Raketenwerfer oder andere Flugabwehrwaffen. Erst im 2. Weltkrieg setzten Alliierte und Achsenmächte verschiedene Raketenwerfer, wie den amerikanischen M1A1, ein. Ende der 60er Jahre des 20. Jahrhunderts wurden erstmals schultergestützte Boden-Luft-Raketen eingesetzt, die Flugzeuge in einer Höhe von mehr als 3000 Metern abschießen konnten. Diese Waffen waren im Falle eines Treffers äußerst effektiv, galten aber als vergleichsweise unzuverlässig.
TEXT.Italian: Con l'invenzione dell'aereo, fu subito chiaro che le unità di fanteria mobile avrebbero dovuto svolgere la funzione di squadre antiaeree. Tuttavia, quando venne realizzato il primo aereo, nessuno poteva immaginare che un giorno qualche soldato avrebbe potuto utilizzare dei razzi per abbatterlo.
