Durante la Seconda Guerra Mondiale, tutti i partecipanti al conflitto adoperarono differenti tipi di lanciarazzi: uno di questi era l'M1A1, un lanciarazzi americano che poteva essere trasportato dalla fanteria. Intorno al 1960, vennero introdotti i primi lanciarazzi utilizzabili da un solo soldato: la maggior parte di questi razzi era in grado di colpire un bersaglio a 3.000 metri circa d'altezza. Queste armi non erano molto affidabili, ma quando raggiungevano l'obiettivo erano di una potenza devastante.
TEXT.Spanish: Con la invención del avión, no tardó en hacerse evidente que harían falta unidades de infantería móvil capaces de servir como armas antiaéreas. Sin embargo, cuando se inventó el vuelo, la idea de que una persona pudiera transportar un arma lanzacohetes capaz de derribar aviones era inconcebible. En la Segunda Guerra Mundial, ambos bandos emplearon diferentes tipos de lanzacohetes. Uno de ellos era el M1A1, un modelo de fabricación americana que podía ser transportado por la infantería Hacia finales de la década de los 60, existían varios modelos de misil tierra-aire diseñados para ser manejados por un solo hombre. Muchos de ellos podían alcanzar a un avión a más de 10.000 pies de altitud. Estas armas no eran tan precisas como hubiesen querido sus diseñadores, pero cuando hacían blanco el resultado era casi siempre sumamente destructivo.

TEXT.English: Sancho III Garcws (c. 992 - 18 October 1035), called the Great, succeeded as a minor to the Kingdom of Navarre in 1004, and through conquest and political maneuvering increased his power, until at the time of his death in 1035 he controlled the majority of Christian Iberia, bearing the title of rex Hispaniarum. Having gone further than any of his predecessors in uniting the divided kingdoms of Iberia, his life's work was undone when he divided his domains shortly before his death to provide for each of his sons. The Kingdom of Navarre existed for almost six centuries after his death, but was never as powerful again.
TEXT.Polish: Sancho III z Nawarry, zwany Wielkim (ur. ok. 985 - zm. 18 paŸdziernika 1035) by³ królem Nawarry od ok. 1000 oraz hrabi¹ Aragoni. Wraz ze swoim siostrzeñcem, królem Alfonsem V z Leonu i hrabi¹ Garci¹ Sanchezem z Kastylii, przeprowadzi³ wspólny atak na Al-Mansura Ibn Abi Aamira (zmar³ego w 1002, zwanego Almanzorem) i podbi³ terytoria na po³udniu.

TEXT.English: Most Azande traditionally practiced an African Traditional Religion, but this has been supplanted to a large extent by Christianity. Other traditional beliefs include magic and witchcraft. Among the Azande, witchcraft is believed to be an inherited substance in the belly which leads a fairly autonomous existence, and has power to perform bad magic on one's enemies. Witches can sometimes be unaware of their powers, and can accidentally strike people to whom the witch wishes no evil. Because witchcraft is believed always to be present, there are several rituals connected to protection from and cancelling of witchcraft that are performed almost daily. When something out of the ordinary occurs, usually something unfortunate, to an individual, the Azande may blame witchcraft, just as non-Zande people might blame "bad luck". Oracles are a way of determining the source of the suspected witchcraft, and were for a long time the ultimate legal authority and the main determining factor in how one would respond to the threats.

Jose Francisco de San Martin (25 February 1778 - 17 August 1850), known simply as Jose de San Martín, was an Argentine general and the prime leader of the southern part of South America's successful struggle for independence from the Spanish Empire. Born in Yapeyu, Corrientes, in modern Argentina, he left his mother country at the early age of seven to study in Malaga, Spain.
TEXT.French: José Francisco de San Martín (25 février 1778 - 17 août 1850), connu simplement comme José de San Martín, était un général argentin et le principal leader de la lutte pour l'indépendance réussie de la partie sud de l'Amérique du Sud contre l'Empire espagnol. Né à Yapeyu, Corrientes, en Argentine moderne, il quitta son pays à l'âge de sept ans pour étudier à Malaga, en Espagne.
TEXT.Polish: Jose Francisco de San Martin y Matorras (ur. 25 lutego 1778, zm. 17 sierpnia 1850) - genera³ argentyñski i przywódca powstania po³udniowych narodów Ameryki Po³udniowej przeciw hiszpañskiemu panowaniu. Bohater narodowy Argentyny, Chile i Peru. Urodzi³ siê w urzêdniczej rodzinie w hiszpañskim Wicekrólestwie La Platy. Edukacjê pobiera³ w Hiszpanii. Tam te¿ rozpocz¹³ karierê wojskow¹. Walczy³ z Portugalczykami w Afryce i Francuzami w Hiszpanii (powstanie przeciwko Napoleonowi I). W 1812 rozpocz¹³ walkê o niepodleg³oœæ Argentyny (1816). Dowodzi³ wojskami, które dokona³y inwazji na Boliwiê; w 1817 odniós³ zwyciêstwo w bitwie pod Chacabuco.

TEXT.English: Sargon I (reigned about 2335-2279 bc) was an Akkadian king who for the first time in Mesopotamian history united the ancient lands of Sumer and Akkad, in present-day Iraq and Syria. Little is known of Sargon's early life. One Sumerian legend says he was placed in a sealed reed basket and floated down the Euphrates River like Moses before being rescued. Earning the approval of the deity Ishtar, Sargon rose to establish his kingdom. Another source describes Sargon as the adopted son of a palm grower. It is not clear how Sargon ascended the throne. His Akkadian name, Sharrum-kin, means the true or legitimate king, though one theory holds that he stole the throne. Better established is that, after founding the city Agade in northern Sumer, Sargon conquered all of Mesopotamia (in parts of present-day Iraq, Syria, and Turkey), including Sumer; parts of northern Syria; and Elam (in present-day Iran). He thus secured command of major trade routes; goods reached Akkad from as far away as Magan, south of the Persian Gulf, by ship. Sargon consolidated his rule by granting royal servants the administration of large estates, something which not only earned their loyalty but fostered a new economic structure. Where earlier rulers had spoken Sumerian, Sargon and his successors spoke a Semitic language known as Akkadian, contributing to the decline of the previous Sumerian speech. Regardless, Sargon is regarded as one of the first individuals in recorded history to create a multiethnic, centrally ruled empire, and his dynasty controlled Mesopotamia for around a century and a half.
TEXT.Polish: Sargon I Wielki, Szarrukin (? - ok. 2284 p.n.e.), pierwszy historyczny król Akadu (Mezopotamia). Ok. 2340 p.n.e. zosta³ w³adc¹ sumeryjskiego miasta Kisz. Zreorganizowa³ armiê i wprowadzi³ nowe typy uzbrojenia (³uk i oszczep) oraz now¹ taktykê bojow¹, dziêki którym jego oddzia³y podbi³y miasta Sumerów (Ur, Uruk, Lagasz, Umma). Sargon I Wielki za³o¿y³ stolicê w mieœcie Akad. Podporz¹dkowa³ sobie Elam (dziœ po³udniowo-zachodni Iran), Szubartu (po³udniowa Mezopotamia), Amurru (Syria) i przez góry Taurus dotar³ do Azji Mniejszej, a nawet na Cypr. Sargon I by³ twórc¹ pierwszego w œwiecie mocarstwa, kaza³ siê tytu³owaæ królem czterech stron œwiata. W ca³ym pañstwie przeprowadzi³ regulacjê sieci kana³ów nawadniaj¹cych. Ujednolici³ system miar i wag.

TEXT.English: In 1916, with the encouragement and support of Britain (which was fighting the Ottomans in World War I), the Sharif of Mecca, Hussein bin Ali, led a pan-Arab revolt against the Ottoman Empire to create a united Arab state. Although the Arab Revolt of 1916 to 1918 failed in its objective, the Allied victory in World War I resulted in the end of Ottoman suzerainty and control in Arabia.
TEXT.French: En 1916, avec l'encouragement et le soutien de la Grande-Bretagne (qui combattait les Ottomans durant la Première Guerre mondiale), le chérif de La Mecque, Hussein bin Ali, dirigea une révolte panarabe contre l'Empire ottoman pour créer un État arabe uni. Bien que la révolte arabe de 1916 à 1918 n'ait pas atteint son objectif, la victoire alliée lors de la Première Guerre mondiale mit fin à la suzeraineté ottomane et à son contrôle en Arabie.

TEXT.English: On suitable terrain, the fast-moving horseman was the dominant force. When infantry operated on ground less favorable to cavalry however, and deployed firearms or disciplined archery, the mounted man was not as effective. Cavalry tactics were varied based on the mix of mounted and foot troops on hand for an operation. Infantry forces were usually larger, and the typical order of battle was a mass of infantry levies armed with hide shields, arrows, bows and spears, and a higher status mounted formation. Cavalry relied heavily on missile action, usually casting javelins in one or two passes, before closing in with lances for shock action. The infantry provided a steadying force if they could mass compactly enough to stand against cavalry charges. Raiding type tactics were standard, particularly in acquiring captives for sale. Generally the savanna cavalries used a "combined arms" approach, seldom operating without supporting infantry.

TEXT.Spanish: Caballeros Savaran

TEXT.English: The Sassanid Savaran were the knights who formed the armour guard of the emperor himself. Unlike knights elsewhere who were born into the role - or were there because they could afford a horse - the Savaran were highly trained, as only the best were selected for this coveted role.
TEXT.French: Les Savaran sassanides étaient les chevaliers formant la garde blindée de l'empereur lui-même. Contrairement aux chevaliers d'ailleurs qui étaient nés dans ce rôle - ou y étaient parce qu'ils pouvaient s'offrir un cheval - les Savaran étaient hautement entraînés, seuls les meilleurs étant sélectionnés pour ce rôle convoité.
TEXT.Italian: I cavalieri savarani sasanidi formavano la guardia dell'imperatore sasanide. A differenza dei cavalieri europei, che diventavano tali per nascita, i savarani erano altamente addestrati, poiché solo i migliori potevano essere scelti per questo ruolo.

TEXT.English: Saxon, member of a Germanic people who in ancient times lived in the area of modern Schleswig and along the Baltic coast. The period of Roman decline in the northwest area of the empire was marked by vigorous Saxon piracy in the North Sea. During the 5th century ce the Saxons spread rapidly through north Germany and along the coasts of Gaul and Britain. The coastal stretch from the Elbe to the Scheldt rivers, however, was held by the Frisians, on whom the Saxons had great influence.

German.Text: Großer Wissenschaftler:Großen Wissenschaftlers:Großen Wissenschaftler:Großen Wissenschaftler:Große Wissenschaftler:Großen Wissenschaftler:Großen Wissenschaftlern:Großen Wissenschaftler

TEXT.English: The Roman general Publius Cornelius Scipio earned his nickname Africanus by defeating Hannibal, Carthage's best general, at the battle of Zama in 202 BC. By his tactical reforms and understanding of strategy, he created a Roman army that gave Rome the dominant position in Spain, North Africa, and Greece. Scipio was born in Rome in 236 BC to one of the city's leading families. Of his boyhood little is known. He served in the army at Rome's disastrous defeat in the battle of Cannae in the Second Punic War. In 210 he accepted the generalship of the army in Spain. In 209 he conquered New Carthage (Cartagena). By 206 he had defeated all the armies of Carthage in Spain and given Rome control of the province. Next he set out to defeat Carthage's home base in Africa. He landed there with about 35,000 men in 204. By 202, with the great battle of Zama, Scipio had defeated Carthage completely. With his military successes behind him, Scipio returned to Rome. He became leader of the Senate in 199. He also served as Roman emissary to Africa and in the East. His influence kept Greece firmly attached to Rome, and he strongly supported the emergence of Greek culture in Italy. Attacks by his enemies because of his leniency toward Carthage and Greece led him to abandon Rome for Liternum around 184. Embittered and ill, he died there soon afterward. His career had established Rome as a Mediterranean power.
TEXT.Polish: Publiusz Korneliusz Scypion Afrykañski Starszy ur. w roku 235 p.n.e. w Rzymie, zm. 183 p.n.e. w Liternum wódz rzymski z okresu II wojny punickiej, który zdo³a³ pokonaæ Hannibala, wybitnego wodza kartagiñskiego, w polu.

TEXT.English: The Scortamareva are some of the most well equipped and heaviest warriors the Lusotannan can muster. They are a fierce, well drilled and well equipped force, making them a great medium infantry that will be likely to stand well against most enemy unit types. Such warriors are considered wealthy by Lusotannan standards, having acquired their gear through trade, mercenary services or sponsorship by an important chief of the somewhat rich coastal towns. They are armed with a well made Iberian steel shortsword, a bronze breastplate, greaves, a bronze montefortino helmet and well made javelins and spear.

Scout droids, commonly referred to as the probot, was a exploration and reconnaissance droid produced by Arakyd Industries. The Viper model was based on the success of Galalloy Industries' early scout droids. The design of the probot also relied heavily on the work of Viper Sensor Intelligence Systems, a corporation acquired by Arakyd during the Clone Wars.
TEXT.French: Les droïdes éclaireurs, communément appelés probot, étaient des droïdes d'exploration et de reconnaissance produits par Arakyd Industries. Le modèle Viper s'appuyait sur le succès des premiers droïdes éclaireurs de Galalloy Industries. La conception du probot reposait également largement sur le travail de Viper Sensor Intelligence Systems, une entreprise acquise par Arakyd durant les Guerres des Clones.
TEXT.Polish: Mechy s¹ to humanoidalne roboty bojowe, sterowane przez umieszczonego w jego wnêtrzu pilota lub zdalnie (co jednak rzadko ma miejsce). Mecha s¹ zawsze bardzo potê¿ne, a posiadanie jednego (lub samo bycie pilotem) zazwyczaj jest zwi¹zane z organizacjami wojskowymi b¹dŸ wysok¹ pozycj¹ w strukturze pañstwa lub organizacji. Mo¿na wymieniæ cztery g³ówne sposoby sterowania mecha: 1. zdalnie z centrum dowodzenia lub przy wykorzystaniu sztucznej inteligencji, 2. za pomoc¹ odpowiednich dr¹¿ków lub dŸwigni, 3. poprzez mechaniczne prze³o¿enie ruchów koñczyn operatora na ruchy robota, 4. poprzez mentalne po³¹czenie pilota i mecha
TEXT.Russian: Роботы-разведчики, обычно называемые проботами, были дроидами-разведчиками, производимыми Arakyd Industries. Модель Viper была основана на успехе первых дроидов-разведчиков Galalloy Industries. Дизайн пробота также во многом опирался на работу Viper Sensor Intelligence Systems, корпорации, приобретенной Аракидом во время Войн клонов.

TEXT.English: Smart application of a nation's military resources often means identifying the points that would benefit from it the most.The use of lightly armed but fleet of foot scouts to survey the situation can permit this effective application of might.
TEXT.French: Pour exploiter au mieux ses ressources militaires, une nation doit avant tout savoir où les positionner. L'emploi d'éclaireurs, peu armés mais rapides, pour surveiller le territoire, peut faciliter les choses.
TEXT.German: Zum strategisch klugen Einsatz militärischer Ressourcen gehört auch, dass taktisch vorteilhafte Standorte bekannt sind. Um solche Stellungen auszukundschaften und die aktuelle Lage zu erkunden, eignet sich der leicht bewaffnete, flinke Späher.
TEXT.Italian: Un attento sfruttamento delle risorse militari implica l'identificazione dei punti che più trarrebbero profitto da certe azioni. L'uso di unità poco armate come gli scout permette di individuare dove utilizzare il grosso delle proprie forze.
TEXT.Spanish: La aplicación inteligente de los recursos militares de una nación significa a menudo identificar los puntos que se pueden beneficiar. El uso de exploradores a pie con armamento ligero para examinar la situación puede permitir la aplicación eficaz de la fuerza.

TEXT.English: A scramjet (supersonic combustion ramjet) is a variation of a ramjet with the key difference being that the flow in the combustor is supersonic. At higher speeds it is necessary to combust supersonically to maximize the efficiency of the combustion process. Projections for the top speed of a scramjet engine (without additional oxidiser input) vary between Mach 12 and Mach 24 (orbital velocity), but the X-30 research gave Mach 17 due to combustion rate issues. By way of contrast, the fastest conventional air-breathing, manned vehicles, such as the U.S. Air Force SR-71, achieve approximately Mach 3.4 and rockets achieved Mach 30+ during the Apollo Program.[PARAGRAPH:2]Like a ramjet, a scramjet essentially consists of a constricted tube through which inlet air is compressed by the high speed of the vehicle, a combustion chamber where fuel is combusted, and a nozzle through which the exhaust jet leaves at higher speed than the inlet air. Also like a ramjet, there are few or no moving parts. In particular there is no high speed turbine as in a turbofan or turbojet engine that is expensive to produce and can be a major point of failure.[PARAGRAPH:2]A scramjet requires supersonic airflow through the engine, thus, similar to a ramjet, scramjets have a minimum functional speed. This speed is uncertain due to the low number of working scramjets, relative youth of the field, and the largely classified nature of research using complete scramjet engines. However, it is likely to be at least Mach 5 for a pure scramjet, with higher Mach numbers (between 7 and 9) more likely. Thus scramjets require acceleration to hypersonic speed via other means. A hybrid ramjet or scramjet would have a lower minimum functional Mach number, and some sources indicate the NASA X-43A research vehicle is a hybrid design. Recent tests of prototypes have used a booster rocket to obtain the necessary velocity. Air breathing engines should have significantly better specific impulse while within the atmosphere than rocket engines.
TEXT.Polish: Scramjet (Supersonic Combustion Ramjet) jest silnikiem strumieniowym z naddŸwiêkow¹ komor¹ spalania, mog¹cym byæ stosowanym w zakresie prêdkoœci znacznie przewy¿szaj¹cych zwyk³y silnik strumieniowy Ramjet. Stosowanie takiego silnika znajduje uzasadnienie nawet do prêdkoœci odpowiadaj¹cej liczbie Macha ponad 20. Do dyfuzora wlotowego naddŸwiêkowego silnika strumieniowego wpada strumieñ powietrza z prêdkoœci¹ przekraczaj¹c¹ prêdkoœæ dŸwiêku i ulega spowolnieniu, sprê¿eniu, a czêœæ jego energii kinetycznej zamienia siê w ciep³o, powoduj¹c wzrost temperatury. Nastêpnie w komorze spalania dodawane jest paliwo, które spala siê w strumieniu nadal poruszaj¹cym siê z prêdkoœci¹ naddŸwiêkow¹, powoduj¹c dalszy wzrost jego temperatury. W rozszerzaj¹cej siê dyszy wylotowej, strumieñ rozprê¿a siê, och³adza i przyœpiesza. Ci¹g jest bezpoœrednio efektem kszta³tuj¹cego siê wewn¹trz silnika uk³adu ciœnieñ a jego wartoœæ jest proporcjonalna do zmiany w jednostce czasu iloœci ruchu przep³ywaj¹cego przez silnik powietrza.
TEXT.Russian: ГПВРД (гиперзвуковой прямоточный воздушно-реактивный двигатель) представляет собой разновидность ПВРД с основным отличием в том, что поток в камере сгорания является сверхзвуковым. На более высоких скоростях необходимо сверхзвуковое сгорание, чтобы максимизировать эффективность процесса сгорания. Прогнозы максимальной скорости ГПВРД (без дополнительного окислителя) варьируются от 12 до 24 Маха (орбитальная скорость), но исследование X-30 дало 17 Маха из-за проблем со скоростью сгорания. Для сравнения, самые быстрые обычные летательные аппараты с пилотом на воздухе, такие как SR-71 ВВС США, достигают примерно 3,4 Маха, а ракеты - 30+ Маха во время программы Аполлон.[PARAGRAPH:2]Подобно ПВРД, ПВРД по существу состоит из суженной трубы, через которую всасываемый воздух сжимается за счет высокой скорости транспортного средства, камеры сгорания, в которой сгорает топливо, и сопла, через которое выхлопная струя выходит на более высокой скорости. скорость, чем входящий воздух. Также, как и у прямоточного воздушно-реактивного двигателя, здесь мало или совсем нет движущихся частей. В частности, не существует высокоскоростной турбины, как в турбовентиляторном или турбореактивном двигателе, производство которой было бы дорогим и которое могло бы стать причиной отказа.[PARAGRAPH:2]ГПВРД требует сверхзвукового потока воздуха через двигатель, поэтому, как и ПВРД, ГПВРД имеют минимальную функциональную скорость. Эта скорость является неопределенной из-за небольшого количества работающих ГПВРД, относительной молодости этой области и в значительной степени засекреченного характера исследований с использованием полных ГПВРД. Однако для чистого ГПВРД это, вероятно, будет не менее 5 Маха, с более высокими числами Маха (от 7 до 9). Таким образом, ГПВРД требует ускорения до гиперзвуковой скорости другими способами. У гибридного ПВРД или ГПВРД будет более низкое минимальное функциональное число Маха, и некоторые источники указывают, что исследовательский аппарат NASA X-43A представляет собой гибридную конструкцию. Недавние испытания прототипов использовали ракету-носитель для получения необходимой скорости. Двигатели с воздушным дыханием должны иметь значительно лучший удельный импульс в атмосфере, чем ракетные двигатели.

TEXT.English: The Horse Archers of the Scythians would appear out of nowhere, striking where you least expected it. Their accuracy with the bow was also the stuff of legend, and rendered them even more lethal.
TEXT.French: Les archers montés des Scythes surgissaient de nulle part, frappant là où on s'y attendait le moins. Leur précision à l'arc est légendaire, ce qui les rendait encore plus meurtriers.
TEXT.Italian: Gli arcieri a cavallo Sciti comparivano dal nulla, colpendo in luoghi inaspettati. La loro accuratezza con l'arco era leggendaria, e li rendeva ancora più letali.

TEXT.English: Archeological evidence indicates the Native Americans and First Nations People in Canada have been hunting seals for at least 4,000 years. Traditionally, when an Inuit boy killed his first seal or caribou, a feast was held. The meat was an important source of fat, protein, vitamin A, vitamin B12 and iron, and the pelts were prized for their warmth. The Inuit diet is rich in fish, whale, and seal.
TEXT.French: Les preuves archéologiques indiquent que les Amérindiens et les Premières Nations du Canada chassent le phoque depuis au moins 4 000 ans. Traditionnellement, lorsqu'un garçon inuit tue son premier phoque ou caribou, un festin est organisé. La viande était une source importante de graisses, protéines, vitamines A, B12 et de fer, et les peaux étaient prisées pour leur chaleur. Le régime inuit est riche en poissons, baleines et phoques.

TEXT.English: A seaplane is a fixed-wing aircraft designed to take off and land (alight) on water. The first seaplane was invented in March 1910 by the French engineer Henri Fabre. Its name was Le Canard ('the duck'), and took off from the water and flew 800 meters on its first flight on March 28, 1910. These experiments were closely followed by the aircraft pioneers Gabriel and Charles Voisin, who purchased several of the Fabre floats and fitted them to their Canard Voisin airplane. In October 1910, the Canard Voisin became the first seaplane to fly over the river Seine, and in March 1912, the first seaplane to be used militarily from a seaplane carrier, La Foudre ('the lightning').
TEXT.Polish: Hydroplan - to samolot przystosowany konstrukcyjnie do startu i l¹dowania (wodowania) z powierzchni wody. Podstawowe rodzaje hydroplanów to: 1. wodnosamolot p³ywakowy - w zasadzie nie ró¿ni¹cy siê konstrukcyjnie od zwyk³ego samolotu z podwoziem ko³owym, lecz wyposa¿ony zamiast niego w p³ywaki. Stosowane s¹ czêœciej dwa du¿e p³ywaki pod skrzyd³ami lub rzadziej jeden du¿y p³ywak centralny i dwa mniejsze podpieraj¹ce pod skrzyd³ami. Czêsto konstrukcje takich wodnosamolotów powstawa³y przez prost¹ przeróbkê samolotu z podwoziem ko³owym, czasami nawet mo¿na montowaæ zamiennie p³ywaki lub ko³a. 2. ³ódŸ lataj¹ca - samolot, w którym czêœci¹ stykaj¹c¹ siê z wod¹ jest odpowiednio ukszta³towany spód kad³uba. Uk³ad ten wymaga stosowania szczelnych kad³ubów, spe³niaj¹cych zarówno wymagania aerodynamiki, jak i hydrodynamiki. Statecznoœæ na wodzie zapewniaj¹ zwykle dodatkowe ma³e p³ywaki pod skrzyd³ami. Samoloty takie musz¹ mieæ silniki umieszczone wysoko nad powierzchni¹ wody. 3.samolot-amfibia - wodnosamolot wyposa¿ony tak¿e w sk³adane podwozie l¹dowe (ko³a). Zazwyczaj amfibie s¹ budowane w uk³adzie ³odzi lataj¹cej, rzadziej wodnosamolotu p³ywakowego. Rozwój wodnosamolotów wi¹¿e siê przede wszystkim z samolotami wojskowymi. Wodnosamoloty wojskowe zaczê³y byæ u¿ywane na wiêksz¹ skalê w okresie I wojny œwiatowej, g³ównie do zadañ rozpoznania morskiego, zwalczania okretów podwodnych, bombardowania, rzadziej myœliwskich. W tym okresie te¿ wodnosamoloty zaczê³y bazowaæ na okrêtach wojennych (transportowcach wodnosamolotów). W okresie miêdzywojennym powsta³y liczne konstrukcje wodnosamolotów wojskowych. Sta³y siê one te¿ czêstym wyposa¿eniem wiêkszych okrêtów (pancerników i kr¹¿owników), s³u¿¹c do rozpoznania i zwiadu (startuj¹c z katapult). Podczas II wojny œwiatowej, wodnosamoloty u¿ywane by³y doœæ masowo do celów rozpoznania morskiego, zwalczania okretów podwodnych, transportowych i ratunkowych, rzadziej do bombardowania lub celów myœliwskich. Zastosowanie wodnosamolotów ogranicza³ fakt, ¿e na skutek swojej konstrukcji, mia³y one gorsze osi¹gi i manewrowoœæ od samolotów z podwoziem ko³owym, jak równie¿ ich trudnoœæ eksploatacji przy wzburzonym morzu. Po II wojnie œwiatowej produkowano ju¿ niewiele wodnosamolotów wojskowych, gdy¿ w wiêkszoœci zosta³y one wyparte przez œmig³owce bazuj¹ce na okrêtach lub samoloty pok³adowe z lotniskowców. Produkowane wci¹¿ wodnosamoloty wojskowe s³u¿y³y g³ównie do celów rozpoznania morskiego, ratunkowych i zwalczania okrêtów podwodnych.

TEXT.English: The Search Bloc (Spanish: Bloque de Búsqueda) was the name of three different Special Operations units of the National Police of Colombia (Policía Nacional de Colombia). They were originally focused on capturing (or killing) a particular individual or group of individuals.
TEXT.French: Le Bloc de Recherche (espagnol : Bloque de Búsqueda) était le nom donné à trois unités différentes des opérations spéciales de la Police Nationale de Colombie. Elles étaient initialement chargées de capturer (ou tuer) une personne ou un groupe en particulier.

TEXT.English: The secretarybird or secretary bird (Sagittarius serpentarius) is a very large, mostly terrestrial bird of prey. Endemic to Africa, it is usually found in the open grasslands and savannah of the sub-Saharan region. Although a member of the order Accipitriformes, which also includes many other diurnal raptors such as kites, buzzards, vultures, and harriers, it is given its own family, Sagittariidae.[PARAGRAPH:2]It appears on the coats of arms of Sudan and South Africa.[PARAGRAPH:2]The secretarybird is instantly recognizable as a very large bird with an eagle-like body on crane-like legs which increases the birds height to as much as 1.3 m (4 ft) tall. This bird has an eagle-like head with a hooked bill, but has rounded wings. Height can range from 90 to 137 cm (35 to 54 in). Total length from 112 to 152 cm (44 to 60 in) and the wingspan is 191 - 220 cm (75 - 87 in). Body mass can range from 2.3 to 5 kg (5.1 to 11.0 lb) with 20 birds from southern Africa found to weigh an average of 4.02 kg (8.9 lb). Other attempts to estimate the mean weight range for secretarybirds correspondingly lie between 3.5 and 4.2 kg (7.7 and 9.3 lb). The tarsus of the secretarybird averages 31 cm (12 in) and the tail is 57 - 85 cm (22 - 33 in), both factor into making them both taller and longer than any other species of raptor since these features are not as long in any other living raptor. The neck is not especially long, and can only be lowered down to the inter-tarsal joint, so birds reaching down to the ground or drinking must stop to do so.[PARAGRAPH:2]From a distance or in flight it resembles a crane more than a bird of prey. The tail has two elongated central feathers that extend beyond the feet during flight, as well as long flat plumage creating a posterior crest. Secretarybird flight feathers and thighs are black, while most of the coverts are grey with some being white. Sexes look similar to one another as the species exhibits very little sexual dimorphism, although the male has longer head plumes and tail feathers. Adults have a featherless red face as opposed to the yellow facial skin of the young.
TEXT.Polish: Sekretarz (Sagittarius serpentarius) - gatunek du¿ego ptaka drapie¿nego, bêd¹cy jedynym przedstawicielem rodziny sekretarzy (Sagittariidae). Wystêpuje w Afryce subsaharyjskiej, od Senegalu do Somalii, a¿ po Przyl¹dek Dobrej Nadziei na po³udniu. Od innych ptaków drapie¿nych odró¿nia go nietypowa sylwetka, która jest przystosowaniem do specyficznego trybu ¿ycia. Ma stosunkowo d³ugie nogi z d³ugimi palcami, zaokr¹glone skrzyd³a i zakrzywiony dziób. Dodatkowo na g³owie ma ozdobny czubek. Obie p³ci ubarwione podobnie, samiec ma jedynie d³u¿szy czubek i d³u¿szy ogon. Z oddali lub w locie przypomina ¿urawia. D³ugi ogon w locie wystaje poza nogi, œrodkowe sterówki s¹ wyd³u¿one. Upierzenie g³ównie szarobia³e, lotki, nogawice, koniec ogona i czubka czarny. Na czêœci twarzowej czerwona, naga skóra; u m³odych ptaków jest ona koloru ¿ó³tego.

TEXT.English: Emory Sekaquaptewa (1928 - December 14, 2007) was a Hopi leader and scholar from the Third Mesa village of Hotevilla, best known for his role in compiling the first dictionary of the Hopi language. Sekaquaptewa worked in many fields during his life. He was believed to be the first Arizona Native American to attend West Point, and he later attended law school at the University of Arizona. Working with his brother, he developed new methods of jewelry production. He held various leadership positions within the village of Kykotsmovi, as well as positions on the Hopi Tribal Council and the appellate division of the Hopi Tribal Court.

Semiramis was a legendary Assyrian queen who was most likely based on a historical Assyrian queen, Sammu-ramat. Sammu-ramat was the mother of the Assyrian king Adad-nirari III (reigned 810 - 783 BC). Her stela (memorial stone shaft) has been found at Ashur, while an inscription at Calah (Nimrud) shows her to have been dominant there after the death of her husband, Shamshi-Adad V (823 - 811 BC). Sammu-ramat was mentioned by Herodotus, and the later historian Diodorus Siculus elaborated a whole legend about her. According to him, she was born of a goddess, and, after being married to an Assyrian officer, she captivated the king Ninus by her beauty and valour and became his wife. Soon afterward, when Ninus died, Sammu-ramat assumed power and reigned for many years. In that time she built Babylon and turned to the conquest of distant lands. In Armenian legend, she lusted after the Armenian king Ara. When he refused her, she attacked Armenia and he was killed in battle. Afterwards, she attempted to revive his dead corpse to no avail.
TEXT.Polish: Semiramida znana z tradycji hellenistycznej i antycznej legendarna królowa babiloñska, bohaterka licznych podañ i legendarnych opowieœci z terenów Bliskiego Wschodu. U Herodota wymieniana jest jako ta, która wznios³a nabrze¿a portowe w Babilonie. Wed³ug Diodora Sycylijskiego mia³a byæ pó³bogini¹, wykarmion¹ w dzieciñstwie przez go³êbice, kobiet¹ wielkiej urody, ma³¿onk¹ króla asyryjskiego Ninusa. To ona za³o¿yæ mia³a Babilon i stworzyæ imperium rozci¹gaj¹ce siê od Egiptu po Indie. Przed œmierci¹ przekazaæ mia³a w³adzê synowi Ninjasowi, a sama zamieniæ siê w go³êbicê. W tradycji armeñskiej zachowa³a siê opowieœæ o wielkiej wyprawie Semiramidy do Armenii i za³o¿eniu przez ni¹ miasta Wan. Imiê Semiramida jest wci¹¿ popularne na obszarze Bliskiego Wschodu. Wielu badaczy za pierwowzór Semiramidy uwa¿a postaæ Sammu-ramat, królowej asyryjskiej, ma³¿onki Szamszi-Adada V (823-811 p.n.e.).

TEXT.English: Regarding the point about corruption due to human making, I find it helpful to think of a governance AI as being much like a constitution - yes there are shitty constitutions out there that are explicitly biased towards those who wrote it, but occasionally sound democratic and rights-ensuring provisions make their way into what are some of the most enlightened documents humanity has ever conceived. An AI could be much the same - if the intentions are good of the founding populace, they could encode rights and principles into an intelligent entity that would forever put them beyond the tampering of dictators or corrupt politicians.
TEXT.Russian: Что касается вопроса о коррупции из-за человеческой деятельности, я считаю полезным рассматривать ИИ-управление как нечто похожее на конституцию - да, существуют дерьмовые конституции, которые явно предвзяты по отношению к тем, кто их написал, но иногда звучат демократично и верно - обеспечение положения проявляется в том, что является некоторыми из самых просветительских документов, которые когда-либо придумало человечество. ИИ мог бы быть почти таким же - если бы намерения были хорошими для основателей, они могли бы закодировать права и принципы в интеллектуальную сущность, которая навсегда выведет их за пределы вмешательства диктаторов или коррумпированных политиков.

TEXT.English: Sentroids are the first non-biological entities to qualify to be called not only alive but truly 'sentient' as we are. We will have to start worrying about our units 'dying' again, but then again they have the advanced firepower to be worth an ounce of angst.
TEXT.French: Les Sentroïdes sont les premières entités non biologiques pouvant être qualifiées non seulement de vivantes mais aussi véritablement « sentientes » comme nous le sommes. Nous devrons à nouveau nous inquiéter de la « mort » de nos unités, mais ils disposent d'une puissance de feu avancée qui justifie cette inquiétude.
TEXT.Polish: Android - robot humanoid, czyli mechaniczne urz¹dzenie wykonuj¹ce automatycznie pewne zadania, którego kszta³t przypomina ludzkie cia³o. Androidy s¹ postaciami wystêpuj¹cymi w literaturze i filmie science-fiction. Android posiadaj¹cy cechy kobiece nazywany jest fembotem.
TEXT.Russian: Ñåíòðîèäû - ïåðâûå íåáèîëîãè÷åñêèå ñîçäàíèÿ ïðåòåíäóþùèå ñ÷èòàòüñÿ íå ïðîñòî ïîäîáèÿìè æèçíè, íî ïî-íàñòîÿùåìó 'æèâûìè' êàê è ìû. Ìû âíîâü äîëæíû íà÷àòü áåñïîêîèòüñÿ î 'ãèáåëè' íàøèõ ïîäðàçäåëåíèé, íî îïÿòü æå îíè èìåþò ðàñøèðåííóþ îãíåâóþ ìîùü, òàê ÷òî íåò ïðè÷èí äëÿ îñîáîé òðåâîãè.

TEXT.English: By definition, the "sepoy" is an indigenous soldier serving in the armed forces of a European power. The most commonly known example is a native Indian fighting for the British occupational forces in India, starting in the sixteenth century. The rank of sepoy is the lowest enlisted rank in the British India army, similar to that of a private. Sepoy soldiers were the driving force behind the 1857 uprising associated with the British East India Company, the commercial trade empire that had occupied and exploited the territories of India since as early as 1610

The Serengeti has some of East Africa's finest game areas. The governments of Tanzania and Kenya maintain a number of protected areas, including national parks, conservation areas, and game reserves, that give legal protection to over 80 percent of the Serengeti.
TEXT.French: Le Serengeti comprend certaines des meilleures réserves de gibier d'Afrique de l'Est. Les gouvernements de Tanzanie et du Kenya maintiennent plusieurs zones protégées, incluant parcs nationaux, zones de conservation et réserves de chasse, offrant une protection légale à plus de 80 % du Serengeti.

TEXT.English: Ratu Seru Epenisa Cakobau was a Fijian Ratu and warlord (Vunivalu) who united part of Fiji's warring tribes under his leadership, establishing a united Fijian kingdom.
TEXT.French: Ratu Seru Epenisa Cakobau était un Ratu fidjien et chef de guerre (Vunivalu) qui unifia une partie des tribus en guerre des Fidji sous sa direction, établissant un royaume fidjien uni.

TEXT.English: Automation has reached a new peak. It is considered substandard and inneffective to employ human mechanics in the field anymore. It places them in unnecessary danger. They operate slower, take longer to make diagnoses and solutions, and demand more pay. Vehicles must transport them. Robots, however, given the advanced degree that AI programming and advanced processing have achieved, can achieve all mechanical needs at a much accelerated pace once given the knowledge that humans have obtained throughout a history of mechanical development. They've even begun to be put to use in evaluating new and improved mechanical designs and before long even human masters are confused by the amazing and efficient complexity droids have achieved. Now humans can't even work on mechanical devices as they can hardly begin to understand them.
TEXT.Polish: Droid - to okreœlenie wiêkszoœci bardziej skomplikowanych robotów, w tym androidów - zazwyczaj wyposa¿onych w pewien poziom sztucznej inteligencji.
TEXT.Russian: Автоматизация достигла нового пика. Считается некондиционным и неэффективным больше использовать человеческую механику в этой области. Это подвергает их ненужной опасности. Они работают медленнее, требуют больше времени для постановки диагнозов и решений и требуют большей оплаты. Их должны перевозить транспортные средства. Роботы, с учетом продвинутой степени, достигнутой в программировании ИИ и продвинутой обработке, могут удовлетворять все механические потребности в гораздо более быстром темпе, если учесть знания, полученные людьми на протяжении всей истории развития механики. Их даже начали использовать при оценке новых и улучшенных механических конструкций, и вскоре даже человеческие мастера были сбиты с толку удивительными и эффективными сложными дроидами, которых достигли. Теперь люди не могут даже работать с механическими устройствами, так как с трудом начинают их понимать.

TEXT.English: When cities grew to a size where the resources were insufficient to adequately insure a decent standard of living for the populace, adventurous groups of citizens set out on their own in search of a place to build a new city. Once a suitable site was found, the settlers would build their new homes, and develop the land surrounding the city. Eventually the whole process repeated, and the new city would send out settlers of its own. This process allowed civilizations to grow throughout history, from the empires of the ancient world to the discovery and settlement of the New World.
TEXT.French: Quand une ville ne disposait plus des ressources nécessaires pour assurer un niveau de vie décent à sa population, un groupe d'habitants audacieux prenait la route à la recherche d'un endroit où fonder une nouvelle ville. Une fois le site trouvé, les colons construisaient de nouvelles maisons et exploitaient la terre autour de la ville. Puis le processus recommençait, et d'autres colons quittaient à leur tour la nouvelle ville en quête d'autres territoires. C'est de cette façon que des civilisations s'étendirent, tels les empires de l'Antiquité, et que, à l'instar du Nouveau Monde, des territoires furent découvert et colonisés.
TEXT.German: Als die ersten Städte zu einer Größe heranwuchsen, bei der die Ressourcen nicht mehr ausreichten, um der Bevölkerung einen ausreichenden Lebensstandard zu ermöglichen, machten sich abenteuerlustige Bürger auf, einen Ort für eine neue Stadt zu suchen. War eine geeignete Stelle gefunden, bauten die Siedler ein neues Zuhause und kultivierten das Umland ihrer Stadt. Schließlich wiederholte sich der ganze Prozess und die neue Stadt sandte wiederum Siedler aus. Auf diese Weise konnten sich im Lauf der Geschichte Kulturen immer weiter ausbreiten, von den antiken Reichen der Alten Welt bis zur Entdeckung und Besiedlung der Neuen Welt.
TEXT.Italian: Quando le città raggiungevano dimensioni tali da rendere insufficienti le risorse disponibili per garantire un tenore di vita normale alla popolazione, alcuni gruppi di valorosi avventurieri partivano alla ricerca di un luogo adatto a fondare una nuova città. Quando veniva trovato un sito idoneo, i coloni costruivano le loro abitazioni, sviluppandosi sul terreno attorno alla città. Questo processo veniva poi ripetuto e le nuove città sarebbero state in grado di inviare nuovi coloni in giro per il mondo. Così facendo, le civiltà hanno potuto perpetuarsi nel corso della storia, dagli imperi del mondo antico alla scoperta e alla colonizzazione del Nuovo Continente.
TEXT.Spanish: Cuando las ciudades alcanzaban un tamaño en el que los recursos eran insuficientes para garantizar un nivel decente de vida para los habitantes, grupos de ciudadanos aventureros emprendían la marcha para construir una nueva ciudad. Una vez encontraban un emplazamiento adecuado, los colonos construían sus nuevos hogares y explotaban la tierra circundante. Con el tiempo, se repetía todo el proceso y la nueva ciudad enviaba sus propios colonos fuera. Este proceso ha permitido a las civilizaciones crecer a lo largo de la historia, desde los imperios del mundo antiguo al descubrimiento y colonización del Nuevo Mundo.

TEXT.English: Shah Rukh (August 20, 1377 - March 12, 1447) was the ruler of the eastern portion of the empire established by the Central Asian warlord Timur (Tamerlane) - the founder of the Timurid dynasty - governing most of Persia and Transoxiana between 1405 and 1447. He was the fourth and youngest son of Timur and child of one of his Persian wives. After Timur's death in 1405, his empire fell apart with various tribes and warlords competing for dominance. The Black Sheep Turkmen destroyed the western empire in 1410 when they captured Baghdad, but in Persia and Transoxiana Shahrukh was able to secure effective control from about 1409. His empire controlled the main trade routes between East and West, including the legendary Silk Road, and became immensely wealthy as a result. The devastation of Persia's main cities led to the cultural centre of the empire shifting to Samarqand in modern Uzbekistan and Herat in modern Afghanistan. Shahrukh chose to have his capital not in Samarqand, but in Herat. This was to become the political centre of the Timurid empire, and residence of his principal successors, though both cities benefited from the wealth and privilege of Shahrukh's court, which was a great patron of the arts and sciences. His wife, Gowhar Shad, funded the construction of two outstanding mosques and theological colleges in Mashhad and Herat. The Gowhar-Shad-Mosque was finished in 1418. The mixed ethnic origins of the ruling dynasty led to a distinctive character in its cultural outlook, which was a combination of Persian civilization and art, with borrowings from China, and literature written in Persian as well as Turkic and Arabic. In fact, Shah Rukh sent a large embassy to the Ming Dynasty of China in 1419. Shahrukh died during a journey in Persia and was succeeded by his son, Mohammad Taragae Ulugh Beg, who had been viceroy of Transoxiana during his father's lifetime.
TEXT.Polish: Szahruch, (ur. 30 sierpnia 1377 w Samarkandzie, zm. 13 marca 1447 w Reju)? w³adca z dynastii Timurydów, panuj¹cy w latach 1405 - 1447. Szahruch by³ czwartym i najm³odszym synem Timura (1370 - 1405), w chwili jego œmierci sprawuj¹cym namiestnictwo Chorasanu. W walce o schedê po ojcu Szahruch udzieli³ wsparcia desygnowanemu przez niego nastêpcy, Pir Muhammadowi (1405 - 1407), jednak mia³o ono wymiar raczej czysto nominalny. Kiedy w roku 1407 zgin¹³ Pir Muhammad, a w roku 1408 jedyny obok Szahrucha ¿yj¹cy syn Timura, Miranszah (1405 - 1408), Szahruch sta³ siê g³ównym kandydatem do przejêcia dziedzictwa ojca. W roku 1409 opanowa³ on Mawarannahr wraz ze stolic¹ Timura, Samarkand¹, i nastêpnie do roku 1418 podporz¹dkowa³ sobie pozosta³ych Timurydów. Niemniej nie uda³o mu siê opanowaæ wszystkich dawnych terytoriów Timura, poniewa¿ w miêdzyczasie w Azerbejd¿anie i Iraku zainstalowali siê Kara Kojunlu. Mimo kilku wypraw ostatecznie Szahruch musia³ zadowoliæ siê jedynie nominalnym zwierzchnictwem nad desygnowanym przez siebie w³adc¹ Kara Kojunlu, D¿ahanszahem (1438 - 1467). Jednoczeœnie od roku 1430 posiad³oœci Timurydów w Azji Œrodkowej by³y naje¿d¿ane przez Uzbeków Abu al-Chajr-chana (1428 - 1468). W ostatnich latach ¿ycia kontrola coraz bardziej schorowanego Szahrucha nad sprawami pañstwa zaczê³a s³abn¹æ. W roku 1446 w zachodnim i centralnym Iranie wybuch³a rebelia jego wnuka, Sultana Muhammada, i Szahruch zmar³ podczas jej t³umienia.

TEXT.English: Shakushain's Revolt was an Ainu rebellion against Japanese authority on Hokkaido between 1669 to 1672. It was led by Ainu chieftain Shakushain against the Matsumae clan, who represented Japanese trading and governmental interests in the area of Hokkaido then controlled by the Japanese (Wajin).
TEXT.French: La révolte de Shakushain fut une rébellion aïnoue contre l'autorité japonaise à Hokkaido entre 1669 et 1672. Elle fut menée par le chef aïnou Shakushain contre le clan Matsumae, représentant les intérêts commerciaux et gouvernementaux japonais dans la région d'Hokkaido alors sous contrôle japonais (Wajin).
TEXT.Polish: Shakushain - przywódca ajnuskiego powstania przeciwko japoñskiej obecnoœci na Hokkaido (1669-1672). By³ wodzem Ajnów zamieszkuj¹cych dolinê rzeki Shibuchari. W 1668 roku, w zwi¹zku z konfliktem z pobratymcami zamieszkuj¹cymi okolice rzeki Saru, zabi³ ich przywódcê. Rok póŸniej wyst¹pi³ zbrojnie przeciwko nieuczciwym praktykom w handlu ajnusko-japoñskim, w istocie jednak jego dzia³ania mia³y charakter wojny narodowowyzwoleñczej. Zosta³ zamordowany w czasie jednej z rund rokowañ pokojowych, natomiast wywo³any przez niego zryw zosta³ ostatecznie spacyfikowany przez ekspedycjê karn¹.

TEXT.English: Shang Yang was an important Chinese statesman of the State of Qin during the Warring States period who contributed to what would be termed Chinese Legalism, as detailed in the The Book of Lord Shang. With the support of Duke Xiao of Qin, Yang enacted numerous reforms, transforming the peripheral Qin state into a militarily powerful and strongly centralized kingdom, enhancing the administration through an emphasis on meritocracy.
TEXT.French: Shang Yang fut un important homme d'État chinois de l'État de Qin durant la période des Royaumes combattants, contribuant à ce que l'on appelle le légaliste chinois, comme détaillé dans le Livre du Seigneur Shang. Avec le soutien du Duc Xiao de Qin, Yang institua de nombreuses réformes, transformant l'État périphérique de Qin en un royaume militairement puissant et fortement centralisé, renforçant l'administration par une emphase sur la méritocratie.

TEXT.English: The first founding of Shan states inside the present-day boundaries of Burma began during the Pagan Kingdom in the Shan Hills and accelerated after 1287, when the Pagan Kingdom fell to the Mongols. The Shans, who came South with the Mongols, stayed and quickly came to dominate much of northern to eastern arc of Burma-from northwestern Sagaing Division to Kachin Hills to the present-day Shan Hills. The most powerful Shan states were Mong Yang (Mohnyin) and Mong Kawng (Mogaung) in present-day Kachin State, followed by Hsenwi (Theinni), Hsipaw (Thibaw) and Mong Mit (Momeik) in present-day northern Shan State.
The Shaolin Monks were the product of the Shaolin Temple. Their martial arts feats have become the stuff of legends across the globe.
TEXT.French: Les Moine Shaolins étaient le produit du Temple Shaolin. Leurs exploits d'arts martiaux sont devenus l'étoffe de légendes à travers le monde.
TEXT.Italian: I monaci shaolin erano addestrati nel Tempio Shaolin. Le loro arti marziali sono diventate leggendarie in tutto il mondo.
TEXT.Russian: Монахи Шаолинь - непревзойденные рукопашные бойцы из одноименного храма Шаолинь. Их подвиги в боевых искусствах стали легендой по всему миру.

TEXT.English: Shapur I was the Persian king of the Sasanian dynasty who consolidated and expanded the empire founded by his father, Ardashir I. Shapur continued his father's wars with Rome, conquering Nisibis (modern Nusaybin, Tur.) and Carrhae (Harran, Tur.) and advancing deep into Syria. Defeated at Resaina (now in Turkey) in 243, he was able, nevertheless, to conclude a favourable peace in 244. In 256 he took advantage of the internal chaos within the Roman Empire and invaded Syria, Anatolia, and Armenia; he sacked Antioch but was repulsed by the emperor Valerian. In 260, however, Shapur not only defeated Valerian at Edessa (modern Urfa, Tur.) but captured him and kept him a prisoner for the rest of his life. The capture of Valerian was a favourite subject of Sasanian rock carvings. Shapur does not appear to have aimed at a permanent occupation of the eastern Roman provinces; he merely carried off enormous booty both in treasure and in men. The captives from Antioch were forced to build the city of Gondeshapur, later famous as a centre of learning. Using the same captives, who excelled the Persians in technical skill, he built the dam at Shushtar known from that time as the Band-e Qeysar, Dam of Caesar. Regardless, Shapur, no longer content to describe himself as "king of kings of Iran", as his father had done, styled himself king of kings of Iran and non-Iran - that is, of non-Persian territories as well. He appears to have tried to find a religion suitable for all of the empire, showing marked favour to Mani, the founder of Manichaeism. Inscriptions show that he also founded Zoroastrian fire temples and sought to broaden the base of the newly revived Zoroastrian religion by the addition of material derived from both Greek and Indian sources.
TEXT.Polish: Szapur I (? - 272)? w³adca Persji z dynastii Sasanidów, syn Ardaszira I. Panowa³ samodzielnie w okresie 241 - 272. Wczeœniej prawdopodobnie wspó³rz¹dzi³ z ojcem. D¹¿y³ do odbudowania dawnej potêgi Persji, przyj¹³ tytu³ szachinszach eran ud aneran (król królów Ariów i nie-Ariów). Rozpocz¹³ likwidacjê niezale¿nych ksiêstw powsta³ych w czasach panowania dynastii Arsacydów osadzaj¹c w nich swoich krewnych jako namiestników. W roku 241 rozpocz¹³ wojnê z Cesarstwem rzymskim podbijaj¹c prowincjê Mezopotamia i Syriê. W 243 Rzymianie zdo³ali odzyskaæ czêœæ utraconego terytorium. Po roku 253 wojska Szapura podbijaj¹ Antiochiê oraz czêœæ Kapadocji. W 256 podbija Armeniê. W wygranej bitwie pod Edess¹ Szapur I pojma³ cesarza Waleriana I, jedynego cesarza rzymskiego, który dosta³ siê do niewoli i w niej zmar³. Jako niewolnik Walerian s³u¿y³ Szapurowi za stopieñ, gdy ten wsiada³ na konia. W czasie swego panowania zbudowa³ wiele miast. Za jego czasów dzia³a³ w Persji prorok Mani.

TEXT.English: Seminole culture is largely derived from Creek culture. Most Seminoles speak the Mikasuki language, with some (such as those living on the Brighton Seminole Reservation) speaking Creek; English is also prevalent today. The most important ceremony is the Green Corn Dance, which is celebrated largely as it is among the Creeks; other notable Creek-derived traditions include use of the black drink and ritual smoking of tobacco. As the Seminole adapted to the Florida environment, they developed their own local traditions, such as the construction of open air thatched-roof houses known as chickees.

is a person who is skilled in precision shooting, using projectile weapons, such as with a rifle but most commonly with a sniper rifle, to shoot at long range targets. The main difference between a sharpshooter and a normal sniper is that a sharpshooter is usually considered an organic part of a team of soldiers, whereas regular snipers tend to work alone or with other snipers. In the military, marksmen are sometimes attached to an infantry squad where they take accurate long-range shots at valuable targets as needed, thus extending the reach of the squad.
TEXT.Polish: Strzelec wyborowy to ¿o³nierz lub cz³onek innej uzbrojonej formacji wyszkolony w precyzyjnym strzelaniu na du¿¹ odleg³oœæ, obserwacji i maskowaniu. Uzbrojenie strzelca wyborowego stanowi karabin wyborowy, specjalnie wyselekcjonowana broñ wyposa¿ona w celownik optyczny, noktowizor lub inny celownik umo¿liwiaj¹cy celne strzelanie na du¿e odleg³oœci. Zadaniem strzelca wyborowego na polu walki jest eliminowanie wa¿nych celów pojawiaj¹cych siê w krótkim czasie. Mog¹ nimi byæ strzelcy wyborowi wroga, ³¹cznicy, obs³uga broni ciê¿kiej, za³ogi pojazdów pancernych uszkodzonych na polu walki, dowódcy.

TEXT.English: Muhammad Shaybani Khan also known as Abul-Fath Shaybani Khan or Shayabak Khan or Shahi Beg Khan (c. 1451 - 2 December 1510), was an Uzbek leader who consolidated various Uzbek tribes and laid the foundations for their ascendance in Transoxiana and the establishment of the Khanate of Bukhara. He was a descendant of Shiban (or Shayban), the fifth son of Jochi, Genghis Khan's eldest son.
TEXT.French: Muhammad Shaybani Khan, aussi connu sous le nom d'Abul-Fath Shaybani Khan, Shayabak Khan ou Shahi Beg Khan (vers 1451 - 2 décembre 1510), fut un leader ouzbek qui consolida diverses tribus ouzbèkes et posa les bases de leur ascension en Transoxiane et l'établissement du Khanat de Boukhara. Il était un descendant de Shiban (ou Shayban), le cinquième fils de Jochi, aîné de Gengis Khan.

TEXT.English: Sha-cpay, whose name in the Dakota language means "The Six", was painted from life by George Catlin. Catlin traveled throughout Western North America and painted Indians at a time when the only contact with Whites was from explorers and traders. The chief of that part of the Ojibbeway tribe who inhabit these northern regions. is a man of huge size; with dignity of manner, and pride and vanity, just about in proportion to his bulk. He sat for his portrait in a most beautiful dress, fringed with scalp locks in profusion; which he had snatched, in his early life from his enemies' heads, and now wears as proud trophies and proofs of what his arm has accomplished in battles with his enemies. His shirt of buckskin is beautifully embroidered and painted in curious hieroglyphics, the history of his battles and charts of his life.

The process of both iron smelting and forging was introduced to Sub-Saharan Africa from the north, thus many African swords were of Egyptian derivation. Among some communities, swords were restricted to royalty or tribal leaders. Forms vary from one area to another, such as the billao of Somalia, boomerang-sword in Niger or the single-edge swords of the Gold Coast. The Abyssinian shotel took the form of a large sickle, like the Egyptian khopesh, with a small 4 inch wooden handle. The edge was on the inside of the blade, which has a mid-rib running along its entire length. Double-edge swords similar to those of Europe and ancient Arabia occurred in some areas such as the takoba and kaskara. Two types of sword existed in Zanzibar: the foot-long shortsword and the standard sword with a blade measuring 3-3.5 feet and a cylindrical pommel. The latter weapon was wielded with both hands like a quarterstaff.

Sheba was a kingdom mentioned in the Hebrew scriptures (Old Testament) and the Qur'an. Sheba features in Ethiopian, Hebrew and Qur'anic traditions. Among other things it was the home of the biblical "Queen of Sheba" (named Makeda in Ethiopian tradition and Bilqis in Arabic tradition).
TEXT.French: Saba était un royaume mentionné dans les Écritures hébraïques (Ancien Testament) et le Coran. Saba figure dans les traditions éthiopiennes, hébraïques et coraniques. Entre autres, il fut le foyer de la « Reine de Saba » biblique (nommée Makeda dans la tradition éthiopienne et Bilqis dans la tradition arabe).

TEXT.English: The founding of Mombasa is associated with two rulers: Mwana Mkisi (female) and Shehe Mvita. According to oral history and medieval commentaries, Shehe Mvita superseded the dynasty of Mwana Mkisi and established his own town on Mombasa Island. Shehe Mvita is remembered as a Muslim of great learning and so is connected more directly with the present ideals of Swahili culture that people identify with Mombasa. The ancient history associated with Shehe Mvita and the founding of an urban settlement on Mombasa Island is still linked to present-day peoples living in Mombasa. The Thenashara Taifa (or Twelve Nations) Swahili lineages recount this ancient history today and are the keepers of local Swahili traditions. Even though today Mombasa is a very heterogeneous cultural mix, families associated with the Twelve Nations are still considered the original inhabitants of the city.

The Hemudu culture was one of the earliest cultures to cultivate rice. Recent excavations at the Hemudu period site of Tianluoshan has demonstrated rice was undergoing evolutionary changes recognized as domestication. Most of the artifacts discovered at Hemudu consist of animal bones, exemplified by hoes made of shoulder bones used for cultivating rice. In the early Hemudu period is the maternal clan phase. Descent is said to be matrilineal and the social status of children and women is comparatively high. In the later periods, they gradually transitioned into patrilineal clans. During this period, the social status of men rose and descent is passed through the male line.

The first people to tend to animals and begin learning how their health needs may at times differ from humans were the humble Shepherds. They mastered these skills to the point that when animals were brought to the battlefield it was the shepherds of the community that were called upon to tend to the injured.
TEXT.French: Les premiers à s'occuper des animaux et à apprendre que leurs besoins en santé diffèrent parfois de ceux des humains furent les humbles bergers. Ils perfectionnèrent ces compétences au point que, sur le champ de bataille, ce furent les bergers de la communauté qu'on appelait pour soigner les blessés.
TEXT.Polish: Pasterstwo - rodzaj hodowli stadnych zwierz¹t domowych, prowadzonej na obszarach nienadaj¹cych siê do uprawy roli, ale bêd¹cych w stanie wy¿ywiæ stada zwierz¹t, np. góry, stepy, tundra. Gatunki pasterskie to g³ównie owce, kozy, lamy, renifery, byd³o, trzoda chlewna, wielb³¹dy, konie i jaki. Dla ludzi trudni¹cych siê pasterstwem wi¹¿e siê z koczowniczym, ewentualnie pó³koczowniczym, trybem ¿ycia. W Polsce prowadzi siê sezonowy wypas owiec na halach górskich miêdzy innymi tak zwany wypas kulturowy.

TEXT.English: The sheriff is most often an elected county official, and serves as the arm of the county or parish court; but some cities, such as those in the Commonwealth of Virginia, also have a sheriff's office that serves as the arm of the city court and jail. The sheriff performs court duties. These may include such functions as administering the county or city jail, providing courtroom security and prisoner transportation, serving warrants and serving process. In urban areas, a sheriff may be restricted to those duties. Many other sheriffs and their deputies may serve as the principal police force.
TEXT.Polish: Szeryf? urz¹d w systemie prawodawstwa angielskiego, szkockiego i Stanów Zjednoczonych, tak¿e stanowisko osoby piastuj¹cej ten urz¹d. Tytu³ szeryfa wywodzi siê ze œredniowiecznej Anglii, gdzie oznacza³ urzêdnika królewskiego na terenie hrabstwa. W Stanach Zjednoczonych szeryf jest zazwyczaj? wybieralnym przez mieszkañców na okres od roku do czterech lat? funkcjonariuszem si³ porz¹dkowych na terenie hrabstwa lub miejscowoœci. Biuro szeryfa znajduje siê przewa¿nie w stolicy danego hrabstwa. Wiêkszoœæ szeryfów nadzoruje tak¿e wiêzienia (County Jail), w których mog¹ byæ przetrzymywani aresztowani np. oczekuj¹cy na rozprawê s¹dow¹.

TEXT.English: Sher Ali Khan was Amir of Afghanistan from 1863 to 1866 and from 1868 until his death in 1879. He was the third son of Dost Mohammed Khan, founder of the Barakzai Dynasty in Afghanistan. Sher Ali Khan initially seized power when his father died, but was quickly ousted by his older brother, Mohammad Afzal Khan. Internecine warfare followed until Sher Ali defeated his brother and regained the title of Emir. His rule was hindered by pressure from both Britain and Russia, though Sher Ali attempted to keep Afghanistan neutral during their conflict. In 1878, the neutrality fell apart and the Second Anglo-Afghan War erupted. As British forces marched on Kabul, Sher Ali Khan decided to leave Kabul to seek political asylum in Russia. He died in Mazar-e Sharif, leaving the throne to his son Mohammad Yaqub Khan.

Ships of the Line were the largest vessels deployed during the height of the European wooden navies, from the seventeenth until the mid-nineteenth century. In naval strategy, the most powerful ships of each respective navy would often form into lines and unleash a barrage upon their rivals. Ships of the Line, as they were known, usually carried 80 or more guns, but this extra-heavy armament cost the vessel dearly in maneuverability.
TEXT.French: Les galions sont les plus grands vaisseaux déployés pendant l'apogée des navires en bois européens, du dix-septième au milieu du dix-neuvième siècle. La stratégie la plus couramment employée par les marines nationales consiste à placer les plus puissants de leurs galions en ligne pour leur faire déclencher un tir de barrage contre leurs rivaux. Les galions transportent habituellement 80 canons ou plus, mais ce lourd armement leur fait énormément perdre en maniabilité.
TEXT.German: Linienschiffe waren die größten Schiffe, die während der Blütezeit der europäischen Holzschiffe eingesetzt wurden - vom 17. bis Mitte des 19. Jahrhunderts. In der Marinestrategie bildeten die stärksten Schiffe jeder einzelnen Marine häufig Linien und beschossen ihre Gegner mit Sperrfeuer. Typische Linienschiffe waren mit 80 oder mehr Kanonen ausgerüstet, das zusätzliche Gewicht der Bewaffnung ging jedoch deutlich zu Lasten der Manövrierbarkeit.
TEXT.Italian: Le Navi da prima linea furono i più grossi vascelli schierati durante il periodo d'oro delle flotte di legno europee, dal diciassettesimo secolo fino alla metà del diciannovesimo. Secondo la strategia navale, le più potenti navi della flotta si schieravano in linea e facevano fuoco su quelle rivali. Le Navi da prima linea, come vennero chiamate, portavano 80 o più cannoni ma tutte queste armi comportavano un costo in termini di manovrabilità.
TEXT.Spanish: Los buques de guerra fueron las embarcaciones más grandes empleadas durante la edad de oro de los barcos de madera, del siglo XVII hasta mediados del XIX. Según los manuales de estrategia naval, los barcos más potentes de cada armada debían formar una línea y descargar sus cañones contra el enemigo. Los buques de guerra llevaban muchas veces 80 o más cañones, pero esta gran potencia tenía un elevado coste en términos de maniobrabilidad.

TEXT.French: Blindé APC à ondes de choc
TEXT.Italian: Veicolo trasporto truppe a onda d'urto

TEXT.English: Now that the Internal Shockwave Engine has largely superseded internal combustion, it is only natural that an armoured personnel carrier has been developed using the new technology.
TEXT.French: Maintenant que le moteur d'onde de choc interne a largement supplanté la combustion interne, il est naturel qu'un transport de troupes blindé ait été développé utilisant cette nouvelle technologie.
TEXT.Russian: Теперь, когда внутренний роторный двигатель в значительной степени вытеснил традиционный бензиновый мотор, вполне естественно, что бронетранспортер был разработан с использованием новой технологии

TEXT.English: Hedjkheperre Setepenre Shoshenq I, (reigned c.943-922 BCE) - was a pharaoh of ancient Egypt and the founder of the Twenty-second Dynasty. Of ancient Libyan (Meshwesh-Berber) ancestry, Shoshenq I was the son of Nimlot A, Great Chief of the Ma, and his wife Tentshepeh A, a daughter of a Great Chief of the Ma herself. He is presumed to be the Shishaq mentioned in the Hebrew Bible, and his exploits are carved on the Bubastite Portal at Karnak.
TEXT.French: Hedjkheperre Setepenre Shoshenq I (règne vers 943-922 av. J.-C.) fut un pharaon de l'ancienne Égypte et fondateur de la vingt-deuxième dynastie. D'ascendance libyenne ancienne (Meshwesh-Berbère), Shoshenq I était le fils de Nimlot A, grand chef des Ma, et de son épouse Tentshepeh A, elle-même fille d'un grand chef des Ma. Il est présumé être le Shishaq mentionné dans la Bible hébraïque, et ses exploits sont gravés sur le portail Bubastite à Karnak.

TEXT.English: Shuttarna II (or Suttarna) was a king of the Hurrian kingdom of Mitanni in the early 14th century BC. Shuttarna was a descendant and probably a son of the great Mitannian king Artatama I. He was an ally of the Egyptian Pharaoh Amenhotep III and the diplomatic dealings of the kings are briefly recorded in the Amarna letters. Shuttarna's daughter Kilu-Hepa (sometimes spelled Gilukhepa) was given to Amenhotep III in marriage to seal the alliance between the two royal houses in the Pharaoh's 10th regnal year, taking with her a great dowry.

War elephants were important, although not widespread, weapons in ancient military history. Their main use was in charges, to trample the enemy and/or break their ranks. War elephants were exclusively male animals, because they were faster, more aggressive, and the females had a tendency to run away from other females.[PARAGRAPH:1]Elephant taming began in the Indus valley around 4,000 years ago. Taming is not used here as a synonym of domestication. Domesticated animals, such as cows or dogs, are born in captivity and eventually subjected to selective breeding. Elephants, probably due to their bad temper, expensive feeding and slow growth rate (15 years to adulthood), were, with very few exceptions, always caught in the wild and subsequently tamed for several purposes. The first species to be tamed was thus the Asian elephant, for agricultural ends. The first military application of elephants dates from around 1100 BC and is mentioned in several Sanskrit hymns.
TEXT.Polish: S³oñ bojowy? s³oñ wykorzystywany w dzia³aniach wojennych, przede wszystkim w staro¿ytnoœci. G³ównym przeznaczeniem s³oni bojowych by³y szar¿e, maj¹ce na celu wzniecenie paniki w szeregach wroga lub przerwanie jego szyków. German.Text: Sibirischer Tiger:Sibirischen Tigers:Sibirischen Tiger:Sibirischen Tiger:Sibirische Tiger:Sibirischen Tiger:Sibirischen Tigern:Sibirischen Tiger

TEXT.English: The Siberian Tracker is a unique unit of the Siberian culture, equivalent to the Warden. It starts with the Arctic Combat promotions I, II and III, as well as the standard Warden's Hunting Sight I and II.
TEXT.French: Le pisteur sibérien est une unité unique de la culture sibérienne, équivalente au Gardien. Il commence avec les promotions Combat Arctique I, II et III, ainsi que la vision de chasse standard du Gardien I et II.
TEXT.Italian: Il cercatore di tracce siberiano è l'equivalente siberiano del guardiacaccia; come tale, ottiene le abilità del guardiacaccia e le promozioni per combattere nei terreni artici.

TEXT.English: The BAF-999 Prototype Siege Droid was a prototype battle droid produced by Balmorran Arms during the Cold War. BAF-999 Siege Droids among the forces used by the Earth Republic during their retreat from the Balmorran Arms Factory.
TEXT.French: Le droïde de siège prototype BAF-999 était un droïde de combat prototype produit par Balmorran Arms pendant la Guerre froide. Les droïdes de siège BAF-999 faisaient partie des forces utilisées par la République de la Terre lors de leur retraite de l'usine Balmorran Arms.
TEXT.Polish: Droid - to okreœlenie wiêkszoœci bardziej skomplikowanych robotów, w tym androidów - zazwyczaj wyposa¿onych w pewien poziom sztucznej inteligencji.
TEXT.Russian: Прототип осадного дроида BAF-999 происходил из линейки боевых дроидов, произведенных Balmorran Arms во время холодной войны. Осадные дроиды BAF-999 среди сил, используемых Земной Республикой при отступлении с Балморранского оружейного завода.

TEXT.English: With the advent of gunpowder warfare in the late 15th century, the balance of advantage for war elephants on the battlefield began to change. While muskets had limited impact on elephants, which could withstand numerous volleys, cannon fire was a different matter entirely-an animal could easily be knocked down by a single shot. With elephants still being used to carry commanders on the battlefield, they became even more tempting targets for enemy artillery.
TEXT.French: Avec l'avènement de la poudre à canon à la fin du XVe siècle, l'avantage des éléphants de guerre sur le champ de bataille commença à changer. Alors que les mousquets avaient un impact limité sur les éléphants, capables de résister à de nombreuses volées, le feu des canons était une toute autre affaire - un animal pouvait facilement être abattu par un seul coup. Les éléphants servant encore à transporter les commandants sur le champ de bataille devinrent des cibles encore plus tentantes pour l'artillerie ennemie.

TEXT.English: With the advent of more complex machinery, particularly in use as powerful wall-busting weapons of war, the need for intelligent, mathematically educated engineers on the battlefield to assist and repair these new gatecrashers became apparent. For its age, this would've been some of the grandest expressions of human technology and these were the folks who understood all which was not immediately obvious about these powerful forces.
TEXT.French: Avec l'arrivée de machines plus complexes, notamment comme armes puissantes de siège, le besoin d'ingénieurs intelligents et formés en mathématiques sur le champ de bataille pour assister et réparer ces nouveaux briseurs de murs devint évident. Pour leur époque, ces engins représentaient certaines des plus grandes expressions de la technologie humaine, et ces ingénieurs comprenaient tout ce qui n'était pas immédiatement apparent de ces puissantes forces.
TEXT.Polish: Narodziny sztuki oblê¿niczej wi¹¿¹ siê bezpoœrednio z powstaniem i stopniowym udoskonalaniem umiejêtnoœci wznoszenia sta³ych fortyfikacji, broni¹cych dostêpu do osad o charakterze miejskim, istniej¹cych ju¿ w póŸnym neolicie. Poniewa¿ sta³e umocnienia maj¹ce charakter szczelnego krêgu murów, skutecznie broni³y wydzielonego terytorium przed jakimkolwiek atakiem z zewn¹trz, napastnicy musieli postaraæ siê o to, aby znaleŸæ skuteczne sposoby na neutralizacjê ich wp³ywu na pole walki.

TEXT.English: The onager was a Roman siege engine that is a type of catapult that uses a torsional force, generally from twisted rope, to store energy for the shot. The onager consisted of a large frame placed on the ground to whose front end a vertical frame of solid timber was rigidly fixed. A vertical spoke that passed through a rope bundle fastened to the frame had a sling attached which contained a projectile. To fire it, the spoke or arm was forced down, against the tension of twisted ropes or other springs, by a windlass, and then suddenly released. As the sling swung outwards, one end would release, as with a staff-sling, and the projectile would be hurled forward. The arm would then be caught by a padded beam or bed, when it could be winched back again.

A Siege ram is a siege engine originating in ancient times to break open fortification walls or doors. In its simplest form, a battering ram is just a large, heavy log carried by several people and propelled with force against an obstacle; the ram would be sufficient to damage the target if the log were massive enough and/or it were moved quickly enough, and if it had enough momentum. In a more sophisticated design, a battering ram was slung from a wheeled support frame by ropes or chains so that it could be much more massive and also more easily swung against its target. Sometimes the ram's attacking point would be reinforced with a metal head and vulnerable parts of the ram might be bound with metal bands. Many battering rams had protective roofs and side-screens covered in materials, usually fresh wet hides, presumably from the animals eaten by the besiegers, to prevent the ram being set on fire, as well as to protect the operators of the ram from enemies firing arrows down on them by allowing them to seek shelter within the battering ram structure. The image of the Assyrian battering ram shows how sophisticated attacks and defences had become by the 9th century BC. The defenders are trying to set the ram alight with torches and have also put a chain under the ram. The attackers are trying to pull on the chain to free the ram, while the aforementioned wet hides would protect against the fire. The first confirmed use in the Occident was when the Spartans attacked Platea. The first use in the Mediterranean Sea with siege towers was in the 409 BC with the Selinus siege.

TEXT.English: Siege Tower is a specialized siege engine, constructed to protect assailants and ladders while approaching the defensive walls of a fortification. The tower was often rectangular with four wheels with its height roughly equal to that of the wall or sometimes higher to allow archers to stand on top of the tower and shoot into the fortification. Because the towers were wooden and thus flammable, they had to have some non-flammable covering of iron or fresh animal skins. The siege tower was mainly made from wood but sometimes had metal parts.

TEXT.English: The Siege Wagon is essentially an armored chariot with a heavily armored roof to protect against arrows and a ram.
TEXT.French: Le chariot de siège est essentiellement un chariot blindé avec un toit fortement blindé pour se protéger des flèches, et il est équipé d'un bélier.
TEXT.Italian: Il vagone da assedio è un carro corazzato con un tetto pesantemente corazzato, per difendersi dalle frecce, e un ariete.
TEXT.Spanish: El Vagón de guerra es, básicamente, un carruaje acorazado con un techo fuertemente blindado, para proteger de las flechas y los arietes.

TEXT.English: Fighting arts in the Malay Archipelago and Indonesian arose out of hunting methods and military training by the region's native inhabitants. The descendents of former headhunters still perform ancient wardances which are considered the precursor of the freestyle form in silat. While these aborigines retained their tribal way of life, the Indo-Malay diaspora instead based their culture on India and China. By adopting the Indian faiths of Hinduism and Buddhism, their social structure became more organised. Evidence shows that silat was influenced by both Indian and Chinese martial arts. Many of the region's medicinal practices and weapons originated in either India or China, and silat's thigh-slapping actions are reminiscent of Hindu wrestling. The martial arts practiced by the Chinese community of Southeast Asia are referred to as kuntao.
TEXT.Polish: Pencak silat - zbiorcze okreœlenie na wszystkie tradycyjne sztuki walki, wywodz¹ce siê z obszaru dzisiejszej Indonezji. Termin ten obejmuje wiele regionalnych stylów. Obecnie, dziêki emigrantom z Indonezji, tradycje te ciesz¹ siê popularnoœci¹ równie¿ na Zachodzie, zw³aszcza w Holandii.

TEXT.English: Simeon I ruled over Bulgaria from 893 to 927, during the First Bulgarian Empire. Simeon's successful campaigns against the Byzantines, Magyars and Serbs led Bulgaria to its greatest territorial expansion ever,making it the most powerful state in contemporary Eastern Europe. His reign was also a period of unmatched cultural prosperity and enlightenment later deemed the Golden Age of Bulgarian culture.
TEXT.French: Siméon I régna sur la Bulgarie de 893 à 927, pendant le Premier Empire bulgare. Les campagnes victorieuses de Siméon contre les Byzantins, les Magyars et les Serbes conduisirent à la plus grande expansion territoriale de la Bulgarie, en en faisant l'État le plus puissant de l'Europe de l'Est contemporaine. Son règne fut aussi une période de prospérité culturelle et d'illumination sans précédent, plus tard appelée l'Âge d'or de la culture bulgare.
TEXT.Polish: W³adca Bu³garii w latach 893-927, car bu³garski od 913, trzeci z synów Borysa I Micha³a i jego ¿ony Marii. Najwybitniejszy przedstawiciel dynastii Kruma. Podczas swego panowania Symeon odniós³ szereg zwyciêstw nad Bizantyñczykami, Madziarami i Serbami, co pozwoli³o mu znacznie poszerzyæ terytorium bu³garskie czyni¹c z Bu³garii najpotê¿niejsze pañstwo we wschodniej Europie. TEXT.English: Sinbad the Sailor is a hero of The Thousand and One Nights who recounts his adventures on seven voyages. He is not to be confused with Sindbad the Wise, hero of the frame story of the Seven Wise Masters. Sinbad, the hero of the stories, is a sailor from Basrah, living during the Abbasid Caliphate. The stories themselves are based partly on real experiences of sailors around the Indian Ocean, partly on ancient poetry (including Homer's Odyssey and Vishnu Sarma's Panchatantra), and partly upon Arab, Indian and Persian collections of tales. They recount the fantastic adventures of Sinbad during his voyages throughout the seas east of Africa and south of Asia.
TEXT.Polish: Sindbad ¯eglarz? bohater cyklu historii pochodzenia perskiego o ¿eglarzu z Bagdadu i jego pe³nych przygód podró¿ach po morzach wschodniego wybrze¿a Afryki i po³udniu Azji.
