TEXT.English: The earliest fully developed spoke-wheeled horse chariots are from the chariot burials of the Andronovo (Timber-Grave) sites of the Sintashta-Petrovka Proto-Indo-Iranian culture in modern Russia and Kazakhstan from around 2000 BC. This culture is at least partially derived from the earlier Yamna culture. It built heavily fortified settlements, engaged in bronze metallurgy on an industrial scale and practiced complex burial rituals reminiscent of Hindu rituals known from the Rigveda and the Avesta.

Sipahi were two types of Ottoman cavalry corps, including the fief-holding provincial timarli sipahi, which constituted most of the army, and the regular kapikulu sipahi, palace troops. Other types of cavalry which were not regarded sipahi were the irregular akinci ("raiders"). The sipahi formed their own distinctive social classes, and were notably in rivalry with the Janissaries, the elite corps of the Sultan.
TEXT.French: Les Sipahi étaient deux types de corps de cavalerie ottomane, comprenant le sipahi provincial fief-holdant (timarli), qui constituait la majorité de l'armée, et le sipahi régulier kapikulu, troupe du palais. D'autres types de cavalerie, non considérés comme sipahi, incluaient les akinci irréguliers ("rapaces"). Les sipahi formaient leurs propres classes sociales distinctes et étaient en rivalité notable avec les Janissaires, corps d'élite du Sultan.

TEXT.English: Swahili culture is the culture of the Swahili people inhabiting the Swahili Coast. This littoral area encompasses Tanzania, Kenya, Uganda and Mozambique, as well as the adjacent islands of Zanzibar and Comoros and some parts of the Democratic Republic of Congo and Malawi. They speak Swahili as their native language, which belongs to the Niger-Congo family. Swahili culture is the product of the history of the coastal part of the African Great Lakes region, an area that has been influenced by Middle Eastern, Indian, Persian and Portuguese cultures. As with the Swahili language, Swahili culture has a Bantu core that has been modified by those foreign influences.
The Si Warrior is a unique unit of the Moche culture, equivalent to the Maceman. It starts with the promotions Shock I and II, and additional bonuses in city attack and against melee.
TEXT.French: Le guerrier Si est une unité unique de la culture Moche, équivalente au massier. Il commence avec les promotions Choc I et II, et des bonus supplémentaires en attaque de ville et au combat rapproché.
TEXT.Italian: Il guerriero Si è l'equivalente Moche del guerriero con mazza. Inizia con le promozioni Shock I e Shock II, oltre ai bonus all'attacco contro le città e contro le unità da combattimento ravvicinato.

TEXT.English: George Castriot, commonly known as Skanderbeg (from Turkish: Iskender Bey; Albanian: Skënderbej or Gjergj Kastrioti Skënderbeu; 1405 - 17 January 1468), was a 15th-century Albanian warrior and nobleman. Skanderbeg was born in 1405 to the noble Kastrioti (or Castriota) family. Sultan Murad II took him hostage at a young age and he served the Ottoman Empire during the next twenty years. He was appointed as sanjakbey of the Sanjak of Dibra by the Ottomans in 1440. In 1443, he deserted the Ottomans during the Battle of Nis and became the ruler of Kruj? Svetigrad, and Modric. In 1444, he was appointed as a commander of the short-lived League of Lezh? which proclaimed him "Chief of the League of the Albanian people". He was admired for defending the region of Albania against the Ottoman Empire for 25 years. Despite his military valor he was not able to do more than to hold his own possessions within the very small area in northern Albania where almost all of his victories against the Ottomans took place. Skanderbeg's rebellion was not a general uprising of Albanians, due to the fact that he did not gain support in the Ottoman-controlled south of Albania or Venetian-controlled north of Albania. His followers, along with Albanians, included Slavs, Vlachs, and Greeks. For 25 years, from 1443 to 1468, Skanderbeg's 10,000 man army marched through Ottoman territory winning against consistently larger and better supplied Ottoman forces.

Many armies of the Middle Ages used lightly armored skirmishers in support of the main fighting force of armored fighting men. They could be difficult to control and of little value on the battlefield, but some armies used them effectively. Skirmishers were deployed in front of the main battle line and engaged the enemy with bows, slings, and javelins. The intent was to disrupt the enemy force and cause casualties before the main battle lines clashed. The skirmishers would retire to the side of the main battle and harass the enemy as practical. They could also be useful in pursuit of a beaten enemy because they could move more quickly than men wearing armor. If caught in battle against men-at-arms, however, they could not stand and routed quickly
TEXT.Spanish: Los hostigadores tiran lanzas a sus enemigos.
TEXT.Polish: Harcownik miota w³óczniami w swoich wrogów.

TEXT.English: Ski warfare, the use of ski-equipped troops in war.
TEXT.French: La guerre à ski, l'utilisation de troupes équipées de skis au combat.
TEXT.Polish: Oddzia³ wojskowy wykorzystuj¹cy narty do poruszania siê.

TEXT.English: Skunks (in the United States, occasionally called polecats) are mammals best known for their ability to secrete a liquid with a strong, foul odor. General appearance varies from species to species, from black-and-white to brown or cream colored. Skunks, together with their closest living relatives, the stink badgers, belong to the "skunk family", the "Mephitidae" and to the order Carnivora. There are twelve species of Mephistids, which are divided into four genera: Mephitis, the (hooded and striped skunks, two species), Spilogale the (spotted skunks, four species), the Mydaus or stink badgers, two species), and Conepatus, the (hog-nosed skunks, four species). The two stink badgers in the Mydaus genus inhabit Indonesia and the Philippines; while all skunks inhabit the Americas from Canada to central South America. All other known Mephistids are extinct and known only through fossils, many in Eurasia.[PARAGRAPH:2]Skunks had been classified as a subfamily within the Mustelidae, or "weasel family", which includes ferrets, weasels, otters and badgers. However, recent genetic evidence suggests that skunks are not as closely related to the mustelids as previously thought; they are now classified in their own family. The stink badgers had until recently been classified on the basis of physical examination been placed with the other badgers, but genetic testing has proven correct those who believed stink badgers to share a more recent common ancestor with skunks than they do with the weasel family, and so the stink badgers have been transferred from the badger family to the skunk family.
TEXT.German: Das Stinktier (der fachsprachliche Terminus ist Skunk) ist ein Raubtier aus der Überfamilie der Hundeartigen, das vorrangig auf dem amerikanischen Kontinent heimisch ist. Die einzelnen Arten variieren stark in der Größe: während die kleineren gerade einmal so groß wie Eichhörnchen sind, erreichen die größeren Körperlängen wie eine kleine Hauskatze. Alle Skunks haben ein markantes schwarzes oder dunkelbraunes Fell mit weißen Streifen oder Flecken. Sie verfügen über ausgeprägte, paarige Analdrüsen, mit denen sie ein streng riechendes Sekret versprühen können, dass potenzielle Angreifer durch starke Tränenproduktion blendet.[PARAGRAPH:2]Bei Stinktieren handelt es sich um größtenteils dämmerungs- und nachtaktive Tiere, die sich tagsüber in die unterschiedlichsten Verstecke zurück (selbstgegrabene oder übernommene Baue anderer Tiere, Felsspalten, hohle Baumstümpfe oder sogar Gebäude). Manche Skunks halten dort sogar eine mehrwöchige Winterruhe.[PARAGRAPH:2]Stinktiere werden aus den verschiedensten Gründen verfolgt. Zum einen war ihr Fell lange Zeit in Mode, so dass sie zeitweilig sogar in Pelztierfarmen gehalten wurden, zum anderen sind sie aber als Überträger der Tollwut gefürchtet. Sie sind dennoch weit verbreitet und gehören nicht zu den gefährdeten Tierarten.

Dieta jest te¿ uzupe³niana pokarmem roœlinnym. Prowadz¹ nocny tryb ¿ycia, dzieñ spêdzaj¹ w norach lub kryjówkach skalnych. Niektóre potrafi¹ wspinaæ siê na drzewa. TEXT.English: This is a unit that acts like a spy. The sleeper cell can move invisibily through enemy territory and explore. If it settles in a city, it can monitor production and attempt to sabotage it for a cost.
TEXT.French: Cette unité se comporte comme un espion. La cellule dormante peut se déplacer à travers le territoire ennemi de manière furtive. Une fois installé dans une ville, elle peut surveiller la production, et essayer de la saboter contre un peu d'or.
TEXT.Polish: To jest jednostka, która zachowuje si podobnie do szpiegów. Mo¿e poruszaæ si po terenie wroga niezauwa¿ona. Kiedy osi¹dzie w mieœcie ma mo¿liwoœæ sabotowania jego produkcji.

TEXT.English: A sling is a projectile weapon typically used to throw a blunt projectile such as a stone. It is also known as the shepherd's sling. The sling is an ancient weapon. It is certain that slings were known to Neolithic peoples around the Mediterranean, but it seems likely that the sling is much older. It is quite possible that the sling was invented during the Upper Paleolithic at a time when new technologies, such as the atlatl and the bow and arrow, were emerging. With the exception of Australia, where spear throwing technology such as the woomera predominated, the sling became common all over the world, although it is not clear whether this occurred because of cultural diffusion or independent invention.

In the 18th and the earlier part of the 19th centuries, a sloop-of-war was a small sailing warship with a single gun deck that carried up to eighteen guns. In the first half of the 18th century, most naval sloops were two-masted vessels. The first three-masted sloops appeared during the 1740s, and from the mid-1750s most new sloops were built with a three-masted (ship) rig. A sloop-of-war was smaller than a sailing frigate and was (by virtue of having too few guns) outside the rating system. In general, a sloop-of-war would be under the command of a master and commander rather than a post captain, although in day-to-day use at sea the commanding officer of any naval vessels would be addressed as "Captain". Sloops were small warships intended for colonial "gunboat diplomacy" deployments, surveying duties, and to act during wartime as convoy escorts. USS Constellation, constructed in 1854 (the last sail-only warships designed and built by the US Navy), is a sloop-of-war and the second United States Navy ship to carry this famous name. She spent much of the US Civil War as a deterrent to Confederate cruisers and commerce raiders in the Mediterranean Sea.
TEXT.Polish: Klasa niewielkich okrêtów, pocz¹tkowo ¿aglowych, póŸniej o napêdzie œrubowym, obecnie nieistniej¹ca. W okresie obu wojen œwiatowych slupy stanowi³y klasê okrêtów eskortowych œredniej wielkoœci. Nazwa tej klasy funkcjonowa³a g³ównie w krajach anglosaskich.

TEXT.English: The sloth bear (Ursus ursinus =Melursus ursinus), also known as the labiated bear, is a nocturnal insectivorous species of bear found wild within the Indian subcontinent. The sloth bear evolved from ancestral brown bears during the Pleistocene and shares features found in insect-eating mammals through convergent evolution. The population isolated in Sri Lanka is considered as a subspecies. Unlike brown and black bears, sloth bears have lankier builds, long shaggy coats that form a mane around the face, long sickle shaped claws, and a specially adapted lower lip and palate used for sucking insects. Sloth bears breed during spring and early summer and give birth near the beginning of winter. They feed on termites, honeybee colonies and fruits. Sloth bears sometimes attack humans that encroach on their territory. Historically, humans have drastically reduced their habitat and diminished their population by hunting them for food and products such as their baculum and claws. These bears have been used as performing pets due to their tameable nature.
Snipers and their modern and high tech equivalents, are elite shooters choosen from soldiers for their skill to shoot difficult and far away targets.
TEXT.French: Les snipers et leurs équivalents modernes et high-tech sont des tireurs d'élite choisis parmi les soldats pour leur aptitude à toucher des cibles difficiles et lointaines.
TEXT.Polish: Snajperzy i ich nowoczeœni odpowiednicy, s¹ elitarnymi strzelcami, wybranymi spoœród ¿o³nierzy ze wzglêdu na swoje umiejêtnoœci strzeleckie.

TEXT.English: The snow leopard (Panthera uncia or Uncia uncia) is a moderately large cat native to the mountain ranges of Central Asia. The classification of this species has been subject to change and is still classified as Uncia uncia by MSW3 as of 2000 and CITES Appendix I. However with more recent genetic studies, the snow leopard is now generally considered as Panthera uncia and classified as such by IUCN. Classically, two subspecies have been attributed but genetic differences between the two have not been settled. The snow leopard remains on the endangered species list classified as C1.[PARAGRAPH:2]Snow leopards occupy alpine and subalpine areas generally 3,350 and 6,700 metres (10,990 and 22,000 ft) above sea level in Central Asia. The Snow Leopard Survival Strategy (McCarthy et al. 2003, Table II) compiled national snow leopard population estimates, updating the work of Fox (1994). Many of the estimates are acknowledged to be rough and out of date, but the total estimated population is 4,080 - 6,590. However, the global snow leopard effective population size (those likely to reproduce) is suspected to be fewer than 2,500 (50% of the total population, or 2,040 - 3,295).[PARAGRAPH:2]Snow leopards are slightly smaller than the other big cats but, like them, exhibit a range of sizes, generally weighing between 27 and 55 kg (60 and 120 lb), with an occasional large male reaching 75 kg (170 lb) and small female of under 25 kg (55 lb). They have a relatively short body, measuring in length from the head to the base of the tail 75 to 130 centimetres (30 to 50 in). However, the tail is quite long, at 80 to 100 cm (31 to 39 in), with only the house cat-sized Marbled Cat being relatively longer tailed. They are stocky and short-legged big cats, standing about 60 cm (24 in) at the shoulder.[PARAGRAPH:2]Snow leopards have long thick fur, and their base colour varies from smoky gray to yellowish tan, with whitish underparts. They have dark grey to black open rosettes on their body with small spots of the same color on their heads and larger spots on their legs and tail. Unusually among cats, their eyes are pale green or grey in colour.[PARAGRAPH:2]Snow leopards show several adaptations for living in a cold mountainous environment. Their bodies are stocky, their fur is thick, and their ears are small and rounded, all of which help to minimize heat loss. Their paws are wide, which distributes their weight better for walking on snow, and have fur on their undersides to increase their grip on steep and unstable surfaces; it also helps to minimize heat loss. Snow leopards' tails are long and flexible, helping them to maintain their balance, which is very important in the rocky terrain they inhabit. Their tails are also very thick due to storage of fats and are very thickly covered with fur which allows them to be used like a blanket to protect their faces when asleep.[PARAGRAPH:2]The snow leopard has a short muzzle and domed forehead, containing unusually large nasal cavities that help the animal breathe the thin, cold air of their mountainous environment.[PARAGRAPH:2]The snow leopard cannot roar, despite possessing partial ossification of the hyoid bone. This partial ossification was previously thought to be essential for allowing the big cats to roar, but new studies show that the ability to roar is due to other morphological features, especially of the larynx, which are absent in the snow leopard. Snow leopard vocalizations include hisses, chuffing, mews, growls, and wailing.

Once data storage and microprocessors have achieved significant enhancements, Software Devopers ermerge to replace the Programmers whom have defined the core of computer science. They bring with them advancements in programming technology, new and improved computer languages that convert more easily written code into base processing language. Practices become established for this coding so that one developer can more easily read and interpret the works of another and even quickly edit or resolve issues. These skillsets, along with new plug and play hardware methods represent a highly enhanced mechanism by which technologies may be recovered and repaired.

TEXT.English: King Solomon (flourished 10th century BC) was the son and successor of David. Nearly all that is known about him comes from the Bible (1 Kings 1 11 and 2 Chronicles 1 9). Through the efforts of his mother, Bathsheba, and the prophet Nathan, Solomon was anointed king while David was still alive. On accession to the throne, he liquidated his opponents ruthlessly and installed friends in key posts. He established Israelite colonies outside his kingdom's borders, cooperating with such friendly rulers as the Queen of Sheba to increase commerce. Fortification of his far-flung empire necessitated a vast building program, the crowning achievement of which was the Temple of Jerusalem. He reorganized the nation into 12 tribes with 12 administrative districts. He is said to have had a harem of 700 wives and 300 concubines. After the ascension to the throne of his son Rehoboam, the northern tribes seceded and formed their own kingdom of Israel, bringing an end to Solomon's empire. His legendary wisdom is recorded in the Book of Proverbs, and he is traditionally named as the author of the biblical Song of Solomon. He was regarded as the greatest king of Israel.
TEXT.Polish: Salomon (? - ok. 930 p.n.e.), król ¿ydowski panuj¹cy od ok. 970 p.n.e. M³odszy syn Dawida. Uzyska³ tron przed starszym bratem Adoniaszem dziêki wp³ywowi swej matki Betszeby. Popierany przez proroka Natana i kap³ana Sadoka zwyciê¿y³ koalicjê próbuj¹c¹ osadziæ na tronie Adoniasza. Pañstwo za panowania Salomona wzrasta³o w si³ê dziêki przyjaznym stosunkom z oœciennymi krajami. Salomon przeprowadzi³ podzia³ kraju na prowincje, zreorganizowa³ armiê na wzór egipski. Zas³yn¹³ jako wielki budowniczy (œwi¹tynia w Jerozolimie, wznoszona przy pomocy rzemieœlników z Fenicji i Egiptu, pa³ac królewski w Jerozolimie, wielkie stajnie w Megiddo). Podda³ kontroli szlaki karawanowe (port Esjon-Geber nad Morzem Czerwonym, wyprawy do Ofiru). Salomon zyska³ opiniê wyj¹tkowo m¹drego w³adcy. Jego dwór by³ oœrodkiem sztuki i przede wszystkim literatury. Przypisuje siê Salomonowi autorstwo wielu powiedzeñ, niektórych pieœni i ksi¹g biblijnych: Pieœni nad Pieœniami, Ksiêgi M¹droœci, Ksiêgi Przys³ów, czêœci psalmów i inne. W Starym Testamencie panowanie Salomona przedstawia siê jako z³oty wiek historii Izraela - wywodzi siê z niego bogata ¿ydowska i europejska tradycja literacka rozwijaj¹ca siê a¿ do czasów wczesnego renesansu. W tradycji arabskiej Salomon, wystêpuj¹cy pod imieniem Sulejman ibn Daud, to jeden z proroków, wielki znawca kobiet, czarodziej i w³adca demonów.

TEXT.English: Piracy in Somalia has been a threat to international shipping since the second phase of the Somali Civil War in the early 21st century. Since 2005, many international organizations have expressed concern over the rise in acts of piracy. Piracy impeded the delivery of shipments and increased shipping expenses, costing an estimated $6.6 to $6.9 billion a year in global trade in 2011 according to Oceans Beyond Piracy (OBP). According to the German Institute for Economic Research (DIW), a veritable industry of profiteers also arose around the piracy. Insurance companies significantly increased their profits from the pirate attacks, as the firms hiked rate premiums in response.

The Soninke (also called Sarakole, Seraculeh, or Serahuli) are a Mand people who descend from the Bafour and are closely related to the Imraguen of Mauritania. They speak the Soninke language, a Mande language. They were the founders of the ancient empire of Ghana c. 750-1240 CE. Subgroups of Soninke include the Maraka and Wangara.
TEXT.French: Les Soninké (aussi appelés Sarakole, Seraculeh ou Serahuli) sont un peuple Mand descendant des Bafour et étroitement liés aux Imraguen de Mauritanie. Ils parlent la langue soninké, une langue mandée. Ils furent les fondateurs de l'ancien empire du Ghana vers 750-1240 ap. J.-C. Les sous-groupes des Soninké incluent les Maraka et les Wangara.

TEXT.English: Celtic archers, Sotaroas (Sow-tah-rows, "Bow Soldiers"), while not great or exceptional, are good. They are well trained, disciplined, and can put a fair deal of range behind their attacks. While their arrows aren't too notable, their ability to swiftly pepper an enemy with arrows is always of use. They are not really meant to defeat an enemy force, or even truly damage one, so much as they are meant to irritate and draw attention away from a main force, so it can position itself for flanking. As such, they are good runners, who fire a few volleys as a distraction, and then withdraw to a safe position to hide. If caught in a melee, they would be slaughtered for sure.

TEXT.Italian: Fanteria con missili terra-aria a impulsi elettromagnetici

TEXT.English: SAM infantry, that uses EMP as weapon
TEXT.French: Infanterie SAM utilisant des impulsions électromagnétiques comme arme.

TEXT.English: Following Columbus, a Spanish military group known as Los Conquistadores, 'The Conquerors', were directed by Hernan Cortes to the New World with the sole purpose of seeking out new frontiers and riches in the unknown. The Conquistadors undertook their expeditions in the vast landmasses of the Americas at their own expense, risking their lives without aid from the Spanish royalty. Horses adorned with many bells enabled the Conquistadors to launch successful offenses against the American Indian natives, who had never seen a horse before the arrival of the Conquistadors. Spanish-Conquistador conquests include campaigns in Mexico, Guatemala, Peru, Cuzco, Columbia, Chile, the Bay of Honduras, and the Pacific Coastal regions.
TEXT.French: Après la découverte du Nouveau Monde par Christophe Colomb, des corps expéditionnaires espagnols conduits par des hommes connus sous le nom de Conquistadores ("Conquérants"), entreprirent d'explorer les terres inconnues à la recherche de richesses. Les Conquistadors, dont le célèbre Hernán Cortés, finançaient eux-mêmes leurs expéditions, et risquaient leur vie sur les vastes territoires des Amériques sans aucun soutien de la couronne d'Espagne. Les chevaux, parés de nombreuses clochettes, permirent aux Conquistadors de vaincre les indiens autochtones, qui ne connaissaient pas ces animaux. Ils conquirent ainsi le Mexique, le Guatemala, le Pérou, la Colombie, le Chili, la baie du Honduras, et les régions des côtes du Pacifique.
TEXT.German: Nach der Entdeckung Amerikas landete der Spanier Hernan Cortez mit den so genannten "Konquistadores" (Eroberern) in der neuen Welt, um diese zu erforschen und zu plündern. Die Konquistadoren riskierten auf dem amerikanischen Kontinent ihr Leben für die spanische Krone, obwohl ihnen das spanische Königshaus jede Unterstützung verweigerte. Ihre mit Glocken geschmückten Pferde verhalfen ihnen zum Sieg über die amerikanischen Ureinwohner, die nie zuvor ein Pferd gesehen hatten. Im Laufe der Jahre plünderten die spanischen Konquistadoren Mexiko, Guatemala, Peru, Cuzco, Kolumbien, Chile, die Bucht von Honduras und Teile der Pazifikküste.
TEXT.Italian: Seguendo la rotta di Colombo, un gruppo di militari spagnoli comandati da Hernándo Cortés, noti come Los Conquistadores ("i conquistatori"), furono mandati nel Nuovo Mondo con l'unico intento di trovare nuove terre e ricchezze. I Conquistadores spinsero le loro spedizioni negli sconfinati territori delle Americhe a proprie spese, rischiando la vita e senza aiuto dalla monarchia spagnola. I loro cavalli, adornati di campanelli, fornirono ai Conquistadores una schiacciante superiorità negli assalti alle popolazioni native americane. Le loro conquiste inclusero i territori di Guatemala, Perù, Cusco, Colombia, Cile e Honduras, fino alle regioni costiere del Pacifico.
TEXT.Spanish: Siguiendo las huellas de Colón, Hernán Cortés condujo al Nuevo Mundo a un contingente militar conocido como "los conquistadores", con el único propósito de buscar nuevas fronteras y riquezas en lo desconocido. Los conquistadores se costeaban de su propio bolsillo las expediciones que los llevaron a las vastas extensiones de las Américas, y arriesgaron sus vidas sin la ayuda de la corona española. Sus caballos, engalanados con campanillas, permitieron a los conquistadores lanzar con éxito ofensivas contra los nativos, que nunca habían visto un caballo hasta la llegada de los españoles. Entre las tierras conquistadas por los españoles se encuentran México, Guatemala, Perú, Cuzco, Colombia, Chile, la bahía de Honduras y las regiones de la costa del Pacífico.

TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Spartacus recrute des Gladiaturs (25% des Chances) après une victoire

TEXT.English: Spartacus (c. 109 BC-71 BC), according to Roman historians, was a slave and gladiator who became the leader (or possibly one of several leaders) in the somewhat successful slave uprising against the Roman Republic known as the Third Servile War. Little is known about Spartacus beyond the events of the war, and surviving historical accounts are inaccurate and often contradictory.[NEWLINE]Spartacus's struggle, often seen as the fight of an oppressed people fighting for their freedom against a slave-owning aristocracy, has found new meaning for modern writers since the 19th century. The rebellion of Spartacus has proven inspirational to many modern literary and political writers, making Spartacus a folk hero among cultures both ancient and modern.
TEXT.Italian: Spartaco (109-71 a.C.) fu uno schiavo e gladiatore che diventò il leader (o uno di molti leader) nella rivolta degli schiavi contro la Repubblica Romana conosciuta come Terza guerra servile. Si sa poco di Spartaco al di fuori degli eventi della guerra dato che i resoconti storici sono inaccurati e spesso contraddittori.[NEWLINE]Lo scopo di Spartaco, spesso visto come la lotta di un popolo oppresso che combatte per la libertà contro un'aristocrazia basata sullo schiavismo, ha trovato nuovi significati per gli scrittori moderni sin dal 19° secolo. La ribellione di Spartaco è stata ispiratrice per molti scrittori moderni, rendendo Spartaco un eroe popolare anche per i popoli moderni.
TEXT.Polish: Spartakus (zm. 71 p.n.e.) - niewolnik, gladiator rzymski, z pochodzenia prawdopodobnie Trak. Przywódca najwiêkszego i najgroŸniejszego w historii Rzymu powstania niewolników.

TEXT.English: The Spartan army stood at the centre of the Spartan state, whose male and female citizen' were trained in the discipline and honor of the warrior society. Subject to military drill from early manhood, the Spartans were one of the most feared military forces in the Greek world. At the height of Sparta's power - between the 6th and 4th centuries BC - it was commonly accepted that, "one Spartan was worth several men of any other state." According to Thucydides, the famous moment of Spartan surrender at the island of Sphacteria off of Pylos was highly unexpected. He said that 'it was the common perception at the time that Spartans would never lay down their weapons for any reason, be it hunger, or danger.

Though early man probably employed spears of fire-hardened wood, spearheads of knapped stone were used long before the emergence of any distinction between hunting and military weapons. Bronze spearheads closely followed the development of alloys hard enough to keep a cutting edge and represented, with the war ax, the earliest significant military application of bronze. Spearheads were also among the earliest militarily significant applications of iron, no doubt because existing patterns could be directly extrapolated from bronze to iron. Though the hafting is quite different, bronze Sumerian spearheads of the 3rd millennium BC differ only marginally in shape from the leaf-shaped spearheads of classical Greece. The spears of antiquity were relatively short, commonly less than the height of the warrior, and typically were wielded with one hand. As defensive armor and other weapons of shock combat (notably the sword and mounted troops) improved, spear shafts were made longer and the use of spearmen became increasingly specialized. The Greek hoplite's spear was about nine feet long; the Macedonian sarissa was twice that length in the period of Alexander's conquests. The Middle Ages would see the evolution of the spear into the pike and halberd.
TEXT.French: Même si nos lointains ancêtres utilisaient vraisemblablement des lances en bois durcies à la flamme, les pointes de lance en pierre taillée furent utilisées bien avant qu'une distinction ne soit établie entre les armes de chasse et les armes de guerre. Les pointes de lance en bronze sont apparues peu de temps après la découverte d'alliages suffisamment durs pour qu'une lame reste durablement tranchante. Ces pointes, de même que les haches en bronze, furent l'une des premières applications militaires du bronze et, par la suite, du fer. La raison est probablement que les moules existants pour le bronze pouvaient facilement être utilisés pour le fer. Bien que possédant des manches différents, les lances sumériennes du 3e millénaire av. J.-C. étaient dotées de pointes en bronze fort semblables à celles en forme de feuille de la Grèce antique. Les lances de l'Antiquité étaient relativement courtes, généralement inférieures à la taille du guerrier, et se brandissaient le plus souvent d'une seule main. Les lances ont gagné en longueur au fur et à mesure que les armures et les armes de combat rapproché (notamment l'épée des cavaliers) étaient améliorées. Dans le même temps, l'utilisation de la lance se spécialisait. La lance de l'hoplite grec mesurait deux mètres de long. La sarisse macédonienne de l'époque d'Alexandre mesurait plus du double de cette longueur. Durant le Moyen Age, la lance évolua pour donner la pique et la hallebarde.
TEXT.German: Neben den Speeren der Frühzeit, die vermutlich aus feuergehärtetem Holz gefertigt waren, wurden bereits lange vor der Unterscheidung von Jagd- und militärischen Waffen auch Speerspitzen aus behauenem Stein benutzt. Mit dem Aufkommen von Legierungen, die hart genug waren, dass eine Schneidkante herausgearbeitet werden konnte, wurden als erste wichtige militärische Errungenschaften die bronzenen Speerspitzen und das Kriegsbeil entwickelt. Speerspitzen gehörten außerdem zu den ersten aus Eisen gefertigten militärischen Waffenbestandteilen - zweifellos weil die bronzenen Vorlagen problemlos in die Eisenfertigung übertragen werden konnten. Wenngleich sie einen deutlich anderen Griff besaßen, unterschieden sich die bronzenen Speerspitzen der Sumerer aus dem 3. Jahrtausend vor Christus in ihrer Form nur wenig von den klassischen griechischen blattförmigen Speerspitzen. Die Lanzen des Altertums waren relativ kurz - normalerweise kleiner als die Krieger, die sie trugen - und wurden einhändig geführt. Mit der Weiterentwicklung der im Stoßkampf eingesetzten Rüstungen und Waffen, (allen voran das Schwert und die Ausrüstung berittener Truppen), wurden die Schäfte der Lanzen länger und die Lanzenkämpfer spezialisierten sich zunehmend. Die Lanze der griechischen Hopliten war über zweieinhalb Meter lang, die makedonische Sarissa war in der Zeit der Eroberungsfeldzüge Alexanders des Großen sogar etwa doppelt so lang. Im Mittelalter wurde die Lanze zur Pike und zur Hellebarde weiterentwickelt.
TEXT.Italian: Malgrado nell'antichità gli uomini usassero probabilmente lance realizzate con del legno indurito dal fuoco, le punte di lancia in pietra furono utilizzate a lungo, prima della nascita della distinzione fra armi da caccia e armi per impiego militare. Le punte di bronzo seguirono rapidamente lo sviluppo di leghe sufficientemente dure per mantenere il taglio e rappresentarono, con l'ascia da guerra, la prima significativa applicazione militare del bronzo. Queste punte furono altresì fra le prime applicazioni significative in ambito militare del ferro, senza dubbio per la facilità dell'adattamento dei modelli di bronzo a quelli realizzati con questo metallo. Malgrado l'impugnatura fosse piuttosto differente, le punte di bronzo sumere del terzo millennio a. C. differivano solo leggermente nella forma da quelle sagomate a foglia della Grecia classica. Le lance dell'antichità erano relativamente corte, generalmente inferiori all'altezza di un guerriero e tipicamente venivano maneggiate con una sola mano. Quando le armature difensive e le altre armi da combattimento da urto (principalmente la spada e le truppe a cavallo) migliorarono, le aste delle lance divennero più lunghe e l'uso dei lancieri si specializzò sempre di più. La lancia dell'oplite Greco era lunga circa due metri e settanta centimetri, la sarissa Macedone era il doppio di quella lunghezza nel periodo delle conquiste di Alessandro. Il Medioevo vide la lancia evolversi in picca e alabarda.
TEXT.Spanish: Aunque el hombre primitivo usó probablemente lanzas de madera endurecida al fuego, las puntas de piedra tallada se empleaban mucho antes de que apareciese la distinción entre las armas de caza y de combate. Las puntas de lanza de bronce siguieron de cerca el desarrollo de aleaciones con la suficiente dureza para mantener un borde cortante, y representaron, junto con el hacha de guerra, la primera aplicación militar importante del bronce. Las puntas de lanza también fueron una de las primeras aplicaciones bélicas del hierro, sin duda porque los formatos existentes podían extrapolarse directamente del bronce a este metal. Aunque el mango es muy distinto, la forma de las puntas de lanza sumerias del año 3000 a. C. diferían mínimamente de las puntas con forma de hoja de la Grecia clásica. Las lanzas de la antigüedad eran relativamente cortas; por lo general medían menos que la estatura del guerrero, y se solían manejar con una mano. A medida que mejoraba la armadura defensiva y las armas de choque (especialmente la espada y las tropas a caballo), las astas de lanza aumentaron su tamaño y el uso de lanceros se especializó cada vez más. La lanza hoplita griega medía más de dos metros y medio de largo; la sarissa macedonia era el doble de larga en la época de las conquistas de Alejandro Magno. En la Edad Media la lanza evolucionó, dando paso a la pica y la alabarda.

TEXT.English: In most countries special forces (SF) is a generic term for highly-trained military units that conduct specialized operations such as reconnaissance, unconventional warfare, and counter-terrorism actions. Some special forces operations, such as counter-terrorism actions, may be carried out domestically under certain circumstances. Special forces units are typically composed of relatively small groups of highly-trained personnel equipped with specialist equipment and armament, operating under principles of self-sufficiency, stealth, speed, and close teamwork, often transported by helicopter, small boats or submarines, parachuting from aircraft, or stealthy infiltration by land. Special forces are sometimes considered a force multiplier, as when they train indigenous forces to fight guerrilla warfare. Special forces have played an important role throughout the history of warfare when the aim has been to achieve disruption by "hit and run" and sabotage, rather than more traditional face-to-face combat. Other significant roles lay in reconnaissance, providing essential intelligence from close to or among the enemy, and increasingly in combating terrorists, their infrastructure and activities.
TEXT.Polish: Si³y specjalne, jednostki specjalne, to elitarne formacje wojskowe lub policyjne. Takie jednostki wojskowe przystosowane, zadaniowane s¹ do wykonywania zadañ niekonwencjonalnych, nadzwyczaj trudnych, w czasie pokoju, kryzysu, wojny: kontrterrorystycznych, rozpoznawczych (g³ównie rozpoznanie g³êbokie, b¹dŸ rozpoznanie specjalne), akcja zbrojna specjalna itp. Zwykle sk³adaj¹ siê z ma³ych wyselekcjonowanych grup ¿o³nierzy. Wysoce specjalistycznie, œwietnie wyszkolonych i nadzwyczajnie wytrzyma³ych psycho-fizycznie. TEXT.English: Special Infantry are the elite special forces units of the future battlefield - still highly trained for specialised operations such as reconnaissance, unconventional warfare, and counter-terrorism, but now augmented with technological aids such as near-perfect night vision and killer drones.
TEXT.French: L'infanterie spéciale sont les unités d'élite des forces spéciales des champs de bataille futurs - toujours hautement entraînées pour des opérations spécialisées comme la reconnaissance, la guerre non conventionnelle et la lutte antiterroriste, mais désormais augmentées par des aides technologiques comme la vision nocturne quasi parfaite et les drones tueurs.
TEXT.Russian: Спецназ - это элитные подразделения спецназа будущего поля боя. С юности обученные искусству войны в Схола Прогениум, специальные пехотные солдаты, возможно, являются лучшими солдатами, когда-либо служившими в истории человечества. Вооруженные своими фирменными Hellguns и Hellpistols, эти солдаты вступают в бой в самое сердце врага с ослепляющей скоростью и смертельной точностью.

TEXT.English: The spectacled bear (Tremarctos ornatus), also known as the Andean bear and locally as ukuko, jukumari or ucumari, is the last remaining short-faced bear (subfamily Tremarctinae) and the closest living relative to the Florida spectacled bear and short-faced bears of the Middle Pleistocene to Late Pleistocene age.[PARAGRAPH:2]The spectacled bear is a mid-sized species of bear native to South America. It has black fur with a distinctive beige-coloured marking across its face and upper chest, though not all Andean bears have "spectacle" markings. Males are a third larger than females in dimensions and sometimes twice their weight. Males can weigh 100 - 200 kilograms (220 - 440 lb), and females 35-82 kilograms (77- 181 lb). Length can range from 120 to 200 cm (47-79 in) long and shoulder height from 60 to 90 cm (24-30 in).They are found in several areas of northern and western South America, including eastern Panama, western Venezuela, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, western Bolivia, and northwestern Argentina. Spectacled bears are the only surviving species of bear native to South America, and the only surviving member of the subfamily Tremarctinae. Their survival has depended mostly on their ability to climb even the tallest trees of the Andes.
The Spiked Clubman is superior to the Clubman for it's sharp stone spikes on the club.
TEXT.French: Le Guerrier avec gourdin à pointes est supérieur au Guerrier avec gourdin normal grâce à ses pointes en pierre acérées sur sa massue.
TEXT.Italian: Il guerriero con clava con spuntoni è superiore al normale guerriero con clava, principalmente per l'arma che usa.
TEXT.Spanish: El Guerrero con garrote apuntillado es superior al Guerrero con garrote normal, por los clavos puntiagudos de su garrote.
TEXT.Polish: W mitologii greckiej maczuga by³a atrybutem herosa Heraklesa. Plemiona Indian zamieszkuj¹cych do pocz¹tków XIX wieku lesiste obszary Ameryki Pó³nocnej u¿ywa³y maczug bojowych, które bia³ym przybyszom przypomina³y kszta³tem drewniane ³o¿a broni palnej, st¹d anglojêzyczna ich nazwa gunstock clubs.
TEXT.Russian: Âîèí, âîîðóæåííûé äóáèíêîé ñ øèïàìè, ÿâëÿåòñÿ áîëåå ïðîäâèíóòûì ïî ñðàâíåíèþ ñ Áóëàâîíîñöåì èç-çà îñòðûõ êàìåííûõ øèïîâ íà áóëàâå.

TEXT.English: Spirit Walkers were warriors imbued with native spirituality, and were feared and respected by the rival tribes in the region. All the Four Corners tribes greatly respected the Spirit Walkers as a threat, and even the Apache (famed desert warriors themselves) were careful not to underestimate them.
TEXT.French: Les Marcheurs de l'Esprit étaient des guerriers imprégnés de spiritualité indigène, craints et respectés par les tribus rivales de la région. Toutes les tribus des Quatre Coins respectaient grandement les Marcheurs de l'Esprit comme une menace, et même les Apaches (guerriers du désert réputés) faisaient attention à ne pas les sous-estimer.
TEXT.Italian: Gli spiriti camminatori erano guerrieri intrisi di spiritualità, che erano temuti e rispettati dalle tribù rivali nella regione. Tutte le tribù dei quattro angoli (un'area nel sudovest degli Stati Uniti, caratterizzata dal confine tra quattro diversi stati) rispettavano gli spiriti camminatori come una minaccia, e anche gli Apache (loro stessi guerrieri del deserto di fama) erano attenti a non sottovalutarli.

TEXT.English: The Lockheed SR-71 is an advanced, long-range, Mach 3 strategic reconnaissance aircraft developed from the Lockheed YF-12A and A-12 aircraft by the Lockheed Skunk Works. The SR-71 was unofficially named the Blackbird, and called the Habu by its crews. Clarence "Kelly" Johnson was responsible for many of the design's advanced concepts. A defensive feature of the aircraft was its high speed and operating altitude, whereby, if a surface-to-air missile launch were detected, standard evasive action was simply to accelerate. The SR-71 line was in service from 1964 to 1998, with 12 of the 32 aircraft being destroyed in accidents, though none were lost to enemy action.
TEXT.Polish: Lockheed SR-71 Blackbird? samolot dalekiego zwiadu strategicznego. Zaprojektowany na prze³omie lat 50. i 60. XX wieku na zamówienie CIA, eksploatowany przez CIA, NASA oraz USAF. Dwusilnikowy odrzutowy œredniop³at w uk³adzie delta, osi¹gaj¹cy prêdkoœæ Mach 3 oraz pu³ap 24-28 km, dziêki temu by³ nieosi¹galny dla ówczesnych systemów obronnych. SR-71 by³ samolotem nieuzbrojonym, dwumiejscowym, w drugiej kabinie za pilotem znajdowa³ siê operator RSO, czyli operator elektronicznej aparatury zwiadowczej. Jej zasiêg pozwala³ na g³êbok¹ penetracjê terenu przeciwnika bez koniecznoœci przekraczania granic i naruszania obszaru powietrznego wroga.

TEXT.English: The Special Services Group (SSG) is the main special operations force of the Pakistan Army. The SSG is a regiment sized group, and is headquartered at Tarbela. It is headed by a Major-General and divided into ten battalions. Each battalion consists of 700 men in four companies, with each company split into platoons and then into 10-man teams. Battalions are commanded by Lieutenant Colonels.
TEXT.French: Le Special Services Group (SSG) est la principale force des opérations spéciales de l'armée pakistanaise. Le SSG est un régiment basé à Tarbela, dirigé par un Major-Général et divisé en dix bataillons. Chaque bataillon compte 700 hommes répartis en quatre compagnies, elles-mêmes divisées en pelotons puis en équipes de dix hommes. Les bataillons sont commandés par des Lieutenant-Colonels.

TEXT.English: The tactics of ambushing have become a more refined and studied procedure at this stage. The cause for the Stalker's expanse in power and strength is enhanced weaponry and tactics developed by more civilized minds whom have taken time to study and apply more examples of tactics from previous military campaigns and observations of the natural world. It's no longer just enough to jump out of the bushes and attack... now we're setting traps and picking where to stage our attacks with great care. And using bows with poisoned arrows over blowguns does help as well.

The Batek do not consider this sharing of resources to be an act of kindness, they believe that all food items belong to the forest, so that the person who happens to be in possession of food has a moral obligation to share it. Since the dwellings are open, it is impossible to hoard food without others knowing about it, since selfishness is prohibited, it would not be considered stealing for another member of the camp to take food away from someone who was hoarding, if the taker was hungry.
TEXT.French: Les Batek ne considèrent pas ce partage des ressources comme un acte de bonté, ils croient que toute nourriture appartient à la forêt, donc la personne qui possède de la nourriture a l'obligation morale de la partager. Comme les habitations sont ouvertes, il est impossible d'amasser de la nourriture sans que les autres le sachent. L'égoïsme étant interdit, il ne serait pas considéré comme un vol si un autre membre du camp prend de la nourriture à quelqu'un qui amassait, s'il a faim.

TEXT.English: Ground vehicles using stealth technology have come to fruition at various times in history. The Challenger 2 features a redesigned hull and turret offering lower radar observability over its predecessor. More recently, the joint U.S./British Future Scout Cavalry System concept was experimented with and appeared in prototype form before being canceled. Other vehicles, particularly unmanned ground vehicles, may unintentionally have an undetectably low radar signature due to their small size. Various coatings and radar absorbing layers of material are available for combat vehicles.
TEXT.Polish: Stealth - techniki maj¹ce na celu zmniejszenie mo¿liwoœci wykrycia obiektu znanymi metodami obserwacji: pocz¹wszy od ludzkiego wzroku, na metodach stricte technicznych koñcz¹c. Obecnie dotyczy ona g³ównie samolotów, okrêtów oraz pojazdów l¹dowych. Jest wiele technik umo¿liwiaj¹cych stworzenie obiektu typu stealth, np.: wykorzystanie materia³ów poch³aniaj¹cych w czêœci promieniowanie radarowe, kamufla¿ obiektu, zmniejszenie œladu termicznego i turbulencji za obiektem (np. w lotnictwie), zmniejszenie ha³asu z napêdu obiektu (bardzo istotne w marynarce ze wzglêdu na mo¿liwoœæ wykrycia przez sonar) i wiele innych. Najwa¿niejsze jest jednak odbicie fal radarowych pod k¹tem innym ni¿ nadesz³y, st¹d w³aœnie p³askie i pochylone powierzchnie. Aparat matematyczny do analizy propagacji fal radarowych, odbijaj¹cych siê od samolotu, stworzy³ w 1962 radziecki fizyk i matematyk Piotr Ufimcew.
TEXT.Russian: Бронетехника, использующая технологию малозаметности, воплощалась в жизнь в разное время. Challenger 2 отличается измененной конструкцией корпуса и башни, что обеспечивает более низкую радиолокационную заметность по сравнению с его предшественником. Совсем недавно совместная концепция американской и британской мотопехоты будущего была опробована и появилась в виде прототипа, прежде чем была отменена. Другие транспортные средства, особенно беспилотные наземные транспортные средства, могут непреднамеренно иметь незаметно низкую радиолокационную заметность из-за своего небольшого размера. Для боевых машин доступны различные покрытия и радиопоглощающие слои материала.

TEXT.English: Concurrent with the development of a stealth fighter, aeronautical engineers began to apply stealth technology to a full-scale bomber. The B-1B bomber, which went into service in 1986 as a replacement for the B-52, incorporated some of these innovations. The radar signature of the B-1B was reduced to a mere one percent that of the B-52 due to its low cross-section and its minimal use of radar-reflective, hard-edged surfaces.[PARAGRAPH:2]Soon after the B-1B entered service, the U.S. Air Force commissioned Northrop to develop a true stealth bomber as an eventual replacement. First revealed to the public in 1988, the B-2 stealth bomber uses a flying wing design similar in shape to the F-117A stealth fighter. The flying wing design reduces the profile of the B-2 by incorporating its engines into the body of the plane. The engine exhausts and intakes are shielded to prevent infrared tracking. The B-2 also makes use of curved surfaces and radar-absorbing materials to enhance its "invisibility", and make it far less detectable than the B-1B. As of the late 1980s, it was announced that 132 B-2's would be constructed, and would enter service sometime in the 1990s.
TEXT.French: Parallèlement au développement d'un chasseur furtif, les ingénieurs aéronautiques commencèrent à appliquer les technologies furtives à un bombardier. Le B-1B, entré en service en 1986 en remplacement du B-52, contenait certaines de ces technologies. Grâce à sa coupe basse et à la réduction des surfaces réfléchissantes, la taille de la signature radar d'un B-1B était cent fois moindre que celle d'un B-52.[PARAGRAPH:2]Peu après la mise en service du B-1B, la U.S. Air Force chargea Northrop de la mise au point d'un véritable bombardier furtif. Dévoilé au public en 1988, le bombardier furtif B-2 est une aile volante, sur le modèle du chasseur furtif F-117A. Le concept d'aile volante permet de rendre plus compacte la silhouette de l'avion en incorporant les moteurs dans le corps de l'appareil. Les prises d'air et les échappements des moteurs sont profilés pour réduire la signature infrarouge. Le B-2 utilise aussi des surfaces incurvées et des matériaux ne réfléchissant pas les ondes radars, ce qui permet d'améliorer sa "furtivité" et de le rendre beaucoup plus difficile à détecter que le B-1B. A la fin des années 1980s, il a été annoncé que 132 B-2 serait construits et qu'ils entreraient en service dans les années 1990.
TEXT.German: Gleichzeitig mit der Entwicklung des Stealth-Jagdflugzeugs begannen Luftfahrtingenieure, die Stealth-Technologie auf einen herkömmlichen Bomber zu übertragen. Der B-1B-Bomber, der im Jahre 1986 an die Stelle des B-52 trat, nutzte bereits einige der daraus resultierenden Neuerungen. So konnte beispielsweise die Radarkennung des B-1B aufgrund seines geringen Querschnitts und der minimalen Verwendung radarreflektierender hartkantiger Oberflächen auf lediglich 1 Prozent des B-52 reduziert werden.[PARAGRAPH:2]Kurz nachdem der B-1B-Bomber in Dienst gestellt wurde, beauftragte die amerikanische Luftwaffe die Firma Northrop mit der Entwicklung eines echten Stealth-Bombers, der den B-1B ablösen sollte. Das Flügeldesign des B-2-Stealth-Bombers, der im Jahre 1988 erstmals der Öffentlichkeit präsentiert wurde, ähnelt der Flügelgestaltung des F-117A-Stealth-Kampfflugzeugs, wobei das Profil des B-2 durch die Unterbringung der Motoren im Flugkörper reduziert wird. Die Ansaugturbinen und die Abgasanlage des Motors sind abgeschirmt, um Ortung durch Infrarottechnologie zu verhindern. Darüber hinaus kommen beim B-2 auch gekrümmte Oberflächen und radarabsorbierende Materialien zum Einsatz, wodurch sich seine "Unsichtbarkeit" im Vergleich zum B-1B deutlich erhöht. Ende der 80er Jahre wurde bekannt gegeben, dass insgesamt 132 Exemplare des B-2-Stealth-Bombers gebaut und im Laufe der 90er Jahre in Betrieb genommen werden sollten.
TEXT.Italian: Gli ingegneri aeronautici hanno sviluppato contemporaneamente le applicazioni della tecnologia stealth destinate a caccia e bombardieri. Il B-1B, entrato in servizio nel 1986 in sostituzione del B-52, incorpora alcune di queste innovazioni. La rilevabilità radar del B-1B è ridotta all'1%% rispetto a quella dei normali aerei, grazie al design particolare e all'utilizzo di superfici non radar-riflettenti.[PARAGRAPH:2]Dopo l'entrata in servizio di questo aereo, l'aeronautica degli Stati Uniti d'America ha ordinato alla Northrop lo sviluppo di un bombardiere completamente invisibile. Venne così costruito il B-2, presentato ufficialmente nel 1988, che ricorda nella forma il caccia F-117A Stealth. I motori dell'aereo sono incorporati nella fusoliera e gli scarichi sono schermati per evitare le emissioni infrarosse. Anche il B-2 impiega superfici curve e materiali non radar-riflettenti, che contribuiscono a rendere l'aereo invisibile, rendendolo meno rivelabile del B1-B. Verso la fine degli anni '80, venne annunciata la costruzione di 132 B-2, che sarebbero dovuti entrare in uso negli anni '90.
TEXT.Spanish: Paralelamente al desarrollo del caza invisible, los ingenieros aeronáuticos comenzaron a aplicar la tecnología de invisibilidad a un bombardero. El bombardero B-1B, que entró en servicio en 1986 en sustitución de los B-52, incorporaba algunos de estos avances. Gracias a su esbeltez y su perfil suavizado, que minimiza la reflexión de las señales de radar, la señal de radar del B-1B era cien veces inferior a la del B-52.[PARAGRAPH:2]Poco después de que el B-1B entrara en servicio, las fuerzas aéreas estadounidenses encargaron a Northrop el desarrollo de un auténtico bombardero invisible como reemplazo futuro. Hecho público en 1988, el bombardero invisible B-2 utiliza un diseño de ala voladora, similar al del caza invisible F-117. El diseño de las alas reduce el perfil del B-2 incorporando los motores a la estructura del avión. Las toberas de los motores y las entradas de aire están cubiertas, con el fin de confundir a las señales infrarrojas. El B-2 también utiliza superficies curvas y materiales que absorben las señales de los radares para aumentar su "invisibilidad", lo que lo hace incluso más difícil de detectar que el B-1B. A finales de la década de los 80, se anunció que se construirían 132 B-2, que serían incorporados al servicio a lo largo de la década siguiente.

TEXT.English: The elusive element of surprise has brought about deciding victories on land, at sea and in the air for centuries. But in the face of more precise forms of radar developed in the latter half of the twentieth century, new technology was needed to return the tactical advantage stealth once provided.[PARAGRAPH:1]Beginning in the 1980s, breakthroughs in naval stealth research, such as radar-silent construction materials and simplified superstructures, initiated the creation of the world's first stealth navies. Since that time, France, Sweden and the United States have all adopted their own stealth ships, capable of performing missions while remaining invisible to enemy radar.
TEXT.French: La surprise a toujours été un élément crucial pour s'assurer la victoire lors de conflits terrestres, navals et aériens. Mais face aux nouveaux radars développés dans la seconde moitié du vingtième siècle, de nouvelles technologies sont nécessaires pour reprendre l'avantage tactique conféré par la furtivité.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dans les années 1980, les avancées en matière de furtivité navale, comme les matériaux de construction indétectables par les radars et les superstructures simplifiées, permettent la création des premiers navires furtifs. Depuis cette époque, la France, la Suède et les Etats-Unis ont tous adopté leurs propres navires furtifs, capables d'exécuter des missions en restant invisibles aux radars ennemis.
TEXT.German: Mit dem naturgemäß kaum vorhersehbaren Überraschungsfaktor wurden auf Land, See und in der Luft bereits seit Jahrhunderten entscheidende Schlachten gewonnen. Jedoch angesichts der immer präziseren Radarsysteme in der zweiten Hälfte des 20. Jahrhunderts benötigte man neue Technologien, um die taktischen Vorteile, die einst die Tarnung bot, wiederzuerlangen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Anfang der 1980er Jahre leiteten Forschungsdurchbrüche im Bereich der Marinetarnung, wie etwa für das Radar nicht erkennbare Konstruktionsmaterialien und vereinfachte Aufbauten, die Produktion der ersten getarnten Kriegsflotten weltweit ein. Seither besitzen Frankreich, Schweden und die USA ihre eigenen Tarnschiffe, die beim Ausführen ihrer Missionen vom feindlichen Radar nicht erfasst werden können.
TEXT.Italian: L'elemento sorpresa ha deciso decine di scontri su terra, in cielo e in mare per molti secoli. Ma di fronte alle più precise forme di radar sviluppate nella seconda metà del ventesimo secolo era necessaria una nuova tecnologia per recuperare il vantaggio tattico assicurato in passato dalla clandestinità.[PARAGRAPH:1]Fin dagli anni '80 i risultati raggiunti nel campo della ricerca stealth navale, come materiali invisibili ai radar e sovrastrutture semplificate, hanno stimolato la costruzione delle prime flotte stealth. Da allora Francia, Svezia e Stati Uniti hanno adottato le proprie navi stealth, in grado di portare a termine le missioni rimanendo invisibili ai radar nemici.
TEXT.Spanish: Durante siglos, el elemento sorpresa ha permitido obtener grandes y decisivas victorias en tierra, mar y aire. Pero, ante los modelos más precisos de radar que han aparecido en la segunda mitad del siglo XX, se ha hecho necesario desarrollar nuevas tecnologías para recuperar la ventaja táctica que proporcionaba el sigilo.[PARAGRAPH:1]A partir de los años 80, ciertos avances en ese campo, como los materiales silenciosos al radar y las superestructuras simplificadas, permitieron la aparición de los primeros barcos invisibles. Desde entonces, las marinas de Francia, Suecia y los Estados Unidos se han equipado con barcos de este tipo, capaces de realizar sus misiones sin ser detectados por el radar.

TEXT.English: The F-117 Nighthawk is a stealth ground attack aircraft formerly operated by the United States Air Force. The F-117A's first flight was in 1981, and it achieved Initial Operational Capability status in October 1983. The F-117A came out of secrecy and was revealed to the world in November 1988. The F-117A is equipped with sophisticated navigation and attack systems integrated into a digital avionics suite. It carries no radar, which lowers emissions and cross-section. It navigates primarily by GPS and high-accuracy inertial navigation. Missions are coordinated by an automated planning system that can automatically perform all aspects of a strike mission, including weapons release. Targets are acquired by a thermal imaging infrared system, slaved to a laser that finds the range and designates targets for laser-guided bombs.
TEXT.Polish: F-117 Nighthawk amerykañski odrzutowy samolot bombowy wykonany w technologii stealth, produkowany przez firmê Lockheed. S³u¿y³ w United States Air Force od 1983 do 2008. Pomimo oznaczenia "F", stosowanego w lotnictwie USA do klasyfikacji myœliwców, F-117 by³ taktycznym bombowcem, przeznaczonym do wykonywania precyzyjnych ataków na cele naziemne.

TEXT.English: Stealth submarine features diesel propulsion and an additional air-independent propulsion (AIP) system using proton exchange membrane (PEM) hydrogen fuel cells. The submarine can operate at high speed on diesel power or switch to the AIP system for silent slow cruising, staying submerged for up to three weeks without surfacing and with no exhaust heat. The system is also said to be vibration-free, extremely quiet and virtually undetectable.
TEXT.French: Le sous-marin furtif est propulsé par un moteur diesel et un système de propulsion indépendant de l'air (AIP) utilisant des piles à combustible à membrane échangeuse de protons (PEM) fonctionnant à l'hydrogène. Il peut naviguer vite au diesel ou passer à l'AIP pour une navigation lente silencieuse, restant immergé jusqu'à trois semaines sans refaire surface et sans émettre de chaleur d'échappement. Le système est également réputé sans vibration, extrêmement silencieux et pratiquement indétectable.
TEXT.Polish: Zgodnie z zasad¹ nie mo¿esz trafiæ tego czego nie widzisz, ale to czego nie widzisz, mo¿e trafiæ Ciebie, podstaw¹ zwalczania okrêtów podwodnych od zarania dziejów tej klasy jednostek jest ich wykrywanie. Z tego wzglêdu, wszyscy konstruktorzy nowoczesnych okrêtów podwodnych k³ad¹ bardzo du¿y nacisk na zmniejszenie mo¿liwoœci ich wykrycia. W dotychczasowej praktyce wojny morskiej, najwiêksze znaczenie mia³o zmniejszanie mo¿liwoœci wykrycia optycznego i radarowego w erze okrêtów nawodnych z mo¿liwoœci¹ nurkowania, szybko jednak podstawowym aspektem stealth dla okrêtów podwodnych sta³a siê kwestia wyciszenia okrêtów celem zmniejszenia mo¿liwoœci wykrycia za pomoc¹ metod akustycznych. Marynarka wojenna Stanów Zjednoczonych dla przyk³adu, szybko utraci³a w trakcie zimnej wojny swoj¹ wynikaj¹c¹ z wprowadzenia napêdu nuklearnego i programu albacore przewagê w zakresie prêdkoœci oraz dopuszczalnej g³êbokoœci zanurzenia okrêtów podwodnych. Przez ca³y jednak czas priorytetem US Navy by³y jak najwy¿szy stopieñ wyciszenia jednostek, a prymatu w tej dziedzinie nigdy ostatecznie nie utraci³a. Dowództwo US Navy wychodzi³o z za³o¿enia, i¿ torpeda zawsze wyprzedzi okrêt podwodny, zawsze te¿ bêdzie w stanie zejœæ w ataku g³êbiej ni¿ jej cel. Nie bêdzie jednak w stanie zniszczyæ go, jeœli nie bêdzie w stanie go zlokalizowaæ. Wyciszenie daje okrêtowi podwodnemu podwójn¹ korzyœæ? jest trudniejszy do wykrycia, podczas gdy jego w³asne sensory akustyczne dzia³aj¹ lepiej przy redukcji ha³asów w³asnych okrêtu. Wyciszenie wspó³czesnych okrêtów podwodnych jest dziœ tak daleko posuniête, ze wed³ug admira³a Bruce'a DeMarsa, amerykañskie jednostki myœliwskie typu Seawolf przy prêdkoœci 20 wêz³ów s¹ cichsze ni¿ okrêty typu Los Angeles stoj¹ce przy nabrze¿u. Wed³ug stwierdzenia tego¿ admira³a, dyrektora amerykañskiego programu napêdu j¹drowego, Seawolf emituj¹ do otoczenia energiê akustyczn¹ mniejsz¹ ni¿ kilka wat energii niezbêdnej do zaœwiecenia ¿arówki. Nie mniejsz¹ rolê w redukcji mo¿liwoœci wykrycia okrêtu podwodnego pe³ni¹ równie¿ inne, nieakustyczne aspekty stealth.
TEXT.Russian: Стелс-субмарина оснащена дизельной силовой установкой и дополнительным воздухонезависимым двигателем (ВНЭУ), использующей водородные топливные элементы с протонообменной мембраной (ПОМ). Подводная лодка может работать на высокой скорости на дизельном топливе или переключаться на систему ВНЭУ для бесшумного медленного плавания, оставаясь под водой до трех недель без всплытия и без нагрева выхлопных газов. Система также считается безвибрационной, очень тихой и практически незаметной.

TEXT.French: Cuirassé à coque en fer avancé

TEXT.English: Stefan Razvan (died December 1595) was a Voivode (Prince) of Moldavia (between 24 April 1595 and August 1595) of Romani descent from the historical Romanian state of Wallachia. The father of Stefan Razvan was a Muslim Roma from the Ottoman Empire who emigrated north of Danube, in Wallachia, while his mother was a Romanian peasant from the new country of settlement. At that time, all the Romani people living in the Romanian states of Wallachia and Moldavia were slaves. The rule was applied also to any Romani immigrants, excepting the Ottoman citizens. Benefiting of this exception, the father and later the son could remain free and become an active part in the local society.

Stephen Fuller Austin (November 3, 1793 - December 27, 1836) was an American empresario born in Virginia and raised in southeastern Missouri. Known as the Father of Texas, he led the second, and ultimately successful, colonization of the region by bringing 300 families from the United States to the region in 1825. In addition, he worked with the Mexican government to support immigration from the United States.
TEXT.French: Stephen Fuller Austin (3 novembre 1793 - 27 décembre 1836) était un colon américain né en Virginie et élevé dans le sud-est du Missouri. Connu comme le Père du Texas, il mena la deuxième et ultime colonisation réussie de la région en y amenant 300 familles des États-Unis en 1825. De plus, il collabora avec le gouvernement mexicain pour soutenir l'immigration des États-Unis.

TEXT.English: Stephen I was the first king of Hungary, who is considered to be the founder of the Hungarian state and one of the most renowned figures in Hungarian history. Stephen was a member of the Arpad dynasty and son of the supreme Magyar chieftain Geza. He was born a pagan but was baptized and reared as a Christian, and in 996 he married Gisela, daughter of Duke Henry II of Bavaria. After the death of his father (997), Stephen combated an insurrection led by his older cousin, Koppany, who claimed the throne in accordance with Arpad succession rules. Stephen defeated Koppany at Veszprém (998) and had him executed as a pagan. On Christmas Day, AD 1000, Stephen was anointed king of Hungary. According to tradition, he received from Pope Sylvester II a crown that is now held as a national treasure in Hungary. His coronation signified Hungary's entry into the family of European Christian nations. With the exception of an invasion by the Holy Roman emperor Conrad II in 1030 and minor disputes with Poland and Bulgaria, Stephen's reign was peaceful. Stephen organized his kingdom on German models. He founded bishoprics and abbeys, made the building of churches mandatory, and established the practice of tithing. He promoted agriculture, safeguarded private property with strict laws, and organized a standing army. While a ruling class was created, the institution of slavery was left virtually untouched. Stephen also opened the country to strong foreign influences, while saving it from German conquest. He treated the church as the principal pillar of his authority, dispatching missionaries throughout his realm. Stephen is Hungary's patron saint. Although his feast day is August 16, Hungarians celebrate the translation of his relics to Buda on August 20.
TEXT.Polish: Stefan I Œwiêty (ok. 975-1038), w³adca Wêgier z dynastii Arpadów panuj¹cy od 997, pierwszy koronowany król Wêgier 1001. Syn ksiêcia Gejzy. Jego panowanie stworzy³o faktyczne podstawy pañstwa wêgierskiego. Zreformowa³ prawo, armiê i administracjê (utworzy³ m.in. istniej¹ce do XX w. komitaty). Aby zapewniæ pañstwu wewnêtrzn¹ spoistoœæ, ok. 1000 umocni³ chrzeœcijañstwo, zak³adaj¹c w Ostrzyhomiu arcybiskupstwo. Kanonizowany w 1083, patron Wêgier.

TEXT.English: Stefan Uros IV Dusan was the King of Serbia from 8 September 1331 and Emperor of the Serbs and Greeks from 16 April 1346 until his death. Dusan conquered a large part of southeast Europe, becoming one of the most powerful monarchs of the era. He enacted the constitution of the Serbian Empire, known as Dusan's Code, perhaps the most important literary work of medieval Serbia.
TEXT.French: Stefan Uros IV Dusan fut roi de Serbie dès le 8 septembre 1331 et empereur des Serbes et des Grecs à partir du 16 avril 1346 jusqu'à sa mort. Dusan conquit une grande partie du sud-est de l'Europe, devenant l'un des monarques les plus puissants de son époque. Il promulgua la constitution de l'Empire serbe, connue sous le nom de Code de Dusan, probablement l'oeuvre littéraire la plus importante de la Serbie médiévale.

TEXT.English: Raids between tribes were prevalent throughout the region's history. This is connected to the ease with which a defeated enemy's flocks can be driven away, which makes raiding profitable. In relation to sedentary societies, the horse gave the nomads the supreme advantage of mobility. Horsemen can raid a village and be gone with their loot before a land army can be gathered. When confronted with superior infantry, horsemen can simply ride away and regroup where there are no soldiers. Outside of Europe and parts of the Middle East, agrarian societies had difficulty raising a sufficient number of war horses and often had to buy them from their nomadic enemies. Nomads could not easily be pursued onto the steppe since the steppe could not easily support a land army. If the Chinese sent an army into Mongolia, the nomads would flee and come back when the Chinese ran out of supplies. But the steppe nomads were relatively few and their rulers had difficulty holding together enough clans and tribes to field a large army. If they conquered an agricultural area they often lacked the skills to administer it. If they tried to hold agrarian land they gradually absorbed the civilization of their subjects, lost their nomadic skills and were either absorbed by their subjects or driven out.

Stiletto is a prototype naval ship. It is notable for its hull design and carbon fiber construction, as well as its networked architecture. The 88-foot (27 m) long vessel has a notable hull design, an M-shaped hull that provides a stable yet fast platform for mounting electronic surveillance equipment or weapons, or for conducting special operations. The hull design does not require foils or lifting devices to achieve a smooth ride at high speeds in rough conditions. Its shallow draft means the M80 Stiletto can operate in littoral and riverine environments and potentially allows for beach landings. It has a topside flight deck for launching and retrieving UAVs and a rear ramp that can launch and recover an 11-meter rigid-hull inflatable boat (RIB) or Autonomous Underwater Vehicle (AUV).[PARAGRAPH:1]Historically, ships have evolved to become narrower and deeper to achieve speed and stability. The M Hull represents a true breakthrough because its distinctively wide hull captures the vessels bow wave and redirects the energy under the hull. The Stiletto's double-M hull enables the craft to achieve an unequaled ride in rough seas at high speed, which is critical for the Navy SEALS and other Special Operations Forces, because it reduces the G-forces and related injuries these personnel are subjected to during training and on missions.
TEXT.Polish: Stiletto jest prototypowym statkiem. Warto zauwa¿yæ, na projekt i konstrukcji kad³uba z w³ókna wêglowego, jak równie¿ jego architekturê sieci.88 stóp (27 m) d³ugoœci statku ma istotny kszta³t kad³uba, który zapewnia stabiln¹ szybk¹ platformê do monta¿u sprzêtu elektronicznego, nadzoru lub broni.

TEXT.English: The Stonewall Brigade of the Confederate Army during the American Civil War, was a famous combat unit in United States military history. It was trained and first led by General Thomas J. "Stonewall" Jackson, a professor from Virginia Military Institute (VMI). His severe training program and ascetic standards of military discipline turned enthusiastic but raw recruits into an effective military organization, which distinguished itself from the First Battle of Bull Run (First Manassas) in 1861 to Spotsylvania Court House in 1864.

Initially axes were probably not hafted. The first true hafted axes are known from the Mesolithic period (ca. 6000 BC). Axes made from ground stone are known since the Neolithic. Few wooden hafts have been found from this period, but it seems that the axe was normally hafted by wedging. Birch-tar and raw-hide lashings were used to fix the blade. Sometimes a short section of deer antler (an "antler sleeve") was used, which prevented the splitting of the haft and softened the impact on the stone blade itself, helping absorb the impact of each axe blow and lessening the chances of breaking the handle. The antler was hollowed out at one end to create a socket for the axehead. The antler sheath was then either perforated and a handle inserted into it or set in a hole made in the handle instead.
The Stone Maceman is a warrior wielding a stick topped with a stone ball.
TEXT.French: Le Guerrier avec masse de pierre est un guerrier maniant un bâton surmonté d'une boule de pierre.
TEXT.Italian: Il guerriero con mazza in pietra usa come arma un'asta con in cima una pietra.
TEXT.Spanish: El Guerrero con maza de piedra es un luchador que lleva un palo con una bola de piedra en su parte superior.
TEXT.Polish: Kamienne maczugi i pa³ki to poprostu kawa³ki kamienia przymocowane do drewnianego lub koœcianego sztyliska.

TEXT.English: Archeological evidence documents that wooden spears were used for hunting at least 400,000 years ago. However, wood does not preserve well. Craig Stanford, a primatologist and professor of anthropology at the University of Southern California, has suggested that the discovery of spear use by chimpanzees probably means that early humans used wooden spears as well, perhaps five million years ago.
TEXT.French: Les preuves archéologiques montrent que des lances en bois étaient utilisées pour la chasse il y a au moins 400 000 ans. Cependant, le bois se conserve mal. Craig Stanford, primatologue et professeur d'anthropologie à l'Université de Californie du Sud, a suggéré que la découverte de l'utilisation de lances par les chimpanzés signifie probablement que les premiers humains utilisaient aussi des lances en bois, peut-être il y a cinq millions d'années.

TEXT.English: Throwing is the launching of a ballistic projectile by hand. This action is only possible for animals with the ability to grasp objects with their hands (mainly primates). Humans, being bipedal, have a wide variety of throwing techniques and abilities. These have been employed in warfare - first through rock-throwing, then refined weapon-throwing (e.g. spear, throwing axe), and into modern day with hand grenades and tear gas canisters. Throwing is used in many sports and games, particularly ball games, and in throwing sports the action is the main determiner of the outcome. These serve as forms of recreation and exercise in society.
TEXT.German: Improvisierte Wurfgeschosse sind die primitivste Möglichkeit, Gegner aus der Ferne anzugreifen oder auf Distanz zu halten. Selbst Tiere mit Greifhänden, wie Primaten, sind schon in der Lage, sich mit aufgelesenen Steinen, Stöcken und Früchten zu verteidigen. Der Mensch wirft durch den aufrechten Gang so treffsicher wie kein anderes Lebewesen und entwickelte darüber hinaus im Laufe der Zeit immer neue Wurfwaffen und -techniken. Weil sie sehr leicht überall zu finden waren und trotzdem bei entsprechender Größe einen immensen Schaden anrichten konnten, stellten Steine die ersten echten Wurfwaffen dar, die von Urmenschen sowohl bei der Jagd als auch im Kampf mit feindlichen Sippen angewendet wurden.
TEXT.Polish: Miotacz kamieni to najwczeœniejsza jednostka dystansowa. Nie jest to zbyt silna jednostka, ale stosuj¹c je w du¿ej iloœci mo¿na poradziæ sobie z wrogiem.

TEXT.English: Most gang members have identifying characteristics unique to their specific clique or gang. The Bloods, for instance, wear red bandanas, the Crips blue, allowing these gangs to "represent" their affiliation. Any disrespect of a gang member's color by an unaffiliated individual is regarded as grounds for violent retaliation, often by multiple members of the offended gang. Tattoos are also common identifiers, such as an '18' above the eyebrow to identify a member of the 18th Street gang. Tattoos help a gang member gain respect within their group, and mark them as members for life. They can be burned on as well as inked. Some gangs make use of more than one identifier, like the Nortenos, who wear red bandanas and have "14", "XIV", "x4", and "Norte" tattoos. Also, many male gang members wear earrings or other types of body jewelry, or simply have pierced ears to depict gang membership, unlike females, who usually wear jewelry for appearance.[PARAGRAPH:2]Gangs often establish distinctive, characteristic identifiers including graffiti tags colors, hand signals, clothing (for example, the gangsta rap-type hoodies), jewelry, hair styles, fingernails, slogans, signs (such as the noose and the burning cross as the symbols of the Klan), flags secret greetings, slurs, or code words and other group-specific symbols associated with the gang's common beliefs, rituals, and mythologies to define and differentiate themselves from other groups and gangs.[PARAGRAPH:2]As an alternative language, hand-signals, symbols, and slurs in speech, graffiti, print, music, or other mediums communicate specific informational cues used to threaten, disparage, taunt, harass, intimidate, alarm, influence, or exact specific responses including obedience, submission, fear, or terror. One study focused on terrorism and symbols states that "symbolism is important because it plays a part in impelling the terrorist to act and then in defining the targets of their actions." Displaying a gang sign, such as the noose, as a symbolic act can be construed as "a threat to commit violence communicated with the intent to terrorize another, to cause evacuation of a building, or to cause serious public inconvenience, in reckless disregard of the risk of causing such terror or inconvenience. an offense against property or involving danger to another person that may include but is not limited to recklessly endangering another person, harassment, stalking, ethnic intimidation, and criminal mischief."

A strike fighter is a fighter aircraft which is also capable of attacking surface targets, including ships. It differs from an attack aircraft in that the aircraft remains a capable fighter. Previously, an airstrike on a ground target would usually involve bombers, defended by fighters. Strike-fighters can attack targets unaided, while remaining maneuverable and well-equipped enough to defend themselves.
TEXT.French: Un avion de chasse de frappe est un avion de chasse capable aussi d'attaquer des cibles terrestres, y compris des navires. Il diffère d'un avion d'attaque en ce qu'il reste un chasseur performant. Auparavant, une frappe aérienne sur une cible au sol impliquait généralement des bombardiers défendus par des chasseurs. Les chasseurs de frappe peuvent attaquer seuls, tout en restant maniables et suffisamment équipés pour se défendre.
TEXT.Polish: Samolot myœliwsko-bombowy (myœliwiec bombarduj¹cy lub myœliwsko-szturmowy) to rodzaj samolotu wojskowego ³¹cz¹cy cechy samolotów myœliwskich i bombowych. Obecnie s¹ czêœciowo wypierane s¹ przez myœliwce wielozadaniowe. Pod tym k¹tem te¿ szkolono ich za³ogi. Na ogó³ by³y to jednosilnikowe jednomiejscowe samoloty napêdzane silnikiem œmig³owym, uzbrojone w karabiny maszynowe lub dzia³ka lotnicze, rzadziej dwusilnikowe wielomiejscowe. P-47 Thunderbolt i Supermarine Spitfire), rozgraniczenie miêdzy myœliwcami i myœliwco-bombowcami jest nieprecyzyjne i w du¿ym stopniu zatarte. Od lat 80. i 90. XX wieku osobne kategorie samolotów myœliwsko-bombowych, bombowców taktycznych i samolotów myœliwskich zaczê³y byæ ponownie zastêpowane przez jedn¹ kategoriê myœliwców wielozadaniowych, posiadaj¹cych na skutek rozwoju techniki rozbudowane elektroniczne systemy kierowania uzbrojeniem zarówno przeciw celom powietrznym, jak i naziemnym oraz odpowiednio du¿y udŸwig i gamê uzbrojenia.
