TEXT.English: The war elephant was first used in India and was known to the Persians by the 4th Century BC. Using war elephants, Candra Gupta defeated Alexander's successor Seleucus and established the Mauryan Empire. Though Carthage's African war elephants accomplished little subsequently, their presence in Hannibal's army during his transit of the Alps into the heart of Rome in 218 BC established their reputation as a fearsome weapon. The elephant's tactical importance apparently stemmed in large part from its willingness to charge both foot soldiers and cavalry and from the panic that it inspired. Although used in Indian military forces until the 20th Century, as with so many traditional weapons, the utility of elephants in war ended with the widespread use of gunpowder.
TEXT.French: L'utilisation des éléphants pour la guerre a commencé en Inde et était connue des Perses au IVe siècle av. J.-C. C'est grâce à ses éléphants de guerre que Chandragupta parvint à vaincre Seleucos, le successeur d'Alexandre le Grand, et à fonder l'Empire maurya. Même si les éléphants africains de Carthage ont peu d'exploits à leur actif, leur présence dans l'armée d'Hannibal lors de la traversée des Alpes en 218 av. J.-C. leur a valu une réputation d'arme redoutable. L'importance tactique des éléphants repose beaucoup sur leur capacité à attaquer l'infanterie comme la cavalerie, et à inspirer la terreur. Bien que les armées indiennes aient utilisé l'éléphant jusqu'au XXe siècle, son utilité dans la pratique de la guerre a pris fin avec l'invention de la poudre à canon.
TEXT.German: Der Kriegselefant wurde zuerst in Indien eingesetzt und war den Persern im 4. Jahrhundert vor Christus schon geläufig. Mit Hilfe von Kriegselefanten gelang es dem indischen König Chandragupta, die Truppen von Seleukos, dem Nachfolger Alexanders des Großen, zu besiegen und das Maurya-Reich zu begründen. Auch wenn die afrikanischen Kriegselefanten der Karthager nur wenig ausrichten konnten, so machten sie ihrem Ruf als gefürchtetes Kriegsgerät alle Ehre, als Hannibal seine Truppen mitsamt den Dickhäutern über die Alpen führte, um im Jahre 218 vor Christus in Rom einzufallen. Die taktische Bedeutung der Kriegselefanten resultiert zum großen Teil aus ihrer Eigenschaft, sowohl Fußsoldaten als auch die Kavallerie anzugreifen und in Panik zu versetzen. Das indische Militär setzte sie zwar noch bis zum 20. Jahrhundert aktiv ein, letztlich erging es ihnen am Ende aber wie vielen anderen traditionellen "Waffen": Ihr militärischer Nutzen endete mit dem verbreiteten Einsatz von Schießpulver.
TEXT.Italian: L'elefante da guerra fu usato per la prima volta in India e fu conosciuto dai Persiani intorno al quarto secolo a. C. Grazie a queste unità, Candra Gupta sconfisse il successore di Alessandro, Seleuco, e fondò l'Impero Maurya. Anche se gli elefanti da guerra africani di Cartagine non furono determinanti, la loro presenza nell'esercito di Annibale durante la sua traversata delle Alpi verso il cuore di Roma, nel 218 a. C., affermò la loro reputazione di arma temibile. Apparentemente, l'importanza tattica dell'elefante si basa in gran parte sulla sua predisposizione a caricare sia i fanti che la cavalleria, nonché sul panico che è in grado di suscitare. Malgrado sia stato usato nelle truppe indiane fino al XX secolo, alla pari di molte armi tradizionali, la sua utilità in guerra è cessata con la diffusione della polvere da sparo.
TEXT.Spanish: Los elefantes de guerra fueron utilizados por primera vez en la India, y los persas ya lo conocían hacia el siglo IV a. C. Utilizando elefantes de guerra, Chandragupta derrotó a Seleuco, sucesor de Alejandro, y fundó el imperio mauryan. Aunque estos animales no sirvieron de mucho a Cartago, su presencia en el ejército de Aníbal durante el cruce de los Alpes y la invasión de Roma en el año 218 a. C. bastó para cimentar su reputación como armas terribles. La importancia táctica de los elefantes derivaba aparentemente de su disposición a cargar tanto contra la infantería como contra la caballería, y del pánico que esto inspiraba. Aunque sirvieron en el ejército indio hasta el siglo XX, su utilidad real, al igual que ocurrió con muchas otras armas tradicionales, terminó con la difusión generalizada de la pólvora.

TEXT.English: The War Wagon is essentially an armored chariot with a roof to protect against arrows.
TEXT.French: Le chariot de guerre est essentiellement un char blindé avec un toit pour se protéger des flèches.
TEXT.Italian: Il vagone da guerra è un carro corazzato con un tetto per proteggere dalle frecce.
TEXT.Spanish: El Vagón de guerra es, básicamente, un carruaje acorazado con un techo, para proteger de las flechas.
TEXT.Polish: Bojowy Powóz przypomina rydwan, ale jest ochraniany specjalnym pancerzem przed atakiem wrogich ³uczników.
TEXT.Russian: Ïî ñóòè, ýòî ôóðãîí, áðîíèðîâàííàÿ êîëåñíèöà è óêðåïëåííàÿ êðûøåé, õîðîøî çàùèùåííàÿ îò ñòðåë.

TEXT.English: Early tribes often relied upon sharp-sighted, wary warriors that watched over the tribe. Despite their strength, they would stay behind with the tribe to guard and protect and to break up any violent conflicts that erupted from within. They didn't answer to anyone in particular except the best interests of the tribe, whatever that would seem to be at the time.
TEXT.French: Les premières tribus s'appuyaient souvent sur des guerriers vigilants et méfiants qui veillaient sur la tribu. Malgré leur force, ils restaient avec la tribu pour la garder, protéger et désamorcer les conflits violents internes. Ils ne répondaient à personne en particulier, sauf aux intérêts supérieurs de la tribu, tels qu'ils étaient perçus à l'époque.
TEXT.German: Sobald viele Menschen in einem Familienverband, einer Sippe oder gar einem Stamm zusammenkommen, kann es zu Missgunst, Streitigkeiten und Hass kommen, die zu Schlägereien, Diebstählen oder im schlimmsten Fall gar zu Mord und Totschlag führen. Ab einer gewissen Anzahl an Individuen werden [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Aufpasser[COLOR_REVERT] benötigt, um die Gesellschaft zu schützen und Verbrechen oder gewalttätige Auseinandersetzung zu verhindern oder zumindest zu bestrafen. Für diese Aufgabe wurden meist die scharfsichtigsten und wachsamsten Krieger ausgewählt.[NEWLINE]Ein Aufpasser ist im Wortsinn eine Person, die jemanden oder etwas behütet. Trotzdem wird das Wort heute in der Regel abwertend gebraucht.

TEXT.English: Even though the Wayuu were never subjugated by the Spanish, the two groups were in a more or less permanent state of war. There had been rebellions in 1701 (when they destroyed a Capuchin mission), 1727 (when more than 2,000 natives attacked the Spanish), 1741, 1757, 1761 and 1768. In 1718 Governor Soto de Herrera called them "barbarians, horse thieves, worthy of death, without God, without law and without a king." Of all the Indigenous peoples in the territory of Colombia, they were unique in having learned the use of firearms and horses. In 1769 the Spanish took 22 Wayuus captive in order to put them to work building the fortifications of Cartagena. The reaction of the Indians was unexpected. On May 2, 1769, at El Rincón, near Río de la Hacha, they set their village afire, burning the church and two Spaniards who had taken refuge in it. They also captured the priest. The Spanish immediately dispatched an expedition from El Rincón to capture the Indians. At the head of this force was Jos Antonio de Sierra, a mestizo who had also headed the party that had taken the 22 Guajiro captives. The Guajiros recognized him and forced his party to take refuge in the house of the curate, which they then set afire. Sierra and eight of his men were killed.

The vehicle was developed in response to an Italian Army requirement for a tank destroyer with the firepower of the old Leopard 1 main battle tank then in service with the Italian Army but with greater strategic mobility. The main mission of the Centauro is to protect other lighter elements of the cavalry, using its good power-to-weight ratio, excellent range and cross country ability (despite the wheeled design) and computerized fire control system to accomplish this mission. Centauro entered production in 1991 and deliveries were complete by 2006.

The wildebeest (plural wildebeest, wildebeests or wildebai), also called the gnu is an antelope of the genus Connochaetes. It is a hooved (ungulate) mammal. Wildebeest is Dutch for "wild beast" or "wild cattle" in Afrikaans (beest = cattle), while Connochaetes derives from the Greek words konnos ("beard") and khaite ("flowing hair"). The name "gnu" originates from the Khoikhoi name for these animals, "gnou".[PARAGRAPH:2]Gnus belong to the family Bovidae, which includes antelopes, cattle, goats, and other even-toed horned ungulates. Connochaetes includes two species, both native to Africa: the black wildebeest, or white-tailed gnu (C. gnou), and the blue wildebeest, or brindled gnu (C. taurinus). Fossil records suggest that these two species diverged about one million years ago resulting in a northern and a southern species. The blue wildebeest changed very little from the ancestor species, while the black wildebeest took on more morphological changes to adapt to a habitat of open grassland in the south. Today there are five subspecies of the blue wildebeest while the black wildebeest has no living subspecies. In East Africa, the wildebeest is the most abundant big game species, both in population and biomass.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gnus[COLOR_REVERT] (Connochaetes) sind eine nur in Afrika vorkommende Antilopengattung aus der Unterfamilie der Kuhantilopen. Sie erreichen eine Kopf-Rumpf-Länge von etwa 2 m, eine Schulterhöhe von 130 cm und ein Gewicht von 200 kg. Gnus verfügen über kurze, aber kräftige Hörner, die bei beiden Geschlechtern gleichsam ausgeprägt sind. Ihre Fellfarbe unterscheidet sich von Art zu Art.[NEWLINE]Gnus leben in großen Herden in der offenen Savanne. Die meisten Gnus sind Nomaden und ihre Wanderungen zählen zu den auffälligsten Tierzügen der Welt. In der Regel bilden Weibchen und Männchen getrennte Herden, nur in trockenen Habitaten findet man auch gemischte Herden. Ältere Männchen werden zu Einzelgängern, die ihr Territorium verbittert gegen Eindringlinge verteidigen.[NEWLINE]Gnus werden schon seit jeher wegen ihres Fleisches und ihrer Haut gejagt. Auch ihre Schwänze wurden zu Fliegenwedeln verarbeitet. Die weißen Siedler schossen Gnus massenweise und der Bestand nahm dramatisch ab. Erst durch massive Schutzbemühungen konnte sich die Population zumindest in einigen Teilen Afrikas wieder erholen.
TEXT.Polish: Gnu (hotentocki) zool. Connochaetes, antylopa stadna z rodziny krêtorogich (Bovidae), ma ³ukowato wygiête rogi na g³owie podobnej do g³owy bawo³u, szar¹ sierœæ z ciemnymi pionowymi prêgami po bokach cia³a, wystêpuj¹ca na równinach pd. i wsch. Afryki.

TEXT.English: William Mariner (1791-1853) was an Englishman who lived in Tonga from 29 November 1806 to (probably) 8 November 1810. He later published Tonga Islands, an account of his experiences that is now one of the major sources of information on Tonga, before it was significantly influenced by European culture, Christianity or colonisation. As a teenager, Mariner was a ship's clerk aboard the British privateer Port au Prince. In 1806, while it was anchored off the Tongan island of Lifuka, in the Ha'apai island group, Port au Prince was seized by a chief named Finau Ulukalala. Most of the crew were killed during the capture of the ship, but the chief spared Mariner and a few crewmates. Mariner lived in Tonga for four years. After returning to England, Mariner he dictated a detailed account of his experiences, a description of Tongan society and culture, and a grammar and dictionary of the Tongan language.

Windradyne (c. 1800 - 21 March 1829) was an Aboriginal warrior and resistance leader of the Wiradjuri nation, in what is now central-western New South Wales, Australia; he was also known to the British settlers as Saturday. Windradyne led his people in the Bathurst Wars, a resistance movement by the Indigenous Australians against the invasion of their lands by the British settlers.
TEXT.French: Windradyne (v. 1800- 21 mars 1829) était un chef guerrier aborigène de la nation Wiradjuri, dans le centre-ouest de la Nouvelle-Galles du Sud, en Australie. Windradyne, aussi connu sous le nom de Saturday ("samedi"), a poussé son peuple à la résistance contre l'invasion de leurs terres.
TEXT.Polish: Windradyne (ok. 1800 - 1829) by³ aborygeñskim wojownikiem i przywódc¹ rebelii narodu Wiradjuri.

TEXT.English: The Polish Hussars or Winged Hussars, were one of the main types of the cavalry in the Crown of the Kingdom of Poland between the 16th and 18th centuries. When this cavalry type was first introduced by the Serbian and Hungarian mercenary horsemen in the beginning of the 16th century, they served as light cavalry banners in the Polish army; by the second half of the 16th century and after Stephen Báthory's reforms, hussars had been transformed into heavily armored shock cavalry. Until the reforms of the 1770s, the husaria banners were considered the elite of the Polish cavalry.
TEXT.Polish: Husaria - polska jazda nale¿¹ca do autoramentu narodowego, znana z wielu zwyciêstw formacja kawaleryjska Rzeczypospolitej, obecna na polach bitew od pocz¹tku XVI wieku do po³owy XVIII wieku. By³a wykorzystywana do prze³amywania si³ nieprzyjaciela poprzez zadawanie rozstrzygaj¹cych uderzeñ w postaci szar¿, które w najwa¿niejszym okresie jej istnienia koñczy³y siê zazwyczaj zwyciêstwami. Ze wzglêdu na nietypowe uzbrojenie i taktykê husaria jest zaliczana do najskuteczniejszych formacji wojskowych w dziejach kawalerii.

TEXT.English: Winnemucca, (ca. 1820-1882) (also called Wobitsawahkah, Bad Face, Winnemucca the Younger, Mubetawaka, and Poito), was born a Shoshone around 1820 in what would later become the Oregon Territory. When he married the daughter of Old Winnemucca, he became a Paiute according to their tribal rules. They were of the Kuyuidika band of the Northern Paiute. His father-in-law honored him by naming him "Winnemucca the Younger". The name means "The Giver of Spiritual Gifts." Winnemucca the Younger became a war chief with the Kuyuidika.

Killke culture flourished in highland Peru in the Late Intermediate Period around what is now Cusco. They built the massive fortress, Saksaywaman, during the 12th century. Later, the fortress was used by the Inca, following their occupation of the region.
TEXT.French: La culture Killke prospéra dans les hautes terres du Pérou durant la période intermédiaire tardive, autour de l'actuelle Cusco. Ils construisirent la forteresse massive de Saksaywaman au XIIe siècle. Plus tard, les Incas utilisèrent cette forteresse après avoir occupé la région.

German.Text: Weise Frau:Weisen Frau:Weisen Frau:Weise Frau:Weise Frauen:Weisen Frauen:Weisen Frauen:Weisen Frauen

TEXT.English: As gatherers explored their surroundings and what the results of consuming various native substances they began to learn what would make a person sick, what would provide sustenance, and what would assist in alleviating various symptoms of disease, injury and discomfort. The wise women who had spent their younger years gathering, keeping and sharing verbal records of what was beneficial for various purposes would often be turned to by the tribe as a source of healing and guidance. This role grew in significance as the human mind evolved into more and more advanced forms deepening the capacity for knowledge retention and application.
TEXT.German: In der Umgebung der frühen Siedlungen wuchsen jede Menge unbekannte Pflanzen. Zunächst wurden sie nur auf Genießbarkeit geprüft und für die Ernährung des Stammes genutzt. Durch dieses Ausprobieren wurde aber auch anderes Wissen gewonnen. Die Menschen erkannten, dass manche Pflanzen nicht nur für Unwohlsein sorgten, sondern den Anwender vergiften oder sogar töten konnten. So manch ein Kraut stellte sich im Gegenzug auch als nützlich heraus, um Krankheiten, Vergiftungen, Verletzungen oder Gebrechen zu lindern oder zu kurieren. Gerade ältere weise Frauen verfügten durch mündliche Überlieferung und aus eigenen Erfahrungen über ein profundes Wissen in Kräuter- und Heilkunde, sodass sie für ihren Stamm von unschätzbarem Wert waren.

TEXT.English: The gray wolf is a canid native to the wilderness and remote areas of North America, Eurasia, and northern, eastern and western Africa. It is the largest extant member of its family, with males averaging 43-45 kg (95-99 lb), and females 36-38.5 kg (79-85 lb). Like the red wolf, it is distinguished from other Canis species by its larger size and less pointed features, particularly on the ears and muzzle. Its winter fur is long and bushy, and predominantly a mottled gray in color, although nearly pure white, red, or brown to black also occur. As of 2005, 37 subspecies of C. lupus are recognised by MSW3. The nominate subspecies is the Eurasian wolf (Canis lupus lupus), also known as the common wolf.
TEXT.Russian: Äèêèå æèâîòíûå íå îïàñíåå ÷åëîâåêà, íî áëàãîðàçóìíûé ãîðîæàíèí íèêîãäà íå ïîêèíåò ãðàíèöû ïîñåëåíèÿ áåç îðóæèÿ.

TEXT.English: The wolverine, also referred to as glutton, carcajou, skunk bear, or quickhatch, is the largest land-dwelling species of the family Mustelidae (weasels). It is a stocky and muscular carnivore, more closely resembling a small bear than other mustelids. The wolverine has a reputation for ferocity and strength out of proportion to its size, with the documented ability to kill prey many times its size.[PARAGRAPH:2]The wolverine can be found primarily in remote reaches of the Northern boreal forests and subarctic and alpine tundra of the Northern hemisphere, with the greatest numbers in the U.S. state of Alaska, northern Canada, the Nordic countries of Europe, and throughout western Russia and Siberia. Their populations have experienced a steady decline since the 19th century in the face of trapping, range reduction and habitat fragmentation, such that they are essentially absent in the southern end of their European range. It is, however, estimated that large populations remain in North America and northern Asia.
TEXT.German: Der Vielfraß (Gulo gulo) ist eine Marderart und in Eurasien und Nordamerika zu Hause. Der Name bezieht sich nicht auf die Ernährungsgewohnheiten, sondern leitet sich vom skandinavischen Fjällfräs (Gebirgskatze) ab. Er wird mit einer Länge von bis zu 105 cm plus einer Schwanzlänge von maximal 26 cm jedoch deutlich größer als andere Marder. Das Männchen bringt bis zu 32 kg auf die Waage, das Weibchen ist deutlich leichter. Der Vielfraß besitzt einen markanten Körperbau, kleine Ohren und einen buschigen Schwanz. Das Fell ist dunkelbraun bis schwarz, eine hellbraune Bänderzeichnung verläuft von den Schultern bis zum Schwanz.[PARAGRAPH:2]Der Vielfraß ist nachtaktiv. Während seiner Ruhezeit zieht er sich in sein Nest zurück, teilweise schläft er auch in fremden Bauen oder gräbt sich eine Höhle im Schnee. Obwohl er die meiste Zeit am Boden lebt, kann er gut klettern und schwimmen sowie lange Strecken am Stück laufen. Er gilt auch als angriffslustig und kann sogar Pumas oder Bären von ihrer erlegten Beute vertreiben. Im Sommer vertilgt er vor allem Aas, aber auch Vogeleier oder Beeren, im Winter ernährt er sich von Mäusen, Schneehasen oder sogar Luchsen. Zwar hält der Vielfraß keinen Winterschlaf, verbringt die kalte Jahreszeit jedoch manchmal in südlicheren Gegenden. Der Einzelgänger markiert sein Revier mit einem Sekret der Analdrüse oder mit Urin. Nach der Paarungszeit im Frühjahr erfolgt eine Keimruhe, bevor die eigentliche Trächtigkeit von 30-40 Tagen beginnt. Die zwei bis vier Jungen kommen im Winter zur Welt, sie sind anfangs schneeweiß und blind.[PARAGRAPH:3]Lange Zeit wurde der Vielfraß von Menschen als Fressfeind gejagt. Vor allem in Skandinavien reißt er machmal das Vieh der Bauern und dringt in deren Häuser ein, wo er sein Analsekret verbreitet. Früher war zudem das Fell sehr begehrt. Er spielt in mehreren indianischen Legenden eine Rolle.

TEXT.English: The Wood Spearman is the first spear-type unit. It carries a sharpened stick with which to better kill animals and horses.
TEXT.French: Le Guerrier avec lance de bois est la première unité de type lance. Il porte un bâton affûté pour mieux tuer les animaux et les chevaux.
TEXT.Italian: Il guerriero con lancia in legno è il primo tipo di lanciere; usa un'asta appuntita per uccidere animali e unità montate.
TEXT.Spanish: El Guerrero con lanza de madera es el primer lancero disponible. Porta un palo puntiagudo con el que carga mejor contra animales, especialmente caballos.

Arbeiter mit Büffel:Arbeiters mit Büffel:Arbeiter mit Büffel:Arbeiter mit Büffel:Arbeiter mit Büffeln:Arbeiter mit Büffeln:Arbeitern mit Büffeln:Arbeiter mit Büffeln

TEXT.English: The majority of people in all civilizations throughout time have been workers. Whether engaged in farming, commerce, or industry, their actions form the economic infrastructure without which no nation can succeed. Over time, the endless activity of workers has reshaped the very surface of the land by mining hills, cutting down huge stretches of forest, and irrigating hostile terrain into fertile farmland. By the late 20th century it had become apparent that excessive deforestation and pollution from heavy industry posed a threat to the world's environment.
TEXT.French: Depuis l'aube de l'humanité et dans toutes les civilisations, une grande majorité de la population appartient à la classe ouvrière. Dans l'agriculture, le commerce ou l'industrie, ce sont les ouvriers qui forment l'infrastructure économique sans laquelle une nation ne peut survivre. Au cours des siècles, le travail des ouvriers a véritablement redessiné l'environnement, notamment en créant des mines, en abattant de vastes parcelles de forêt ou en irriguant des terres stériles pour en faire des zones cultivables. Ce n'est qu'à la fin du XXe siècle que l'Homme s'est véritablement rendu compte que la déforestation excessive et la pollution générée par l'industrie constituaient une menace pour l'environnement.
TEXT.German: In den primitiven Kulturen der "Jäger und Sammler" gab es bis auf geschlechtsspezifische Aufgaben keine echte Arbeitsteilung. Spätere Zivilisationen besaßen dann eine "Arbeiterklasse", die sich mit der Warenproduktion und niederen Arbeiten beschäftigte, welche zur Erhaltung der Gesellschaft benötigt wurden. In den meisten frühen Kulturen übernahmen Sklaven und Bauern diese Rolle. Im Mittelalter organisierten sich später viele spezialisierte Arbeiter in Handwerksgilden. Die technologischen Fortschritte des industriellen Zeitalters schufen dann eine neue Klasse von Lohnarbeitern, welche meist in Fabriken und Büros beschäftigt waren. Aber auch die weitere Spezialisierung und Professionalisierung der Arbeitswelt am Ende des 20. Jahrhunderts änderte nichts an der Tatsache, dass die Zivilisation auf den Schultern derer ruht, welche die Felder bestellen und Straßen anlegen.
TEXT.Italian: Nel corso della storia, la maggior parte della popolazione delle civiltà è sempre stata impiegata come forza lavoro nell'agricoltura, nel commercio o nell'industria; grazie al loro lavoro, è stato possibile creare infrastrutture economiche in grado di far fiorire una nazione. Nel corso del tempo, l'opera continua dei lavoratori ha prodotto molte modifiche sul territorio, con gli scavi di miniere, il disboscamento di grandi zone e l'irrigazione del terreno ostile fino a renderlo coltivabile. Verso la fine del 20° secolo, è diventato chiaro che l'eccessivo disboscamento e l'inquinamento delle fabbriche potevano rappresentare un serio pericolo per l'equilibrio ambientale del pianeta.
TEXT.Spanish: A lo largo de la historia, la mayoría de los hombres de todas las civilizaciones han sido trabajadores. Ya sea en la agricultura, el comercio o la industria, su actividad conforma la infraestructura económica sin la que ninguna nación puede prosperar. Con el tiempo, la acción incansable de los trabajadores ha cambiado la mismísima faz de la tierra, al horadar colinas, talar grandes superficies forestales e irrigar el terreno yermo para convertirlo en fértiles cultivos. A finales del siglo XX se ha hecho patente que la deforestación excesiva y la contaminación debida a la industria pesada suponen una amenaza para el medio ambiente a nivel mundial.

TEXT.English: In naval terminology, a destroyer is a fast maneuverable long-endurance warship intended to escort larger vessels in a fleet, convoy or battle group and defend them against smaller powerful short-range attackers. They were originally developed in the late 19th century as a defense against torpedo boats, and by the time of the Russo-Japanese War in 1904, these "torpedo boat destroyers" (T.B.D.) were "large, swift, and powerfully armed torpedo boats designed to destroy other torpedo boats." Although the term "destroyer" had been used interchangeably with "T.B.D." and "torpedo boat destroyer" by navies since 1892, the term "torpedo boat destroyer" had been generally shortened to simply "destroyer" by nearly all navies by the First World War.
TEXT.Polish: Klasa niszczycieli, jako okrêtów przeznaczonych do zwalczania torpedowców i ochrony przed nimi zespo³ów floty, powsta³a pod koniec XIX wieku. Pierwsze przeznaczone do tych zadañ jednostki powsta³y w po³owie lat 80. XIX wieku. Za protoplastów niszczycieli uwa¿ane s¹ brytyjskie "Swift" i "Rattlesnake", nale¿¹ce do klas nazywanych torpedo boat catchers (dos³ownie "³apacze torpedowców") i kanonierek torpedowych.

TEXT.English: The King George V-class battleships (KGV) were the penultimate battleship design completed for the Royal Navy (RN). Five ships of the class were commissioned: King George V (1940), Prince of Wales (1941), Duke of York (1941), Howe (1942), and Anson (1942). They carried one quadruple and one high "super-firing" twin turret forward and one quadruple turret aft. In this unique layout, she carried ten 14-inch guns. Her secondary armament consisted of sixteen 5.25 inch guns clustered amidships in eight double turrets.[PARAGRAPH:2]The five battleships of the King George V class were the most modern in service with the Royal Navy in WWII. All five rendered invaluable service in the two-ocean war and could in fact be credited with helping to influence policy of the war itself. The best example of their importance was their critical role in the chase and sinking of Hitler's battleship Bismarck; a loss that significantly altered German Naval policy toward increased reliance on its U-boat arm.[PARAGRAPH:2]The other significant impact in the war the Sinking of Prince of Wales and Repulse, which was a World War II naval engagement illustrating the effectiveness of aerial attacks against naval forces that were not protected by air cover and the resulting importance of including an aircraft carrier in any major fleet action.[PARAGRAPH:2]The action took place east of Malaya, near Kuantan, Pahang where the British battleship HMS Prince of Wales and battlecruiser HMS Repulse were attacked by Imperial Japanese Navy land-based bombers and torpedo bombers.[PARAGRAPH:2]The two ships were the first capital ships actively defending themselves to be sunk solely by airpower while steaming on the open sea. This incident demonstrated the vulnerability of even the most modern surface ships to the potency of air attack and drove home the necessity of air cover to protect against such an incident.[PARAGRAPH:2]Following the end of World War Two, the remaining battleships of the King George V Class had become obsolete and expensive to run. In 1950 the class was laid up in reserve in Gareloch. The scrapping of the class was approved in 1957.
TEXT.Polish: W 1922 po wejœciu w ¿ycie traktatu waszyngtoñskiego Wielka Brytania zosta³a zobowi¹zana do znacznego ograniczenia zbrojeñ morskich. Zgodnie z postanowieniami traktatu Royal Navy otrzyma³a w 1927 i 1930 dwa pancerniki typu Nelson. Traktat przestawa³ obowi¹zywaæ w 1936 i w zwi¹zku z coraz bardziej napiêt¹ sytuacj¹ miêdzynarodow¹ przewidywano, ¿e nie zostanie przed³u¿ony. Przewiduj¹c taki rozwój wypadków w Wielkiej Brytanii, opracowano projekt nowych pancerników, które mog³yby wejœæ do produkcji natychmiast po wygaœniêciu traktatów rozbrojeniowych. Nowe okrêty mia³y mieæ artyleriê g³ówn¹ sk³adaj¹c¹ siê z dzia³ kalibru 356 mm i niespotykane na okrêtach tej wielkoœci silne opancerzenie.

TEXT.English: Xicotencatl II Axayacatl, also known as Xicotencatl the Younger (died 1521), was a prince and warleader, probably with the title of Tlacochcalcatl, of the pre-Columbian state of Tlaxcallan at the time of the Spanish conquest of Mexico.
TEXT.French: Xicotencatl II Axayacatl, également connu sous le nom de Xicotencatl le Jeune (mort en 1521), fut un prince et chef de guerre, probablement avec le titre de Tlacochcalcatl, de l'État précolombien de Tlaxcallan au moment de la conquête espagnole du Mexique.

TEXT.English: The xiphos is a double-edged, one-handed Iron Age straight shortsword used by the ancient Greeks. It was a secondary battlefield weapon for the Greek armies after the dory or javelin. The classic blade was generally about 50-60 cm long, although the Spartans supposedly started to use blades as short as 30 cm around the era of the Greco-Persian Wars. The xiphos sometimes has a midrib, or is diamond or lenticular in cross-section. It was generally hung from a baldric under the left arm. The xiphos was generally used only when the spear was discarded for close combat. Very few xiphoi seem to have survived.

The Yaghan may have been driven to this inhospitable area by enemies to the north. They were famed for their complete indifference to the bitter weather around Cape Horn. Although they had fire and small domed shelters, they routinely went about completely naked in the frigid cold and biting wind of Tierra del Fuego. Women swam in its 48-degree-south waters hunting for shellfish. They often were observed to sleep in the open, completely unsheltered and unclothed, while Europeans shivered under blankets. A Chilean researcher claimed their average body temperature was warmer than a European's by at least one degree.

Marshal Naval General Isoroku Yamamoto (4 April 1884 18 April 1943) was the commander-in-chief of the Combined Fleet during World War II, a graduate of the Imperial Japanese Naval Academy and a student of the U.S. Naval War College and of Harvard University (19191921). One of the major advocates of Japanese naval aviation, as Commander of the 1st Fleet, Yamamoto was responsible for the plan for the surprise attack on Pearl Harbor, and for the many Japanese naval successes in the opening months of the Pacific War. Ironically, he was opposed to going to war with the United States, which he knew would be a more dangerous opponent than many Japanese imagined. His statement that Japan would "...have to dictate the peace treaty from the steps of the White House!" was not the ruthless invasion plan that Allied propagandists made it seem, but, rather, a warning to his peers that Americans would not accept defeat in the kind of limited war that Japan could afford to fight. However, once the decision to go to war had been made, he supported it in spite of his doubts. His bold plans for the opening moves of the war worked far better than he had expected; but his second campaign, to finish off the U.S. Pacific Fleet, ended in disaster at Midway. Thereafter, he operated on the defensive, waiting for a chance to strike another crippling blow, but that chance never came. He was killed in 1943, when USAAF P-38 fighters intercepted the bomber carrying him on an inspection tour of forward bases.
TEXT.Polish: Isoroku Yamamoto (ur. 4 kwietnia 1884 w Nagaoce, zm. 18 kwietnia 1943 nieopodal Bougainville na Wyspach Salomona)? japoñski admira³, jeden z najwiêkszych dowódców marynarki japoñskiej, uwa¿any za znakomitego stratega. Urodzi³ siê 4 kwietnia 1884 w rodzinie Teikichi Takano. Po wczesnej œmierci rodziców zosta³ adoptowany przez rodzinê Yamamoto. By³ katolikiem. W wieku 17 lat rozpocz¹³ naukê w Akademii Morskiej w Etejima w Hiroszimie (1901 - 1904). Jako m³ody oficer (chor¹¿y) na pok³adzie kr¹¿ownika "Nisshin" uczestniczy³ w bitwie pod Cuszim¹ podczas wojny rosyjsko-japoñskiej. Podczas starcia straci³ 2 palce u lewej d³oni. W latach 1913 - 1916 studiowa³ w Akademii Sztabu Marynarki w Tsukiji. Od 1916 s³u¿y³ w sztabie generalnym japoñskiej II Floty Morskiej. W 1919 wyjecha³ do USA, na studia na Uniwersytecie Harvarda, które ukoñczy³ w 1921. W 1925 zosta³ attachŸ morskim w USA (w stopniu komandora). Funkcjê tê pe³ni³ do 1928. W 1930 awansowa³ do stopnia kontradmira³a. W grudniu 1936 zosta³ wiceministrem marynarki wojennej. Rozpocz¹³ wówczas forsowanie rozbudowy infrastruktury lotnictwa morskiego i naciska³ na rozbudowê ciê¿kich pancerników. W 1939 awansowa³ na stopieñ admira³a i zosta³ g³ównym dowódc¹ japoñskiej floty morskiej. W 1941 opracowa³, ju¿ jako admira³, plan ataku na Pearl Harbor. Yamamoto by³ zagorza³ym zwolennikiem budowy lotniskowców jako g³ównej si³y bojowej floty wojennej. Zgin¹³ 18 kwietnia 1943 w samolocie Mitsubishi G4M str¹conym przez amerykañskie myœliwce dalekiego zasiêgu P-38 Lightning, podczas walk tocz¹cych siê wokó³ Wysp Salomona. Lightningi zosta³y wys³ane w daleki rajd specjalnie w celu przechwycenia jego samolotu, poniewa¿ dziêki z³amaniu japoñskich szyfrów dowiedziano siê, ¿e Yamamoto bêdzie wizytowa³ swoje bazy. Œmieræ admira³a by³a wielkim ciosem dla prowadz¹cej wojnê Japonii.

TEXT.English: Flower wars differed from typical wars in a number of important aspects. While engaging in a flower war, competing armies would meet on a "preset date at a preselected place." These places became sacred sites and were called cuauhtlalli or yaotlalli. Combatants signaled the start of war by burning a large "pyre of paper and incense" between the armies. Actual battle tactics also differed from typical warfare. In typical warfare, the Aztecs used atlatl darts, stones, and other ranged weapons to weaken enemy forces from afar. However, in flower wars, the Aztecs neglected to use ranged weapons and instead used weapons such as the macuahuitl that required skill and close proximity to the enemy. The use of these kinds of weapons allowed the Aztecs to display their individual combat ability, which was an important part of the flower war.

Yao Chang was the founding emperor of the Chinese/Qiang state Later Qin. His father Yao Yizhong had been a powerful general and Qiang chieftain under the Later Zhao emperor Shi Hu, but after Later Zhao's collapse after Shi Hu's horses death, Yao Chang's older brother Yao Xiang tried to start an independent state but was defeated and killed by Former Qin forces. Yao Chang became a Former Qin general, but after an incident in 384 after the Former Qin emperor Fu Jian's defeat at the Battle of Fei River, Yao Chang feared that Fu Jian would kill him and therefore rebelled. He subsequently captured and killed Fu Jian, who had saved his life when Yao Xiang was defeated, causing many historians to view him as a traitor and murderer.

The third earliest documented European contact with the Yagua was probably made by the Spanish explorer Francisco de Orellana in January 1542. While exploring in the area of modern day Pebas, Orellana encountered a village called Aparia, and captured two chiefs named Aparia and Dirimara, as well as some others. These names could conceivably have come from the Yagua words (j)apiirya 'red macaw clan' and rimyura 'shaman' respectively. The former could very well be a village name as well as a name applied to an individual; today clan names are still used by many Yaguas as family names. The word for shaman might also be used to refer to an individual, especially one singled out as a 'chief'. Regular European contact began in 1686 with the establishment of a Jesuit mission at San Joaquin de los Omagua, on an island in the Amazon river probably near what is now the mouth of the Ampiyacu River. Though this mission was established to serve the Cambeba people, there was undoubtedly contact with the Yaguas as well. From the 17th century to the last half of the 19th century, contact with the Yaguas was mainly through the Jesuit and Franciscan missionaries. In the early 18th century, Portuguese raiding parties attacked the Spanish missions throughout the Amazon region causing much geographic dispersion of the tribes that were in contact with the Spanish, and inflicting severe casualties.

A yeoman was a member of a social class in late medieval to early modern England. In early recorded uses, a yeoman was an attendant in a noble household; hence titles such as Yeoman of the Chamber, Yeoman of the Crown, Yeoman Usher, King's Yeoman, Yeomen Warders, Yeomen of the Guard. The later sense of yeoman as "a commoner who cultivates his own land" is recorded from the 15th century; in military context, yeoman was the rank of the third order of fighting men, below knights and squires, but above knaves. A specialized meaning in naval terminology, "petty officer in charge of supplies", arose in the 1660s.
TEXT.Polish: Yeoman - cz³onek warstwy spo³ecznej stanu wolnego w Anglii XV-XVIII wieku. W œredniowieczu by³ on cz³onkiem œwity króla lub mo¿nego, póŸniej termin oznacza³ wolnego ch³opa, drobnego w³aœciciela ziemskiego lub dzier¿awcê gospodarstwa ob³o¿onego obowi¹zkiem s³u¿by zbrojnej, od XVII w. ju¿ tylko dzier¿awców ziemi szlacheckiej. Warstwa wzbogaci³a siê w epoce Tudorów dziêki wyprzeda¿y ziemi pokoœcielnej oraz w toku ogradzania, z tego powodu odgrywali oni znaczna rolê w gospodarce wiejskiej. Wspierali oni ponadto rewolucjê angielsk¹ d¹¿¹c do likwidacji przywilejów stanowych szlachty rodowej, tzw. gentry, bezpoœrednio pod któr¹ sta³a. Yeomani mieli prawa polityczne i stanowili zaplecze armii (zob. yeomanry), sk¹d nazw¹ t¹ wspó³czeœnie okreœlani s¹ równie¿ cz³onkowie pewnych formacji, np. przybocznej gwardii królewskiej, Yeomen of the Guard (za³o¿onej w 1485 roku), czy ochotniczej kawalerii obrony wewnêtrznej (utworzonej w 1761 roku).

TEXT.English: Yi Sun-Sin was a Korean admiral and national hero whose naval victories were instrumental in repelling Japanese invasions of Korea in the 1590s. After passing the government examinations to become a military officer in 1576, Yi served at various army and navy posts. Although he was twice discharged after being falsely accused by jealous colleagues, in 1591 he was appointed commander of the naval forces in Left Cholla province, where he concentrated on training his men, stocking equipment and supplies, and developing the renowned kobukson (turtle ship). The kobukson is thought to have been the first ironclad battleship in history. Its upper deck was covered with armoured plates to protect its crew, and spikes and knives were attached to the plates to discourage enemies from boarding. The ship's bow was equipped with a dragon head through which cannon could be fired and clouds of smoke could be emitted to obscure the ship's position. Cannon and guns could also be fired from the stern and the sides of the ship. As a result of Yi's preparations, his forces, unlike most of the Korean military, were ready to fight when the Japanese invaded in 1592. Yi's victories off the southern coast effectively cut off the Japanese troops in Korea from supplies and reinforcements and prevented the Japanese from pressing their initial advantage. In 1593 Yi was given command of the entire Korean fleet, but, following peace negotiations, in 1597 he was again falsely accused of disloyalty and demoted to the rank of common soldier. The Japanese then launched a second invasion and succeeded in destroying almost all of the Korean navy. Yi was reinstated as commander of the few remaining ships and, continuing his undefeated battle record, soon restored Korea's control of the seas. He was killed by a stray bullet as he pursued the retreating Japanese forces during the final campaign of the war. Today, Admiral Yi is considered one of Korea's greatest heroes of all time. Koreans look upon Yi as a man of courage, perseverance, strength, self-sacrifice, and loyalty to his country.

Yolu sustained good trade relations with Macassan fisherman for several hundred years. The Macassans respected the land as Yolu land; they only ever camped on the beach, and generally avoided contact with Yolu women. They made yearly visits to harvest trepang and pearls, paying Yolu in kind with goods such as knives, metal, canoes, tobacco and pipes.
TEXT.French: Yolu entretint de bonnes relations commerciales avec les pêcheurs macassans pendant plusieurs centaines d'années. Les Macassans respectaient ces terres en tant que territoire Yolu ; ils campaient uniquement sur la plage et évitaient généralement tout contact avec les femmes Yolu. Chaque année, ils venaient récolter des holothuries et des perles, rémunérant les Yolu en nature avec des biens tels que des couteaux, du métal, des pirogues, du tabac et des pipes.

TEXT.English: The word "yumi" means either a long or short bow used in kyudo, the ancient Japanese art of archery. The traditional yumi stands at over 6 feet fall, often dwarfing the archer, and is made from laminated bamboo, wood, and animal hide, in a process that is still the same today as it was two thousand years ago. The yumi's unique asymmetric design, where the upper and lower curves differ, is a style that dates to around 250 BCE. It is believed the asymmetric shape was designed for use on horseback, so the bow could be switched from one side of the horse to the other with relative ease.

The bow and arrow appears around the transition from the Upper Paleolithic to the Mesolithic. At the site of Nataruk in Turkana, Kenya, obsidian bladelets found embedded in a skull and within the thoracic cavity of another skeleton, suggest the use of stone-tipped arrows as weapons. After the end of the last glacial period, use of the bow seems to have spread to every inhabited continent, including the New World, except for Australia.
TEXT.French: L'arc et la flèche apparaissent vers la transition du Paléolithique supérieur au Mésolithique. Sur le site de Nataruk à Turkana, Kenya, des éclats d'obsidienne trouvés incrustés dans un crâne et dans la cavité thoracique d'un autre squelette suggèrent l'utilisation de flèches à pointe de pierre comme armes. Après la fin de la dernière période glaciaire, l'utilisation de l'arc semble s'être répandue sur tous les continents habités, y compris le Nouveau Monde, sauf l'Australie.

TEXT.English: Lloque Yupanqui was the third Sapa Inca of the Kingdom of Cuzco (beginning around CE 1260) and a member of the Hurin dynasty. He is said to have established the public market in Cuzco and built the Acllahuasi. In the days of the Inca Empire, this institution gathered young women from across the empire; some were given by the Inca as concubines to nobles and warriors and others were dedicated to the cult of the Sun god. Sometimes they were simply servants.
TEXT.French: Lloque Yupanqui fut le troisième Sapa Inca du Royaume de Cusco (vers 1260 ap. J.-C.) et un membre de la dynastie Hurin. On lui attribue la création du marché public de Cusco et la construction de l'Acllahuasi. À l'époque de l'Empire Inca, cette institution rassemblait des jeunes femmes de tout l'empire; certaines étaient données par l'Inca comme concubines aux nobles et guerriers, d'autres étaient dédiées au culte du dieu Soleil. Parfois, elles étaient simplement servantes.

TEXT.English: In many of the Indian cultures these rites take a central position among other important ceremonies such as funerals and fertility rites. In the Guianas and the northwest Amazon region, the initiation of the boys is very complex. The Yurupary celebration inducts the boys into the secret society of mature men. Special rites are revealed to them; they are shown the sacred trumpets or the masks representing ancestral spirits. They are subjected to violent whippings, which they must tolerate without the least expression of pain.

Yusuf ibn Tashfin'was an ethnic Berber and Almoravid ruler in North Africa and Al-Andalus (Moorish Iberia). After succeeding to the leadership of the reformist movement in 1060, he continued to expand his territorial base across the Maghreb, building Marrakech as his capital. In 1085, he was invited by the beleaguered Muslim emirs in Spain to assist them against the Christian Reconquista and inflicted a crushing defeat on the armies of Alfonso VI of Castile. The emirs thought he would go home after this, having completed what they had asked of him. He did go home, but while there obtained opinions from Muslim jurists supporting the emirs' overthrow as lax and corrupt. In 1090, he crossed back over to Ibera, defeated and deposed the rulers, reuniting splintered Muslim territory into a single state. Although he did not add significantly to this territory, he succeeded in pushing back the Reconquista. He did annex Valencia, which resisted his armies until 1100. He died at the age of 101, six years later. The dynasty lasted until defeated by the even stricter Almohads in 1147.
TEXT.Polish: Jusuf ibn Taszfin (ur. 1009, zm. 2 wrzeœnia 1106) - w³adca Maroka z dynastii Almorawidów. Jusuf ibn Taszfin by³ stryjem przywódcy Almorawidów Abu Bakra ibn Umara i otrzyma³ od niego w³adzê w Maroku w 1070 roku, gdy sam Abu Bakr wyjecha³ t³umiæ powstanie plemion na Saharze. Jusuf wykorzysta³ nieobecnoœæ Abu Bakra do organizacji w³asnej administracji w kraju i budowy wojska najemnego. Kiedy Abu Bakr wróci³ do kraju w 1073 roku, zrezygnowa³ z walki o w³adzê i wycofa³ siê z powrotem na Saharê. Jusuf ibn Taszfin sta³ siê w ten sposób za³o¿ycielem dynastii Taszfinidów, przewodz¹cych Almorawidom a¿ do 1147 roku. W kolejnych latach Jusuf podbi³ plemiona Miknasa i Magrawa, w 1075 roku zaj¹³ Fez, w 1077 Tangier, a w 1083 Ceutê. W 1081 roku panowa³ ju¿ nad ca³¹ zachodni¹ Algieri¹ a¿ do Algieru, jednak w 1082 roku jego marsz na wschód powstrzymali Hammadydzi przy wsparciu Banu Hilal. W 1082 roku andaluzyjscy w³adcy po raz pierwszy poprosili Jusufa ibn Taszfina o wsparcie przeciw chrzeœcijañskim królestwom na Pó³wyspie Iberyjskim. Dopiero jednak po ponownej proœbie ze strony Abbadytów, Aftasydów i Zyrynidów z Granady Jusuf wyl¹dowa³ z wojskiem w Andaluzji i 23 paŸdziernika 1086 rozbi³ wojska kastylijskiego króla Alfonsa VI w bitwie pod Sagrajas. Kiedy jednak w 1088 roku królestwa Taify odmówi³y mu wsparcia, Jusuf ibn Taszfin zwróci³ siê przeciw nim i w 1090 roku obali³ Zyrynidów z Granady i Abbadydów z Sewilli, a do 1095 roku zaanektowa³ prawie wszystkie pozosta³e królestwa. W 1102 roku Jusufowi podda³a siê Walencja, broniona wczeœniej przez wojska Cyda, a w 1110 roku Saragossa pod wodz¹ Hudydów.

TEXT.Italian: Guerriero con lancia di Yu il Grande

TEXT.English: Qiang is the Chinese term for spear. Due to its relative ease of manufacture, the spear in many variations was ubiquitous on the pre-modern Chinese battlefield. It is known as one of the four major weapons, along with the Gun (staff), Dao (sabre), and the Jian (sword), called in this group "The King of Weapons".
TEXT.French: Qiang est le terme chinois pour lance. En raison de sa relative facilité de fabrication, la lance sous ses nombreuses variations était omniprésente sur les champs de bataille chinois pré-modernes. Elle est connue comme l'une des quatre grandes armes, avec le bâton (Gun), le sabre (Dao) et l'épée (Jian), appelé dans ce groupe « Le Roi des Armes ».

TEXT.English: Yu the Great was a legendary ruler in ancient China famed for his introduction of flood control, inaugurating dynastic rule in China by founding the Xia Dynasty, and for his upright moral character. The dates proposed for Yu's reign precede the oldest known written records in China, the oracle bones of the late Shang dynasty, by nearly a millennium. No inscriptions on artifacts from the supposed era of Yu, nor the later oracle bones, make any mention of Yu; he does not appear in inscription until vessels dating to the Western Zhou period (c. 1045-771 BC). The lack of anything remotely close to contemporary documentary evidence has led to some controversy over the historicity of Yu. Proponents of the historicity of Yu theorise that stories about his life and reign were transmitted orally in various areas of China until they were recorded in the Zhou dynasty, while opponents believe the figure existed in legend in a different form - as a god or mythical animal - in the Xia dynasty, and morphed into a human figure by the start of the Zhou dynasty. Many of the stories about Yu were collected in Sima Qian's famous Records of the Grand Historian. Yu and other "sage-kings" of Ancient China were lauded for their virtues and morals by Confucius and other Chinese teachers.

Until the beginning of the 18th century, Crimean Tatars were known for frequent, at some periods almost annual, devastating raids into Ukraine and Russia. For a long time, until the late 18th century, the Crimean Khanate maintained a massive slave trade with the Ottoman Empire and the Middle East which was the most important basis of its economy. One of the most important trading ports and slave markets was Kefe. Slaves and freedmen formed approximately 75% of the Crimean population.
TEXT.French: Jusqu'au début du XVIIIe siècle, les Tatars de Crimée étaient connus pour leurs raids fréquents, parfois presque annuels, dévastateurs en Ukraine et en Russie. Pendant longtemps, jusqu'à la fin du XVIIIe siècle, le Khanat de Crimée maintint un commerce massif d'esclaves avec l'Empire ottoman et le Moyen-Orient, qui constituait la base la plus importante de son économie. L'un des ports commerciaux et marchés aux esclaves les plus importants était Kefe. Les esclaves et les affranchis représentaient environ 75 % de la population de Crimée.

TEXT.English: The Zaporozhian Cossacks were Cossacks who lived beyond the rapids of the Dnieper River, the land also known under the historical term Wild Fields in today's Central Ukraine. Today much of its territory is flooded by the waters of Kakhovka Reservoir.
TEXT.French: Les cosaques de Zaporojie étaient des cosaques qui vivaient au-delà des rapides du fleuve Dniepr, une terre également connue sous le terme historique des Champs Sauvages dans l'Ukraine centrale d'aujourd'hui. Une grande partie de leur territoire est aujourd'hui submergée par les eaux du réservoir de Kakhovka.

TEXT.English: According to the legend, he robbed nobles and gave the loot to the poor, a deed often attributed to the famous Robin Hood. The legend was also known in neighbouring Silesia, the Margraviate of Moravia and later spread to the Kingdom of Bohemia. The actual robber had little to do with the modern legend, whose content partly reflects the ubiquitous folk myths of a hero taking from the rich and giving to the poor. However, the legend was also shaped in important ways by the activists and writers in the 19th century when Janosík became the key highwayman character in stories that spread in the north counties of the Kingdom of Hungary (much in present Slovakia) and among the local Gorals and Polish tourists in the Podhale region north of the Tatras (Tatra). The image of Janosík as a symbol of resistance to oppression was reinforced when poems about him became part of the Slovak and Czech middle and high school literature curriculum, and then again with the numerous films that propagated his modern legend in the 20th century. During the anti-Nazi Slovak National Uprising, one of the partisan groups bore his name.

The Zenu culture existed from about 200 BCE to about 1600 CE, constructing major water works and producing gold ornaments. The gold that was often buried with their dead lured the Spanish conquerors, who looted much of the gold. With the arrival of the Spaniards, the tribe all but died out. The 16th-century Spanish chroniclers wrote about the Zenu who were still living there, but recorded little or nothing about the history of the Zenu
TEXT.French: La culture Zenu a existé d'environ 200 av. J.-C. à environ 1600 ap. J.-C., construisant de grands ouvrages hydrauliques et produisant des ornements en or. L'or souvent enterré avec leurs morts attira les conquérants espagnols, qui pillèrent une grande partie de l'or. Avec l'arrivée des Espagnols, la tribu disparut presque entièrement. Les chroniqueurs espagnols du XVIe siècle écrivaient sur les Zenu encore présents mais mentionnaient peu ou rien de leur histoire.

TEXT.English: Zheng He, a contemporary of European explorers such as Henry the Navigator, was an admiral and diplomat who helped to extend Chinese maritime and commercial influence throughout the regions bordering the Indian Ocean. Born to a Muslim family of Yunnan province, he was made an eunuch at an early age, and gained the trust of the Emperor Yongle. Selected by the emperor to be commander in chief of the missions to the Western Oceans, he first set sail in 1405, commanding 62 ships and 27,800 men. He made a total of seven voyages in his lifetime, traveling through most of Southeast Asia, Indonesia, India, Sri Lanka, Persia, Arabia, Egypt, and East Africa. After his sixth voyage, the Yongle emperor died. In the shift of policy his successor, the Hongxi emperor, suspended naval expeditions abroad. However, he was allowed to do one last, seventh voyage, in 1433, in order to take the pilgrimage to Mecca that all good Muslims were expected to do. He died on the trip home. Zheng He was the best known of the Yongle emperor's diplomatic agents. Although some historians see no achievement in the naval expeditions other than flattering the emperor's vanity, these missions did have the effect of extending China's political sway over maritime Asia for half a century. Admittedly, they did not, like similar voyages of European merchant-adventurers, lead to the establishment of trading empires. Yet, in their wake, Chinese emigration increased, resulting in Chinese colonization in Southeast Asia and the accompanying tributary trade, which lasted to the 19th century. Though it will never be known, it is quite possible that had Zheng He's voyages not been suspended, the Chinese fleets could have possibly explored even more territories, perhaps to even discover the Americas (certainly it was logistically possibly), and thus, China's influence on the world - and modern history, undoubtedly - could have been very much different.
TEXT.Polish: Zheng He, (ur. 1371 w Kuanying, prow. Junnan zm. 1433) - chiñski admira³, który w latach 1405-1433 odby³ seriê podró¿y do wielu miejsc w Azji i Afryce. By³ muzu³maninem, eunuchem i zaufanym cz³owiekiem chiñskiego cesarza Yongle z dynastii Ming. Odby³ podró¿e do po³udniowo-wschodniej Azji, Sumatry, Jawy, Cejlonu, Indii, Persji, Zatoki Perskiej, Arabii, Morza Czerwonego a¿ do Egiptu i Mozambiku. Jego wyprawy przyczyni³y siê do rozwoju handlu i wiedzy nawigacyjnej.

TEXT.English: The assassination of the leaders of rival Mongol tribes was a common occurrence thanks to the ever-shifting loyalties and conflicting interests at play within Mongol tribal politics. The father of Genghis Khan, Yesugei, for example, was unwittingly poisoned by one of his enemies. The risk was especially high at night since the ger that Mongol nomads traditionally sleep in lacked a solid wall, and so a sword or spear could easily penetrate the walls and kill the subject inside. As a result, the Mongol and Turkic monarchs in Mongolia typically had personal guards. The Kerait khan Toghoril (Wang Khan) had an imperial guard, Torguud. According to an oral tradition, their descendants could be Torghut people. After the defeat of Wang Khan in 1203, Genghis established the kheshig. The kheshig consisted mainly of sworn personal followers.

Archaeological evidence of the earliest repeating crossbow from Tomb 47 at Qinjiazui, Hubei Province has been dated to the 4th century BC, during the Spring and Autumn period. However, its invention is commonly attributed to Zhuge Liang (181-234 AD), a famous military advisor of the Three Kingdoms period; Zhuge Liang improved the design of the repeating crossbow, and made a version which shot two to three bolts at once and was used in massed formations. For this reason, it was named after him. Other repeating crossbows fired as many as 10 bolts before exhausting the magazine.

The Zulu spearmen were warriors without peer in southern Africa, dispatching every force that they encountered until running up against the superior technology of the Europeans. The Zulus were organized for the first time by Shaka, who began forming spearmen into groups called "impi" even before he became the chief of his tribe. Impi warriors began training as early as the age of six, serving first as porters and servants, and when of age, the cadets were trained in the use of weapons. When Zulu males reached adulthood at age twenty, they would become full members of their warband. [PARAGRAPH:2]Zulu spearmen were expected to be able to outrun a horse, travel 50 miles a day on foot, and move silently through rough terrain. The difficult training that the Zulu warriors went through made them tougher and stronger than their opponents, who frequently outnumbered the Zulus in battle. [PARAGRAPH:2]When going into battle, the Zulu spearmen painted their faces with chalk and red ochre to make themselves more intimidating. They carried spears (called "ilkwa") made of wood with a long iron point. The ilkwa was a stabbing weapon, unlike its predecessor the javelin-like "assegai," which had been used for throwing. Along with the spear, Zulus would carry a medium-sized shield. As contact with Europeans became more frequent later in the nineteenth century, Zulu warriors also made use of muskets and rifles captured from the British, although the Zulus did not have the training to use them properly. [PARAGRAPH:2]Tactically, the soldiers of a Zulu impi often used Shaka's "bull horns" formation, which consisted a main force ("isifuba" or chest) and two wings on the sides ("izimpondo" or horns) designed to outflank the enemy. A fourth group of veterans would remain as a reserve in the rear. [PARAGRAPH:2]The Zulu spearmen formed an effective and highly-versatile army which proved to be almost invincible when facing other African forces. They traveled lightly and could move very fast (if not the 50 miles a day that they claimed), but they also packed enough force to disrupt heavy enemy formations. Shaka used hit-and-run techniques against the numerically-superior Ndwandwe in the 1820s and achieved complete victory in a series of engagements. [PARAGRAPH:2]However, the Zulu spearmen were no match for the Martini-Henry rifles and Maxim guns of the British army when they went to war in 1878. The technological rift could not be overcome with Zulu valor. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.French: Les porte-lances zoulous sont des guerriers hors pair du Sud de l'Afrique, qui l'emportent contre toutes les forces qu'ils rencontrent jusqu'à ce qu'ils soient confrontés à la technologie supérieure des Européens. Les Zoulous sont organisés pour la première fois par Chaka, qui commence à regrouper les porte-lances dans des groupes appelés "impis" avant même qu'il ne devienne le chef de cette tribu. Les guerriers impis commencent leur formation dès l'âge de six ans, servant d'abord de porteurs et de serviteurs. Devenus majeurs, les cadets s'entraînent à manier les armes. Lorsque les hommes zoulous atteignent l'âge adulte, à vingt ans, ils deviennent membres à part entière de leur groupe guerrier. [PARAGRAPH:2] Les porte-lances zoulous doivent être capables de dépasser un cheval, de marcher 80 km par jour et de se déplacer en silence sur des terrains escarpés. Le difficile entraînement auquel sont soumis les guerriers zoulous les rend plus résistants et plus forts que leurs ennemis, qui sont généralement plus nombreux que les Zoulous dans les batailles. [PARAGRAPH:2]Lorsqu'ils partent aux combats, les porte-lances zoulous se peignent le visage avec de la craie ou de l'ocre rouge pour être plus intimidants. Ils portent des lances de bois avec une longue pointe en fer, appelées "ilkwas". La ilkwa est une arme coupante, contrairement à l'arme qu'elle remplace, la "assegai", qui ressemblait à un javelot et devait être lancée. Outre la lance, les Zoulous portent un bouclier de moyenne taille. Au XIXe siècle, lorsqu'ils entrent plus souvent en contact avec les Européens, les guerriers zoulous utilisent également des mousquets et des fusils pris aux Britanniques, même s'ils ne savent pas les utiliser correctement. [PARAGRAPH:2]Sur le plan tactique, les soldats d'un impi zoulou utilisent souvent la formation en "tête de buffle", qui consiste en une force principale ("isifuba" ou poitrine) et deux ailes sur les côtés ("izimpondo" ou cornes) qui servent à déborder l'ennemi. Un quatrième groupe de vétérans reste en réserve à l'arrière. [PARAGRAPH:2] Les porte-lances zoulous forment une armée efficace et pleine de ressources qui se révèle presque invincible face aux autres forces africaines. Ils se déplacent avec peu d'équipement et peuvent avancer très vite, même s'ils ne font par les 80 km qu'ils prétendent parcourir. Ils disposent par ailleurs de forces suffisantes pour vaincre d'importantes formations ennemies. Dans les années 1820, Chaka utilise des techniques éclair contre les Ndwandwes, numériquement supérieurs, et parvient à remporter une victoire totale dans plusieurs combats. [PARAGRAPH:2]Cependant, les porte-lances zoulous sont trop faibles face aux fusils Martini-Henry et aux mitrailleuses Maxim de l'armée britannique, lorsqu'ils entrent en guerre en 1878. Le fossé technologique ne peut pas être comblé par la bravoure des Zoulous. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.German: Die Speerkämpfer der Zulu waren die mit Abstand besten Krieger Südafrikas und schlugen bis zur Entwicklung überlegener Technologien durch die Europäer jede Streitmacht nieder, der sie begegneten. Die ersten Schritte in Richtung Kampfordnung erfuhren die Zulu durch ihren späteren Stammesführer Shaka, der die Speerwerfer in "Impi" genannte Regimenter ordnete. Die Ausbildung eines Impi-Kriegers begann im zarten Alter von sechs Jahren, wobei sie zunächst als Träger und dann als Diener eingesetzt wurden und erst, wenn sie alt genug waren, den Umgang mit Waffen erlernten. Sobald ein männlicher Zulu 20 Jahre alt wurde und damit als Erwachsener galt, wurde er als vollwertiges Mitglied in den Kampfverbund aufgenommen. [PARAGRAPH:2]Von den Speerkämpfern der Zulu wurde erwartet, dass sie ein Pferd ein- oder überholen, etwa 80 Kilometer pro Tag zu Fuß zurücklegen und sich auch auf rauem Gelände sehr leise fortbewegen konnten. Die schwierige Ausbildung, die ein Zulu-Krieger durchlaufen musste, härtete ihn zusehends ab und machte ihn stärker als seine Gegner, die den Zulu im Kampf häufig zahlenmäßig überlegen waren. [PARAGRAPH:2]Wenn sie ins Gefecht zogen, bemalten die Speerkämpfer der Zulu ihre Gesichter mit Kreide und Ockerfarbe, um noch Furcht einflößender zu wirken. Statt mit den früher verwendeten Wurfspießen (den "Assegai") waren die Krieger seit der von Shaka eingeführten militärischen Neuerungen nun mit Stoßspeeren (den so genannten "Iklwa") ausgestattet, die aus Holz gefertigt waren und eine lange eiserne Spitze besaßen. Außerdem führten sie mittelgroße Schilde bei sich. Als es im 19. Jahrhundert immer häufiger zu kriegerischen Auseinandersetzungen mit den Europäern kam, setzten die Zulu-Krieger auch die von den Briten erbeuteten Musketen und Gewehre ein, obwohl sie keinerlei Ausbildung im Umgang mit derartigen Waffen hatten. [PARAGRAPH:2]Taktisch wurden die Zulu-Krieger des Impi oftmals in Shakas "Büffelhorn"-Formation eingesetzt, die aus einer Hauptkampftruppe (den "Isifuba", zu Deutsch etwa Brustkorb) und zwei Flügeltruppen an den Flanken (den "Izimpondo", zu Deutsch etwa Hörner) bestand, wobei Letztere den Feind umzingeln sollten. Und schließlich bildete eine vierte Veteranentruppe an der Rückseite die Reserve. [PARAGRAPH:2]Die Speerkämpfer der Zulu stellten eine effiziente und höchst flexible Armee dar, die sich in Begegnungen mit anderen afrikanischen Streitmächten als nahezu unbesiegbar erwies. Sie waren nur leicht ausgerüstet und konnten sich sehr schnell fortbewegen (wenn auch nicht unbedingt immer die besagten 80 Kilometer am Tag), aber sie hatten stets genug Kraft, um selbst schwere feindliche Formationen auseinander sprengen zu können. Im Kampf gegen die zahlenmäßig überlegenen Truppen der Ndwandwe um 1820 wendete Shaka die "Hit and Run"-Taktik an und trug so in mehreren Gefechten den Gesamtsieg davon. [PARAGRAPH:2]Gegen die Martini-Henry-Gewehre und Maxim-Maschinengewehre, welche die britische Armee im Krieg von 1878 einsetzte, konnten die Speerkämpfer der Zulu allerdings nichts ausrichten - die technologische Kluft zwischen den beiden Kriegsparteien ließ sich auch durch die Tapferkeit der Zulu nicht überbrücken. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Italian: I lancieri zulu furono guerrieri senza pari nell'Africa meridionale, capaci di sconfiggere ogni avversario finché non si scontrarono con la superiorità tecnologica degli europei. Gli Zulu furono organizzati per la prima volta da Shaka, che cominciò a ordinare i lancieri in gruppi detti "impi" prima ancora di diventare il capo della sua tribù. I guerrieri impi iniziavano l'addestramento a sei anni, facendo prima da ausiliari e servitori ai soldati e poi, una volta diventati maturi, venendo addestrati all'uso delle armi. I maschi zulu raggiungevano la maggiore età a venti anni e solo allora diventavano membri della tribù a pieno titolo. [PARAGRAPH:2]Dai lancieri zulu si esigeva che sapessero superare un cavallo in corsa, che fossero in grado di percorrere 50 miglia al giorno a piedi e che sapessero spostarsi silenziosamente su terreni aspri. Il rigoroso addestramento rendeva i guerrieri zulu più resistenti e più forti dei nemici, che spesso superavano di numero i guerrieri zulu. [PARAGRAPH:2]Quando andavano in battaglia, i lancieri zulu si dipingevano il volto con gesso e ocra rossa per intimidire il nemico. Essi avevano con sé delle lance corte ("iklwa") fatte di legno con una lunga punta metallica. L'iklwa serviva a pugnalare e non a essere scagliata, a differenza del suo predecessore ("assegai") che era simile a un giavellotto. Oltre alla lancia, gli Zulu avevano uno scudo di medie dimensioni. Quando i contatti con gli europei diventarono più frequenti, i guerrieri zulu utilizzarono anche i moschetti e i fucili sottratti ai Britannici, anche se nessuno mai insegnò loro a utilizzarli in modo efficiente. [PARAGRAPH:2]Dal punto di vista tattico, un impi adottava spesso la formazione a "corna di bufalo", che era composta da un corpo centrale ("isifuba" o torso) e da due ali ai lati ("izimpondo" o corna) che dovevano aggirare il nemico. In retroguardia restava un gruppo di veterani come riserva. [PARAGRAPH:2]I lancieri zulu formavano un corpo molto efficiente e versatile e praticamente invincibile se opposto agli altri eserciti africani. Essi viaggiavano leggeri e veloci (anche se forse non raggiungevano le 50 miglia al giorno), ma un impi era abbastanza potente da scombussolare formazioni nemiche pesanti. Intorno al 1820 Shaka usò la tecnica del mordi e fuggi contro i più numerosi Ndwandwe e ottenne una vittoria completa dopo una serie di scontri. [PARAGRAPH:2]Tuttavia i lancieri zulu non potevano competere con i fucili Martini-Henry o con le pistole Maxim dell'esercito britannico quando le due fazioni si scontrarono nel 1878. Il divario tecnologico era troppo profondo persino per i valorosi Zulu. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Spanish: Los lanceros zulúes, guerreros sin igual en la zona de África del sur, derrotaron a todos los que se enfrentaron hasta topar con la superior tecnología de los europeos. Los zulúes fueron organizados por primera vez por Chaka, quien empezó a formarlos en unidades llamadas "impi" incluso antes de llegar a ser jefe de su tribu. Los guerreros impi empezaban a entrenarse a los seis años. Primero servían como porteadores y criados y, cuando llegaban a la edad necesaria, eran instruidos en el uso de las armas. Cuando los zulúes llegaban a la mayoría de edad (a los veinte años) se convertían en miembros de pleno derecho de sus unidades. [PARAGRAPH:2]Los lanceros zulúes debían ser capaces de correr más que un caballo, recorrer ochenta kilómetros al día a pie y viajar por terreno abrupto. Las dificultades que afrontaban durante su instrucción los hacían más duros y fuertes que sus adversarios, que muchas veces los superaban en número en el campo de batalla. [PARAGRAPH:2]Antes de las batallas, los lanceros zulúes se pintaban la cara de teja y ocre para parecer más amenazadores. Iban armados con lanzas (llamadas "ilkwas") de madera con una alargada punta de hierro. La ilkwa era un arma punzante de cuerpo a cuerpo, a diferencia de su predecesora, la "assegai" que era una especie de jabalina utilizada como arma arrojadiza. Junto con esta lanza, los zulúes llevaban un escudo de tamaño medio. A lo largo del siglo XIX, a medida que aumentaba su contacto con los europeos, los guerreros zulúes empezaron a hacer uso de los mosquetes y rifles capturados a los británicos, pero siempre carecieron de la instrucción necesaria para utilizarlos bien. [PARAGRAPH:2]Desde el punto de vista táctico, los soldados de los impis zulúes empleaban a menudo la formación de "los cuernos del búfalo", que consistía en un contingente principal ("isifuba" o pecho) y dos alas ("izimpondo" o cuernos), cuya tarea era envolver al enemigo. A veces, un cuarto grupo de veteranos permanecía en retaguardia como reserva. [PARAGRAPH:2]Los lanceros zulúes formaban un ejército eficaz y muy versátil que era casi invencible cuando se enfrentaba a otras fuerzas africanas. Viajaban con poca impedimenta y podían moverse muy deprisa (aunque puede que no tanto como los ochenta kilómetros que ellos decían) y, además, tenían la fuerza suficiente como para desbaratar formaciones pesadas enemigas. En la década de 1820, Chaka usó una táctica de incursiones y maniobras rápidas contra los ndwandwe, superiores en número, y alcanzó una victoria total tras una serie de batallas. [PARAGRAPH:2]Sin embargo, los lanceros zulúes no eran rival para los rifles Martini-Henry y las ametralladoras Maxim del ejército británico cuando se inició la guerra (1878). La bravura zulú no podía llenar el abismo de la diferencia tecnológica. [PARAGRAPH:2]
